priuy counsel ihon daus daily oratour wisheth helth peace co solatio christ iesu thincrele honor digntiy amonges wryters compile bookes knowledge instruction others right honorable singular good lord thei opinion deserue best common welth commit wrytinge story wherby men maye learne thexamples others set eies guide gouern theyr life thinges embrace eschue iudge matter past shalbe consequent end thing come cause eloquent orator cicero calleth history mystres maners guid light life sercher vertues driuer away vice many like goodly title attributeth certenly ther wer euer story written whereof men might reape frute commodity worthy hand practised common vse man life ether worthines ofihargumente concerning state religion common wealth report thing done lately fresh memorye thys work sleidane treateth thenterprises men casuall chaunces thing happen climing higher auauncing minde man vp vnto heauen constraineth maruel wo derful prouidence liuing god touching gouernement churche induceth men wonder vnsearchable counsel god almighty hath preserued somany troublesome stormes tempestes ful pearil daunger concerninge author dilligence fidelity hath vsed deserueth doutles highly commeded men much hauing respect common wealth regard priuate commodity hath wholy imploid self consecrate best excellent matter maye euerlasting memory said thucidides desyrous verity doubtfull scrupulous wryting story gaue great monye euen ennemies haue truth matter know thinges went assuredly may say also sleidan selfe confesseth content go heare say common report people hathe fished certenty story common recordes least report men worthy credit herein hath spared nether cost paine although hath wrytten many thinges self hath sene germany fraunce italy place yet muste necessitye holpen herein eies eares many compact history many seuerall nation place far distante one seing therefore thys story ihon sleidane compiled matter singuler excellent perfection worthy perpetuall memory j haue thought expediet sondry cause present honoure wel great good wil zeale good lordship beareth towards lerninge christen religion common wealth natiue country also place dignity iudgement al worthely called cosidering shalbe neither vnprofitable vnnedeful honor vnderstand state realmes comon welthes tormoils church thing aboundantly sufficiently appear thend may easely knowen place euery matter may found haue set beginnyng euery boke argumet conteining matter comprised humbly beseching honour accept simple translatio dedicated good lord ship wrytten vtility common coutry honorable tuition throughe good lordship authority tonges euil speaker repressed put silence others disposed may receiue commodity profit readinge doutlesse profitable boke hath ben setforth thenglish tong many yeres thus liuing god preserue increase honor replenish noble mind light grace holy sprite perswade treat quenes highnes moste honorable wise thinges ther condescended agreed vpon may wholy redownd glory god holy name kalendes august anno translator boke go forth painful boke thou art longer mine eche man may loke shame praise thine seke thou praise thanke yet reward eche man please haue thou great regard labor hath bene mine trauell paine reproches shalbe thine beare must fain yet hath study bene profit others mo men thereby win trust shalbe pleasure many haue bene euer glad right displease wold loth sad thou please best skill passe reast good men accept good thou mightst remaine eschue blame since thou wouldst faine gon goe god name p excellent prince augustus prince electour duke saxon lantzgraue turing marque meissen high mareschall thempire singuler good lord ihon sleidane wisheth health diuers author excelleut prince haue setforth vnto v many sondrye alteration kingdomes god self wold shuld taught thinges mouth long shoulde come passe foure greate monarchyes worlde theyr greate aulteration succession taughte v prophette daniell whose prophecy mooste parte alreadye made euidente manifest vnto v wyth certaine knowledge pleasaunt ful consolation alteration contention shoulde relygion doctrine prophet hathe spoken paule comminge prophecieth also manifestlye sorte shalbe setforth declared mo one two howe alteration hath chaunced time notable others romain empire whyche last also much greater rest prophet said shuld deuided brought huge vnmeasurable great quantity right small thing manifest whiche consisteth within limites germany hathe bene manye time great hasard daunger partly reason domesticall euils partly throughe faction forain enemy length god hath geuen v emperour mighty hath bene many hondreth yeres vnto haue descended mooste ample realmes prouinces ritch welthy also mooste commodious thinges sondrye place bothe sea lande like self excelleth power emperor germanye haue bene sence tyme charles great also reason thinges haue chaunced time gouernment famous notable amonges thinges alteration religion hath chiefest place whiche beginninge raigne toke originall time whan emperour maximilian departed present life matter ben hand aboue xiiii monthes time prince electours chose manne emperour manner self time luther beinge prouoked came forthe reason matter disputed openly eckius lipsia fell men theyr study ether side wherefore thempire man ought considered dilligentlye waied memory former time god hath euery time stirred vp certain great prince table tha rest whe ether state religion comon welth shuld altred sort cirus alexander macedonie iulius caesar constantine charlemaigne also ottous saxonie speake charles fift certenly alteratio sort wherof make mention man knoweth thing perfectly thinck theof without great maruel wonder beginning ful small manner contemned one man alone susteined malice violence world yet might self haue ben appeased quieted case aduersaries would haue taken condition beginning offred promised kepe silence would like refused prescribed recantation herein perseuered said vnlesse could first shewe erroure coulde chaung opinion dissention increased matter brought counsell thempire come great maner se meanes came pa thing bishop rome vniuersities king prince haue tempted self hath pleaded cause themperour counsell prince diuers men excellent learning haue ioyned selues howe matter hath ben debated thassembles thempire howe meanes reconcilement haue bene assaid oftentimes bishop rome haue bene hand emperour kinges oft haue put hope reformation counsel persecution burning ther hath ben league conspiracy haue hen made religio hath ben setforth germany place also diuers haue reuolted others remained constant tumultes warres battels haue risen occasion say great sondry thing leaue vnspoken commit memory wryting think ther man would iudge blame worthy moreouer passed ouer silence state common wealthe man empire space six thyrty yeres war hath kept commotion tumultes haue ben meane season thing haue chaunced realmes prouinces neuerthelesse thordre argumente shalbe obserued hereafter shalbe declared like emperor raigneth ouer moste large ample dominion hath also strong puissant enemy wherfore matter haue ben wonderful great haue chaunced memorye duringe raigne thys emperor therfore certen yeres past diuers worthy wel lerned men chanced talke matter began perswade whosoeuer chanced dais especially touching cause religion shuld put wrytinge vnto dyd exhort could best ther wer others much mete purpose saw delite much kinde exercise therefore supposed acerten natural inclination thing bestow time labor amisse self doubtlesse knew wel enough daungerous sea muste enter case required maner man endued greater wit eloquence albeit almost despair could bring thing passe yet vanquished theyr auchority opinion determined assay thing beginning time luther began inuey selling pardon brynging matter still vnto disputation lipsia appoynted duke george hadde composed sente vnto setter woormes time counsel thempire ten yeres past read peruse ouer afterward letter mouth also importune procede longe ther chaunced sorowfull time germany whan arose warre great let hindraunce study learning also disturbe let purpose doings nether could procede desired many time must tarye make delay sone relieued euils especially iii yeares paste imploide study trauel herein neuer reasted till came thend wished surely worke made chiefly principally concerning religion neuerthelesse obseruynge order thought good also put polliticke matter touching whole narration sort euery man reading shall easely perceiue nothing becommeth history better truth sidelity doubtlesse least man finde lacke behalf haue traueled diligently haue written nothinge lighte reportes hear say haue compiled worke publick record haue gathred vp dilligently verity wherof man nodeth dout also aid helpe worthye noble man lame sturmie hath ben occupied publicke waighty affaire xxx yeres mo commendation gentlenes shewinge frendship whan somtime doubted sticked fast rockes shelues expert sailer many time brought right course void dagers part work red ouer request sicknesse wherof died admonished diligently suche thing wer nedeful also much mention made forein matter especially french englishe therein haue also folowed ordre haue put nothing tried certenly knowne french matter part self haue sene ix yeres dwelt ther diuers execution burning whereof mention made many decree made action commenced diuines paris againste certen minister church shortly article religion setforth faction court chaunced time whan party warlike matter suche like affaire omit mighte wise yet haue professed treat expresly said little laboure purposed chiefly cause religion therfore wold haue reader warned whan shal come vnto place loke long discourse affaire nether mine intent may read men work haue taken hand wryte part much herein shalbe wanting thing said obserued history fidelity vprightnes wit nothing told affection although harde performed albeit perauenture shall perswade men haue ben dilligently ware yet require instantly burthened suspition cause worke mine wholy compiled sayde publick recordes collected great dilligence wherof also great part setforth print partly latin partly vulgare italian also french hath many oration demaunds answer diuers accusation consutations also thinges recite plainly simply truely euerye thinge done neither adde thing mine speak mine iudgement leaue reader free neither vse also collour rhethorick wryte thing hatred fauor man frame stile vse mine word speache may alwaies like equal bestow eche thing place followed ordre first yeres bishop leo adrian spake many thinges bitterly againste luther whose wrytinges take away nothing likewise adde nothing vnto luther answer neyther make complainct worsse yet defence better bishop succeded clement paule man especially whan luther dostrine spred abroade farre neare making digression person haue inueyed spitefully prince also city follow ordre throughout whole volumne kepe self trade wherfore beseche reader lay part disliking know firste matter self tender laboure hath surely bene great theyr good wil fauor certenly vnlesse cause moued write first eftsones allured procede deuour tediousnes long since forsaken enterprise ther appeared great variety much stomack strength came first supposed shuld concern glory god opened time omnipotency wonderful counsel comon vtility moued euen germany remember thing past forain nation know certenty many mennes mindes disposed dislikinges thinck farre otherwise many matter ought furthermore respect posterity leaste wise wrytinges may abide light continuaunce besides also many thing like fort others put wryting nether truely modestly ther one natio setforth boke vi yeres since mentz moste full lie slaunders trisling rayling wordes last yeares past came forth two tome florence authour wherof handleth dede larg ample wise history time wherso euer speaketh germain matter especially concerning relegion bewraieth disease mind thing vntrue false sclaunderous euer wryteth may euidently proued omit manye oration epistle preface whiche setforthe rinte whan touch matter handle thing hatred mallice swarue also far truth cause say thought good proceade permit ordre actes done vntruely set ether present age el time come kind thing vile le suffred tha thing shuld make reader expert shuld wyth false tale lie depraued assuredly magistrate ought foresee nothyng done herein licentiously thys faulte vsed oure dayes verye manye wryters seke pike thanke whilest ind uour please gratifye one man deserue euil many induce mo errour doutlesse part whiche yet would shuld spoken without ostentation affected herein knew ther wer anye thing work vntruely wrytien self wold scrape frankly warn reader geue credit trust assuredly vntruthe obiected study paine dilligence haue taken certen yeres might know eche thing exactly manye good men witnesse trust also thing self shall declare notwithstanding although comprise thinges haue chaunced thys emperor gouernement al yet aliue hath gouernment although many thynges mo yet may fortune day yet forsomuch former actes chalenge first chiefest greatest part vnto wold longer wanting many learned men germany also foreine nation instantly requiringe wold gratify herein comming doubtlesse moste greuous commotion wonderful alteration thing also holy scripture dothe nether doubtfullye daroklye prognosticate present state thinges doth plainly signify applye theyr minde vnto shall want matter wryte cause moued wryte publicke vtility self perswadeth nowe also thinges haue written comprised xxvi bookes shoulde suffer come abrode others men handes labor pain taken wil dedicate whole vnto moosie excelient prince whiche descended noble house familie whiche fyrsto gaue harborow refuge thys religion whose father earnestly imbrace whose brother education youth true religion learning imploied wonderful substaunce whose father law self cause hath famous name among kinges much also walke theyr fotesteps great commendation worke hope wil profite many trust also vnpleasaunt liuing god preserue highnes safe healthful geuen x kalends april yeare lord first boke firste booke sleidans commentary concerning state religion common wale reigne emperour charles fyfte argument fyrst booke pardon graunted byshop leo luther reproueth preachyng wryting proposicions letter sent tharchbishoppe ments fyrst unpugned frete tckell eckins siluester prier hogestrate upo pope sendeth cardinal caietane taduertise theperour maximilian cite luther rome fridericke duke saxon founde meanes luther aunswered caietane auspurge cardinal threatenynges thalligations decree mainteyneth thauthoritie supremacie pope luther depertynge thence set appellation caietane solliciteth letter duke saxon vaine whiche pope perceyuing publisheth new remission synnes pardon wynne duke fridericke sendeth golde rose meane tyme dieth maximilian great suite meane made taspire vnto thempire whiche fine charles austriche atchieued word sent spaine golden bulle lawes thempire recited erasmus commendeth luther time disputacion lipsia zwinglius preached zuricke luther resisteth perdoner one samson agraye frere bishoppe rome leo tenth name florentine borne vsurped auethoritie predecessours preteded haue ouer church sent forth al realmes vnder bulles lead indulgeces pardos wherein promysed cleane remissyon synnes euerlastynge saluation suche would gyue money leuiyng wherof sent collectours prouinces gathered together heaped vp great treasure place speciallye germanie affirmed doynges good bothe wordes writyng pardon papistes call olde accustomed terme indulgence grauntyng moreouer money licence eate whitmeat fleshe day prohibited time martin luther augustine frere professed diuinitie uniuersitie wittemberge beynge little tickled preachinges fonde bokes collectours sawe howe simple people beleued thinges true bragged began admonishe men ware circumspecte bie marchaundise dere bestowed vpon trifle might much better emploied yeare lorde thousande fiue hondreth seuentene thintent might woorke thynge effect wrote also archebyshop mentz firste nouembre signifying taught also lamenting ignoraunt luther letter b mentz people far abused put whole trust saluation pardon thinke wickednes euer committed forgeuen soules tormented purgatory soone mony cast boxe straight wayes flie vp heauen fele payne sheweth christ comaunded gospell taught propre office byshop see people rightly instructed wherfore putteth reme braunce dutie prayeth authoritie whiche beareth would eyther put prattelinge pardoner silence el prescribe better order teachinge lest inconuenience might growe vpon doubtles wil doo vnlesse inhibited cause wrote vnto muche also byshop maydenburg care al matter b mayde burg charge belonged vnto letter sent certen questios whiche lately set vp wittenberg disputed nombre foure score fiftene whiche reasoneth muche purgatory true penaunce dutie charitie indulgence luther question wittenberge pardos large inueigheth rageouse preachinges certen desyre boulte trie truth prouoked men come disputation hadde anye thinge saye could present desyred send myndes wrytinge protesting would affirme nothing submitte selfe whole matter iudgement holy churche neuerthelesse sayd woulde admitte thomas aquine suche lyke writer farre foorth luther exception consonaunt holy scripture decree auncient father byshop aunswered woords shortly iohn b mentz clence tecela frere dominick set vp conclusion franckford quite contrary luther wherin extolleth supremacie ihon tecell ft concl frankford byshop rome frute pardos lyke thinges muche compareth peter apostle crosse whiche commaundeth set vp church crosse christ suffered vpon man cotrary parte wold repeare disputacion wittenberge question suche many destrous reade luther wrote longe exposition sent first hierome byshop braundenburge one stupice prouinciall austen freres desiring hym cause sent byshop rome self moneth iune wrote vnto leo teth partly complayning pardoner whiche owne auarice abused auethoritie partly purging selfe knowing suertie complayned luters letter pope leo matter affirmyng hym wrong inforced reason fonde sermos bokes collectours set vp certain questios ye matter disputation whiche woulde playnly declare beseching geue credit sclaunderous reportes alledging duke fredericke duke frederick wisdom prince electour saronie man suche wisdome honour case suche thinges true aduersaries reported would haue suffered countrey beare infamie vniuersitie wittenberge lyke consideration submitted vnto workes lyfe also refusing death seme good vnto whatsoeuer procede would take oracle flowed christe selfe amonges others luther aduersaries iohn eckius wroote echins booke luth little booke tyme whiche luther aunswereth neyther bringeth scripture hym thinge auncient doctours certein dreames owne receiued scoolemen vnallowable euill custome eckius one siluester prierias freer dominicke master siluester priers dialogue holy palace terme wrote dialoge preface leo tenth right stoutelye saying woulde proue whether luther inuincible confuted vanquished answer wil set forth greater thinges moste exacte diligence speaketh vnto luther exhorting amende commeth disputation propoundeth certain theme byshop rome head whole silue priers theme churche churche rome firste chiefest others erre matter faythe religion neyther generall counsell erre byshop roome present moreouer holy scripture taketh force authoritie churche byshop rome moste certain rule beleueth wyse heretike foundation one layd beginneth debate matter afterward doth luther luth answer sil priers make answer ye boke preface siluester saith wodreth question rather vnderstadeth takyng example defence cause putteth forth also certen theme suche taken holy scripture wherin sheweth ought geue credit euerye doctrine man way euery thing exactely embrace thing whiche consonaunt goddes worde none doctrine receiued left v prophetes apostle scriptur choldewriters also wed although haue neuer goodly apparence neuerthelesse thautoritie writer whiche next allowed rest well ware wryte concerning indulgence lawfull collectours inuente anye newedeuise herein followe order canon iudulgences vsed canon lawe law obiecteth alledgeth testimony scriptur reciteth opinion thomas aquyne treated maner al thing pleasure without thauthoritie scripture wherfore reiecteth affirming doth onely commanndement saint paule austen also emogs ciuilians commonly sayd lawfull pronounce ciuilias vse citing thyng prescript lawe much lesse diuine matter ought thing suffered spoke without testimony scripture paules precept suche appointed instruct people furnished syllogismes sondry decree men holsome sounde doctrine lefte v godly inspiration muche many haue contemned precepte great blyndnes hath induced innumerable sorte vnprofitable question hath flowed ouer worlde tyme hath thus made waye commeth confutacion aboute thende therof sayth howe nothinge affrayed manasinge wordes set forth brauery albeit shuld dye therfore yet christe liueth immortall vnto whome honoure dewe therfore list come trial matter must fight stronger weapos el authour thomas lyke goo woorse againe syluester writeth luther aunswer saythe deliteth muche submitteth hym silut prier seconde aunswer luth selfe iudgemet byshop rome wyshing also spake harte vnfainedly luther charged ambition fllatterie purgeth self therof muche may defendeth right stoutly doctrine thomas affirming suche sorte receiued approued churche rome ought preferred aboue writinges blameth sore hath spoken worthy man vnreuerently accomptyng honour selfe called thomiste notwithstanding sayeth howe hath red men woorkes also whiche shall hereafter appere preface setteth forth little booke wherin comendeth exceadinly aucthoritie byshop rome much clerely preferreth counselles decree affirminge strength scripture dependeth vpon authoritie thomas comming noble house gaue self wholy learning leauing italy went first collyn paris proued best learned al men time wryting diuers workes whiche treated matter diuinitie philosophie blacke frere disciple albertus magnus whan thomas aquine albertus magnus scollar dead iohn byshop rome xxii yt name made sainct fifty yeares lefte lyfe great mainteiner byshop rome authoritie attributed vnto supremacie ouer byshops kynges church vniuersall thomas aquine salt iurisdictions aswell sacred ciuile affirming necessary thyng vnto saluation men subiect vnto hath full authoritie churche appertaineth call thomas aquin geueth authoritie pope counsell confirme decree made moreouer sayeth howe men may iustlyappeale generall counsell finallye ascribeth vnto thinges onely excepted make newe article faith neither abolishe whiche left v handes apostle auncient father iudulgeces pardon wrote muche also graunting maketh byshop rome great prince died saide thom aq died yeare lorde athousand two hundreth thre score fortene comonly called thangelical doctor subtiltie witte booke syluesters luther aunswereth onlye epistle luth seconde answer siluester prier reader saying compacte altogether lye terrible blasphemy god holy name appeare deuyl himselfe aucthour therof wherfore byshops cardinalles opinion suche doctrine taughte rome seat antechrist rome longer doubted rome seate antechrist happy grece happie lande grece bohemes happines boheme yea fortunate haue made diuorcement wt miserable haue doe wherfore vnlesse bishop see punished compell recante lut forsakig rome protesteth wil dissente fro forsake church rome also take henceforth filthy synke puddell wickednes daylye inuented newe prayses byshop rome suche lyke haue heard subtile ende craftie polycie lawful counsell take place therfore flatterer preferre aboue al counsel affirme vnderstanding scripture must fetched caus wh ye rome extold hande mooste certen iudge wherefore holde madnes iuggelinge caste mocke worlde sorte remedy noone ciuile magistrate must se punished theues murtherers malefactours punished death great deale prince necessitie must reforme ro right whiche muche hurthfull enemy common wealth common assent trauell men supsuppressed bishop rome state al bishop rome bounde god commaundement lesse bounden obseruation goddes commaundementes poorest man liuing teache otherwyse greatest iniury may diuine maiestie tyme also iames hogestrate blackfreer wrote luther full bitterly exhorting byshop rome fyre iames hogestrate wrote luther sworde whome luther aunswering fewe wordes reproueth cruell bloudy mynde scoffing merely man ignoraunce admonishing procede chiefest way wyn true fame tyme man blamed vnlearned euil men byshop leo handes saith looketh better thinges whilest matter thus handled either parte maner scoleme themperour maximilia calleth assemblie ausputg thassembly ausputge maximilian whether also leo tenthe sendeth afterwarde ambassadour thomas caietane cardinall assemblie present seuen prince electours called bycause haue authoritie electe create themperour treated warre againste turke solyman emperour turkes hauing lately subdwed sultane conquered syria egipte wherfore cardinall made exhortacion promysing maisters name treaty warre turke treasure churthe employde vpon warre required herein ayde assistaunce maximilian defendoure churche selfe tyme leo tenth created albart archebyshop mentz cardinall assemblie comaundeth caietane cosecrate ceremony rytes accustomed albert archb mentz mabe cardinall whiche thing doone accordingly themperour leadeath home newe cardinall churche sendeth presentes saye princelyke horselitter wythe horse manye ryche costly hangynges byshop rome gaue also hat set golde pearle precious iwels swoorde gylt skabarde moste part al bishoppes germany wel ciuile ecclesiasticall magistrate howbeit thoughte cause cardinalship leo preferred dignitie theude church rome myght haue defendour germany suche oue nobilitie birth authoritie also right famous lyke vnto man could founde besydes noble house brandenburg archebyshop mentz chiefest prince electours consull euer albeit byshops bonde byshop rome yet made cardinalles muche bonden maximilian aduertised controuersie luther maximilians lettre pope leo cocerning luther moneth august writeth letter byshop roome signifiyng hath heard sorte luther hath reasoned many matter preached also thinges seme hereticall sory defendeth doctrine styfly hath many fauorers opinion emonges whiche diuers hygh estate exhorteth hym therfore hyghe authoritie beareth would abolyshe suche idle vnprofitable question inhibite sophisticall contencions wordes much applie study way little hurt christe comon weale intent thing whiche haue learned bee praysed receyued men alledging tyme past great diligence shewed appoyntinge ayt preacher intent ye al sophisticall contention myght eschewed howbeit order lyttle lyttle felle cotempt maruell suche haue taught others haue oftentimes erred selues cause therof somuch auncient writer interpretours holy scripture haue long tyme layde syde filled full lye maye bee imputed also muche contention reysed oure day matter learnyng laste daungerouse controuersie pardon certeinly weightines thinge requireth remedie betyme lest disease runne farre delaye daunger euer shall determine therin wyll allowe see shall take place throughout partes thempire mencion made howe luther syluester wroote one nowe office rome aggrauated luther matter leo cited tappeare rome luther cited rome vnder great penaltie afterwardes xxiij day august wryteth letter caietane ambassadour germany signifiyng howe aduertysed luther holdeth certein opinion wycked iudgement churche roome whiche maistres faith religion fatherly loue desyrous represse rashenes hath geuen commaundement hierome byshop ascula vnto whome thing properly apperteyneth somone hym rome might aunswere matter charged might also make declaracio fayth byshop ascula executed commaundemet comme amendement stubbernly persistinge heresy set forth muche pestilent workes great grief vexation mynde wherfore let fynde meanes may brought auspurge herein requiring ayde emperour prince germany wha brought thither appreheded sent rome wherfore repent owne accorde desyre remission offence let hym pardoned restored churche whiche neuer wont exclude true penitent let excommunicated commaundeth moreouer men shall obeye letter shall otherwyse ecclesiasticall persones confiscateth goodes promotion therwith taketh awaye hope possibilitie obtaine hereafter others ciuile office depriued al honour office commodity finally want christen buriall vnto shall dooe faithfull seruice herein pleasure shall haue eyther common ful remission sinnes haue also rewarde geuen precept byndeth men emperour excepted wyse wylleth ma fredome priuilege shuld force herein day also writeth frederick duke pope letter duke saxo saxon tyme auspurg howe emonge ornamentes house sarony euer propre vnto greatly fauour religion wherfore sayeth lyke noble familie farre degenerate elder mayntayne man would impugne notwithstanding harde dayly greuous coplaintes martin luther bearyng selfe highly prince fauour forgetting ordre profession doth many thinges wickedly churche regarding authoritie albeit doubteth braggeth prince fauoure falselye yet thought good wryte vnto herein admonishe euer myndefull owne honour dignitie auncestours myght eschewe crime selfe also lest suspicion sayeth well assured teacheth manye wicked pestilent heresy whiche maister palace haue dylygently noted verely cause hath cited hym appere rome written cardinall caietane ambassadour would haue furthermore donne matter muche matter religion doeth appertaine properlye churche rome examine euerye man faythe requyreth hym neuerthelesse chargeth commaundeth hym beynge requested vnto ambassadour doe endeuoure brynge passe luther maye bee delyuered custodye wherein shall bothe dooe god hygh seruice also thynge shall hym selfe hys familie ryght honourable case shall bee founde faulte hym whan shall examined roome maye retourne home safe sounde case bee founde crime worthie punishemet shal duke whiche wold longer suffer pestilet fellow clere al blame part clemecie yt neither wold oppres innococent exclude fauour one willyng amende thus sought meanes possible oppresse luther pope letter gabriel veneius yeare moreouer wrote vnto gabriel prouinciall thaustine fryer spedely seke redresse martin luther frier vnder iurisdiction soweth newe opinion germany quickly quenche flamme newly kyndled lest proces tyme takyng force strengthe paste remedy set fyre disease increaseth dayly neyther thynge much feared delaye therfore must applye thynge study labour deuise diligence muche hathe authoritie ouer hym whan luther perceiued selfe cited rome laboured muche haue matter heard germany indifferent iudges place subiect iniury coulde meanes bryng passe vniuersitie wittenberge letter vniuersitie wittenberg writeth luther byshop rome written xxv septembre gaue hym maruelouse good reporte lyfe learnyng saye howe cited rome certain question howbeit reason sickenes daunger lyfe notable beseche hym haue none opinion good man propownded certen thinges dispute determine whiche aduersaries haue interpreted woorse parte haue exasperated ye matter proteste howe wyll admitte nothinge churche requested luther coulde geue hym testimony whiche beseche geue credit letter sende others also charles meltice germaine chamberlaine byshop leo vnto whome declare luther without desertes brought great hatred byshop muche cited rome could yet fynde muche fauour cause might herde germany saye howe affected toward religion also towardes holy churche rome case cryme wicked errour luther would beare man suche learnyng honestie lyfe hath well deserued whole vniuersitie faile case neyther would duke frederick faithful wittie prince vnlesse iudged honest suffer long vnpunyshed wherfore require fauour estimacion yt hath byshop would bryng passe indifferet iudges might appointed rome germany doubte declare selfe lyke christen man good diuine hath rashely without cause sought occasion strife require earnestly muche haue conceiued greater hope whiche germain selfe wil naturally coutrie sake honest matter helpfull germaine maner oppressed daunger lyfe besydes intercession frendes duke fredericke deuised cardinall auspurge luther nede trauayle rome come pleed luther called auspurg cause caietane comming thether begynnyng october remayned thre dayes spake cardinall duke friderick gone homewarde aduised frendes come cardinalles fyght emperour maximilian graunted saufe conduicte whiche obtayned gently receyued cardinal sayd would contende disputacion frendly appease controuersy according byshops roomes commaundemente propoundeth two thinges first come ame dement reuoke suche errours published secondlye henceforth abstayne suche wrytinges disturbe tra quillitie churche hereunto doeth luther make aunswer priuie errour hath erred thyng desyreth conferens cardinal caietane maye shewed wherein cardinall chargeth hym affirmeth question howe merites oure sauioure christe consiste treasure pardon whiche sentence saith decree clemet syxte moreouer vnto come receiue sacramet faith necessary wherby myght assured synnes forgeuen neyther true sayeth cardinall luther aunswered read decree byshop shewed mynde touching mention made thomas aquine affirmeth authoritie scripture preferred farre aboue hym cardinall extolling byshop rome authoritie preferreth aboue scripture counselles recityng howe cou sell whiche determined contrary abrogated condemneth also gerson paris fauourers opinion contrariwyse luther denieth authoritie byshop aboue cou sell alledging emonges others diuines paris opinio long disputacion could agree luther asketh deliberation next day retourneth presence secretary certain witness foure also emperours counsell protesteth beareth dew reuerence holy churche rome haue spoken thyng wyll haue ratified howbeit much admonished commaundeth forsake errours abstayne henceforth supposeth hath spoken nothing swarueth either holy scripture opinion auncient father decree byshoppes also ryght reason yet denye may erre disceiued may euery man therfore committeth hearing lawfull holy churche referryng whole matter iudgement wil also rendre reason doctrine place may suffise wil make aunswere wryting argumentes may brought refuse stande iudgement herein vniuersities germany paris cardinal charged againe done daye decree clement though made muche fine permitteth hym deliuer vp wryting theffect wherof time set vp question wrote exposition red decree clement mynde therewith satisfied although established decree byshop rome aswell receiued voyce peter apostle yet ought taken muche thei consonaunt holy scripture agreable decree auncient father doubt voyce peter sacred holy yet soore rebuked paule neyther coulde doctrine receiued tofore consente churche whiche hierusalem hadde establyshed wordes men may hearde thinges must referred wordes christ disceaued decree sondrye place scripture cause whiche tyme brought question afterwarde affraied make exposition euer synce tyme fully resolued stire vp disputation concernyng matter rather heare opinion others albeit leuer instructed others especially byshop roome yet muche constrained necessitie defende owne wyl proue best make decree question accorde whan made preface goeth matter selfe certain expositio made sheweth howe decree maketh purpose yet would neither bishoppes authoritie owne estimation therby infringed commeth seconde parte hys accusation alledging purpose many place scripture declareth playnly howe faith maketh v iust god wherfore desyreth deale fauourably shewe hym errour force thinges whiche alledged scripture muche beleueth sufficiently grou ded vpon owne truthe whiche forsake much ought rather obey god therfore requireth may released harde burthen recantynge came contencion vpon arrogancie desyre vayn glorie yea would wyshe nothing truthe might opened man el myght bryng moore learned godly beseched yt may copelled hurt conscience cardinall receiued wryting offered vnto luther whan red estemed lyghtly yet promysed sende byshop rome vrged muche recant vnlesse doe threateneth punishment appointed already byshop also commaundeth sight vnlesse amende maners come presence threatening whiche xvij day octobre luther wrote vnto gentle letter ful good wil dutie caietane thus chidden luther sent away wrought secretly iohn stupice prouincial augustine freers shuld induce recant accorde wherfore luther letter maketh mention stupice verely omitting nothing becometh faithfull frendly man dooe geueth thankes beneuolence towardes whiche perceiueth well talke stupicious wherby doubtles much comforted nowe would gratifie man rather hym graunteth ouer quicke little regarde byshop rome authoritie howe imputed importunitie collectours desyreth forgeuen fault promyseth modeste hereafter affirmeth also wyll sermon satisfie byshops request cocerning indulgence wil speake therof aduersaries may lykewyse commaunded silence reuoke sentence already taught defended safe conseience tyll suche tyme testimony holy scripture codemned errour therfore requyreth hearing matter may referred byshop rome nothing ran dooe hym pleasure heare voyce churche whan cardinall would make none aunswere letter manased wordes counsell frendes departed thence two dayes leauing behind appellation openlye set luther appeleth vp tyme departure euer went wrote agayne cardinall hath done able howe came foote sickly longe iournaye auspurg intent might declare dutie towardes byshop rome nowe hauing litle monye left lothe longer chargeable house white freres host dryuen retourne rather abyde sight hath forboden presens wherefore freindes maner counsailed appeale bishoppe selfe whiche woulde haue done aduise freindes chifely supposeth duke friderick also rather appellatio made thinge rashely vnaduisedly reuoked appellation made muche sort question touching indulgence hath bene diuersely handled many neuer throughly determined suche doubtefull question hath bene alwayes lawfull namely diuines reason thing also selfe time whan certein clamorous pardoner onely write teache rashely vncircumspectlye also polled people exceadingly yet affirme anye thinge trie trueth committed also whole controuersie iudgemente learned men euen bishoppe rome pardonars haue inuented sclaunders haue complayned sore byshoppe brought matter suche passe last matter committed bishop ascula syluester prierias cited rome much wer suspected one also vnfit iudge matter moreouer shold haue gone rome douted shold haue ben great dauger lif last comauded prince remain home cause also feare may come vpo costant liuing desyred duke friderick bring passe yt hearyng matter might referred skilful fitte men germany place suspected subiect iniurie wherfore bishop rome hath committed ye whole matter ambassador cardinal caietane whiche doubtles done instaunce aduersaries whiche knewe alreadye mynde wyll cardinall thoughe myghte wythoute iuste cause suspected yet dyd obey cardinall fyrste metynge commaunded reuoke workes whereunto aunswered woulde iustifye done eyther present disputation writinge yet would submit whole matter onely vniuersities also iudgement churche rome al thynges beynge nothing satisfied commaunded styll recante coulde bringe threatened greuous punishment bothe others also opinion therfore findeth selfe sore greued suche preiudices doeth appeale byshoppe rome well infourmed matter bishop yt shal better instructed protesteth openlye furthermore decree clement founde parte cannon lawe called extrauagaunte clemente appoynteth yere iubile boniface eight ordained euery hundreth yeare nowe euerye fiftithe yeare speakinge benefite sauioure christe welspring pardon sayeth howe one droppe christes bloud bene sufficient haue redemed man kynde wherefore ouerplus hathe left treasure wyth peter successours dyspose distribute vpon penitente personnes confesse theyr synnes lyke good stewardes releue temporall punisshemente dewe vnto theyr synnes moreouer besyde merittes uirgin marie sainctes belonge vnto thys place saieth matter power remyttynge synnes vnmeasurable wherefore vpon decree caietaine groundeth authoritie pardon luther sayth howe nothyng committed peter hys successours besydes keyes ministration worde wherein christ commaundeth trust remissio sinnes shold shewed beleuers true sence meanyng scripture decree clement meane thus content otherwise alow whiche spoken moreouer merites saintes wholy agaynst holy scripture men soeuer onely oughte also muche bounden neither saued owne merites sole mere mercy god men must pray dayly god father forgeue v offence stand iudgement agaynst v lest damned touchynge whiche cardinall inferreth authoritie byshoppe rome thus standeth case enacted fourth fifte syttyng cou sell constaunce bishop rome selfe obey decree synode afterwarde established repeted pope vnder coun seuententh eyghtenth syttting counsel basil wheras eugenius fourth would come counsell basill although oftentimes warned cited thither pronounced frustrate called farrare whither came iohn paleologe last emperour grece saue one iosippe patriarche constantinople numbre bishoppes yeare lord mccccxxxvij farrare remoued florence consent grekes decreed amonges thinges church rome haue supremacie yt bishop rome successor peter prince thapostels trew vicar christ head ye whole church ye father doctor al christias comitted christ ful power fede gouerne church vniuersal decree whereby caietanus woulde preferre bishoppe rome aboue generall counsel syxe yeares whan yet cardinall maister blacke frieres made oration seconde syttynge counsell laterane wherof shall speake hereafter inueiyng muche agaynste certeyne cardinalles forsaken bishop rome taunteth waie counselles costauntz basil father tune toke selues aucthoritie ouer byshoppes wherefore saieth wel done eugenius suppressed factio suffered aucthoritie diminished oration iulius seconde whose fauoure thynges spoken commaunde recorded caietane made cardinall leo gerson paris tenth gerson spake diuine paris right famouse wrote diuers worckes presente counsell constans bookes written commendeth hyghely decree whereby agreed byshoppe rome subiecte counsell sayeth thing worthie written church publike place perpetuall memorye saieth pestilent flatterer whiche brynge thys tyrranny churche thoughe bishoppe rome ought neither obey counsel iudged though counsell take force aucthoritie thoughe coulde called pleasure though bounden obseruation lawes none accompt myght taken doynges certeinly monstruous sayinges muste vtterly reiected lawes equitie reason aucthoritie churche dependeth generall counsell lawefull appeale pope vnto inquire whether byshop rome churche greater make wise question aske whether part whole aperteineth cousel constitute iudge depose byshop rome lately declared constaunce semed doubte pope iohn deposed matter attributed ouermuche byshoppe question determined iohn three twentith deposed seate many thinges writeth gerson effecte therefore nowe reiected caietane died yere oure lorde mccccxxix vniuersitie paris holdeth opinio includeth vnmesurable vsurpation romishe byshoppes wyth boundes fewe monthes luther wrote indulgence uniuersite appealed leo tenthe abolyshyng law whych profitable studentes fraunce opened waye promotion luther departure aspurge cardinall writeth letter ye duke saxonie fiue twentye daye october signifiynge luther dede came auspurge spake caietan writeth ye duke saxonie till obteined themperours safeconduit marueileth greatlye little credit geuen much treaty aboute matter certaine fatherly loue admonished luther amende albeit waxed stubberue yet deuise stupice others waye reconcilemente suche forte neyther churche rome shoulde lose dignitie estimation wheras good foundation thing already laid went preuely away first stupice luther whiche chaunced muche contrary expectation luther pretendeth treateth matter onlye waye reasonynge disputation sermon people affirmeth thynges whiche maye wise bee permitted muche hys doctrine bothe swarueth churche rome also verye parnicious certainlye proued wherefore dothe admonishe regarde owne honour conscience either sed luther rome el banishe countrye pestilent thinge shoulde longe continue neyther anye doubt wil procede iudgement againste rome hath accordinge duetie signified bishop whole matter clokynge prayeth hym therefore geue credit vnto suche commended luther doinges neither suffer greate euill spot blemishe noble house saxonie like oftentimes promised whiche epistle exhibited duke letter cardinall ninetene daye nouembre duke fredericke maketh aunswere eighte daye decembre promised sende luther auspurge whiche beinge perfourmed require promised likewise let frendly departe nowe woulde dryue hym recante hys matter hearde lyttle maruell dyuerse well learned men aswell partes countrye whyche dyd condemyne doctrine suche hys aduersaries blyneded wyth auarice corrupted wyth filthye lucre case hys erroure hadde bene detected woulde whiche seeketh bothe glorye god safetye hys owne conscience haue done readye herein duetye christen prynce therefore wryteth processe shall passe againste sayde luther rome beyonde hys expectation desyreth moreouer eyther shoulde sente rome elles exile lawfull hym firste yet detected heresye secondely shoulde greate losse uniuersitie wittemberge whiche lately founded whereof luther certeine lyghte ornament unto whome sent letter myght reade offereth selfe readye dispute matter anye indifferente place iudged anye indifferente hearer elles aunswere matter wrytynge whiche request reasonable muche wyll defende none errour wyllyngly thynketh meete graunted length maye appeare wherefore shoulde accompted heretike selfe myghte chieflye folowe lyke wyll maynteine errour willyngly woulde verye lothe swarue church rome euen condemne heretike tofore detected errour nowe luther sene cardinales letter sayed wrote againe hys prince immediatlye wente caietaine obtayned emperours saufeconduit done aduise freindes cardinall would haue recante suche thynges wrytten touchynge pardon faythe necessarye sacramentes fyrste dyd muche passe denye wherein consisteth effecte saluatio might wise coset declareth place scripture papistes depraue wraste wronge sense reciteth also done euery day howe length cardinall began threaten vndoubtedly wisheth nothing might shewed wherein erreth case rome shall refuse take muche paine poore man least wise let write hereof duke selfe themperor great bishoppe germanye elles appoynt somwhere free disputation whiche thinges haue denyed hitherto thus perseuer easye iudged whether faulte exhorte crueltie oughte perswaded woordes seme note errours might muche easely sende writyng germany tha great charge present daunger life trauaile rome vnderstande errours finally wheras boasteth iudgement shall passe againste rome vnlesse eyther come thither exiled refuseth exile although knoweth full well place safe hauynge many aduersaries liynge waite hym moreouer great griefe vnto man shoulde sake incurre daunger wherefore lest attempte thing departe limittes whole countrey whither soeuer shall please god leade wherfore geueth thankes prayeth prosperous health reioyseth self hath pleased god suffer thinge glorie christes name dyd uniuersitie wittenberge moneth nouembre uniuersitie wittenberge writeth lut write vnto duke theyr fauourable letter luther behalfe nowe vnderstode luther cardinall caietanes letter bothe request also offer luther made auspurge luther therefore requireth errour maye shewed submitteth selfe holy churche rome beseche see open wronge shewe erroure way oute holye scripture selfe hopeth well gentlenesse bishop leo feareth lest aduersaries flatter abuse name churche albeit duke accomplishe papistes requestes semed rather defende luther tofore maye appeare yet neuer read hys woorkes yet hearde preache selfe witnesseth letter written auspurge raphell riare cardinall olde acquaintaunce frindely admonished shold take vpon defence luther whilest thinges doinge leo fearinge alteration establissheth indulgence newe decree new pardon sayinge doctrine romaine churche maistres others bishoppe rome successour peter christes uicare hath authoritie graunte great benefite suche sorte shall profit onely quicke also deade purgatorie doctrine muste men receyue beleue vnlesse sequestred felowshippe holy churche decree sent caietane mighte published vnto men folowyng commaundement publisshed thinge lintz towne austriche riuer danubye tonoware decembre sendeth copy byshoppes germany commaunding leo name vnder great penaltie immediatly set foorth euery man dioces commaunded reuerently kept obserued luther perceiuing cardinal letter sentence shoulde geuen luther appealeth pope counsell rome putteth vp newe appellation xxviij day nouembre wherin conteined would diminishe thauthoritie bishoppes rome thinking rightly muche lesse dissent churche notwithstandyng muche byshoppe state mortall men maye maye erre offende neither ought attributed vnto alone cannot erre disceiued proueth exemple peter erred sounde doctrine sharpely openlye rebuked paule aucthoritie rich bishoppe rome great may commaunde liste careth man suche thinke haue wronge hande haue onely one remedie lefte appeale reciteth howe inforsed throughe ouer muche asperitie cardinall caietane appeale bishop rome whose humanitie thought haue founde fauoure asmuch offered reasonable coditions promised al thinges errour beyng taken away nowe sin appellation condemned offer dispised lookynge helpe health bishoppes hande might learne cardinalles letter written duke saxonie beynge broughte thorow extreme necessitie appealeth bishoppe rome nexte general cousell al meanes ought preferred bishop rome sendeth charles meltice chamberlaine pope sendeth golden rose duke saxonie germanye presente duke fridericke golden roose bishoppe yearely wonte consecrate many ceremony great pompe solemnitie token singular freindship geue vnto wrot also degenart phesfinger noble man duke counsell praiyng also woulde suite duke maister luther childe sathan might punished noble house saxonie might thorowe blemished effecte also wrote george spalatine better perswade said wholy geuen plucke vp euillwedes christes felde sorte wrote vice chauncelour also degenart desyring moue duke fridericke imitation auncestors commit nothing vnworthy famouse memory wha meltice come saxonie exhibited rose folowed suite right stoutly whiche thynge knowen luther thirde day marche writeth bishop rome letter full submission wherin declareth howe greuously complained vpon vnto duke whose displeasure smal grief vnto besydes stil called vpon recate might honoure dignitie churche rome refuse since germany therbe many wittie wel lerned men hable iudge controuersie rather blotte hinderaunce churche rome anye furtheraunce dignitie hath done iniurie therunto collectours pardoner couetousnes vttered shamefull thynges people haue complained accused without deserte beareth affection towardes churche rome attempt nothinge againste power thereof great christ onely excepted nothinge worlde excellent besecheth credite enemy pardon wyll make mention hys aduersaries maye lykewyse commaunded kepe silence wyll also admonishe people sermon thinke well churche rome ascribe vnto auarice others yet folowe example thorowe impudencie aduersaries enforced treate vnreuerently briefely thinges quietnes errour false parswasion remayne mindes men meltitius came germany themperour maximilian death maximilian departed life austriche vij daye januarye time wer prince electours albert mentz herman collon rycharde treuers archebyshoppes lewes palsegraue fridericke duke saxonie joachin marque brandenburge kingdome boheme lewes kinge hungry beynge called assemblie archebyshop mentz custome empire month june mette franckefourt towne ryuer moene except kinge boheme sent thither depute ladislaus sterneberge archebyshop mentz beginneth oratio speakyng much weightie importaunce thing exhorteth vnto concord declaryng many exaples heape euilles dissention prince electours brought germany within father memorye nowe one mynde consent muche requisite greater daunger hageth ouer turke others seke spoyle germanye two aspire dignitie thempire charles archeduke austriche three yeres succeded ferdinando kinge spaine graundfather mother side fraunces frenche kynge whiche foure yeares past vanquisshed heluetians marignane possessed dukedome millan kynge spaines ambassadoures comen alreadye mentz whiche fyue mile franckefurt frenche ambassadours staied confluence towne archebishoppes treuers rhine moselle mete whence either partie letter messagers commended eche prince electours beste reason perswade especially frenche perceiued cause lesse fauoured differed fro german laguage lawes maners sente therefore heluetians praiynge matter prince notwithstandyng dyd cleane contrarye exhortyng chose one prince germany swises also wrote leo tenthe praiynge asmuche hys parte inueste confirme emperour beyng chosen woulde se geuen foreine prince aunswered heard say one laboured might haue lawe kynges naples tributary bishoppe rome haue promysed faith couet empire content one hath admonished prince hereof alreadye ment tale charles austriche fauoured frenche kynge euer syns subdewed heluetians led awaye maximilian sfortia duke millan captife fraunce whiche yere lorde mdxv aboute ides septembre swiss banquished whome decembre folowinge mette bonony made perfecte league amitie touching kingdome naples thus standeth time manfredus bastarde sonne emperour fridericke seconde made warre agaynste churche rome clement fourthe byshoppe name yeare oure lorde mcccccxv thentent represse hym whiche predecessor urban fourth aboute doo sent charles erle gaunte prouince fraunce kinges naples paye tribute rome italy made kynge sicilie naples yet vnder condition fyrst suche benefite receiued pay yerely churche rome fortie thousand ducates moreouer shoulde time sewe emperour yet take vpon beynge offered freely prince comen consulte archebishoppe talked seuerally fridericke duke oration archebyshop meiz saxonie whose authoritie verye greate begynneth matter whiche saieth diuided three question whether fraunces frenche kyng charles king spaine el germane chosen emperour touchinge french kynge saieth suppose prohibited lawes othe also wherby prouided dignitie empire alienated straungers thinke man doubteth foreine prince albeit let yet commune weale seketh meanes enlarge kingdome hath ioyned millan attempte germany warre vpon charles whome hateth yea hathe proclamed already germanye shall tormoiled vprores ought forese styrre vp ciuill warres inuade austriche suerly shall leaue breres hath themperour maxilimilian deserued thus v empire countreis ouer runne howe longe thinke shall libertie continewe maye truste fayre promise oftentimes couetousnesses ambition cary awaye men headlonge doyng theyr dewtie time paste many noble house fraunce nowe fewe nombre kinge maner hathe owne handes say stouce prince like brynge monarchie seke maintaine present state nobilitie promiseth great aide agaist turke dede thinge wished germany mighte ioyne wyth fraunce italy first wil bend power againste house burgundy warre vppon flaunders naples shall aide enterprise least say prophecied dreames doubtfull matter leuying armye forasmuche therfore letted oure lawes othe loue natiue country protest iudge vnmete elected nowe rest party suppose thyncke vnmete charles shoulde chosen spaine farre absence go well germany either turkishe warre ciuile dissentions thinges onlye graunte true also consider depelye moued maner quake feare waye also emperour time come germany displesure bring spaniardes shalbe daunger lose liberty consider moreouer may spaniard wil hardly time restore vnto v dignitie thempire force power recouer millan kepe hereafter selues almost semeth better create one owne nation fit example elder whiche passinge ouer foreine prince haue chosen inhabiter contrie wil deny state tyme farre otherwise worlde great deale better nowe emperour small power thinke austriche country obey frenche kinge warre vpon charles without doubte wyll eyther lowe countrey italie shall geue lokyng shal new emperour suffer straunge nation spoile great parte empire yea world goeth day thought prince germany contemnynge theyr emperour ioyne selues house austriche frenchemen fridericke third emperour charles duke burgundie warred germany philip maria duke millan italy represse dishonour moreouer greater shame whan emperour beseged austriche yea driuen oute owne countrey hungarian yet time dyd lande boheme take parte also graundefather albert marque bradeburge duke saxonie name chaunce see like ensew day prince addicted others stipendes leaue speake howe many incidente cause maye chaunce whiche prince city maye refuse shewe obeidience moreouer like haue great tumultes trouble religio ther spronge vp disputation indulgence authoritie byshoppe rome ecclesiasticall lawes whiche seme yet curable euer longe cause great ruine alteration churche manye subcribe myghtye nation maynteine cause saxon heluetians neither mischief holpen generall counsell howe shall emperour small power eyther call counsell defende especially kinges agaynst remayneth turkish warre must onely defende make also recouer lost restore grece vnto libertie doynge whereof haue nede aide many sundry nation emperour haue small power litle authoritie howe shall gather greate army cause iudge mete chose mightie prince charles austriche preferred prince germanie incommoditie put feare thinke great deale lesse shall ensew case gouernement committed anye bothe germayne borne hath many country holdynge empire see owne countrey brought bondage besydes shall sweare neither alienate diminish thempire break infringe liberty albeit great cause haue mentioned yet moue one whit vnlesse towardnes wel knowen loueth religion justice chastitie hateth crueltie hath good witte vertues shall euer admonishe mainteine comonwealth know throughly muche commende consyder well hys father philippe graundfather maximilian doubt great age yet fitte ripe gouerne shall haue graundefathers counsellours certeine prince germany chosen purpose whereas said worst shoulde longe oute germany shall condition matter asmuche hathe greate possession germany time come see shall turke driuen hungary frenchemen oute italy church shal refourmed established many others holpen thynges cosyder care lesse absens owne naturall courage loue countrey verye necessitie thinges shall prouoke come ofte amonge v oration archbi treuers archebyshop ended oration exhorted rest speake myndes others talked litle together desired archebishoppe treuers succede syngular witte experience muche estimation began tale prophete sayd maximilian last germaine emperour nowe saieth thinketh almost comen passe forasmuche lorde mentz hath spoken many thinges wittely hath gon aboute perswade v commit gouernement empire straunger maruell muche preferreth spaniarde frencheman certes lament state germany folowe steppe oure elder shoulde nede forayne helpe nowe seyng seke vpon straungers thinge procure owne bondage leauynge complainte folowe order lorde mentz hath done speake fyrst lawe oure othe chiefe cause ground law suppose lest foreine prince chosen certen habitation germany dignitie thempire shoulde litle litle alieuated straungers meaning lawe spaniarde chosen frencheman charles may created hathe landes lyinge within empire necessitie must force also fraunces hath millan membres common weath wherefore two thinges propounded let fraunce germani wer ted v see whether better certaynly wha fraunce vnited germany empire florishe muche remembraunce time doth litle delite chance reade story therof like occasion offered v whiche certainly would let slippe foreyne nation also opinion bishop rome venetian prince city italie frenchman come ofspringe vse almost lawes maners shewyng loue gentlenesse men vicinitie therof necessary italia v tumult shall arise straight way shall armye ready fraunce shall paye wage turke shall inuade either hungary italye verelye thincke wil shal goodly matter haue nere florishing emperoure fournished strength either nation spaniard though accompted warlicke notable thing euer italye without healpe germanes furthermore farre v loke helpe handes time though would neuer faine yet healpe v greatlye spaine wasted continual sayling send forth great nombre men moreouer shall haue frenchman fellow souldiours companion trauell paine spaniardes thing wel done haue al praise selues enioye boaties rule country shal bewaile bondage late leaue comparison come election chose kynge fraunce shalbe none occasion warre italy hathe millan nowe possession shall perswade shall attempte nothinge naples nether base countreis flauders artois yt wil quiet yet see shoulde thincke countreis ought defended v dede oure neigbours haue league wt neither obserue lawes thempire geue thing towardes comon charge doth englad scotlade seing yt frech kiges power greatest hath lubardy quiet possessio furnished wt al thinges necessary wil attempt greater enterprise honorable moue warre namely turke bend al power thither wardes yt cruel enemie expulsed hugary italy germany maye liue rest case preferre charles liuing god tumultes shall raise vp italy wil recouer millan wilbe long warre whilest goodly cou trey shalbe thus tourmoyled turkes inuade hungary theyr whole power praye shall resiste able bringe sufficient armie agaynst thinges would consydered diligently passed ouer lightly nowe end italyan warre shalbe vncerten frenche kynge conquere couet naples maye byshoppe rome throughe impulson vndo oure election trouble arise thereby euerye manne perceyueth righte well agayne charles get better hande let v loke haue italy restored againe spaniardes kepe selues foreuer onely wyll hardely let theyr handes empyre kepyng naples possession wherof wel knowen came misery haue suffered may therfore brought italy speake thinges either king doubt king charles milde gentle disposition reported many yonge man howe men discerne vertues required mightye prynce common welth nede suche one besides thinges could establish reforme state church lord mentz wittely admonishe verely king fraunces performe best men hath good wit good iudgemente hath oftentimes conferens lerned men religion readeth muche selfe moreouer state presente time requyreth prince captaine skilfull warres payneful lucky shall behalf take price away fraunces vertue rightwell tried knowen king charles haue noue experiment towardnes promiseth thinge prowes dedes armes doeth farre excell auncestours hath latly ouercome battaill swisers mighty nation neuer subdued syns iulius cesars time yonge man therefore oughte wyse preferred worthye capitayne lorde mentz doeth accompte discommoditie theperour shold longe germanye yet biddeth v take thoughte matter thinke matter full greate daunger haue emperour absente farre withoute border empire shall resiste inuasions turkes shall represse sodayne insurrection ciuile vprours arise tempest shall saue shyppe wanteth master shal know certentie oure affayres beynge absent many thynges shalbe told vntruely shall haue germaines counsell spaniardes onely wyll make many decree send vnto v farre tyme season afterwardes beynge tyckled wyth false complaintes sklaunders come germany anyetyme armye foreine souldiours state thinke shall wyth empire wherfore thinke good oure destinie foreine prince shall time weare oure crowne vpon heade certenly thinke mete preferre frenche kynge spanishe lawe prohibite v chose frenchekinge letthe take place spanishe kinge let v throughe subtill interpretation accompt king charles germanie let v espie amonges prince one whiche hath mansion germany germanie birthe language maners dispotition lorde mentz supposeth suche emperour shoulde small abilitie dispised chose mete man germanie riche stronge enough beare vp burthen raffe xj themperour raffe emperour maximilian man small power excelled vertue restored thepire ful weak sore afflicted great warres sorte kinges feare good opinion also foreine prince amonges others lewes xij king fraunce themperor maxilian onely wit vertue suppose knowe righte well doubtles prince germany haue bene euer muche estimation yet noble fame extinguished florisheth stil amoges others day thre principal house germani house bauar saxonie bradenburge house also diuers worthy wherfore chose one assist aide surely bouden shal nede feare straugers one minde althinge shalbe saftie therfore setting part straungers let v create one owne cou treymen shal proue right wel many domestical example vertue wherof shall recite one matthias kinge hugary stout warriour fortunate proclaimed warre vpon time againste father lord saronie whe perceiued sufficient armie prepared againste anger sone pacified mighte also meanes founde emperor owne nation elected might mainteinehis estate authoritie home broad thirdly spake ye duke saxonie proued frenche king excluded lawe king charles germayne prince haue habitation germany said common weale nede mightie prince knew noue compared charles therfore contented declared emperor yet vpon certen condition germany shall reteike libertie daungers mentioned eschewed finallye rest approued sentence archbyshoppe treuers sayde see fatall destenye germany alteration euen nowe hande withstandynge asmuche semeth good confourme wyll vnto iudgemente xxviij daie iune darke night wherfore departed mette agayne next daye began treate condition propounded emperour matter debating certein day lengthe agreed vpon written sent ambassadours mentz whan receiued theyr voice committed writinge maner sealed daye thempire offered friderick duke duke saxo refuseth emperour saxonie stout courage refused gaue voice vnto king charles whose ambassadours doynge offered hym great sume money vtterly refused would suffer also take one farthing tharchbishop mentz calling nobilitie comon people church saint bartholomew sermo declareth charles archduke austrich king spaine charles declared emperour king romanes ye stede maximilia departed yt chosen wt cosent saieth ought geue god thankes exhorting shew fidelitie obeysauce speaking much praise declareth chose others thambassours comen myle sent matthew ye cardinall salisburge erarde bishop liege barnard bishoppe trent fridericke countie palatine casimire marque bradeburge henry erle nasso maximilia sibebouge certe others cousel whe come cosulted howe common wealth gouerned vntill suche tyme came selfe germany howe casimire paulsgraue leuie force men place garisons foresee state take harme afterwardes prince electours sente ambassadours letter king charles declare whole matter chief fridericke paulsgraue howbeit ye meane time friderick paulsgraue sent spaine diuerse messenger went spaine amonges one went fro franckefurth barcelona nine dayes countie palatine arriued ende nouembre deliuereth prince letter content wherof would receiue thempire offered delaye sette parte repaire germany soone mighte aunswereth ryght curtesiye mouthe mercurine cattinar beit muche trouble towardes turkes frenche men yet withstondyng sayd neither coulde woulde faile common countrie chiefly syns noble prince opinion required wherfore receiueth honour offered right thankefully shortly may imbarke self come border thempire maner wordes writeth prince electours sendeth home fridericke honourably rewarded thus made emperor fift yt name xxj yeres age frenche kyng toke repulse greuouslie perceiued greater dauger hang ouer state seing power enemie suspected herby muche increased rather man el bene chosen geuen great somme money haue bene cosydered flauders like case reported herein affirme nothing certenly declare petiegre kinge charles charles fift surnamed wise king frauce gaue dukedo burgudy fel vnto philip yongest brother philip maried afterwards ye lady margaret thonly daughter lewes erle flauders sonne called iohn sonne named philip father charles stoute warriour slaine nancey leauing daughter called mari inheritour many great coutreis maried maximilia sonne theperor friderick iij brought forth son called philip maried ye lady iane ye daughter ferdinado kig spaine ij son charles ferdinado whan lady wt child went flauders brought abed charles gaut yeare lorde md xxiiij day february thynge sayd ferdinado theperours graudfather mother side byrth emperor king aragonie sicilie wife elizabeth daughter heyre iohn seconde kyng spaine fine also kingdome naples begotte fyue child iohn isabel iane mary katherine iohn isabell deynge without issewe inheritaunce lawes realme came vnto iane next syster meanes yt duke burgudie exceding much whatsoeuer ferdinando king spaine came wholy charles sonne lady iane landes house austriche diuisio thinheritauce went ferdina brother wherfore long time germany emperour greater power father died wha sixe yere olde graudefather ferdinado whan sixtene whiche tyme wet spaine remained til elected emperour came germany shalbe declared herafter forsomuch arecome place shal much purpose speak thing creatio themperor charles kinge boheme ye iiij emperor name made law herofin yeare called comenly golden bull wherof one thing yt theperour dead tharchbishop mentz soone knoweth therof shal immediatly signifie residew price elector mane chosing emperour appoint day within iij monthes mete frackfourt either owne parson sende deputy wt ful authoritie elect new emperor king romanes fortune yt saide archbishop neglect yt yet neuertheles rest shall assembe within time prescribed accopanied euery ij c horse aboue wha enter towne armure neither cometh himselfe yet sendeth ambass depute tofore busines ended shall lose right electio yt time officer frakefurth shal shew al fidelitie thelectours duringe time thelectio suffer nomato enter besides prince family yt comen together shal haue messe holy ghost church bartholomew euery sweare yt shal nothing yt matter bargain bribe reward promise afterward come electio depart thece theperor chose thing differred aboue xxx day haue nothing geue bread water part shall chose muche effect chosen wt comen assent alme themperor thus elected shal first cofirme al priueleges whatsoeuer apperteineth honor dignitie libertie fredo moreouer prouided ordeined one shall suffer another passe coutrey place eche shal haue consistory sort shall giue voice office euery shall haue time theperor either dineth abroade doth thig opely furthermore yt durig ye vacatio thepire coutye palatine shal haue gouernemet sueuelade frakeconie rhine duke saxo place vse lawes saxnie prince elector departed eldest sonne shal succed brother germayne electour vnder xviij yeares age next kinsman shall supplie rowme til come age electours mete euery yere consult come wealth frankefurth place election agnon base contrey towne shalbe inuested spake condition prescribed prince ratified emperours ambassadours puttyng caution maner writinges made name whiche shall defend christen comen wealth bishoppe churche rome whereof aduocate shall minister law vprightly seeke maynteine peace shall confyrme establish al lawes thempire chiefely called golden bulle also theyr aduise time shall require encrease appointe cenate counsell within empire chosen germaines onely shall minister comon wealth shall breake diminishe lawes priueledges dignitie prynces state thempire shalbe lawful electoures nede shall requyre assemble consult common welth shall let hereunto take euill parte shall abolishe confederacy conspiracy nobilitie commos prince prohibite law made hereafter make league compacte stranger touching matter thempire without assent vii prince neither alienate lay pledge anye parte thempire deminishe goodes landes empire nation haue plucked away occupy seeke forthwith recouer yet infringe lawes priueleges also selfe house possesse parte thempire vnlawfullye gotten restore beinge required vii prince kepe peace amitie withall christen prince attempte warre affaire empire without consent al ye state chiefly prince electours either within empire wythout bring straunge souldiours germany without assent man moue warre thempire shalbe lawfull vse aide cal none asse bly empire commaunde taske tribute consent electours also within limittes empire publike affaire appointe foreyners germaines nobilitie writinges made latin duche tonge man sommoned appere court bondes thempire forasmuch many thinges done rome contrary couenautes made time past bishoppes therof deuise bishop fraude vsed towardes preuileges liberty thempire impose custome droicte ye assent thelectours neither letter diminish custome thelectors dwell rhine haue action agaynst man shall trye lawe vse force suche aunswere lawe stande ordre lawe goodes empire whiche shall chaunce vacant shall geue away man lotte publicke patrimonye shall wynne foreine countrey throughe aide state germany shal annexe thempire shal recouer publike thinge owne force power shall restore common welth shall ratifie done vacation thempire countie palatine duke saronie take counsel vnite thempire house posteritie propre inheritaunce leaue seuen prince fre election according vnto lawe charles fourth prescript canon lawe thinge otherwise frustrate none effect shortly may repaire germany inuested time ambassadours approued thinges othe name deliuered vnto eche elector writinges therof sealed whiche spoken cannon lawe conteined epistle decretall innocentius thyrde testifieth seuen prince electours haue fre authoritye create themperor thempire goeth succession election innocetius liued yere lord miic nowe let v retourne luther time erasmus erasmus iudgement luther roterdam wrote letter andwarp frederick duke saxonie wherein amonges thinges maketh mention luther saying bokes ioyfullye receiued red good well learned men moreouer life man reprehended farre suspicion auarice ambition deuines louain hearinge greatly oppressed thaucthoritie cardinall caietan nowe triumphe theyr sermon bankettes raile vpon callynge heretike antichrist declaringe mo wordes much contrary theyr profession slaunder man comiicte heresye wryteth also maner woordes archebishop mentz cardinall campegius tauntyng sophisticall diuines monkes whiche abide studye tonges eloquens good learnynge writeth also luther frendly louain sayth howe hath receyued receiued epistle whiche declareth excellencie witte also christian hert shewinge tragedie bokes haue styrred vp hatred suspicion ronneth diuines preuaile nothinge excusynge matter howe many englande great estimation whiche thinke rightwell workes himselfe hath tasted comentaries vpo psalmes trusteth shall profit many like well one thing would admonishe man shall preuaile certeine ciuile modestie vehement muste rather thunder abuse bishop rome authoritie bishoppes themselues certeine good counsel whiche gaue exhorting procede hath begonne luther hauing thus manye aduersaries disputation appoynted lypsia towne misnia belonging george duke saxonie disputatis lypsia uncle duke friderike thither came luther melanthon read greeke lecture wittenberge thither came also iohn eccius diuine bothe stoute bolde fourth day iulye began disputation luther touching supremacie bishop rome affirming said church rome fyrst chiefest others euen time ciluester erre hathe seate faith peter euer taken successour christes uicar earthe luther setforth one contrary suche dyd attribute supremacie churche rome ground themselues onely vpo bishoppes decree whiche made foure hundreth yeres syns decree cotrary history written thousande yeres past contrary holy scripture counsell nice famous others eccius mainteyneth supremacie bishoppe rome called luther dissented bohemer iohn husse time past opinion luther aunswereth churche christe spreade abroade farre nere twentie yeres peter came rome establishe churche therfore fyrst chiefest law god saieth disputed purgatory indulgeces penaunce remission synne authoritie priestes ended disputation fourteneth day iuly whiche appointed luther andrewe carolostadius eccius luther comming onely company carolostadius drawen forth eccius got saufe coduict duke george muste nedes dispute eccius lustie courage reason matter selfe wherein thoughte selfe assured victorye whiche disputation luther set forth afterwardes wordes wrytinges aduersaries throughe wittye obseruation collected diuerse article doctrine altogether termeth hereticall thintent mighte playnely declare howe whilest speake write thinges fauor bishop rome desyre maynteine theyr cause straiynge farre broade confounde thinges beynge nerer looked conteyne ofte tymes great errours wickednes tyme ulrichus zwinglius taught zuricke shortly byshop rome sent thither pardoner one sampson graye frere millan gather vp money zwinglius stoutly resisteth declarynge disceyuour people p seconde booke sleidans commentary argument seconde booke motion charles miltice luther wryteth pope dedicateth vnto boke christian libertie themperour hauynge passed throughe englande came lowe countreyes luther writeth boke fouretene image consolation confession uowes prouyng lordes supper ought permitted vnder kyndes obiected counsell laterane vnder iuly ii wherevpon way spoken iuly actes sayd counsell meane diuines louayne condemne luther bokes defence article picus erle mirandula question ockam controuersie rewcline diuines recited seyng selfe assayled many enemy writeth themperour shortely tharchbishoppes mentz marseburge duke fridericke beyng aduertised cuill rome reason luther maketh purgation letter luther lyke case yet notwithstanding pope extreme bulle doeth excommunicate luther contrary decree mantua waye recited maketh appellation hauinge set forthe print boke captuitie babilon emperour tune goeth crowned acon solemnity maner whereof recited pope beginneth agayne sollicite duke fridericke agaynst luther nothing preuailyng causeth luther workes burnt likewise luther burneth pope decretals sheweth cause afterwarde aunswereth ambrose catarine written agaynst charles meltice sent leo tenthe vnto duke fredericke golden rose perceiued howe luther doctryne farre spreade abroade highly estemed many shoulde hearde almost vnpossible quench sought meanes possible heale wounde plaster reconciliation wherfore longe conferens luther frendes last meanes foude luther write letter bishop reportyng hym muche honour request frendes aboute luters letter pope syxte day aprill tenure letter albeit appealed counsel yet neuerthelesse ceased make prayer vnto god healthe much sore blamed haue hurt offended name dignitie hartely sorye charged cause writinge present signifiynge dede hathe bene earnest rebukyng vice errours hath euermore written right honorablie sene bokes doth frankely taunte false doctrine doeth example christe prophetes apostle reprehension holsome admonishementes yet take place long naughtie flatterer tickle men eares regardeth god glory court rome vnturable seeketh onely truth might appere may obtaine willinge ynough giue place matter leaue professyng god veritie meanes commeth court rome call sayeth corrupt wicked euer sodome babilon ca mischiefe wrought antichrist selfe wherefore sory lambe amonges manye wolues rome worthy haue good man gouerne muche better content meane benefice liue owne landes reuenewes farre suche pestiferous slatterers whiche serue owne lust ambition depraue name dignitie addeth barnarde bewailed state eugenius rome better present asmuche filthy sinke al place uniuersall worlde rakehell heaped mischief ought much lamented cause inueighed soore agaynst whiche appertayneth nothing reproche rather saluation would wishe learned men woulde set touch nayle ouercome monstre touching thing selfe whan set forth certeine litle bokes sawe attempt vayne willyng haue left enterprise imployed frudye profite bretherne house rose vp eccius disturbed quiet cogitation desyred leasure wherin nothing el aptely disclose shame wickednes rome toucheth fewe wordes howe vsed cardinal caietane saieth might haue appeased matter pleased vnto faulte imputed thinge misse afterwarde came charles meltice quieted kinge bene importune disputation eccius whiche prouoked reason matter agaynst dede enemie fyrst men kindled fyre nowe asmuch requested
