shame also self time cheregate bishop rome ambassador came norinberg vpon new yeres day sent fro then senate strasbourgh bishoppes letter offering seruice case would writ answere whilest many bare grudge towardes zuinglius diuerse well within citie without preched doctrine wicked swaruing faith especially black freres againe affirmed agreable scripture able proue senate zuricke called couocation priestes disputatio zuricke within jurisdiction xxix january controuersie religio time men shalbe heard much shalbe requisite require also louingly theyr letter bishop constance yt either would come selfe sende deputie thefore came many dai appointed amoges others iohn faber bishoppes deputie borowmaster speaketh wordes forasmuche great dissention rysen religion therfore assemblie called intet hath ought say yt doctrine zuinglius may speake frely zuinglius comprised doctrine certein common place theme nubre lxvij published question zuinglius place intent men might come disputation fournished prepared time borowmaster done speakyng propouded againe desyring ioyne hym disputation whan faber shewed cause hys commyng goeth perswade place mere decide matter religion apperteineth generall counsell whiche trusted shortely zuinglius required dispute thinge saye dissemble matter said would confute doctrine writyng many wordes betwixt neither would come forth dispute senate breakynge vp assemblie commaundeth throughe dominion tradition men layde syde ghospell taught syncerely bokes olde new testament fourth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale empire charles fyfte argument fourth booke pope adriane ambassadoure vttereth manye thinges confesseth wickednes rome prince germany answere propounde conditiond counsell alteration denmarke christierne kyng sleeth speaketh impostes ouer germany fyrst fruictes tenthes dere mantel archbishop burning two austen freres decree norinberge expounded luther certeine bokes written complaint made kyng englad adriane dieth clement succedeth trouble swysserlande z uinglius doctrine strasbourgh mariage priestes assemblie norinberge cardinall campegius came ambassadour clemente prayeth duke friderike hauinge spoken counsell prince make aunswere replie trouble arrise swiserlande againste z uricke rendre reason theyr doctrine ambassadours sent ca ton byshop constance defendeth image yet wythstandyng wrytyng image beaten downe al dominion z uricke foresaid assemblie orinberge themperor sent ambassade strasburgh byshop vtter theyr controuersie campegius sayde assemblie kynge ferdinando others make league agaynst gospell warre bowres besides former letter bishop adrian request adrian dispatch lu prescribed ambassadour furthermore saye expressed writing fyrst accompt prince grief luther shoulde styrre vp trouble sedition thing concerned losse soules destruction flocke committed hym christ kepe secondly hath chasised cuntreye hymselfe borne nation euer furthest suspecion heresye wherfore desyreth greatly would helpe remedye matter soone might lest longer delaye thinge happen vnto germany dyd lande boheme affyrmyng wyll neyther spare cost labour herin beseching euerye man power lyke beynge many weightye cause whie oughte fyrste glory god holy name throughe heresye chiefly obscured rite ceremony churche defaced maner quite abolished loue oure neighboure vnto charitie bindeth v shewe right waye germany wont haue chiefe prayse religion reason reuolting theyr fame estimation groweth contempt ignomie might easely haue dispatched luther also quenched heresy would degenerating herin auncestours left notable example theyr vertu costance open wronge doeth also theyr elder folowed religion catholick churche rome nowe iudgement condemneth religion damned let wey consyder selues fellowes purpose intende uerely vnder pretence libertie gospel subuerte take away al lawes magistrate albeityt luther semed begynning impugne onely ecclesiastical power tyrranical wicked yet intent hath perswaded christian lawes bounden obeye magistrate maye open waye vnto men worke mischief liste therfore greate daunger hangeth ouer also hitherto craftely traiterouslye hyde theyr purpose flatter magistrate intent may frely vtter theyr malice vpon clergie oppressed wyll doubtles attept may see already experience grudge hatred tumultes offence heresie hath alreadi brought common wealth whiche euyles vnlesse suppressed time feared lest god hathe gyuen power sworde wyll plage theyr great negligence bothe owne priuate also common destruction germany luth compared bahomet luther differeth muche secte mahomet permitteth men mary many wiues forsake whiche policie mischieuous man bewitched allured greatest part worlde whiche thing thoughe luther permitteth yet doth aduise mary haue vowed chastitie gyuing reignes lybertie man lust concupiscens maye haue mo confyderacie vtter destruction common wealthe namely germany sayd therfore theyr partes put execution decree leo cesar intent may auenge god glorye auoyde sklaunder countrey eschewe present daunger yt hangeth ouer owne heades furthermore yt say howe luther condemned matter heard reason thing shold debated executed thinke well christ hath taught v rule faith religion whose authoritie must folowe reason article faith inquire cause precept dede hearde examined whether spake thinge hys sermon whether setforth boke touching faith sacramentes may permit reason defend thinges whiche hathe written thereof muste folowe vse custome church wise swarue againe sith hys doctrine suche hath bene heretofore condemned generall counsel none accompt made therof moreouer ende cotention might lawfull euery priuate man call question thinges wittie great learned men haue muche deliberation established wheresoeuer asseblie felowship certein lawes bounden obserue howe muche oughte done time anye thynge openlye establisshed churche seyng men onely contempne lawes decree counsel auncient father also burne ought suerly punished breaker common peace quietnes neuertheles confesseth howe god reuenger wronge doeth thus plage churche synnes minister therof scripture saieth iniquitie people procedeth iniquitie procedeth fro priestes priestes elder certenlye saieth haue synned rome many yeres full greuously sundry wayes euen highe bishoppe lowest ecclestasticall parson one excused cause callynge mekely god synne rome spred ouer al worlde pardon wyll endeuour redresse thing see court rome perchaunce hath bene occasion mischief fyrst sharpely refourmed hathe bene example vice may begynning amendement patron vertu saieth must lytell litell al sodayne mutation daungerous common prouerbe bloweth nose ouermuche shall wringe bloude writing dyd luther translate vulgare toungue set note lut expoundeth pope saiynge margente sayeth lytell lytell luther affyrmeth space many men liues frankely bewrayed vicious lyuyng court rome gote great loue cardinal reported neuertheles say euer bishop rome policie wil deferre cousel delay hearynge matter promise largely whilest men trust meane let cousels vpon promyse maye fynde meanes fauoure prince force armes mainteine hys power dignitie like fall daunger fyre generall counsel whilest byshoppes ambassador declared thus prince complained league made time past byshoppes rome broken diuerse wayes whereof byshoppe beyng certifyed letter ambassadour answereth suche thynges predecessours dyd lieth helpe misliked handelyng matter rome priuate man purposed lesse refourme thoughe man spoken therin suffer man susteine wronge muche lesse common countrey sake coueteth chiefly gratifie desyre action commenced might retourned germany soone iudges aduocates whiche fled oute rome plage shall retourne inquire case therin shall seme resonable commaunded moreouer ambassadour require aunswere prince theyr opinion best way destroy pestiferous secte maye vnderstande time shall part therin thinges beyng declared counsel prince answer price state make aunswere fyrste recityng briefly demaundes say ryght glad hath pleased god place gouernement church perilous time nede pastour beareth suche zeale common wealthe taketh suche paynes set kynges quietnes emploieth hys treasure repressing turkes violence whiche thynges reioyse heare ciuill warres thempire decaied turkes power increased man prepareth armye resist ambassadours kyng prince hungary without great lamentation haue recited cruell thinges haue suffered daunger stande dayely wherfore desyre father pastour others perseuer holy purpose trauaile yt eyther suer peace el long treuce may taken yt meane time may make preparation withstande turkes violence recouer countreis empire loste whereunto promise aide bothe men money concernyng luther displeasure growen germany meanes doctrine right hartely sory therefore becommeth lesse desyre also remedy euyll knowyng theyr duetie obey themperour nother wil luth punished degenerat progenitours herein complaineth already punished according emperours decree vpon lyght consyderation omitted degree complayne heinously courte rome maner al men wel instructed preachinges bokes luther case decree put execution would doubtles styre vp great sedition many would coustre done intent trueth oppressed lyght ghospell extinguisshed mayntenaunce suche open crymes borne withall perswasion certeinly would styrre vp rebellion people magistrate tan denied himselfe graunteth also lyue dissolutely vitiously rome great decay religion wherefore dyssembleth nothing clooketh disorder court rome promyseth reformation deseruith muche praise especially performe dede thing hathe promised wordes writynge whiche earnestly require would otherwise certein longe quietnes loked germany muche impouerished warres charge tribute extraordinarie hardely hable susteyne necessary charge common wealth gyue aide hungarian others turke nowe sorte germanes certein yeres past permitte bishop others clergie certein time tributary bishop rome suppose ignoraunt coditioned tyme al money tyme serued employed vpon warre turke nowe bothe tyme expired predecessor bishoppes rome haue put money vse ought haue done whiche cause nowe subsidie gathered countreis empyre turkishe warre men grudge mutine think great summes money haue bene leuied many yeres kepte purpose serue tourne charged desyre therfore hence forth demaunde anye suche tribute permitte broughte common treasure house empire thus shall many men quieted germany nede shall require shall want money ayde foreine nation agaynst force violence turkes areth counsell alteration religion consydering matter consisteth onely luther doctrine also many abuse errours crepte churche mayntened longe custome men corrupte life iudgemente self cofesseth ca see better way redres al thing free generall counsell whiche emperour beyng maner free cou sell chiefe magistrate christendome may sommon citie germany mentz straseboroughe metz collen whiche thynke also good comon wealth begyn shortly mighte furthest within ayere yet vnder condition many shal present estate degree euer shall take othe speake frely hyde euer shall seme make glory god profit comen wealet el shalbe suspected harme good may rather done accordynglye see luther meane time shall write mo bookes doubtinge fridericke noble duke saxonie wyll assiste herein preacher shall teache gospell syncerely reuerently interpretation approued churche printer shall print nothinge shall fyrste perused aucthorised certeine learned men appointed byshoppes matter controuersie reserued counselles amonges thinges ambassador spake priestes maried wiues forsomuch punishment appointed ciuill lawe thinke misse suche haue offended shoulde punished canon lawe finally beseche take good part theyr opinion touching euery thyng doeth procede syncere minde tendereth common weale fauoureth also dignitie tyme chaunsed great alteration denmarke thus befel case christierne fyrst name king demarke alteratiu denmark norweye suecia two sonnes iohn fridericke iohn succede father warre suecians whiche rebelled notwithstandynge composition matter appeased iohn sonne named christierne whan syxe yeres age proclamed kynge father yet lyuing syxe twentie yeres whe father dead crowned yeare oure lorde mdxiiij durynge whose reigne suecians rebelled againe set vp steno stura haue gouernement christierne made power agaynste many battels sondry siege subdueth commaudyng steno slayne battell buried shoulde taken vp brent yeare mdxx suecians beynge thus vanquished gustauus erixonius noble man hauing aide thought lubeckes stirred vp new rebellion good fortune preteded fyrst haue done steno child assuraunce maried daughter king lost prouince euill beloued home gouerned common welth eruelly offended men also vncle fridericke lubecke moued warre fearynge lest broile length would tourne vtter destruction fled king denmarke flecth away child wife isabell syster charles themperour whan reigned ix yeares fyrste aryued selande themperours prouince immediatly state realme callynge counsell create vncle fridericke duke holse aged man kynge beyng aided herin lubecke sending abroad theyr letter emperor byshoppe rome prince empire rendre reason dyd accuse greuous crime say howe banisshed hys iuste deseruinges thinge also doeth fridericke citie lubecke aucthoritie power al party christierne fyndynge good wryter cornelles scepper flemmyng well learned aunswereth crymes desyreth cornelles scepper state empire assembled norinberge aide succour one sonne emperour toke vnto two doughters dorothie christine yere frendes attepted warre haue restored vaine emperour beyng intangled frenche warres ambassodor rome complained preacher norinberge teach euill doctrine required might layde faste feete prince supposed misse infourmed preacher saye greate estimation people ought done men would take done set purpose oppresse trueth whiche thinge myght cause rebellion notwithstandyng wyll appoint certein men shall make inquisition whole matter therin shall reasonable tyme prince answered bishoppe rome demaundes gather certeine article suche thynges would haue done bishop germany infringed liberty made germany bare money keptmen great bondage said plainely would longer suffer case reformed spede wold seke redresse selues concernyng tribute clergie thus amonges meanes gather vp money one byshoppes spirituall parson shoulde paye byshoppe rome rate benefice certeine summe beginnyng first fruictes tenthes money commonly called fyrste fruites tentes ascribe deuice iohn xxij others vnto boniface ix pretese fayre goodly ther might treasure ready time turkes saracenes much time aucthoritie bishoppes rome growen great estemed holy easely graunted englishman refused pay namely theyr smal benefice continued till counsel basil put downe brought vp againe eugenius fourth made counsell frustrate hath continued euer syns yet much repining yere lorde thousande fine hundred time emperor maximilian held counsell au rge turkishe warre decreed ambassador sent alexander sixt aide common wealth geue yerely reuenewes vnto vse graunted purpose tharchebishops metropolitanes receane certein signe honor dignitie made flaxe wolle call palle must paye great piece money byshoppe romishe palle rome short space maye admit none byshoppe till haue receiued palle whiche weareth alwayes masse deliuered must take othe owne faith obeidience sixte day marche prince norinberge set forthe writinge thinges mentioned charging men obserue vnder great penaltie whiche decree published emperours name establisshed senate iudgement retorned spaine fridericke countie palatine deputie assemblie two freres brent brusels tyme taken bruxels two monckes austen order iohn henry hogostrate frere dominicke examination asked beleued made answere howe beleued bokes olde new testament crede apostle conteined article faith againe whether beleued decree counsel au cient father agreable scripture whether thinke deadly synne man breake decree father bishoppe rome ascribed god commaundementes condemne saue whe perseuered herin condemned dye gaue thankes god yt suffer glorie name brought forth suffer ceremony disgratyng men marueyled beholde theyr constancie burnt fyrst day iuly wer executed disgraded thing done vnto priestes onely beynge condemned heresye ecclesiasticall iudge hath put vpon albe uestement deliuered handes chalice wine water also gilt patent singing cake knelyng vpon knee bishoppes deputie taketh thynges named commaundynge hym shall saye masse quick dead piece glasse skrapeth finger ioyninge neuer herafter halowe thing taketh rest thinges certein curse ioyned therunto whan exempted thus numbre priestes also put ye rest ordres came vnto priesthod torned naked decked againe layman apparell deliuered magistrate bishoppes chaunceloure entreateth yt wold determine harme life body vse ceremony lest beynge holy men shoulde seme aucthors death bloudshed whan decree empire made norinb many taken diuersely also cotemned luth writinge letter luth interpreteth prince prince doth aduertise yt hath read reuerently great pleasure first comaunde gospell taught interpretatios approued church dede vnderstad ye accustomed maner thomas aquine duse suche others bishop rome haue allowed taketh mont aucient writer hilary cypria auste others yet much credit giue vnto nothing like scripture bible preferred others thus doubteth met doth take cause yt certen chiefest nobilitie wold subscribe suffer proclamed theyr coutreis secondly bishop appoint mete present sermos geue gentle admonition thing misse saith decre good bishop though wold obserue yt wat learned men haue suche haue learned nothinge elles sophistrie prohibite yt bookes printed learned appointed therunto haue first perused wil yt cocerue bokes scripture wise oughte inhibited finally haue decreed yt priestes mary wiues forsake order shalbe punished according canon law yt ouer hard thig cofesse gospel preached sincerely tha must cano law much qualified afterwarde bewalleth miserie frowardnes time yt clere light gospel yt extreme law prohibiteth mariage abolished hath geuen thoccasion many great euils yet much praised content wt punishmet prescribed canon law wold kill priestes yt marie leaue ordre haue prison kind punnishement tormented greatly abhorred wherfore besecheth prince muche theyr aduersaries obeie decre mighte ought obserue pore priestes might pardoned yt thinge ech power performe euery man hath gift chastitie vowes made foolishe set forth boke ordeining minister senate lut wrot senate prage prage ioyneth writynge wherein declareth howe church hath power authoritie iudge euery doctrine appoint minister fyrste defyneth churche euer ghospell syncerely taught byshoppes calleth image heades without braynes wherof one yt doth duetie place namely germany longe wrote eschewynge men doctrine luther wrot eschewing doctrine men wherin saieth holdeth dede contene lawes tradition men yet nothynge belongeth dwetie trewe christian prescribeth masse communion vsed churche wittenberge saieth howe hath hitherto wrought slouthfullye reason men infirmitie haue care one lye howe myghte plucke wicked opinion men myndes nowe many confyrmed time suffer vngodlines churche longer cloking simulation set parte sincere workyng maye ensewe vpon pure doctrine addeth wrytyng holy ceremony obserued churche againe abhomination priuate masse call canon wherin exhorteth ye people flee fro accustomed sacrifice masse woulde deuyll hym selfe demonstration wherof reciteth order canon masse declaryng howe full blasphemy againste god amonges learned men germany fauoured luther ulriche hutten noble man borne death workes hutten one died yere farre zurick certein workes remaining declare excellent witte iij boke shewed luther made answere henry king englande whiche kynge read writeth letter king englande writeth prince saxonie prince saxonie fridericke john brother vncle george greuously coplaining luther sheweth daunger hangeth ouer germany reason doctrine thinge contemned neglected great crueltie turkes nowe spred farre broad beginning naughtie man two boheme hard may warning see thing reformed time admonisheth also suffer luther translate newe testament uulgare tong wel knowe practisioner doubt suche thinges well written euill translation wil corrupt depraue unto letter answer duke george duke george answereth frendly blaming also luther excedingly whose bokes saith hath banished al dominios hurtfull enemy moreouer howe righte sory hath written extremely hath giuen co maundement throughe countrey man reade sell howe hath punished printer brought fyrste copie thyther assemblie norinberge besydes matter religion prince entreated peace lawes punnisshement obeyde lawes empire continuall aide againste turke two last agreed vpon al city thempire certein thinges enacted sowe preiudiciall sent theyr ambassadours sp ine emperour ariuynge ualolet sixt day august thyrde day declared theyr message unto emperor aunswered gently frankely notwithstandynge sayde byshoppe rome complained letter strauseborough norinberge auspurge fauorers luther doctrine trusted trewe yet woulde hyde thentent might obserue byshoppes decree thinketh ambassador pourge selues faiyng accomplishe pleasure meane time dieth byshoppe adrian ides septembre adrian pope dyeth clement succedeth place chosen clement vii house medices zuricke onely folowed zuinglius doctrine rest suices hated wherfore comon assemblie fal e purpose berne accused zuinglius preached openly howe suche made league nation dyd sell zuinglius broughtin hatred bloud eate men fleshe zuinglius heringe therof wrote spake said generall howe abhorred wicked thing eate fleshe beyng forbidden bishoppe eatyng fleshe rome lawe thinke none offence sell men fleshe gold destroy weapon herin named nation seyng vice doeth nowe muche abound dewtie rebuke doeth nothing concerne good innocent parson zuinglius amonges thing taught image shuld church masse put wicked thing cause senate called new assemblie new disputatio zu citie whither came great resorte moneth october disoutation cotinued thre day time sundry place namely strausburgh priestes maried wiues thinge made priestes maried wiues muche contention accused doyng answered done nothinge agaynste god lawe permittinge men marie indifferently senate strausburghe muche bishoppe case called xx day ianuary appeare hym towne sabernes heare sentence shoulde gyuen agaynst contractyng matrimonye wherein saieth haue broken lawes churche holy father byshoppes rome emperoure also empire haue done great iniurie order offe ded diuine maiestie priestes receiued citation make suite senate haue theyr cause hearde refuse suffer death founde haue done thing againste comaundement god senate intreateth bishoppe much refuse come theyr aunswere punish like brede much trouble co syderinge reside kepe harlot openly nothynge saied would lest defferre thende imperial counsell norinberge doubtles suche like case decided later cousel holden yere norinberge clement bishop rome sent legate cardinal campegius pope clemet sendeth campegius duke fri letter moreouer friderike duke saxonie written friendly ianuary signifiynge howe reioysed heare assemblye shoulde presente selfe trustynge thynge shoulde enacted mighte helpe common cause hathe sent thither cardinall campegius man excellent vertue enfourme prince carefulnesse towardes common weale deuise priuately meanes peace quietnesse whereunto exhorteth gyue mynde thyng concerneth prosperitie dignitie al magistrats beareth great good vnto germany hauynge good hope wyll fall auncient vertue helpe eschewe publike daungers wherfore requireth shewe good fauoure hys legate whome shall heare thinges large sixe twentie day ianuary heluetias called conuocation decree suyses lucerne decree made man shoulde mocke contemne god worde whiche bene taught thousande foure hundred yeares masse wherein bodye christ consecrated honor comfort quicke dead suche lawfull age receyue lordes supper cofesse selues priestwise lent season al men absteine fleshe day forbidden lent also egges chese nothing luther newe doctrine taught priuely openly suche cary reliques holy gost virgin reliques holy gost mary anthony laughed yt obserue olde customes offende herein presented magistrate punished whe capegius comen norinberge cardinall writeth duke saronis duke friderike departed thence wherefore wrote vnto hym laste daye february sendinge also bishoppes letter lamenteth vnhappye chaunce speake wyth presently hauyng many thynges talke bishop rome whiche well done letter messenger suche sorte maye abyde delaye seynge better muche gretyng made bishop name saieth albeit reporte great fauorer newe spronge vp heresyes yet bishoppe hitherto perswaded manyfold excellent vertues perceiue especially hath bene euer great fauourer religion apostolicall churche whereupon truste iudgementes others nother leaue good opinion hath shall see cause know self germany hath bene wonderfully altered fewe yeres co cernyng religion vnderstandeth howe muche commo people differ nobilitie prince ruler lawes amonges principal aswel also deserte aucesters haue euermore done great honor church rome wherfore bishop requireth daugerous dayes woulde example elder declare vertue stoutenes onely mislyking lybertie people also extremely punishing vnlesse theyr licentious boldnes malapertenes restrained bring lyke miserie confusion germany tyme boheme hongary yet quieted stubberuely contemne sacred lawes ecclesiasticall magistrate also vndoubtedly worke violence ciuil magistrate loue manye nowe glad see pastours church courte rome thus troubled dispised whiche perceaue ful litel daunger selues stande byshoppe whiche master shyppe sitteth watching healme doeth foresee storme approching hath sent hym warne prince especially beware tempest like distroy onely citie rome also germany selfe cause also hath sent letter willed treate diligently matter intente tranquilitie quietnes germany might recouered purposely sent lifte vp fallen receiue vnto grace penitet whereunto albeit fit yet trustynge vpon gentlenes wil attempt al diligence wherfore seing hath taken wery painefull iorney praieth maye want helpe fauor herein woulde write agayne shortly thinketh best done againe worlde counsell prince fyrste declareth howe man willyng rome take voiage germany campegius oratio prince norinberge last appointed one may thanke germanes promotion hauing two thinges treate religion turkishe warre fyrst marueleth muche manye greate worthy prince beare alteration suffer religion rite ceremony wherin borne brought vp theyr father also progenitours dead thus defared set naught thing spedely reformed wil styre vp doubtles great commotion rebellion people agaynste theyr magistrate hyghe bishoppe fearing consyderyng hath sent hym deuise way howe remedie matter whose diligens herein refused good father pastour wissheth well child shepe cause hereafter laye blame touchynge turkes denieth money gathered purpose brought rome albeit employed wayes yet may comon welth therfore calamitie time neglected hurt cruell enemie hathe done vnknowen negligens cowardise owne men hathe taken rhodes chiefest foretresse hongary rhodes endured harde siege many monethes laste wantynge thynges necessarye whan saw aide would come yelded like chauce hongary subdew wholly bringe vnder subiection feared lest wyll become enemy muche worse turkes vnlesse contention procedynge new doctrine fyrst taken away part common wealth opinion well holpen hereunto prince answere wheras beareth good prince aunswere vnto germany glad came thither amonges wyll chose certeine conferre supposing hath order prescribed bishoppe cardinal haue willed folow knowyng matter wel laste yere tyme another ambassador wrote vnto theyr mindes howe daunger alteration foreseen remedied also required done parte wherof haue brought aunswer desyre vtter intent may better procede cause touching turkishe matter confesse hath sayd notwithstandyng great warre doth concerne empire together kynges prince christendome like maner vnlesse peace amonges selfes giue aide ther nothing done continew asmuch turke nowe maketh great preparation vnto warres sea lande would also knowe opinion herin legate said againe whether way deuised appease strife aboute religion whether deliuered bishoppe cardinalles certeinly tell bishoppes good wyll muche hathe gyuen full aucthoritie suche matter whiche knowe men maner custome countrey must fynd way may lead ende wished counsell wormes emperor theyr common assent decre wormes repeted made decree haue bene executed thorowout germany obeied wherefore great diuersitie empire knoweth thinketh good thynge determined consulte howe maye executed comen thither styrre vp fyre dissention reporte desyre bishoppes like case make peace concorde thentent suche haue erred straied may reduced waie decree counsel themperors prince proclamation might obserued concernynge requestes whether made sent rome knoweth three copy brought thither priuate men whetof one byshoppe colledge cardinalles coulde perswaded made prince thought rather priuate men deuised hatred malice bare citie rome wherin diuerse thinges deny byshoppes authoritie smell heresye suche meddle withall others bishop grounded vpon equitie reason refuse treate howe semeth vnto demaundes haue bene propounded wt modestie ought say highe bishop dyd lately spaniardes sendyng ambassade rome declared ge tely theyr request wheras printed publisshed abrode thinketh ouer muche yet doubte bishoppe rome wyll germany moreouer power turke hath preparatio maketh bishop hath good intelligence hath alredy great treasure pope wel monied readines haue muche concorde christen prince requisite hath done emperor frenche kynge king england hauyng peace together might set vpon turke handes employ therupon treasure doeth bishoppe good sheperde foresee care peace quietnes case shepe wyll folowe voyce sheperde take paciently commit whole matter vnto god amonges suyces encreased dayly cotention religion suises offended zuricke rest townes sendynge theyr ambassador zurycke shewed theyr grief tymes past thinges godly quiet contention doctrine nowe meanes luther fyrst began zuinglins leo iude preached amonges interpretinge godes worde theyr owne iuste appetite godly peace quietues churche common weale nowe tourned trouble dissention besydes incommodities ensew vpon fastyng dayes eate bothe egges flesshe religious folkes aswell men woman forsaking theyr profession order marrie god seruice laide downe singe churche neglect confession penaunce masse railed lady sainctes dishonoured theyr image pulled downe broken sacramentes contepte muche nowe day sacred holy host yeare hoste representeth christes body skarsely safe priestes haides thinges lameted auenged also losse life good wherfore desyre leaue newe doctrine perseuer olde religion father beare gere longer case thinge wherin fynde selues offended bishop rome cardinal byshoppes marchaundise clergie suche others whan entre benefice choppe chaunge gather vp money countrey vsurping taking ouer muche vpon suche like thing molest greue refuse helpe reforme mislyke muche selues senate zuricke aunswered xxi daye marche answer zuricke minister church preached fyue yeares whose doctrine begynnynge semed vnto newe heard like vnderstode ende therof shewe iesus christ aucthor saluation dyed ye sinnes world loue deliuered v wretch fro death euerlasting onely aduocate mankinde god father could wyth feruent desyre embrace ioyful newes great agrement concorde time past betwixt apostle theyr time embraced christes doctrine trust shall nowe also amonges giue mind hereunto luther teache well done neyther ought god word called doctrine although honor christ yet iniurie therfore virgin marye saint al earth loked eternall saluatio onely name christ nowe light giuen maner men within citie reade ye bible diligently minister wrast wrye continuallye men handes wherefore secte obiected vnto name accordeth mainteine lucre dignitie wraste god worde whither list said error man shewe haue often time required herin bishoppe constaunce basill courtes certeine uniuersities also vnto day ther nothing done therfore minister gyue none occasion diffention commo wealth author scismes bishoppes suche owne profit teache contrary godes worde deceiue people offende god greuously feare lose theyr commodity wer loth forsake theyr pride auarice touchyng eatyng egges fleshe albeit free forbidden christ yet haue made lawe auoide offence rashenes god aucthour matrimonie lawfull men matrimony hath ordeined almen paule also commau deth minister church husband one wife sin bishoppes permit priestes money kepe concubine harlot filthy example neither wyll without woman thinke good resist god ordeyned holy wedlocke sufferyng haue gifte chastitie marrie rather singlenes lyue fylthy lyfe colledges place fyrst founded pore part possesse haue enough besides often time sene one hath much wold find many wherfore think reasonable suche good againe conuerted vse poore wherin notwithstandyng vse moderation suche possession already permitted enioye rente theyr liues leste man shoulde haue cause complaine iewels churche apperteine trewe nedeth gold churche worshipping god acceptable vnto god time pore nedye releued order priesthode dispised muche set case dewtie teach syncerely rest rabble yt doeth good harme litell litel diminished without offence theyr possession put godly vse doubte woulde vnto god acceptable whether god accept singing seruice latin muche doubted many vnderstande say yet hired order monkes inuention man ordinaunce god howe muche auricular confession valewe numbreth sinnes wil leaue vndiscussed wherby trewe penitentes true cofessio haue accesse vnto christe theyr mediator iudge onely profitable also necessary conscience troubled pressed burthen sinne trewly repent doeth amende life sacrament instituted god contemned great reuerence notwithstandyng must vsed accordyng vnto god worde lordes supper applied oblation sacrifice clergie thus complaineth fynde error amonges prone hindred empeched make amendes reason commaunded theyr dewtie teache treuth abstaine sklau dering others desyre deliuered pillage vsurped howe yoke papistes shaken aucthoritie bishoppe rome clientes exceadyng glad heare whiche thinge done meanes better godes worde may throughly receiued longe theyr lawes decree shall take place let v looke deliuerauce onely preaching god word shaketh theyr power dignitie force gospell veritie suche distrusting theyr owne strength seeke forthe aide kynges wherefore case vse helpe scripture requisite done lyke wise thinges god offended may abolished reformation whereof wyll glad bestowe onely theyr trauaile counsel good also would haue bene done longe syns wherefore desyre accept good part weighe diligently conet nothing peace quiotnesse nothing contrary theyr league case concerneth theyr euerlastyng saluation otherwise vnlesse theyr errour detected desyre therfore thinke theyr doctrine scripture maye shewed ende maye longe tary answere fro byshoppes also universitie basill meane bishoppe constaunce calling conuotion bishop costance maketh booke defence image made boke answere zuricke ende wherof declare scripture speaketh againste image vnderstand onely idoles amonges iewes gentile image receyued churche kept styll treateth masse proueth many testimony bishoppes rome theyr cousels oblation sacrifice boke sendeth zuricke fyrst daye iune exhortynge senate many weightie wordes neither take downe theyr image abrogate masse suffer people taught otherwise senate make answere eighteneth day auguste howe glad hathe setforth booke shall appere whether partie defendeth iuster quarell declared mindes theyr learned menne teaching contrary scripture wrote aunswer senate commaunded throughout theyr incisdiction image betaken downe brent image bret zuricke yet without trouble moneth iune within fewe monethes canon zuricke make compact senate order taken landes good colledge imploied emperor sent counsel norinberge iohn hawnart complainyng decree made worines common assent counsell broken great losse germany commaunded hence forth diligentlye obserued prince answer wyll herein finally xviij aprill decreed assent decre norinberge emperour bishop rome shortly might shoulde free counsel germanye place conueniente estate empire assemble spire xi nouember consult shall folowe vntill begynninge counsell prince shall assigne certeine good well learned men euery prouince gather luther bookes others question disputable exhibite prince next assemblie maye procede spedely shall come counsell meane diligens magistrate gospel may purely taught soberly according interpretatios approued churche moreouer herafter therebe set forthe mo famous libelles picture finally suche thinges prince haue charge court rome clergie treated discussed next assemblie spire counsel campegius dyd vndertake promysed prince declare byshop diligently prince assemblie lewes countie palatine wylliam lewes duke bauare friderike palatine casimire markes brandenburge byshoppes treuers bamberge wirciburge trent brixine albert brandenburge master pruselande tolde howe senate strasebrough intreated bishoppe therof maried priestes whome cited appeare suite betwixt bishop senate strauso sabernes came theyr day appointed wherfore bishop writeth legate campegius complaynyng senate saith letted execute office punisshe haue maried contrarie byshoppe rome lawes thomas murner graie frere messager complained greuously senate cardinall ambassadours thomas murner towne beynge present norinberge came made purgatio neither would let bishoppe signified vnto letter yt looke actio maried priestes agreable god law might come execute would assiste called liberty contrary ordre take betwixt whereas claimed theyr liberty condemned theyr cause neyther hearde knowen sayde moreouer part clergie strausb liued viciously kepig stroptes home lewd example yet bishop doth punish one wherfore senate permit handle extremely obseruing bishop rome law let comon whoremonges breake lawc god escape vnpunished doubtles people would grudge styre thereat capegius answered yt copaet bargaine betwixt knew surely theyr act manifest neded greate triall law wer sequestred fro felowship church dede doyng bycause others kept harlot lyued dishonestly yt doeth excuse theyr cryme knoweth maner bishop germany permit theyr priestes money kepe lemans euil done dede shal yeld accopt one day neuerthelesse greater offence priestes mary campcgsus raileth agai holye matrimony kepe home many harlot perswaded yt well acknowledge theyr synne men chaste iohn baptist yet neuer sene myght lawefully refuse sole life amonges grekes theyr rite customes differ much fro v wherfore praieth giue theyr aide theyr bishoppe matter ambassador say would fyrst punishe whoremonger might senate assiste better correcting others hand againe first assist theyr bishop woulde punishe whoredome would come thither selfe see punished accordingely assemblie norinberge fernando campegius cardinall salisburge duke bauare yt bishop decree papistes gospeller trent regenspurge also thambassadors bishop baberge spire straus auspurge costance basil frisinge passame brixine mette ratisbone agreed vpon opinio sixt day iuly muche themperor folowing herin iudgement request leo tenth codemned wormes publik decree doctrine luther wicked likewyse decreed assemblie norinberge aswell fyrst last al men obey much lieth therfore request cardinall campegins hath ful auethoritie bishop rome concernynge matter commande foresayde decree decree made laste assembly obserued kepte wythin theyr iurisdictions ghospell others scripture taught church interpretation auetent father puritie life excelled theyr great vertu confyrmed theyr doctrine martyrdome teach herestes already codemned thing el reproch christ lady saint may occasion sedition let punished according tenure therof man admitted preach without haue bishoppes license ecciesiastical lawes cardinal capegius hath writte como asset take away vice reforme maners whe ons published shalbe obserued touching masse sacramets al thing let nothing altered done hath bene accustomed oure forefather receyue lordes supper wtout confession absolutio eate fleshe dayes forbidde also mock none yt ron ordre priestes deacos subdeacos yt marrye shalbe punished let nothing put print cosent magistrate namely luther copanions let nothing set forth sold theyr iurisdiction studying witteberge wtin thre monethes shall heare decree made retourne home go el wheras luth poison taketh place shall otherwise shalbe depraued theyr benefice lose theyr inheritace shall cotinew uniuersitie witteberge shal neyther enioy benefice haue charge brynge vp youthe certeine fit men chosen euery place see thinges executed offender many taken committed warde rest yt shall banisshed haue place refuge farre theyr rule dominios rtretche comotio sedition fortune arrise reason decree wtin theyr limittes rest shall come aide ecclesiasticall lawes whiche campegius deuised let priestes liue honestly go comely appareled nother sell marchantes haut tauernes let couetous theyr ministration extorte money gredelye let kepe cocubines displaced let nubre holye dayes measure woulde campegius haue enacted counsell empire could bring passe held assembly part whan luther vnderstode emperoure diuerse prince woulde practise decree wormes bewaileth state lamentatio lut germanye whiche beynge ofte admonisshed neglecteth wealthe calleth vpon prince selues beynge openly wickedly disceaued romishe byshoppes maynteyne neuertheles theyr dignitie seke distructio wissheth best vnto wherfore saith great ingratitud frowardenesse inexcusable hangeth terrible plage ouer germany warneth also attempte rasshelye warre vpon turke counsell moderation doeth farre excell prince liuing may hope victorye furthermore calleth mockery theperour kynge englande lengthen theyr lyues one momet cai selues defendors church faith besecheth god sende suche magistrate seke tendre god glory golden rose pope lately consecrated atcustomed golden rose sent kynge englande erasmus boke free three weekes easter sendeth heury eyghte kynge englande notable token singular good wyll beneuolens aboute tyme came forth erasmus boke freewill wherunto luther aunswered contrary tytell bondewyll kynge englande cardinal yorke caused erasmus write booke selfe confesseth certeine epistle cardinall printe time also anthony duke decree duke loraine loraine made decree muche luther doctrine condemned bishop rome emperor famous uniuersities commaundeth none preache doctrine suche haue bokes set forthe luther exhibite within certeine day appointynge penaltie suche dyd disobey yere henry zutpha put death exceadinge henry zutphan paine torment doctrine gospel dietmary marces germany beyng called went thither taught two yeres amonges bremers tolde cousell haue bene spire emperor biameth prince altered themperor knewe writing letter spaine state thepire ides iuly doth blame exceadinly decree made wheras certeine yeres paste counsell wormes common assente state moste weygtie wordes condemned luther doctrine hereticall pestilent also byshoppe rome dewe examination condemned bokes commaundyng bret marueyleth greatly sory also shoulde forbed onely sclaunderous bookes skornefull picture sold though decree wormes ryghtly orderly made moreouer lytell moued woulde haue counsell holden germany haue spoken legate campegius would write byshop herin thoughe concerned bishoppe doeth thought expedient germany haue counsel made preuie yt might haue obteyned thing byshop nowe albeit perceiueth rightwell howe muche bishoppes authoritie also decree diminished yet consyderynge waye shal vnprofitable comon wealth approueth counsell also yet may done bishoppes authoritie tyme place conueniente maye presente selfe fully determined whereas haue appoynted assemblie agaynste xi day nouembre establisshe religion till begynnyng counsell haue also chosen certeine learned men gather summe doctrine neyther wyll consent therto wyse accordynge hys office muche defendor protectour byshop rome churche doth meanes prohibite decrre lest themperor defendour romishe churche procure selfe displeasure god bishop also greater cotumelie ca wrought christia church tha reueres dew highest power thus shake germany hath bene euer comended vertu obeidiece lone alter yt religio prince bishop rome self euer durst neuer man forsoke hitherto felt god vengeaunce wickednes forsake abolish hath bene long cotinewauce christendo craftye perswasion luther endeuoureth wt painted word disceaue lut copared mahomet abuse time past mahomet plage god might loke besecheth god loke mercifully vpon germany suffer great mischiefest take place ther log liueth wherfore let obey decre wormes vnlesse smart defer matter religio till general cousell may bishop rome appointmet theyr chief magistrats selfe sorte writeth also priuatly certein state amoges others senate strauso thus decre next asseblie abolished themperor hauing hand full frenche warres sought winne bishop rome meanes duke bourbo besieged marfelles possible sommer charles duke bourbon costable frauce yere partly owne accorde partely laboured themperor fell fro french king beseged marselles vain departing thence italy kyng foloweth great expedition taking many holdes lubardy citie millan selfe towardes wynter besegeth pauie towne riuer ticine moneth nouembre countrey people suelande began ryse theyr lord countie lupse charge wherwith begynnynge rustical war complayned ouer muche burthened lykewise others place nere vnto rebelled theyr magistrats much yt counsel thepire gouerneth comon welth themperors absence beyng eslinge sent theyr ambassador appeased certeine cotrouersies broile ceased shalbe told herafter yt begining greatest daugerous comotion yt pearsed afterwards throughout great part germany tyme luther doctrine set forth place ye clergie resist forse fearyng lose theyr goodes benefice papistes fight bely certein straceborugh complained senate empire townes men infringe theyr liberty priueleges diuerse way howe appointed maryed priestes monkes capito bucer others haue gouernement church receiued lordes supper vnder kindes yt rasshely cast image theyr church cause two chiefest counselor thempire friderick cou tie palatine philip marque baden letter written fro esling moneth ianuary admonishing senate leaue theyr chauge restore eche thing place diuers swices namely schafusians basill oecolampadius taught bega litel litel giue ouer theyr displeasure towards zuricke maner al rest could meanes pacified wha captaine turege wherunto zurick belongeth taken priest night cariyng awaye makinge outcry calling helpe neighbour reised vp sode tumult euery man gote weapon whan zuricke suffered many iniuries fourth day ianuary wrote theyr letter al theyr confederate felowes complaining wise christ say comaundeth yt stryketh thee coplaite zuricke one cheeke thou shalte offer folowinge doctrine haue suffered many thinges patietly sith ther ende measure iniuries inforced flie yt christ self vsed haue done euill desyre yt may taught shewed v undoubtedly much susteine suche hatred malice euery euill reported men thynge selfe requireth constreineth v make answere wherfore wil declare cause al malice cause theyr hatred confute sclaunders shewe howe affected towards common countrey fyrste dede wheras fraunces frenche kyng made great long suite enter league v consent therto notwithstandynge ofte hande v vtterly refuse diuerses cause chiefly maner liked v witte shold serue foreine prince vile sende strength souldiours vnto straungers money hired warre neuer harme bring vp suche euill example maineteine idlenes whiche die warres theyr wiues childre come extreme miserie iudged vusittynge thynge oure owne great losse hynderaunce serue kynges torne brynge countrey men suche bondage therefore haue iudged best retaine kepe libertie bodie good elder great valeautnes blouddy handes haue gotten v wyth like vertue constauncie al matter cause wer welspringe begynnyng displeasure woulde haue ratified league thinke haue rysen displeasure often tymes hande v forsake league shewed mynde kepe amitie kynge accordynge composition peacetions olde league made wealth preseruaalready established moreouer would obserue condition common countrey perseuer herein haue gotten displeasure abroade syns lyghte ghospell sprange vp haue shaken shoulder moste weigtie burthen whiche bishoppe rome adherentes laide vpon v abolished manifest errours occasion haue taken late ambassador sent haue intreated v conuerte amende aunswere thereunto worke prescripte goddes worde man shewe v errour alter purpose surely reason obey god men stode vp egly captein lucerne threatenyng v vulesse forsake doctrine luther zuinglius lucernates uranites switensians unterualdians tugiaus friburge sit counsel v henceforth longe confyrmed thing amonges selues law captaine turege taken night season iohn oxeline preacher ghospell hys owne house caried away prisoner vnto vsis double iniurie owne man taken owne liberty whereas many ran oute night al part outcry many thinges wickedly blame layde vpon v men happened amonges nowe seconde matter charge v procedeth assemblie whiche ferdinando archeduke austriche helde last yere regenspurge ruler countrie also bishoppes suche others hate doctrine ghospell era papistes endeuor go vnknowen verely make dissention amonges v plucke v sonder thinge greueth v credite suche time past haue knowen leaste lewde wycked parsous whome also vnderstandyng theyr craft treason haue banished limittes euen nowe muche woulde gyue eare fled vnto accuse v nowe though broke league made house austrich say sent aide walsute theyr prince ferdinando vntrew whers walsutensias dau ger theyr religion could suffered speake selues fewe men knowledge ran thither saue harmeles men iniurie violence sone knew therof called backe againe therefore grounde theyr accusation vntrewe ferdinando haue thing shewe league broke let bring forth shall aunswered suche sort al men may plainly see whether parte hath kept couenauntes therefore haue secret talke ferdinando ambassadours part oures litell maruel treated tholde league ought haue bene made priuie religion whye deale wt v condition haue many time offered report goth haue conspired destroy secte luther whiche althoughe trew yet much ioyned league aswel moreouer folow steppe luther holy scripture ought accompted numbre muche knowe done amonges complained malicious parson though spoken aide certeine city protest false sclaunder like sort say howe wil sodainly side dromme cause men take armure surprise baden certeine place lie deuised entente purpose might take townes laye garuisous v thing done doubt greater tumult would therby arrise might kindle amonges v domesticall ciuile warre besydes go manye sclaunderouse reportes v one howe shoulde teache mary mother christe mo sounes yonger iames apostle died v christ selfe suche like thinges would haue cofuted lucerne wold suffer men speake vnto people tyme also eckins promised come shewe zuinglius errours right glad therof sent onely ecksuc pope champion also others safecouduict exhorting earuestly come promisyng shewe fauour finally heare say plucking downe image hath procured v finale displeasure hereof haue declared cause reason wherfore seyng haue done nothing condition league seyng refuse perill safgarde oure common countrey beare lyke loue haue done alwayes case permitte v suffer diuisyon pouertie boundage swices made amonges v knowen state condition auncesters content poore liuinge gote sore labor householde oppressed nobilitie extreme bondage god looked mercyfully vpon expulsed tyrrauntes gote libertie inriched substaunce suche rich libertie driuen oute fortified selues league force wherof able defende theyr coutrey inuasions forein power many time victory ouer theyr enemy many ye sought seauer break societie yet vaine aide power oure elder prepared time doubte haue remembraunce fewe wordes may suffice touching begynnyng league faith indeuor diligence hath bene shewed v euer sin amplifiyng dignitie common countrey nede recited doubtles mynde good haue shewed euer hitherto remaineth styll v seynge thus greueth v exceadingly perswasio others seke theyr owne commoditie therby incensed v call rather remembrauce amitie hath bene alwaies betwene v time sundry place aswel home broad haue abiden like chaunce warre done many thinges ryght worthely assuredly memoriall hereof ought onely bynd v also posteritie streight bonde amitie ye cause religion facte oures offende reason matter quietly frendly amonges selues becommeth felowes frendes knitte together brotherlye league wyll neyther frowarde obstinate vntractable haue alwayes saide wilbe content glad reformed suche teache v better thinges muche profession ghospell sakynge frenche league moreouer many sclaunders inuented v haue torned good willes v altered former mindes must write thinges necessitie defence oure owne estimation haue often saied vnlesse errour canne shewed consta cie zurieke v scripture may forsake religio force euer bent v aboute middes february senate strausburge aunswered letter sente chamber imperiall confuted thynges three accuser mo say founde charged reporte troublesome parson fled citie styrre vp strife contension therefore require gyue credyte haue opinio senate mete example theyr elder seke concorde wealth empire also preacher theselues wrote time vnto counselers longe oration declare reason theyr doyng muche haue committed nothyng againste goddes lawe require moste humbly geue credite theyr aduersaries determine thing agaynst matter knowen time warre italy waxed hote betwixt emperor freche kyng taken prisoner frenche kynge beseged pauie winter aboute later ende february taken battell caryed emperour spaine warre bishoppe rome clement secretly vnconstacie clement frenche parte chaunge fortune gaue vnto themperors captaines greate summe money paye theyr souldiours anthony lena kept pauie garnisons germanes spaniardes kyng wonderfull great armye much imperialles beyng dispaire lumbardie consulted howe conueigh armye kepe naples encouraged throughe oration fernando daualle marque piscare gate battell wanne felde takyng mightie kinge victor themper alles obteined noble victorie riche spoiles chirstaine charles de lanoy bourgonion pretendyng fyrst would haue led kyng naples takyng shypping chauged course sayled spaine matter might sooner pacified battel foughten day emperor borne foure twenteth february begynnyng spring time began newe commotion comotion bulgare people sueuelande parte germany yt lyeth riuer thonawe bulgare people prelate churche pretendyng cause thoughe would defende gospell brynge selues bondage magistrate promised heare theyr complaintes reforme misse perseuered still encreased dayly set forth certeine demaundes numbre theyr demaundes xii wherin would satisfied commynge handes others styrred vp newe commotion sundry place whylest thinges brewing ulriche duke wirtemberge duke wirtemberge attepte warrs certeine yeres confederacie suelad driuen coutrey got armie swices thinking recouer dukedome beyng resisted fernandoes captain kept townes therof others foresaid confederacy last wantyng money gaue ouer enterprise meane tyme hoste bowres much increased power prince giuen repulse duke wirteberge recouered townes taken went ulmes gathered three army whereof one pitched nere vnto biberake algouia thyrde lake co staunce muche intreatye peace betwixte rauesbourge campodune also senate thempire carefull state common welth sent ulmes simon pistor duke george saxonie iames sturmnus noble man senate strausburge treate peace wt counsellours prince confederated commaundyng eyther partie emperours name withdraw theyr warre vnder greate penaltie neyther peace trewce could taken certeine bandes horseman wente ulines elchinge whiche riuer danubius slewe great numbre bowres fyrste slaughter bowres brought many prisoner backe citie george truckese chiefe capitaine sueuical league marching forward army came lippene little towne danubius two mile beneth ulmes great numbre pesauntes neyther taryinge footemen munition gaue charge horseman slewe mooste parte rest toke riuer another slaughter drowned towne beyng gyuen vp taken spoyled many therin beheaded truckesse victorie would haue gone agaynst resydew fotemen whiche lead wylliam furstemberge would forward wer paid though fought battell captaine saide battell enemy discomfited euer came yet longe could pacified new entreatie peace nothing could concluded armie marched wer algouia would haue men lyke tyme ioyne battel ran away rest yelded selues ides aprill meane another parte sueuia assembled great numbre hala franckonie vpon great crueltie bowres easterday beyng xvi aprill toke towne winsperge slewe diuerse noble men therin amonges others lewes erle helfestene cruell sorte runnyng speares muche cruelly sight wife bastarde daughter themperour maximilian cariyng yonge childe armes fell downe theyr feete lamenting wepyng miserably beholde axing pardon husbande father childe spurned vtterly reiected capitaine truckesse discoinfited three army mentioned marched streight vpon also slew two three thousande putting rest flighte punishynge greuously prysoners namelye whiche fleyne countie cruel maner burnynge helfestene one tyed stake longe chaine might ronne vp downe fyre made rounde burnt others nobilitie like fyreth towne winsperge comaunded neuer builded againe another troupe went franckonie burned two hundreth castels aboue besydes abbeis noble men house taking citie wirciburge beseged castell truckesse commynge vpon throughe countrey wittemberge vanquished also put flight recouereth wirciburge reskeweth castel beseged beyng aided lewes cou tie palatine owne parson germany broile went loraine much warre bowres loraine anthony duke therof accompanied brother claude duke guise gathered vp remenaunt frenche armye dispersed battel pauie kyng taken went sabernes wheras muche people assembled well lorayne alsate wheras bowres resorted aide ye others made certeine horseman fotemen village called lupfsteine slew nubre thousand fyue hudred residew escaped flyght nexte daye made great slaughter sabernes notwithstandyng kept promise commaundyng laye downe theyr weapon promisyng pardon done accordyngly goyng home wardes without weapon slayne horse men fotemen part towne bishoppes slaughter bowres castell spoiled lewde foldiours citizen also slayne without respecte mercie duke retourned home slaughter armye bowres encamped valley willers kepinge streightes shoulde passe ioyned battel slaine aboue iiii thousande conflicte lost erle iserburge thus retourned home much spoile many prisoner slaine thoughte three place aboute eghtene thousande monthe may like successe others place petersheme besydes wormes great numbre murthered soldiours time redred selues layde parte weapon slaughter present countie palatine tharchbishop treuers countie best power stay pacifie soldiors crueltie archebishop treuers allow theyr doynges also killed many hand crediblie reported notwithstadyng sundry place policie magistrate thing appeased quietlye friburge brisgoye whither senate straus request gnest marque baden great land sent iames sturmius conrade iohame ambassador whose perswasio ambassador basill together yt encamped lara foure mile straus appeased xxv day iuly yet fidelitie fayled many came home executed likewyse heluetians appeased rebellion sontgauia prouince belongyng kinge fernando house austriche declaringe vnto dewtie magistrate people also theyr requestes wer euery like beginning suelade passing vnto others reaching thuringe border saxonie vnto toppe alpes cou trey salisburge whither rebellion appeased frackonie came also armye prince confederated distroied geismer captaine bower banished many amoges theyr captein geismer passed alpes streyght passage part hoste uenetians yerely stipende dwelled padwey wheras slaine treason thend bowres warre whiche slaine one sommer least fiftie thousande league swelane prince confederacie league swelad oft mentioned werethese cesar prince austriche brother fernando tharchbishop mentz palsegraue bishoppe salisburge bamberge wirciburge aistet auspurge wylliam lewes brother duke bauar otho henricke philip brother county palatine george marque brandeburge albert nephewe philip lantzgraue hasse diuers others nobilitie clergie moreouer part city sweuia amoges norinberge eight day aprill masse put downe zuricke commaundement masse abolisshed zuricke senate aswell within citie without stead instituted lordes supper lykewise ceremony abolished doctrine godes worde taketh place lawe made againste fornication adulterie iudges appointed heare cause matrimony fyfthe booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common ale empire charles fyfte argument fyfth booke muncer newe doctrine teaching goodes common inflamed rage people hauinge phifer companion duke fredericke departeth prince assemble muncer perswading people resist discomsited executed luther written toye senate misshuse requestes wurs made ye beginning recited wherunto luther answereth sheweth disordre exhorting ye magistrate destroy wicked men themperor vnderstanding trouble appoynteth counsel auspurge carolostadius exiled wittenberg goeth make purgation luther marieth nonne z winglius meete marseburge conferre theyr controuersie lordes supper whilest french king prisoner pope clement receiuing letter kynges mother solliciteth parlamente paris make persecusion faber constrained flee wherof king wing aduertised causeth suite action learned men surcease common welth pruse altered knightes germany duke donie receiueth gospell agreat occasion terrible warre muncer great anabaptist came rashe lewd preacher wherof thomas muncer principall leauing preaching gospell set forth new kind doctrine alstet atowne duke saxonye thuringe taughte byshop rome luther also contendinge bothe doctrine vyle naught byshop byndeth men conscience straight ouer harde lawes whiche bondes saide luther deede hath lowsed offended contrary parte geuing ouermuche libertie teaching thinges spirite bishop decree maye fafely contemne helpe nothynge vnto saluation whiche obtayne saith must first eschewe open crymes murther adultery blaspheming god name body must chastened made leane fasting simple apparel coutenaunce must framed vnto grauitie speake seldome weare long beard like thigs called crosse ye mortifieg ye flesh discipline wherwt yt furnished said must get copany thike oft god whether hath care ouer whether christ died sake whether religion better tha turkes moreouer axe god sygne wherby maye testifie careth v true religion albeit shew token yet must neuertheles procede praie still yea expostulate braule god dealeth well wt v seyng scripture promiseth graunt thinges demaunded righte doeth exhibite muncer haue token ared god signe man seketh true knowledge expostulation anger saieth god well accepted perceiueth herby earnest minde zeale doubt thus instantly sollicited declare selfe notable signe quenche thirste minde dealinge v intymes paste tholde father taughte moreouer god opened hys minde dreames wherin builded foundation intet loke whose dreame could interprete would praise openly sermon meanes allured many began take stipulation wrot theyr name promised othe ayde pretensed mischiefe said commaunded god distroy wicked prince subsistute new theyr place taughte moreouer thinges comon al like fredom dignitie wherupon ye comon teacheth thinges common people leauig theyr daily labor toke thing neded others yt store eue agaist wils duke sax banished time bega fyrst preach seditiously thence wet norin fro thece mulhuse wherhe altered senate droue mo kes entred theyr possessios takig vpo hi preacher also senator determining al matter list sayd thinges shewed reuelation loke said sacred holy partes plaied space two thre monethes whe bowres vp swelande frankonie nubre fourtie thousand discomfited great parte nobilitie taken spoyled fyred many holdes castels mentioned began set hade seing time seruing well muncer maketh gonne purpose cast felde peces gray frier gote wonderfull numbre people coutrie thinking get thig counsell one phifer bold desperate felow phifer companion much gyuen dreames vision nighte dreamed sawe certeine stable innumerable sorte myse put flight al toke yt god comaunded lead forth armie nobilitie scatter muncer albeit made sedicious sermon yet hote hasarde whole coutrey vp armure therfore sent letter al place namely digged mine coutrie maunsfelde exhorting wise set vpon theyr prince without respecte shortely yt vp franckonye come party meane phifer yt could longer phifers enterprise abide maketh roode company spoyleth countrye isefelde hardely sacketh castelies church discomfiteth many gentleman casteth fetter retournynge wyth great buttie encouraged men herts excedinly mucer supposing men redynes departeth mulhuse wt thre hundreth ioyned francuse time departed death fridericke noble duke sax fridericke duke saxonie without issewe neuer maried leauing brother iohn succede nowe alberte countie musfelde hearing sturre countrey leuied spedelye certeine bandes horseman gyuynge charge slewe two hundreth thinge put suche feare remayned still frackuse tariyng company durst procede prince make power meane time duke saxonie iohn prince elector george vncle philip lantzgraue hesse henrye duke brunswike leuied thousande v hudreth horseman certeine bandes foote men marched towardes rebelles incamped hill litell without towne fensed selues carriage hardely coulde inuaded neyther sufficiently furnished munition weapos skilfull warres wherfore prince hauing compassion sente vnto aduised deliuer theyr captaines lay aside theyr weapon haue theyr pardon retorne home muncer fearing selfe came forth sower countenauce seditious oration muncer made oration se felowes brother farre fro tyrrautes albeit haue conspired deathes yet discouraged mindes date attepte nothing v offere suche condicions foolishe torne weapon know right well haue attempted thinge owne braine priuate aucthoritie neuer experienced suche matter commaundemet god seyng shal dewtie obey depart grounde god selfe hath placed v tymes past commauded abraha offer vp sonne although ignoraut shold thede yet folowyng comaudemet refused nothing therfore god bothe preserued sonne also rewarded faith wt great benefit likewise ought yt stad saith abraham obteined god great benefites case comit successe thig god nodoubt shal haue desire selfes shal se helpe god manifestly shal discofit enemy al place god hath promised sudrie place scripture helpe pore toppresse wicked saying apperteineth vnto v poore afflicted seke setforth mainteine true knowledge god doubt victory let v cosider state enemy muncer rai leth prince called dede prince tirates care take good spende wickedly pride riot voluptuousues light cause moue wartes destroye pore haue lefte theyr princelik uertues place widow orphane mainteine bishoppe rome aucthoritie wickednesse cleargie youthe shoulde brought vp learnyng poore releued establishe marchandise massing abhominations thinke ye god wil suffer longer truely eue droue cananites wil expulse also christ whipt bier blouddy preacher bloweth crompet seller forth temple nowe likewise priestes theyr patrones mainteiners wherefore play men gratifie god distroiyng vnprofitable people surely suerer waye pacifie matter forsake theyr olde wont wil restore v vnto libertie permit v haue true religio seruice god wi ought rather die allow theyr wickednes suffer doctrine gospel taken fro v promisse assuredly ye god wil aide strengthen v uictorye shalbe oures selfe promise selfe lye disceased commau ded procede wise punishe magistrate herein god power chiefly declared whan stronge army destroied smale handfull appeared example gedeon ionathos god power appeareth sewest men iud vii sam xiiii xvii dauid killed goliah greate gyaunt tyrrible looke vpon doubt present day shal notable like spectacle spoken whilest worlde goeth albeit well fournished wyth weapon thynges necessarye owne defence yet shall engine heauen earth chaunged rather tha god shal forsake v water red sea chaunged tymes past israelite beyng persecuted pharao might passe therfore feare nothing fight mafully wicked enemy fraide theyr gunnes pellettes yt shall shoute receaue cote beholde se howe mercyfull god haue beholde signe token euerlastyng good wyll towardes v lift vp eies see reinebow skie seing haue painted enseigne god declareth plainely similitude sheweth v muncer disceaueth people rainebowe highe wyll aide v battell distroye tyrrauntes wherfore nowe set vpon wyth bolde courage moste assured godes helpe made ende part afraide great daunger yet amonges many lewde fearein mu cer campe desperate person ready vnto mischief beynge inclined theyr nature euyll perswaded oration chieflye celestiall signe supposyng sure token victorie ouer hauing smalle company numbre eight thousande place mete ynough kept cried oute men shoulde take theyr weapon fight stout courage enemy singing sog wherby called helpe holy gost ther messenger slaine agaist lawe armes sent vnto noble yong man muncer lawes armes slayne wherwith prince displeased caused trompettes soude battel set order tha philip lantzgraue hesse though yongest exhortaci lantzgraue ryding vp downe fro one copany another exhorted soldioures valcaut although thinges trew wherof accused yet lawfull subiectes rebell prince magistrats vnto god hath giuen sword wold haue obeyed may proued sundry place scripture wente aboute execuse eyther owne faultes prince confesse theyr fault graunt many thinges ought amended yet ought people neuerthelesse absteyne seditio alledge permitted haue doctrine gospel iust cause make rebellion whan peter stroke sworde rebuked christ prince persecute trew religion ought beare yea suffer death rather resist force armes take ye name gospell cloke theyr intent dede take men good sley magistrate force men wiues crime punished asmuche pretende name holynes shamefull deedes doubte god wyll plage hypocrisie reuenge blasphemie holye name suche like wordes encouraged hys men fyght gaue charge theyr enemy fyrst wente ordinaunce poore wretch standyng amased men rauished theyr wittes neither defended selues madnes munceriane sought theyr saftie flight songe duche mytre requiringe aide holy ghost many trustyng muncers promise looked helpe heauen greate peces shotte entred theyr campe slayne many laste fled towarde towne franckuse others went againe thother syde hill valley beneth skirmished wyth certeine horseman slewe two three horseman scattered selues theyr enemy fledde folowed chase oute raye missed company wer rage reuenge theyr felowes death slewe fyue thousand immediatly battell towne taken thre hundreth beheaded muncer fled towne hyd selfe house slaughter mu cerians farre gate hither chaunce came gentleman seruaunt goyng vp see house founde chamber aboue one lying bed asketh one rebel fled sayd nay layue sycke good whyle ague purse chaused laye vpon bed chatcheth vp thinkyng haue pece money opened foud letter albert countie mansfelde sent muncer admonishynge cease enterprise styrre vp people rebellion red letter demaunded whether letter written vnto denied thother threatened desyred content confessed muncer led duke george saxonie latz muncer taken graue beynge demaunded thus abused poore simple people aunswered done nothinge dewtie magistrate whiche abyde godes cruell answere word ought thus punished lantzgraue replied proued scripture howe god hath commaunded magistrate honoured obeyed reproued lantzgraue howe hath forbidden sedition lawfull anye christian reuenge owne wronge wherunto aunswered nothing beynge examined vpon racke cried oute paine duke said vnto thou art nowe muncer payne remembre againe losse many men beyng wickedly abused thys day haue bene distroied greate laughter saide would haue vnreasonable laughter muncer afterwardes led helderunge towne coutie masseldes vpon pymebanke appeached many companion confederats conspiracie beheaded mulhuse amonges others phifer mentioned executed hable receite belefe henry duke bruswicke saide shoulde die acknowledged houre death repenteth offence error beynge inuironed soldiours exhorted prince would shewe mercy poore men reade ouer diligently bokes scripture written kynges souer spoke thus sword neck exaple head set vp pole middes feldes time banished saxonie saide wanderyng place place last reported purposed come mulhuse luther hearing thereof wrote letter senate admonishyng case receiue muncer sedicious parson imagined nothing murther mischiefe signifiyng thinges attempted alstet place moreouer doctrine fonde pernicious whereof wylled beware shortly would craft knowen frendly wordes saide contempted fell misery shold without blame diligently warned repente late likewise anye tumolt germany yet thynges lyke come suche passe luther set forth boke wherein warned men abstayne lut diswadeth sedition sedition declaryng way refourme tyrrany clergie shall fall confounded force men spirite god commyng sauior christ appere daniell sainct paule grounde hys ii thess ii opinion right well assured seke redres thinge force armes shall trauaile vayne yet muche great tumult daunger hageth ouer cleargie thing requireth counsell wyll franckly declare opinion fyrst magistrate dewtie foresee people dewtie good magistrate susteine hinderaunce fault others trew religion defaced false doctrine theyr propre office vse theyr power giuen glory god welth people muche contrary let one also mainteine false doctrine shall escape vnpunished neuer purpose papistes oppressed wt magistrate shold deale wyth papistes force armes ciuill maiestrate shoulde compell theyr dewtie herin extende theyr right aucthoritie neyther theyr lenitie yet dissimulation confyrme boldenes lewde doynges touchyng co mon people muste earnestly admonished styrre except magistrate commaunde way labore al together vayne god wil auenge thing greuous punishment wheras magistrate worke slowely herin beare suffer many vnworthy thing god wrath slowe yet sore moued manifest iniuries mockery cleargie done throughe god permission alone myghte auenge matter powre indignation vpon case matter come tumult god could content light punishment yet maner procedyng onely discommendable also vnprofitable seditio reason part chaunceth thinnocent parson plaged soner others moreouer man thauthors rebellion wythout excuse stirreth vp rebellion yt excused matter neuer iuste great comotio people good wt bad honest wicked necessitie must perishe together wherfore let haue eye magistrate long styrreth let priuate attempt sedition comaundement god comaundeth controuersies priuate men shouldebe lawfully decided iudge consyderinge yt rebellion nothyng thing rebellion el priuate reuengement man nede doubt ye god disaloweth abhorreth sedition like coine reised deuill hym selfe enemye mankynde abyde lyght treweth styrreth vp tumultes men professe gospell might bringe cotept hatred trew doctrine hath bene god benefite former yeres restored though proceded god semeth geue occasion many euils aduersaries gospell already bragge theyr iudgementes co temned vtterly dispiseth herin hathe neuer written spoken thing might kindle sedition vnto question obiect shall howe longe shall suffer theyr enormity seyng magistrate winketh therat wicked dominion shaken answer yt ought folow order fyrst let acknowledge theyr faultes wherwith god beyng offeded hath suffered tyrrany clergie continew long stretche farre doeth wicked cruell gouernement reward offence wyll deliuered oughte fyrste reconcile selues vnto god thamendement life wt earnest prayer desyre god aide popish knigdome example best way ouer threw pope authoritie king dauid praied god many time breake ye power prid wicked finally doctrine gospel preached set forth iuggelinges papistes made manifest world theyr error beyng detected trueth knowe men may esteme lightly clerely contemne euer shall procede rediest way ouerthrow theyr authoritie strength forse armes ye preuaile nothinge commonly chaunceth throughe warre made stronger case copare christ wt pope gospel wt doctrine shall openly appere difference betwixt lighte sunne mere darkenes howe great benefite god lu yt word tha cold haue bene force armes way vnto knowledge made open al lettes take away tha slideth faleth downe force estimation thing may appere example hath afflicted popishe kingdome force armes could haue done therfore rebellion wished preachyng gospell raised vp christe selfe mightie sharpe ynough ouerthrow papistrie hereupon let fixe theyr eye mindes also loke meane furthermore owne matter wherin muche occupied great weight exceadeth strength capacitie ma witte loked yt matter brought farre forth therfore putteth doubt hath laide foundation worke hath gyuen increase bringe also conclusion ende maugre head aduersaries saieth howe deuill knew longe great alteration went let certein appereth prophecy briget others men prophecied tymes intent might driue men farre holsome doctrine seeth attempte vaine seeketh newe waye styrreth vp men rebellion let reuolting bishoppes kyngdome yet shall faile purpose preachinge pure doctrine kingdome shall confounded true doctrine must styll perseuer declaring howe men decree helpe nothinge vnto saluation moreouer howe men must warned suffre selues bounden monkish vowes suche intangled already forsake furthermore giue money vaine foolish v church taper belle tabels uessels armes workes ornamentes suche like thinges lyfe christian consisteth thinges faith charitie thus people taught doubt aucthoritie kyngdome bishoppe adherentes fal fewe yeares case doctrine taught therrours plucked oute men myndes papistrie shal continew though neuer many conspiracy made let nowe consyder poder litel time brought passe doctrine aduersaries testifie wanted wonted commodity wherby may easely perceiued would haue come therof case doctrine might haue free course two yeres longer wherfore deuill smelleth matter doeth nowe bestyrre goeth let enterprise sedition practise deuill must worcke wisely commede benefite god high prayses hath set vp light knowledge eies iuggling papistes bewraied theyr ignoraunce briberie tyrrany theyr fylthynes wher haue longe disceaued world nowe disclosed whiche heretofore haue bene feared men nowe broughte exigente nowe appeare theyr likenes beholden naked eies men vncleanes haue hid hertofore popishe kingdo maie long indure nowe driuen force armes state longe endure chaunce part theyr power remaine doctrine ghospell shall infringe shall abolished commyng christ must therfore applye manfully procede course yet muste done order farre frame furnished learnyng haue heard two three sermos take muche vpon callyng selues lutherianes reproue bitterly yet knowe nothing wherin much offende ought requireth man vsurpe hys name rather indeuour seing professe name christ may rightly chalenge ourselues may surnamed christian teacheth hath nede wel ware preacher ought circumspect dealeth obstinate froward wyl contemne sounde doctrine also bring others errour must quite eschew precept christ cast pearels hogges wheras cotented eyther theyr ignoraunce obstinacie seke seduce others bringe fro crew doctrine tha must sharpely withstande theyr owne sake multitude might least saued agayne therebe others obstynate symple without knowledge must deale gently hastely rashely shewyng order wherein saluation men consisseth accordyng theyr smalle capacitie applye theyr speache tyll lytle lytle increase confyrmed last boke shewed bowres yt vp sweuelande muncer came forth felde people handled matter attempraunce begynning declaringe article written thinges would haue reformed theyr prince magistrate case abused thing would styfe wilfull promised folowe better cou sell theyr requestes fyrst might chuse suche minister preache theyr demaundes god worde sincerely without mixture men tradition secondarely herafter would pay tithe corne onely distributed discretion good men partly minister church partly vpon pore partly aboute commen affaire thyrdly haue bene
