hitherto vnworthelye kept bondes consydering howe made free bloude christ refuse haue magistrate knowyng ordeyned god wyll obey honest thinges abyde longer bounde vnlesse shewed reasonable testimony scripture againe standeth equitie forbidden huntinge haukyng fishyng prohibited hunte hauke fishe many place may suffered chase wilde beastes corne seynge beginnyng world god hath gyuen man right rule ouer kinde beastes desyre equalitie herein maye rather commoditie multitude fewe mighte consydered moreouer wodes men handes great discommoditie people wherfore theyr minde haue suche common fewel also building priuate man inheritace woddes frendly vsed owner furthermore sore burthened diuerse way dayly wherfore desyre prince moderate rule gospell charge time past hath bene accustomed would also haue good landes possession benefite graunte prince magistrate charged couenaunted beginninge lykewise pay rent yerely theyr fermes worth wherfore reason lordes remit part therof intente ye tyll grounde may reape fruite trauaile liue extreme pouertie brieflye paimentes money woulde require equitie dayly diuised new lawes meanes get money amendement oftentimes thing hadled fauour displeasure one pertialtie wherfore require affection set part thing vsed hence forth maner first prescribed finally haue taken la de meddowes common redresse vnles agreed withall last al wheras goodma house departeth wife child wont paye whiche vnreasonable would magistrate shoulde vtterly take away unto article beyng published answereth luter vnto lut answer bowres referred matter framing stile vnto trew sayeth graunt suche prince admit preaching gospell oppresse people diuerslye worthy god thrust gouernement haue none excuse albeit trew yet must take heede bring hither pure vnspotted conscience el shall suffer losse bothe body soule neyther ought consyder power howe much aduersaries blamed howe iust quarel defende take diligent hede therfore beleue preachinges men sathan hathe tyme vnder pretence gospell styred vp many sediciouse bloudy doctours wyll counsell ryghtly truely bo den shall parte geue eare mynde heare nether shal moue one whitte though many shal reporte euyll rayle vppon shall suffice lest wyse may delyuer goddes vengeaunce rest passe contempne shall feare purpose take bours vse godlye title selues holy name call selue christian felloweshyp bragge wyll followe thinges lawe prescribed god know certenly name god may taken vayne vntrewlye god threateneth punyshemente gen gene whiche remayneth dewe vnto also handle busines ryghtly drowned whole worlde flud swallowed vp sodome fyrie shoure easely destroye also power someuer haue proued easely take name god doinges falsely wherfore harde coniecture ende disceaueth sayed shoulde dye sworde math whiche toke vnto selues sworde boldnes vsurped aucthritie correctyng others paule withstanding commaundeth men generally rom tobey magistrate reuerence feare wyl aunswere vnto whiche seme followe prescript god lawe yet laye holde sworde resiste magistrate whome god hathe ordeyned take name god vayne wyll saye magistrate suche vntollerable take v doctrine gospell thinges oppresse v vnreasonably admitte yet maye therfore styre vp commotion sedition euery man pacte punishe malefactours appertayneth vnto whome geuen right power sworde scripture planely teacheth againe onely lawes wrytten also lawe nature printed mennes myndes sheweth man ought iudge owne cause faulty blinded loue oure selues neither denied tumult sedition priuate reuengement take vpo determination matter iniuries thinke done vnto seke reuege aucthoriti god lawe lawe nature finally equitie iustice seing meanes able defend fact haue commaundemet god concerning doinges necessitie must declared notable myracle taketh place christe spake see manifestly rebuked others consider wyekednes owne cause magistrate doeth naught doe muche worse whiche blind cause contempnyng god commaundement doe entre man iurisdiction whiche leaue vnto magistrate nothing remayneth whan haue taken waye power authoritie hygher power take goodes possession doe wrong take away iurisdiction whiche thynge consisteth state magistrate wherin co sisteth state body goodes nowe whether wicked taketh parte goodes spareth lyfe taketh lyfe goodes also waye well sayde shalbe founde wicked desyre lyfe goodes wyll saye let hym beleue lyst wyl taketh awaye chiefest thyng wyll afrayde take rest also whiche dependeth vpon let saye let enioye goodes lyfe safitie whiche haue done already exceadeth measure whan takyng authoritie wyll lordes ruler selues waye youre selues beseche case enterpryse magistrate necessary seune worlde commended take place place iudgement magistrate eche man myght vse thought good wold followe therof robbyng murtherynge one sone one shall thynke hym selfe haue receyued wrong another wyll couet reuenge hym selfe pleasure whiche amysse suffered man muche lesse permytted vnlawfull assemblye maye suffered also borne others say assemblye cause requyre euery man woulde pryuatlye auenge owne cause tell woulde doe doubtlesse constrayned stand publique iudgement appoynted thyng doth excuse contempne lawes iudgementes reiecte magistrate god hym selfe hath appoynted ouer lawe wherof speake nowe impryuted men harte law nature aloweth magistrate obserued also moste barbarous people el ther wonderfull confusion thynges whiche lawe beit obserue neuer dilygently yet shoulde nothynge better turkes suche lyke people knowe religion ruled lawe magistrate maketh man good christian necessitie byndeth maugre heades wherfore seing breake lawe whiche ingryft mynde common men ye great deale worse heathen people farre vnworthy name christian whiche tytle doe vsurpe selues doe iniury goddes name beynge worthy deede called turkes breakyng lawe nature howe shall stande face christe tyme shal iudge v al see therfore agayne agayne maner men preacher feare lest blouddy butcher crept amonges whiche perswade sermon intet may ayde beare rule reigne carclesse saluation god comaundeth vengeaunce lefte vnto scripture teacheth v obeye magistrate though frowarde ought therfore obedient otherwyse shall reyse comotion dede shall lyght owne neckes god wil permytte youre lycencious outrage vnpunyshed whylest seke lybertie shall procure selfe losse lyfe goodes soule also wrath god kyndled agaynst deuyll ennemye almens saluations hath sent felloweshyp false teacher followyng therfore counsell beware amende tyme nowe wyll speake christian lawe lawe gospell christia lawe muche chalenge selues surname mete shold tryed knowen lawe behalf first christ comaundeth v resist harme stryken one cheke offer also hym taketh awaye coote byddeth delyuer also cloke commaundeth v praye doe enemyes math sense also many place scripture nowe consyder howe enterpryse agreeth christes commaundement see howe farre youre doctours haue lead astraye parte christian suffer beare crosse resyste reuenge stryke sworde lyke thyng appeareth profession christian man exceadynge harde verye christe profession harde fewe doe perfourme deede whiche bounden make thyng playne shal bring example lawe peter defende lorde maister stroke byshoppes seruaunt iuste cause seynge dyd onlye seke lyfe christe take waye also dissciples doctryne gospell wherin consisted saluation suche lyke cruell iniury hath yet touched sayde christe commaunded peter cease fro defence geuing sore sentence stryke sworde saye whiche concempning magistrate auenge owne cause dyd nayled crosse prohibyted execute office committed vnto hym god father uerely toke nature veritie paciently committyng whole matter god father vnto whome maketh intercession persecutor steppe must folowed el must leaue laye asyde goodlye name tytle christianytie case woulde followe example christ power god would appeare moste vnworthie death onlye sonne set forth gospel farre nere wyll aduersaries would vndoubtedly loke vpon also send holsome doctrine aboundantly consydering matter attempted force armes shall neyther obtayne purpose escape daye battell wyl speake suwhat also whole worlde force myght yet greater theyr violence better successe doctryne vsed force styred vp commotion desyrous vengeaunce obeyed ciuyle magistrate reuerece wrote commendation set hym forth muche lay whiche pryncipall committyng cause goddes handes rested wholy protection thus haue bene preserued vnto daye though byshop rome al reste stampe stare haue decayed kyngdome force armes could haue done doctryne spread ouer sondrye nation rushe forth headlong vnaduisedly whylest thynke thynge consyder howe muche hynder wherfore quarell must set aparte name tytle christias though neuer iuste yet muche christen man maye fyght resiste iniury maye wyse graunte tytle surname yet speake defende pourge magistrate confesse doe many thynges vniustly notwithstandyng doynges farre profession christianitie muche case wyll obstinatly kepe styll name colour shaddowe euell cause protest ennemie vnder pretence gospel ye doe clean contrary christes doctrine therfor wyll pray vnto god wyll mercyfully loke vpon subuerte enterpryse perceyne euydently deuill goeth asmuche coulde hytherto oppresse byshop rome destroye bloudy preacher wherfore wyll praye notwithstandyng craftes deuill oppresse gospel leuer would demeane youre selues nede make prayer al synner yet hauing iust cause pray doubt praier shalbe heard god wyll haue name sanctified hath commaunded also praye wherfore exhorte beseche despise prayer others lest ye fele vtter vndoing bryng passe haue prayer suche lyke faythe affiaunce scripture gylty conscience doe declare proceadynges prophane vngodly praye howe many haue prayed vnto god cause suppose one put whole truste affiaunce great armie assure selfe muche doe youre atattemptes last wyll tourne owne destruction nowe concernyng demaundes easely answered aunswere demaundes bower whiche though grounded vpon equitie agreable lawe nature yet touchyng theyr pryncipall parte stande vpryghte wyll extorte vyolence hygher power whyche agaynst lawe equitie agayne deuysed good man place scripture whiche alledgeth incense brynge daunger reciteth wholy truly loke better vpon make nothing al brauery may kept gospell gospell taken restrained one place may repare wher frely preached place maye kepte force must forsake flee another christe hym selfe hathe taught v firste demaunde ordeynyng minister amysse done dewe order landes possession fynde mynister geuen magistrate lawefull people gyue whome lyst first muste magistrate howe minister shoulde ordayned required place one whiche refuse shal people chuse one maintaine charge magistrate wil suffer let minister chosen people flee lyst done otherwyse wt wrong mischief tenthes vnreasonable tithe must payde thing tha take away al rule power must liberal man nowe ye vse matter al authoritie hades wherby easely perceiued intent purpose wold haue christianitie taketh away bodage men free abraha holy bondman reade paul shall instructe touchynge bondemen wherfore request full violence robberye striueth gospell seruaunt may neuerthelesse deuoute vse bondage let christen libertie christian lybertie well sycke kepte pryson shoote al marke haue equalle one state condition whiche fonde absurde ciuile lyfe gouernment publyque wealth endure vnlesse difference persones theremaye free bounde rule obeye rest concerning wylde beates wooddes water pasture paymentes money suche lyke leaue disputed lawyer touche dutie whiche instructe myndes men godlynesse nowe ye men brother mynde counsell luters office whiche desyred knowe nowe shall partes muche saye ye wyll obeye testimony scrypture hearken vnto soone shall comme handes make outcrye though flattered magistrate taught ryghtly ponder whole matter waye reason dylygentlye certenly cause owne aboue althinges ware preacher pricke forwarde knowe sorte men ryght well leade head longe daungers myght get preferment ryches peryll cause luther doeth muche caste tethe false false title bower tytle bragged lettres wrote prouoke allure others felloweshyppe made boaste toke armure vppon god commaundement certen loue zeale common wealth intent doctrine gospell myght set forth augmented mayntayned truthe equitie honest lyuyng myght reingne floryshe myght prouyde hereafter oppressed violence whan thei thus fewe woordes declared cause enterpryse woulde commaunde neighbour put armure come vnto immediatly helpe would threaten come vpon withall power tyme luter thus aunswered commotioners admonyshyng also prince nobilitie wrytynge sayeth vnto trouble busynes daye altogether longe chieflye beareth tytle churche whiche cease yet daye preachynge persecute doctrine gospel conscience secondarely prynces cyuyl magistrate beyng wholly addicted exacte gather vp money care meanes poore people longer hable beare burthen al mainteyne ryot pryde voluptuousnes wherfore hangeth assuredly wounderfull daunger ouer sworde dependynge ouer neckes twhyne threde yet meane tyme carelesse though man hable displace securitie wyll doubtles hurte one daye god powreth tyme indignation vpon prynces read psalmes haue oftentymes admonyshed beware therof warning wyll serue wherfore god whrath wil fall upo head psal vnlesse amende lyues signes wounders seene place doe pretende good maye easely coniecture god anger boyleth v permitteth false doctours muche estemed amongst v intent beinge lead errours darkenes myght plaged worthely moreouer rebellion people whiche wyll vtterlly destroye germany vnlesse god moued wt prayer send remedy gouernment daye suche sorte men neyther wyl nother ought dede suffer longer must cleane altered gyue place vnto goddes worde people bryng passe tyme others shal succede albeit kyl vp yet god wil reise new worketh warreth seketh plage wickednes dyuers haue made boaste would spende al goodes lades haue vpon condicion luther doctrine myght cleane taken away thing brought effect god forbydde ieste weyghty matter iewes tymes paste sayde kyng last state common wealth came vnto passe want kyng euer many content former faultes woorke newe iniury gospell affirmyng hurly burlye fruicte spryngeth doctrine well go rayle styll hardely wyll knowe doctrine vnderstand voyce gospell gospel sclasidered rebellio whiche signe obstinate malicious minde haue euer beginnyng taught quietly haue abhorred sedicion haue earnestly exhorteth people obediet hygher power nay rather haue admonyshed beare tyranny wicked gouernment hereof selues beare witnes therfore hath sedition proceaded rasers tumultes bloudy prophetes lesse ennemies haue brought mischief seducing people haue ben thre yeares man hath resisted muche alone god hath synne permitted satha bluddy prophet styrre vp rage fury people shall lye let appease storme say pray faulte layde gospell whan doctrine whiche professe hath borne crueltie hitherto also prayed vnto god hath commended authoritie state people maynteined high commendacion coueted nowe auenge iniuries haue done myght laughe slyue loker cruel tragedy assist furious people common saiyng increase flamme oyle sharpe nayle sore wherfore noble prince require earnestly despyse myne admonition set lyght sediton feare left shoulde able destroye would dreade ire god fearfull vnto intede plage worthely whiche thynge feare shall escape daunger although power ennemies neuer small therfore place yet remayne counsell pray gyue place vnto fury appease matter wittely much end vncerten part wyse man god wyll vnknowen shall mete firste trie alwayes take hede flamme kyndled shall set germany fyre certainly offence wherewith haue styrred god wrath agaist v manifest ought afrayde euery lyttle sturre muche whan great number ennemies assembled offer battell lenytie gentlenes tourne losse yet wyll restore aduauntage go force shal peraduenture great hasarde may preuayle meanes wyll venter great daunger requestes twelue wherof agreable reason equitie maye haue good cause ashamed demaude first minister churche may ordeyned lawfully suche preache god worde albeit haue respect herein owne priuate commoditie asmuche would pay hym stipende men tythes yet reason shold denied lawefull magistrate keepe people doctrine gospell others concerne seruices droictes lyke thinges grounded also vpon reason parte dutie magist magistrate vexe orpille people rather maynteine preserue wealth substaunce ende pillage howe continue certainly ye ought leaue exaction refraine prodigalitie riot poore maye haue thyng releue great mysery thus admonyshed eyther parte seuerally wryteth epistle common muche eyther partie maynteyneth euyll quarel aduyseth laye downe weapon put arbitrement declaryng vnto magistrate howe cruell euer howe bloudy ende tyrauntes hath ben agayne people vnfortunate myserable hath bene successe wyndyng vp ende tyranny commotioners whiche haue taken armure standen defence hyghe power one thynge lamenteth exceadyng seing warre eyther syde euyll conscience prince establyshe tyranny others sediciously accomplyshe wycked desyre lose owne soules many peryshe warre bewaileth state germany ciuile warre vtterly destroyed begyn warre easy matter wel ende wolde admonysheth therfore absteyne leaue poste ritie state common wealth full trouble bloudshed force armes nothing done continewe amendemet lyfe much exhorteth committe whole matter hearyng determening certayn good chosen purpose prince would remitte somewhat ryght people againe followe good cousell leaue demaundes aduise counsell whiche vnlesse woulde folowe would gyue lokyng eyther syde vnlawfull seyng people moue warre agaynst prynces oppressours wealth ryches prince agayne people theues murtherers also iniury vnto name christ ther obstinate fiercenes wyll praye vnto god eyther would shewe waye accorde el subuerte counsell enterpryses howe wonder feareth wrath god shall mitigated tyme declared ieremy wrath displeasure aswaged instaunt prayer moste holy men woulde plage iewyshe nation wherefore would wyshe nothyng would amende serue god feare tremblyng daniel ob lest wyse plage hangyng ouer v myghte differred aswaged whylest endeuoured thus appease tumulte yt franckony indiuers place marchynge forewarde sodainly warred papistes nobilitie luther bloweth tro pet boures also muche mischief wed luther wrytyng exhorteth men would come destroye wycked theues paracides lyke case woulde come quenche commen fyre haue moste shamefully broken fayth prince taken men goodes force cloke al abomination wickednes couer christianitie vylest moste vnworthiest thing imagined hath confuted reason rehersed byddeth prince doubte feare set vpon destroye seditious ther nothig worse sedicio rabble apertayneth chiefly dutie also euery pryuate may kylle seditious persone meanes pestilent thyng publique wealth sedition long protested obstinate reformed testimony scrypture coulde instructe better thynges durst bolde condempne nowe sythe thinge selfe declareth dyd nothyng dissemble must also chaunge style therfore ryngeth larme admonysheth men set vpon destroye many wylde beastes booke dyd many discommende place earnest lut vehement cruell aunswereth defence therof maintaining opinio none ought pardoned whiche co strayned others haue done thynge sediciously sauynge whiche beyng one admonyshed content rendre yelde selues tolde howe emperour letter theperors letter prince germany sent spayne inhibite assemblye empyre shoulde haue bene laste yeare nouembre spyres nowe hearyng trouble state germany great preparation turke made inuade hongary sent letter agayne toleto appoynting counsell whole empire auspurge begynne first daye october cause aboue assemble called auf mentioned chiefly ayde agaynst great turke sygnifyinge case present hym self wyll appoint others supplye place whiche letter beyng wrytten xxiiij may delyuered germany tyll xiij august wherfore aduyse ferdinando others differred tyl saint martyns daye xj nouembre suche dwelt farre might prepare selues come dew reason carolostadius dissenting fro luther therfore departing wittenberge mentioned kept familiaritie secrete teacher fayned themselues see vision haue talke god whiche cause duke saxony banyshed hym countrey set forth bookes luther fellowes callyng carolostadius writeth lu newe flatterer romyshe byshop suche taught amysse concernyng masse confession synnes image thinges wordes christ body interpreted thus sytteth body rayleth duke exylyng hym layde blame luther whereunto luther aunswered large defendyng opinion affirmed cause iust wherfore prince banyshed sedition opressed army commoner discofited many executed dayly al place carolostadius beyng afrayde parte copyleth booke wherin pourgeth selfe ryght dilygentlye affirmynge carolostadius maketh porgatio doe vnto hym great iniurye reporte hym one author seditio writig letter luther desyreth hym earnestly set forth booke defende innocensie vniustly condempned neuer come aunswere luther wryting epistle dissented much hym yet asmuche distresse fleeth vnto hym sucour sayeth would disceyue expectacion herein considering chiefly dewtye christenman wherfore desyreth magistrate others generall muche vtterlye denyeth thyng layde charge refuseth come answere lawful iudge might grau ted whiche standeth equitie iustice carolostadius sendeth luther boke wherin protesteth suche thinges wrote lordes supper defyne determine thing way disputatio searche truth luther admitteth excuse warneth al men beware opinion much doubtful selfe el thei doubt lyke case suspende iudgement tyl tyme certenly knowe beleue therin thynges must beleue ought doubte wauer certen rather faith ought vauer forsake opinion refuse dye thousand tymes dayes luther maried nunne wherby gaue occasion aduersaries speake euyll hym sayd playnly luther maried nune madde became seruaunt deuill tyme zwynglius minister congregation zurick agreing luther thynges dissented touching lordes supper wordes christ body luther vnderstode barely symply texte letter admitting none interpretation affirming bodye bloude christe verely bread wyne receyued mouthe also zuinglius taketh trope fygure many others mo found scripture expoudeth wordes thus signifieth body wherunto subscribed oecolampadius preacher basill interpretyng thus signe body matter hadled eyther syde much contention wryting saxos held ye opinio luther zwicers zwynglius followed others expoud otherwise agreed opinion body blud christ receiued spiritnally corporally ye mouth wt hart cotention endured space iii year last meanes lantgraue luther zwynglius met marpurge came comunication marburg hereafter shal also cousel thempire appointed litle auspurg came thither reason tumultes germany proroged first may next yeare folowyng time ferdinando put hope emperour would self place appointed spyres neuerthelesse decreed yt meane tyme preacher expound scripture people mindes doctours whiche churche receiued teache sediciously god name may gloryfied quietnes maintained whilest fraunces french kyng prisoner spayne ale mother gouernment kepe byshop rome signified vnto letter messagers zeale affection bare towardes churche rome wherupon elemet seuenth writing court parliament pope letter paris paris signifieth vnderstode certen heresy began spring vp fraunce auncient faith religion haue wittely forseing thing chosen certen men punishe offendours whiche thing confirmeth also authoritie wyllyng diligent herein god glory also welth realme many faire wordes exhortation perseuer letter dated rome xx day may deliuered senate paris xvij daye iune moreouer kinges absence diuines paris faber driue paris euill entreated iames faber stapulles hathe written dyuers workes philosophie diuinitie droue hym fraunce wherof kyng certified lettres sister margaret loued faber vertue writeth senate paris behalfe geuyng godlye testimony learnyng vertue much estimation amonges italian spanyardes wherfore wileth surcease let action falle till retourne pleasure knowen beyng assured euyl wyll commenced hym doctours serbone matter heard commyng home letter dated madricea town spayn kynges letter faber xij nouembre delyuered paris xxviij moneth thyng geuen deuines tymes paste rayle vpon learned men cause sawe ignoraunce dispised yeare state common wealth altered lande pruse vttermost prouince germany bordering shall repete matter beginninge empyre henry syxth sonne frederick barbarosse tyme christian warred recouer hierusalem instituted order knyghtes germany whiche fought religio weare whyte crosse garmets badge profession yeare lorde c foure score story pruse ten first maister order chosen reported campe cytie ptolomais wardes dyd subdue pruse lande frederick second emperour kept warres long tyme kynges polande beyng vanquyshed battell became subiect geuyng fidelitie othe casunire kyng pole father sigismund first maister marque albert brandeburg thritty thre albert chosen yeare lorde mdxi kept great warres two yeares together sigismunde kyng polle yeare mdxxi trewce take iiij yeares tyme albert sued oft emperour state empyre ayde commyng councell nurrenberg wherof haue ofte tymes spoken place amonges prynce empyre cause warre wold sworue kyng tyme emperour empeched frenche warres turke inuaded hongary germany tourmoyled sedition communaltie ayde looked thence tyme trewce expyred maketh peace kyng pole geuyng hym faythe suprome magistrate receyue doctrine gospell alteryng order taketh pruse maister kynges assente called duke pruse shortly maried dorothe daughter frederick kyng denmarke foundeth vniuersitie conningsberge called kynges mount wherby displeasure order al kept countrey supported kyng pole yet common assent chosen rowme walther cronberge shold represent aunciet name dignitie assembly complayned vpon hym greuously againe defended cause wrytyng declaryng howe dryuen extreme necessitie beinge vtterly forsaken empyre submytte hym selfe vnto kyng epistle leo tenth sigismunde alberte exhorting vnto concord eyther committe matter legate whiche wold sende counsell laterane moste conuenient cotrouersies prince shold decided determined generall counselles syxthe booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale empire charles fyfte argument syxth booke luther wrote kyng england duke george thei reiected christerne kyng demarke moued luther sycknes frenche king duryng imprysonment hasted treaty madrice king deliuered two sonnes geuen pledge whylest estate assembled spyres aboute matter religion turke entreth hongarry disputation hoioen baden swycherlande pope element frenche kynge make league emperour kyng complayne sore one rome sacked duke burbon frenche kyng sendeth lawtrecke italy secte anabaptistes beginneth disputation kept berne reformation contention betwyxt ferdinando uayuode paccius beheaded andwarpe emperour frenche kyng offer selues combat masse abolished strasburge trouble basyll relygion ca ous papistes make league ferdinando assembly holden spyres name protestauntes hath begynning ciuile warre emonges swychers treate peace cambray uienna beseged turke sweatyng sycknes protestantes make league haue heard heretofore howe kynge englande wrote agaynst luther luther lut letter submissio kynge england agaynst hym hearde certen thynges sounded muche kynges co mendation delighted reporte writeth hym great submission doubting sore offended hyghnes setting forth booke neuerthelesse dyd muche accorde instigation others bolde trouble hym hys letter present proceadeth prynclyke humanitie whiche hyghly commended manye moreouer vnderstandeth howe bookes set forthe agaynst hym hys owne doynge wrytten certen sophisters whiche full craftely tooke occasion speakynge occasion cardinall yorke calleth hym plage englande heareth moreouer great comforte howe grace mislyketh naughtye sorte men gyueth mynde knowledge truthe wherfore besecheth hym pardon hym one facte woulde please hym remembre syns man mortall ought beare ennemytie immortall shal commaunde wyl confesse faulte openly commende pryncelike vertues worke exhorteth maiestie gyue eare sklaunderous tale reporte heretyke chief point doctrine al chief point lu doctrine must saued fayth christ whiche bare punyshement synnes necke shoulder al body dyed v rose agayne reigneth father euer doctrine prophetes apostle foundatio one layde teacheth dewty charitie one ought howe must obey magistrate applye whole lyfe profession gospel anye errour wyckednes doctrine aduersaries shewe hym condepne banyshe beyng neyther examined conuicted writeth byshop rome adherentes doeth teache contrary christ apostle owne ende papistes doctrine gayne lucre intent may comaunde men lyue lyke glutton voluptuousnes vnto ende tende denises doinges whiche thing well tryed knowen selues deny case wold amende liues leade idle beastly lyfe losse iniury manye stryfe myght sone quieted diuers prynces city germany haue embraced doctrine acknowledging reuerently god benefite woulde gladlye wyshe myght also accopted nombre emperour certen others attempte thynges agaynsthym newes dauid hathe prophecied longe synce kynges people conspire imagine many thynges agaynst lorde annoynted reiectyng lawes commaundementes considereth suche place scripture maruayleth anye prynce fauour doctrine gospell fynally requyreth hym may receyue gentle aunswere longe wryteth also george duke saxony signifyinge howe god hath accustomed beginning chastise seuerely sharpely luth letter george dake saxon getly louigly embrace aterrour feare iewes wha gaue law moses preachig gospel shewed great ioye gladnes hath followeth maner hadling ouer roughly euen one yet since hath writte thingesful fruite co solatio wherby easy se yt taketh al payn profit others euil zeale beareth truth duke george hateth gospel heareth yt relenteth nothing displeasure beareth hym increaseth malice daily cause whye nowe wryteth vnto hym desyryng surcease persecute doctrine whiche consonaunt writinges prophetes apostle admonysheth also haue respect basenes persone matter god almighty al men fret fume therat yet shall doctrine continue euer therfore greueth muche offended may wise forsake yet seketh gratisie desyreth forgeuen hath spoken thing sharpely wil agayne craue pardon god hath persecuted gospel doubteth shal obtein leaue time seke extin gwishe great lyght gospel appereth nowe vnto al worlde procede pray god helpe doubteth prayer shalbe heard whiche taketh stro ger craftes deuyll alwayes refuge moste assured defence whan kyng englande receiued luther letter made sharpe aunswer defendeth boke whiche sayeth well accepted diuers good well learned men hathe rayled reuerend father cardynall yorke marueyleth nothing therat abstayne fro contumely men sainctes sayth cardinall necessarye instrument hym whole realme hath loued hym dearelye well nowe wyll set hym ten tymes consyderyng myslyketh hym amoges thinges doeth forsee great dylygence none leprosye contagion heresye infecte parte realme casteth teeth incestuouse marryage whiche thomas wulley cardinal butcher sonne vyce moste detestable cardinalles name thomas wulsey buchers sonne ipswyche hyghe authoritie wyth hys prynce lykewyse duke george made luther suche aunswere man myght well perceyue mortall hatred bare hym ambassadours fraunce whiche sent spayne peace amonges whome margaret frenche kynges syster wydowe could brynge nothyng passe ale mother whiche gouernaunce ayde defence founde meanes bryng league amitie henry kynge englande whiche done moneth auguste league betwene englad frauce fyrst chiefest poynt league violens turkes pestiferous secte luther dryuen kept lesse daungerous turkes cardinal england whiche might al ye tyme thought haue perswaded ye king vnto league bare ye emperour great good wil yt toke haue bene thonly let yt chose bishop rome death adria dede certe theperours haue expressed writinges whan luther red kyng englandes aunswere printe sawe ascribeth vnconstancie though chaunged opinion considering concerne owne priuate iniurie professio gospel toke matter heuely gratifie frendes made humble submission lyke maner intreated getly word writing christerne kyng denmarck wold receiue pure doctrine trusting haue preuayled gentlenes nowe perceiued farre abuse lyke thinge happened vnto cardinal caietane george duke saxonie erasmus roterdame vnto whome hath written frendly request others hath obtayned therby nothynge el made fierce cruell fondely done thinke coulde haue foude godlines courtes prince sought christ wher godlines sought court sathan ruleth loketh john baptist amonges clothed purple wherfore seing preuaile gentle fredly kinde writing wil take order fro henceforth frenche kyng treaty peace toke place great thought pensiuenes fel syck comforted gentle talke emperour bad good chere began somewhat better emperour also waying hym selfe pray lose thyng chaunced vnto wise wel inclyned mynde peace daylye wherfore xiiii daye january concluded thynges madrice whiche wryting emonges thynges recited peace madrice emperour kyng haue respect chiefly ennemies christian religion heresy luther secte extyrped peace concluded shall set ordre common welth moue warre turkes heretikes communion churche verye nedefull byshop rome hath often warned bene hande applye thing diligently wherfore rather satissye request determyned entreate hym would appoynte certaine daye place conuenient ambassadours prynces assemble hauyng ful power authoritie agree vpon suche thynges shalbe good requisite well turky warres also wedyng heretikes peace makyng elenor ye emperours syster lady elenor bene maryed emanuell kyng portugall beyng espoused frenche kynge emperour promyseth gyue hym dowery two thousand ducates certen landes high burgundy controuersie kynge shall within two monethes retourned home restore emperour duckdome burgundy whiche kynges fraunce haue kepte possession syns death charles duke burgundye space fyftie yeares moreouer shall renounce naples millan gene aste flaunders shall gyue ayde henry kyng nauarre charles duke gelders ulryche duke wirteberg robert erle marche shall attempte secrete deuises counsel italy emperour wyll go italy sea shall assiste nauie sixtene galleis vitayled fournyshed thynges sauing soldiours also two hudreth thousand crownes arme yerely pension emperour bounden paye kynge englande shall frenche kynge paye kynge englande shall restore charles duke burbon fellowes ryght landes goodes permittyng vse dwellyng lyste suche action title duke burbon hath prouince marseille kyng shall abyde ordre lawe tyme gyuen emperour fayth obserue condition set lybertie retourne home departyng border spayn leaueth behind two sonnes frauces kynges sonnes pledge henry verey yonge pledge agreed vpo vnlesse obserue couenauntes promyseth yelde hym self prysoner agayn prince germany assemble spire told last boke appointed emonges whome duke counsell spyres iohn electour saxony philip lantgrane hesse emperour deputes ferdinando brother barnarde byshop ttent casimire marque brandenburge philip marque baden william duke bauarre ericus duke brunswyck begunne counsell xxv daye june declared cause assemblye added moreouer emperour aboue thynges wylled commaunded state empyre shoulde common assent take order howe christian religion auncient custome church log tyme obserued might still reteyned former estimation al men punyshed attempt contrary also resisted make force matter intent cesars decre made wormes publyshed fyue yeres syns decre assembly also may obserued al men put execution certen chosen degree treate matter emonges also lantgraue iames sturmius straisborourgh cressus norinberge emperours deputes call assembly state iii daye august saye vnderstande haue chosen certayne nombre conferre matter propounded suppose wyll first consulte religion intent emperours pleasure may accomplyshed intreate nothing determine losse time lette hynderaunce matter therfore wyll let vnderstande emperours commaundement behalf read emperours letter dated hispale xxiii marche wherof howe intended emperours letter go rome inuested also treate byshop generall counsell meane tyme wylleth commaundeth state assemblye decree nothynge shall anye wyse agaynst olde custome lawes ceremony church theri dommions establyshe thinges according decre made wormes common assentes take well worth delay tyll haue deuised hyghe byshop concernyng generall counsell whiche shalbe shortly priuate assembly good done also errours licenciouse lybertie people cofirmed turke inuadeth hu gary tyme emperour turkes settyng foreward armie fro belgrade whe passed ouer riuers danubie saue marched ryght way hongary wherfore king lewys sendyng agayne ambassadours spyres requyreth ayde league betwene venetian pope fre che kyng italy came certen newes clement byshop rome venetian hadde made legue frenche kyng lately retourned home spayne warre vpon emperour shall heare afterwarde whan emperours letter mentioned read assemblie cyties moste parte namely hygh germany put vp aduise writing declaring desyred meanes obey gratifies emperour nowithstanding controuersie religion encreaseth dayly especially touchyng ceremony men tradition hitherto decre wormes could well obserued feare sedition vprores nowe daunger muche laste assemblye legate rome also wel declared much emperour selfe present infourmed state thinges could iudge none otherwyse maketh promyse letter counsell tyme wrytten byshop frendes nowe farre otherwyse seynge byshop hath altered mynde leuied armie hym wherfore synke heades trouble tyme haue generall counsell wherfore thynke beste sende ambassadours emperour whiche maye informe hym whole matter state germany howe daungerous matter also delay cause relygion longer lesse perilous put vre decree wormes therfore entreate hym auoydynge inconueniencie would permitte holde counsell prouinciall germany treate matter controuersie whiche thyng agreed vpon norenberg place appoynted citie many state made preparation agayne defeated emperours countremaundemet opened waye rebellion sedition ciuile warres al thinges myght easelye haue bene eschewed case tyme cause relygion bene heard indifferently wyll allowe counsell germany entreate differre execution decree wormes vntyll generall councell otherwyse wyll come passe wounde newly healed wyll waxe rawe agayne another shalbe worse breake furthermore discorde long euery man carefull owne estate wylbe harde paynefull collecte money ayde others besydes wrytinge exhibited prynces fourthe daye august put vp also wherin pouertie coplayned city townes ouermuche burthened wyth beggyng freres whiche helpe vnto susteyn false freers life preueted caught vp often tymes also came handes throughe flattrye great landes legacy losse hynderaunce many wherfore deuyse suffered make anye moo freres dead permytte wyll take kynde lyfe vpon depart cloyster annuall stypende rest geuen poore men boxe moreouer thynke reason clergie frelye exempted al charge paymetes priuilege grau ted tymes past lyberalitie kynges prynces yet tyme fewe nombre small lyuynges nowe many growen welth consyderation cause inunitie beyng taken away benefite also employed taketh place longer enioye benefytes commodity muche nober holy day men whiche tribute custome mony payde agayne haue ouermany holye dayes whiche hynder people sore wherunto bounden vnder great penaltie leaue necessary workes vndone also idle day offende god diuerse wayes thynke also mete abolish lawe made choyse meates leaue vnto men owne ceremony tyll counsell wyse stoppe course euagelical doctrine byshoppes vnderstode emperours pleasure woulde proceade matter religion thought great dissention bet wyxte byshop hym deferre thynge tyll better oportunitie serued arose great stryfe among men chosen whiche contrary relygion duke saxon lantgraue consultation layde asyde ment go home commaunded company make ready take iournaye seyng ferdinando archebyshop treers others consyderynge daunger peryllous tyme yf shoulde thus breakynge displeasure conclude vppon nothynge departe wyth grudge malyce founde meane salue wounde wherof commotion yere dissention euer nowe germany sprange vp altogether controuersye relygion thoughte good remedye thynge tyme wherfore appease certen men myndes laste made decree religion decre establyshynge religion mayntenaunce common peace tranquilitie necessarye haue lawfull counsell eyther prouinciall generall begyn within yeare furthest entent shall let delaye sende ambassadours emperour entreate hym woulde consyder myserable troublesome state empyre repayre shortly germany holde counsell touchyng decree made wormes thei contented untyll counsell begonne men shoulde demeane selues prouinces woulde yelde accompte theyr doynges bothe god emperour decree made duke saxon lantgraue enter talke ambassadours strausborough norenberge auspurge begynninge protestates league whiche sawe fauoured gospell concernynge league muche knewe byshoppes theyr adherententes intended fortuned anye stande daunger relygion one myght helpe muche good opinion frankeforth ulmes woulde refuse breake wyth also matter ambassadours make aunswere commission touchynge anye suche matter neuerthelesse would wryte home ryght diligently duke saxon preacher george spalatine iohn islebie lantgraue also residewe prince requested might preache feare sturre vayne fardinando also calling ambassadours city accomting vnto benefites auncesters house austriche exhorted obediet emperour caried away counsell perswasion others decreed also sende ayde kynge hungary tyme assemblye finished ende kynge hungary slayne august turke entred hungarye vanquyshed kynge lewis battell also slayne chase assemblye prynces electours sauinge onlye marque brandenburg emperour sommer maried isabell emperour maried wyfe daughter emanuell kyng portugall syster iohn whiche succeded father tyme assemblye spyres thetwelue townes neluetians swycers kept disputatio badene thether came chiefest diuines byshop rome disputatio baden syde faber eckius murmer byshop constance basill courtes losanna sent thither ambassadours theames set vp whiche eckius defendeth ryght boldely body bloud christe present lordes supper trewe oblation quicke dead vyrgin mary saynctes must prayde vnto intercessours image ought taken downe lyfe fire purgatory oecolampadius others impugne zwynglius absent letter heluetians declared cause absence confuted opinion eckius writing zwynglius dred bad measure suspecting bothe men place concluded thus men perseuer religion haue obserued hytherto receyue newe doctryne followe authoritie counsell byshop constaunce priest burnt litle caused one iohn huglie priest brent merspurge woulde allowe byshops rome doctrine thinges lewys king hongary thus myserably slayne ferdinando contended kyngdome discorde hongary dewe vnto hym certen composition aduersarye iohn sepuse vayuode transsyluania whiche dissentio nobilitie state deuided arose warre right noysome hurtfull germanes nation dwelled nere afterwardes emperour turkes receyuing uayuode fayth protection established hym kyng tributarye client buda delyuered vp handes frenche kyng whiche retourned home leauing child freche league agaist emper pledge spayne sayde conditios peace vnreasonable wherfore sendyng ambassadours fro byshop rome uenetians enter league hym effect wherof defence quietnes italy shall fynde armye xxx thousand fotemen men armes lyghthorse men syxe thousande shall also prouide nauie two thirtye galley shippes bourthen tyme shall haue vanquyshed enemy lumbardye italye shall muade kingdome nayles sea lande beyng one wone remayne power churche rome yet lxxv thousande duckates payde yerely frenche kyng claymeth tytle dignitie house medicees maynteyned citie florence frenche kyng leaueth duckdome myllan fraunces sfortia whome emperours men besegyng castell millan constrayned rendre promiseth owne ayde swycers helpe hym also wyfe fraunce bloud royall yet vpon condition shal paye vnto therfore yeare fyfty thousande crownes fynde brother maximilian whiche prysoner fraunce byshop rome pope benefites emper wrytyng letter emperour recyteth benofites towards hym goodly offer refused frenche kynges handes sake howe kynge taken gaue hondreth thousande duckates captaynes vpon certayne conditios hath vttered vnto hym oftentymes cousels enemy time men dyd besege france sfortia castel millan certen men great power moued hym ioyne league hym would heare whiche thynges full euyll recompensed souldiours haue wrought suche iniuries shame mysery hym churche rome hathe bene hearde moreouer neyther condicions fulfylled money restored appeareth good wyll beareth hym whiche woulde make hym prinie vpon condition concluded frenche kynge vtterly reiected suite intercession made sfortia howe sent duke burbon fro siege marseille reyse vp newe kynde warre italye whiche cause necessitie constrayned make league suche loue quiet wealth italy wherfore wyl also content embrace peace well good shal wat force power defende italy common wealth rome league comprysed kyng england great promyses desyred protectour therof unto epystle cesar aunsweryng granato xviii september reaccompteth emperours aswer desertes benefites done vnto hym howe sute meanes made byshop rome howe tyme gaue hym yerely pension ten thousande duckates reuenewes archebyshop toledo legate byshop leo notwithstandyng conspyred hym albert prince carpes haue dispossessed hym naples sicily frenche men dryuen italy conducte bourbon could deny myght warre frauce el recouer frenche kyng owne graunteth kyngdome naples holden hym withstandynge kyngdo naples case sayeth make warre shoulde thereby lose right tytle euen cause cliente loseth benefite graunted selfe also doth patrone point yt lawe lose prerogatiue kyng taken entreated peace intent might haue inioyed dukedome millan therfore uenetians florentine withdrewe ayde motion captaynes league frenche kyng confesseth openly howe throughe prouocation entred newe league went spayne knowe certayne reporte haue dispensed othe wherby bounden furthermore haue moued warre letter wherein proclaymed vnto deliuered seking dryue italy also depose dignitie empyre able proue letter ferdinando daualle marque pistare whome would haue entysed league promising hym kyngdome naples haue tytle millan mo wayes one yet quiet italye suffered sfortia enioye whan greuously syck would haue placed steade duke bourbon sawe pleased well dyuers others italy cause sfortia besieged castel millan committed treason ioynyng league wherof beyng detected would delyuer captaynes castelles cremone millan neyther make pourgation come talke matter request forgyue hym altogether whiche neyther coulde deede ought doe lest euyll example shoulde gyue occasio vnto clientes offende patrones touchyng peace concluded frenche kyng kept nothing secret ambassadours condicions suche would haue concealed tende publique peace resistauce christes ennemies se vnworthines yt thing ther commeth money yearely rome realmes prouinces doth nation proued requestes prynces germany tyme complaynyng greuously court rome desyred reformation whose coplaint rome treasure house yt whole worlde tyme neglected zeale bare churche rome whiche thynge considered muche haue geuen none occasion offence instantly requyre lay army wyll doe lykewyse seynge bothe appoynted god two great lyghtes let v endeuour selues pope emper two gret lyghtes whole worlde maye lyghtened v reason dissention aryse eclypse let v regarde publique weale attempt dryue turkes quenche secte errours luther appertayneth vnto god glorye hereof ought begynne debate controuersies shall haue ready vnto thynges obtaine wil nedes perseuer play man warre pope warrier proteste appeale general counsell maye griefes decyded requyre maye called shortlye may speaketh two lightes followeth herein wordes innocentius thyrd applieth two great lyghtes god created one guyde day ye nyght byshops princelyke dignitie whiche ministreth godly thinges muche excellent gouerneth polytike matter loke different betwyxte sonne mone great diuersitie betwyxt office high byshop kinges office whan cesar made aunswere clemet wryteth also coledge cardinalles sixt day october signifiyng little sory heare byshop clement confederated french kyng reneweth warre agaist afreshe bishop hath sent letter defiance supposeth writte comon assent wherat marueleth little considering kyng yt beareth loue affection churche rome witnes parma placence whiche city empyre plucked late hath withstanding restored churche ryght bounde prince state germanye coplayned vnto wormes sondry iniuries done courte rome required recompence singular loue naturall inclination towardes churche rome passed ouer requestes deaf eares great sedition trouble ensued therupon germanye prince appointed another counsel indemnitie bishop church rome countremaunded vnder great penaltie appease counsell promysed myndes put hope general counsell holden hande wherfore byshop hathe done hym great iniury whiche hath done muche sake hath meanes lost good wylles prince empire desyreth therfore admonyshe byshop duty appointe counsell perswade hym incline mynde peace rather warre whiche refuse wyll differre counsell would call christian comon wealth susteyne losse dammage eyther want counsell long delaye ought hereafter imputed newes came hongary great ouerthrowe prynces set forward ambassade appointed spire emperour great spede expedition intreate freche kyng graunt saufeconduicte passe spayne fraunce whiche graunted prescribing certen tyme passe toke occasion hereby wryte vnto vj octobre frenche kyngs leters prynces germany losse hongary death lewis kynge daunger approched germany conceiued inwarde sorowe minde nothyng lesse lamented yt publique wealth also peryshed ciuile warres surely log christome quiet emperours faulte refuseth al honeste reasonable condition peace much neither moued comon losse destruction moste vnworthy death brother lawe king lewis yet miserable estate owne sister wydowe cosidereth daunger standeth austriche shal wel according dutie exhorte perswade vnto peace kepe loue amitie kinges dwell nere hym refrayne vnmeasurable couetousnes honorable hym styll endeuour get men landes possesse selfe alone progenitours kynges fraunce haue often time fought many battelles ennemies christentie myght nowe done power ioyned one emperour mynded wherfore case deuise bring thing passe wyll bestowe turkyshe warre al force selfe also man blame hym assaye recouer force armes suche thynges good wyll stadeth vpon rather seke peace nerer turkes daunger tha whan cesar aduertysed letter xxix noue bre empe confuteth letter writeth prince first rehearseth howe mercyfully gently vsed frenche kynge prysoner howe set hym lybertie howe gaue hym marriage eldest syster hym degree succession seconde thynges beyng quyeted supposed takynge iourney italye entent myghte bende hys whole force agaynste perpetuall ennemyes christiane religion breakynge fidelitie makynge league wyth byshop clement certen others deuydynge emonges kyngdome naples whiche alreadye hope conceyued theyr owne renewed mortall warre meanes whereof coulde delyuer countrey hongary violent fury turkes forced defende owne limites pretendeth lament death kyng lewis destruction hongary playne dissimulatio intent myght meane put silence founde letter constantly affirme turke attepted warre instigation spayne synce retourne home also confirmed letter obseruation conue nauntes muche hath kingdome liyng middes europe carelesse seketh warres contention therby make profite besides wrytinge mentioned came forth french kinges name apologie defence declaring apologie frech kyng cause stadeth peace madrice wherunto answere made emperours behalf large muche turke buda great parte hongary oppressed people miserably great terrour germany certe prince empire consulted eslyng write spedely emperour prince letter emperour intreating repaire germany shortly might consideration great daunger hanged ouer empire letter written xix decebre make mentio ambassade determined haue sent vnto hym haue trauailed fraunce kynge wold graunt saufe conduict iiij monethes wherof one past ambassadours mete together time wold much shortned therfore auoyd daunger haue determined differ vntil next assemblie empyre whiche haue appointed regensburg first day april next folowyng treate turkysh warre trusting ye either yt time assemble regensburg shal haue better occasio sende yt shal haue intelligence thing ye meane time al cesar wrote thus byshop rome cardinal yet wold preuaile nothing cofederatours sending vnto ambassadours agreed vpo require depart fro army restore sfortia duke millan receiue money raunsome send home kyngs sonnes whome deteineth pledge repay money borowed kyng england hereunto answered emperour ualolete xij february ca dismisse army short time notwithstading wil refuse take truce thre yeres sed army partes agaist turke comon ennemie ye meane time treate peace sfortia holdeth landes empire accused treason therfore restored matter examyned wherfore let hym answere lawe accuser wyll appoynt hym indifferent iudges restore kynges chyldren vpon receipte money agaynste kynges promesse othe fidelitie require repaie kinge england money marueleth litle consydering haue co maundement matter kyng frendes mony matter breake frendshyp wherfore seinge requestes vnsitting willeth bryng forth others part wyl nothyng obstinatly shalbe content beare many thinges comon wealthes sake wherfore ambassadours thus departing without thing concluded renewe warres againe wt force power day iohn frederick sonne heire prince electour saxony married sibille iohn fridmarrieth sibille cleue daughter duke iohn cleaue lady catharine yt emperours yongest sister promysed writinges made alteratio religion chauced saxony swarued fro couenauntes hawnart emperours ambassadour germany sayd plainly promise kept heretikes following herein suppose fote stepes cousel constance dede duke saxony reciteth certen writing emoges others themperours captaines charles duke bourbon going certen power naples way toke citie rome sacked next daye rome sacked arriued sixt day may clemet byshop cardinal prelate fleing castell aungell beseged certen tyme trenched euery syde whiche endured siege seuen monethes laste deliuered emperours commaundement harde expresse wordes great crueltie oultrage germanes spanyardes rome besydes cruell slaughter destruction spoyling raueshynge woman left kynde contumelious reproches mockinges bishop cardinalles emperour excused facte diligently affirmyng done commaudement chiefly wrote therof king england albeit supposeth thyng haue happened vnto hym iust iudgement god auenged wronge iniurie done vnto hym yet sayeth wil vse matter calamitie shalbe beginning occasion helth common wealth whan newes brought spayn sackig rome cesar immediatly comau ded cease fro playing pageantes interlude whiche set forth ioy son philip newly borne king englad answe king englande red nothig themperours letter bishop rome captiue vnto bare great zeale reuerence themperours power increasing daily fixed mind vpo warre sending ye cardinal yorke ambassadour fraunce cousel regesburg came prynces sent ambassadours wherfore nothing cocluded sauyng sent letter emperour xviij day may signifiyng diuers cause presence requysite nedefull tyme sprange vp newe kynde doctryne suche called anabaptistes condempne baptisme infantes baptysed agayne selues teachyng begynning anabaptistes thynges common wrote luther zwynglius diuers others magistrate punished euery place boaste vision dreames sangal town swycerlande one cut brother head presence father mother whome perswaded god comaunded hym apprehended magistrate suffered lyke punyshment muche increased co motion styred vp germany hereafter shalbe declared yeare senate strasborough decreed none shoulde henceforth buried within citie appointed certen place buriall dead without citie frenche kynge heard rome taken makyng league kyng englande sent great armie italy conduicte lautrech freche armye gascon rescewe byshop comming lumbardy ayded uenetians taketh first alexadria pauie partly force partly composition souldiours rage fury king taken wouderful slaughter townes men spoyled citie xxvij day iuly charles duke burbon lately stayne assaulte rome condempned duke baurbon conoempned paris paris court parliamet treason name memoriall accursed armes plucked downe landes goodes confiscated anthony prate chauncelour gaue sentence duke bare mortall hatred kynge tyme went besege marseille mentioned fourth boke tyme kynge englande toke emperours parte wrote cardinall yorke emonges thinges would spare paynes peryll kyng henry might helpe recouer ryght tytle hath fraunce englyshe men doe clayme fraunce theires two hundreth englande hath title fraunce yeares since aboue especiallye normandye gascoyne gwyne letter therfore bourbon prouoke kynge clayme chalenge ryght whiche letter frenche kyng afterwardes chauncing vppon conceyued muche hatred leonarde cesar hym dukedome bauarie one leonarde cesar professour gospel apprehended comaundemet byshop passauie defendeth opinion faythe onlye doth iustifie two sacramentes baptisme lordes supper masse sacrifice profite quicke dead confession syns depende counsell commaundement christe hath made satisfaction synnes vowe chastitie byndeth scripture maketh mention purgatory difference dayes dead intercessours v diuine thinges hath free wyll examined woulde haue declared thynges people large coulde suffered emonges eckius reasoned altogether latin people vnderstand answered vulgare tongue neither yet coulde cause doe lyke fyne condempned byshops owne mouthe heretyke burnt xvj august commaundement william duke bauar vnto whose iurisdiction comitted condempnation byshop lest shoulde deede defile hopocrisy byshops sacred thynges become prophane irregular gyueth sentence lyfe death tyme ferdinando emperours depute germany death kyng lewis created kyng boheme contended uaynode transiluania kyngdome hongary philip baden substituted place appointed counsell empyre cesars name comaunding regesburg beginning marche yeare followyng consulte religion turkyshe warre senate people berne whiche moste fame power emoges swycers co sydering power berne howe dissention religion encreased daily minister churche one doctrine doe assigne disputation within citie xvij decembre settyng forth wryting called vnto byshops nere byshoppes constance basyll sedune losanna warnyng come selues brynge diuines el lose possession haue precincte lymites nombre clergie iurisdiction appoyntyng scripture onely olde newe testament shoulde force authoritie wyll come thether graunt saufe conduicte make lawe lawes disputacion thynge done quietlye wythout chydynge brawlynge euery man shoulde speake mynde frelye pronounce suche sorte euerye man sayinges myght written euer shold agreed vpo shold ratified obserued al domions thintent men myght know thynges shoulde decided comme thether prepared propounded ten conclusios minister church fraunces colbe bertholde haller dyd professe sayde would proue scripture whiche trewe churche wherof christe head procedeth god word perseuereth heareth none man voyce self theames conclusion church maketh lawes without god worde therfore otherwyse bounden men tradition bearyng name churche muche consonant god worde christe hath made satisfactio synnes whole worlde therfore man say waye saluation meane put away synne dothe denye christe howe proued testimonie scripture body bloud christ really corporally receiued vse masse wherin christ presented offered heauenly father quicke dead scripture contumelie sacrifice christ offered vp v christ called vpo mediatour aduocate mankynde god father place lyfe wherin soules pourged founde scripture wherfore prayer ceremony yearely diriges obites whiche bestowed prayer dead superfluous vpon dead also lampes taper suche thynges profite nothyng image lykenes set vp worshypped holy scripture therfore errected church intent ought taken downe matrimony kynde men prohybited auoyde fornication commaunded permitted vnto men holy wrytte euery whoremonger euen testimony scripture sequestred communio churche syngle life vnchast fylthy moste vnsemely order priesthode tyme men berne wrytten letter concernynge matter vnto heluetians exhortyng sende learned men suffer others passe saufelye countreis lucernates uranites unterualdians engianes glareos soloturnians friburg exhorte long letter leaue enterpryse sayinge lawfull nation prouince alter state religion belonge generall counsell wherfore desyre wold attempte suche wycked acte contine religion whiche parentes elder haue obserued fynally saye neyther wyll sende suffer men come graunt saufecoduit others passe countrey standyng men bernesse procede matter daye prescribed whiche vij ianuary begynne disputation came none byshops named basyll zuricke abbecell also shafusias sangallians mullusias neighbour rhetia sent moreouer thei strausborough ulmes auspurg lindaue constance isne dyd lykewyse doctours citie named began disputation conclusion defended zwynglius oecolampadius bucer capito blanrer diuers others impugned emonges others conrade treger austen freer great fame laste tyme sought helpe besydes scripture maisters disputation would permitte hym doe forbydden lawe departed place disputation ended xxvj ianuary forsayde conclusion approued common assente moste parte ratified obserued berne also proclaimed magistrate religion reformed sondry place aboutes mass aultars image abolyshed place constance chaunged certen thynges made lawe whoredome adultrye dishonest suspected company called cannon departed prebids departe thence great displeasure ambrose blaurer preacher ther gentleman borne professed selfe monke abbey alperspacke dukedome wyrtinberge whyche ambrose blaures readyng luther workes chaunged mynde cote together returnyng home agayne frendes abbot woulde haue hym agayne wroote earnestlye senate constance wherfore blanrer expresseth whole matter writyng propoundeth certen condition vpon contet retourne suche abbot refusyng remayneth styll constance disputation berne image aultares masse ceremony vtterly abolyshed lykewyse geneua remouinge image ceremony dyd religion reformed geneua imitate berne wherfore byshop clergie forsoke citie anger religion thus altered berne renou ced league made frenche kynge prohibitynge hyred warfare zuricke done contented yearely pension kyng payeth kepe peace wrote victory gospel daye yeare wherein forsoke popyshe religion vpon apyllour golden letter myght euerlastyng memory posteritie shewed cardynal yorke sent fraunce agred vpon matter kinges kinges frauce englad amballade ye emperour sent ambassadours emperour frenche king requireth take raunsome delyuer sonnes pledge kyng englande agayne debte payde threfolde first thre hondreth thousande crownes lent hym secondarely fyue hundreth thousande obseruing contracte matrimonie thirdly foure yeares pension whiche emperoure promysed hym third boke declared emperour hereunto aunswered myndes kynge englande also sent hym defiaunce herault armes tyme consultynge howe myght deuorced catherine emperours haunt marry whiche afterwardes shalbe recyted place emperoure letter kynges accused frenche kyng moste greuously kept fayth promyse ofte tymes sayd muche frenche ambassadours vpon kynge letter wrytten paris xxviij marche sent herault talke sayth whiche thou hast myne perceiue thou braggest certen thinges founde dishonour freche king inuectiue emper though escaped thy handes fidelitie nowe al whiche compacte made hath put pledge hym selfe quytte bonde hereby sufficiently excused yet neuerthelesse defence honour thought wryte briefly vnto therfore thou blame facte mine departure sayest euer thyng contrary dutie noble prynce tell playnly thou liest determined maynteyne myne honour estimatio whylest haue day lyue nede many wordes therfore thou wylt ought thou shalt nede hereafter wryte appointe place may fyght hande hande thou darest mete meane tyme ceasest speake euyll protest offereth emper combat shame therof belongeth vnto combat stryfe shall parted tolde contention betwene kynge ferdinando uayuode transiluania whan burst cruell warre ferdinando greater power uayuode moneth apryll wryting letter state empyre lamentable death kyng lewis sayeth letter iohn uaiuode state empyre common assent noble chosen crowned kinge hongary except three whome pouertie hatred hope better fortune seduced forgettyng wealth countrey subscribed ferdinando kyng boheme tyme wholy addicted succour countrey recouer lost meanes procure quiet beholde inuadeth realme violence taketh certen townes whiche faction created kyng posonye marueled lytle greued also exceadingly nation molested hym whiche ought moste succour releue misery bene harde tyme haue gyuen hym repulse would hasarde rashely remnant power lefte manye shypwrakes loss realme hath late complayned vnto clement seuenth frau ce frenche kyng henry kyng england sigismude kyng pole dede kynge pole sendynge ambassadour without knowledge entreated wold daungerous tyme make away ciuile discorde let foreyne enemy whiche neyther yet able kepe would kepe peace ioyne power myne resiste common ennemye ferdinando answered would attempt nothing ryght equitie agreed vpon certen daye fytte men sent debate matter controuersie content sendyng also ambassadours vnto submytting selfe vnto arbytriment made request woulde gyue none ayde myne aduersarie tyme came ferdinando countrey beyng taken deteyned prysoners lawe natios ambassadours take could declare commission shoulde haue gone emperour al extreme wronge iniury neuerthelesse daye appoynted kyng pole sent certen others desyrous peace themselues also commaundemet notwithstanding fardinando men propounded thinges farre reason ther could nothyng concluded whylest thinges workyng certen nobilitie entysed crafte polycie ferdinado breake fidelite gyuen somuche waye layde neyther come sende vnto thought good declare vnto letter howe vniuste warre attempteth peraduenture intending recouer auncetours frederick maximilian emperours haue lost fore one triumphyng thought hym selfe sure kyngdome hongary myne vncle emeryck expulsed whole countrey father stephen sepuse matthie kyng disconfite suche sorte adioyned uienna hongary selfe beyng yonge gaue repulse maximilian whan moued warre v wold haue done lyke enemy also contendeth rather craft subtyltie doth power manhood hytherto haue borne iniury might thinke selues moste noble prynces howe greuous thynge cast downe hyghest degree power dignitie state priuate man suppose none found mylde patient sufferyng many iniuries woulde loke hym euery syde ayde myght get wherfore seyng tyme synce receyued gouernment commo wealth haue refused condition reasonable wyll yet doe rather doe thyng styre vp cyuyle warre myne aduersarye proceadeth obstinately doe proteste ought layde charge blame worthy myne owne defence seek best meanes case common wealth doe susteyne thereby dommage maye ascribed vnto hath soughte wayes haue peace myne ennemie whiche inuadeth man realme great iniury hathe layde dylygent wayte wayes passage nothynge conueyed vnto notwithstandynge suppose haue hearde howe forsoke kyng ferdinado forsoke kyng lewis brother lawe kyng lewys vnto whome beyng ofte earnestly requyred sent neyther men munition ayde agaynst violence ennemie loked death kyng moreouer common ayde empyry appoynted hongary sent brother disquiet italy sent kynge lewys tyme brother three thousande men myne owne costes charge woulde haue bene battell selfe bene commaunded kyng remayne transiluania brother dyed battel ryght valeantlye ferdinando promysed othe vnlesse dyd fyrste recouer belgrade certen castelles turkes wold take vpon gouernment fayth fayled herein turkes haue inuaded destroyed spoyled coutrey haue wonne castell iaice chiefest fortresse bosna whiche castel kyng matthias great losse men recouered time past turkes mine vncle emerick defeded afterwards induring long sege kinges haue fortified synce time exceading great charge lost valeaut captaine yt made many goodly promise thinke log wil necessite cal vpon ayde though stode dau ger defence germany mynde waye intendeth warre vpo turke vnto cotent pay tribute yearely hath sent ambassadours thither purpose myndeth men money helpe brother italye destroye brynge realme hongarye bondage seyng matter thus earnestly beseche forsee priuate iniurye donne vnto turne great hynderaunce common wealth whyle wrote also emperour muche lyke effecte exhortinge ferdinados title hongary appease brother thus much ye defece case ferdinado grounded self vpo coposition whiche themperour maximilian made wt hongarians king ladislaus yeare iiij c xci whiche prouided ladislaus died without heire male maximilian heyres descending right line shold possesse kingdome wherfore whan lewys sonne ladislaus dead without issue tolde ferdinando nephewe maximilian sonne philip archeduke austriche moreouer hauig maried syster kyng lewys affirmed kyngdome good right selfe tyme lantgraue hesse prince electour saxony mustering prepared selues vnto warre cause therof one otto paccius lawer gentle man borne one chiefest councellours george duke saxony occasion talke admonyshed lantgraue loke owne thynges nowe late ferdinand marque brandenburge cardinall mentz salisburge george duke saxon william lewis duke bauer certen byshops bamberge wirciburge made league destroye duke saxon electour luther religion credit thing shewed copie confederacie duke saxon lantgraue prepare warre promysing hym also principall whylest leuie army make preparation warres men marueled muche wherfore would come sayde one thynge suche case accustomed whan thynges redynes sendyng abroade letter messenger partes thei published copie cofederacie brought vnto wrote also vnto whiche thought haue made league sent ambassadours knowe intent al pourged selues euery man seueral sending abrode letter affirme forged matter proued duke george ye lantgraues father law vrged chiefly bryng forth partie tolde hym whiche wyll thynke none wyse deuyse styre vp stryfe disturbe quietnes german ye fyrst attempt shoulde haue bene haue set vppon byshoppes next therfore toke vp waged men many could get vpon suche soden paccius coulde shewe dede selfe according promyse lantgraue begaune waxe colde busynes laste mediation countie palatine richarde archebishop treer dimysed army vpon condicion byshoppes shoulde paye vnto latgraue charge warre hudreth thousand ducates archebyshop mentz fortie thousande wirciburge muche bamberge twenty thousande afterwardes tyme ambassadours prynces mete day prescribed dede accusation touche paccius whome lantgraue presented conuicted falsihode yet meanes put lybertie whan wandered straunge countreis certen yeares last beheaded andwerpe matter thus paccen beheaded pacified prynces confederated sweuicall league accused lantgraue done wrong iniury felowes new sturre lyke haue growen vpon matter fine quieted wormes ende decembre intercession palsgraue thinke altogether nothyng spoken conspyracie assemblie certen prince regensburg foure yeares encreased suspicion wherfore supposed suche thing conceaued brought perfection fully determined whiche thyng doe affirme certentie leaue vnto euery man owne iudgement assemblie empire shewed shold haue bene beginning spring tyme regensburg warlyke preparation emperours deputie sending worde come frenche kynges letter wrytten later end marche emperour receiued seuenth daye iune afterwardes sendyng aunswer herault armes xxiiij day iune fro mou tison emperours aunswer frech king blame sayeth accuse departing home done leaue permission thou diddest returne againe custody captiue thou diddest promyse thy fayth thou wouldest vnlesse thou fulfillest condition peace lyke dede proued wryting subscrybed thyne owne hande dede thou haddest done thou haddest played parte iuste man worthye prynce nowe muche thou hast herein broken thy faith affirme without lye thou hast done shamefully wyckedlye thou desirest haue place appointed cobate content assigne place ryuer runneth besyde fount arabie andey whiche thou oughtest case refuse thou diddest credit thine owne lyfe thy chyldrens two yeres past tyme set libertie retourne home thou gauest pledge thou mayest aswel also committe thy selfe assuredly intent differred long delay let noble men sent thether party skilfull suche matter whiche shall espye place conuenient agree vpon kynde weapon appoynte certen daye case receyue none aunswere within fourty dayes receipt letter thy mynde herein fault delaye shame shall remayne towarde cryme falsifying thy fayth shall added also letter emperour delyuered vnto herault goyng fraunce reade kynge openly refuse heare co maundeth deliuer kyng reade herault came lengthe kynge syttyng paris themper heraulde came paris hearyng sermon noble hym demaunded hym brought maner combat sayde somwhat saye besydes howe commaundement reade hym el delyuer owne handes whiche besought hym myght doe kynge vnderstandyng ryght well emperours request herein lothe haue thyng read openly fallyng woordes herault arrose would neyther heare hym speake receyue anye letter hym deede emperours men affyrme theyr wrytinges firste august emperour wryting letter ualolete calleth counsell empyre spyres assemble spire beginning february treate religion turkysh warre excuseth hym selfe certen affayres meanes whereof present appoyntyng deputes brother ferdinando friderike palatyne william bauer byshop trent hyldesseme lantrechus lieutenaunt frenche kynges armie taken pauie alexandria haue hearde wyntered armie bononie begynning spryngtyme went forewarde beseged naples whiche kept lantrech segeth naples defended alphonsus daualus ugo moncada ferdiando alarco philibert prynce orenge ferdinando gonzago moneth iuly sore pestilence consumed great part armie lantreth hym selfe also moneth auguste hym mounsour uaundemont brother vnto anthony duke lorayne whiche serued kyng hope attayne kingdome naples house gaunte whereof house lorayn hath also ofsprynge affirme ryght disputation berne religion altered sondrye place wherupon preacher strausborongh emonges contention masse errours bishop rome doctrine taught chiefly masse wicked great blasphemy god holy name wherfore ought abrogated right vse lordes supper instituted vnlesse could proue thinges testimony holy scripture wyll refuse kinde punishment againe byshops minister taught otherwyse bred smal contention afterwardes senate bycause refused dispute conferre wt papist forboden preache others comaunded sylence byshop letter senate exhorted perseuer auncient religio elder senate desyreth hym agayne done oftentymes suche thinges myght set forth appertayned trew seruice glory god residue taken away abolyshed belongeth office notwithstandinge would tyme appoynte metynge daye suche matter would nothyng ded put feare letter wherin oftentimes mingled intreatinges threateninges alter nothyng almoste dispayre thynge intreateth senate empyre whiche tyme spyres ambassadour chamber imperiall strausbor authoritie set foote matter sendynge ambassadours solemnely later ende decembre requyre put downe masse neyther power emperour state chaunge auncient religion theyr forefather eyther generall el prouinciall counsell whiche supposed farre ouer long would differre leste vntyl next assemblye empire put vp requestes doubted shoulde receyue reasonable aunswere forboden lawes priuate magistrate may vndo thinges agreed vpon common consent whole worlde wherfore reason obtayne handes obstinatly procede enterpryse worke force violence emperour theyr hyghe magistrate kynge ferdynando also depute throughout empyre would take matter right greuously lykewyse accordyng ther office dutie must bothe informe emperour therof letter also see suche redresse thyng apperteyneth whiche would loth vnwilling wherfore desire aduysedly waye matter followe good counsel shalbe emperour acceptable selues moste profitable senate made answere ambassadours purpose departed shortly byshop hildesseme came vnto themperours bishop letter name like exhortation furthermore bishop strausborough writeth letter diuers senatours gentleman helde landes hym muche bounden vnto othe fidelitie much lieth holde wt masse suffer abolished ye meane time senate wha thing bene aboue two yeres cotrouersie preacher called vpo sermos daily citezes also suters callig whole nubre ccc matter weight difficultie ther accustomed doth declare yt case shuld abolishe masse dauger themperour howe muche god would offended wherfore graunt leasure consider require consulte together next assemblie common wyll consent matter may determyned wherfore daye came sentence masse preuayled vpon decree made xx february masse ought suspended layde downe vntyll suche tyme aduersaries could proue seruice acceptable god decree take place aswel within masse put stansbor citie without place farre iurisdiction stretcheth afterwarde letter certifie byshop newes hym heauy leade wrote agayne hym selfe next letter also great dissention relygion certen yeares basill fyne senate decred dissentid basil religion one vniforme doctrine whole citie touchyng masse whiche yet sayde fewe place open disputatio determined voyces done therewith papistes defende masse touthe nayle parson rayled agaynst others vnpunyshed burgeses chose certen put senate remebrauce promise requyre senatours let thynge myght displaced coulde obtayned citezens flocke together mete gray freres church first without armure weapon keepe gate towres basill take armure strong place citie watche warde senate glad graunte certen requestes apease furye referryng cause iudgement first sent vnto meane tyme certen appoynted make prouision cytie reste chaunced comme chiefe churche one staffe thruste image saincte muche fell downe brake upon whiche occasion serued mo lyke case priestes came thether whiche much offended doynges woulde passe commission departed without bable worde hereof brought cytizens market place reporte made fellowes stoode daunger image put downe lyues three hondred armed men sent heade churche helpe whan came thether others gone leste shoulde appeere haue commen thyther nothyng breake downe idol image coulde fynde thence goe church doe lyke certen senatours ranne foorth appease tumulte cytezens sayde vnto haue bene consulted thre yeres shall dispatche one houre intent shall haue contention image thus senate condescende al requestes twelue senatours displaced emonges others henry meltinger tyme boroumaister lucius ziegler captayne bourgeses decree also made well within citie without lyberties masse maner image abolyshed masse put downe senate henceforth admitte two hondreth thre score burgeses consulte matter co cerning god glory common wealth decree made citezens retourne home ioyfull anger wreaked vpon image thyrde daye whiche asshe wednesdaye image distributed poore burne want fewell tyme fell partyng matter came woordes vnto hande strypes agreed shoulde brent wherfore nyne stake heapes made image bret sh wednesday head churche set fyre burnt fortuned daye wherein byshoppes minister wont marke men foreheades asshes intent remembre selues earth asshes vnto whole citie consuming idolles asshes mery ioyfull men zurick berne solodure hearyng tumulte sent ambassadours meanes betwene tofore came thether matter appeased tolde lyttle assemblie spir assembly spyres whiche emperour appointed co mence beginning february began tyll ides marche thither came many prince state prynce electour saxony brought hym melanchton fyrst treated religion muche decision decree made shall tell hereafter byshoppes complices dyd coulde sequestre duke saxon prynces city take counsell agree one whiche hoped well brynge passe muche dyffered opinion touchynge lordes supper ferdinande college callyng ambassadours certen city charged sore contrary emperours decree altered many thynges fynally exhorted confourmable myndes others lest dissention assemblye papist swicerlad make leage kynge ferdinando quite dissolued make aunswere alteration iniurious emperour desyrous concorde woulde doe anye thynge emperours sake refusynge stande iudgement lawfull counsell two moste floryshynge cyties swycers zuricke berne agreed one religion lucernaites urites swites unternaldians engians whiche abhorred moste doctrine make
