league kyng ferdinando clement byshop rome xiij day aprill sendeth iohn thomase mirandula exhorte prynces warre turke al hath susteyned great loss late yeares yet promyseth assiste ayde doe endeuoure emperour frenche king accorded counsell may begynne immediatly intent germanye may embrace religion countreis assemblye senate empire woulde permitte daniel miege ambassadour citie strasborough sitte counsel amb srausborough excluded cause masse abrogated counsell imperiall withstanding intreated contrary wherfore iames sturmius ambassadour citie sayed vnto case thus displaced contrary lawe custome empire let loke henceforth wyll beare part charge might preuayl ferdinando hym self aunswering intercessours bad citie obserued emperours decree substituted place longe dispute religion fourmer actes spire repeted new decree made wyse haue hitherto obserued emperours decree let obserue styl vntyll generall counsell bynde people lykewyse decres spire suche haue altered religion nowe departe feare sedition let staye henceforth alter nothynge besydes vntyll tyme counsell furthermore doctrine whiche teache otherwyse lordes supper churche doth receyued masse abolyshed suche place newe kynde doctryne anye man letted go masse wyll anabaptistes also defende opinion obstinately shall suffer death minister churche commaunded teache according interpretacio receiued church referring al disputable question cou sell decided moreouer state kepe common peace none hurte cause religion neither one take defence others subiecte shall otherwyse accompted numbre outlawes decree resisted prince electour saxony george marque brandenborge ernest france certen prince resist duke lunenborough latgraue counte anhald ye xix april recite openly wryting cause doe consent thereunto firste doe repete decree former assemblie whereby euery man hathe religion permitted frely vntyll counsell maye departe infrynge thynges whiche great delyberation common quiet establyshed sygnetes othes also confirmed woulde deede glad example progenitours thynge myght content emperour goodes lyues also wyll spende wyllinglye hyghnes seruice present cause coucerneth euerlastyng saluation men wherfore desire offended thei herein dissente like former decree made common assent broken consentes wyll shall countrey establysh religion shal seme good vnto beseching god illuminate harte men light knowledge truthe hath bene dissention controuersie religion certen yeares declared counsel norinberge haue bene authours causers therof well author dissention confession byshop rome hym self also requestes prynces state empyre delyuered byshoppes legate numbre foure score wherof notwithstanding yet redresse made al consultation hath euer bene ende debating controuersies refourmyng vice nothyng better generall counsell left parte haue nowe decreed suche haue chaunged religion nowe without muche trouble forsake shal alter nothyng henceforth neither comende allowe vnlesse discredite doctrine whiche haue professed hitherto true godly graunt moreouer ought leaue thei might tumulte vprores thynges el tha denye god worde whiche taught purely syncerely whiche moste heynous offence coulde committed must confesse wordes deede also moreouer hynderaunce abnegation would howe muche preiudiciall fauourers gospell easy coniecture cocernyng masse ryght well knowen howe strong inuincible testimony holy scripture preacher within dominios haue confuted popishe masse steade therof instituted lordes supper according institution christe maner apostle obserued wherfore neither admitte part decree neyther permitte subiectes heare masse whiche abolyshed though byshop rome masse neuer good godly yet haue church two cotrary mass al may wel perceiue grudge dissentio would vpon ensewe moreouer prescribe shal commaunde owne subiectes lawes shall make owne dominion lytle maruell consyderynge selues would suffer man doe lyke furthermore thyng taught church touchyng presence body bloud christe euydent men nedeth declaratio notwithstandyng haue sayde oftentymes thynke good also yet make decree teache otherwise emperours commissios teach latin beneth maketh mentio therof agayne muche maynteners doctrine nother called hearde whiche weyghty matter muche considered nothyng determyned tyme hearde speake whome matter doth chiefly concerne howe scripture shoulde expouded saye gospell must taught interpretation approued churche well stryfe trewe church seyng doctrine certen god worde besydes nothyng ought taught place scripture appeare obscure better expouded manifest place scripture therfore wyll dwell herein endeuourynge bookes olde newe testament may taught syncerely playnly onely meane waye euermore certayne sure men tradicions grounded weake foundation decree last assemblie enacted peace concorde case decree take effecte would ope waye muche trouble displeasure euen nowe decree wormes suspended doe prince seke make subiectes forfyte goodes obseruyng decree decre wormes men may easely coiecture wyll insewe decree shal nowe take place agayne wyl vse force co pelle men suche thinges done saufe conscience well spoke fourmer decree penned suche wordes many abuse thyng tyl counsell called myght doe lyste bruted chieflye whiche lytle afrayde last iudgement whan thynges shal come lyght partes wyll refuse aunswer indiferent iudges suche wyll saye haue anye poynte broken decree whiche thynges standyng thus consent decree howe wyll aunswere matter openly men also emperour hym selfe meane tyme tyll eyther generall el prouinciall counsell germany shalbe called wyll nothyng shall deserue iuste reproufe unto protestation prynces certen chief city laying heades together subscribe strausborough nore berge ulmes constance rutelinge winsseme meminge lindane campedune hailbrune isne wysseburge norling sangall thorigicall protestantes dede ye first original name protestautes germany also emonges foreyn nation nowe co mon famous ferdinando departed assemblie prince thei protested notwithstanding duke saxon felowes required tary litle protestantes deuise certen appellation wherein doe appeale decree made spire vnto emperour next lawful general prouinciall counsell germany iudges suspected determined also sende ambassadours empeperour long men zurick berne sent forth army ennemies fiue townes made league ciuil warre emong swicers ferdinando declaryng wryting emonges sondry cause iniuries whiche recite one yt tyme certen citezens came money dewe vnto snites whypped naked unterualdias despyte hanged vp armes also armes city basil strausborough vpon gallous howe haue ioynctely made league wyth kynge ferdinado oppresse religion roote coutrey wherby haue onlye infringed lawe nature also broken bondes betwene conspiring moste vtter mortall ennemie whome subdue haue long many yeares euen fro first beginning league one assent ioyned together al force power army ready ioyne battel mediation neyghbours strausborough matter taken vp ferdinado sent ayde came farre rhine emoges thinges agreed vpo haue warre religion henceforth absteyne opprobriouse wordes vnder great penaltie frenche kynge consyderynge state chyldren mishappes freche kyng whiche lefte pledge spayne euyll successe warres italye hauynge loste bothe armie also chieftayne latrechus ouer androwe de aure gene captaine sea moste skylfull tyme lantrech coronell dyed reuolted frenche kyng emperour restoryng countrey vnto lybertie inclined hys mynde peace wherfore cambrey cytie artoys mette ladye margaret emperoures aunte ale kynges peace canbrey mother many noble emonges others erarde marchiane cardinall byshop liege whyche concluded peace moneth auguste wherein recite decree made thre yeare spayne agaynste lutherians whiche newely ratified condition partely altered emperour permitteth frenche kyng inioye bourgundy case haue sonne sister kyng paieth vnto emperour delyuery sonnes twety hodreth thousand crownes accompting herein debte dewe kyng englande log emperoure imbarked hym selfe spayne arryued gene time also soliman emperour turkes prouocation iohn uaynode made ambassadour hierome laske hongarian man excellent wytte marcheth armie innumerable hogary austrice moneth septembre layeth sege uienna chief citie countrey assayed vndermyne ouerthrowen turke besegeth uienna walles gyueth assaulte desperatly seynge souldioues garnyson whiche germaines whose chief captaine philip palsgrane defendyng breache moste valiauntly space one moneth eight day octobre raised siege departed without purpose many thousandes retourne partely slayne partly lead away myserable vyle captiuitie departure created uayuode kynge buda sweating sicknes yeare also germany sore afflicted newe kynde disease called sweathing sicknes men sodainly take pestilent sweate within foure twenty howres eyther died amended remedye knowen many thousandes peryshed began ocean sea small tyme spred ouer germany vnspeakeable spede lyke fyre con med thynges farre nere called germany english sickenes first yeare henry seuenth kyng england whiche yeare lorde cccc lxxxvj death began ilande new disease remedy knowen made wounderful destruction moreouer yere small plenty wyne corne wherfore thynges whiche god displeasure wonte caste vpon vnthankefull people sedition warre sycknes penurie powred vpon germany sondry plage tyme one tyme collen peter flisted adolphe clarebacke two learned men imprysoned touchyng lordes supper opinion beleued otherwyse two clerk brenct collon papistes senate citie hath authoritie leade pryson suche offendours archebyshop hath power lyfe death maye whome senate hath condempned archebyshoppes officer may acquite set lybertie men deteyned pryson halfe yere nowe laste condempned partes brent great lamentation compassion many layde blame therof diuines preacher whiche cried daily god wrath must appeased deathes wicked plaged v newe kynde disease adolphe well fauoured learned eloquent lead fire declared maner beleue comforted one another testimony scripture suche sorte men eye mindes fixed vpon shewed luther zwinglius luther zwinglius dispuie marpurg differed opinion touching lordes supper bycause muche contention lantgraue found meanes learned men party mete certen daye marpurge conferre vpon matter frendlye saxony came luther melancthon ionas swycers oecol padius zwynglius strausborough bucer hedio rinberge osiander besydes many graue well learned men luther zwynlius reason matter forsayd disease comen thether brake disputation commaundement lantgraue concludinge thus muche consented chiefest pointes maner agrement doctryne agreed fro henceforth abstaine contention besechyng god woulde shewe foorth hys lyght also controuersie set concorde thus departed frendly beginning octobre haue hearde howe duke saxon lantgraue league three yeare synce spire nowe decree made intended earnestly wherof draught drawe norenberge debated place one opinion touching lordes supper long accorded wherfore apoynted another assemblye smalcalde eyght day decembre erasmus boke againste gospeler tyme cesar arryued italye erasmus roterdame alteration religion auoyde suspition gone basyll frybourg towne kyng ferdinandos moneth nouembre set forth booke intituled falsly boast selues gospeler toucheth dede whole nu bre emonges many thinges sayeth knewe one whiche appeared made worse aunswered deuines strausborough whome concerned basill chiefly bucer emperour comme bononie fraunces sfortia whiche fraunces sfortia league byshop rome frenche kyng pleaded cause hym intercession clement vij restored dukedome myllan vpon condition pay hym nyne hondreth thousande crownes one half yeare resydue within ten yeares emperour pledge reserueth hym selfe come castell millan vntyll payment first yeare made seuenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale empire charles fyfte argument seuenth booke ambassadours protestantes sent emperour appeale answere made placence stayed wherof aduertysed protestantes assemble smalcade stausborough entreth league thre cyties cautons emperour returnyng coronation commeth auspurge protestantes offer doctrine whiche aduersaries go confute meane whyle certen nominated accorde emperour perswadeth prince protestantes notwithstanding threatnynges euyll wordes replication made scaunders wherwith charged persisted sayde confession hauyng geuen last aunswere departe home eckius faber forgyng confutation strasborough townes lyberally rewarded compacte pruselande made frustrate notable decree assemblie auspurge red ryuer tibre ouerfloweth rome melanchthon heauy decree comforted luther come nere vnto auspurge bucer went agree hym zwynglius commaundement came make ferdinando kyng romaynes whiche electour saxony prynces resiste saide howe protestantes sent ambassadours emperour ambassadours ye protestant emp iohn khinger alex framentrute michaell cadene norynbergh goyng far gene vnderstode emperours commyng spayne afterwardes nynthe septembre placence make theyr waye meane mercurine cattunarie made cardynall daye henry earle nassow alexander schweissie alphouse ualdese spanyarde emperour appointed heare xii septembre withstanding warned compryse requestes writing vse long circumstance sondrye moste weighty affayres whan came theyr day admonished eftsones interpretour knit vp matter fewe wordes lyke case commaundement repete ordre decree empyre made thre yeares past newlye taken awaye decree whiche shoulde force great trouble would come therof wherfor prince electour saxony fellowes city also ioynynge dyd proteste openly would consent decree request would take thyng displeasauntly euyl parte wyll nothyng vntyll suche tyme shall counsell whiche truste shal allowed god hym also offeryng selues meane tyme example auncesters doe thynge wealth dignitie hym empyre eyther serue warres agaynst turke charge shall put moreouer beseche hym case shall reported hym otherwyse would gyue credit therunto trust vnto information conceaue displeasure agaynst vnlesse first heard make purgatio especially seyng make alwayes offer maye ryght instructed scripture wil nothyng obstinatly dewty wherfore desyre hym accepte defence protection shortly may aunswer mercyfully louyngly wrytyng whole matter declared mouthe hath also commaunded therfore haue comprehended wrytyng thynge euer nedefull knowledge matter whiche delyuer vnto emperour aunswereth interpretour emperours aunswere hath heard sute lyketh well also obsequiens seruyce offer theyr prynces behalfe wherfore whan hath talked counsell wyll make aunswer reasonable fynally twelth octobre gaue aunswere writing request vnderstode kyng ferdinado brother residue commission hym decree made spyres thei came howe ryght sory dissention amongest muche dewtie forsee suche thynges happen leste whan chanced see refourmed therfore longe delyberation priuie counsell whole matter findeth howe decree made intent nothyng hereafter altered place newe secte henceforth many al ready euyll fauoured enough peace concorde myght throughout empyre therfore duke saxon fellowes ought ryght haue consented al thinges prynces set muche healthe theyr soules tranquillitie conscience doe parte lesse desyreth generall counsell staye common wealth whiche withstandyng together nedefull lawes decres woormes others whiche made comon assente state myght obserued selues wyll graunte suche decree oughte fyrme stable whiche thynge considered seyng vse custome loke parte state empyre decree may disolued fewe persones therfore hath letter duke fellowes commaunded doe accepte decree ratisfied attempte nothyng obeye vpon theyr allegeaunce owe vnto hym empyre wyll come passe aucthoritie example sake must punyshe extremely supposeth letter already delyuered vnto wylbe shortelye wyll obey comaundemet wherof wold ryght glad especialy tyme wherin credibly infourmed howe great turke common ennemy christendom present marchynge hongarye power germanye daunger turke wherfore requysite haue domestical concorde intet myghty cruell ennemy myght repulsed whome intendeth sone shal haue stayed thynges italy bende force power wherfore trusteth consyderyng well daunger wyll doe whiche bounden dutie tyme ambassadours red aunswere ambassadours appeale delyuered appellation whiche ready made alexander schneissie callyng wytnes thyng maner fyrst would receyue fyne content take caried emperoure daye none retourneth hauyng ended talke sayeth howe emperour commaundeth styre one foote inue wryte nothing home sende men til bring newes payne fayting life goodes wyse left charge geuen fortuned yt michaell cadene within lodging hereof immediatlye certified seruant wryteth whole matter senate norinberge dispatcheth awaye letter great expedition bounde vpon fidelitie fellowes length last daye sauyng one octobre parma whether comauded folowe nicolais granuellane executed office cardinall mercurine lieng sicke weth graunulane emperour taketh euyll parte appellation sent hym yet doth neuerthelesse permytte retourne home countrey commaundeth michaell cadene remayne styll vnder payne death disobeye cause wherof lantgraue came forth geuen hym booke fayre garnyshed whiche conteyned briefly somme christiane doctryne intent delyuer emperour vpon occasion cesar went masse present emperour boke presented emperour agayne delyuered certen spanyshe byshop vnderstande fortuned lyght place christ warneth disciple desyre soueraignitie theyr profession kynges gentyls doe vsurpe vnto authoritie place authour emoges thing expounded declaryng dutie suche minister church lokyng vpon superficially emperour asked hym honeste byshoy made aunswere though booke toke away authoritie sworde christian magistrate permitteted gentyls vse whiche farre christian religion cause stayed granuellan sayde moreouer howe emperoures pleasure shoulde delyuer lyke booke byshop rome sought excuse doynges receyued pleasaunt aunswer perceyuyng wordes granuclane dannger tooke horse priuely roode farrare poste thence goyng uenyse retourned home senate norenbergh receyued cadenes letter mentioned immediatly certified duke saxon lantgraue theyr fellowes therof xxiiij octobre matter debated agreed mete smalcaldia ende nouebre thyther came duke saxon assemble smalcald iohn frederick sonne erneste france brother duke lunenburgh philip lantgraue certen counsellers george markes brandenburgh moreouer city strausborough norinberge heilprune rutelynge constance menynge campodune ulmes lindaue mentioned prynces certen city differed opinion touchynge lordes supper wherfore strausborough already made league zuricke berne basyll whiche league stransborough zuricke berne nerer vnto accorded better religion intent myght tymes able defende selues iniurye condicions shoulde attempted force armes religion sake city sende ayde men many shalbe requisite yet strausborough shall gyne vnto euery thousand fote men two thousad crownes moneth parte recompence agayne chaunce first assauted citie strausborough shal ayde thre thousand crownes euerye moneth whylest warre shall endure moreouer ennemies founde part others dominion escape free suffer accordinge lawe armes shall warred vpon one euerye cytie beare theyr owne charge strausborough shall tyme peace sende vnto zuricke may conuenientlye ten thousande poundes gunne powder many rasers wheate vnto basyll wherof shall nothyng spent tyme warre delyuer townes men vpon reasonable price shall come ayde strausborough maye spende powder muche shall nedefull warre common paye one halfe league made fyfteneyeares fyft daye ianuary knowen fridericke palatyne presydent chambre wryteth straush counsell imperiall addressed letter vnto aboute ende moneth signifiyng howe commonly reported haue made league certen townes swycerlande whereat marueyleth lyttle whiche bounden empyre enter league others without consent emperour state empyre moste men affirme trewe yet wyll credite thynge shal vnderstande selues wherfore requyreth declare playnely wryting vnto hym whiche representeth place emperour league condition agreed vpon protestauntes appoynted assemblye norinberge protestantes asse ble norinberge whyther came ambassadours certen prynces cyties muche thought howe emperour would call counsell shortly agreed vpon meane tyme consulte propounde euerye moneth aduertyse duke saxon thynges thought mete reste myght vnderstande hym thus departed fourth ides ianuarye meane whyle emperour whiche come bononye fyfte daye nouembre one twentye daye ianuarye dispatchynge assemble auspurg letter germanye sommoned parliament state auspurge eyght daye apryll chyefiy cause religion emperours coronatio bonony turky warre foure twenty daye februarye wtithout great pompe solempnitie inuested byshop rome whan fyrst taken othe cotinuall defendour byshoppes dignitie came bononye enter within lymites byshoppes iurisdiction three cardinalles sent byshop rome demaunde take fidelitie neuer iniury libertie yt churche aunswered sorte declared would lose part right signifiyng secretly parme placence belonging dukedome millan whiche townes churche rome possessed tyme departing bononie created fridericke duke mantua tymes past mantua free citie empyre afterwardes sore afflicted vprores ciuile tumultes chose lewys gonzaga gouernour expulsyng tyraunt called passeryne yeare lorde ccc xxvii whose nephewes sonne iohn france emperoure sigismunde created marque yeare mccccxxxiiij seconde daye septembre remayneth estate vntil time first came auspurge duke saxony sonne iohn fridericke trayne came behynde philip melauctho ihon iselbe agricola iustus ionas george spalatine cytie ulmes sent mete welcome emperour diuines yt protest longe myght suffered come speche fine requyred renounce protestation yeare promesse obedient henceforth men auspurge mustered eyght hondreth footemen kepe towne whan emperour hearde commaunded discharged appoynteth sweareth others theyr steade requyred one gat cytie delyuered vnto hym certen dayes came thether cattinarie newly made cardinall dyed tyme isprouke granuellane rowme lady eleuour commeth fraunce tyme also ladye elenor kynges two sonnes fraunces henry whiche bene pledge father spayne foure yeares came nowe home fraunce whyle byshop inuested themperour sent vnto king ferdinado peter paulle uerger legate great authoritie unto whome gaue co maundemet especially deuise ferdinando shuld endeuour uergerius yt pope ambassadour let hinder yt prouincial cousel germany yt wyse holden handleth comissio right diligently seketh al meanes possible hynder lutherians extended lyberalitie towardes iohn faber eckius chocleus nanseas play men made eckius cannon ratisbonne bishop legate whose presence right election ceasseth emperour came auspurg ides iune company cardinall campegius byshoppes full authoritie emperour purposed haue ryde citie middes ther ferdinando cardinall maner empyre archebyshop mentz collen rode hym hym ferdinando campegius nexte day corpus christi day emperour therfore wet deuoutly churche cardinall mentz sayde masse prynces present except duke saxon lantgraue two duke lunenboroug george brandenburge countie anholde prince woulde heare masse emperour dede wylled put preacher silence thei neither came selues yet imposed silence preacher sayd could muche assemblie appointed intent al might speake conscience two dayes proclamation made preacher sydes kepe silence til cause religion decided notwithstanding howe emperour meane time appointe certen preache without reproche proclaimed herault vnder great penaltie twenty iune parliament began emperour goyng heare masse maner comaundeth duke saxon beare sworde office duke saxon fice house saxon solenities asked aduise yt preacher said might present muche called forth office wet heare masse god seruice execute office accopanied wt george marque brandenburg none rest came masse came court parliamet frederick coute palatin excuseth long absece themperour repeteth cause calling asseblie recited log oration writte maner wheri aswel declared cause themperours departure germany spayne log abode also returne callig asseblie instituted chiefly two cause thone establishing religio sin depature hath heard great griefe tumultes commotion haue bene germany turkyshe warre cosidering turmoyle late turkes haue made hongary taken beigrade turk victorye hongary many fortes castels slayne kynge lewis wonne towres fortress betwixt riuers saue draue spoyled brent whole countrey slayne ful many thousad sin also haue inuaded slauonie lieng aboue goulfe uenise whence doue exceadynge muche mischiefe slaughter burnyng spoylyng destroying rauyshynge led awaye xxx thousande moste myserable captiuitie howe laste yeare made incursion austriche armye innumerable beseged chiefe citie uienna destroyed countrey farre nere tyll came almoste lincie workyng crueltie coulde imagined cuttinge sondre myddes yonge infantes deffouring rauyshing yong maiden wyues driuing awaye lyke sorte beastes whiche tyme fully determyned haue comen whole turk crueltie power wrote brother ferdinando prynces captaynes beseged uienna shoulde defende valeauntly loke certenly commyng hearyng turke leuid sege chaunged purpose supposyng moste requisite sette thynges quiet italy conferre byshop clement establyshyng religion germany intent yt peace cocorde one vniformitie religion place turke may better resysted handes stronger army sent hym haue bene al toke uienna present caried armie back agayne yet lefte behynde hym border garysons captaines vexe hongary austriche also stiria place nere seyng hath limites extended vnto doubte next occasio wyll retourne greater power vtter destruction especially germanye wherfore neful requisite cosulte nowe houge cruell ennemy whiche seketh brynge men vnder subiection yea bannyshe quyte bondes nature may resisted repulsed discomfited also subdued vaquished dryuen europe wherunto haue nede contributaries greater ayde men mony highe byshop hath promysed parte largely liberally although hathe bene charge coronation bononie selfe alone whiche hath cost hym great quantitie treasure yet holye necessary businesse wyll doe whiche shall become estate lykewyse brother kyng ferdinando whiche nowe set forth strong bulwarke christendom chiefly germany flake turkyshe rage also kynges prynces wil faile helpe v wherin hath wrytten alreadye wyll hande reste hath bene dissention religio euer synce first begynnyng empyre great discomforte according office dutie intendyng prepare remedy tyme made decree wormes common assentes whiche bene obserued germany bene yeares past sore afflicted sedicion commonaltie wycked secte anabaptistes sondry assembly touchyng nothynge coulde concluded hytherto thinkyng presens shoulde auayleable herein hath called assemblie intent euery man may herein propounde wil writing matter may muche soner easely vnderstade determined wyll cause empyre thynge shall concerne office dewtie loue beareth common wealth countrey requyreth others would bryng hyther lyke mind affection euery man parte prynces deliberatio taken iudged mete first treate relygion fourth daye consistory emperour prynces cardinall oration cardinall campega campege made oration latin exhorting whole numbre present matter religion would folowe obey emperour commending vertue deuotio wil name high byshop endeuoure maye professe one fayth mindes reconciled might moue warre turke done ambassadours austriche coplais ambassadour austriche come declare ouerthro haue turke desyre ayde marque george electour saxony duke lunenburge lantgraue intreate emperour would heare confession doctrine comprysed wrytinge commaundeth writing exhibited confession protestantes layde downe agayne thei muche thing concerneth estimatio lyfe landes goodes also euerlasting saluation happely thyng hathe bene wyse reported vnto hym dede requyre hym instantlye heard emperour commaundeth come home house next daye wryting deliuered hym nowe agayne vrge hym beseche hym earnestlye could deuise saying howe thought ful little haue bene denyed seing content heare others inferiours muche matter lesse importaunce would alter nothyng purpose requyre leaue boke tyll suche tyme hath bene read opely graunted came next daye audience prynces state emperour hym selfe present recite ouer afterwardes delyuer vnto hym wrytten bothe latin dutche shall doubte thyng offer declaration case matter determined present refuse abyde counseell often tymes promysed looked emperour whiche layne wynter nouembretyl march bononie place bishop rome endeuoured muche myght appease controuersie religion without counsel meanes knewe please clement best whose intent case matter could quieted ge tle meanes shuld oppressed force armes therfore xxvj june calleth owne hous ambassadours al city declareth vnto frederick palsgraue howe assemblye spire decree made wherunto moste parte consent right glad certen others contemned sory wherfore requyred swarue away rest orels shewe reason obey hereunto aunswered ambassadours city protestauntes done nothing contrary dutie haue lesse desyre elder haue perfourme fayth obedience woulde knowe cause dyd admytte decre desyre tyme make aunswer seuenth iuly put vp aunswere wrytyng effecte lyke vnto whiche sent yeare ambassadours italy two dayes emperour causeth one demaunde duke saxo felowes whether wyll exhibite thynge saye nothing el brief somme confession whiche haue delyuered already commaundeth ambassadours city saye conscience sake kepe decree spyres drawe article briefly thynges founde selues greued delyuereth confessio saxonie resydue prynces skanned agayne diuines amonges whome faber eckius pryucipall consultation protestates doctryne wrote confutation whiche prynces heard red many iudged much extreme thought mete certen chosen reade ouer wrytynges qualyfie opinion preuayled whiche sayde shoulde thus exhibyted emperour whole matter referred vnto hym meane tyme strausborough constance memming lindaue present emperour confession confession zwinglians doctryne touchyng lordes supper beleued otherwyse duke saxon fellowes emperour debatyng matter byshoppes legate framed aunswer doctrine saxon sheweth vnto prynces fyrste daye august wyndyng vp vehement harde co maunding obserue vnder paine outlawing cousel ye prynces thing mitigated wherfore third daye auguste sendeth al state declareth frederick palsgraue hath long much consulted vpon co fession saxon doctryne hath also commaundeth certen honest well learned men examyne iudge godly therin consent churche whiche haue done accordingly haue declared myndes wrytynge whiche also alloweth confutation confession rehearsed ordre deuided saxon bookes two partes first part conteined xxj chapter doctrine receiued reiected certen thinges partely admitted partly refused alledginge manye testimony father counsell forsoke good thinges refused workes deserue nothing iustification ascribed faith vnto workes also churche congregatio godly make satisfaction sinnes sainctes intercessours v thinges admitte sorte ceremony matter receiued moreouer true body bloud christe sacrament christ vnder kyndes wyne bread cleane chaunged allowed article confession people bound confesse euery yere easter tellyng synnes diligently receiue lordes supper beleue seuen sacramentes church prouided alwayes man appointed instructe people byshoppes leaue consent moreouer lawes decree churche obserued suche place abolyshed restored seconde parte comprehendeth fyue thynges chiefly communion lordes supper vnder bothe kyndes terme reiected emperour desyred herein would followe consent custome christendome marriage priestes sayeth hym maruell wyll requyre syns neuer vsed apostle tyme vnto day wherfore may wyse graunted masse admitted masse sacrifice consonant vse romane churche case altered reiected also affirmed masse sacryfice quicke dead neyther priuate masse oughte abolyshed daniell prophecied long antichriste shoulde come dayly offeryng shoulde cease whiche thyng fayre exposition daniel yet come passe saue place masse layd downe aulters destroyed image brent whyche church nothyng songe read lyghtes burne longer deede saying prophet represented verified wherfore men must take dilygent hede geue none occasion comyng antichriste monasticall vowes grounded aswell vpon authoritie newe testament olde wherfore deserue punyshement whiche contrary profession haue forsaken ordre bishop haue authoritie teache also gouerne common wealth therfore ought abridged ryght priuilege whiche haue obteyned liberalitie elder abstayne fleshe dayes forboden faste lent ceason cofesse good ghostly father synnes obstinate frowardnes christian lybertie beyng recyted confessed howe many thynges woulde refourmed emperour promyseth doe endeuour thynges maye redressed state churche also refourmed sayeth howe trusteth surely muche agreed vpon dyuerse thynges protestantes wyl retourne bosome churche submitte selues vnto hym whiche doe nothynge maye bolde craue loke hande must nedes becometh protectour defendour churche wherunto prynce saxony aunswered selfe fellowes muche promised fyrst went reconsiliation religion woulde doe euer myghte saufe conscience moreouer errour coulde founde doctrine proued testimony scripture would stande furthermore requyred declaration geuen nowe seynge doctryne article admytted refused requisite shoulde confyrme theyr thynges playne manifest reason wherfore desyre haue copie confutation two dayes emperour taken long delyberation sayde shoulde haue copie vnder condition put forth part therof prynte also wyll haue disputation matter requyryng ordered hym shewe hym howe receyue vppon condition next daye whiche syxt august lantgraue departed lantgraue departeth auspurg thence small company leauing deputes emperour toke displeasauntly commaunded senate shoulde suffer none departe citie posternes nyght ceason nexte daye sendyng duke saxon fellowes dissembled displeasure requyryng tary tyll later ende wyll make cocord excuse lantgraue wyues sycknes shewe hym howe hath lefte deputes saye wyll departe notwithstandynge maruell see gate kept watche warde hath ben thus accustomed assemblye empyre cesar excuseth matter done sor murther committed dissention betwene germaynes spanyardes lyke trouble chaunce hereafter wyl nothing therein without makyng hym fyrst priuie whiche high marschall empyre duke answereth thyng happen wherin duty requyred wyll ready commeth hym duke saxon marschall empyre warder remoued gate daye tyme ended warre florence wherof shal somewhat declare waye tyme rome sacked sayd byshop taken florentine expulsed house medices ayded frenchemen sege naples byshop restored intent myght reuenge kynsfolkes warre florence sending ambassadours spayne made league emperour promysing emonges thinges crowne hym case wyll punyshe florentynes demerites emperour pope made league ye emperour content shortly arriueth gene thyther came ambassadours florence craue pardon unto whome cesar sore blamed made aunswere albeit deserued great punyshement yet might fact pardoned case would receiue againe byshop rome way none haue peace come home answere matter longe muche debated opinion one two preuayled whiche sayde would defende lybertie vttermoste power inferred byshop also emperour hym selfe long warres muche impoueryshed wanted money notwithstading whan emperour come bonony thei sent ambassadours thei byshoppes counsel would receiued wherfore beseged army bishop rome emperour whan prolonged warres almoste space one yere moneth florence rendred august fell composition ferdinando gonzago emperours general armie afterwardes emperour addressing moste effectuall letter appointed alexander medices vnto whome promysed margaret bastarde daughter marriage prince ruler builded maruelous strong castell begynning seruitude bondage florence loseth libertie towne one rendred byshop rome clement chopped heades certen senatours set new ordre commune wealth assured alexander gouernour according emperours promise purpose agayne muche debatinge ides august seuen chosen eche syde frame matter concorde chatholyke syde byshop auspurg henry duke brunswike certen chosen accord religion two lawayers thre deuines wimpine eckius cocleus protestates george marque bradenburg iohn friderick saxon two lawyer thre diuines melancthon brentius schnepsius agreed vpon diuerse thinges chief controuersie masse marriage priestes lordes supper monasticall vowes iurisdiction byshoppes especially masse uotaries herein woulde catholikes nothyng relent matter though dyd myslyke yet sayde myght suffered vntyll counsell permitted also priestes haue wyues suche maried already others auoyding trouble touchyng power iurisdiction byshoppes saxony grauted lantgraues men duke lunenburgh norinberge would allowe toke lesse numbre eyther side thre melancthon two ciuilias eckius many fyne could agree whylest consulting together emperour doth solicite george marque brandenburge byshop mentz others familie protestantes laboured duke saxon friderick palsgraue erle nasso george truckesse thei leaue enterprise sought drawe awaye duke saxon reste pryncipal desyred inuested duckdome custome empyre denied vnlesse would first reconcile self churche rome tolde playnely vnlesse wold obeye would take wardshyp nephewe albert sonne brother casimire went perswade lantgraue case would agree vnto emperour ulriche duke wyrtemberge restored agrement myght emperours meanes betwene hym erle nassoe rule chattes assemblie byshop rome graunted kyng ferdinando maner plate ornamentes golde syluer church germany turkyshe warre also take subsydie clergie prince woulde suffer sollicityng emperour make yt decree frustrate xviij august erasmus roterdame wryteth cardinall campegius friburge howe emperours erasmus writeth campegius power dede great men doe acknowledge name germanes acknowledge rule rather obey luther doctryne sowen abroade throughout germany farre neare muche chayne mischiefe reacheth ocean sea vnto vttermoste border swycerlande nowe emperour shall attempt accomplyshe byshop rome desyre thynges feared lest shall haue fewe commende doinges moreouer great daunger turke stande whose power force europe skant able resyste power turk thynge fyght vnwyllyng souldiours manyfest mo example one emperour doubtlesse nature inclyned peace neuerthelesse certen desteny haled inforced warres fraunce italy haue bene sore afflicted wyth warre nowe many yeares warre wyll doe harme reste well forseen men commonly perswaded thynges done instigation counsell hyghe byshop feare lest great parte peril redounde emperour selfe thei loue sectes dede worthy punyshement yet ought rather respecte preseruation common wealth state churche tymes past full miserable whan arrians pagan donatistes manycheis sowed abroade opinion also barbarous nation made warre notwithstandyng waded daungers length verely tyme selfe wyl laste bring remedy also vnto daungerous disease bohemers bohemers borne al though acknowledge byshop rome also permitted lutherias amisse conceipt verye muche yet great deale lesse euyll warre seuent daye septembre emperour sendeth home house pryntes state catholicke none two houres duke saxos fellowes commaunding others asyde sauyng brother ferdinando byshoppes constance hispalia granuellan truckesse speaketh fredericke palsgraue wyse empeoracion ye protestates trusted assuredly beyng frendly gently warned confession exhibited would haue taken parte hope vaine yet request prince content certen chosen eyther partie conferre make agrement thus brought agayne newe hope concorde nowe vnderstandeth great grief dissente others chiefest opinion whiche cleane contrary expectation wold neuer haue thought beyng fewe numbre wold haue induced suche newe fanglednes auncient sacred custome whole vniuersal churche chouse vnto selues seuerall religion farre differinge fro bishop rome religion king ferdinandos al prince state empire yea kinges prince whole worlde much desire haue generall counsel haue quiet decree made whiche chiefly coueteth quietnes wyll deuise byshop rome christia prynces haue one called soone agree vppon place wyll vndertake brynge passe yet vnder condition meane tyme shall obserue religion prynces doe procure counsell suffer gere hange waueringe prohibite newe fanglednes euery man sayeth plainely howe sore preiudiciall woulde hym others make delyberate aunswere neyther aunswere emperour haue brought vp newe secte swarued fro christian churche refused counsell gyue hym great thankes desyryng hym shortely possible maye germany lawfull free counsell laste former assemblye spyres agreed vpon receiue ceremony romyshe churche one abolished good conscience emperour long consultation aunswereth agayne truckesse hath red ouer diligently disceptation fyndeth swarue muche christian churche marueylyng also lyghtnes parte would graunte muche agayne styffenes would take theyr offer craue counsell decree empyre take place refused last decree protested appealed whiche appellatio notwithstanding maketh none accompte reason woulde lesse parte comfourmable howe small handfull compared great byshop hym rest christian prynces wherfore desyreth knowe whether wyl maynteyne talke discourse matter wyll spare payne trauayle brynge attonement whiche shall refuse doe yet perseuer theyr purpose muste doe becommeth protectour churche nere night gyueth leaue take aduisement tyll morrowe next daye whan state assembled howre appoynted pontane ciuilian set aunswere duke companion emperoure dede doe vnderstande whole matter wyll geue credite fyrste tale doubt theyr doctryne shall adiudged testimonie godly free counsell agreable god worde wherfore lesse marueyled dyd receyue suche thynges late offered graunted appellation necessitie obiected againste parte decree made agaynste doctryne gospell maner primatiue churche reste doe obeye agayne counsell promysed begynnyng assemblie longe decree made onelye also assembly empyre thys euer opinion men wherfore seyng haue appealed vnto hym also free counsell truste wyll disanulle thynge tyll sentence lawfully geuen whether lesse parte controuersie ought gyue place discussed place appellation whiche done necessitie wyll make aunswere counsell therfore fourmer assembly haue determined vpon counsell beseche hym woulde breake decree gyue co sent herein good wylles desyre state also offereth paynes haue matter debated rendre great thankes manifest done already much submitte selues laste marueleth byshoppes syde woulde graunte many thynges easy coniecture therby iudgement therfore vayne treate therof much let hynderaunce matter wyll agaynst deuyse howe peace maye kepte throughout empyre offered begynnynge meane tyme wyll doe nothyng whiche truste wyll allowed god lawfull counsell beyng commaunded syde last called agayne much matter weyghty emperour sayd woulde take good aduisement therein desyred duke saxon whiche chiefest woulde depart deede georde truckesse uehus doctour ciuile decree made deuysed reconcilement touchyng masse uowes vayne wherfore emperour chouseth certen romysh relygion make decree effecte wherof duke saxon fellowes exhibited confession doctryne whiche afterwardes confuted testymonies holy scripture howe great paynes trauel state matter brought conclusion receyued certen opinion churche certen refuse wherfore declare selfe howe desyrous peace howe coueteth doe nothyng vpon wyll singular humanitie gentlenes graunteth space take aduisement vntyll xv april intent maye meane whyle waye determyne themselues whether content article professe byshop rome doe rest christendome meane tyme wylleth men kepe peace throughout empyre neither duke saxo fellowes suffer meane time new thynge prynted concerning religion within dominios also alter nothing el neyther allure compelle man vnto religion let subiestes would followe olde religion moreouer disturbe religiouse persones may saye seruice heare confession minister lordes supper wonted facion shall consulte state punyshe anabaptistes sacramentaries fynally hath bene counsell longe tyme manye thynges refourmed wel laitie clergie therfore wyll labour sollicite byshop prynces within halfe yeare one shall counsell promysed sommoned begynne yeare duke saxon fellowes consultation set pontane make aunswere decree mentioneth theyr doctryne confuted scripture co fesse graunte thynke thus grounded vpon scripture nothynge founde vngodly would haue proued manyfestly obteined copie consutation notwithstading lest passed ouer scripture touche stone doctryne silence haue made aunswere sone hearde red muche could beare memorye whiche al dyd aunswere euery partycular want copie yet doubte would please emperour peruse shoulde fynde theyr doctrine yet fyrme stable neyther pearsed shaken theyr aduersaries weapon whe thus farre proceded delyuereth apologie emperour whiche fridericke palsgraue receiued apologie deliuered receiued emperours beckenynge whome ferdinando whyspered eare delyuer agayne pontane proceadeth decreed shoulde alter publyshe anye thynge prynte haue last assemblye touchyng thyng made aunswere thought sufficiet yet mynd wyll doe nothynge may iustly reproued moreouer haue nothynge doe sectes although doctrine trewe whiche professe yet dyd neuer brynge man compulsion wyll hereafter touchyng anabaptistes doe contempne sacrament altar neuer suffered suche kynde men within theyr lymites theyr diuines haue preached agaynst anabaptistes haue also bene punyshed suche sorte suche sectes take roote remayne emonges fynally muche matter weyghty importace whiche verely concerneth eyther euer lastyng saluation damnation losse soules ambassadours fellowes whiche absent haue nede aduertyse thinges doe earnestly beseche hym graunte copie decree intent may consider condescende vpon aunswere agaynste daye next daye emperour sent worde emp ye protest prynce electour brandenburge stoutelye affyrme theyr doctryne trewe godly maruell enough consyderynge howe onlye confuted nowe euen authoritie scripture also condempned former counselles longe syns marueyleth muche doe ascrybe vnto hym resydue prynces errour false religion shoulde trewe saye shoulde bothe duke saxon progenitours also whiche haue kepte maynteyned religion accompted heretikes wherfore perswaded graunte theyr doctryne establyshed testimonye goddes worde syngular clemencie loue peace hathe wylled decree thus deuysed herein hathe abased hym selfe ouer muche therfore requyreth wyll admytte lyke case prynces doe consyder selues vnlesse doe great occasion shall gyue muche michief whiche shal rendre strayght accompte god one daye moreouer howe neuer set forth wryting prayer mixt threatnings lawfull spoyle men afterwardes excuse thus though hath sustayned losse shoulde make restitution concernynge apologie wrytten confutation shewed would admytte disputation relygion muche maye nother part office cause hath refused vnlesse wyll allowe confirme decree wyll doe shall see cause thynge whiche shall come estate office marque sayde moreouer howe knewe trauell paynes reste prynces state taken controuersie myght ended quietly nowe besought way selues howe muche bothe priuate profyte also common wealthes obey emperour admitte decree whiche vnlesse wyll doubtlesse al state wyl herein soeuer themperour shal comaunde haue conspiracie papistes againste protestates promysed hym already vpon fidelititie wil quarell spende al substaunce bloud life also fynishe vp matter hath promysed theim againe bende hytherwardes force power departe limites empire haue brought passe commaunded saye muche prynces state agayne protestauntes maynteyne theyr doctryne agreable god worde whiche gate hell notable resist declared wryting lately presete decree made alowe saufe conscience wherfore thei desyre haue copie therof intent good deliberation maye frame determinate aunswere whiche shall conformable god worde shall permitted al cause wyll sticke spende lyfe goodes sake heare prince state haue bounden selues emperour suche sorte little maruell consyderynge haue giuen none occasion nothing whiche ready example auncesters emperour nede requyreth wyll last sayed man ought spoyled goodes protest spoyle doe confesse also herein nothynge culpable touchynge religious house haue oftentymes protested vse matter vntyll counsell maye certenly sene perceyued seeke owne priuate lucre commoditie muche deliberation emperour aunswered agayne marque brandenburge wyl confesse graunt baoste religio hath also regard conscience soules health well wyll cleaue auncient religion olde father decree made nothyng chaunged wyll allowe well good hath occasion gyuen hym deuyse rest decree made wherby newe spronge vp sectes maye plucked vp rote germany set vp quietnes aunciet religion churche fayth cerimonies estimation whiche thing belongeth chiefly office dutie except wyll ordered wyll declare hyghe byshop kynges vse counsell ayde herein unto saie haue gyuen none occasion offence much obiected preacher great occasion comotion rusticall warre wherin almoste hondreth thousande slayne protest accused sedition many thinges haue bene done dominion open reproche contempt mockery byshop rome hym state also therfore clere without blame would make moreouer prynces state haue priuate affection according duty offered assistaunce especially seynge howe wyll admitte waye vnitie concorde fynally wylleth comaundeth restore theyr drone bee desyre restored hyue former estate abbottes moukes ecclesiastical person whiche haue expulsed heareth dayly complayntes troubled almoste continuallye restitution lytle respyte protestantes replie thus muche obtayne copie decree tyme consulte whole matter foly make discoursynge thereof wherfore committe whole cause vnto god thei repose chiefe hope saluation charged sedition common thei vtterly clere matter tyme howe spared neither cost peryll paynes manifestly knowen men cause originall sedition declared also foure yeares synce assembly spyres wherfore well done lay thyng charge therein suffer iniurie man wyll trye lawe matter refuse abyde iudgement wherfore beseche hym woulde conceaue hainous displeasure incensed wt hatred malice cosidering al haue well commaundemet thyng el state thus sayde axed leaue departed leauing certayne cousellers deputes went archebyshoppes mentz excuse ye protestatee trier also palsgraue sent declare vnto electour brandenburg spake gening ayde assistaunce defence religion done without commaundement whiche thynge also hyd emperour shewyng howe none occasion ennemitie displeasur wherfore case conceaued euyll opinion desyred leaue prince saxony content purgation bad againe loke al good wyll frendshyp hande next day gone emperour calleth hym state first commaudeth ambassadours city truckesse shuld departe end assemblie declareth bene done duke saxon fellowes city strausborough constance memmyng lyndaue exhibited seuerall byll selues sheweth howe wyll treate lyke case debated matter deluge rome selande empyre chiefly turkyshe warre tyme rome ryuer tiber ouerflowed exceadingly great terrour citie reason wynde blewe sore streame droue backe course water sea wherfore much hurte lyke deluge cruell hollande zelande sea brake ouer walles made kepe party drowned al countrey farre nere finally xiiij daye octobre whan al state besydes protestauntes called assembled courte decree red ambassadours city requyryng copye sayde naye repeted one twyse al moste parte allowed auspurge ulmes hale franckeforth desyred delyberation eight day deputes duke saxon fellowes declare vnto archebishop mentz whiche chief emonge prynces maye haue religion quiet vntill counsell also contented become cotributaries money ayde towardes turkyshe warre wherfore next daye beyng called courte red certen tenure peace wherin comprised whiche consented vnto decree made rose contention ambassadours affirming concerned nothynge howe ought vttered playner wordes take awaye ambiguitie said would moue emperour two dayes emperour sent home house strausborough fellowes state commaundeth cofutatio zwilius doctrine confutation doctryne red openly wrytyng long tedious also touched lordes supper ful bytter sower author therof john faber eckius argument odiouse left kind excusation wherby kyndle emperour prynces agaynst ende muche religion professed opinion contrary al reste allowed moste heynous errour sacramet also cast image church abolyshed masse plucked downe college builded tymes past lyberalitie kynges emperours maynteyned sondry sectes dispersed bookes wrytten suche matter throughout germany therfore requyreth eftsones come amendement receyue agayne auncient religion otherwise wyll fayle thing office requireth aunwer long confutation charged many thinges vntrue ther city nothyng aunswer done ordre extremely punyshed wherfore seing thei clere coscience cause weightie cofutation ouerlong aunswered make certificat home city desyre fyrst therfore haue copie secondarely credite geuen accusation suche tyme pourgation heard examined matter wyll thyng sake emperour sayeth wyll take aduisement fyst daye weth marque brandeburge haue copie weightie cause denied ye duke saxony disputatio fayth nowe prohibited desyre reconciled retourne agayne churche content shall heare confutation red agayne one twyse chargeth professe kynde doctrine al prynces state gyue ayde turke vnlesse forsake theyr stubburnes wyll worke counsell byshop rome kynges shal become hym make sute obtayne copie graunted haue peace quietnes religion tyll begynnynge counsell therin haue cause decided wyl meane time geue theyr ayde turke farforth power wyll extende el could graunte nothing maques promysed petitioner emperour noone red vnto graunt peace wherein conteyned suche receiued decree rehearsed deputes duke saxon fellowes wherunto aunswered lyke case touched nothyng desyred knowe emperours pleasure herein meane whyle ulmes auspurge franckeforth halle forsaken decree made concerning religion vrged sore haue cousel faber eckius craue great rewarde prince makyng confutation promyse heceforth bestowe theyr trauayle defence romyshe religion dyuerse others sought preferment meanes luther dede faber afterwardes kyng ferdinando made byshop uienne wherupon erasinus roterdame wont say poore luther maketh many men ryche merely howe poore luther made many ryche meane ceason saxon fellowes put vp supplication emperour intreating hym establyshe peace throughout empyre man put trouble daunger religio coulde obtayned wryte epistle state makyng brief rehearsall thinge hath bene done desyryng name prynces put later ende decree emonges reste muche haue sued peace vayne saye howe graunte none ayde turkyshe warre ouer prouided decree shall haue place iudgement counsell chamber whiche allowe decree made requyre may chaunged amended el beare parte charge whiche chambre requyreth tyme thus denounced departed next daye beyng xij nouembre shewed fyft booke howe marque albert brandenburge kyng pole made duke pruselande emperour beyng sued vnto walter cronberge disallowed treatie copacte made dammage empyre xiiij daye nouembre pronounceth none effecte fyft daye emperours presence decree recited state long discourse decree auspurg handlyng matter emperour decreeth shuld longer suffered teache otherwyse lordes supper hath bene obserued hytherto masse eyther common priuate nothyng altered chyldren confyrmed chresme sycke folkes annoynted oyle consecrated image remoued taken awaye restored opinio denye man haue fre wyll receyued beastly also contumeliouse god nothyng taughte agaynst authoritie magistrate opynion fayth iustifieth take place sacramentes church numbre place accustomed ceremony churche rite obsequies dead suche obserued benefice vacant imployed vpon mete persones suche priestes men clergie whiche haue maried tyme depriued benefice whiche immediatly assembly shal geuen others suche forsakyng theyr wyues wyll retourne olde profession absolued byshop may restore consent byshop rome legate others haue refuge place banyshed extremely punyshed priestes honest conuersation apparell decent commonly auoyde sclaunder preacher exhorte people heare masse praye virgyn mary sainctes kepe holy dayes fasting dayes abstayne meates forbodene releue poore tell monkes howe may forsake theyr profession ordre briefly nothyng altered religion shall otherwyse lose bodye goodes abbey pulled downe reedified soeuer hath bene taken awaye clergie restored wonted ceremony rite may accomplyshed suche follower olde religion dwellyng within lymites cotrary parte allowe decree shall receyued protectio empire shall flitte whether lyste without hynderaunce byshop rome shalbe called vpon apoynte counsell place conuenient within syxe monethes afterwarde may begynne shortly may furthest within yeares space thynges ratified establyshed al exception appellation made contrary voyde none effect intent decree may take place obserued cocerning religion force power god hath geue shalbe wholy applied hereunto lyfe bloude also spent quarell duryng parliament luther commaundement prynce coburge border frankony intent myght nerer auspurge case matter requyred aduyse counsell though absent yet intent myght luth wrote booke ye byshoppes commo benefit wrote booke byshoppes prelate assemblye wherein sheweth state churche hath bene vnder byshop rome wicked doctrine shamefull errours moste weightye wordes admonisheth dutie chargeth cruell bloudy mindes agayne exhorteth let slippe occasion nowe redresse euyll sheweth howe doctrine agreable bookes prophetes apostle proueth vaine soeuer consulte imagine god malyce threatheninge emperour byshops melancthon discouraged careful mynde owne cause posterity sake gaue hym selfe wholy pensiuenes wepynge mournynge luther knewe therof comforteth hym luther comforteth melancton sondrye letter muche mennes matter cause almyghtie ggd admonyshed hym layinge al thought care parte caste whole burthen vpon hym sayeth doest thou thus afflicte tourment thy selfe god hath geuen sonne v tremble feare doe syghe lamente sath stronger wil hath geuen v great benefite forsake v lyghter matter whye shoulde feare worlde whiche christe hath vanquyshed defende euyll matter doe chaunge pourpose cause iust godlye truste god promyses certenly deuyll take v lyfe christ liueth reigneth euer whose protection consisteth veritie wyll cease v vnto worldes ende wyth v beseche shall founde churche doe thynke byshop rome aduersaries synners dede dynerse wayes yet christe lyer whose cause haue hande let kynges nation fret fume muche euer lyste dwelleth heauen shall laughe skorne god hathe gouerned maynteined cause hetherto without counsell shall also henceforth bryng ende wyshed luther opinion mistraditions touchyng lawes tradition men wryte aunswere harde fyrst comaundement al prophetes also doe codempne suche maner workes may bodely exercyse come one worshyppyng idolatry agremet vayne loked neyther depose byshop rome neyther true doctrine safetie longe popery shall endure wyll haue lordes supper communicated wholy geue place aduersaries whiche holde indifferent doe well arbitremet decree suffer thynge vsed churche whiche hathe god worde beare crye condempne whole churche saye churche violently taken oppressed tyrannye communion deuided middes therfore holden excused whole synagoge excused captiuitie babylon kepte lawe church oppressed wt tyranny excused moses ceremony beyng force prohibited coulde doe take hede wyse graunt byshops ouer muche iurisdiction lest trouble ensue hereafter treaty concorde doctryne cleane agaynst mynde labour spent vayne vnlesse byshop rome woulde abolyshe kyngdome condempne doctryne whye seeke vniformitie allowe mainteyne olde errours condemyne openly wherfore dissimulation falshode whatsoeuer go labour sore appereth ceremony let fyrst restore doctryne fayth workes let suffer churche haue minister wyll doe dutie requyre monkes maye set agayne papist accused rerages possession let restore v agayne manye innocent godly men haue murthered let restore many soules destroied wicked doctrine let restore great rychesse gotten fraude disceiptfully let restore god glory many contumely dishonored whan shall haue made satisfactio thynges shall talke vnto whome possession bucer laboreth co corde belongeth luther certen others differed opinion touching lordes supper whiche catholykes reioysed rest muche lamented bucer duke saxon procurement went auspurge luther agrement receyued suche aunswere mislyked much went thece zwynglius zwycers intent might ioyned nerer mynde opinion state thynges stoode thus full displeasure lantgraue maketh league syxe yeares city zuricke basill strausborough lantgraue made league wt strausbotough zurick basyn attempted force religion shoulde ayde one concluded nouembre tyme emperour addresseth letter duke saxon commaunding collon xxi decembre certen weightie affayres common wealth whiche receiued xxviii nouembre daye came messenger letter archebishop mentz wherein wrytten emperour required hym cal assemblie prince electours create kyng romaynes wherfore cited appeare collon xxix decembre appertaineth byshops office hath bene declared whiche thinge one knowen duke saxon dispatchyng letter lantgraue prynces city protestantes prayeth exhorteth mete smalcalde xxii decembre neuerthelesse meane tyme sendeth spedely collon iohn frederick sonne hym certen priuie counsell daye appoynted emperour whome declareth citation archebishop mentz rightly orderly done creation king romaine right libertie empyre infrynged also lawe charles fourth broken wherfore wyl allowe ratifie enterprise assembled smalcalde deuise league offensiuely league protestantes smalcalde defensiuely unto subscribed immediatly prince moreouer albert gebart erles manssteld maidenborough bremen strausborough ulmes costance lindaue ming capedowne heilbrune ruteling biberack isne receiue sorte first infourme city therof within syx wekes make directe answere wil herein furthermore decreed follicite ambassadours king denmarke duke pomerane megelbourg city embeck northeme franckfourth brunswick gotinge minda hannobria hildesseme lubecke stetine hauon townes byshop rome vnderstode yt end assemblie auspurg coplait pope kynge poole wrote letter kyng pole others trusted assuredly authoritie presence emperour either haue quenched quieted luther heresie vpo hope cause chiefly came mete emperour bononie intent might encourage forward notwithstanding owne accorde wel willing thing ben brought passe religio bene staied many men soules saued heresie nowe dauger might remedy haue ben foud turkish fury vnderstadeth al well theperours also letter legate wise reformed waxed also obdurate yt wyll god gouerneth shyp peter time tepestuouse susteyneth greatest part whole care consultinge wt pope sayler cardinal cafinde better remedy tha predecessours haue vsed yt general cousel wherfore doth admonish hym synce matter brought issue either hym selfe presentlye el hys deputes woulde holye cause entendeth shortly may appoynte one italy place conuenient letter dated first daye december xxiiii daye decembre prynces confederated smalcalde protestauntes letter ferdinando wryte vnto emperour howe heare commonly bruted pourposeth create brother ferdinando kynge romaynes maketh great sute authoritie ryght prince electours haue herein lawe charles fourth howe emperour dead chosen name whole empyre knowen men notwithstandinge alyue helth suche chaunce happened howe archebyshop hath cited collon prescripte lawe agaynst custome empyre heare moreouer howe residue electours wyll come thyther requeste accomplyshe sute ferdinando conuenaunt promyse report spread farre neare wherfore haue thought good admonishe hym certen thynges al leuer abstayne suche kynde talke yet muche loue hym theyr conntrey especiallye lybertie therof haue receyued auncesters agayne later ende worlde many thinges done captiously crastely otherwyse doe fyrst therfore knoweth ryght well circumspectly howe depely wordes bondes bounde hym selfe empyre gaue fayth othe woulde obserue lawe carolyne whereupon lybertie empyre chiefly dependeth howe promysed cofirmeth othe yt would neither self thing suffer certenly conuenauntes may infrynged broken chaunged without consent aduyse state nowe case lyfe prosperitie kyng romanes shuld chosen naturall brother makynge suite labour seeth hym selfe howe directly againste lawe againste ryght lybertie empyre agaynste promyse conuenaunt fayth oweth common wealth confyrmed solemne othe moreouer howe incommodiouse also hym howe chargeable whole empyre haue two ruler one tyme whome must obeye woulde sory suche thynge shoulde layde charge breakynge fidelytie also vnto sloughtsulnes defending co mon wealth therfore ernestly beseche impute writing loue coutrey world would call remembraunce thynges past office aucthoritie prohibite creation new kinge woulde consyder well wyth hym selfe many euils mischiefes thinge wyll hereafter geue occasion vnlesse forseen signifyeng howe wryte also touching matter resydue electours trusting wyll worke profit co mon wealth endeuour diuision made amonges state empyre rest doe muche sake habilitie power wyl extende afterwardes duke saxon writeth seuerall letter prynces hys college muche somoned collon arche duke saxon letter prince byshop mentz therfore hath sent thither sonne certen cousayle shal name shalbe requisite requireth leaue enterprise waye selues preiudice discommoditie wilbe vnto al theyr posteritie breake right libertie honour empyre desyreth also suche thinges sonne counsellours haue treate woulde vse selues may appeare perceiued loue common wealth countrey duke luneburge lantgraue counte anhald erles mansfelde wrote vnto electours time long letter effect admonishing righte ernestlye doe suche open wronge lawes countrey sayeng howe reported matter handled brybes promesses whiche also openly agaynst lawe caroline laste decembre well prince city named comon assent wryte letter emperour wherin recite treatie religion auspurge long sued peace aunswer made also maner decree made afterwarde al selfe mitigate wordes electour brandeburge affirming made compact rest prince owne defence offende others yet authoritie committed chambre imperiall decree purporteth whome doubtful thinge apperteyneth force violece seyng aucesters haue shewed many testimony great good wyll progenitours beseche muche hath mitigated saying electour brandenburge woulde also qualifie deede take away terrour confiscation intent may assured vntyll ende godlye free counsell shall nede feare violence cause emperour alledged create king romains first comunication wt prince collo first cause creating kyng romaine ye rule sondry realmes nation could always germany agayne yt state christendom troublesome namely germany reason dissention religion violent power turkes late sedition rurall warre disobedience within empyre wherfore thought necessary profit common wealth kyng romaynes chosen vnder hym head empyre absence wyttie cyrcumspect industrious great power loued peace concorde skilfull matter empyre euery poynte suche one myght repose whole truste confidece knoweth none mete charge brother ferdinando king boheme hongary realmes dominion defence vnto germany turkyshe oultrage prince electours delyberation intreate emperour woulde forsake germany sette plante himselfe persisteth stiffe opinion conferrynge counsel together fyft daye ianuary proclayme ferdinando kynge romaynes duke saxon muche laye hym sonne protested election faultie shewed cause coulde allowe longe departed auspurge brute ferdinando obtayne dignitie afterwardes went collon aquon ferdinado crowned kyng xvj day ianuary ferdinando proclaimed kyng romaine streightwayes letter dispatched al partes germany signifie cesar also commaundeth letter patentes men shall acknowledge kyng romaine therof sent seueral letter protestantes done aquon emperour wet brussel brabant eyght booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument eyght booke protestauntes smalcalde sent letter kinges fraunce englande agaynst sondry false reportes sollicite kyng denmarcke city sea coaste entre league league swycers admitted kyng fraunce descended almaines aunswereth letter doeth also kynge englande strife creation kyng ferdinando assemble holden franckforth also debated controuersic betwixt byshop bamberge george marque brandenburge emperour appointeth metyng spyre whether duke saxon moued come excuseth hym selfe condition put wryting whiche graunted protestauntes offer selues fyue canton geue battell z uricke wherein z wynglius slayne shortly dieth ecolampadius peace graunted protestauntes vntyll counsell christierne kyng denmarke committed pryson turke inuadeth austryche thence repulsed pope ambassadour sent duke iohn fredericke lately succedeth father condition counsell duke associate deliberation make hym full aunswere wryting first assembly smalcalde emoges thynges agreed vppon muche aduersaries aggrauate cause profession gospell manye sclaunders broughte euerye great hatred shoulde wryte pryncipally kynges fraunce englande would credite perswaded herin protest letter kynges fraunce englande wherfore xvj daye february protestauntes wryte seuerall letter one effecte knowe vndoubtedly olde complaint hath bene long tyme concernyng vice faultes clergie whiche many notable men late memory fraunce iohn gerson englande gerson collet iohn colet haue sore noted reprehended thing hath happened late yeares germany certen freers wet indulgence pardos whiche highly comended great contumelie christe lesse daunger men saluation yt got shameful vnreasonable gayne therby getly admonyshed certen good wel learned men thei abstayne suche vsage also cruelly condempned heretykes whiche gaue good counsell muche constrayned stande defence trewthe vpon whyche occasion many thynges espyed reprehe ded aduersaries whiche impudent marchadise gaue occasion offence woulde neuer quiet tyll doctryne whiche reuealyng crafty iuglyng without dewe examination condempned wycked intent might wholy oppresse haue brought great hatred emperour kynges neuerthesse truthe breakyng lyke sonne beames discouered faultes moste manifestly whiche euyl customes preposterous iudgementes crepte churche muche could denied byshop rome hym selfe whe bene exhibyted emperour state empyre assemblie wormes bene treated assembly empyre men iudging certentie reformation therof waye better free lawfull counsell wherewith emperour also content commyng spayne germany italy addicted wholy auspurge quiet matter without counsel thei discourse whole treaty auspurge hath bene rehersed howe sore decree made compelled appeale free godly cousell lest haue hurt theyr conscience offended god moste greuously afterwardes thei confute appelation false opinion sclaunders theyr aduersaries ascribe vnto bryng hatred men chieslye doctrine whiche professe authoritie magistrate dignity lawes confession exhibited auspurge doth fully aunswere matter wheren office state magistrate theyr doctrine declared god ordinauce agayne people taught owe due obedience magistrate god comaundement coscience sake may truly sayde learned men tyme doctrine haue hyghly commeded dignitie lawes magistrate former age hath done el seing also appointed god haue rule gouernment others madnes permitte doctrine whiche geue licencious lybertie take awaye obedience styre vp people wherfore dyuers thynges saye howe much sclaunders reported howe forceth much comon wealth christendome beyng kynges wysdome authoritie ryghtly infourmed matter therfore haue thought good owne purgatio wryte much vnto earnestly desyring geue credit vnto sclau ders conceaue sinistre opinion keepe theyr iudgement suspence tyll may come place make theyr purgation openly whiche thing chiefly desyre beseche also exhorte emperour weyghty importaunce matter profit whole churche would call godly free counsell germany shortly myght woulde worke extremitie vntyll suche tyme cause may lawfully decided determyned hitherto haue alwayes done duty common wealth empyre nowe professe doctrine brought daunger selfe wyll obstinacie god worde glory whereby haue better hope also wyll graunte theyr requestes herein hyghe prayse worthy coulde throughe theyr aucthoritie mediation bryng passe controuersies decided force armes vpryght iudgement abuse maye remoued church reconciled force violence done vnto men conscience finally maye vnderstande letter theyr good wylles towardes shall theyr great coforte february duke saxon summoneth fellowes smalcade xxix marche co sulte howe resiste force ennemies thynge attepted againste prynces city mentioned duke discrased sent thether sonne iohn frederick former meting agreed sollicite fredericke kyng deumarke city sea coaste saxonie touchynge league nowe met agayne rehersall made bene done meane tyme aunswere euery one made kyng dede saide howe fauoured doctrine gospel realme many bishoppes great bishop demarke resute gospell power aucthoritie reason rychesse clientes noble kyndred coulde enter league kyng concernyng countreis lieng within empyre contet henry duke megelburge excused matter deputes subscribed decree auspurge notwithstandinge would ennemy berninus prince pomerane elder brother yet maner yt whole gouernment lubecke refused muche bene great charge warres desyred myght consydered fortuned christerne kyng de marke whome thei holpe dryue realme warre desyred knowe ayde looke agayne theyr handes citie lunenbourge sayde loke theyr duke ernest would doe woulde also afterwarde consulted geuyng theyr voice sodayne ayde leuieng money continuall ayde chousyng captaines receiuing would league appointed theyr attourneis aduocates aunswere lawe emperour attempte sute parte defence adioyned selues george marque brande burge norinberge campedowne heilprune league refused decreed moreouer open crymes punished eche man dominion league made toke aduyse counsell lawyer also diuines luther taught alwayes myght resiste magistrate set forth boke matter lawyer consultation dyd affyrme howe lawes permitte lawes permitte yt inferiour magistrate maye som case resist yt superiour case resiste howe nowe come point lawes made mencion luther confessed playnlye knewe lawfull gospell doeth impugne abolyshe polityke lawes hathe alwayes taught agayne muche doubtful daugerous tyme many thynges may happen lawe selfe also force conscience necessitie may dryue v take weapon sayeth howe make league owne defence whether emperour hym selfe name shoulde moue warre booke also set forth declareth firste howe obstinate romishe syde conuocation auspurge secondly warneth men generall obeye magistrate commaunding take hande suche warre reciteth manye moste detestable errours romyshe doctryne whiche sayth mainteined warre campes wherein sayeth great wickednes sheweth also howe greatly men myndes lyghtened knowledge gospell warnyng men tempre selues entryng wycked warres appoyted metynge frankefurte fourth daye iune wherein determyne whether zurick berne basyll shoulde receyued league without exception opinion doctrine city make determinate answer touchyng preparation defence also aunswer framed meane tyme duke saxon emperours letter wylling take ferdinado kyng romanes thynge wil graunte whylest yet smalcalde receyued letter emperoure pourportinge howe newes yt turkes co myng great turke comyng exceading great armie inuade germany wherfore charged without exception prepare ayde resiste make aunswere howe wyll thensample progenitours refuse charge dutie owe comon wealth knoweth threatning wordes marque brandenburge spake vnto auspurge name rest prynces thynges decreed howe haue synce sewed vnto hym peace get graunte answere wherfore sende ayde agaynst turke whan obtayne peace home dryuen loke dayly outlawyng violence vnarme selues cut owne senewes howe wyll graunte peace quietnes fro lawe ciuile warre religion vntyll tyme counsell wyll doe agayne theyr partes turkyshe warre also affayres concerne common wealth thynge whiche shall dutie requesting signifie vnto ambassadours mynde pourpose herein moneth marche rychard archebyshop treers departed lyfe archebyshop treers departeth without suspicion poyson one house racked constance stoutenes escaped daaunger byshop great authorite emonges electours experience frankenes speakyng whan ulmes asked leaue senate strausborough bucer went thether bucer set order yt church uimes set ordre church prescrybing forme religion aduyse counsell oecolampadius ambrose blanrer tyme lady mary emperours syster maried lewys kyng hongary came flaunders emperour made regent base countreis place hys quene hungary made reget flauders aunte margaret lately departed clement seuenth sute alphonse duke farrare city rhegio mutina length makyng compromisse put emperours arbitrement tyme brabant gaue sentence duke farrare frenche kyng aunswereth letter prince city protestauntes xxi aprill desyreth aunswere frech kyng protestauntes nothing concorde europe right glad also bende waye couet haue counsel appeareth vnto hym profitable also ryght necessary ofte chaunceth talke refourming co mon wealth iudgeth alwayes thatthere surer foundation holy spyrit vtterer truthe myght case president whereunto others would geue lyke consent place myght assigned counsell voyde daunger suspicion euery man myght speake minde frely nothyng chief geuen affection dede good hope well carefull lest beare lesse good wyll reason sclaunders aduersaries nede afrayde wont credit thynges lightlye reported ennemies seing great auncient frendshyp betwene kynges fraunce prynces empyre vngentylnes ally frendes co ceaue amitie fraunce germa sinistrall opinion especiall harde muche setteth olde amitie hereby well perceyued tyme hath warre emperour yet haue germaynes citezens empyre free accesse fraunce libertie passe thence againe whan marchaundise busines done muche owne pleasure home muche fraunce may well called mansion place prynces citezens germany al thynges comonly knowen yet great occasio shall serue wyl muche case professe shall refuse decree free godly counsell haue controuersie decided waye disputation rather yt sworde lyke theyr requeste semeth vnto also honeste profitable common wealth whiche shall suffer great misfortune case matter come handstripes speaketh familiaritie alliaunce betwyxt fraunce germanye thus story yt kyng fraunce germanes franconie bordering vpon swaues time past makyng inuasio gawles subdued people treers gelderlande cleauelande terwen tourney vanquyshed amiens beanuois soissons setlinge selues last parte gawles yet called fraunce vnto day chief citie wherof paris many kynges reigned enlarged dominio last gouernemet cam vnto pipine also sonne charles worthy actes called charlemaigne people saluted hym charles great tytle emperour auguste possessed germany italy fraunce afterwarde sonne lewis ofspryng kinges fraunce wherunto kyng fraunces doth ascribe originall sayeth howe lineally descended stocke frankons perswasions vsed also tyme death emperour maximilian seke dignitie empyre knowyng aucient lawe strauger myght attayne crown imperiall went also proue hym selfe germayne dede laste kynge fraunce heyremales charlemaigne lewys fifte died without isshewe yeare grace nyne hodreth foure score eyght whan possession kingdome lewys fyfte remained familie two hondreth eight thyrty yeares death succession descended ryght charles duke lorayne vncle kyng lewys hughe capet hugh capet erle paris reporte whose mother fetched petygrewe great charles discomfiting takynge duke lorayne prysoner vsurped kyngdom left sonne robert whose heyres male continued afterwardes vntill kyng fraunces saye howe hughe capet lowe base hyrth moste parte wryters frenche cronicles recite originall haue sayde heretofore henry eight kyng england writeth agayne thyrde day maye hath answer kynge england red letter great cotentation muche inclined bent true religion remayning styll saufe peace conserued faultes abuse churche clergie maye refourmed suche thynges redressed haue bene eyther wyckednes ignoraunce men corrupted depraued moreouer howe toke great displeasure reade ouer whole discourse procead inge reporte dede went good though maynteine certen franticke personnes whiche sought disturbe tourmoyle thynges vpsyde downe gaue therunto credite first christia charitie doth requyre secondly knowyng certentie suche kynde sclaunder take place suche dignitie
