nobilitie wysdome would neuer haue beleued anye suche reporte certenly tried knowen true yet muche haue thus pourged selues glad thys cause disceaued opinion iudgement desyre refourmation doe agree mynde opinion good men state worldly thynges suche sorte lyke man body also co mune wealth publique administration nede continual remedy wherfore deserue great prayse lay medicine commo wealth hath nede many remedy wyll heale cure disease doe brynge outrage matter doubteth endeuoure tendeth ende notwithstanding howe nede take diligent care sorte men seke alteration woulde haue men lyke brynge magistrate contempt hath certen secte within realme whiche came thether germany letter metioned obedience vnto magistrate therfore thought good admonishe fewe wordes geue man ouermuche lybertie beware seke reformation shall doubtles doe hygh seruice vnto common wealth howe also desyreth chiefly generall counsell besechyng god styre vp harte prynces vnto desyre hath good hope thynges nothyng wyll glad doe sake wyll peticioner emperour meanes peace concorde may founde wyll worke herein selues shall tyme tyme thinke best theyr purpose daye came assemblie franckefourth ambassadours city agreed vppon declare thought touchyng creation kyng romanes long consultation founde expedient title style king opinso city kynge romains ferdinando enter sute trouble long emperour lyueth within lymites empyre whole power absence commeth dede ferdinando depute lieutenaunt emperour haue sondry tymes promysed euer laye power nowe case resiste creation kynge many woulde iudge promesse vayne therfore would beare lesse good wyll woulde also worke whiche el woulde haue done nothyng al cause religion also feared lest suche would haue ioyned selues vnto league wyll affcayde nowe withdrawe selues yt cause may election kyng ferdinando holde indifferent ferdinando shall commaude thyng co trary god worde wyll obeye attepte force wyll worke prescripte league defend vttermoste power prynces wrote vnto emperour ferdinando could allowe thing done custome lybertie empyre attrybute vnto hym tytle kyng romaynes duke saxon letter emperour added moreouer matter duke saxon doubte yt swycers might lawfully vsed would vnlyke auncestours concernyng swycers whome citie would gladly haue receyued league duke saxon answered ambassadours muche contrary opinion touchyng lordes supper myght haue fellowshyp howe muche estemed strengthe power ignoraunt myght haue respect vnto lest shoulde come euyll ende scripture witnesseth haue chaunced vnto whiche defence haue cared ayde haue sought durynge assemblie letter brought duke lantgraue ambassadours prince city pourportyng howe archebishop mentz lewys palsgraue yt archbyshop mentz intercessonrs palsgraue leaue emperour treate peace requested letter graunte also woulde appoynte tyme mete deliberation ambassadours aunswere contended wherfore duke lantgraue made reporte agayne howe misliked processe lawe myght cease meane tyme hauing first obteyned emperour appointed daye last sauing one moneth auguste wigande byshop bamberge controuersy byshop ba berge marque brandenburg certen yeares complayned fellowes sweuicall league george marque brandenburge certen wroges iniuries whiche done vnto hym hynderynge ecclesiasticall iurisdiction lyuing compellinge priestes thys false kynde doctrine refused erpulsynge imployinge churche goodes prophane v muche contrary equitie iustice decree bishop rome emperour requyreth according league would ayde assiste hym herein wherfore yeare moneth iulye daye appoynted norlinge hearynge matter whether came request marque ambassadours protestantes byshops side byshops auspurge wircinburg aester coadiutours counsellours plantife propounded charged iniuries requiring iudges procede gyue sentence prescripte league defendaunt thinges co cerning religion iurisdiction ecclesiasticall put appellation appellation marque wherein appealed decree iudgement generall counsell iudges sayde howe would admitte theyr sentence geuen cause concerne marque george also nephewe albert whiche worde meane tyme emperour calleth counsell imperiall spyres ides septembre appeasyng controuersie religion eleuenth kalendes septembre came vnto duke saxon erles nassowe nuenar men great authoritie nobilitie vertue emperours priuitie moue reconciliation erles nassowe neuenar treate hym fyue thynges lordes supper cerimonies churche churche goodes ayde nedeful turke election king ferdinado appered wordes emperour perswaded allowed doctrine zwinglius opinion anabaptistes aunswereth kynde doctrine minister doe preache teache ryght well knowen confessio exhibited auspurg pourposeth god grace remayne duryng lyfe neuer anabaptistes greatly zwinglians desired pourge herein emperour sayd knew neuerthelesse woulde declare emperour doubt would glad ioyfull heare reste theyr demaundes agreed differred vntyl next assemblie empyre whether desyre hym eyther come selfe sende sonne sayeth howe woulde glad gratifie emperour thynges aged vnhable trauayle besydes certen weyghtie cause whiche neyther come hym selfe sende sonne vnlesse emperour wyll graunte saufe conduicte hym trayne upon condition duks saxon wyll come assemble agayne euer shall become want preaching god worde haue prescribed hym certen kinde meate furthermore disputation shall touchyng religion requysite bryng hym luther others whiche muste also haue saufecouduicte fynally howe hathe oftentymes made suite emperour inuested owne dukedome custome empyre thynges whiche coulde neuer obtayn made many fayre promyses nowe laste assemblie auspurge fridericke palsgraue intercessours protestant aunswered name easely appeare emperour sore offended hym vpon whiche consyderations come vnlesse maye mediation obtayne emperours saufe conduicte dewe season wyll come without fayle later ende auguste ambassadours archebyshop mentz palsgraue mette ambassadours protestauntes smalcalde speakynge muche loue zeale theyr prince bare theyr countrey seynge coulde agree auspurge consyderynge great daunger myght ensue dissention would neuer reste tyll emperour graunted leaue treate peace wherfore thought good call agayne question suche thynges coulde agreed vpon auspurge begynne lefte others saye agayne howe protestauntes knewe thynges propounded therfore gaue certen commission determyne thyng wylled sende home wrytinge sealed whiche shoulde propounded must none otherwyse whan much altercation wordes could otherwyse coclude last agreed mete spyres daye whiche intercessours assigne pleasure duke lantgraue herein knowen ought dede shortly myght name selues fellowes signifie mynde therin letter yt duke lantgraue intercessours decreed seconde daye septembre beginnyng octobre duke lantgraue wrote archbyshop palsgraue repetinge treaty ambassadours sayde declare howe coulde good done therein without diuines howe continewe iin religion styll whiche professed auspurge assembly emperour absent nowe also late present counsell promysed whiche shoulde forthwith called commenced trusted emperour would shortly procure one germany wherein fellowes open doctrine large meane tyme beseche meanes emperour extremitie wrought within empyre suche nowe hereafter shall professe gospell may lyue quiet vntyll suche tyme decree authoritie lawfull counsell may determine matter shall thynke good treate howe conclude peace appointe daye wyll sende theyr ambassadours thither theyr doctrine exhibited auspurg man shall thynke fynde errour wyll shewe cannot proue stande testimony scripture would fellowes glad shall please emperour assigne daye spire graunting saufe conduicte fellowes luther whome intende bryng amonges minister churche wyll permitte haue free open preachinges god worde vse lordes supper according vnto christes institution prescribyng difference choyce meates wyll either come themselues el sende theyr deputes large commission make declaration doctryne vnto men metyng theyr doctryne scripture confuted truste emperoure wyll moleste may styll perseuer religion muche haue appealed lawfull general counsell yet nothyng founde theyr doctrine agaynst god worde also order lawe equitie duryng appellation extremitie ought shewed vnto partie appealleto trust emperour wyll rather theyr requestes suffor germany haue peace quietnes shewed assemblye haue bene septembre spyres emperour aduertised sondry letter messenger turkyshe preparation prorogeth moneth ianuary followynge appoyntynge place regenspurge myghte muche nearer austriche perceyued warre woulde shewed syrt booke howe warre whiche zurycke berne would warres swycerlace haue made vppon fyue townes pacifyed intercession city yeare sore brake agayne two city steppynge streightes passage woulde permitte victuall brought vnto dayes longest great trouble lyke ensue therof condicions peace frenche kyng certen cyties suysses laboured take vp matter drewe certen condition peace vaine zuricke berne declare wryting great wronges iniuries costreyned stop victualles muche refuse codicions peace whiche intercessours haue deuised propounded declare malicious harte howe haue broke fourmer conuenauntes made betwene wherfore lawefull cut theyr victualles hurte come therof ought ascribed vnto whiche seeke nothyng elles dissention nynth daye septembre tyme fyue townes great want penury nynth octobre armed selues secretly marched forwarde man ware come vnto border zurick laye garrison thousand men sent diuerse messenger citie warne men come spede ennemies approched faste coulde hardely come reskewe come toppe hylle whereby must nedes passe sawe theyr men great dauger next valley exhorting incouraginge one ranne downe hyll myght go foremoste nature hylle suche coulde one go downe one whiche cause coulde marche ordre battell greater multitude vanquyshed put flyghte eleuent daye octobre amonges nombre thei zarick disconfited slayne zwynglius maner zuricke go forth warfaye chief minister theyr churche goeth zwynglius also hym selfe beynge man stoute bolde courage consyderyng shoulde rary home death zwyng shoulde go worse displeasare susteyne one sermon woulde encourage others hym selfe faynte whan daunger would nedes take te shewed great crueltie vpon dead corp hatred towardes muche theyr malice satisfied beastlye cruelite death fourty foure yeares olde foure yeares yonger luther moneth august seen blasyng starre tyme died lewys frenche kynges mother syster vnto charles duke sauvy citie berne hearyng ouerthrowe comforted zuricke promysing sende ayde come whole power auenge ennemies whan commen together whiche aboute eight daye battell berne whiche desyred take matter hande alone nothyng hasty citie zuricke whiche ayde sent schaffusians mullusians also sangall basill whole numbre chose certen enseignes whiche settynge foorth nyghte laye hylle besydes mencinge pourposynge whan moue rose take towne tugie thereby vpon sodayne theyr ennemies whiche encamped selues farre thence knowynge espeiall went thether spedely set vpon beynge slepe xxiiij daye october put greater feare made wonderfull clamourous outcrye many slayne slaughter partes fyue townes vpperhande yet woulde zuricke nothyng relent religion last mediation peace concluded whereunto added zuricke berne basill forsake league whiche latelye made cytie strausborough lantgraue lykewyse shoulde fyue townes breake league kyng ferdinando hereof obligation made sealed later ende nouember oecolampadius departed presente lyfe supposed inwarde sorowe death oecolampadius thought conceaued death swynglius whome loued intierly wanted one yeare fifty workes written vpon certen prophetes whiche learned men muche commended xxix daye december ambassadours protestauntes mete agayne frankeforte finishe vp rest concernyng preparation defence assemblie city goslarie embecke receiued league litle fore also eslyng george marque brandenburgh citie norinberg campedown hailbrune absent professe religion yet league emperour begynning ianuary toke iourney bruselles go regenspurge assemblie mentioned waye came mentz begynnynge assemble rege spurge february archebyshop palsgraue intreate hym agayne peace whiche emperour grauntinge vnto aduertyse duke saxon lantgraue wyllynge doe lyke wherfore theyr letter sent fro appoynte mete schwinfurte towne imperiall ryuer moene begynning apryll dyd begynne treate peace whiche shoulde continue vnto generall counsell prynces intercessours present ordre geuen emperour propounde condition besydes writyng exhibited auspurge touching religion alter nothing teache nothyng publyshe thing condition peace betwene emperour protest remayne boundes vntyll tyme counsell haue nothyng doe zwynglianes annabaptistes neither occasion religion allure vnto prynces subiectes permitte minister preache owne countrey abstayne wordes reproche disturbe iurisdiction rytes ceremony churche geue ayde agaynst turke obey decree empyre whiche concerne common wealthe politike gouernaunce obedient emperour kynge romaynes haue made league againste emperour kyng state contrary religion abolyshe wyl thus truste emperour king wyll leaue forget displeasure paste duke sent thether sonne iohn fridericke selfe sore sicke also fraunces duke lunenburg counte anhalde agayn ambassadours prynces city whereunto came also nortusians halbestans swelande muche debatyng intercessours aduertise letter emperour whole matter assemblie ratisbonne knowe pleasure matter unto demaunde whiche duke saxon fellowes obey kyng romains wryte aunswere emperour lacke fynde woulde requyre hym doe therein deliuered sealed intercessours xvij daye apryll effect wherof ferdinando take vpon hym kyng romaine case emperour nede coadiutour aduyse counsell prynces electours interprete lawe caroline makyng acte therof euer ye myght done lawefully sorte longe emperour lyueth condition creatinge kynge romaynes neuer hereafter chosen kynge romaine vnlesse seuen prince electours sixe prynces empyre ioyned iudge mete done tyme shall appeare profite common wealth archebyshop mentz shall appointe rest electours syxe prynces mete place conuenient consultation therin whan shall haue considered whole matter diligently prynces electours kyng boheme shall haue authoritie electe kyng romaynes long emperour lyueth shall gouerne comon wealth emperours name onlye otherwyse take vppon hym none aucthoritie gouernment prince state empyre bound fidelitie othe except emperours death whan newe kynge shall created sworne order lawe carolyne electours power alter ye shalbe proued haue done contrary othe el great suspicion therof maketh purgation shalbe depriued ryght electourshyp euer moreouer chosen three kynges successiuelye one house prynces none chosen kyng romaynes except house prince germany suche thynges establyshed lawe caroline concernyng kynges election neyther emperour kynge romaynes maye chaunge whan shal seme good electours create king romaine shall nede signifie emperour neither shalbe lawfull emperour case commaude archebyshop metz assemble prince electours tyme shall appeare iust cause electe kynge romaynes duryng lyfe emperour archebyshop certen daye call company franckfurth lie authoritie appointe assemblye el vnlesse collegues doe vpon weyghtie consideration permitte hym archebyshop mentz shall demaunde crowne scepter ornamentes empire norinberge consent peres neyther diminishe anye parte thre monethes sommoned grauted prynces haue co ference together may daungerous empyre comon wealth one two comyng tyme absent whilest electours consulte frankeforth others shut matter infrynged electours bonde eyther repare thether remaine soeuer done voyde none effect neyther emperour king roman italy frauce place permitte harmes prince electours borne hym office executed electours selues deputes kyng romaynes solemnyse laste coronation vnlesse eyther electours deputes present neyther emperour kyng romaynes let ambassadours foreine kynges prince wherby may come counselles empyre propounde matter apperteyneth lawe nature also thyng full humanitie ciuile dutie neither emperour kyng romaynes case prynces empyre take vpon authoritie determining suffer lawfully decided place ought suche thinges shal apperteine honour welth preseruation prince empyre suche emperour hath promysed vpon fidelitie obserue doe maynteyne case thynge otherwyse done refourme bynde kynge romaynes lawe obserue emperour woulde sorte expounde confyrme lawe charles fourth duke saxon woulde faile doe dutie euer common wealth requyre suche consultation case intercessours coulde obtayne thynges emperour woulde refuse lawfull hearyng matter yet meane tyme king ferdinando neyther take vpon vsurpe gouernement matter empyre authoritie namely ouer ouer willia lewys brother duke bauier wyl grau ted emperour would heare openly cou sayle prince state wyll declare vpon weightie iuste cause disalowe election muche refusall perceyue incurre emperour also foreine kinges natios suspicion rebellion desyre muche emperoure would take displeasautly make theyr purgatio well within germany also without lymites empyre must necessitie amonges thynges sayde electours sweare ordre prescribed caroline thus standeth tyme comen franckeforth masse done go vp aultar lay othe theelectoars handes vpon holy boke call certen wordes beynge spoken take solempne othe fayth owe god empyre wyll chose newe hyghe magistrate suche one shall thynke moste worthy mete necessary office farreforth thei coniecture wytte iudgement without compacte bribe rewarde promyse accompte duke bauier numbre consideration also misliked election kyng ferdinando takynge counsell herein entred league duke saxon lantgraue frenche kynge defende lybertie germanie indede kyng fraunce delyuered cucustody two brother duke bauer hondreth thousande duke bauer misliked election ferdinado crownes alwayes readines nede requyred prynces intercessours make aunswere hereunto xx day april howe treate matter concorde neyther thoughte woulde haue propounded thynges haue chosen kynge romaynes emperour yet lyuyng haue moste weightie cause whiche tyme declared iohn fredericke father deputie nede requyre may yet playnely expounded synce matter co cerneth emperour also kyng residue fellowe prynces wyll make many wordes therof leaue alone intent may come easelye reconciliation rest neuerthelesse constrayned make aunswere doinge wyll refuse iudgement herein doubt approue doynges suche sorte nothinge iustly layde charge case thynges reported emperour feare muche take place also let hynder whole treatie peace wherfore truce may taken reconcilement may wel religion election neyther separated yt ernestly beseche bothe father sonne duke saxon would consyder thyng forsake opinio doubte emperour king woul put good assuraunce election shoulde hurtfull heyres woulde shewe besydes pleasure coulde well matter religion otherwyse religion shoulde haue peace graunted matter election remayne vndertermined feare muche coulde obtayned thus verely doe frendly counsell requyre take parte vse selues may perceyue aduise regarded diligence well imployed hereunto aunswereth duke iohn fridericke fourth daye aunswer duke itercessours loked suche aunswere sayed lately amonges thinges kyng romaine elected welth dignitie empyre oughte necessitie aunswere poinct satisfiynge well father fellowes perswaded electio good profitable empyre susteyne persones intercessours thought certenly woulde neuer haue defended matter haue left doubtful vndetermined thinges haue spoken concerne intercessours ought referre dvnto time wha thing shall come comon consultation dede collon tyme emperour desyred ioyne hym brother ferdinando fellowship empyre adledged certen cause ought semed great therfore lawe caroline ryght libertie empyre ought infringed tyme father ambassadours aunswere ought done wherfore thynge spoken last place nowe repete agayne also case emperour wyll admitte theyr requestes matter determined lawfull iudgement reason theyr refusall may heard seyng treate equitie supposed wold also case haue founde way honest meane profitable empyre muche done co trouersie wyll moleste herein vndoubtedlye father fellowes wyll declare yet iniury man howe lawe libertie empyre meane infringed trusteth also much thynges concerne honour preseruation common wealth emperour wyl take displeasauntly reste theyr demaundes craft papistes first poinct whiche touching zwynglians ment prynces myght sequestred moste parte city treaty intercessours expounde zwynglians would acknowledge theyr errour forsake myght also comprysed peace refused neyther ayde cancorde enter league last yeare smalcalde protestantes accorded time thei strausborough certen city sweuia playnly expounded opinion propounded auspurge concerning lordes supper declaration excepted saxon therfore one mynde aunswere one thynge eueryry requeste length propounde condition peace auspurge exhibite confession theyr doctrine apologie suche hereafter shall receiue doctrine consiste within lymites renewe nothynge furthermore vntyll counsell often tymes promysed poynted vpon ioyne concernyng theyr doctryne whiche teache otherwyse lordes supper baptisme specified wryting exhibited auspurg thei neyther allure vnto maynteyne man subiecte occasion religion howe shall lawfull men eyther lawe condition go whether wyll whan shal haue first declared lordes magistrate may flitte remoue wyll receiued sende forth preacher without owne limites preache vnlesse eyther magistrate place desyre permitte hym doe whan assembly shall happen refuse shalbe lawfull doe home shalbe eyther counselles empyre sende power agaynste turke let suche tymes vse theyr owne preacher also lordes supper accordyng christes comaundement let absteyne reproches withstanding let minister churche according dutie reprehende errours vice modestie shewe thynge ryght religion secluded chamber imperiall ecclesiasticall iurisdiction remayne place nowe shall lawfull byshoppes moleste brynge trouble man professyng doctrine sentence geuen concernynge religion iurisdiction ceremony churche goodes whiche yet put execution differed tyll generall counsell let vse churche goodes whiche remayne place wherunto gooodes properly appertayne neyther let thyng violentlye taken man yerely reuenewes brought place haue bene olde tyme accustomed tyll counsell shall otherwyse determine al ciuile matter let euery man office dutie let men tende common wealth shewe mutuall faith beneuolence matter brought vnto poynt woulde come nerer intercessours continue styll theyr purpose intent thynges myght reported emperour spedely appointe metynge norynberge thyrde daye iune laste albeit ful emperour necessitie graunteth peace germany agrement yet muche turke inuading austriche necessitie requyred make power againste hym myght gathered emperour doth establyshe vniuersall peace throughout germany decreeth man molested religion vntyll tyme generall counsell none vntyll state empyre shall fynde meane redresse controuerste vnto shal otherwyse appoynteth great punyshement sayeth wyll endeuoure may called within half yeare begynne within yeare obteined matter shalbe discussed counsell empyre wherfore chargeth commaundeth suytes proces lawe commenced religion shal meane tyme let falle suspended thyng otherwyse done protestauntes commaudeth voyde none effect agayne protestauntes seuen prince xxiiij city offer vnto hym obedience seruice promyse ayde turke peace concluded ibre protest intercessours xxiij iuly emperour aduysed letter messenger confirmed seconde august caused proclaymed openly commaunding counsell empyre iudges obey decreed counsell auspurge iudgement counselles chamber refourmed wherunto emperour appointed two name moreouer chose archebyshop mentz palsgraue prynces electours also byshop spyres strausborough philip marque brandenbourgh euery one sent depute spyres begynnynge marche made certen lawes whiche concerned partly iudges pattly aduocates partly suters exhibited emperour assemblie regenspurge lyked reformation well added fewe thynges laste booke assemble regespurge haue hearde howe emperour vnded conuenantes betwene alberte duke pruse sigismunde king pole albert perseuered purpose outlawed tyme iudges emperiall chambre sute walter cronberge whiche thynge whan kynge pole vnderstoode sent ambassadour assemblie declare howe lande pruse hath olde tyme bene vnder defence tuition realme wherfore desyreth sentence outlawerye maye reuersed cronberge long oration thyrde daye iune proueth vnder iurisdiction empyre belong nothing al kynges pole al predecessours vanquyshed battell constrained geue fidelitie casmire father vnto sigismunde yet cleane contrary conuenauntes made tyme whiche thynge able proue testimony albert selfe cofessed eight yeares synce assemblie norinberge therfore requyreth requeste kynge pole set parte sentence geuen agaynst alberte may put execution yeare christierne kynge christierne kyng denmarck taken denmarke bene ten yeares banyshed man prouyded nauie intendyng recouer kyngdome taken sea committed warde tyme died hauing towarde young man sonnne broughte vp emperour vncle chiefest consultation assemblie turkyshe warre whan newes came daylye letter messenger turck inuaded austriche howe turke sent great bandes horsmen ryuer danubius also ambassadours austriche countreys nere declared daunger werein decreed geue ayde al state empyre shuld ayde mony soldiours wherfore xxvj daye iuly ended assembly al men prepared warre ides auguste duke saxon prynce electour ended lyfe iohn fridericke sonne succede whan solyman death duke saxon emperour turkes come belgrade taketh waye left hande attempteth towne castell giunte vayne manfully defended nichas iurixe sent forth captaine cason fiftene thousande horseman spoyle countrey inuaded countrey far lintzie aboue uienne destroying farre nere leaueth kynde crueltie vnpractised retourne fel lappes horseman made kepe hym spoyle beyng fought slaughter yt turkysh warre sondry place vtter destruction lengthe hym selfe slayne solyman tournyng left hande marcheth vnto gratin towne stiria whiche thynge one knowen emperour beyng lintze taketh aduisement beste done last determied encampe whole armie uienna abydyng ennemie thus fyne solima retyreth without notable exploict done emperour intreated frenche kyng ayde made aunswere emperour tyme reported germanye able enough resyste turke alone kyng englande also wrote agayne somewhat doubtfullye byshop rome clement sent hym ayde conduicte hipolitus cardinall house medices swycers beyng requested emperour would styre one fote yeare sene blasyng starre septembre octobre blasyng starre sonne rising turke retyred armie emperour mislykyng aduyse thought good pursue ennemye dischargeth armie wynter hande uienne toke iourney italy mantua appointeth letter wrytten state empyre empe goeth italy brother kyng romaine shall gouerne comon welth absence weightie cause gone italy woulde treate byshop rome concerning counsell decreed ratisbone wylleth menne therfore maynteyne peace whiche late proclaymed obedient brother would selfe departyng thence bononie entred talke clement seuenth deuysynge amonges thynges religion generall counsel maketh also legue hym resydue prynces italy wordes mayntayne peace quiet italy verye deede kepe frenche men embassadours frenche kyng sore byshop admonished ernest priuely signifiyng long endure emperour brought hym great nombre spanyardes byshop wold fayne haue dispatched italy cause made league obser g pope serueth tyme occasion tyme emperour shortly sayled spayne moneth marche longe byshop rome sendeth legate germanye hughe rangon byshop rhegio whan came duke saxo accompanied emperous ambassadour made long oration effect wherof muche long conference betwene byshop oratio pope ambassad duke saron emperour controuersie religion fyne concluded remedy therof waye better tha generall counsell wherof perceiued prynces germany also desyrous cause message euen declare vnto hym prynces byshop emperour determined haue counsell free common men suche olde father accustomed haue tymes pope policie past whose myndes vndoubtedly gouerned holye ghoste prouided alwayes suche shall repare thyther make faythfull promesse obserue decree therof el labour spent vayne make lawes whiche none woulde obserue kepe concerning place holsome ayre plentye victuall commodious byshop thinketh either placence bononie vnmete purpose el mantua whiche citie empyre nere vnto germany goodly situatio plentiful thynges necessary whiche thre shall lawfull chose one whereunto kinge romaine prynces germany woulde make reasonable aunswere byshop consulting also kynges would cal within halfe yeare begynne within one yeare intent suche dwel farre may prepare selues take iorney whan hadde spoken deliuereth certen article comprysed wryting prynce electour byshop rome afterwardes emperours ambassadour speaketh wyse muche al former assembly recociliation religion oratio emperours amb hath bene hetherto attepted vayne supposed cou sel matter might pacified therfore hath emperour late obtayned byshop rome say holde maner time place ambassadour hath declared therfore sent emperour beare witnesse byshop rome content haue counsell ambassadour hath spoken sufficientlye whole matter nedeth saye desyre hym credite tale make hym frendly aunswere duke saxon sayeth matter weightie wyll take delyberation weymer fewe dayes duke aunswereth emperour byshop haue agreed vppon counsell exceadinge glad duke saxon aunswere state common wealth doth chiefly requyre one oftetimes emperour hath promised germanes wherin ye cause may duely examined according prescripte god worde whiche might would nothing doubte thinges go wel wil pray vnto god graunt also admonishe people vnder iurisdiction lyke applie whole studie hereuto moue fellowes also carefull would glad moreouer make present aunswer many others religion father duke iohn professed doctrine assemblie auspurge emperour aunswere selfe alone without making priuie neither expedient cause doe better done comon assent much emperour byshop last wynter letter wrytten state empire bononie put hope counsell therfore fellowes appoint day xxiiij iune mete smalcalde consult whole matter wherfore desireth offended differment time sone fellowes mete day prescribed shal haue answer either ambassadours letter shortly wold god grace demeane self present age also time come shold perceiue right wel wyshed nothing tha pure religion doctrine peace germany whole comon wealth christendom might also floriche emperour chiefe souereigne might haue due honour dignitie afterwarde whan fellowes come good deliberation prote aunswere pope emperour framed answere commo assent letter last iune howe gaue great thankes emperour whiche god glory preseruation comon wealth taken muche paynes good zeale doubted therfore pray god confirme direct mynde yt ende truthe may set forth embraced false doctrine wicked worshipinge rite abolyshed errours cleane weded men myndes god true seruice godly vertues may agayne take place chiefly desire counsel wherin matter controuersie may duely orderly decided suche counsell also emperour hath promysed long synce assembly empyre great deberation hath bene decreed kepte germanye wherof sprang dissention religion dissention sprange vp fyrste welle certen impudent persones ouermuche extolled indulgence pardon whiche tyme also errours perceyued detected byshop leo condempned doctryne whiche brought errours lyghte yet haue hetherto impugned condempnatio testimony prophetes apostle therfore hath counsell ben alwaye thought moste nedefull well prynces state wherin cause myght examined openly tryed true false sawe howe many thynges crept religion whiche refourmed therfore assembly empyre decreed free christian counsell eyther nation el prouince germany especiall wordes lest eyther sentece byshop force power man preiudiciall cause agayne cause iudgement geuen byshoppes decree opinion scholemen accordyng vnto holy scripture yf man power force scripture due examination doubteth shoulde contende againste byshop shoulde lose labour stryue agaynste streame wherfore without great consideration hath decreed counsell holden germany emperour also content shoulde nowe requestes bysshop vtterly decree empyre confyrmed seales emperour prynces speaketh free councel yet doubtles intendeth thynge wha free counsel vnderstad goeth haue kynges prynces bounden hym case woulde haue free shoulde obligation nede nowe seyng wholy bent waye certenly purpose vnder name counsell maye maynteyne power aucthoritie man shall reprehende faultes errours doe atttempte shall escape vnpunyshed knowe men wyll doe surelye demaunde wrytten suche sorte rather maketh afrayde counsell prouoketh woulde bynde hym selfe sorte especially beynge yet knowen shall ordre counsell fourme maner whether byshop wyll haue adherentes beare moste aucthoritie whether controuersies shall determined accordyng holy scripture tradition lawes men grounded vpon scripture lybertie counsell also restrayned wyll haue kept olde accustomed maner doe refuse former counselles consonant scryptures suche haue bene tyme lyttle cousels swarued old puritie whiche haue attributed reason wold byshop rome decree men farre differing auncient counselles therfore sayeth shall olde accustomed maner crafte policie shall lybertye speache geuinge sentence desyre also cause requireth iudgement shall geuen accordynge vnto lawes vsurped power whiche taketh vppon hym certen last couselles manifest vsage hadling matter neither church pacified troubled conscience quieted brought darkenes bondage wherfore seing bishop hath yet satisfied requestes emperour state empyre ernestly desyre cesar considering empe part religion weightines cause whiche concerneth vniuersall comon wealth nation would see matter might handled indifferently office dutie may doe lawes dede byshop impugneth truthe forseen prouided plaintife defendaut also iudge cause nation haue great hope counsell doe pope plentife defendaut iudge wyshe pray laste men conscience troubled sore afflicted doubtfull dissentio may made free set libertie taught way saluatio many hondreth yeares hath bene muche contention weighty matter thys present stryfe aryseth sondry errours vice whiche haue spronge longe tyme men disceaued theyr expectation shall haue suche councell hathe bene promysed sorowe grief thynge wyll men harte easy coniecture agayne byshop shall refuse dewe examination triall matter feared lest comon welth state churche shall tourmoyled sorer tempestes tha hath bene hitherto state empyre haue theyr assembly codescended vpon vpright counsel distrust perseuer also vtterly refusing snare pope snare bondes wherwith bishop intendeth craftly catche trusting kynges prince wyl like bonde goeth full craft deceitfulnes neyther true iudgement vnlesse myndes men franke free procede thus hold counsel owne pleasure wyll co mitte whole matter vnto god whiche doubtles defende owne cause doctrine howe case matter come passe byshop permitted wold take aduisement tha nedeful done perchaunce shalbe sumoneth se shalbe able thing glory god holy name wil come thither saufe coduict wha made wel assured send ambassadours propounde soeuer necessitie cause shall requyre neuerthelesse vnder condition wyll wyse admytte requestes byshop acconsente counsell contrarye decree empire see howe interprise byshop make contynuall peace churche common wealth neyther also semelye hym doe case would execute office true pastour whiche haue care men feede true doctrine christ whiche bishop office thynges standing thus desyre cary theyr aunswere emperour bishop emperour thei reuerently acknowledge chief souereigne appointed god take euyll parte woulde fynde meanes counsell myght according decree empyre whole controuesie may decided vertuous men nothyng suspected certenly appertayneth co mendation vertue employe al power aucthoritie aduauncement true doctrine establyshynge theyr crueltie whiche nowe many yeares haue persecuted innocent persones profession gospell holsome doctryne residue committe euer haue vnto emperour neyther thyng whiche wyll glad doe sake tyme kyng ferdinando byshoppes ambassadour peter paule uerger whome spoke uergerius former booke byshop rhezo aged man sickly clement commaunded uerger case impedimet happened vnto supplie rowme geueth hym especiall charge beare alwayes memory mynd wyll touchyng counsell let hym loke therfore wyse doe passe boundes commission one fynger breadth dryue hym suche exigent must necessitie kepe counsel though king ferdinado would neuer fayne haue vrged pope sleeth cou sell hym streightly therunto nynth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument nynth booke george duke saxon marketh suche fauoured gospel accuseth luther electour saxony cosyn pope element meting frenche kyng marseille geueth niece marriage henry duke orleaunce dake wirtenberge dryuen countrey henry eight kyng englande putteth away quene katherine wyfe forsaketh pope pageaunt spirite graye freers orleaunce recited lantgraue recouereth duke dome wittemberge agrement betwene kyng ferdinando duke saxon article peace betwixt ferdinando ich duke wirtemberge rehersed clement dieth paule house fernese succedeth persecutio paris reason certen placardes kyng pourgeth selfe germaynes therfore emperour taketh citie tunnes moore byshop rochester beheaded pope paule legate uergerius sommoneth counsell mantua wherfore protestauntes metyng smalcalde sende aduyse wrytinge lorde langey sent thether kyng fraunce solliciteth league debated diuers matter wher vnto protestauntes made aunswere kyng englande also sent thether declare woulde ende attende suche counsell league smalcalde renewed whiche newly admitted sondry prynces city whan made aunswer appoynted diuines lawyer delyberate vpon action counsell come determined set forth byshops aunswere prynte communicate forein kynges nation also sende ambassadours iudges chamber contrary emperours proclamatio graunted proces certen cause religion whose iudgement vnles surceased would refuse moreouer sende ambassade archebyshop mentz palsgraue intercessours last reporte vnto emperour whole matter wryting haue tolde oftener one howe duke george saxony bare malice luther priuely hated doctrine craft duke george fynde lutherians openly vnderstode diuers subiectes holde opinion ought receyue lordes supper commaundemet christe charged minister church geue vnto suche olde custome easter confessed synnes receiue sacrament byshop rome lawe certen token whiche afterwardes deliuer vnto senate intent myght knowe romyshe luther opinion founde lipsia whiche head towne countrey numbre luther cou sell lxx without token consulted luther nedefull done wrote vnto suche beleued certenly howe ought receiue whole supper doe nothing owne conscience rather suffer death wherfore thus encouraged sticke vnto whan prince called hym geuing two monethes respite deliberate woulde alter purpose bannyshed town luther letter lipsia called duke george apostle sathan whiche thinge breade muche trouble duke george accuse hym cosyn electour saxon howe rayled hym also styred vp subiectes rebellion prince electour letter charged luther withal amonges thynges sayth vnlesse make purgation herein must necessitie punyshe hym wherfore vpon occasion luther wryteth booke wherein confuteth accusation declaryng howe gaue counsel resiste prince luther purgation commaunding doe wickedly rather suffer death exile whiche concerneth rebellion ascribed vnto teache howe magistrate shoulde resisted force armes sedicious deede whome also peter apostle hath prophecied belongeth profession gospel condempned seditious christ hym selfe cause put death moste vnworthy though would haue bene kyng iewes christe called seditious haue made people rebelle emperour booke adioyneth epistle wherwith doth comforte banyshed men lipsia admonishyng take exile paciently also geue god thankes whiche hathe graunted comforteth eri e constancie mynde perseuerance shewed league concluded betwene emperour clement seuenth emperour retourned spayn clement request frenche kyng toke shipping arriued marceilles haruest tyme intier fredship marrieth niece pope clement cometh macilles katherine medices vnto henry kynges sonne duke orleans younge prynce fiftene yeares age occasion serueth purpose speake litle touching ye house medices syluester euerarde iohn first accompted name whiche senatours florence fyrst ennobled house cosmus rychest marchaunt owne citie also italy sonne peter two sonnes laurence iulian iulian sonne borne dead called iuly afterwardes clement seuenth withstanding reporte diuersly touching byrth lawrece sonnes peter iulian iohn made byshop many suppose hym bastarde rome leo tent iulian chyldre peter expulsed florence lenght drowned mouth lyre reason tepest left sonne named lawrence married galla house bolonois katherine whome mention made clement made abode marseille moneth somewhat gratifie kyng noble made foure frenche cardinalles whome perceiued moste fauoure consecrating cardinalles kyng odet chastilion philip bolon claude gifrie iohn uenerie byshop lisiens man doubted affinitie pretended alteration state italy many marueled vniqualitie mariage muche clement hym selfe report unmete mariage goeth doubtfull woulde beleue ment good ernest mariage solempnised within fewe monethes lantgraue goeth french king cause wherof lantgraue goeth frech kyng duke ulrich expulsed yeare lorde ulriche duke wirtemberge driuen countrey confederatours sweuicall league takyng rutelyng towne imperiall whiche confederacie prouince first emperour rest diuision inheritaunce ferdinado receiued emperour assemblie auspurg certen prince peticioners duke whiche bene eleuen yeares exile might tha restored vayne emperour reciting cause beginning whiche exiled dyd create brother duke openly countrey wherfore lantgraue dere frende nere kinsman duke ulriche thought attempte thing present disapoynted certen promysed theyr ayde differred matter vntyll better oportunitie serued nowe emperours absence co sidering sweuicall league made eleuen yeares dissolued goeth fraunce layeth pledge countrey mount pelicarte vnto kyng summe mony name lantgraue boroweth monye frech kyng duke ulriche vpon condicion redeme within thre yeres inheritaunce realme fraunce besides money kyng also promysed lende hym another som hope lande redemed tyme fortuned wonderfull alteration englande occasion henry great alte ratio englande seuenth kyng englande two sonnes arthur henry arthur maried katherine daughter ferdinando kyng spayne diyng without ishewe henry father coueted much alliaunce spanyarde myght continue lycence byshop rome iuly seconde deuyseth marrie katherine sonne also whiche kyng departed yeare grace wherfore henry eight name maried father beyng dead nowe manye yeares kyng hery sufficiently establyshed kyngdome propoundeth scrupulositie conscience certen byshoppes calleth questio whether lawfull marrye brother wyfe longe tyme abstayned company byshoppes hauynge priuate talke quene kinges assignement declare vnto byshop rome lycence herein neyther good lawfull aunswereth late nowe examyne licence whiche longe synce allowed dyuerse tymes miscaried chylde brought forth none prospered sauynge one daughter called marie byshop rome committeth hearynge matter vnto two cardinalles campegius whome sent englande cardinalle yorke longe muche debatyng whan kynge put hope rome sentence geuen syde campegius maner instant iudgement haue passed byshop rome admonyshement inconstancie pope clement began drawe backe fynde delayes cause wherof men suppose death duke captaine lawtrech distruction frenche armie naples androwe de aurie moste experte man sea forsakyng frech kyng fled vnto emperour whiche thynges chaunced tyme byshop afrayde offende emperour nephewe quene katherine whiche suche lucky successe assayes italy wherfore campegius fyne retourned without thyng determyned wherwith kyng toke excedyng muche displeasure neuerthelesse lest appeare anythyng vniustly kynge sent fraunce italy germany enquyre opinion vniuersities moste part consented kyng emonges diuines paris vniuersities paris others approued kynge vniuersitie seale thoughte lyberally rewarded therfore amoges others quenes maydes one excellent beautie called anne bolen whome kyng began fantasy muche men myght easelye quene anne loued gospell perceyue entended marrie wyfe whan cardinall yorke perceyued whiche chief kyng saye authour diuorsement chaunged purpose admonyshyng byshop rome letter approue diuorsement shoulde succede quene katherine whiche infected luther opinion whiche thyng whan kyng vnderstode ambassadour ledger rome sore offended longe thinges whiche practised e chauncelour realme thre beste byshop he york duresme wynchester first displaced hym office taketh away two byshoprikes conclusion time leading priuate lyfe home spooken certen wordes arrogant importing desire reuengement kyng sent syr william kingstone captaine garde discharge house brynge hym london fallyng vehement ixe way dyed buried lecester byshop rome death cardinall woolsey intent campegius myght haue excuse departe reuoked sute handes perceiuing marriage quene anne would hym preiudiciall warneth kyng full ofte goeth also feare threateninges leaue enterpryse whan could preuayle please emperour gaue sentence katherine yeare xxiij marche kynge yeare married forsakynge katherine proclaiming daughter marie bastarde lady mary bastarde perceiued sentence geuen hym conceaued mortall hatred byshop immediatly maketh lawe whereby declareth self head church englande abolishyng byshop vtterly commaundeth vnder payne death maketh treason man ascribe vnto kinges hatred pope byshop rome supremacie denieth also yearely pension whiche wont geuen bishoppes collectour moste weightie wordes enacteth henceforth monye conueyed rome consent whole nobilitie common realme ordre hyghe courte parliament fraunces frenche kynge thoughte haue furthered muche diuorcement intent myght thus cleane drawe frendshyp emperour concerning trybute payed rome thus standeth inas kyng britane aboute inas kyng yeare lorde fiue hundreth forty opinion religion deuotion made realme tributory byshop rome leaft memory ioynyng euery house paye penny wherfore byshoppes collectours cotinually gather annuall stypende called common people peter penny byshoppes collectour tyme peter uan retourned rome remayned styll englande money bene continually payed fro time vnto day kynge henry firste men made restrainte therof inhibitio conte tion betwen erasmus luther payed haue heard erasmus luther wrote one againste free wyll fourthe booke yeare contention began freshe luther takyng occasio one frendes epistle chargeth erasmus sore though call christian religion doubt mocke condempne also alledgyng certen place owne workes goeth proue sheweth wrytyng ambiguous eloquence practyseth kynde tyraunye muche godly thynges trifleth dalieth thus doubtfull wordes coulde oughte speake playnly aduoucheth thynges ought construed agaynst wherunto erasmus afterwarde aunswered ryght sharpely feared al thynges left workes lose grace authoritie tyme fraunce grey freers traged grey freers orleaunce wrought terrible bloudy enterpryse thus thinge mayer wyfe citie prouided wyll would buried without pompe noyse whan departeth fraunce belmen hyred goe citie place moste frequented assemble people sounde bell declare name title partie deceased also wher whan shal butied last exhorte people praye dead whan coarse caried forth moste solene burieng fraunce parte beggyng freers go churche many torch borne pompe solempnitie vsed concourse gasyng people woman wold haue none gere done wherfore husbande loueth well followed mynde herein gaue vnto graye freers whose churche buried besydes father grandfather syxe crownes rewarde looked great deale afterwardes wha cut wood folde freers craued haue part therof without money sayde nay toke maruelous euyll parte loued hym deuise waye reuenged saying wyfe damned euerlastingly worker tragedy coliman stephen arras doctours diuinitie first dede coniurer trynkettes false doctours furniture concerning suche matter redinesse vsed matter thus set youg man yt nouice aboue ouer vaulte churche came mumble vp mattyns mydnyght accustomed maner made wonderfull noyse shryking lofte goeth colman crossynge coniuring aboue woulde speake beynge charged make signe declare dume spirit rustleth maketh dume spirite noyce agayne signe token whan layd foundation go certen chiefest citie fauour red moste tell heuy case chaunced theyr house yet vtter entreate take paynes come seruice night came seruice begonne lost made great noyse beinge demaunded would signified could speake commaunded aunswere interrogatory signe hole made laying eare might heare perceyue coniurer sayde question moued yt dome spirit table hande wherupon asked question clapped beat myght easely heard beneth wherfore fyrste demaunded whether haue bene buried rekening vp name order whose body bene buried laste come mayres wyfe signe made sheweth spirite questioned whether dampned deserte offence whether couetousnes pryde letchery workes charitie el newe sprong vp heresye lutheranisme furthermore ment noyse disquietnes whether body buried within holy grounde shoulde digged vp caried place unto thinges aunswered sygnes like case commaunded wherby affirmed denied thynge muche stroke vpon table twyse thryse whe thus sygnified luther heresy cause dampnation body must taken vp freers desyre citezens present beare witnes thynges sene heard set handes wryting taking aduisement lest offende mayor bring selues trouble refused subscribe notwithstading freers take pyxe hoste terme reliques sainctes cary place say mass thing acustomably done bishop rome lawe tyme churche suspended must hallowed againe byshops iudge deputed whome call officiall heard came thether vnderstande matter better associatynge hym selfe certen honest men comaundeth coniure presence would haue chosen certen go vp uault se case spirit doth appere steuen ara sore againste thinge exhorted instantly might sayinge spirite ought molested albeit official earnestlye vrge coniure hym yet coulde bryng meanetyme maior makynge frendes priuie would doe went kynge enfourmed hym whole matter much yt freers reason priuileges refused come vnto iudgement kyng chose certen court parliament paris examine matter gaue themfull authoritie also anthony prate chauncelour cardinal byshop rome legate fraunce wherfore hauing exception caried paris constrayned make answere woulde confesse nothyng yet kept parte game prayer called paris nouice whiche fumeus senatour home often tymes examined woulde vtter nothyng fearyng leste shoulde murthered sclaundering ordre iudges promised hym escape free come freers handes declareth whole matter ordre brought others aduouched albeit conuicted maner taken deede yet refused iudges bragged priuileges vayne condempned open iudgement shoulde caried agayne orleaunce put pryson afterwardes condepnation fal r brought openly cathedral churche place punishment malefactours executed shoulde confesse owne wyckednes euen time chaunceth apersecution lutherians cause sentence albeit gentle great offence put execution persecution lutherians name lutherians moste odiouse feared lest punishment men haue bene muche thought dewe theyr offence done reproche ordre soeuer misfortune happened vnto many iudged woulde moste pleasaunt syght spectacle lutherians ordre franciscanes common people estemed holye time caried paris certen woman moued pitie followed vnto gate vniuersitie manye teares syghinges came vnto orleaunce bestowed seuerall prysons beganne boaste agayne theyr liberty pryueleges lengthe longe imprysonment discharged set lybertie without punyshement whylest prysoners wanted nothynge hadde thynges ministred vnto aboundauntly especially woman persecution fyrynges mentioned letted thing kynge determined dede reported plucke downe theyr house make euen grounde romyshe kyngdome wonte many spyrites spirites popyshe kingdome beleued certenly dead men soules dyd walke buried wherefore shewed eyther dampned el tyme tourmented fyre purgatory woulde sollicite nerest kynsfolkes frendes sucour moste commonly requyred eyther performe vowes pylgrimages behight sainct lyfe tyme el cause trentall mass sayd whiche thynge increased maruelously opinion purgatory brought masse highe authoritie priestes gainful aboue measure luther doctrine spred abroad luther apt touching spirites knowen spirites lytle lytle vanyshed cleane syght luther taught scripture howe soules dead men quiet rest loking last daye iudgement suche terrible noyses vision styred vp deuyl letteth none occasion slyppe confirme men myndes idolatrie false opinion quenche benefite sauiour christe whan lantgraue bargayned frenche kynge begynnyng spring tyme leuied armie wrytyng letter vnto kyng ferdinando declared cause theyr enterpryse whylest ferdinando referreth matter trial lawe marche forwardes armie fourtene day may chauncing mete theyr ennemies twelue thousand foote men shotte theyr ordinaunce put flyght besydes towne lausene lande wirtemberge generall ferdinando armie philip counte victory lant palatine battell hele stryken great pece chase many drowned ryuer neccar wher ran headlong feare ennemies pursued whan battell done men moste parte dukedome wirtemberge yelded selues naturall prynce ulrichus asperge situated vpon verey hyghe mountayne standyng alone also urach tubinge nipha stronge castelles nature fine rendred also ferdinando fyrst maye set forth proclamation man shoulde ayde faction al men resiste vttermoste power wrytten protestauntes seueral letter touching matter likewise emperour done litle openly man assiste al men marueled end stiring wold grow tyme warre archbyshop mentz george duke saxon lantgraues father lawe sought reconcilement kyng ferdinando prince electour saxon cadamea town boheme last day iune sauing one concluded peace coditions religio force attempted sute lawe commensed peace condition peace cesar hath made obserued ferdinando emperours place shall brynge passe iudges chamber shall surcease al proces protestauntes amonges whome notwithstanding neyther anabaptistes sacramentaries suche lyke sectes comprehended duke saxon fellowes shall acknowledge ferdinado king romaine gyue title ferdinando shall againe within certen tyme deuise emperour prince electours decree made sorte whan tyme shall hereafter require make kynge romaine duryng lyfe emperour electours first assemble consulte whether cause iuste reasonable appere proceade tenure lawe carroline whiche shall otherwyse done frustrate vnlesse decree made within ten monethes duke fellowes stande bound codicions within time emperour shall also cofirme duke succession possessious father progenitours ferdinando shal also endeuour emperour ratifie compactes matrimony betwixt duke saxo cleaue whilest thei treate matter take hande also peace making duke saxon offereth latgraue duke wirtemberge substitute shal ratifie euer agree vpon muche debating dukedome beinge wholy recouered codicioned thus ulrich prince heires condicions betwixt ferdinando duke ulri male shall holde dukedome wirtemberge kyng ferdinando archeduke austriche wardes clientes fortune house wirtemberge without heyres male prince austriche possesse region holde empyre whiche shalbe bounden therunto ulriche acknowledge ferdinando king romaynes make league againste hym lantgraue duke ulriche restore suche goodes haue gotten tyme warre owner doe constreyne man chaunge religion shall lawefull suche fled feare shamefastnes retourn home lyste take theyr goodes goe wyll peces ordinaunce defence auspurge shall remaine kyng ferdinando kinges debtes priuate affayres selfe shall paye employed comoditie countrey duke shal aunswere suche landes dukedome holden kyngdome boheme duke heire shall holde styl ferdinado heires king boheme philip palsgraue residue prysoners let go without raunsome lantgraue duke shall submitte selues aske pardon kyng ferdinando either person deputes duke ulriche receiue full state possession kyng ferdinando ferdinado shall entreate emperour also forgeue charge warre nothinge required either parte lantgraue duke shall sende vnto ferdinando armes fyue hondreth horse men thre thousand fotemen whiche shall immediatly go sege munster cost charge promyse fidelitie ferdinando othe nede requyred serue thre monethes time munster towne westphalia kept anabaptistes beseged hereafter shalbe declared wherfore king ferdinando requyred aide winning towne whan duke meane recouered countrey wirtemberge made peace ferdinando yeare ended repaied french king money recouereth possession mompelicarte lone money king forgaue liberal tie yt frech kyng whiche small somme peace making peter paule uerger byshops legate toke well clements name expostulate sore king ferdinando taken luther prince amitie answered dyd cosideratio time auoyding trouble time duke ulriche expulsed sonne christopher child iiij yeares olde first brought vp vnder tuicion vncle willia duke bauer remoued fro thence insprouek towne ferdinandos countie tirol whe turkes retire sayde emperour retourned italy motion aduise frendes coueyeth self emperours traine repareth bauier sole heire thought deuise yt sholde haue bene lead strauge countrey made religious father restored wet frauce attended vpon frech king matter pacified latgraue sent messager wt letter emperour spain coditions peace writing lantgraues letter emperour craning pardon self duke ulrich henceforth promiseth al due obediece moneth iuly septebre following emperour answereth hym letter fro ualentia vnderstode whole matter already empe aunswere brother ferdinado vnto whome hath written mynde behalf sheweth ambassadour may vnderstand clemencie desire peace quietnes wherfore doth admonishe perfourme deede thinges hath promised wordes vsing self obedietly eschewig troublesome cousell warres wirteberge fraunces sfortia married yt emp nece sfortia duke milla taketh wife christine ye daughter christierne king denmarck captiue emperours nece syster frenche kyng would haue moued warre agaynst hym death clement seuenth whome sayde death clement seuenth made league supposed haue bene lette delaye therof diseased stomack whan aduise phisicion curtius chaunged diet aged man dieth moneth septembre successour paule third paule ye iii surnamed farnesius whiche shortly made alexander young nephewe bastarde sonne peter aloise nephewe ascanius bastarde daughter constance bothe cardinalles calleth home peter paule uerger oute germany vnderstande state countrey consulteth cardinalles howe counsell myght differred tyll suche tyme priuie practyse might fynde meanes set emperour kynges together eares conclusion agreed sende uerger againe germany make promyse generall counsell handle matter craft subtiltie suspected clementes tyme paule r clement aduertyse prynces howe counsell holden mantua entreate condicions shoulde chiefly marke forme disputation protestauntes would seke haue one knowen myght prescribe vnto suche lawes knewe woulde come also commaunded incense harte prynces practise prelate kyng englande whose realme intended geue awaye pray hym coulde get shoud see ouer whether luther melancthon myght throughe anye meanes broughte purpose also certen cardinalles byshoppes chosen deuise refourmation clergie whiche fyne made puplished place shalbe declared kynge ferdinando causer paule sent againe uerger saying fitte man purpose tyme andrewe gritte andrewe gritte duke state uenyse man great authoritie singular wysdome experience tyme liued constantinoble bastarde sonne called lewys whiche lewys sonne brought vp fro yougth good witte syngular industrie attayned great ryches throughe lyberalitie gotten many frendes first gentleman courte meanes ibrain bascha tyme myght doe thynges alone well knowen emperour soliman also admitted vnto priuate talke thus vsing oportunitie tyme beneuolence liberalitie hongary great turke came hongary great power dignitie possesse part slauonie next vnto border uenife priuate vse kepe nether part hongary wherof belgrade chiefe emperour ye turkes sonne named anthony bishop quineueecclesia bishop clement purposed father gradfathers sake haue made cardinall meane whyle lewys hope lesse kyngdome muche reputation men father glad exceadingly good lucky successe sonne occasion grudge faction reysed againste taken aduersaries beheaded aboute tyme paule succeded clement meane tyme beginneth anewe persecution fraunce againste anye thynge suspected persecution fraunce lutheranisme wherof dede occasion citie paris certen place euen within kynges palace aboute one tyme night season sondry billes set vp masse poinctes religion streight wayes inquyrie searche made many apprehended information suspition whiche racked brent alyue vnstrangled whiche terrible beholde beyng fastened engyne lifted vp ayre wer punyshment godly let downe fyre hyghe fynged skorched hoysed vp agayne length hangeman shoulde cut corde fall downe fyre vnderneath suche also thynge learned tongue cut lest either thei vtter cause death declare vnto people crueltie iohn morin somme doctrine busines iohn motine lieuetenaut criminell mete minister could moste craftely smel searche thynge suspected lykewyse whan founde execution extreme booke marchauted punyshement passed extremitie neuerthelesse tyme came forth booke frenche without name authour romyshe marchauntes tempered mirth grauitie first sayeth howe marchandise kynde trade lyfe neyther dishonest vnprofitable common wealth voyde fraude auarice kynde men christe toke similitude tyme commaunded talentes receiued occupied might made gainfull whiche place dede vnderstande mistery nothynge lesse becommeth pastours minister churche lest suspicion filthy lucre notwithstanding almighty god offended wickednes men hath suffered enter churche ryche welthy marchauntes also theues murtherers wyll call hym thefe eyther selleth othermans goodes owne counterfeited ware ryght true bier foule disceaued thyng hath chaunced vnto v longe synce steade true shepeheardes crept exceadyng rauenyng wolues al man witte tongue sufficietly able expresse theyr craft subtiltie yet wyll touche little wherfore marchauntes whome speake craftie beyonde crafty marchauntes measure haue auaunced trafficke lytle corner haue fylled full theyr stuffe al pretensed kynde fayned holines apparell differ rest moste part shauen crowne neyther maye others suche haue greate beastes charact balles marke permitted occupie trade marchaundyse sell sell againe chaunge busy marchauntes al time marchauntes cease busynes vpon holy dayes especially principall feastes agayne followe occupie moste part one kynde marchaundyse woulles sylkes el corne wyne el cattel metall grossery ware marchauntes let slippe time yeare thei occupie al maner ware nothing escapeth handes nother men woman young chyldren well borne vnborne reape againe thinges generall unto luste serueth heauen hell earth tyme selfe yea creature lyuinge without lyfe wyne bread oyle flaxe milke butter chese water salte fyre perfume thynges wrynge golde straunge chaunge syluer wonderfull losse people concernyng goodes chiefly soule hauing infected vtterlye extynguyshed true doctrine god thinke point subtile marchaunt sell thyng dere wherof bier hath none commoditie sauyng syght thing marchau te whan set forth ware sell wonte say commo ly shall see loue money farre otherwyse man departe streightwayes readye demaunde whether wyll haue beste crosse beste bere cloth whan corp goeth burieng el yt worste best sauyng one shall choyse shall paye accordingly beseche hast thou thy money thinge cariest thou awaye besydes syght therof laye vp ware againe next daye sell muche lyke policie encrease pryce thynge better apparell marchaunt price masse derer som tyme parso case abbot bishop say masse must coste monke chaplayne saye whiche thynge deede differ nothing common harlottes gayer whore derer selleth filthines pratty sleyght sell selfe thynge one instaunt sondry men neuer wyser especially suche place great resort people cometh man honour worship freers church desireth haue masse freer doucketh sayeth syre furth craueth lykewyse thyrde also laste commeth forth disguysed whan masse done taketh whole rewarde euery thinke nothynge gere doth wante wylie wytte moste parte shall fynde nede lytle thynge make profite crafte pollycie fortuneth poore woman commeth churche setteth vp candell image marchaunt priest hande whiche fyngereth candell putteth selleth sundry others one al sorte occupie waxe poorer sorte haue tolde greatter cobbes sealyng letter writinges whiche sorte commonly called officialles commissary seale kepers notary lyke great choploch whiche farre exceadeth others placeth selfe two degree aboue god god called od marchaunt sanctus deus wyll called sanctissimus saye holy god holy father dede vseth ware maruelous artificial policie thaungeth leade golde farre exceadinge alcumisticall multiplier euer agayne selleth harte dere namely redde purple whiche byers haue one gotten heades bragge proude pecockes iette vp downe place great resorte people shewe set forth selues moste commonlye frequente courtes kynges emperours whome checkmate haue wonderfull great prerogatiues maye enioye many byshoprikes benefice lyste without charge paymentes againe numbre whiche election clyme hyghest degree seate dignitie whose example doctours louen paris namely sorbonistes sell cappes also batchelars diuinitie charge fare ryght delicately woulde fayne pope iohn woman knowe muche iohn eyght name woman deliuered chylde going procession thirde yeare byshopryke saye would fayne know first whether chosen vertue holy ghoste whether doinges approued ratified tyme solde cardinalshippes byshoprikes abbotshippes finally thought priest marke receiued returne purpose declare whole worlde founde fyne crafte subtiltie kynde marchauntes see howe haue gotten handes empyres kyngdomes countreis city great possession haue oftentymes deposed couetous marchaunts kinges prynces spoyled realmes dominion brought muche mysery nowe suche force power kepe al thynges stronghand proude marchauntes wyll tourmoyle heauen earth together rather wil forgoe lose one iote oh vnsatiable woulues howe ryghte tymes paste haue prophetes apostle namely paule peter paynted set forth colour marchauntes force man bye ware doe compell men wyll nyll bye refuse baggage crie vpon heretike fyre hym dieth poore man leauing behinde wyfe chyldren able helpe selues pitiefull case surely poore wydowe worthy releued haue compassion vpo hauing eye praye immediatly haue mumbled vp fewe prayer must haue money good chere besydes parson vicar wyll haue mortuary coarse present best thynge house greater iniurye theuishe marchaunts done sell thynge owne yea sell vnto haue moste ryght sondry men one thyng tel pray bought belle hanged vp unto belongeth churche flowre patrimony forsouthe sel ryngyng belle church floure dere oftentymes perauenture wyll saye right churche graunt churche whiche christe hath washed instituted iustified wherein walke replenyshed theftes robbery kynd vice christe commaundeth thynges geuen frely sporte pleasaunt syght see howe rauens wyll stryue amonges selues carion ryche man dead brawlynge freers come flockyng swarming gaping eche man praye full busely especially called beggyng freers graye freers contende dominickes white freers austen oftentimes buriyng kynde people idle sloughtful vnprofitable also chargeable worthy whipped euery good common wealth thynges haue sayde denied sene dayly yet miserable worlde assotted mortall men blynded vnderstande spyrite moued whan benefice prebende fallen lord god busie suite gadding prickyng vp downe diligent inquisition selling benefice made knowe yearely value worthe absent resident vpon profites arryse christenyng childre mariages pilgrimage reliques saintes may leuied buriynges habites diriges legacy laste willes moste auauntage gotten suche sainctes notable propertie power sore feared sainct laurece angry salute anthony roche suche angry sainctes whiche muste pleased vowes great giftes oh ye kinges prince wynke wicked detestable thinges longe suffer paciently many great enormity wyll dede refuse reformed yet doubtles haue rule ouer whether wyl god hath geue sword authoritie punyshe vse auenged moste cruell kynde extortioner god requyreth dutie handes whiche ye neglecte wyll leaue vnpunyshed would god diligent auauncing glory vigilante circumspect handlyng matter let slyppe none occasion kepe good watche wyly marchauntes nothing escape hauing many eye eyther ianus argus sound bel runne thither streight welthie persone sicke put selues prease neuer awaye tyll haue rewarde euery mariage wil must blesse bride bed saye ouer certen praiers chast holy men warrant whiche liue sengle lyfe moste filthely entent may libertie play partes naughtines whiche haue spoken marchauntmen concerneth also marchaunt woman called nunnes wherof ther sondry order idle n expressed wordes idolatry wickednes rabble induced last arryse thou god auenge thy self glory thy name whose league societie man ought presume come foresayd buchery began moneth nouembre ianuary followyng kyng came paris appease god wrath goeth pylgrymage diuers sainctes vncredible nombre concourse people worshyp paris sainct geneuefa virgin aboue al sainctes whose image nowe caried great pope solempne procession whiche neuer wont done tyme geneuefa yt goddes paris extreme daunger whan either god wrath pacified muste fyght great battell el feare great penury skarsitie corne wyne flye vnto vnto laste ancker porte theyr succour people perswaded helpe neuer yet desyred vaine mutch wyll saye howe god verey mutche saynct geneuefa sauiour paris caried foure butcher olde custome whiche prepare selues hereunto certen dayes fasting prayer officer appoynted make rowme waye whiche done without great payne image borne people runne vnto euery syde great deuotion well may touche theyr fyngers ende el theyr cappe handkerchief thronge prease people beyonde reason whan masse done kyng dyned byshops palace lady churche presence kinges oration chyldren foreyne ambassadours al nobilitie made oration full affection testifying inward sorow conceaued presumption naughtines wicked persones made longe discourse concernynge obedience churche exhorted beware pestiferous secte none escape without punyshement taken maner knewe part owne body infected contagion sayed woulde teare away least growe make amendes towardes god daye syx brought forth whiche beynge fastened engine sayde sondry place kynge passe home owne house burnt fyre beyng kyndled instaunt kyng go waye beseching hym mercie pardon custome fraunce doe execution none silence proclaimed redde cause punyshemen whan man executed heresy maner execution fraunce touchyng iustification fayth without respect workes praying sainctes haue affyrmed christe byshop aduocate mankinde haue eaten fleshe dayes forboden whiche death suche thyng spoken generally reported haue offended diuine maiestie bene cotumelious virgyn mary sainctes haue broken lawes mother holy churche therfore people beleue nothynge hurtfull wicked lutherians ab borred worlde kynde people comonly seen whan burning flammes fyre people wyll gnashe theyr teeth euen myddes theyr tourmentes wyl curse deteste wicked vnworthy loke vpo sonne turkes ambassadours tyme fraunce kyng hymselfe heard cause brought hatred suspicion throughout germany fyryng offended manye first day february addressed letter vnto prynces state empyre excusyng freche kinges letter commyng turkes ambassadours frauce example others whiche haue sent receyued ambassadours turke lyke case also burnyng lutherians saiyng constrayned seuere owne nature wyll reason rashenes certen whiche vnder pretence religion intended destruction common wealth excuseth matter though bene rebellion religion men executed first beginning spring tyme lantgraue went vnto king ferdinando yeare lantgraue agreed vpon full reconcilement founde peter paule uerger newly come thither rome vpo occasion message lantgraue concerning counsel mentioned taking deliberation made none aunswere yt uerger traueling rest prince applied busines diligence fewe monethes lantgraue duke ulriche also went vnto kyng ferdinade conuenaunted come aske pardon commyng seueral tymes easely graunted howe beit duke ulriche sore offended lantgraue also duke saxon consented shoulde holde landes house austriche long tyme doubtful whether woulde ratifie peace made lengthe perswasion frendes went ferdinando according conuenauntes moneth aprill emperour tooke shippinge emperour voiage barbaria barchin transported armie barbarie whan wonne citie tunnes taken castell golete restored kynge countrey muleasses mahumetes religio whome barbarossa turkes admirall expulsed byndyng hym paye tribute fortified castell strong garnyson sayleth sicilie unto warre byshop paule sent certen galleis furnyshed coduicte virginie ursine also permit take tenthes clergie spaine barbarossa men negligence ignoraunce steppynge barbarossa asyde escaped first fled hippon thence argiers repared nauie returned constantinople englande two notable men iohn fysher byshop rochester syr thomas moore knyght well learned rochestr beheaded fyrst wrote sondrye bookes luther moore also whilest chauncelour whiche chiefest office extremely punished suche suspected luther doctrine neither approued king diuorsemet much lesse act parlamet denying byshop rome supremacie affirmed ye kyng head church englad wherupobeing apprehended wher perseuered obstinatly opininio th yere ye month iuly beheaded byshop rome made rochester cardinall whylest prysoner towre thyng supposed rochester cardinall haue kyndled hatred hym afterwarde ende octobre fraunces sfortia duke millan died without issewe whiche gaue occasion newe death sfortia warre shalbe shewed hereafter meane tyme emperour came sicilie vnto naples letter written laste daye nouembre protestauntes sayd dede wold obserue peace norinberge notwithstandyng informed howe thei taken churche goodes withholde whan iudgement geuen make restitution refused alledging pacification norinberge appereth vnto hym vnreasonable discontente offende hym time also went prince electour saxony vnto kyng ferdinando austriche hauing dispatched busines whiche went thether retourne home prage chief citie bohemy met byshoppes legate peter paule uerger declared vnto hym message touchyng generall counsell uergerusto duke saxen whiche byshop paule intended sayed holde mantua free godly lawfull without condicions whereunto al prynces consented bene namely germany wherfore nowe refuse men woulde suppose nothinge could contente hym emperour kynge ferdinando willyng thing place byshop ernestly desyreth vnlesse brynge passe wyll doubtles wery lyfe therfore nowe tyme requyreth declare howe muche loueth aduauncement god glory common wealth willing let passe preset oportunitie whiche hardely tyme hereafter recouer albeit woulde nothynge counsell yet neuerthelesse procede christ trusted would fayle wher vnto duke saxon sayd wha deuised fellowes duke aunswer wold make answere requiring deliuer vnto thinges spoken wrytinge wherfore kaledes decembre exhibiting wryting declareth thinges large otherwyse spoken howe ambassadours sent vnto kinges vnto king ferdinando prince germany mantua place agreed vpon emperour kynges germany ful sacrametaries anabaptist suche sectes muche daunger nation kepe counsell emonges moste parte franticke without reason agayne supposed byshop woulde gyue place ryght hath bene longe time confirmed farre disceaued also beleue howe emperour holde prouinciall counsell germanye agaynste byshops wyll muche abused talke saufe conduicte pledge theyr commyng italy cause mantua citie empyre nere vnto germany nexte dominion emperour uenetians wherfore daunger finally sayeth howe wil go kyng ferdinando abiding aunswere uergerus spake luther saxony spoke luther wyttemberge retourne kyng ferdinando met duke comming thence homewarde protestauntes appointed mete smalcalde sixte december matter wherfore xxi answer prot framed aunswere byshops rome ambassadour whiche saye exacte thynges requyreth yet muche desyred haue expedition playne manifest first howe haue declared myndes concerning counsell diuerse assembly also two yeare synce emperours byshop clementes ambassadours also wyshe haue lawfull counsel preseruation comon wealth common saluation men haue required emperour ioyntly prince also thought nedefull hym selfe doubting good men desyre suche counsell may helpe profite common wealth greueth many good men true holsome doctrine wicked crueltie certen men euery oppressed member churche tone sondre open crymes mainteined suche crueltie becommeth crueltie vnsemely churchman ruler churche wherfore euer nowe moste nede counsell bothe olde accustmed vyces maye roted also vniuste violence crueltie restrayned churche henceforth set due ordre therfore wyll fayle common wealth herein wyll ryght gladlye come vnto suche counsell sondrye assembly empyre hath bene agreed vpon besechyng god doinges may redounde vnto glory saluation men wher bishop hath chosen mantua place truste assuredly emperour wyll poynte swarue decree empyre owne promyse also muche prouyded counsell holden germany sayeth daungerous keping truthe farre wyse peryll prynces cyties obedient emperoure onlye cyties ordered defende straungers iniuries saue peryll therfore oughte chieflye kepte intent matter controuersie might duely debated men might frankely speake iudge vpryghtly feare force faction saye theyr myndes freely two yeares paste clement seuenth promysed counsell condition verye caption nowe chiefest point craftely left touchyng lybertie counsell treatie partlye referred craft spied byshop rome whose office saye call ordre counsell nowe byshop whiche hath ofte condempned theyr religion doctrine ope enemie case permitte theyr aduersary geue iudgement coulde counsell free wherein aduyse emperour prynces mete men chosen whole numbre whiche accordyng vnto god worde might heare determine cause counsell iudiciall seate byshop rome state also proued example primatiue churche also holy scripture prynces state haue tymes paste admitted counselles hearyng matter wheresome woulde haue byshoppes power aboue authoritie whole churche agaynst reason full tyrannye belongeth well emperour ciuile empe may order counsel state set foote counselles chose experte men especiallye suche cause byshoppes errours impugned wytte false doctrine idolatry thynge permitted also byshop rome lawe feinge vniuersall cause men concerneth pepes concempned heresy whole common wealth emperours parte prynces forsee vpryght iudgement byshops owne people also byshoppes rome haue time paste bene condempned heresy obstinacie emperoure churche together tyme contention manie weightie matter whiche byshop doth defende wordes also wycked cruell decree punishyng sharpely suche obey muche therfore aduersary susteineth one halfe sute thinge selfe requireth whole church emperour kinges take hande prescribe ordre deciding matter wherfore haue done euer requyre nowe also matter maye handled vpryghtlye accordynge example holye wrytte olde primatiue churche maye wyll behynde theyr partes trustynge truthe shall come lyghte glorye sauioure christe aduaunced tranquillitie restored churche otherwyse doubte greater commotion wyll arryse therof hytherto hath bene seen partes wil tyme neglecte common wealth forsake shrynke true doctrine lykewyse matter thynges peace concorde kyng frauce whiche fully determined make warre italy sent ambassadour willia bellaye assemblie smal oration frech ambassad calde xix daye decembre eloquent oration first excuseth kynges seueritie punyshynge certen owne subiectes whiche withstanding nothing preiudicial hurtfull cause religion though euill tongue dyd reporte displeasure tyme force suppresse rebellion common punyshed anabaptistes yet nothing without iust cause wherfore distrusteth men wysdome grauitie wyll lyght reporte conceaue euill opinion noble
