kynge frende nowe vrgent cause spoken constrayned nature vse extreme punishment folysh pitie marreth citie lest hauing large realme ouermuche lenitie set open wyndowe wickednes temeritie manye touching religion doctrine kyng wyll take vpo persone iudge dede lyketh many thinges well rest leaueth vndiscussed goeth wynne theyr fauour confuteth theyr opinion whiche warned ware forayne ambassades proueth doth tende theyr owne hynderaunce bondage sayinge people stronge long prosper floryshe vnlesse mainteined league amitie theyr neyghbours frendshyp kynges fraunce prynces germanye fraunce germany one ofspring hath bene suche auncientie nation procedinge one originall lye borderynge together maye onlye ayde strengthe also honour beautie one vnto therfore whan kynge hearde saye howe germaynes dyd hardely agree amonge selues ryght sorye muche hym lyeth wysheth reconcilement fearyng lest dissention religion come sorowfull ende wherfore vnderstandinge theyr owne preseruation nowe assembled kynge sent hym declare vnto aduise thus muche free general counsel could yet obtained germains within selues shold assemble altogether come vnitie concord furtherauce cause case contented chose certen well learned men experte diuines fraunce sende germany reconcilement el woulde sende fraunce lyke purpose maruelous great pleasure meane tyme doth exhorte peace amonges selues knitte mindes mutual consent brotherly loue king wyl neuer ayde ennemies neyther helpe counsell case continue good wyll towardes hym haue done alwayes hitherto beginnyng booke shewed howe iudges imperiall chamber contrary emperours decree made proces protestauntes iudges chamber trouble yt protestates iudges dede wer romish religio tyme emperour retourned warre austriche italy suite clergie whiche complayned protestauntes attempted lawe albeit emperours proclamation contrary yet proceede protestauntes wrote herein emperour duke saxon selfe traueled kynge ferdinando co maunded lawe cease ratifieth peace made emperour would staye protestauntes vtterly refuse iudgement suspected enemy declaryng cause wherfore would admitted encouraged emperours letter whereby gaue emp letter authoritie iudge whiche matter religion proceaded onlye doubtfull cause suche also concerned religion nothyng el duke saxon obtayneth newe commaundement kyng ferdinando vayne finally muche adoe ferdinando consented would fynde meanes staye matter lawe whiche duke fellowes touchyng religion co prysed peace norinberge unto suche thynges french answer protestauntes frenche ambassad ambassadour spoken answere made albeit execution done reportes went diuersly yet sayeth thei went sedicion muche offended kynges doynges herein whiche deede woulde suffer suche thynge selues owne countrey neuerthelesse woulde wyshe kynge haue respecte vnto suche professe pure doctrine gospell whiche protested assemblye auspurge punyshe rest denied many false wicked opinion crept churche vnlearned malicious persones defende great crueltie maynteyne lucre authoritie maruelous polycie forge oftentimes great crymes vpon good innocet persones exasperate kynges mynde agaynst seyng propre office kynges prince seeke god glorye duty prince pourge churche crrours inhibite vniuste crueltie desyre instantly moste mightie kyng would wholy applye selfe hereunto doe wyll suppose beareth frendly louyng mynde towardes wyshe lucky fortunate highnes churche touchinge auncient alliaunce frendshyp betwixt kynges fraunce prynces almaygne talke ryght pleasaunt wyll power endeuour mutuall loue amitie may long continue concernyng reconcilement opinion religion desyre nothyng el matter may heard indifferently determined lawfull counsell muche office byshop rome appointe counsell thynge also concerneth kynges prince desyre kynge forsee violent counsell called place suspect perillous intent vnder name counsel true doctrine extinguished weyghty matter concerne preseruation peace vniuersall churche euery particular persone free disputation vpright iudgement accordingly whiche thinge get kyng immortal fame thankes present age also tyme come longe worlde endure conferens betwene learned fraunce germany requireth long deliberation diuerse comissions extende suche matter sone thyng may determined herein wyll aduertyse kyng letter desyre nothyng holsome doctrine myght set forth auaunced last sayde howe kynge would geue none ayde glad heare thereof wherfore thynges concerne emperour empyre also wyll assist man hym ambassadour also priuate talke pontane melancthon lantgraues learned men iames sturmins sondry doctrine declared kynges opinion euery article myndes also learned men fraunce especially paris byshop rome supremacie kinges opinion matter controuersie lordes supper masse inuocation sainctes image free wyl purgatory iustification monastical vowes marriage priestes moste thynges kyng agreeth booke melancthon hath wrytten common place touchyng byshop rome kynge wholy philippus commo place malancthon opinon chief supreme god lawe man lawe affirmeth kyng england denieth certenly byshop vsurpeth ouermuche authoritie whan taketh vpo hym depose kynges emperours whiche nowe entendeth put practyse kynge englande albeit kynge also diuers cardinalles iutreate contrary diuines say head churche god lawe kyng demaunded place could shewe misliketh also defence pourgatory wel spryngeth masse dirige al theyr marchaundise masse taken away combes cut masse mainteineth purgatory loger able defende authoritie wha kyng grauted certen monethes wherin shold proue purgatory scripture aunswered lengthe howe oughte reache enemy weapon whiche myght vse touching monasticall vowes kyng supposeth might obteined byshop none taken yong monasticall voues vower type yeares lawfull depart thence whan woulde mary thinketh good deface theyr house conuerte college wherein yought may brought vp learnyng vertue diuines would case haue priestes liue vnmaried king deuised meane waye suche haue maried wyues shold remayne styll rest mary absteyne fro ministration churche concerning whiche alledged paphnutius counsell niece perswaded mariage paphnutius priestes diuines aunswere proued priestes haue maried tyme withstandynge wyl deny wyues admitted ordre priesthod concerning lordes supper receyued wholye vnder kyndes terme kynge conference herein lordes suppervnder kyndes clement seuenth trusteth also wylbe obtayned byshoppes handes shalbe lawfull euery man receiue conscience moreouer kynge affirmeth hondreth yeare synce fraunce receiued whole supper myddes churche chappelles heard old men make relatio agayne kynges fraunce receyue whole communio kynge obiected vnto diuines made aunswere kynges anoynted well priestes scripture speaketh priesthode royall whiche lawfull kynges permitted others lyke case furthermore mattins dayly seruice kyng doth acknowledge many thinges may cut many taken cleane away clemet seuenth committed charge vnto cardinall crucei spaniarde whose boke thing remayneth whiche diuines paris haue condempned heresy whiche suche kynde men wyll condempne onlye germaines wicked erring religion also byshop hym selfe cardinalles case require seynge whole matter full difficultie kyng altogether addicted haue churche restored vnitie concorde hath talked herein duke bauier fyndeth stiffer tha diuines paris finally exhorted admitte place counsel kyng maisters also kyng englandes aduise whiche wyll consent one moreouer certen yeres past lewys frenche kyng contended laweful kynges fraunce nauane ercommunicated iuly byshop appointe counsel without consent emperour kynges kyng nauarre opinion iuly excommunicate ferdinando kyng spayne title inuaded nauarre kyng nowe also mynde opinion neyther wyll admitte counsel vnlesse place sure suspected apt iniury wherin man may speake mynde frely besydes talke mentioned earnestly hand enter league kynge principall cause hys ambassade except emperour sayde myght attempte nothynge departed without protest would make league wt kyng purpose certen spake counsell marueled would neglecte mightie kyng sayde tyme woulde come wherin would wyshe haue redemed frendshyp derely kyng englande also henry eyght sent thether ambassade chief wherof edward foxe byshop hereforde begynning made relation muche aliaunce kinred oratio byshop fore ambassa kynge englande great betwene kynges england prince saxo kyng beare muche good wyll towardes hym hys cosortes especially synce chief endeuour set forth god true knowledge vnto others al cause haue susteyned great reproche yet doth mislyke neuer whyt therfore iudgeth otherwyse suche good men contrary dutie without reasonable cause wyll doe nothing haue respect true preachynge gospell god glory myght aduaunced desyre alteration religion englande kyng also whiche sufficiently enough declared alteratio englad kinges comaundemet great part errours abolyshed commo assent whole realme byshop rome deceiptfull iugglynges fro thence cleane banyshed lyke case saxony muche desyre good wyll common kyng hath wonderfull great affection towardes woulde thus procede professe al one doctrine doubtles establysh continuall peace quiet commotion haue arrysen diuersitie opinion kynge vnderstandeth anabaptistes theyr example haue declared byshop nowe pretendeth though would calle counsel certenly remayne dissention doe agree doctrine wyl make much whan shall come counsell wherein notwithstandyng imputeth fault diuines state churche neuer quiet tyme hath dissention whiche thynge also proued example peter paule state churche troublesome barnabas therfore vniformitie sought maye grounded vpon sure foundation scripture byshop rome endeuoureth myght let peace concord wherfore kynge opinion longe authoritie tyranny crueltie endureth vnpossible come agrement kynge hath lately deliuered realme englande moste fylthie bondage restored vnto lybertie idole antichriste nowe starke madde work mischief openly goeth fraude gyle false forged sclaunders incense kynges hym al woulde thynge mainteyne authoritie yet deuyse polycie styre vp cruell warres set one others toppe kynges pleasure thus declare vnto stode feare byshop furnyshed thynges cared neyther hym yet adherentes intent might clerely perceyue antechristes purpose rage antichrist chieflye present tyme whan pretendeth holde counsell mynde intendeth farre thynge kyng doeth confesse graunte lawfull disputation profitable expedient common wealth yet ought forseen wyse ther cousel shal intreate establysh bishoppes authoritie wherfore requyreth admonysheth wyll allowe counsell common peace made christendome moreouer wisheth god true religion seruice maye restored whiche thinge accomplyshe mayntaine content ioyne hym selfe thynges commau ded declare vnto moreouer required might hereafter haue conference matter priuately certen appointed persones kyng bare suche affection towards religion would employ herein al treasure hym selfe also whereunto made aunswere commending kinges good wyll shewe howe chief desyre doctrine gospell myght spred far abrode whatsoeuer herein done dutie haue suffered great rebuke iniuries although thei haue procured selues hereby moste heinous displeasure haue oftentymes endured malice threatnynges many yet haue nothynge relented slacked therfore enterpryse settyng forth moste holy thyng cause great hatred malice forsaken wicked errours false doctrine kyng promysed ayde herein ample maner also hath expulsed banyshed realme tyranny byshop rome whence well sprang wicked idolatrye glad ioyful heare beseche god may thus procede moreouer doeth admonyshe beware dissention doctrine gyue hym harty thankes doubtles controuersie doe perseuer doctrine whiche professed auspurge concernynge anabaptistes extremely punyshed vnlesse come amendement also reigne chiefly place wher doctrine gospell prohibited talke also byshop craftie dealynge pleased muche byshops legate nowe germany makyng promyse counsel holden mantua howe talked herein prynce electour saxony deliberate aunswere made vnto demaundes comprised wryting whiche shall haue deliuered vnto hym beare vnto kyng intent may vnderstade mynde herein kynges societie coniunction wherof spake yelde harty thankes also intent holsome doctrine may kepe ryght course wil spare neyther paynes peryl doubte god wyl gouerne affayres although aduersary doe neuer muche contende spurne desyreth conferre thynges large men priuatly haue chosen certen purpose whome may comunicate thing praying reporte vnto kynge theyr good wyll towardes hym may appere better commendation whan duke saxon retourned kynge ferdinando protest league renewed smalcalde twelfte decembre christmas euen decree made league whiche lasted one yeare longer shoulde renewed ten yeares howe reste furniture shoulde prouyded agreed receyue league wyllynge desyrours professe doctrine propounded auspurge woulde beare scot lotte emonges whome prynces pomerane ulriche duke wyrtemberge roberte bauier prynce bipounte aulpurge franckeforte kempten hamborough hannobria herein toke ordre howe withstande defende themselues againste vniust iudgement emperiall chambre tyme also william erle nassowe admitted league albeit lantgraue reason controuersie betwixt erle nassowe lande chattes assente yet wrong offered profession gospell sayde woulde fayle case desyred ayde yeare also senate gospel receiued auspurge auspurge dissention length taken cleane awaye receyueth doctrine gospell wrytinge letter vnto luther intreate hym would sende faithful minister churche amonges others urbanus regius tenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument tenth booke citie munster preachyng barnarde rotman receaued gospell wherupon clergie theyr byshop forsoke place neuerthelesse reconcilemet made lantgraue came thether hollande anabaptiste called iohn leiden hauing wonne rotman diuers others infected whole citie poyson muche secte set mischief became stroger thinges common married many wylles iohn leiden death iohn matthewe declared chiefest prophet shortly kyng vniuersall hauing cheyalry power life death citie beseged metinge appointed confluence enforce siege anabaptistes sent letter lantgraue booke doctrine whiche luther impugned citie extreme famine last surprysed wonne kyng companion taken prisoner whose execution recited busines mu ster assemblie appointed wormes duke sauope besegyng geneua repoulsed kyng fraunce prepareth armie go towardes millan occasion mentioned ryght whiche pretendeth haue emperour beynge aduertysed enterprise commeth rome accuseth kyng solliciteth pope holde counsell protestauntes make league kyng englande pope publisheth counsell kept mantua warre betwyxt emperour frenche kynge archebyshop collon reformeth countreis nowe must come siege munster munster citie westophalia metropolitane citie westphalia first certen thinges repeted euen beginning vntyll tyme citie finally taken chief malefactours executed spake thomas mucer fist boke howe reysed tumulte communaltie shewed doctrine also howe endeth lyfe schole procedeth original anabaptistes doctrie maners kynde prople whiche practise doctrine called anabaptistes also thing metioned thei prohibite christening child selues baptised affirming others ought lykewyse take away al efficacitie former baptisme pretende certen outwarde holynes teache howe lawful christian go law beare office take othe neither haue thynge priuate yt al thigs ought como vnto al th ye begining afterwardes thei propounde great deale heinous matter shall hereafter declare whan began spreade ouer germany luther almoste learned men inueyhed magistrate also punyshed much could great nubre cleaue together length placed selues forsayde citie whiche dede great strengthe fortuned thus farre citie munster churche sainct morice wherin yeare lorde xxxij barnarde rotma preached gospell great rotman preacher audience citie deuised receiue citie catholickes hinder gyue hym meane summe money intent go place exercise selfe learning departeth certen place thought attayne knowledge fewe monethes retourneth wherewith beinge sore offended doe endeuour debarre preaching vayne great fauoure people within whyle certen beste principall senatours receyue hym citie kept churche set vp pulpet hym churche porche heare hym without audience encreased daylye requeste made churche myght open hym el dores broken vp longe aduise certen people chosen writinge letter hessia far lantgraues countrey desyreth certen good well learned men myght sent thether helpe hym preache gospell wherfore couple sent thether marpurge came thether consulted rotman thre others howe myght bannyshe byshop rome authoritie fyrste myghte teache gospel profit hearer compassing wherof waye semed vnto best drawe certen article byshops error numbre thyrty delyuer senate beynge meane tyme prepared vnlesse could proue scripture directly god worde would refuse punyshment senate comaundeth catholiques clergie come court propoundeth vnto forsayde article errours haue alwayes pretended theyr doctrine pure grounded vppon goddes worde preacher denye wyll ieoperde theyr lyues proue demaunde whether wyll confute scripture suche thynges obiected beyng thus spoken vnto perceyuynge senate tooke pleasure thynge aunswere fewe wordes haue nothyng alledge selues haue affirmed hitherto doinges papist co sesse ignoraunce ryght good done wening ignoraunce senate muche conuicte false doctrine nothyng saye selues confessed owne naughtines commaundeth henceforth teache geue place church newe preacher whiche haue detected errours consent senate common people church assigned euerye shoulde preache whiche thynge popyshe priestes toke displeasauntly especially cathedrall churche beynge moste parte gentleman borne good house tyme coulde otherwyse preuayle departe thence great dislikynge go vnto byshop citie layinge heades together doe papist forsake citie deuise stoppe wayes passage corne brought vnto citie lyttle whyle whan wayes stopped euery syde byshop others afore sayde consultation come telget litle town myle without citie whence messenger sent senate letter effect shoulde forsake enterpryse restore olde former state el would take ennemies byshop countie fraunces waldeck last hym frederick brother archebyshop collon frederick forsaketh byshoprike eyther coulde haue health party el smelled thynge long forsoke place owne accorde content lyue priuate lyfe home countrey munsterians consulting matter deteyne messenger setting forth vpo christmas eue night mu ster oppresse papistes c coming vpon soden taking towne keping gate yt none shold escape apprehend al bishop gone thece day happened cary prisoner citie amoges wer chief clergie diuers others nobilitie senate demaundeth intet whether purpose hereafter disturbe preaching yt gospell make gentle answer wyl endeuour doctrine may floryshe wherupon couenaunt made copie condicious peace wherof senate sent vnto lantgraue requestinge gospell common wealthes sake would matter sendeth certen counsel whose meditatio cocluded reconciled myndes forgetting al displeasure past partes obserue peace gospell preached syxe church al wicked supersticious religion abolished cathedrall churche nothyng altered neyther citie imagine cocerned thyng coclusion peace confirmed seales latgraue bishop clientes nobilitie comon people foretenth day february yeare saluation xxxiij wha al thinges thus pacified cometh certen cobler mu ster hollande one iolm leidan ranke anabaptist acquainted preacher gospel demauded iohn leida anabap priuatly whether supposed yonge childre rightly christened affirmed wholy addict contrary opinio began smile contempne theyr answere thing perceiued barnarde rotman metioned exhorteth people sermo pray yt may kepe still trewe doctrine maynteine infected fantastieall person namely anabaptistes also priuely crept amongs kept company others whose opinion shoulde preuaile state comon wealth religio also become miserable time came thither also herma stapred herman stapred beyng copagnion rotman inueighed openly christening child scholler henricke rollie whiche lyttle executed utreight thopinion anabaptisme another occasion newe doctrine nowe matter comen farre great brute anabaptistes throughout citie albeit yet thynge closselye secretly wroughte man admitted vnlesse theyr secte besydes chiefe aucthors professe thynges openly neyther taught night stepe practised theyr misteries whan thinge knowen many citezens sore offended whiche said suffrable newe doctrine priuatly taught night decree senate commaunded departe citie anab banished citie went one way came another braggyng god commaunded remayne defended theyr cause earnestly thing troubled senate also stroke soden admiration wherefore auoidinge tumulte daunger senate commaunded preacher aswell anabaptisme gospel come certein learned men rotman bewray opinion rotman became anabaptist kept close vntill time condemned christenynge child wycked detestable herman busche chieflye defended contrarye opinion senate suche sorte commaunded get oute cytye immediatlye common decree alledged myghte safelye passe throughe byshoppes countrey senate obtayned saufe conduicte gaue also money beare theyr charge whiche longe determined go whither el went priuely follower theyr secte lurked certen space meane tyme came abroade agayne senate shut vp church saue one fearyng lest anabaptistes numbre whome encreased dayly accompanied teacher shoulde haue driuen preacher gospell church afterwardes moneth nouembre lantgraue request senate sent two thether preache theodoricke fabritius consta cie fabritius iohn melsinger dede vnderstanding trouble towardes affrayde daunger retourned home agayne aboade stoutely admonyshyng citezens diligently beware anabaptisticall doctrine keepe styll course perseuered tyll anabaptistes gettinge vpper hande droue reste citie hereafter shalbe recited entent thei fynde lacke nothyng penneth certen fourme doctryne ecclesiasticall administration whiche allowed senate commos moreouer leaue senate peter peter wirtemie wirtemie began preache agayne made fewe sermon instigation rotman expulsed anabaptistes nowe waxinge fierse prouoked fabritius others disputation senate consente matter tried scripture suche like wrytinges agreable certen well learned men arbitrers consyderynge sentence reason eyther parte determine case decreed ratified intent fine controuersie secluded peace might restored churche codition rotman fellowes refused wherfore whan would abyde iudgement began dispysed intent myght washe spotte inuente waye easye one though moued spirite prophecie prophet inspired tuneth vp downe citie cry repente repente baptysed agayne wrath god shall nowe ouerwhelme began common people sturre many christened agayne cryed maner dyd many feare god anger much bragged abused simplicitie beyng deede otherwyse euyll followe myndes herein others also sauyng goodes rebaptysed anabaptistes punished sore theyr aduersaries best losse theyr substaunce ende decembre nowe agayne crept dennes spake resortyng market make outcrye comaund whiche rebaptised slayne paganes wicked men take common piece ordinaunce eiuile war citie munition inuade towne house muche mischief many others intent myght defend spoyle iniurie kepe stronge place citie take diuers contention anabaptistes kept market fortified euery syde continewed longe tyl last came compositio geuing pledge party wherby agreed euery one follow religion go home kepe peace meane tyme rotman cnipperdoling whiche chief faction notwithstandynge commended composition cnipperdolyng yet sendynge letter priuely townes nere warned men secte leauing goodes behynde shoulde repare vnto possible diligence soeuer left behinde shoulde receiue ten tymes muche recompence allured large ample promise came thether great nombres men woman hauing assured hope attaine better fortune especially suche poore able lyue home resorte citie munster tounes especially great substaunce sawe theyr citie full straungers conueyed selues thence well myght leauing anabaptistes multitude shroftyde moneth february mdxxxiiij tyme one parte thus weakened anabaptistes doe chouse newe senatours owne factio also make new conselles one cnipperdolyng shortly fyred churche saint morice suburbes buyldinges thereabout spoyle church vndermyne cathedrall churche within done flocke together euerye strete crye first repente repente auoyde thence quickly ye wicked men vnlesse intende hazarde lyues finally assemble armure al secte immediatly thrust citie without respect age sexe muche hurly burly diuerse woman miscaried chylde sone put flyghte streight wayes toke goodes albeit happened yt day besieged citie yet neuerthelesse certen fled chau ced byshoppes handes toke ennemies dyuerse lost heades emonges others one two preacher gospell peter wirtemie beyng daunger amonges rest request lantgraue preserued whiche thynge moued residue honest citizen mynded forsake towne yet seyng present dauger without maner constrayned tary agaynst wil tyme chiefest prophet amonges name doe vsurpe themselues iohn mathewe commaunded loke golde syluer euery man shoulde brynge iohn matthewe high prophet foorth vnder payne death purpose common treasure house appointed people beyng fore astonied cruel decree durst obeye neyther myght man disceiue begile part two certen yonge maydens prophecied coulde declare fraude vsed neither bryng maydens prophecie toke also owne vse goodes whome expulsed prophet cominaunded man henceforth haue kepe booke sauing holy byble others commaunded brought forth brent commau dement sayde geuen hym aboue therfore bookes brought thether wonderfull numbre consumed fyre chaunced tyme one hubert trutelynge smyth spoken thynge ieste whiche named selues prophetes whan knowen called people together iestyng p nyshed commaunded put harnesse accused codemned die whiche thinge astonied people maruelously chief prophet named taketh poore man casteth hym downe flat vpon grounde thrusteth speare hym yet gaue deadly wounde although pearsed hym great violence done commaunded caryed away another place caught boore speare young man hande stode next laie iobbed staffe heade seyng man would die sayde howe declared vnto hym heauen tyme yet come dye god grauted pardon notwithstandyng died within fewe dayes whiche thyng whan prophet knewe toke long morispike rode vp prophet inspired wt downe towne great pace crieng god father commaunded hym discomfite ennemies without citie put flyght whan came nere campe souliour encountred ran albeit yt false prophecie thus detected seconde tyme yet fellowe prophetes bewitched men made matter fayre common people ryght sory losse hym saying hanged great plage ouer worthye man taken next prophet vnto hym iohn leidan bad good comforte reuealed vnto hym longe shoulde thus ende lyfe marry wyfe two day easter ran euery churche range belle one fewe dayes cnipperdoling prophecieth cnipperdoling prophecieth placed high dignitie shalbe cast downe others preferred rowmes lowe base degree commaundeth church destroyed affirminge earnestlye commaundement came god therfore obeyed commaundement whiche sayd came heauen accomplyshed great diligence longe iohn leidane deliuereth sworde execution vnto cnipperdoling appointeth hym hangeman thus hath pleaseth god whiche horse asse borne hyghest office consulshyp haue lowest office hangeman refusyng toke offer good part also whan byshop nowe space two thremonethes borne whole charge warre alone herman archebyshop collon iohn duke claeue sent hym money munition certen bandes horseman fotemen ayde archebishop wet also campe tasist hym cou sell longe citie assaulted diuers place hope wynne assaulte buylded seue bulwarkes fortes citie take away victualles put euery forte enseigne fotemen certen bade horsmen wynter continuance siege warre whiche aswell concerned others byshop munster desyred ayde prince city prouince rhine reason nere hande whiche cause assemblie appointed cofluence xiij daye decembre yeare mdthe diuisio germany prouice xxxiiij germany deuided sixe prouinces frankony bauier swelande saxonie coaste rhyne burgundy within whiche limites prince city aunciet custome accopted assembly empyre saxonye deuided hyghe lowe agayne base countrey germany westphalia austriche added hereuto empyre conteineth ten region assaulte attempted vayne iohn leidane gaue self reste slepeth thre whole day together tyme awake spake worde salshod leidane last called forpaper wherin wrote name twelue men wherof certen gentleman whiche twelue trybes israel rule gouerne thynges sayde twelue iudges wyll heauenly father thus meanes twelue men prepared awaye kyngdome propoundeth certe opinion preacher whiche requireth haue confuted testimony scripture vtter people may approued ratified wherof man bouden one wife might paradox iohn leiden lawfully marry many list whan preacher reproued opinion calleth counsell house twelue also come thither taketh cloke throweth grounde newe testament withall witnessing swearing thinge whiche propounded reuealed vnto heauen therfore thretneth right high wordes thoughe haue god theyr frende vnlesse consented fine agree opinion doctor preache matrimony three dayes together streight way marieth three wyues one wherof one wife aforesaid great prophet iohn mathew whose example afterwardes others folow muche accompted praise often married diuerse honest citezens misliked doynges geuing notice throughout citie called suche professed doctrine sedition citie gospell market place afterwardes apprehended prophet cnipperdolinge preacher whiche thing rascall people vnderstode came armure tooke away prisoner slewe fiftie wt great crueltie tyed vnto tree pillers shotte dagges theyr highe prophet greatly commendinge wylling would god pleasure shoote first howbeit others otherwise murthered eight kalendes iuly arriseth newe prophet goldsmith calling assemblie people marketplace declareth vnto howe commaundement heauenly father iohn leidane possesse thempire whole worlde marchyng forwarde puissaunt iohn leida inuadeth kingdome armie distroy kinges prince without respecte spare multitude least loued righteousnes possesse seate dauid father vntill suche time father reuoke kingdome owne handes howe wicked beyng destroyed godly men reigne life thinges openly declared iohn leidane immediately fell downe vpon knee liftyng vp handes vnto heauen said men brother thing knew many dayes sin yet would neuer speake intent might better credit new king anabap father hathe vsed another minister beynge thus made kinge forthwith displaceth xii men custome kynges chouseth vnto noble commaudeth also sworde gylte seabarde two crownes cheyne ptre suche like ornamentes prouided pure golde appointed certen dayes wherin wyll heare openly haue sutes hym ofte came abroade accopanied pompe noble officer houshold next followed two yogmen ryding wherof one ryght hande caried crowne byble bare sworde drawen lyke pompe went chief wyfe diuers one market place prepared hym highe seate hanged cloth golde complaintes sutes came moste part concerning wyues diuorcementes whiche moste common case much many liued together long time first diuorsed fortuned tyme people stoode thicke preasing heare beholde cnipperdoling lea peth forth creping vpon men heades sholders stoode madnes cnipper thick together breathing mouthes sayd vnto euery one father hath sanctified receiue holy ghost certen tyme daunced kyng thus sayeth wonte playe tymes past whore father hath commaunded lykewyse kyng ouer tedious could make none ende kyng offended departed tha getteth vp kynges seate toke vpon king kynge retourning meane tyme plucked headlog kepeth pryson thre dayes siege compyle set forth booke whiche call restauration wherein amonges thinges teache kyngdome christe shalbe boke restitution sorte last daye iudgement elect chosen shold reigne wicked vtterly destroyed place teache moreouer howe people may put downe magistrate albeit apostle commaundement vsurpe iurisdiction yet suche nowe minister churche ought take vpon ryght sworde force establyshe newe common wealth man ought suffered churche whiche true christian againe saued vnles make goodes common kepe nothing priuate hym self saie also luther bishop rome false prophetes yet luther worse finally saye mariage lyghtened true fayth polluted filthie rather reputed whoredome aduoutrie opinion wrote comfuted chiefly melanchtho iustus ionas menius urbanus regins whose workes full eloquence remayne touching fewe weakes newe prophet spake blewe trompet euery strete commauded men arme selues repayre head churche porche enemy must driuen citie whan came thether fynde supper ready commaunded sate downe supper numbre foure thousand afterwardes also suppe thei watched meane tyme thousand kyng quene theyr familie serued tyme eate wel supper almoste done king selfe reacheth bread vnto euerye one wordes take eate shewe death lorde quene geuing cuppe sayeth drynke shewe lordes death done prophete mentioned goeth pulpet demaundeth whether wyll obey god worde whan sayde yea heauenly father commaundement saith sende forth preacher worde numbre twenty eight whiche going foure partes worlde may preache doctrine taught citie reciteth apost munster name weth whether eche man shall go wherfore sixe sent osenbridge many warredorfe eight soest many co elde kynge quene suppe rest seruitours preacher appoynted sent forth supper tyme kynge ryseth vp sayeth hath little busines father hath communded chaunced souldiour taken prysoner whome kyng accuseth treason iudas beheaded hym selfe kinges murther retourneth supper telleth merely done supper foresaid eight twenty sent away nyght besydes charge euery man deliuered piece golde whiche commaunded leaue suche place would admitte doctrine whiche token destruction death euerlasting refusyng peace holsome doctrine offered setting forth whan euery man came place cried throughout townes men shoulde repent penaunce preacher mu ster el shortly destroyed spread clothes vpon grounde magistrate threwe vpon piece golde whiche receiued affirming sent father offer peace wyl receyue thei bid communicate ryches refuse doe sygne witnesse acte vnthankefulnes tyme prophetes haue spoken wherin god would haue ryghteousnes obserued whole vniuersall worlde whan kyng shal accordyng duty haue brought matter passe iustice shall reigne place shall christ deliuer vp kyngdome father tyme spoken thus apprehended fyrst gentle meanes afterwardes tormentes examined beliefe kynde lyfe fortification citie make aunswere howe racked haue true doctrine woulde witnesse stande death since apostle tyme hitherto worde god neuer preached ryghtly neither hath bene iustice foure prophetes wherof two iuste dauid iohn leidane two vniuste byshop rome luther worse damauded expulse innocent people citie contrary fidelitie promyse taking goodes wyues childre place scripture could proue defend iustice say nowe tyme come wherin christ sayd meke possesse earth yt sorte time paste god gaue goodes egiptians vnto people israell afterwardes speakyng numbre men victualles within citie affirmed diuerse many aboue fiue wiues moreouer howe loked dayly greater power hollande friselande sone come kyng would marche forwarde whole armie subdue coquere world destroying kinges prince ministred iustice racking whan perseuered styl purpose would acknowledge obstiuacie magistrate besides owne kynge rewarded losse heades neuerthelesse one escaped nowe citie euery syde narrouly straightlye besieged waye go wherfore citezens fearing famine carefull owne perill thought apprehende kynge sende hym byshop boude king hearing therof chose kynge taketh hede hym selfe twelue amonges whiche thought moste faithful vnto called duke appointed euery garde part towne kepe lest aryse anye tumulte amonges people maketh promyse multitude howe easter deliuered siege penurie vnto twelue duke whiche chose promised ample thinges great deale telling howe shoulde haue chiefe rule gouernment namyng also coutreis townes castels would geue vnto euery one sayd would spare lantgraue trusted woulde take parte length shewed assemblie appointed confluence moneth decembre state prouince rhine unto also friderick prince electour saxony annexed selfe owne accorde assemblie consultation decreed ayde byshop munster immediately thre hundreth horseman thre thousande footemen syxe monethes ouer whiche garryson whole warre also wiricke countie obersted charge decreed moreouer sollicite residue state imperiall ayde emperour spayne entreate king ferdinado moneth aprill assigne generall metyng purpose admonishe beseged letter earnestly wrytten leaue forsake theire enterprise whiche dishonest wicked nothynge could vnlesse thei would obey submit selues vnto laweful magistrate proteste byshop nowe besegeth shal wante ayde whole empyre ende decembre ides ianuary yeare xxv thei write many wordes dede smal purpose yet comended mainteined quarel vnto whiche obiected vnto makynge kynge aunswered nothynge howe theyr letter lantgraue go excuse matter speakinge many thynges salle destruction wickedmen deliuerauce kyngdome godly lyfe sende withall booke restauration mentioned admonyshyng amende attempte warre wycked prynces doe holy men good people lantgraue readinge ouer booke letter noted thought blame worthy comaunded learned aunswer muche fewe wordes abscure written king muche god appointment demaundeth wherfore expresse place scripture wherby thought lawefull thus doe dyd confirme thynge signes wonder cominge christe god declared longe prophetes euidently well knowen house familie also whan borne also requested matter might heard wherunto lantgraue answered might take place much take vpon aucthoritie sworde bene worker muche mischiefe men see marke shoute certely subuerte lawes common wealth lyke intente wicked detestable nowe requeste haue cause heard fayned dissembled doubtles sent vnto faythful preacher minister churche whome ryghtlye instructed nowe contepning doctrine resist errours mischief anabap magistrate take men goodes mary sondrye wyues haue chosen newe kynge also denye christe toke humane nature virgyn mary affirme man hath free wyll compell men make goodes comon saye remission sinner falleth thynges lawes god man whan answer brought vnto wryte agayne sende booke compyled vulgare togue misteries booke yt mi ries scripture scripture againe epistle amplefie cause defende opinion booke deuide course tyme whole worlde thre partes fyrst age adam noe saye destroyed deluge water secod wherein nowe daye shalbe consumed fyre diuisio world thyrde shall cleane newe worlde wherein iustice shall reigne neuerthelesse last tyme shall appeare present age must pourged fyre shall tofore antichriste shall reuealed power vtterly abolyshed tha shall come passe scate dauid whiche decayed shal newly erected christe shall possesse kyngdome earth wrytinges prophetes shall accomplyshed present worlde lyke tyme esaw iustice kepeth silence godly persecuted captiuitie babylon nowe also preset age cumpared esaw tyme restauration hande delyuer v myseries rendre vnto wycked aboundantly demerites apocalipse declared restauration goeth worlde come intent vngodlye beynge destroyed house seate iustice myght prepared beautified whan lantgraue red booke set hande minister churche wryte residue state imperial assembled essinge mislyke doinges coffuence affirming authoritie impose charge burthen vnlesse bene consent emperour state moneth february corne within citie waxed scarse muche also died honger wante meate fortuned one quenes pitieng people sayde rest howe supposed god woulde men peryshe thus famine kyng whiche stoore house furnyshed home kynge beheaded quene necessitie also riot voluptuousnes knewe brought forthe market place reste commaundynge knele downe stroke heade whan dead vttered haue played whore done residewe syng gyue thankes god heaue lye father kynge daunceth wyth exhorteth rest multitude whiche nothynge lefte breade salte dauncynge mery pastymes whan easter came deliueraunce appered kyng whiche promysed stoutely inucnte excuse fayned selfe sicke space syxe dayes commeth abroade amonges people telleth howe hath ryden blynde asse god father hathe blynd asse layde vpon backe synnes people wherfore made cleane delyuered euery spotte deliueraunce whiche promysed wherwith ought holde co tented luther amonges thynges whiche set forth vulgar tongue tyme wrote also tragedye munster luther writig must ala sayeth howe complayne lamente wretched men thynge selfe declareth dwell deuylles thycke threfolde yet ought praye infinite mercy god herein haue good cause doe albeit contempt gospell reproche goddes holy name shedyng innocent bloud germany hath iustly deserued plaged yet hathe god hetherto restrayned force violence sathan hath permitted haue reignes libertie mercifully admonysheth v tragedye munster nothinge artificious calleth v amendement lyfe vnlesse god brydeled god bridleth power sathan hym holden hym backe doubte moste subtille fynde wylie artificer would haue handled matter farre wyse nowe god hathe made restraynte rageth tourmoyleth muche woulde much permitted wycked spirite seketh subuersion christian fayth goeth way worke perswade marriage many wyues seyng vnlawfulnes fylthye beastlynes thynge apparent syght men perceiueth well enough men woulde abhorre dede politicke ciuile gouernemet may meane disturbed kingdom christ must attempted weapon ingines would circumuente deceaue men maye affectate rule gouernment playe tyraunt men disalowe meanesmen disceaued see playnely intente must attayne thereunto secrete meanes certen bypathes goe olde euyll fauoured apparell looke graue countenaunce hange downe heade towardes grounde faste handle croked necked cattell money absteyne flesshe abhorre matrimonye eschewe bearynge offyce prophane thynge refuse gouernemente professe wounderfull lowelynes mynde say ready way meane deceyue also ryght wyse whiche couertly priuely setteth open way kyngdome ouermuche impudencie take vpo self king fleshly luste mary many wyues craft ignoraut deuyll fansieth sure ye policie skilful deuyl one yt yet rude ignorant expert tha assuredly god hath boude chayne yt worke craftely whiche doubtles doth intentethat shoulde feare deitie amende liues let lose cunning deuyl whiche certenly wyll assaulte v muche fiersly deuyl symple grammarian hath styred vp muche trouble shal whan satha muche knowledge expert lawyer perfite diuine shall make towardes v full sayle wherfore great feare vngoodly deuyll suppose also citie lyke well sport game playe many ryght sory whiche without syghynges teares desyre god delyuered chaunced certen yeares synce also sedition countrey men woulde god whole worlde craftier deuyll munster god would take worde v beleue fewe woulde geue credite grosse drunken maister yet surely whan god wrath kyndled errour absurde god wrath vnsauery whiche deuill perswade see happened doctrine mahomet albeit altogether folyshe yet lyght god worde beyng quenched toke force strengthe spread abroade suche ample maner see god infrynged deuise enterpryse muncer woulde haue come passe also germany sathan rayse vp great meanes deuil vanquished flamme god permission verey small sparke neyther better waye quenche fyre worde god ye armure ennemies al together incorporate ca neyther subdued trope horseman yet force munition warlyke furniture prynces byshoppes go contrary waye worke hynder doctrine gospell whiche myndes harte men healed meane tyme exercyse cruel punyshement bryng body deuyll leaue hym better part man whiche harte soule whiche thyng shall haue like successe wyth iewes time past thought queche christ crosse passion concerning thinges munster haue wrytten set forth suppose thynge standeth thus theyr wrytinge lately publyshed maketh thinke wherin haue gallantly paynted theyr owne furye fyrst touchinge faythe teache verey absurde thynges christe though borne virgyn mary withstanding errours munsterians fayth confesse howe came seede dauid sufficietly declare thinges assuredly sathan bringeth vp monstre dede doth signifie nothinge darkely seede fleshe marye delyuer v laboureth vaine scripture saith christ borne virgin mary whiche vocable sure al tonges referred vnto chyld baptisme whiche conceiued flesh bloud mother takyng shape brought forth worlde againe condempne baptisme tyme paste prophane thinge vnwittely done iudge esteme worke thyng ordeyned god man case euery thing ought dispised cast away wicked men geue haue maruel surely wherfore aswell contemne gold syluer ryches taken wicked inuente newe metall deuise lyke also baptisme worke creation god whan wicked sweareth abuseth true name god haue true name god offendeth nothyng robeth stealeth breaketh commaundement god case haue true commaundemet god synneth likewyse former baptisme nothyng suche washed therewith haue erred tha fellowes detest christening though wycked thyng nothynge selues doe confesse mariages fourmer tyme accompted whoredome adultery contracted mariage suche wanted faith saye praye graunt selues whore sonnes packe nowe bastardes misbegotten tell doe enioye landes patrymony citie theyr auncesters reason woulde deede muche sorte shoulde inherite lande newe kynde matrimonie prouyde newe possession ryches whiche myght haue honest tytle semelye holy godlye people doe pretende shoulde lyue vnlawfull bastardelye goodes harlottes muche lesse take fro others vyolence playne robberye touchynge theyr foolyshe kyngdome many open crymes one thynge nedeth longer discourse certenly whiche sayde maye seme ouer muche greatly necessarye especiall seynge matter sufficiently treated declared others assemblye empyre whyche kynge ferdinando requeste prynces kepte deputes moneth aprill wormes city whiche hitherto geuen money proteste beginning comming thether assemblie wormes decree made confluence obeye emperour king ferdinando great altercatio prince contribution length condescended giue ayde fyue monethes twenty thousand crownes monethly decreed moreouer tyme citie wonne taken innocent people spared good men either beseged el fled thence restored goodes whan decree made byshop munster deliuereth armie vnto obersten money ouer negligetly leuied almost dede late coulde notable exploicte done captaynes selues lacke money oftener one daunger lyues sedicion souldiours tyme matter brought suche extremitie within citie many died dayly famine many also departed thence went broade pyned hongerstoruen ennemies pitie compassion vpo captaines sent worde citie required rendre townes men case would deliuer king certen others haue harme whiche albeit citezens woulde fayne haue done yet afrayde kynges crueltie vigilacie durst attempte nothynge obstinate log thyng remayned selfe fewe others eate would neuer rendre wherfore captaynes wryte againe bidde sende hence forth muche woman childre first day iune next day wrote answer coplait ye munsterians complayning matter could heard said afflicted without desert parte man coulde detecte errour would become doe expounde certen place daniel fourth beast much cruell rest conclusion letter would god helpe perseuer styl confession veritie whiche thinges thus wrytten kynges mynde whan thynges brought maruelous extremitie two escaping betraye citie citie two certen men escaped one taken souldiours vpon fidelitie came byshop eyther shewed meane wynne citie countie obersten byshop hearyng bothe tale two twenty iune sommoned towne charging citezens rendre vp yelde selues people might saued perysh thus honger cause rotman aunswer walles kynge standing suche sorte would relent chaunge purpose two dayes aleuen clock nyght fotemen brought closely citie certe chosen souldiours conduict two men escaped got ouer dyche vp walle slewe watche others followyng fynde posterne gate open fiue hondreth certen captaynes ensignes entred citie tounes men assembled together stayed reste would lykewyse haue inuaded longe euer coulde put backe shut gate done geue charge vpon wer come slew many whan foughten sore space one houre wynnyng mu ster two souldiours enclosed stept next gate kept small garde breake open perforce made way fellowes without immediatly pressed strog power wheras townes first made resistaunce kept market place whiche wel fortified defence last matter desperate many stayne first encountre craued founde mercy kynge cnipperdoling taken instante botman kyng taken hope liue running amoges ennemies thickest stayne lest come handes alyue whan citie byshop toke hym selfe munitio half rotman desperate spoyle discharging armie reserueth selfe two enseignes asiste citie followed counsell imperiall wormes moneth iuly wherin kyng ferdinando deputes propounded demaundeth whether citie beyng nowe taken shall treate furthermore howe destroye anabaptistes admonysheth also call vpon byshop rome counsel thei saye touchyng anabaptistes hath bene redy set forth diuers proclamation mete done byshop byshop munster demaundeth charge hath bene oft enoughe sollicited counsell euen emperoure hym selfe neyther doe thinge therein counsell byshop munster requyreth recompenced charge coplayneth money promysed yet paide whan nothyng el could concluded fewe state also wer present metinge assigned nouembre wherin shoulde take ordre accomptes charge warre howe commo wealth munster hereafter gouerned whan daye come ferdinando ambassadour fewe wordes repeteth cause assemblie amonges thynges myght deuise also citie lately taken maye remayne hence forth olde religion byshoppes ambassadour declareth charge hath bene warre tyme great somes money hath borrowed howe citie taken auoyding tumultes ut ther daunger enforced buylde two fortes citie manne thinges desyreth cosideration might hereunto aunswere made byshop greatest part spoyle munition also citezens goodes whiche thynges dede apperteyne common wealth empire wherfore reason would al thynges estimate made much charge diducted ouerplus aunswered accordinglye decreed byshop munster vnder empire according olde custome nobilitie citie restored citezens also fled awaye anabaptist touching religion byshop shall take ordre therein accordinge decree empyre spring next yere following ambassadours prynces go munster vnderstande state citezens saue innocent people destroye fortification made anabaptistes byshop shall also caste downe two fortes whiche hath buylded within citie execute immediatly king cnipperdoling crechtinge prysoners according demerites kepe longer point concerning religio duke saxon lantgraue duke wirtemberge countie anhalde protested openly would neuer assente city also professed neyther would haue olde fortification defaced newe kyng two fellowes kyng fellowes caried caried hither thither vnto prynces shewe mockery whiche occasion lantgraues preacher enter disputation kynge touchynge opinion chieflye kyngdome christe magistrate iustification baptisme lordes disputation ye king supper incarnation christe mariage testimony scripture priuayle farre albeit chauge wholy stroue defended opinion stifly yet turne cofounde fyne graunted many thing whiche withstanding supposed haue done saue lyfe whan retourned vnto seconde tyme promysed myght haue pardon brynge passe anabaptistes whiche hollande brabant englande freselande exceadyng great numbre shold kepe sylence obey magistrate thynges afterwardes preacher reasoned fellowes also mouthe wryting mortification christening chyldren communion goodes kyngdome christe tyme brought telget kyng beyng demaunded byshop authoritie durst bolde vsurpe muche libertie vpon citie people asked hym gaue power aucthoritie ouer citie wher bolde aunswer kyng byshop made aunswere consent college people rule iurisdiction sayde called hether god thirtene kaledas february thei brought munster comitted euery man seuerall pryson daye also came byshop thether accompanied archbishop collon ambassadours duke cleue space two dayes followyng spent godly admonition myght reduced heresy deede kynge confessed faulte fled vnto christe prayer two neyther woulde acknowledge offence yet stode obstinatly opinion next daye king brought vp skaffold tied post two hangemen ready eche payre tonges read hote three first pulles helde peace afterwarde callyng continually goddes mercy whan bene cruell death kyng thus turmented howre last thrust harte sharpe poynted dagger left lyfe fellowes punyshement whan thei dead fastened grate iron hanged hyghest towre citie called saynet lambertes king myddes man height aboue two moneth ianuary present yeare died lady katherine dowager whome henry eyght kyng englande death quene katherine put away thre yeares shewed fourth booke howe fridericke duke holste helpe lubeckes made kyng denmarke whose death arrose mortall warre betwene sonne christiane kinge citie lubecke duke saxon lantgraue ernest duke lunenburge citie breme hamborough mayde burge brunswicke lunenburge hildisseme intreated peace yeare moneth february pacified charles duke sauoye certen space maynteyned warre citie geneua beynge ayded byshop citie warre geneua ye duke sauoy set rather partely profession gospell partly matter citie geneua ioyned league citie berne swicerlade whome length receiuing great ayde gaue repulse ennemies berne marching subdued al laye comodious countrey euen loke geneua residue swicers also bordered ayde berne vpo sauoye whylest working kynge fraunce whiche longe purposed warre italye especially synce death fraunces sfortia leuieng armie begynning spryng tyme maketh warre also duke freche king duke sauoye sauoye vncle controuersie inheritaunce whiche said due vnto possessed deteyned duke beynge already much inpoueryshed swycers therfore vnmete matche puissaunt ennemye short tyme dispossessed maner whole duckdome kyng passing ouer alpes inuadeth also countrey piedmount amonges taketh turrine chiefest town partes fortifieth workes strength men conduict philippe schabotte admirall duke sauoy marryed beatriche daughter emanuell kyng portugall emperours syster isabel former tyme addicted selfe neyther semed incline emperour styred vp king nephew owne syster lewesse reporte howe byshop clement tyme marseille last booke recited pope counsel inuade sauoy gaue kyng counsell case intended recouer millan first seke lorde sauoy piedmonte adioyning howe soeuer kyng yeare followyng certen newe custome ordeyned realme fraunce legion souldiours numbre forty thousande legion souldiours whiche shoulde exercise weapon readynes tyme seruice came aunciently kynges fraunce haue alwayes maynteined cheualry whole force hathe bene horseman man would haue also footemen ready monstered shold euermore haue nede forein souldiours kynges purpose leade forth armie make warre thereby lu bardie intent myght recouer duckdome milla enioyed syxe yeares together contented right child ualentine grandmother sister philippe uicecounte last duke millan familie thus matter standeth house uicecoutes bare noble brute house vicecoutes lumbardie first accompted otho archebyshop millan tyme raffe emperour expulsed turrians noble worthy familie whome nephewe matthewe brother theobaldus sonne succeded hym galeace actius luchine iohn matthew seconde galeace seconde barnabas iohn galeace emperour weceslans created first duke millan two sonnes iohn philippe died without issewe one daughter ualentine fraunces sfortia stoute warriour married bastarde daughter philip occasion vsurped dukedome millan secludyng uale tine philippes syster whome lewys duke orleaunce brother charles sixt kyng fraunce maried sfortia thre sonnes galeace lewis ascanius wherof lewis inuaded dukedome freche kinges title millan begot two sonnes maximilian fraunces duke orleaunce ualentine charles philippe iohn charles father lewis duke orleaunce whiche king fraunce twelfth name philippe died without issewe iohn erle engolesme sonne named charles father kyng fraunces toke maximilian sfortia prisoner subdewed lumbardie leo tenth emperour dispossessing hym agayne restored fraunces sfortia exile nowe dead kyng fraunces reclayme ryght saieth aueged moueth warre agayne death sfortia emperour taken possessio lumbardie anthony leua left depute tyme sayled barbaria mentioned wherfore sone anye knowledge kynges enterpryse leuieth immediatly power myghte germanye place come italy coming fro naples rome beginning aprill within fewe dayes repayre required senate might called wherin byshop emperous oration freche king great numbre cardinalles ambassadours foreyne prynces graue vehement oration frenche kyng breakyng league olde hatred malice hindreth impecheth moste worthy godly enterprise ende oration declare ready fight combat intent priuate losse one two rather publique domage whole worlde warre might one haue ende departed naples uenetians entred league uenetians league ye emperour turke rather hoped well would delyuer possession millan priuate man state italy chiefly uenetians wouldneyther emperour yet frenche kyng enioye goodly dukedome millan therfore former yeares conspyred oftentymes one whyle frenche kynge whyle emperour fraunces sfortia myght restored whome supposed stande lesse daunger league clement uenetians made emperour ten yeares cause thinkyng emperour hauyng displaced sfortia would haue kept owne vse lumbardie whiche dede supposed would great hinderaunce intercession byshop clement sixe yeares past restored sfortia boloigne la grasse got wonderfull fauour great good wyll naples also emperour finished vp mariage bastarde daughter alexander medices whome made duke florence tolde seuenth booke duke florence marieth emperours bastarde alexander bastard sonne laurence medices father peter whiche drowned mouth lira last boke mentioned haue heard howe uergerius sent germany whan emperour arriued naples byshop calleth hym home againe returning great expedition whan came rome declareth ambassade protestauntes required haue free christian counsell within precinct empyre place conuenient emperour made promyse luther rest hope luther constancie vnlesse dispatched way concerning king englande protestauntes wyll assente reste prince colde howe george duke saxonye affirmeth great daunger lutherians whiche otherwise eschewed auoyded vnlesse emperour byshop make warre ryght shortly whiche thynge whan byshop vnderstode sendeth hym naples spede recite thynges uergerius sent emperour emperour especially concernyng warre attempted agaynste lutherias aterwardes wha emperour come rome earnestly hande haue counsel called coueted greatly cary hym letter patentes byshop said content notwithstading woulde chouse citie italy prescribe therein certen condition necessary churche rome hereunto emperour woulde one cared would bryng greater parte germany followe hym herein therfore byshop chouseth nyne nu bre make wrytte campegius cesius simonet ginucius cotarene poole cardinal archebishop brunduse diuisers b byshop rhezo uergerius tha made byshop modruse long instinopulis together first byshops presence afterwardes seuerally selues deuise forme somoning counsell haue heard ambassadours englande whome accorded smalcalde vpon certen condition kyng set forth pure doctrine gospell whiche professed auspurge maynteyne lawefull counsell suche shalbe neyther admitte calling place counsell comon assent neuerthelesse may appere certayne manifest reason suche counsel like hath bene declared peter paule uerger byshoppes legate refused case byshop continue purpose enterpryse letted open protestation refused lyke kynge hath ioyned hym selfe religion lykewyse ioyne league also called patroneand king england patrone ye pro league defendour common opinion supremacie byshop rome vtterly reiected euer anye warre attempted parte religion cause ayde geuen vnto hym inforceth defence league kyng shal paye one hundreth thousand crownes wherof one halfe confederatours shall may employe wha nede shall requyre rest charge borne money whiche shall contribute amonges warre shal longe endure force ennemy driue tha king disburse two hundreth thousand crownes much lyke chaunce fortune stande also bounde sped goodes bloud lyfe also somme also like consideration emploied vse defende league remainder restored whan warre finished ambassadours shall wryte kyng hereof whan knowe mynde aduertise duke saxon lantgraue therof commo ambassade english ambassad wynter witteberg maye sent vnto hym whan ambassadours sent requestes vnto king going wittemberge passed away rest wynter meane whyle reasoned diuines certen article chiefe controuersie mariage priestes lordes supper popyshe masse monasticall vowes chief desyre diuines would approue kynges diuorsement sayde coulde scripture whan alledged many thinges perswade matter one chieflye byshop clement varied sentence declared frenche king priuate talke thought diuines answered case king great cause vrged say cause iust would graut letter come englande pourporting declaratio kinges letter protestant kynges mynde herein ambassadours aduertise prince electour hereof xij day marche wittemberge whether duke tyme come speaking first many thinges kynges great good wil declare part requestes content fewe might amended albeit england thinge quiet neither cause wherfore kynge feare man happely cause hath bene taken away death wyfe forsaken neuerthelesse recouer mayntayne true doctrine doth refuse de ray somme money whiche requyre league goe forwarde hereof wyll treate large theyr ambassadours offer vnto hym honour shoulde defendour pairone league geueth great thankes acknowledgeth good wil although vnderstandeth howe muche enuie displeasure annexed yet common wealthes sake could contente agree vppon fyrst seconde demaunde vnlesse vniformitie doctrine supposeth charge greatly honour would chiefly wyshe learned men realme myght wholy one opinion seeth king england requireth co ference lerned men well wyll vnlesse certen place confession apologie doctrine maye priuate talke thynge qualified therfore desyreth instantlye sende ambassadours amonges one excellently learned whiche may conferre diuines whole doctrine ceremony determine matter sheweth selfe lyberall vnto requyreth agayne case anye man attempte warre againste hym fyrste wyll ayde hym eyther fyue hondreth horseman el ten shippes well manned fournyshed foure monethes vpon charge shall prouyde hym two thousande horseman fyue thousande fote men finally sentence whiche diuines kinges deuorcemet wittemberge prononced touchinge diuorcement made wold approue also defende next counsell duke aunswereth muche whole matter concerneth consortes wyll make priuie vse counsell foure twenty daye aprill assigned mete franckeforth cause firste prescribe fourme ambassadours followe whiche sent englande wherein prouided amoges thinges whan shall come thether perchaunce coclude vpo league al thinges except expresse wordes empire emperour vnto bounde othe fidelitie ambassadour citie appointed iames sturmius receyued league diuines melanchthon bucer george draco assemblie receyued league ulriche duke wyrtemberge bernine philippe brother duke pomerane george ioachime bretherne countes anhalde moreouer city auspurge franckeforte kempten hamborough haunobria treated also thynges appertayning league defence therof iudgement imperial chaber decreed moreouer sende messenger letter emperour thereby aunswere epistle sent fro naples george duke saxon exceadyng hatred bare luther doctrine oftentymes great cotention sute prynce electour saxon man father last agrement made nowe broken againe sayde duke george diuerse wayes prynce electour declaringe whole matter ambassadours consortes assemblie requestyng assisted ayde counsell case attempte anye force violence assemblie brake vp tenth day may begynning iune kynge englande hauyng co dempned lamentable death quene anne wyue quene anne adultrye inceste vniustly supposed proued synce causeth head stryken borne hym daughter calleth elizabeth executed certen gentleman kynges priuie chaumbre noreis weston brewton one markes whiche contrary conscience reported hope preferement subscribed byll whereby condempned hym selfe reste lorde admirall fizt williams erle southhampton sayde vnto hym subscribe markes see wyll come subscribed receyued therfore rewarde vnloked also lorde rochforte quenes brother false accusation errant strompet wyfe whiche afterwardes suffered therfore accordynge desertes whiche doulfull tragedie toke cleane awaye ambassade haue sent englande whan warre hotely begonne betwene emperour counsel called frenche kyng paule thyrde publisheth wrytinge vnder bulles lead somme wherof call counsell mantua xxiij day may yeare followyng commaunding al archbishop byshops head church day vnder penaltie ecclesiasticall lawes prescribed disobediece furthermore chargeth desireth emperour king prince al others either lawe custome haue interest loue christe comon welthes sake come persone otherwyse letted tha send ambassadours full authoritie remayne tyll ende counsell churche may refourmed heresy weded cleane warre attempted ennemies religio effect therof whereunto subscribed sixe twenty cardinalles seuenth iune kyng ferdinando sent iames sturcelly ciuilian ambassadour insprucke swycers heare saith fre che kyng hath requyred ayde obteined great pleasure haue aduertised emperour hereof certenly reason would emperour gaue none occasion warre fully resolued sommer haue warred vpon barbarian ennemies religion notwithstanding frech kyng frenche kynge immediatly death fraunces sfortia duke millan albeit hath right title therunto composition made touchyng whole matter certen yeares paste contrary conuenauntes sought renewe warre recouer lumbardy tyme passing alpes great armie inuaded duke sauoye prynce empyre intent hauing one subdued countrey might haue way open passe nowe emperour hath leuied armie resiste hym dede constreined informed craueth nowe ayde agayne neuerthelesse muche breakyng fidelitie hath commenced warres freshe desyre doe assiste hym whereby shall emperour pleasure preserue quiet owne commo wealth protestantes send emp meane protestantes sent ambassade emperour italy make purgation charged letter haue taken churche goodes complayne iudges emperiall chamber ambassadours arriued emperoure seuenthe iulye sent letter protestauntes towne sauilie signifieng hath al tymes present absent letter empe letter protestant ambassadours sought quiet germany hath promysed peace theyr relygion also perfourmed nowe muche frenche kynge whome enforced rayse armie maye perauenture false suggestion perswade would take occasion breake treuce religion therfore hath thought good admonyshe letter beleue suche thinge assure selues woulde obserue promyse neyther would moue warre vpon man religion styre vp trouble germany preparation warre mainteyne ryght authoritie wherfor let quiet selues styre euer shal heare shall hym acceptable also profitable whan emperours power come altogether marched empe inuadeth french prouinces myddest italye stronge armie tyll came prouynce fraunce kynge incamped hym selfe auignion betwyxte ryuers rhosne druence destroyinge countrey whereinto perceiued emperour woulde come kepyng hym selfe geuynge battell brought ennemies great perplexitie myserie emperour enforced penurie scarscitie thynges losse manye thousandes whiche died famine pestilence also death anthony leuie dischargeth reste armye retourneth gene armie warred sommer uermandoys peronne beseged beseged towne peronne coduicte henry erle nassowe preuayling leuied siege time emperour retyred prouince reporte eyther newes brought vnto paris daye reioysed citie exceadynglye verye great feare preacher sermon people inuehed sore emperour kynges lieutenauntes began intrenche cytie kepte gate watche warde william furstemberge germane serued frenche kynge warre begynning warre ended lyfe frenche death fraunces dolphin kynges eldest sonne fraunces daulphin eyghtene yeares age reporte went poysoned one sebastian de moute cuculo italian beyng suspicion fyrste racked torne piece sondrye horse lion kynge afterwardes letter prynces germanye amonges made greuous complainte hereof anthony leuie ferdinando gonzage emperours lieutenauntes whome layd blame herman archebyshop collon long tyme intending reformation collon reformation churche holdeth tyme counsell owne prouince callynge maner byshoppes within iurisdiction liege utreicht munster osenbridge myndes herein decree made ceremony doctrine set forth booke compyled iohn gropper wherein al popyshe ceremony moste parte paynted new colour whiche booke dyd contente byshop hereafter shalbe declared tyme also moneth iuly erasmus roterdam death erasmus departed lyfe olde man thre score ten yeares buried basill howe excellently learned howe eloquent man howe muche al learnyng bounde hym workes shall testifie occasion puttyng downe papistrie englande suppressing certen abbeyes vnder thre hundreth markes yearely valewe arose commotion lynkcolneshyre commotion linkcolnshyre market towne call lowthe styred vp doctour mackerell false monke named selfe captayne cobblar appeased duke southfolke kynges lyeutenaunt began yorke shyre grear deale worse rebelles manye stronge came farre dankcaster duke northfolke met kinges power haue ioyned together battell mediation erle shrewisbury man welbeloued common matter taken vp without bloudshed chief captaine robert aske executed treason certen others nobilitie adherentes unto letter captayne aske emperour wrote iuly protestautes answer nynth day septembre pleased hym wryte gentle lyberally shewe hym howe conceaue great pleasure theyr mindes albeit neuer distruste promise yet much diuerse reportes displeasure came eares agayne iudges imperiall chamber others makyng none accompte peace concluded procede diuerse wayes agaynste cause doubte feare matter nowe hath wrytten againe louingly playnly doubtes wyll perfourme refuse sclaunderous reportes aduersaries lykewyse wyll doe geue credite vnto suche shall otherwyse reporte al thinges also doe according dutie came counsell byshop lately appointed mantua muche emperour oftentymes promysed free counsell germany especially peace concluded norinberge shall perceiue wryting desyre hym woulde see matter myght indifferently heard vsed moneth byshop rome publysheth pope wyl reforme court rome wryting sayeth howe meane tyme tyll counsel begynne wyl refourme holy citie rome head christendome maistres doctrine maner disciplyne washe cleane spottes vyce intent owne house first well pourged may easely take ordre rest nature man full imbecillitie neyther great thing alone also dispatche affaire common wealth therfore hath chosen certen cardinalles whome liuing god hath ioyned hym coadiutours companion cure office worker necessary holsome busynes cardinall ostia sauseuerine ginute simonet thre byshops whome commaundeth men obeye vnder great penaltie moneth octobre emperour imbarketh selfe king scottes maried yt frech kinges daughter gene sayle spayne frenche kynge came afterwardes paris new yeares day gyueth mariage madame magdalene eldest daughter iames fift kynge scottes came fraunce autumne maner tyme laurence medices treason nyght murthered alexander medices duke florence owne kyndred familie duke florence slayne cosyn whan allured hym home house putting hym hope enioye noble matrone neyghbour beautie honest fame farre excelled others slayne gouernment came vnto cosmus medices emperours consent married elenor daughter peter toletane uiceroy naples ides ianuary kyng fraunce came court parliament paris whiche thinge seldome accustomed great audiece maketh sore complaint emperour declared cause country flaunders artois whiche emperour holdeth kynges fraunce elder haue done also ought called againe patrimony frauce speaker hereof capell kynges aduocate named swycers sewe king gospeller hym emperour charles austriche meane tyme city zuricke berne basyll strausborough make sute frenche king imprisoned religion intreating hym exile myght restored kyng graunted partly vnto requestes yet accomplished desyre wherfore whan receyued aunswere foure twenty february anna momorantie conestable suspected kynge impulsion dealt lesse frendly ambassadours vsed afterwardes helpe quene nauarre kinges owne syster good ladye whiche bare great zeale true doctrine meane whyle kyng hauing mustred men beginning marche leadyng army towardes arras besegeth towne strong castell hesdine whiche rendred hesdine rendred hym within moneth selfe tyme came kynge ambassadour byshop rome reignalde poole englysh borne bloud cardinall poole pope ambassadour frenche kyng roial lately made cardinal cause ambassade thought worke mischief kinge englande tyme kyng scottes maried frenche kynges daughter byshop sent present fayre sworde riche well wrought exasperate kyng englande byshoppes accustomed christmas daye nyght amo ge thinges certen ceremony consecrate thei terme sworde hallowed sworde whiche honour token beneuolence geue sende vnto man whome lyketh sixtus fourth first authour custome mentioned booke pooles boke king henry eyght ceremony afterwardes cardinall poole wrote booke whiche intitled defence vnitie churche addresseth style speache vnto king henry reprehedeth sore toke vpon head churche title longe byshop rome whiche uicar christe cold reasos pope supremacie successour peter whome christe appointed prince apostle aunswered christe sonne god vpon hym vpon rocke christe buylded churche howe christe prayeth fayth conuerted myght also conuerte brother iohn christes death euer obeye peter tyme made haste bothe christes sepulchre wold go gaue honour cure charge fede shepe committed chiefly hym christ nette also ful fysshe whiche many able hale vp drawen vpon shore peter alone hath long discourse deathes byshop rochester syr thomas moore detestinge crueltie moreouer howe kyng afflicted state realme muche mysery brought moste floryshynge kyngdome daunger stode emperour diuorsement aunt subuersion religion sheweth hym neyther ought loke ayde eyther owne subiectes men whiche hath deserued euyll common wealth tourning tale emperour many wordes stireth vp prouoketh inceseth emper king englande prycketh hym forewarde auenge notable reproche done vnto familie sayeth howe turkyshed seede sowen abroade englande germany signifiyng doctrine contrary byshop rome finally many opprobrious wordes sharpe rebuke prouoketh hym regentaunce telleth hym howe none remedy retourne agayne bosome churche whiche one defended setting forth bookes greatly honour booke printed rome bearyng date long tyme kept close last manye yeares came one two germany sayeth cause wrytinge therof kynge desyred hym wryte opinion albeit certen learned men englande whiche done lyke lost lyues yet could whiche muche bounde vnto hym dissemble opinion neyther ought imputed hym raylynge cursed speakynge doeth naturall disposition also certen ordre life cleane abhorre vice endeuoureth reduce agayne waye deceiued flatterer strayed farre ryght pathe geueth hym great benefite kynge henry brought vp yought good letter done much poole vnthankful whan alteration englande whiche haue spoken myslyked paule thyrde commendation contarene made hym cardinal sent hym rome familiarly acquaynted say knoweth hipocrisie falshod ryght well doctrine gospell suppose cause haue wrote kyng henry auoyde suspicion lutheranisme caused booke printed rome coste charge reporte taking selfe copy gaue reade byshop self cardinalles others dere frendes vnto wold commended feared syde leste red openly men incure rebuke obloquie oftentymes heard hym speake contrary eleuenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument eleuenth booke protestantes hauing declared emperour ambassade three poyntes heldus co ming smalcald maketh answer reply vrge fre counsel promised vpon pope sendeth bishop aste protestant set forth apologie vpon refusal counsel writ therof french king king england writeth cou saile pope spake citie auspurge nynthe booke chaunge religion whiche cause clergie moste parte noble house forsoke citie wherupon senate writing directed emperour wryting auspurg kyng ferdinando state empyre declareth cause doynges howe frendly dealte many thynges suffered howe scornefully behaued selues howe often went stire vp sedition citie whereunto long christopher byshop aunswered selfe reste many contumelious wordes exhorteth emperour prince muche daungers concerneth aswel self would loke time haue heard last booke ambassadours prote ambassad emp protestauntes sent emperour italy gaue commaundement chiefly thre thynges treate first confute brute whiche raysed vp shoulde haue made league kynge fraunce england secondly emperour would restrayne iudgement counsell chaumbre thirdly suche come league since composicion peace norinberge myght inioye peace whiche requestes emperour dede hearde wholy occupied warelyke matter sayde howe woulde sende ambassadour germany make aunswere wherfore departure gene spayne sent matthie helde vicechau celour heldus emperours ambassad germany whan protestauntes vnderstode ambassadours nowe retourned appoynte generall metyng smalcalde seuenth daye february daye counsell approched nere neyther doubte emperours ambassadour would haue talke agreed also bring chiefest diuines wherfore daye assigned besydes prynces ambassadours city came thether luther melanchthon bucer osiander diuerse whan ambassadour come smalcalde fyftene daye february speaketh thus howe emperour commaunded hym doe message sration smalcald duke saxony lantgraue muche haue thought good make consortes also partaker contente followe mindes herein saith dede knoweth al ambassadours league wherfore case amongs answere emperous doth concerne cause shoulde suppose treaty made chiefly auspurge haue oftentymes sollicited emperour italy spayne religio nowe also lately gene ambassadour unto whome emperour sayde howe would sende ambassadour germany whiche shoulde make aunswere abyding commyng haue altered state religion without contempte also making emperour therefore whan came auspurge beinge constrayned necessitie chaunge purpose treated nothynge hath wrytten emperour whole matter standeth wha exhibited testimoniall ambassade procedeth diligently pourged selues frenche englysh league emperoure ioyfull heare whiche doeth credit also comendeth vertue haue wittely eschewed frenche practises full disceirfulnes afterwards freche practises discoursing warre sauoy speakynge many thinges frenche kyng sayde lette vnto emperour could bende whole power turke also consulted turkes prouoked inuade cristendome also daily practise styre vp stryfe ciuile warre germany nowe endeuoureth al may perswade emperour wyll kepe promyse desireth therfore credite crafty counselles emperour suche honour vertue wyll shrinke promyse may well perceiue mo experimets one touchinge iudgement imperiall chambre emperours commaundemet meddle case religion aduertised letter oftentymes controuersies whiche partely concerned religion partlye therfore emperour comaunded matter thei supposed sequestred religio thei iudge indifferently pitie lawe haue course seyng emperour hath commaunded surcease determining matter religion ought contente iudges haue done ought contrary emperours decre shall escape free shalbe punished according lawe made regenspurge emperour againe admonished would nothing rashely neither prescribe imperiall chambre thinge neither lawfull voyde seditio iudges chaber seme done contempt emperours iurisdictio reproche iudges whiche ar partly men noble house partly excellent learning vertu therfore requireth hynder lawe unto thirde requeste whiche suche also comprised peace norinberge shoulde inioye benefite therof sayeth emperour safe conscience graunte haue promysed subscribed decree empyre whiche contrary religion eche man suffered swarue promyse whan liste wer ready waye breake pacification norinberge wherfore whan emperour shall knowe certenly procedynges wyll shall seme ryght reason meane tyme requyreth obserue peace selues see broken others whiche truste wyll doe considerynge counsell nere whereof haue wrytten emperour fourth thyng whiche hath commaundement treate vseth great long perswasio seing emperour kynges nation intende wyll refuse agaynst wherein emperour desyreth vnderstand playnly myndes case refuse take exception make delaye emperour thynketh godly purpose shold stopped middes
