course straungers woulde also conceaue suspicion loued rather vexation common wealth peace quietnes seyng emperour hath respect god glory set forth saluation men consydered exhorteth earnestly requyreth would satisfie herein desyre common wealthes also hath also commission anye controuersie shall happen matter shall solute appease wherunto wyl diligence shalbe ready desyre also declaration talke woulde refuse next daye thus spoken treateth seuerallye duke saxony howe emperour beareth especiall good wyll lette hath declared thesame hitherto hath bene dissention religion seing great hope matter shalbe quieted counsell already called desyreth hym sende ambassadours thether intente discorde taken awaye may declare good wyl towards hym refuse take exception displeasure wyll come knoweth well enough moreouer muche turke maketh great preparation inuade germanye requyreth hym sende hym ayde decreed regenspurge turkes force chaunce turke come field attempte germany woulde sende hym ayde agaynst fre che kyng hath inuaded sauoye prouince emperour last emperour hath borne whole charge theim periall chambre long tyme alone hath consumed great treasure warres requyreth olde custome empyre would contributary portion money hereunto beloging residue prynces haue also promysed duke sayeth duke aunswere muche thynges concerne hym alone co sortes also wyll take deliberation xxiiij daye february confederatours make aunswere together first wyshynge vnto emperour longe health preseruation concernynge auspurge haue heard whole matter ambassadours say howe sequestre theyr fellowshyp touchyng emperours warre frenche kyng lytle sory seyng commodious turkes ennemies empyre emperour hath taken good parte purgation mynded kepe peace made norinberge ryght glad thanke hym touchynge iudgement imperiall chamber sayde howe sore greue emperour stoppe course lawe shew difficultie thinge time archebishop metz palsgraue intercessours much long deliberation appered surer way establish comonwelth graute peace religion al matter annexed till either general counsell europe prouincial counsel germany migh vnlesse might except yt maner matter procede religion might coprised together howe lightly occasion trouble may geuen considered nowe may also perceiued wordes also themperours proclamation set forth time declare sufficiently neuer minde pretende cause saue matter religion neither iudges counsel chaber opinio able proue cotrary sayth themperour gaue authoritie iudge qualitie matter greuouse accopt al action concerne religion whiche dede decided vnlesse controuersie religion first lawful counsel determined thing haue many time signified themperour kyng ferdinando letter ambassadours question religio preiudiciall ought determined counsell suche matter examined depend vpo seing benefites imployed desert dutie suffer yt wtin dominion folowe cotrary religio fro doctrine enioye goodes church muche either wil execute dutie muche matter cocerneth cosciece mynde remaineth place right possessio restitutio seing yt whe copositio made noriberg expresseli named al actios sutes hanged eyther chaber courtes iudgemet exhibiting intercessours matter religio promised fynde meanes yt themperour exempt fro iudgement thing also king ferdinado toke vpo thasseblie cadane wordes proclamatio theperour cutteh ple authoritie iudge state matter cleane taken away fro iudges yt imperial chaber although wold report euil yet many seyng ready geue sentence agaynste wer incouraged rather comece actios thing prouoked mo wayes tha one time men require iugedmet thyng ar admitted also contumeliouse wordes reiected late humborough comauded restore clergie citie goodes possession also olde religio al iurisdictio could wt safe conscience condemned great money therfore themperour may se one fact mynde purpose either th matter religion el none al may vse matter sorte truce made vayne case meane rite ceremony chauged may restored shal nede general counsel wherunto notwithstanding themperour self saith al thinges belong wherfore vpo iust necessary cause haue refused iudgemet whan diuerse exceptios could preuaile nothing touching person iudges past one two religio found whole copany decre made regesburg th behalf vnknowen fiersly impugneth doctrine better accepted eue coutenauces may easly perceiued affectio thei beare v hadlig matter whiche thing thus doubt themperoure wyll comaunde surcease case themperour thinke yt anye prophane matter mixed matter religio refuse due examinatio meane tyme iudgement imperial chaber may cease comen league since pacification norinberge former yeres intercessours require scwinforte receiue mo league nubre refused whan came norinberge perseuered opinion sayd many promysed codicioned alter religion answere thus made promyse al againe made exception priuate compositios might thus dede promised vpo condicio themperour put hope procure cousell called wtin sixe monthes begin within yere wheras yt longer delayed meane god benefit vnderstode rightly true doctrine thei could differre longer thought duty professe yt thing knew true godly yt byshop rome lawe teacheth yt man hath also bounde selfe othe thing yt wicked bound performe like aduersaries refuse nubre fall take partes may also may escape come felowshyp let maye doe wherfore beseche emperour woulde restrayne iudges suffer onlye others also whyche synce come enioye benefyte peace otherwyse thei haue wrog offered forsake league fellowes lyke professours doctrine necessitie declared also ferdinado uie na cause alone iudges cha ber shal take vnto preuente counsell herein doubteth extortion open wrong constrained euen lawe nature defende selues discomoditie come therof wilbe ende themperour wisdome consider thei doubtles wishe peace couet gratifie themperour thinges yet men may haue fre accesse true doctrine may obtayne wylbe prest ready accoplishe emperour king ferdina require touching turke charge chabre cocerning counsaile wherunto themperour greatly perswadeth haue red copie letter paule third hath publyshed touching perceius therby minde opinion themperour although adrian sixt thasse blie norinberge cofessed legate yt maner al thinges rome sore corrupted promising endeuour might reformed yet clement seuenth successour two yeares cleane minde appered legate sent next assemblie muche themperours lieutenautes prince decree made ordeined fre general councell might holden germany cousel errour vice euer crept church might take away decre afterward cofirmed theperour yt suite tharchbishop mezt palsgraue prince electour howbeit clement yeare propouded counsel farre otherwyse tha specified decree thempire assigned place italy tha refused thing afterward paule third answered also following lyke trade nowe also doeth byshop rome attempt although couertly clement seueth openly expresse wordes herein doth certen implicatio condene doctrine speaketh late sprog vp heresy meaneth doctrine intendeth plucke vp rootes manifest thexecution punishmet putteth innocet persones professing doctrine yet shamelesse dissembling pretedeth though wold reforme horrible e rours vice church many yeres many good learned men haue coplained yt themperour crafty policy perswaded prouoketh ye counsel would knew fraude disceiptfulnes craftes vseth also time legate solliciteth kynges prince yea also admitte counsell intet may haue fauourers mainteiners wicked purpose confirmation counsel myght selues condemne owne doctrine whiche craft iulian apostata disceaued time past christen souldiours although byshop rome susteineth persone aduersary yet taketh vpo authoritie iudge al right equitie hath others consenting herein whiche bounde othe manye wayes vnlawful ought grau ted themperour doubtles king opinio iudge yt byshop rome hath brought errours ye churche doctrine cleane cotrary god worde also auncient touselles doctours mainteineth hath also made exceading many lawes god comaundemet wherby true knowledge vtterly oppressed defaced vereli haue diuines god gift declared therfore intede accuse byshop fellowes lawfull counsell great matter coudepne also euil craftes dishonest meanes yea force guyle achiefe dignity filthie life leade euil example thei geue part dutie thei neglect comitted charge wallowe wickednes lyfe wel knowen tried yt nedeth declaratio cause also lawfull bishop euen testimony owne lawe appoint cousel muche lesse iudge neither may sworne clientes vsurpe persone iudge seing may dede part lawful cousel moreouer place cousel appointed italy cleane cotrary decree themperour state thempire scornefully dispiseth thei know ouer yet whether prince christendom wil allowe yt place weighty cause shold daugerous come thither albeit haue saufe conduicte yet muche byshop hath clientes euerye hate doctrine bitterly ther great dauger lieng wayte priuie cospiracies party much feared furthermore since matter weighti vnder sonne arrise greater doubtles cocerneth either euer lasting saluatio danatio seing greatnes matter requireth yt great nubre wt minister churche preacher present comit weighty matter deputes proetours alone great griefe vnto passe limites thempire go italy leauing cou trey people suche grudge mindes germany wtout garde church long time without preacher wherfore moste humbly beseche emperour would way hym selfe poinctes diligently seing high supreme magistrate vnto chiefly belongeth setting forth trew doctrine wold applie self wholy true knowledge god might aduaunced doe embrace wicked kynde doctrine seke thyng glory god holy name aunswere concerning counsell agreed vnto also ambassadours george marque brandenburge city norinberge halle hailbrune thinges medled league time protestantes thus spoken heldus ambassadour aunswereth speaking answer heldus many thinges againe great good emperour frenche kyng whiche conspired turkes distruction comon wealth cometh matter touching iudgement imperial chambre sayeth deede peace graunted matter religion man say cotrary strife consiste matter religion take suche case religion others acco pte ciuile prophane farre reason thyng debated cause obiectios either part heard procedeth meaning yt matter touching lately receiued league yt emperour thiketh thus yt coprised within peace norinberg bounde al decree thempire ought yelde ye authoritie cou sel asmuch themperours minde wholy addicte peace cocorde requireth estsones yt wyl ayde wt men mony turkish warre nedeful charge imperial chabre turke inuade yt tha wold monthes assiste themperour like ayde french king whiche wil doe shall repet yt seruice wherin desireth know direct answer may aduertise themperour therof concerning cou sel selues knowe labour trauayle themperour bring passe trust yt shalbe appeased cotrouersie yt religion wt quietnes state como wealth reformed glory god preseruatio men wherfore perour trusteth assuredly make none exception swarue rest men persiste herein would grieffull heare againe vsed sondrye perswasions amonges emperour would saufeconduicte saue harmelesse requyred haue determinate aunswere herein besydes name come vnto synce peace norinberge wherein wrytten marque george city norinberge weysenburg hailbrine winsem hale religion league wherefore emperours name desyred knowe league condition selfe daye came thether romyshe legate byshop aques letter pope ambassad byshop rome duke saxon exhorting come counsell whome byshop rome sent germany place peter paule uerger hopinge well newe ambassadour thing haue brought passe also loste labour little regarded muche certen day whan desired speake latgraue tolde leasure maner instant went see howe luther tyme laye sore sycke stone thyng ambassadour pope ambassad vispysed myght see lodging uergerius geuen ambassadour instruction whole state germany euery man byshops behalfe must enterteined vsed fourth daye whiche last february protestauntes aunswer heldus emperour self neuer doubted woulde obserue peace made whiche hath also promised publique priuate letter imperiall chamber contrary expresse wordes composition sealed confirmed emperour hath taken vpon heare determine call diuerse alteration religion rite ceremony churche goodes whiche thyng playnly exempted pacification concluded iudges imperiall chamber also contrary religion bounden othe geue sentence well prescript byshop rome lawe emperours doe lyttle regarde compositio peace procede directly wherfore haue iust cause refuse theyr iudgement desire reformation diuerse consideration whiche also mentioned first iudges imperiall chamber moste parte cotrary religion bounde othe iudge decree byshop rome wel lawes empire thei beare fauour aduersaries manifestly frowne vpon v fellowes medle mere matter religion contrary emperours proclamation finally haue condepued cofederatours hamborough matter religio great somme gold would procede others case refused touching name come league synce peace making long synce wrytten sent emperour italy ambassadours seing tyme counsell longe differred ioyned selues league iudgyng mete preferre conscience ciuile bonde last hedesyreth knowe fourme maner league thei maruell requyre considering emperour knoweth well inough made meanes intercessours norinberg haue left made hym suche aunswere moued herein howe aduersaries haue geuen occasion hereof mischiefe haue deuysed right well knowen league ordeined iniurie man defende selues framed suche condicions nede require may declared emperour man el without shame concerning suche thynges spake counsell emperours mynde towardes common wealth lyke well howe beleue also emperour knoweth byshoppes minde herein therfore procureth counsell ernestly opinion emperour hath bishop thei wil leaue vndiscussed neuerthelesse much wrytte cotrary emperours minde altogether suspicious dissemble thinke thereof counsell begyune hath condempned doctrine word dede also also wel knowen assembly religion treated albeit thei see scripture maketh yet wyl presume take vpon authoritie determination although mynded lawefull counsel accuse byshop complices false doctrine heresy pope errours impietie yet doubte accustomed maner partie iudge also entent wrytte selfe wittenesseth whiche one allowe vain late afterward talke condition fourme disputation counsell whether suche counsell emperour state empyre haue diuerse assembly agreed vpon leaue opinion indifferent iudge euermore wordes free christian counsell wyselye pourposely added deede taken lawfull euery man speake minde also neyther bishop adherentes depely bound fidelitie promyse one pronounce sentence owne cause ought interpreted though place counsell turkes suche others accordinge vnto holy scripture partes doctrine might examined determined know moreouer one countrey euery also pope vnreasonable authoritie whole worlde godly learned men dispersed whiche thinge refresheth spirites thinke vpon considerynge hopyng case vnreasonable power byshop rome might diminished thinges shoulde depende vpon one man comaundement would come passe diuines also diuers good men sondry countreis whiche oppressed tyrannie hyde coruers sayde nothyng would applie whole study endeuour refourmation churche concerning place counsell knowe better chosen germany albeit counsell doth also appertayne nation yet chiefly concerneth germaines whiche must come thether selues minister church kynges prynces may thing deputes olde woted maner long tyme accustomed furthermore situation co moditie matua wyl dispute warre italy case none yet haue lately declared place ought suspected duke tua selfe affected wyll reason owne brother one chiefest cardinalles whiche maketh muche encrease suspition therefore nation shall heare one reason wherfore doe refuse place fourme pleadyng doubte wyll allowe dede conceaue wronge opinion emperour place cousel knoweth also germany many city commodious pourpose mantua whiche ought chiefly respected muche commended equitie iustice secret priuie conspiracy dispatche men waye well knowen practised germany place thei cleaue sticke wyse decree empyre wyll permitte selues remoued ought seme maruell newes emperour also tymes past liberius bishop rome frende fawtour athanasius required emperour constantine call counsell alexandria defendant plaintiues dwelled albeit place nothing commodious west churche although emperour alledged athanasius fellowes consent whole worlde condempned exco municated albeit contended liberius one man emoges athanasius arrius liberius others sought disturbe publique quiet yet neuerthelesse relent nothyng whan emperour denied long time errour arrius reigned fine doctrine athanasius vpper hande preuayled euer able recite bloud spilte quarell doctrine condition religion like vnto whether aconuenient place geuen otherwyse lyke cause also suche counsell basill refused ferrare eugenius byshop summoned counsell emperour henry seuenth great sute cotrouersie robert kyng sicilie cited hym appere pisa thought vnreasonable byshop clement firste whiche bothe defended kyng also shewed reason wherfore boside come thether nothynge weighty therfore wher refuse suche maner counsel faulte ought imputed vnto byshop ofte haue referred matter counsell ment suche counsell emperour state empyre decreed ignorant case byshoppes might permitted haue whole orderyng matter would worke owne auauntage oppressing true doctrine woulde establyshe theyr owne wyckednes yet doth paul thyrde collour matter wordes emperour though woulde vse thynge vpryghtly sincerely intendeth contrary moreouer counsell requyred thei haue declared writing craft paule peter paule uerger ambassadour clement also paule thyrde sayth emperours mynde errours vice might reformed none apparence therof byshops wryting case intended true nedefull reformation would haue codempned theyr doctrine heard albeit distruste emperours equitie muche sory gratifie hym herein yet nothing furthered good wyl diligence albeit emperour selfe present counsell yet well enough knowen authoritie bishoppes wyll permitte eyther hym kynges also haue suche maner case moste wyll graunte shalbe perauenture vse counsell matter determine wyll pope haue emperours subsectio permitte reserue authoritie themselues entent case emperour ciuile magistrate went thynge farre myght hereby bridel hamper fine determine al thinges pleasure desire therfore emperour would offeded seke eschew snare bishop wold intrappe geue naturally euen vnto brute beastes shunne place knowe layde wayte taken furthermore commonly knowen howe matter handled counsell constance emperour sigisinude albeit counsel costasice graunted saufeconduicte iohn husse yet byshops deminishe authoritie saying howe lawfull neyther iohn hus man el prescribe measure behalf wherwith emperour vaquished gaue place authoritie whiche chalenged selues sighinge opinion yet miserable destruction hym trustinge vppon saufe conduicte fell calamitie wherby appereth euidently muche emperour able helpe herein though wold neuer fayne haue one intrapped enclosed pinnefolde therfore must worke circuspectly yet lest thyng imputed ready abyde lawfull iudgement also moste earnestly beseche emperour waye pounder weightie matter diligently call lawfull counsell germany wherin neither byshop consortes shall occupie place iudgemet byshop wyl let impeche emperour shal permitte sincere counsel holden germany proteste ope ly faulte matter brought co corde incommoditie also shall arise therof wholy ascribed byshop conclusion requeste hym make reporte vnto emperour declare good wylles dutie wardes hym whan matter thus decided amonges heldus promysed make relation emperour thynges protestauntes decree also howe mainteyne protestaun e decre mainteining minister minister church lyuing erecting free scholes church common wealth might neuer want learned men last suche thynges concerne league defence concerning turke aunswered ambassadour might haue quietues matter would glad wyllynge ayde emperour hym nowe brute went howe kyng ferdinado prepared warre john uayuode therfore requyred ayde whiche perplexitie lest haply theyr dutie common wealthe decreed absence heldus duke saxon lantgraue sendynge abroade espialles common charge get intelligence thynges brewyng turke entended inuade germany assemble agayne consulte eche man dutie herein moreouer entent men myght vnderstand iust reason protest refuse counsel cause refuse counsell condescended compryse whole matter wryting whiche wardes set forth print speaking foreine kynges nation paule thyrde saye thei hath sent forth bulles late sommo counsel mantua begynne nowe xxiij daye may alledgyng certen cause therof moreouer hath sente ambassadours kynges prynces well germanes others aduertyse counsell exhorte eyther come thither selues send protectours moued v also ambassadour vnto emperour lyke maner thynge selfe requireth therfore declare peryll losse v also whole common wealth christendome men obeye hym herein notwithstandyng cause determination iust reasonable yet doubte aduersaries suche nature wyll blame doyng constrewe worste parte entent may bryng v cause hatred wyll affyrme doubtlesse abyde examination iudgement despyse al nation amonges whome haue often bene many excellent learned men wyll saye moreouer wickednes refuse decree counsell hyghe iudicial seate churche whiche men bound obey wyl forge also though ashamed doctrine afraid come light el sought contentio nede endure n vniuersall quiet nowe myght verefied v dede wicked also detestable heard wherfore must necessitie shewe reason doynge truste good men whether germany place wyll credit suche thynge v wyll also doe endeuour moste weyghty cause others may handled vprightly byshop rome permitted vnder forged coloured name counsell oppresse manifest truthe kynde tyranny shal declare professe pure doctrine also respecte nothyng el god glory preseruation common wealth obstinacie frowardnes obiected vnto v fyrst proue contemne iudgement nation churche hereby appereth manyfestly al care lest byshop clientes take vpon authoritie iudgement thynges myght decided mete suspected persones whiche thyng trust godly men would lykewyse wyshe dyuerse countreis remayne certen olde wrytinges complayntes false doctrine vice idolatrie crept churche doubte place daye godly learned men also whiche vnderstande sounde doctrine although oppressed byshoppes tyrannye constrayned holde peace dede iuste deserte ought counsell ought present cousel myght speake myndes frely accompted free counsell gouerned byshop fellowes whiche defende false doctrine power violence olde custome make decree contrary god worde christe tyme instituted highe iudiciall seate commaunded matter referred churche requyred reformation whiche selfe wordes excludeth tyranny lordshyp also sclaunder saye perhaps feard come abroade abyde ope light assemblie imperial auspurg professed doctrine openly emperoure state empyre againe preacher gospel haue brought godly workes lyght selfe doctrine preached openly dominion learned men haue set forth bookes diuerse aduersaries confesse men wrytinges sondrye article called agayne lyght whiche laye hidde darkenes nowe true doctrine shyneth agayne penaunce faythe christe remissio synnes good workes true worshipping vse sacrametes authoritie keyes magistrate tradition men suche lyke thinges neither ashamed gospell paule sayth haue especiall desyre myght declare mynde thinges al men also obiected preacher shoulde haue false yt styre vp heresy reysed vp agayne heresy time condempned neither nede therfore disputation hearing false may easlye excused haue red confession defence annexed doctrine confesse newe verey consent primatiue churche moste clerely doth appere neyther haue admitted heresy wycked opinion men haue restored doctrine aunciet father oppressed bishop monkes vntrue also reported v shoulde delight dissention sory botome harte christe commo wealth thus deuided haue concorde desyre lawfull counsell muche byshop fellowes codempne true necessary doctrine tormente persecute professers thereof exhorting others mislike cruel tiranny god wil honored confession name wickednes man ioyne hym selfe byshops tyranny whiche rageth moreouer manifest beare susteine maner charge common wealth residue state whereby seene woulde also gladly accorde others relygion byshoppes styre vp price case lawful besydes vnderstande dau ger hangeth ouer v byshoppes haue nowe many yeares declared manifestly go incense kynges myndes v extreme madnes abide great daugers great charge iust cause knowe assuredly owe dewtie vnto god nothing much respected commaundement take god wytnes seke nothing el nowe haue confuted theyr sklaunders come seconde part emonges straungers many parauenture suppose yt certen curiositie haue impugned light faultes kepinge quiet mighte better haue bene dissembled especiallye consydering state worldly thinges suche common wealth euer remaining thinges whiche must wincked matter standeth farre otherwise fyrst dede errours false opinion may dissembled christ commaundeth v beware false teacher againe false doctrine borne controuersie light errours touching doctrine faith true knowledge god principall pointe christian life sincere worshipping god ought passed ouer silence obserued purely diligentlye taught churche denied doctrine wholy extinguished newe brought greate contuinelie christ moreouer reprehende diuerse sundrye errours wickednes others also haue espied longe day therfore desyred counsell wrong beyng redressed concorde might reteined time counsell muche nedefull muche errours vice remaine sundry place strife contention arrisen many therefore daunger lyues innocent person therfore weightie consideration onely themperour also innocentes perill residew state bishoppes haue determined acounsell chiefly necessary church wherin pure doctrine might mainteined vnlesse suche sort sawe right well howe would styre vp greater confusion behold whilest loke counsell bishop buls come forth quite contrary decree thempyre doth cocerne v also whole commen wealth christendom haue thought nedefull publike writyng testifie declare wherefore discommende counsell power authoritie iudgement belongeth onely vnto bishoppes vnto churche numbre verely kinges state wherfore al tha thoritie iudgement churche beit bishoppe rome nothing accused yet graunted alone iudges excludyng minister churche seyng manifestly partie one suters much lesse ought permitted god lawe also lawe nature accuse bishop rome smale crime neyther dispute onely vsurped authoritie abhominable liuinge reprehende doctrine lawes wicked religion accuse giltie idolatrie heresie whiche crime pope accused idolatry heresye beyng obiected bishoppe ought churche geue iudgement olde lawes bishoppes selues testifie furthermore bishoppe one party hath condemned oure doctrine longe hathe heaped vpon selfe greater suspition seyng thus doubte iudgement shalbe counsell concernynge doctrine thought contrary olde custome permit man haue determination matter wheras writynge speaketh nothyng maner treatie counsell haue iust cause suspecte thynges calleth onely thither bounden vnto like lippes like lettuse diuerse wayes whose good willes assured protesteth also cause calling counsel heresy sprong vp late might weded albeit may taken largely yet doubt meaneth doctrine credible yt speaketh errours yea sent forth writynge touchinge reformation courte rome wherein expresse wordes confesseth counsell called intent pestiferous heresie luther might abolished dede fyrst couered mynde crastely writte myght haue shewe disclosed afterwarde wherfore doubte fullye bente roote oute craft pope doctrine madnes v allow intention goeth suche receiue writyng shoulde confesse oure doctrine wicked hereticall moreouer kynges prince whiche admitte shoulde bounden aide asiste therfore seing thing concerneth vniuersal common wealth beseche men consider diligentlye thys crafte policie marueiled whie conceaued writynge suche wordes doubt whether intent feare v counsel approuing writte haue v intrapped amonges v assuredly doubt themperours mynde common wealth neyther thinke allowe forme writte byshoppe hathe onely appoynted counsell hathe also pronounced sentence v permitte matter may tried scripture aledge lawes custome certen counselles latter time proue matter chiefly hold affirme ye men tradition contrary god worde oughte reiected admit doctrine church byshops error tyrannie ought coloured wt title church tholde church neyther receiued law cotrarie scripture attributed ye vnmeasurable power bishop rome taketh vpon selfe againe sorte men condemne persecute doctrine gospell church paricides generatio ofspring cam old time dede godly bishop dyd oftentimes refuse cousels seing thosspring c called defende veritie either main tenauce wicked opinon el establishe authoritie themperor costantine assigned counsel antioche maximus bishop hierusalem albeit farre came thither knewe themperors minde arrians intended although athanasius came cousell tyrus yet taried long yt saw chiefest cousel plaie part accuser iudges yt saw certen accuser procured holde great counsel sirmiu town hungry photynus matter weightie albe themperour comaunded bishop come thither yet wold west partes obey sawe numbre arrians encreased suspected yt false opinion shoulde decreed time osius bishop corduba famous man themperor request arrians commaunded also come thither spaine come approued yt perilous counsell sirmie brought afterwardes great consusio church cause osius sore reproued hilarie whiche came cyrillus bishop hierusale neuer came assembly denied christ substannce wt father accompted fyrst euer appealed counsell writyng counsell kepte millan bishoppes called thither emperour time paulinus bishoppe treuers fewe others sawe howe anxentius byshoppe millan mate went euill purpose departed counsell mill broken brake vp counsell sort worthy men flie suspected counselles lest made partaker crime asmuche bishop signifieth plainly counsell instituted confirme authoritie besech al men wold impute refusal v fault blame worthy finally place counsell like diuerse cause fitte offer iniurie altogether let libertie speche besydes muche hatred conceaued againste v foreine nation sclaunders aduersaries though religion honest liuing exiled among v perswasion mennes mindes thus prepared without great perill wherfore expedient cause onely counsell holden germany entent straungers might see order maner oure church city throughe false sclauders hate trew doctrine weightines cause also requireth yt many v come cousell oure selues forsake limites maner way v expedient seyng yt weightie cause decreed yt counsel holden germany se wherfore depart fro considering therfore yt case cocerneth preseruation al christendome beseche al kinges prince geue credit vnto oure aduersaries herunto rather applie selues yt trew knowledge god might restored cado nothing yt shal redound theyr honor bishop laboreth ende yt mighte perswade practise crueltie thei ought moste chiefly abhorre eue cause placed degre dignitie yt shold honor god holy name light vnto rest good ensample defende innocet person fro wrog violece shal euer time lawfull counsell tha shal defende matter yt men shall vnderstande endeuours haue bene euer annexed preseruation common wealth assemblie duke saxon ernestus frauces bretherne duke luneburge ulriche duke wirtemberge lantzgraue philip prince pomerane three erles anhalde albert counte mansfelde besides many ambassador city large ample comission admonished thinges treated departed thence vj day march addresse letter french king wherin first excused matter potest letter frech king satisfied ambassadoure former assemblie shewe cause also whie sende ambassadours nowe vnto tha desyre continew frendshippe seynge haue set open way come concorde religion yet haue nothing preuailed would recompence theirendeuor fauor beneuolence fynally declare mynde touchyng counsell desyre knowe hathe also determined herein kinge afterwardes maketh aunswere tenth kalendes iune accepteth theyr satisfaction promiseth largely concernynge hys continuall amitie towardes confutyng sclaunders aduersaries wrytynge whiche sent saieth opinion counsell euer hath bene vnlesse lawefull sure place wyll neuer allowe neyther doubteth kynge scotlande inlawe also folowe mynde herin lytle beginning maye retorned home wyfe aboute midsomer ended life queene scottes dieth meane time bishoppe rome deferreth counsell till kalendes nouember cause thereof saieth friderick duke mantua mindeth fortifie citie garnisons souldiours employe cost therupon thinge hath happened contrary expectation saith sore affraid lest many folowyng decree already commen mantua happely beyng excluded dryuen retourne home againe chaunce dede sory yet taketh matter lesse greifefully forasmuche thinge hath fortuned throughe another man faulte longe king englande owne name king england suseth counsell noble realme publisheth writing counsell called bishoppe rome hath none authoritie called suche time whan mortall warre betwene themperour frenche kynge place appointed mantua whither neyther saufe commodious men come dede desyreth christian counsell wyth harte vnto byshoppes counsell wyll nether come selfe yet sende hys ambassadours alwayes theyr facion theyr l cre sake wyll suche maner assembly oppresse christ veritie parte haue nothynge bishoppe rome regardeth decree wrytynge anye byshoppe addynge counselles wont called authoritie emperour kynges maner ought restored especially tyme whan byshoppe hath many graue personage accuse yet neuerthelesse neither reprehended without daunger man life accused presently lawfull counsel nether prouision made saufconduicte thoughe yet manifest daungers shoulde let hym coulde come newes bishoppes falsefie theyr faith sprincle desile selues innocent bloude albeit lawfull others repaire thither yet saftie whome bishop hath laide waite hateth deadly seketh bring hatred kinges none cause assuredly tyrranny exiled realme yerely reuenewes taken away thinge dede taketh euill part much worse feareth lest kinges warned throughe example hereafter like nowe also counsell proroged vntyll kalendes noue bre yet place appointed holde faulte imputed duke mantua delude whole worlde duke mantua surely blameles wyll receiue great multitude citie vnfurnyshed garrison blame ascribed alone doeth nothing syncerely worketh al thinges craft collusion case shall assigne place purpose wyll eyther appointe citie owne prince yt bound hath self ryght ample large dominion many goodly city predecessours haue gotten force subtiltie small fidelitie kepeth seing hope haue true cousel men witte iudgemet suppose thinketh best euery magistrate dominion seke reformation religion perchaunce bishop obiecte vnto custome taketh place euen testimonie cypriane custome grounded vpon counsell hath sayde man haue way better proper saying cipriane wil refuse emperour remained al yere spaine armie flaunders conduict counte de bure wan assaulte towne castel sanpulle artois moneth ianuary put al sworde thence went beseged citie terowen yet vayne length truce taken ten monethes party piedmote hote warre neuerthelesse town cherie taken terowe beseged invain assaulte imperialles made wonderfull slaughter souldiours citezens whan garrison turrin suffered great penury euery syde beseged stopped virtualles frenche kyng haruest tyme leuied power sente thether eldest sonne henry daulphin mommoracie making waye entring perforce releued present famine moneth october armie kyng ferdinando wherin horseman saxony meissen franckonie austriche carinthians bohemers hongarians whome germaines cal hussares beseged towne exechium vpon ryuer draue whiche kept strong garryson turkes ferdinando armie destroyed tracted tyme constrayned wante victualles leuie siege retire fel lappes ennemies layd ambusches woodes kept straytes could way escape distresse firste certen centurion captaynes souldiours hongarians fled also went cacianer kinges lieutenaunt reste detested shame running away exhorting selues vnto manhode especially horseman almaigne aboade charge violent force ennemies fine vaquished greater numbre moste parte slayne manye captaynes taken prisoner led constantinople moste miserable captiuitie fourth ides octobre kyng englande birth kig edward sixt sonne borne hamptoncourt prince edwarde quene iane semer whome maried death quene anne meane whyle byshop rome muche truce taken twyxt fraunce flaunders went procure like also al place entent occasio might worke purpose ceased tyll brought passe bishop deuise reported setting peace myght stire pope hateth kyng vp kyng england hated vnto death lutherians tyme also christina emperours nece syster quene denmarke duchesse millan leauing italy retourneth flaunders germanye treaty mariage betwene william duke cleaue toke effect also men gelderland began rebellion gelderland rebelle prince charles egmonde whiche al lyfe tyme frenche parte therfore sore hated burgundians sayd went make country fre che chased owne people euery outragious tumulte scarsly towne two lefte hym flye alwayes great mainteiner bishop rome doctrine pope paule euil reported abstained sore punishment paule third first beginning byshoprike made two yonge nephewes cardinalles wrytten whiche thing euyll reported vouched saufe call worthy men also nobilitie learning degre honour partly asswage enuie displeasure partely haue mete champion whiche able defende hym learnyng eloquence amonges whome caspar contarene reginalde poole iohn bellie frederick fregose vnto within shorte space added moreouer sadolete alexander bembus purposed also erasinus pope entended make erasmus cardinall certen epistle frend erasinus himselfe reporteth remayne also certen epistle written sadolet erasinus wherin hath spoken muche great good wyl byshop towardes hym sayth within shorte tyme wyl auaunce hyghe dignitie contarenus noble man senatour uenise learnyng ryght famous beyonde expectation whan craued nothynge sodaynly promoted dignitie twelfth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyste argument twelfth booke pope paule deputes ordeyned reformation touching abuse churche permutation voisomes benefice incompatibles cardinalles courtier chaplelaynes courtisanes pardoner colloquy erasmus prohibited protestauntes mete brunswycke whether came king denmarke persecution aryseth pan pope emperour frenche kyng mete nice kynge kissed foote colledge frenche churche erected strasborough kyng englande burneth bone thomas becket prince efectour brandenburgh aduertiseth duke saxon preparation great turke secte antmomians aryseth conspiratie heldus duke brunswycke discouered takyng secretary assembly holden franckeforte decree made appointment mode conference peace protestauntes whiche let duke henry brunswicke leui th armie george duke saxon ennemy veritie dieth henry brother succedeth hym kyng englande hauyng set forth booke counsell uicence callseth certen article made concerning religion gaunt rebell emperour hauing saufeconduicte passeth fraunce uenetians make peace turke certen senatours disclosed secretes haue shewed counsel wer deferred til kalendes noueb also made frustrate notwithstandyng bishoppe intent myght feed men hope seme thinge longe chosen certen owne sect amoges whole numbre streightly commau ded shoulde espie oute diligently faultes clergie flatterie set apart declare vnto released also othe yt myghte speake mindes franckly commaunded kepe thinge close secret chosen caspar contarene peter theatrire iames sadolete renalde poole cardinal fridericke archebishop salerne hierome aleander archbishop brunduse iohn mathew bishoppe uerone gregorie uenet abbot thomas maister sacred palace conclusion consultation comprehended hole matter writing addressinge theyr stile vnto extolle great praise zeale hath trueth wherunto eares certen bishoppes time past haue bene stopped chiefly faulte flatterer whiche haue ascribed vnto ouer muche authoritie tyme haue affirmed clearely lordes althinges haue power liste welspring horse troy haue spronge churche many euils wherwith greuously afflicted therfore wisedome vertu great considereth remedie must fetched thence whence beginning cause disease proceded followyng doctrine paule wilbe minister steward lorde asmuche hath committed charge vnto willyng obey herin haue accordyng theyr meane wittes drawen certen article whiche concerne bishoppes churche susteineth pope hath double office double person onely bishop vniuersall christian churche also prince many region city onely touche suche thinges concerne ecclesiasticall administratio ciuile commen weale gouerneth muche commedatio wisedom fyrst al say holy father like case aristotle commaundeth lawes rashly altered semeth vnto v also thecclesiasticall lawes case diligently maynteyned infringed without vrgent cause greater plage inuade commenwealth time thauthoritie lawes weakened disolued whiche oure predecessours would haue kept sacred holy next pointe bishop rome christes uicar whan authoritie hathe christe geueth graunteth anye thinge take money rewarde seynge thinges giuen freely christ also freely distributed others fou dation laide must foresene may haue manye mete minister churche gouerne men saluation numbre bishoppes occupie chiefe place herein great abuse kinde men receiued ordre confusely without respect neither commended learninge honest lyuing diuerse also yong wherof arrise sundry offence wherof meth co tempt clergie holy thinges come contempt growe oute reuerence semeth good vnto v therfore first citie rome appoint certen make choise suche desyre take order commaunde bishop like euery within owne diocese suffer none admitted without consent said commissioner bishoppe let youth also purpose made pristes haue scholemaster appointed bring vp learnyng vertuouse maners moreouer geuing benefice spirituall promotion farre misse suche especially concerne cure charge soules haue respect lie beneficed man may well prouided laying apart care flocke therfore whan suche office geuen chiefely bishopricke must diligently forsene good men ought made bishoppes learned gouerne church themselues bounden law therfore may italian enioy benefice spayne englande spaniarde englishman italy furthermore much fraude vsed tyme man leaueth benefice resygneth another reseruing self yerly pension many time also whole profytes pension maye reteined vnlesse pore godly vse fruit annexed benefice ought sequestred bodye soule hathe bounden vse commodity therof honestly much suffiseth residew employ vpon suche v beforesayd notwithstandyng shalbe lawfull bishoppe case require impose bondage shall pay certen thing yerely pore man especially beyng clergie wherby may liue honestly better ease againe offende exceadingly permutatios thinges done lucre albeit lawefull gyue unlawefull geue benefice legacye benefice legacie yet subtill way founde wyttie men defeate law benefyces giuen another yet haue theyr reentrie agayne fame whole profytes ministration thus commeth passe beareth name bishoppe hath right authoritie whiche indede possession bishop hath name thing el make selfe heyre bishoppe clementrenewed olde lawe wherby forbydden sonne shoulde pristes son may inioy father benefice enioy father benefice yet permitted truly euill example denied greatest part sclaunders arryse churche good conuerted priuate v hitherto many haue loked redresse thynge nowe vtter dispayre speake thinke full euill v therefore euill vse geue vousons benefice reuertion man death wished looked others better deserue haue secluded matter ministered muche strife contention shall saye benefice whiche coulde employed vpon one man alone called commonly incompatibles herin tholde discipline neglected one also permitted haue diuerse bishoprikes semeth vnto v worthy reformation herunto belongeth plurality totquotes vnitynge benefice whan many benefice ioyned together partes membres one body delude lawes finally nowe disease crept also bishoprickes giuen vnto cardinalles many vnto one whiche thynge semeth vnto v dede matter importaunce chiefly refourmed office cardinal bishoppes distinct diuerse agree one person cardinalles ordeined thys cause onely remayne holy father neuer departe syde gouerne vniuersall churche together vnto bishoppes belongeth fede theyr flocke committed cardinal fyrst made god dede done vnlesse present see shepardes shepe moreouer thynge selfe doeth harme example face audacitie shall redresse faultes others apparent best sene fellowshyppe arice concupiscece let counsel may thinke placed dignitie may therfore take libertie let vnderstande oughte rather vse temperauncie ought shine others life maners neyther must folow phariseis whiche made lawes themselues kept christ florished word worke libertie also great let good counsel whan minde possessed lust auarice besydes diuerse cardinal frequent courtes kynges obteyne bishoprikes cause addicte vnto dare vtter nothynge frankely woulde god waye inhibited cardinal otherwise prouided might honestly fynde selues theyr family equalitie obserued herin yerely reuenewes egall thinge semeth vnto v harde broughte passe could forsaking couetousnes folowe fotesteppes christ whan faultes redressed mete minister churche appointed chiefly loked bishoppes inhabite amonges theyr owne people husbandes church heuie sorowefull sighte shewed euerye se congregation forsaken flockes destitute pastor deteyned handes hirelinges therfore oughte extremely punisshed whiche leade flockes deserte excommunicated outlawed onely also lose theyr liuinges euer vnlesse craue pardon within short tyme auncient lawes decreed bishoppe might aboue three wekes absent congregation se also many cardinal absent rome nothynge properlye belongeth office graunt expedient certeine resident theyr owne prouinces certein brau ches rote tree stretched farre wide christiane worlde men kept theyr dewtie dewe obeidience common wealth yet requisite parte called againe rome shoulde bothe execute theyr office also theyr presence shoulde bothe honourable profitable courte rome moreouer punyshynge crime vice wanteth greate seueritie discipline suche haue offended deserued punishment fynde meane wherby conuey themselues iurisdiction bishoppe iudge ordinary case cannot go master pentionaries fyne pece money chiefly clergie thing doeth offende many wherfore beseche bloud christ wherewith redemed washed sanctified churche licentious libertie may vtterly abolished seyng common wealth maye longe endure wherein synne vnpunished howe muche ought looked churche emonges monckes also many filthy actes monkes many abhominable actes committed wherefore thinke good colledges couentes dissolued sodely violence henceforth admitted order shall litle litle decay afterwardes may honester men placed theyr house neuerthelesse thinke mete yong nouices haue yet professed religion vow solempnely made presently remoued thence muste also diligent hede taken mete person set confession herin ought bishoppe haue vigilante eye chiefly nothinge done money free gyfte spake concerneth onelye others like maner moreouer house nunnes sacred uirgins namely gouerned monkes many open crime committed filthy detestable example therfore must ouersight suche take monkes comitted vnto others perill suspicion wheras many place chiefly italie certen wicked opinion disputed onely vniuersities also church deserueth muche dispraise therfore bishoppes muste charged suche place wheras vniuersities scholes admonish teacher propounde suche thynge herafter instructe bringe vp youth vertue feare god haue open disputation matter diuinitie within theyr priuate house likewise muste prince magistrate admonished giue commaundement printer set forthe sortes bokes suche onely permitted commonly read al scooles boke colloquy compiled erasmus roterda wherin many thynges whiche may beate younge tender myndes vngodlynes infecte frayle bryckel age therfore suche lyke bookes must bannyshed scooles permitted monkes haue professed religion cowle maketh monke vowe put theyr owne wede putte apparell thinke well done garment badge monasticall vowe therfore one forsake theyr cootes let depriued theyr lyuinges ecclesiasticall function also suche cary relyques saincte anthony lyke iudgementes worthy vtterly abolyshed innumerable superstition brynge ignoraunt people erroure playnly abuse oftentymes also e permytted marrye whiche haue taken holy order ought graunted man vrgent cause whan whole stocke defence realme brought one man lutherians permitte men marry without respecte therfore must stifly resyste nother may suffered mary together seconde degree bloud affinitie vnlesse vpon moste weyghtie consideration suche maye haue lybertie graunted done without money excepte perauenture haue fyrst carnall copulation lawfull punyshe purse money employed immediatly good v vyce simonie whiche hath name simony reigneth churche simon magus reigneth churche nowe adayes men nothynge ashamed offende herein moste boldely seke assoyled geuyng money benefice thus wyckedly gotten enioye withstanding doe denye youre holynes may pardon theyr offence touchynge punyshement haue deserued occasion transgressynge may taken awaye thynke nede deale strayghtly remitte punyshement shamefull detestable thyng bieng sellyng must prouiso clergie geue away legacie part churche goodes without great cause lest hinderauce poore shal haue aboundaunce spende riot voluptuousnes also licence graunted euery man chouse chaplaine lyste haue masse priuate house whiche ought rashlye graunted lest secrete thinges come contempt especially chiefest sacrament iudulgences pardos ought geuen commonly one yeare great city uowes may lightly chaunged conuerted worke vnlesse correspondent vowe sometyme last wyl testatours wont chaunged whiche happely bequethed portion money godly v chaunceth comonly reason pouertie heires wylmakers must hede take vnlesse testatour fall pouertie wil well perfourmed suffered wickednes el alter deades wyll nowe haue declared mindes thiges cocerning vniuersal churche shal adde fewe case whiche properly belong byshop rome citie churche rome mother maistres church comlye decent harlottes honoured rome excelle others religion honestie life churche peter haunte many vnlearned filthie priestes appareled vile garmentes owne churche also vndecet like worne priuate house porest sorte garmentes say masse great offence lokers therfore must archedeacon comissarie comau ded first citie also place suche filthines auoyded men sight shall saye vnchaste woman strompetes whiche apparell kynde ornamentes differ nothing citie fro matrones honour rydyng vpon mule middes citie euen none dayes accompanied familiar frendes seruautes chiefest cardinalles suche like certenly haue sene suche intemperancie dissolute liuing vsed ani citie ought dede spectacle ensample whole vniuersall world courtisanes also maynteyned inhabit gorgeous house doubteles great shame also citie great contention faction parte amende thinges shalbe requisite yt oppointe certen cardinalles mete purpose appease strife reconcile myndes citezens last prouision wydowes pore people properly apperteineth charge thinges moste holy father whiche haue thought mete refourmed albeit vnmete charge yet haue done laye v vttered coscience vprightly entred great hope yt vnder gouernment shal see church pure cleane quiet perpetuall immortall glory name haue take name paule wherfore trust come passe example embrace churche certen earnest seruent zeale god chose paule singular instrument preache gospell gentyles truste also chosen cal light name christ getyles defaced remedy publique disease reduce flock christe one shepefolde tourne away god wrath hageth ouer v dewe offeces reformation deede conceaued woordes neuer brou ght effecte published finally byshop delayeth cou sell beginninge nouembre kalendes may next yeare followyng assigneth place uicentia large plentifull citie belongyng state uenise sendeth thither three cardinalles campegius simonet brunduse whiche presidentes cousel begynne treatie receyue came byshop would haue matter reformation kept close sayde longe hydde tyme brought rome germany luther answered duche tongue iohn sturmius latine framynge theyr style commissioner reformation luther booke sette picture whiche playnely declared argument byshop placed hyghe seate certen cardinalles standing whiche fox tayles tied staues lyke besomes sweepe thinges vpsyde downe amoges cardinalles nicholas archebyshop capua coulde abyde reformation beinge sente bishop paule crediblie reported contended sore cardi capua ca abide reformation nothynge redressed amonges thinges sayde howe lutherianes would make boast wer driue doe maner compulsion wherupon byshop cardinalles cotenthed perswaded alter thing yet selfe letted reported haue sent booke priuely certen frende germany whiche manye men take though would haue byshop sayde commissioner lawghed scorne labour others thynke bishop made priuie booke reformation setting forth might appeare hym wyll amendement thynges yet vnderstande meane though hym selfe would haue done greater thinges case entended haue publyshed suche like matter touchynge colloquy erasmus thus standeth amonges manye workes wherby erasmus wonderfully auaunced learning made colloquie erasmus also booke dialogue chyldren seyng red gredely ofte augmented man excellent witte great eloquence toke pleasure wryte sondry argumentes taken naturall thynges lyfe men certen maruelous dexteritie style moste pleasaunt setteth forth precpres godlye vertuouse maners noteth occasion olde accustomed errours vice whereof commeth complaynte hym moneth februarye frenche momoraci made constable fra kyng made anna momorauncie conestable fraunce whiche hyghest degre honoure office bene euer voyde synce death duke bourbon kyng beyng greuously offended treason bestowed vpon man vntyll tyme office hath bare lucke one two whilest abusing authoritie haue styred vp either kynges selues nobilitie meane tyme protestauntes assemble brunswicke ende marche treate matter cocernyng league receyue christiane kyng denmarke christiane kinge de marke receiueth gospell league sonne frederick receiued doctrine gospell appointed iohn pomerane whome called wittenberge set ordre church annoynted crowned kyng iohn also marque brandeburg brother ioachim prince electour made meanes duke saxon admitted league therfore appointed treate vpon certen coditions retourne home tha receiue hym name requeste also made albert duke pruselande whome syxe yeares chamber outlawed chiefest cause whye receyued duke pruse outlawed societie neuerthelesse promysed hym fauour good wyll whan duke saxony lantgraue co sortes goyng assemblie henry duke brunswycke denied geue saufe conduicte whan passe countrey euen imagined warre hereafter shall heare duke saxon company maurice nephewe duke george brother henry young man seuentene yeares olde henry protestauntes religion therfore duke toke sonne maurice beyng kynsman bring vp kyng denmarke hym selfe came also brunswicke nynth booke spake persecution frauce lutheranisme long recite al yeare ides apryll whiche nyne dayes easter young gentleman tolouse learned twenty yeares age brent paris eatyng fleshe alyue dede yet beinge hanged gentlema tolouse burnt paris ryght ouer felte fyre kyndled vnder hym whiche maner accompted great benefite prison brought forth execution feared cruell wordes morine iudge threatenyng hym confessed done wyckedlye agaynste religion maner repentaunce shal suffer lesse torment suche abyde constant moste cruelly tourmented two younge men flaunders lyke daunger admonyshed therof certen senatour learned good iudgement escaped death flyeng awaye moneth may bishoppe rome goeth nice hauen towne ligurie thyther also came emperoure themperor frenche king pope meet nice frenche kynge request chiefly nauie spaine kynge lande accompanied amonges others power almaignes whiche lead wylliam countie fursteberge longe treatie albeit coulde throughlye agree yet trewee made moneth iune ten yeares lady margaret emperours bastarde daughter ensured octauius duke parma byshoppes nephew sonne peter cosmus duke florence woulde fayne haue maried death alexander medices two kynges spake together place albeit byshoppe desyred muche fewe dayes whan departed mette aegnes mortes towne prouince mouth riuer rhosne whither emperour retorninge spaine came nauie ides iulye kinge sent mete uelius ambassadoure galleis conduicte whan emperour came nere vnto aegnes conestable fraunce readye entreate hym woulde arriue nauie saied kynge woulde within two houres would come barke whan emperour sawe rest shippes scattered daye reason miste come together putteth hauen longe commeth kynge also accompanied amonges others anthony duke loraine cardinall brother goeth streight waye shippes emperour goynge forth farre ladder shippe mete receaueth spoken embracynges gratulations whan set downe sterne shippe noble aboute emperour come salute kinge lowly right curtesly emperour sent andrewe aurie admirall prince melphite forsoke kynge tenne yeares andr w de aurie mentioned sixte booke come salute kyng whan came kynge said prince andrewe muche frende seruiture emperoure pleasure speake wyth contente gratifie herein esteme brother whan talked familiarlye frendly together space howre kynge departeth next day mornyng sone light day emperour gyueth commaundement trompet man go lande himselfe garded wyth certen noble saileth dyne kynge came lande kinge quene two sonnes gently embrace lead palace towardes euenynge themperour aduertiseth androwe de aure remained meting ofthemperor kynge within borde howe request kinge queene syster purposed lie towne night next day diner retourne nauie whiche intent leste throughe absence conceaue false suspicion hys minde wherfore next day emperour came againe sea accompanied king noble whan drunken together emperours cabben shippe departed great frendes thing knowen paris place songe tedeum made bonefyers bishop requested nice whan peace concluded woulde go counsell uicentia sende thither suche prelate theyr companyes also sende commaundement rest home repayre thither like maner excused selues thinges cardinal whiche sent thither aduertised great solitarinesse againe deferreth day counsell till easter folowyng sendyng abrode letter touching matter fourth kalendes iuly whan retornyng homewarde gene fyrst metyng kyng kissed right foote sate chayre freche kinge kissed pope right foote rest noble notwithstandyng diuerse kinges traine refused although conestable warned christopher duke wirtemberge william cou tie furstemberge germanes mareschall marchan frencheman george gluchie ambassadour kynge denmarke selfe time departed life charles ecmonde duke gelders former boke haue harde howe maner turned al possession brought distresse wha laye sicke deuised cosin william duke cleaue consent nobilitie common brought hys owne gouernement without themperours highe displeasure shalbe declared place litle dieth also erarde marchian cardinall bishoppe liege man tourmented religion bishop liege made graue yet liuing cathedrall churche liege many yeares builded tombe sumptuous masse dirige songe yerely papistes wonte deade iudged merit priestes auaileable beyng liue wherunto attribute deserte rewarde eternall life knewe man well affirme certen ostentation desyrous vayne glorie toke pleasure pompe solemnitie time englishe bible printyng paris kinges commaundement english bible printed paris church englande knowen prohibited printer daunger fraunce haue commonlye scripture vulgare tongue neither doth want suspicion man chaunce read newe testament suche like thinge frenche neyther lawfull studye scripture professe diuinite common sort men know nothing towne wiues whan go masse cary bokes latin prayer muble vp sorte knowing saye perswaded god acceptable praie mother tonge practise priestes ignoraunce people gainefull priestes vnto ignoraunce others gainefull bishoppe retourning home begynnyng august receiued citie rome merueilous pompe triumphe stretes way beyng hanged spired rich costly carpet posy written euery place wherin extolled wonderfully restoryng peace vnto world reco ciling prince yeare strauseborough erected colledge gra mer colledge erected straus scoole youth meanes chieflye iames sturnne principall senator whiche shorte time thoroughe diligence learned men florished repared thither onely furthest partes germany also foreine nation maner teaching youth diuiding fourmes whole order deuised iohn sturmie whiche fyrst exhibited senate afterwardes booke put forth declareth large wheras many fayne flie religion consciece sake fraunce flaunders senate appointed churche wherof iohn caluine fyrste certeine yeres superintendent iohn caluin peter brulie peter brulie whose ende wil speake herafter englande thomas canturbury long time great reuerence body shryned siluer hanged rounde costly iewelles gold precious stone beyonde measure amonges others one riche iewell called regal fraunce yeare king henry take shrine burne reliques thomas surnamed becket thomas becket time past archebishop canturbury stode styffe defending liberty clergie fell displeasure kyng englande henry seconde name commaunded exile fledde bishoppe rome alexander thyrde tyme themnitie themperour friderick barbarousse fraunce length thomas becket intercession lewes vij kinge fraunce reconciled retourned home seuenth yere exile afterwarde troubled certen bishoppes toke kynges parte excomunicate kyng beyng againe offended said miserable estate could liue quiet one priest lame ted also man aboute woulde deliuer suche disquietnes whiche wordes ticled many knowing displeasure kinge went cantorbury slewe thomas kynge pretended great sorowe sendynge ambassador rome make purgation fyne entreated bishoppe sende inquisitours england enquire examine matter time bishoppe laste sente two cardinal murther could searched kyng pourgeth selfe othe former hatred wordes spoken suspecion fault conclusion reconciled vpon condicion yeares shuld go syria warre vpon saracenes murther committed yeare man saluation mclxxi longe memoriall thomas waxed famous throughe miracle monkes canturbury sayd wrought whereof bishoppe rome aduertised legate came englande canonised made saint time metyng nice ioachim marque brandenburge prince electour sonne ioachin beginninge iune sent ambassador eustace schlebie duke saxon instruction howe sigismunde kinge pole iohn wayuode kynge hungary aduertised hym turkes made great preparation inuade hungary fortifiyng buda make incursion germanye themperour newes turkes approche turkes signifie vnto uayuode inioyned father open assemblie whan intelligence turkishe matter aduertise state therof therfore also performe dewtie common wealth litle moued newes chaunce calamitie natife countrey therfore cause went kyng ferdinando lusatia comming also receiued letter messagers touching thinges wherfore case resisted doubt lie nexte se shortly theyr countrey cruell enemie way buda vntill theyr frontier nother castell towne fortified able hold power mountaines streight passage stoppe carriage sauing onely citie uratislauie towne lignice situation morauie silesie howe champion fruietfull countrey knoweth well enough nedeth rehearsall albeit hath promysed ayde kynge ferdinando common daunger yet seeth howe lytle suche maner ayde able helpe greatnes case requyreth al ayde power whole empyre muche haplye obtayned without generall assemblye vnlesse ail germany quieted agayne present daunger wyll permitte long delaye therfore hath talke moued kyng woulde wholy dispose selfe vnto thynge onlye fyrme sure peace myght concluded wherunto kyng ferdinando answered ryght honorably promysed endeuour cause emperour might vnderstande league frendes furthermore demaunded seing standeth thus desyreth hym geue mynde hereunto open vnto hym vnfaynedly suche condition peace thynketh mete intreated hym selfe wyll deuyse owne name ferdinando shall preferre emperour suche sorte trusteth treatie shalbe commodious vniuersall worlde nowe also maye turkes violence easelye resisted muche iohn uayuode reconcyled kynge ferdinando kynge hym selfe tolde hym counsel would haue bruted abroad leste come turkes care certen yeares past hetherto hath great part hongary bene plucked awaye christendome ciuile warres nowe myndes appeased displeasure paste goodlye occasion offered well doynge wherfore eftsones besecheth hym would help cause common wealth marque maried daughter sigismunde kyng poole whiche nece iohn uayuode systers syde hereof came frendshyp familiaritie betwyxt also receyued religion saxony set forth booke marquses denburge protestantes religion kepte hym league otherwyse wholy addicted emperour kynge ferdinando reteyned certen ceremony sought quiet offence duke saxony signifieth whole matter letter lantgraue twelfth daye iune wryte bothe marque brandenburg wyse albeit matter muche importaunce altogether suche oughte make fellowes priuie yet doe see discommoditie myghte come thorowe delaye especially consideryng turke flacketh nothyng fiersenes haue also consulted ouerlonge quiet germany withstande hym power aduertised ambassadours nedefull resiste moste cruell ennemie truthe confesse common wealth requyred lesse stad case chiefly nede suche peace honourable trewe syrme nothyng doubtfull case spende theyr treasure turkyshe warre meane whyle haue vnquiet neighbour home seeth selfe howe vnmete hurtefull would vnto parte verye desyrous peace whiche obtayne therfore doubtfull matter diminishe parte power meane time comon wealth sustayne damage may blame therof imputed together vnto refuse condition peace moreouer suppose concerne kinge ferdinado others border turkes relatio made thinges vnto state also hetherto counsel imperiall called profite commo wealth though perchaunce time wil permitte publique ayde decreed sodaynly nede requyreth craue ayde men yet turke suche power able continew warres many yeares wil cease tyl eyther hath obteyned pourpose hauing ouerthrow costrayned breake vp warres time wherfore thinke assemblie empyre expediet peace germany therein myght established co sultation conserning turkishe warre later great force albeit al thinges quiet germany yet neuer thelesse common assembly nedefull skileth greatly perchaunce kyng ferdinado well emperours name ambassadours sent full commission authoritie whiche thing bring passe shalbe comodious emperour germany howe leste shoulde point fayle common wealth hinder comoditie woulde haue readynes suche ayde partes acustomed oughte finde alwayes readye serue whan nede shall require neyther doubte theyr fellowes wil vnder condition kyng ferdinando immediatly obtayne emperour sure vndoubted peace whiche prince empyre bysshoppes religion shall ratifie done suite action chamber set apart ayde shalbe streight wayes ready case emperour reason absence brynge prynces heeeunto time leste perswade opinion william lewis duke bauier george duke saxony archebyshop mentz collon treuers also bishop salisburge maydenburge breme bamberge wyrtenburge munster auspurge aeslet case perswaded emperour kyng ferdinando doe confirme peace selues subiectes make promyse endeuours prynces also maye geue theyr assente whiche case shall refuse doe yet shall neuer swarue conuenant shortly may cause shall call assemblie empire done truste league frendes also wyll ready sende theyr ayde lyke themselues determined doe case league frendes agreable well maye enioye benefyte peace whiche came league composition norinberge suche shal repare vnto hereafter moreouer may extende prince empyre also kyng denmarke entent may well appere howe desirous peace muche state empyre soone assembled therefore wyll appointe assemblie company isenacke xxiiij iuly moste ample commission wherfore well done could brynge passe emperour kyng ferdinando hym selfe also palsgraue sent ambassadours thither whan aunswered wyse dispatched letter vnto league frendes requyringe daye iseuacke towne turingie marque caused ambassadour shewe case content wold deuyse palsgraue tedred also comon welth trauayle matter letter marque brandenburge sent also whole treaty heldus emperours ambassadour myght clerely perceiue whole matter whiche thynges receyued marque intrateth kyng ferdinando would immediatly preferre matter emperoure fore retourned italy spayne requireth palsgraue take matter hade together hym maketh aunswere albeit protestauntes spoken hym herein yet woulde refuse men gone whiche wonte serue hym affayres wherfore wylleth hym sende counsellours vnder one matter afterwardes requyre presence would fayle whan daye came marque ambassadours declared first duke saxon lantgraue rest isenacke prynces selues present wylled desyre palsgraue take trauayle payne daye myght appoynted wherin mete agayne meane whyle matter may brought passe emperour consent also aucthoritie may moreouer requested woulde ouer streight lased graunt muche myght saufe conscience kynge ferdinando wyll slacke maner dilygence neyther doubteth emperour also greatly inclined peace hereunto protestauntes aunswere isenacke fifte day auguste make concorde desirous emperours wyl comaundement accordingly though thinke nedefull intreate palsgraue whiche selfe well disposed emperour comaunde hym wil refuse yet wyll wryte vnto whan emperours pleasure shalbe knowen aduise palsgraue wyll assigne daye wherin shall mete treate forsayd matter assemblie receyued league lady elizabeth lady elizabeth sister lantgraue receiued league protest lantgraues syster wydowe city also halle hailbrune made sute admitted mediation auspurge ulmes heard also euery ma complaintes especially cause goflarians whome henry duke brunswycke sore oppressed wherfore agreed requeste marque woulde obteyne emperour meanes kyng ferdinando precept wherby duke brunswicke may compelled aunswere matter otherwyse state co dition goflariens miserable forsake distresse hitherto also newes brought peace concluded betwene emperour frenche kyng assemblie brake vp nynth daye auguste yeare sprang vp secte whiche called antinomian fecte antinomias doe affirme repentaunce taught ten commaundementes impugne whiche teache gospell preached vnto myndes firste shaken broken declaration lawe determyne soeuer man lyfe neuer sinfull yet iustified beleue promyses gospell chiefe iohn islebie surnamed agricola luther doth plainly confute thynges proueth lawe geuen iohn isleby intent iustifie declare synne feare conscience therfore ought fyrste taught gospell whiche sheweth vnto v sonne god mediatour aduocate mankynde fyne islebie admonished luther priuatly conference scripture better instructed perswaded luther opinion afterwarde open wryting witnessed confessing errour laste booke haue heard muche speaking heldus emperour sent ambassadour germany receiuing protestauntes suche aunswere woulde goeth moste parte prince deuising sclaunder though protestauntes could abyde right hearing matter refused moste reasonable condition peace hym propounded began moue league wherof protested bothe emperoure kynge ferdinando aucthours rested brought passe archebyshops metz salisburge william lewys duke bauier george lege papistes protestates duke saoxony ericke henry duke brunswicke matter assembled norinberge league made vnder title case man iniuried molested byshops religion whiche call olde others shoulde assiste aide therfore thei called holy ordeined god glory defence churche decreed eleuen yeares frenche kyng returnyng nice came comunication marie emperours syster regent flaunders compegue towne swycers men thought dryfte occasion newe made peace frendlye metynge aeguesmortes myght turne awaye kynges mynde duke cleaue possessed gelderlande opinion kynges amitie myght make hym sore afrayde ye haue hearde much iudgement imperiall chamber euermore lyke selues nothyng relentynge wonted rygour lately outlawed citie myndin sute betwyxte citie mynden ou lawed clergie citie whiche thynge one knowen duke saxony lantgraue name league frendes publyshe wrytynge ides nouembre wher recite ordre trouble haue chamber certen yeares paste neuer quiet vpon moste iuste cause haue bene refused yet neuerthelesse procedyng obstinatlye haue nowe prescrybed theyr fellowes citezens myndyn doe admonyshe praye prynces state would repute sentence geuen vniuste suffer selues styred vp violence wyse sentence put execution would sure neglecte iniuries confederatours meane tyme emperour beyng moued kyng ferdinando sayde sent letter germany declarynge good wyll towardes common wealth howe muche desyred appease thys controuersie religion fewe dayes paste receyued aduertysement protestauntes also dyd refuse concondicions peace required treatie consente therto therfore vnto whome nothynge lieuer publique tranquilitie doeth allowe waye maketh deputes archebyshop londe matthie helde one geueth ful aucthoritie presentes together counsellers brother kyng ferdinando prynces intercessours may treate determyne matter soeuer shall doe wyll ratifie letter dated toledo xxv daye nouembre whan afterwardes brought germany twelfth daye february assigned whiche daye shoulde mete franckefurte tolde litle league made norinberge chief ryngeleaders hereof lewis duke bauier henry duke duke brunswick desyrous war brunswycke whiche wholy addicted disturbe common quiet endeuour styre vp warre agaynste protestauntes tyme receyued letter archebyshop mentz morowe christmas day aunswereth fewe wordes committing reste credite hys secretary stephen faber whome sente withall last daye saue one december chaunced farre towne cassel lantgraue going hunting mette yonge man archebyshop mentz brought letter lantgraue almaigne facion demaunded younge man firste mette hym sayeth seruaunt prynce electour brandenburge lykewyse whan stephen nowe came nere hym asketh hym selfe aunswered done enquireth whether goyng sayde spyres howe doeth prynce health beyng demaunded whether woulde iustifie thynges trewe sayde yea woulde dimissed afterwarde whan gone little waye one lantgraues seruauntes tolde howe duke brunswickes secretary whiche also affirmed knewe hym lantgraue sent fetche back casselle tyll came huntynge hym selfe meane tyme lantgraue intercepteth duke letter stephen faber whylest stowffe plucketh bosome lether bagge takynge certen letter hasteth doer one houshold seruauntes perceiued gaue notice stewarde chaunced present lookynge downe stowffe wyndowe courte vnderneth wherfore asked letter draweth bosom steward receiueth custody delyuered latgraue whan came hunting two letter wherof one directed archebyshop mentz matthie helde al certen table remembraunce instruction thinges incredite seing matter selfe suspicious note within table increased suspition lantgraue openeth somme archebyshoppes letter receyued letter reioseth muche hath hym contynuall remembraunce commaunde howe hath sent vnto stephen secretary trustye man whome maye vnderstande whole matter newes brought hym bauier unto whome desyreth hym geue credit wysheth well hym theyr adherentes aduersaries commendeth sathan effecte wrytten also heldus howe sent agayne stephen instruction desyreth heare hym gently gyue lesse credite hym spake presently hym persone longe lyueth wyll take emperours parte howe euer matter falleth neyther doubteth emperour wyll deuyse thynges well enough remembraunce archebyshop lantgraue vnquiet could take slepe reste geuen huntynge almoste madde wherby thing myght better done parte already brought passe lantgraue goeth aboute vnknowen duke bauier moste certen wil make warre againste one two wherfore muste perswade fellowes college come league shall doe well also addicte selfe wholy vnto league haue respect whome beynge one forsaken receyued muche displeasure howe duke bauier intende talke together conferryng counselles determine thyng moreouer state sweuia moued vnto league matter brought almoste ende instruction heldus truste emperour wyl come shortly spayne perseuer co stante purpose thynges shall procede well trusteth kynges also whiche yet haue vttered selues wyll fauour waye confederatours mynde wylle shall wante nothynge howe soeuer others vse selues wyll euer remayne constant obedient emperour howe thynketh good chamber comaunde lantgraue laye aparte weapos meane whyle wyll duke bauier readines obeye chamber may comaunde duke bauier forsee comon wealth susteine da mage inioyne prynces also geue assistaunce forme league time thinges thus come light great daunger towarde occasion warre sought latgraue furthwith wrote letter father lawe duke george declaringe whole matter stoode sheweth hath great wrong offered maketh preparation warre time matthias helbus rode great post haste frauce spayne emperour afterwardes lantgraue wrote king ferdinando syster mary regent flaunders prince electours duke bauier sorte duke george father lawe maketh purgation whan duke bruswicke perceiued matter disclosed heard lantgraues letter aunswereth hath susteined wrong handes whiche nowe hath taken secretary also duke saxon last yeare whan commaundement kyng ferdinando emperours name went duke george saxony againe comming home norinberge tyme league made laye wayte unto duke saxon aunswereth muche denied fellowes saufeconduicte whan went brunswicke lawe custome empyre coulde thinke none otherwyse hym ennemye dyuerse tymes gone two thre hym disguysed seruauntes apparell knowen brother countrey priuely neyther whiche knewe well enough empeche lette would haue passage stopped hym league frendes thinke haue libertie men wyl graunt vnto wherfore vpon occasion began write one long ended sharpe bitter inuectiues hauing dede beginning duke inuectiues vnmete prince brunswicke whiche rare example amonges prince let passe kynde raylyng opprobrious wordes bokes set forth prynte doe declare whylest thynges workynge dieth iohn duke cleaue leauyng william sonne heyre whome death iohn duke cleaue conradus heresbachius chyldhode instructed good letter maners tyme come franckefurte moneth februarye accordyng appoyntment much sondrye sharpe debatynge matter concluded last nyntene daye apryll vpon condition emperour intent comunication learned may cocerning religion graunteth cofederatours doctrine professed auspurge whiche nowe numbre truce xv monethes commaundeth meane tyme molested case concernyng religion peace norinberge emperours decree regenspurge also tyme ratified duryng tyme truce fully agree religion yet shall peace force vntyll nexte assemblie empyre perchaunce assemblie truce expyred yet neuerthelesse peace shall take place vntyll assemblye meane whyle tyme truce emperour doeth suspende suite action lawe commenced againste protestauntes also outlawyng cytie myndin anye thynge otherwyse done commaundeth frustrate wonte obiected vnto though profession religion myght consiste iudgement shall take place longer shall enioye benefite lawe without exception agayne protestauntes shall moleste man durynge truce shall take none theyr league yet man susteyne anye wronge quarell religion emperour shall also forsee man receyued ouer contrary league protestauntes shall permytte clergie enioye yearelye profites whiche haue daye consent emperour daye shall assigned kalendes auguste whiche daye mete norinberge cathoqliues protestautes good men desirous peace contention frowarde shal chouse certen numbre diuines whiche quietly frendly may conferre religion also shalbe ioyned others professe diuinitie yet experte men sobre moreouer emperour kynge ferdinando lyste maye haue deputes conference soeuer shall agreed vpon consent eyther partie shalbe signified state yt absent approuing emperours ambassadour also shal ratifie el emperour self next asseblie thempire shal haue cofirmed shal co maund kept inuiolate party shal lay away ye preparatios vnto war yt shal seme go thig shalbe enforced shew cause doeth yet inhibited kepe defece necessary al thigs law thepire shalbe party obserued truce copreheded neither anabaptist others yt followe doctrine cotrary cofessio auspurg protestates shal haue redines ayde turckish warre yt ther delay whan prince electours principall state shall emperours commaundement sende deputes woormes xviij daye
