may protestautes shall sende also may consulte soden ayde turke someuer shalbe agreed vpon consent parte shall also subscribe turke shall moue warre duryng tyme truce shall resiste hym reste thynges ratified case emperour within syre month shall allowe begynning kalendes may meane tyme agrement concerning truce augmente league shalbe force case emperour declare mynde within tyme yet shall peace norinberge full strength vertue hereafter emperours depute iohn archebyshop londe heldus gone spayne sayde kyng ferdinando also sent thether ambassadours protestauntes many duke saxon selfe lantgraue whiche brought certen diuines palsgraue marque brandenburg electours intreate meanes duke saxon amonges thynges protested duke saxony woulde geue ferdinando title kyng romains tyme would attribute ferdinando title king romains stode conuenautes cadame uienne archebyshop londe germayne borne counsellour christierne kyng denmarke beyng expulsed also exiled lost byshopryke came agayne germany attended vpon emperour afterwardes made byshop constaunce whylest treaty frankefurte certen bandes souldiours assembled saxony commaunded gouernours go lye countreis citie breme duke lunenburge others religion remayne tyll campe remoued kept secrete first whose conduicte aucthoritie leuied length certenly knowen mustred henry duke brunswycke brother christopher archebyshop bremen ried complayned dede imperial chaber vayne protestautes afterwardes industrie lest harme procured men serue whome notwithstanding vsed iniurie man request prince wer intercessours stephen faber set libertie lantgraue gaue passeporte sayde owne accorde woulde retourne prince trusted hym whan released went streight way assemblie william duke cleue ambassadour exhibite wrytinge protestauntes wherin declared ryght tytle possessed gelderlande prayed would meanes emperour commende cause also emperours ambassadours frenche kyng aduertised ulrich duke wirtenberge frecha kyng geueth tousel duke wittemberge ambassadour heard saye howe motion confederatours determined make warre vppon certen byshoppes germany pourpose alowe good wyll beareth hym doth admonyshe hym offende emperour kyng ferdinando vnto whome lately reconciled bryng selfe al euer great daunger duke geuyng thankes good admonishement sayth sclaundered howe supposeth reysed vp duke bauier hathe fasly sowen lyke bruite hym germany desyreth hym geue credit neither entent yet fellowes styre vp trouble attepte thyng force armes vnlesse constrayned doubteth also shal heare therof wyl pourge selues herein wherfore whan declared fellowes franckefurte duke saxon lantgraue xix daye aprill addresse letter kynge saye howe vnderstande duke ulriche reporte duke saxon lantgr write frech kyng made vnto hym sclaunder forged ennemies euill wyllers entende make warre muche desyre peace prince tell intercessours albeit wayes one prouoked albeit theyr fellowes citie outlawed league made dyuerse defence vniusle decree though bandes souldiours hired great vnaccustomed wage nowe spoyling countreys league frendes yet quiet styre one whytte loue natiue countrey remitte iniuries comon wealthes sake aduersaries lead certen impudent hatred followe temperate wayes wyll admitte lawefull reasonyng seke germany maye swymme ciuile bloud seyng thus desyre hym credit false reportes geue ayde churche maye quieted godly meanes properly dutie kynges maynteine truthe innocencie defende cause religion done none euyll pourpose certen godly dutie doubte doctrine whiche doe professe agreable vnto god worde whiche maye wyse forsake duke george saxon irth ende assemblie xxiiij daye apryll died george duke saxony without chyldren two sonnes departed without issewe whereof one maried elizabeth lantgraues syster one house mandesfielde wherfore duke george legacie maketh heyres brother henry sonnes maurice auguste vnder condition alter state religion whiche vnlesse shall perfourme geueth whole landes emperour kyng ferdinando vntyll suche tyme eyther sonnes nexte kynsman familie doe accomplyshe condition wyl made sheweth first nobilitie comons countrie beinge nowe olde sickly wylleth confirme othe neuer alter last wyll fearyng leste occasion warre betwene kinsme intreate would content sende brother henry truste wyll consente alter nothing religion whereupon ambassadours sent perswade whan alledged ambassadours sent brother henry sondry reason especially sayd muche ready money great quantitie plate goodly stuffe whiche come wholy handes case would obeye brother wyll aunswered thus certenly message semeth vnto resemble writte gospel tyme sathan promysed christe kyngdomes whole worlde would falle downe worshyp hym doe youthynke sette muche ryches would therfore forsake truthe pure religion assuredly farre abused thinke wherfore whan answere departed without purpose came home duke george lefte hys lyfe brother henry going immediatly dresda townes bindeth people hym othe easely done reason league protestauntes moreouer prince electour saxony hearyng death hasteth home expedition nede myght ayde henry prince popysh parte losse sure pyllour lucky successe protestauntes sore agreued especially archebyshop mentz duke brunswycke hereafter shal heare thus duke george successour heire cleane contrary wylle whome hated moste men duryng lyfe tyme namely luther sent new prince lipsia preache alter religion tyme moneth may appered blasyng starre shortly departed isabel wyfe charles emperour whome frenche kyng sone heard therof kepte solempne funerall paris maner kynges shewed counsell uicence whiche byshop rome proroged tyll easter yeare seyng none would come publisheth letter tenth iune wherin prorogeth counsell suspendeth owne pleasure senate cardinalles kyng englande certen monethes set forth another wryttyng touching synode uicence declareth howe byshop deludeth whole worlde excused hym selfe duke mantua playne mockery seing taketh vppon hym great anothoritie compelle hym coulde wherfore shoulde commaunde men come place vncerten whiche power nowe albeit hathe chosen uicence pourpose yet doubt enetians men great wysdome wyll suffer citie pestred suche multitude without garmsons souldiours woulde duke mantua fyne wylbe small resorte thether mantua fore delusion euer doeth neyther oughte permitted dissolute lybertie longer nothynge dede better commodious lawfull counsell whan applied vnto priuate lucre commoditie establyshynge certen men aucthoritie brynge wonderfull destruction common wealth whan name counsell churche nowe common euery man mouthe luther setteth forth booke either vulgare speache fyrst treatefh assemblie apostle hierusalem whiche mentioned xv actes reciteth contrary opinion doctours especially austen ciprian concernyng baptisme occasion maketh mention lawes called canon apostle proueth manifest reason thei comonly called apostle false false countrefeated geue tytle deserue death doeth recite ordre foure counselles chiefe authoritie counsell nyce constantinople ephesus calcedonie declareth cause assebled ther decreed euery commeth principall question sheweth aucthoritie counsell wherfore sayeth howe counsel maye confirme newe doctryne commaunde newe worke neyther bynde men myndes newe ceremony intermedle ciuile gouernementes make decree establysh authoritie dutie therof abolyshe condemne newe opinion contrary holy scripture newe ceremony whether superstitious vnprofitable churche suche thynges brought controuersie examine determine written text god worde diffineth churche sheweth token ought knowen comparyson made declaring christe apostle taught sayeth howe byshop rome whiche hath brought churche farre cotrary doctrine wicked meanes hath pylled whole world intollerable exaction ought condempned dryuen make restitution amonges diuerse thynges wherby boke declareth blyndenes men led vnder byshop rome howe shameful vyle religion sayeth freers maketh deuyll afrayd come thus farre monke freers wede thought sufficient bryng man eternall lyfe manye onlye meane folkes also great prynces would buried freers garment shall come peraduenture wyl beleue yet true wont commonly done italy mory fraunces marque mantua seconde name put last wylle myght buried gray freers cote albertus pius prynce carpes paris christopher longelie bourgonnion buried padwey man excellently langelius oration lutherians learned great ciceronian also wrote oration lutherians lyke case alberte diuers erasmus roterdame immediatly death duke george henry duke brunswycke rydeth emperour spayne thorowe fraunce tyme henry eyght kyng englande calleth parliament wherein amoges thinges enacted certen decree religio called syxe article followeth vnder syr article four bread wyne true natural body bloud christe wordes consecration remayned substaunce bread wyne receiuing whole supper lorde necessary saluation christ wholy coteyned vnder kyndes lawful priestes marry vowes chastitie ought perfourmed priuate mass reteyned auricular confession good necessary suche thought otherwyse appoynted punyshement dewe heretikes tyme kynge stoode termes marry lady anne cleue mayde excellent lady anne cleaue beautie affianced within monthes sent caleis whether kyng sent lorde admirall others shyppes receyue transporte englande hymselfe accompanied noble gentleman realme receiued vpo blacke heath brought grenewitche shortly married archebyshop canturbury saye howe bishoppes perswaded kyng cosent syxe article intent myght bring archebyshop cantorburye lorde crumwell whiche great fauourers religion aucthoritie creditie yeare moth august barbarousse turkes lieutenaunt barbarouse taketh castel newes taketh assiege castelneufe towne slauonie borderinge vpon goulfe uenise sleying souldiours leadeth awaye many captiue yere moneth october emperour uenetians beyng one confederacie wonne emperour dede put garrison foure thousand spanyardes made captayne fraunces sarmiento whiche chaunced uenetians contrary expectation sayde town standing coaste ought rather therfore longe mislyked societie sawe wold daungerours aske truce turke obteyne maner tyme arose sedition gaunte whiche citie rebellienat gaunte great force aucthoritie party hath oftentymes made many sore bickeringes lybertie gouernours flaunders whose dominion standeth emperour hauing intelligence hereof firste thought haue gone italy germany altered purpose determined passe fraunce seyng kyng required hym instantly emperour passeth throughe fraunce doe promysed hym thynges franckely meane tyme palsgraue marque brandenburge intercessours addressyng letter emperour pacification franckfurte requyred hym permitte conference learned men norinberge sayde death wyfe certen affaire would suffer hym entende suche matter whan intercessours sent copie duke saxon lantgraue yet signified whether emperour confirmed truce xv monethes xix daye nouember assemblie appoynted arustet towne turingia consulted augmente confederacie nedefull defence case emperour wyll allowe peace makyng franckefurte well disposyng churche goodes sende ambassadours englande touching syxe article mitigate kinges mynde moue frenche kynge innocente persones tormented religio moreouer sende ambassadours emperour sone shall vnderstande commyng flaunders certen confederatours absent commission determine certe matter daye assigned smalcalde kalendes marche wherin treate reste receiued league men rigen citie linonia whiche cotencion archebyshop lyke many others germany neyther wer receyued vpon condicion defended counsel cha ber commo procurer therfore payed confederatours thousande fyue hundreth crownes henry duke saxon taken league two yeares without charge poore yet vpon condition tyme enriched beare like charge reste nowe therfore auaunced goodly inheritaunce assemblie treated hym touching whiche assemblie ended tenthe decembre prynces present sent deputes duke saxon sent iohn dulcie fraunces burcarte vicechauncelour englande moneth nouembre name present marriage betwene kynge lady anne cleane married syster sibille mentioned sy booke wherfore vpon occasion enioyned arnstade treate kyng name protestautes matter sayd emperour receyuing saufe conduictetoke iourney small company moneth nouembre whan came frontier fraunce borderynge vpon spayne met kynges two sonnes henry charles come thether poste constable gone thether long great parte nobilitie fraunce receyued conduicted myddes fraunce greatest city wha came loche burges mette kynge hym selfe scarcely ameded late disease passyng leaunce newe yeares daye rydynge myddes betwene kynges two sonnes entred citie paris constable bare sworde kinde ioyful myrth gladnes honour solemnitie mynde man coulde delight emperour entreth paris left vndone thether came byshoppes legate alexander farnesius cardinall together cardinall bellaye byshop citie receiued emperour cathedrall churche paris emperour remaining seuen dayes afterwardes departeth kynge hym selfe accompanying hym uermandois sonnes brought hym farre ualencenes towne henaulte kynge brought great almoste sure hope recouer millan chaunced farre otherwyse hereafter purpose declare tyme emperour frenche emperours frech king ambassade uenetians kynge fraunce sent ambassadours uenetians moste nobly accopanied emperour sent alphonse daualle gouernour millan king claudie hannebalde lieutenant piedmonte exhorted senatours longe discours ioyne selues amitie two myghty prince put theyr good willes power ouerthrow turke whan honorably dimissed ambassador uenetians ambassador turke considering thing diligently thought mete reconcile selues turke trewce already wherfore concluding last rendre vnto nanplia epidaurum obteyned hande peace saye frenchemen albeit exhorted openly themperours ambassadour yet secretly whispered eares prouide themselues enter daunger fyrst like smarte king selfe apologie themperour reporteth common wealth uenetians destroyed meanes releued recouered aloisius bardnarius ambassadoure uenetians sente turke peace commaunded fyrst offer al condition reserue two city extreme necessitie turke priuie espiall knewe determination senate longe expostulate declare commission plainely directly without two place deliuered would conclude beyng amased seyng priuities common wealth secret senate vttered turke bewrayed full sore againste permitteth haue laste whan retourned uenise declared whole matter senatours greatly astonied moste diligente inquisition apprehende certen fyndynge giltie cut theyr trators executed heades one fledde frenche ambassadours lodgyng bishoppe mompelier saintuary wherefore officer sent haue searched house wha might suffered enter senate commaundeth certeine great piece fetched theyr ordenaunce house ouerthrow lodging wherupon frenchman consyderinge theyr owne daunger bring forth vnto senate afterwarde wrote vnto kinge cause dyd lest shoulde thynke ambassadour susteined wrong themperour came flaunders themp arriueth flaunders kyng ferdinando comming austriche met also protestantes ambassador condescended arnstad xxiiii daye february beyng admitted emperours speach gaunt welcome low countrey pourge selues euill reportes theyr aduersaryes complayne duke brunswike iudges chaumber declare desirous peace howe many way haue sought nowe desyre graunt establishe euer emperour telleth granuella hath consulted matter wyll make aunswere maner tyme sent ambassade emperour prote wryte freche king wrote also frenche kynge reioysinge muche great good wyll amitie betwene emperour hym long proces intreate hym cosent mindes cause religion publique quiet emperour kalendes marche ambassadours prince city protestauntes assembly smalcald met smalcald appointed also came diuines ionas pomerane melancthon cruciger bucer inioyned deuise fourme wryting wherwith shoulde thinke mete treate aduersaries cociliation religion assemblie cosulted matter left vndiscussed arnstad said meane time dulcie burcarte returned englande seuenth day marche make reporte smalcalde state religion england decree made yere great punishement latimer shaxton notwithstanding hugh latimer byshop woorcester shaxton byshop salisbury deteined prison religio yet released lorde cromwell whiche moste authoritie lorde cromwell doth appease mitigate kynges mynde also kyng selfe familiar talke opened vnto mynde supposeth thus diuines protestauntes thinke rightly co cerning mariage priestes lordes supper vnder kyndes priuate masse requireth write vnto necessary question large alledging cause reason opinion wyll see agayne learned men realme shall wryte aunswere thus waye may made come knowledge truthe moreouer cromwel certen others thinke mete expedient sende great ambassade kinge melancthon meane agrement religion might kynge woulde bestowe great somme money vpon league purposeth make onlye cause religion generall kyng marueleth greatly confederated religion tyme wyll come shalbe attempted warre vnder contrary title fewe dayes diuines exhibite wryting wrytinge exhibited diuines wherof swarue steppe confession auspurge apologie afterwardes annexed sentence afterwardes diuines absent approue letter sent thether tyme came henry duke brunswick emp aunswer protest gaut day ides march theperour answereth ye protestates ambassadours cornelles scepp getly yet suche sorte coulde wel perceiued whether would graunte peace wherfore ambassadours emperours leaue going litle asyde retourne desire hym inhibite processe imperiall chamber graunte peace whereunto emperour sayde aunswere tyme woulde take delyberation aunswere recited smalcalde tenth daye easter munday xxix marche came thether prince selues tyme certen contention hatred betwyxte granuella heldus fine came ende hatred betwixt counsellers heldus displaced departed courte lyued priuate lyfe aboue hym authoritie brought heldus hatred obloquie ouer vehement counsell matter affaire constreyned emperour thinkyng nothyng lesse haue warres maner wyll whan granuella geuen certen manifeste instruction wyll mynde inclyned peace concorde beynge requested protestauntes perswaded emperour also conditios peace hymselfe begynning though bene owne name sent smalcalde intercessours ambassadours theodoricke manderschitte william nuenarie erles men great wysdome dignitie notwithstanding first taried waye sore sycke demaundes reasonable enough neuerthelesse signified emperour almost perswaded false perswasio emper though cared religion neyther desyred peace theyr harte altogether sought conuerte churche goodes theyr priuate v delyghted discorde bare good wyll addicte take partes open ennemies thing reported emperour partly aduersaries partly frenchemen sayde certentie tyme emperour went fraunce thinges lyke growe perfite frendshyp certen thinges disclosed protestauntes letter vnto kyng shewed vnto emperour impute kyng selfe constable chief authoritie sought al meanes possible quiet agree prince dyd beare protestantes good wyl religion thirtene booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument thirtene booke protestauutes make aunswere emperour demaundes shewyng haue regarde religion churche goodes confute also argumentes kyng englande touchyng syxe article emperour hauing punyshed gaunt sendeth letter assigne metyng protestauntes whome speaketh alexander farnese pope legate followed emperour fraunce meane tyme frenche kyng made league duke cleane whose syster kyng englande refused assemble hagenawe certen poinctes religion agreed vpon resydewe referred conuention kyng ferdinando assigned woruies whether granuellan sendyng first naues came afterwarde also hym selfe made oration hym campeigius pope legate conference brake offe differed yt iourney regenspurg meane whyle luther answereth booke set forth duke brunswycke spoken dere mantell archebyshoppes counsell beyng begonne regenspurge granuellan presenteth booke interim duke cleaue commynge fraunce marrieth daughter nauarre vnto whiche thinges protestauntes eleuenth daye apryl make long aunswere answer prot grauella declaryng innocencie suche thinges emperour suspected chief cause great charge peryll professe doctrine done neither priuate comoditie pleasur displeasure persone respect saue god requyreth dutye professe name sonne gospell commaundeth v flye idolatrie warneth v straightly allowe crueltie whiche persecute true doctrine touchynge churche goodes shewe vnto good v imploye dissention others author thereof discourse cause religion large confute sclaunder inclyned emperours ennemies hym goodly large offer whiche cause refused ayde assistaunce whiche haue geuen hym warres finally requyre monser granuellan great comendation hath euermore hytherto perswaded emperour fro ye bloudy cousels aduersaries peaceable wayes wold preferre emperour complainte chamber intreate hym graunte peace often sought desyred tyme made answer ides apryl ende theyr intreaty appointe diuines make confutation syxe article enacted confutatis six article kyng englande booke afterwarde sent thether entent case diuines englande wyll aunswer hope agrement communication may make league otherwyse relion man thought expedient also decreed intreate kyng suche persecuted fraunce religion first learne state fraunce howe kynge affected whether maye thought mediation wyll take place dyuerse decree touchynge churche goodes seueral complayntes haylbrune abolyshe popyshe masse remayned yet certen church fynally determine nedefuull done case emperour eyther refuse peace aunswere doubtfully chamber procede olde maner power reised vp pryuelye whilest thynges workyng emperour doth great great execution done gaunt execution gaunt making chiefest rebelles hoppe headles taketh away armure weapon priuileges commodity buyldeth castell placeth garnison neckes citie euer wonte rebell theyr prince haue also declared parte played charles burgundy emperours great graundfather phylip father lewys erle flaunders great grandfather philippe mothersyde whiche emperour semeth haue reuenged neuer subdued thys tyme eyghtenthe daye apryll emperoure addressed hys letter duke saxony lantgraue howe hathe emp letter prootestat talked wyth hys brother ferdinando kynge romaynes amonges thynges state germanye especiallye dissention religion whiche woulde fayne appeased lyke tofore hathe omytted nothynge herein nowe also mynde styll wyll acknoweledge zeale abuse desyre peace whiche haue longe synce pretended wordes promyses wyll nowe perfourme deed hath vsed many yeares nowe sondrye getle meanes treaty hathe priuayled hetherto nowe matter come poynte vnlesse shortlye remedied wil followe great dissolutio comon welth maruelous sturre state although yet benigne gentlenes appointeth againe assemblie spyres syxte daye iune perchaunce plage infection sickenes wyll permitte suche place brother ferdinando shal appointe deuise meanes great daunger hanged ouer germany may auoyded willing ther present selues daye assigned lettes set aparte vnlesse syckenes sende chief counsellours suche louers peace mete treatie priuie doings signifie fellowes entent daye thether shall come brother ferdinado declare mynde wyll theyr ambassade sent vnto hym frame selues preseruation selues countrey dissention beyng taken awaye may muche better consult affayres empyre cause feare daunger wylassure vpon fidelitie graunteth benefite peace norrinberge wyll suffer man doe yet agayne doe offende man unto whiche letter aunswered xv day answer prot emp letter may followeth counselles peace geue hym harty thankes admonyshed shuld acknowledge studious desyre abuse cause saye thinke otherwyse cofederates league frendes nothing derely beloued peace matter hath ben agreed vpo hetherto ought imputed vnto greatnes cause aduersaries whiche coulde abyde declaration doctrine nowe would haue presente daye appointed wyl gladly obeye howe beit woulde kynge shoulde trauell vayne wyll shewe fantasye vnknowen hyghnes euersynce fyrste beginning controuersie muche delyberation assembly empire waye semed beste vnto al men eyther lawefull counsell myght el prouinciall synode germany sythe shortnes tyme semed litle purpose deuysed franckefurte haue communication matter decree made seynge matter weightie wherein saluation man cosisteth shortly determined purposely done therfore troublesome paynfull kyng ferdinando also others traue suche matter fore communication waye prepared wherfore whiche pleased men franckefurte semeth nowe best vnto also case conuocation germany communication myght appointed iudgement better way founde declared also late counte nuenar wherein truste holy scripture euen commaundement shall occupie chief place whan aduersaries shall swarue maye called agayne waye albeit maye go thether without makinge fellowes priuie tyme shorte assemble yet whan thing shalbe comenced shalbe hope good wyll let come thether persone requiring hym would graunte saue conduicte whiche promysed onlye ambassadours deuines also muche shal haue moste doe matter laste desyre vnderstande pleasure herein tolde cardinall farnesius went emperour paris flaunders scarsely yet come man state muche emperour toke euill part byshop sent man rype yeares counsell tyme therfore consulte religion turkish oratie yeug cardinall warre granuellan spoken mynde laste young cardinall presence emperour king ferdinando said fantasie inueighing chiefly againste lutherianes throughout whole oration amonges many thinges sayd could well discerued whether christe protestantes turkes one shewe crueltie onlye prote turkes body others drawe soules also euerlasting perdition farnesius ioyned hym marcellus ceruinus byshop nicastre gouernour counselles legacie made cardinall oration farnesius coming abroade fewe monethes set forth prynte iohn caluine made comentary leste man mistake tyme duke cleaue came emperour point possession gelderlande woulde therfore returnyng home agayne began consulte frenche kynge whan hope recouer millan emperour offering hym suche condicions woulde lyttle haue priuy hatred yt fre che kynge emperour thought tourned mynde wholly frendshyp yet couertly complayned farre abused began mislyke constable whiche put hym great hope cause emperour passed fraunce could neuer abyde hym thynges therfore sought meanes priuelye howe moleste emperour duke cleaue able susteyne great sute displeasure alone beganne entre mutuall bandes amitie frenche kyng nece lady iane daughter syster margarete quene nauarre eleuen yeares age greatest inheriter fraunce excellent beaultie well brought vp vnto whose frendes kyng made sute especially quene sister myght maried duke cleaue brought duke cleaue ioyned frenche kynge passe shalbe recited place tyme dyd byshop rome warre vpon perusians refused pay certen custome salte thynges reysed vpon brought citie vnder iurisdiction like cause expulsed ascanius man great power house columnois pope warreth vpo ye perusias dominion cardinall farnesius hauing done commission seyng peace take effecte betwixt emperour frenche kyng also vnknowen hym daye assigned hagenaw protestauntes decide cause departed flauders came paris ides may feaste pentecoste cathedral churche consecrated anthony uncle madame destampes kynges darlinge cardinall medone setting vpon head purple hatte latelye brought rome salutyng kyng waye goeth great spede rome afterwarde kyng ferdinando toke iourney brusselles goe assemblie hagenaw could holden spyres reason plague unto assemblie fre che kyng also sente lazarus baysius aduyse emperour eyther dissembled theyr grief matter hetherto handled flatteryng wordes first daye iune kyng fraunce set forth sore proclamation sower abroade heresie false doctrine luther companion twelfthe daye imprinted proclaimed paris aboute tyme kynge englande beheaded lorde cromwell whome lowe degree auaunced hyghe dignitie lorde crumwell beheaded little made erle essex forsaketh lady anne cleaue marrieth catherine hawarde nece duke norfolke lord cromwell maker marriage house cleaue kynge loued hawarde kynge marieth katherine hawarde thought perswaded hir cromwel iudged lette vnto matter might dispatched waye man also wellbeloued nobilitie suspected though seke distruction papistes meane tyme duke brunswicke accused moste heinously boeth protestantes chiefly henry duke saxony duke bruswik accused protestaun contrary wyl brother george condition expressed testament altered state religion molesteth byshoppes merseburge misene iurisdiction kept hym selfe money brother lefte vse league lx thousande crownes wherfore admonyshed emperour compell hym doe dutie whiche shall refuse dispossesse hym inheritaunce fourme wyll wrought alone albeit principal certen others also confederacie nowe wyll speake assemblie hagenaw whiche began fyue twenty daye iune kynge ferdinando assemble hagenawe come thether moneth fewe dayes comencement protestauntes spoken palsgraue archebyshops collon treuers ericus duke brunswick byshops ausburge spyres euerye man seuerallye owne house would entreate peace ferdinando therfore forsayde daye callyng protestauntes hym declareth vnto cause assemblye prynces came selues whiche emperour thought verely woulde haue done wylleth commission aucthoritie nameth intercessours lewys paulsgraue iohn archebyshop treuers lewys duke bauier william byshop strasborough contente beganne treaty thether came also diuines protestantes great number iustus menius pistorius urbanus regius bucer brentius blanrer osiander shirepsius many others melanchtho fell sore sycke waye preached home euery man company chiefly tyme al ambassadours mette together consulte vpon matter ferdinando whan vnderstoode forbade ambassadours agayne shewed hym howe preachyngs forbydden preached openly priuatly neyther anye cause offended duke saxon lantgraue come case talke gone forwarde taried vpon frotiers entent hearing newes therof might haue bene intercessours requyre protestates deliuer brief somme article controuersy say exhibite somme confession doctrine ten yeares synce auspurge apologie whiche sticke vnto none beyng ready make aunswere man fynde lacke therin knowe thynge chiefly aduersaries reprehende therin haue nothyng exhibyte rather requyred hades shewe suppose contrary god worde whiche doe matter come disputation thoughte mete franckefurte wyll cocorde shew againe within fewe dayes forasmuche dwel styll confession exhibited auspurge doe fynde readinge treaty certen thinges brought conciliation certen nowe reste also myght come reconcilement wyll doe endeuours desyre vtter myndes herein protestauntes agayne saye dede talke certen article nothyng concluded anye agrement al made thus matter debated fro protestauntes requyred myght come disputation againe sayd howe comaunded king emperour procede accordinge treaty auspurge kyng ferdinando xvi daye iuly callyng al ferdinados request hym forasmuche sayth matter standeth thus nothyng nowe determined chiefly absence duke saxo latgraue day must appointed wher ambassadours learned men partes shall mete lyke number conferre article professed auspurge longe controuersie betwyxt kyng protestauntes peace confederatours restitution churche goodes iudges chamber ferdinando xxviij daye iuly maketh decree reciting whole matter decree hagenaw appoynted day comunication wormes xxviij daye october vpon condicion emperour content prynces electours duke bauier duke cleaue byshoppes madenburge salisburge strasburge commaunded sende thether counsellours protestauntes also eleuen eyther part also many scribe wryte diligently euery man sayeth conference protestantes doctrine professed auspurge request made emperour wyll call counsell empyre meane tyme commaundeth men obserue peace abstayne violence vnder great penaltie appointed emperours commaundemet prynces mentioned assemblie christopher byshop trent henry duke bruswycke went home matter ended greatest peace maker assemblie byshop collon paulsgraue electours also byshop auspurge reste extreme agaynst protestauntes duryng assemblie died iohn uaiuode kyng hogary leauing death iohn uayuode king hungary behinde hym younge sonne stephen whome isabell daughter sigismunde kyng pole borne hym lytle whiche cause also kyng ferdinado beyng aduertysed therof letter hasted homewarde time also certen townes village protestantes set fyre saxony aboutes burnt vp cleane wicked acte sayde done duke brunswyck fyres saxony shalbe declared hereafter seconde kalendes iuly robert barnes doctour diuinitie brent london smithfield certen tyme fled englande doctrine doctor berne burnt smithfielde gospell tyme vnderstode howe kynge henry gaue mynde knowledge truthe retourned home agayn ambassade sent germany one whiche treated diuines witteberge touching kinges diuorsement wrytten tenth boke kyng exiled name byshop rome kept styl doctrine man whiche loued truthe chieflye meanes byshop wynchester daye executed protested hys fayth openly place execution hym also thre prot burnt thre papistes hanged one tyme brent two others religion daye selfe place three others hanged vpon gallowes helde supremacie byshop rome yt neyther rake papist ernest protestauntes escaped punishement moneth august ended lyfe paris willia budey maister requestes man great learning worthy perpetuall memory death budey cause cardinal bellaye byshop paris counsell perswade fraunces frenche kyng moste noble acte appoint great stipendes reader tongue good artes paris welspryng beleue clere plentiful ryuers flowe fraunce also countreis lyke hath henry eight done englande cambridge oxforde buden would buried without solemnitie yeare notable reason intollerable heate drought also excellent good wyne erceadig hote somer meane tyme kyng fraunce dispatchyng abroade letter byshoppes commaunded go procession place albeit peace emperour whiche would willingly breake yet feared greatly leste olde enemye mankynde would styre vp warre minister euer longe emperour aduertised letter brother ferdinando intercessours whole matter cofirmeth decree hagenawe wryting letter utrecht ides august exhorteth protestauntes sende ambassadours diuines wormes daye assigned sendeth saufe conduicte affayres hym selfe sayeth wyll sende thether notable man doubteth byshop wyl sende thether also quiet cotrouersy promiseth moreouer assemblie thempire whither come parson vnto assemblie also summe talke must referred afterwardes ides octob letter dated brussels maketh granvellan deputie giuing full authoritie communication time granvella bizanse highe burgundie towne borne beynge occupied affayres coulde come thither day writyng letter archebishop mentz residew prince appointed talke seconde daye nouembre sendeth iohn nauie lucemburge excuse hys longe tariyng wronge oute mathew helde said called forth man obsequious agreable maners placed rome meane time themperour nauius hath place heldus calleth counsell thempire moneth ianuary al ready regenspurge whan granvellan selfe came wormes accompanied sonne bishoppe arras certen diuines spaine muscosa maluenda carrobello shewing fyrste commission emperours letter xxv daye nouembre made oration excusynge matter neither themperour king ferdinando declareth oratio granvellan wor louing frendly minde themperour beareth common wealth wisheth nothing earnestly olde feastred strife might taken awaye wherewith onely church also common wealth sore afflicted doubteth selues see present calamitie wil iudge reformation churche necessary therfore nothing concerne dewties throughe godly counsel remedy euill spread abrode like case part good citezins quenche fyre happeneth casualtie must worlde case peace concorde may restored furthermore let wet selues set eies heape euilles haue throughe dissention ouerflowed germany passe ouer murther mischief religion destroyed charitie men herts euils cometh discention religion cleane quenched reuerence olde catholike churche taken away finally great misery sufficientlye expressed man eloquence time past germany hath florished relion kinde vertu nowe hath muche degenerated accompted cause author discommodities vniuersall commune weale vnlesse remedye found disease thinges go ruine asmuche themperor hathe appoynted thys disputation thentente bothe truth myght searched god glory auaunced must bring mynd neyther ambitious couetous godly moderat hauing regarde vnto chryst armes stretched foorthe wold imbrace desyreth menne also wish high bishop themperour august king ferdinando therfore besecheth death christ loues woulde amende oure lordes coate rent torne euery syde remembryng name christ geuen holy baptisme remembring also noble prouince germany natife countrey except reconsyled ascribed vnto mischiefe euer shall arryse hereafter theyr obstioate mynde yf wyll handle weyghty matter modestie sobrietie shalbe bothe god acceptable themperour also accepte steade greate benefyte wyll afterward endeuour nexte assemblie thempire matter shalbe wholy accomplisshed death uayuod tutours rest noble sent ambassadours turke commend childe vnto turke receiueth infant uayuode hym promiseth defend sendeth hym giftes fernando also knew therof sedeth hierosme lascie certen yeres past forsaken uaynode hagenaw constantinople fit man myght appease turke whe came home thought best make warre quene beyng wydow tutours infante furnished knowen turke throweth hys ambassadoure pryson moste priuie farnando counsel also sendeth ayde withstanding lascus committed prised letted reason winter came somwhat late nexte daye granuellan hys oration beegan deuyse notaryes scribe eyther syde chosen two whyche shoulde penne kepe althynges diligentelye protestantes assygned caspar cruciger woolfangus musculus diuines eyght daye yf december thomas campegius bisshop feltre roomisshe legate oration preface wherof speakyng many thynges concernyng peace whych greately commended vnto v chryst lamentyng also state germany affyrmeth serten bisshops rome especially paule thyrde haue done put calamitie cause late called counsell uicence certen monethes passed man came constreined differre tyll tyme themperoure whyche eldest obedient childe churche roome protectour also aduocate hathe appoynted conference certen preparatiue treatye shalbe regenspurge whose wyll assent byshops comaundement coomen thither intreat would applye theyr whole endeuours vnitie concorde sertaynly bishop rome herein sauing holines president assemblie toke order beginning man made priuie theire talke vnlesse nomber appoynted actes therof bee published till themperoure wer first aduertised together moreouer required protestantes would comprise exhibite wryting article wer fully resolued sticke vnto matter maner othe nober also disputers geuing voyces longe altercation catholickes perceyued counsellours paulsgraue marque bradenburg electours also duke cleaue inclined towardes protestant fearing lest shoulde ouer coomen voice set pourpose differred matter day day tyll tyme worde themperour papist seke delayes herafter shall declare second daye ianuary doe propounde new straunge condicyons whole nomber ther chose two diuines reason matter scribe wryte theyr argumentes delyuer presydentes lesse parte shoulde bee bounden followe opinion greater vnlesse themperoure state thempyre shoulde thynke expediente notaryes shoulde write talke reasoner bare sentence whether wer agreed vpon left controuersie decree auspurge lyke shoulde neuertheles force protestantes agayn require forasmuche ther bee xxii bothe partes appoynted conferre euery man mighte speake hys mynde bare sentence also argumentes reason probation committed wrytyng declare also vnreasonable holy cause al others follow opinion part rather prescripte god worde compell man shoulde eyther thynke speake whilest time thus prolonged protestantes oftetimes coplain thereof desire disputation doctrine propounded auspurge may accordinge decree hagenawe forthewith commenced especially consyderyng frendly disceptation captious thentent certen way vnto concorde might prepared diuines also many required melancthon capito bucer osiander brentius caluine alesius scot sent thither marque brandenburge diuers others vnto wer annexed symon grineus iohn sturmius last aboute ides ianuary catholickes choose iohn eekius thothers melancthon dispute together disputation betwixte eekius melancton first thentent might procede order reason originall synne course open consistory beholde thirde day disputation began themperours letter wer brought granuellan rest ambassadours wherin differreth whole matter vntill assemble regenspurge commaunding chiefly protestantes come thither granuellan repare vnto hym syede letter beyng red consistorie xviii daye ianuary granuellan exhorteth obey themperoure come vnto regenspurge desyrous peace yf self occasion talke hath spoken thyng roughly desyreth take euell part promiseth beare hys good wyll towards publyke weale whereunto protestantes say ryght sory disputation bego great whyle souner canot procede therin asmuch themperour doeth commaund must obey wherfore wyll retourn home declare howe thinges stande doubte prince city gratifye perour herin notwithstandyng case longe euer come sende ar holden excused reason time shorte thys assemble also peter paul uerger bishop iustinople worde frenche kyng sent dede bishop oratio uergerivs roome supposed myght serue hys tourne better beynge another man name made oration vnitie peace churche settyng foorthe prynte gaue dyuers wherein goeth chiefly proue maye one thynke vpon counsell prouinciall assembly dyd represente certen shew lyke thyng semed prepare waye byshop coulde abyde nothynge worse uergerius knewe hys mynde full well hym therefore suche others bisshops minister thynge letted lengthe dyssolued tractyng tyme fyndyng delayes seeke startyng holles wayes escape begynnyng ianuary themperoure takyng hys iorney brussels came vnto mentz head citie lorayne thence spire goeth regenspurge way sent sayd letter grauella traueled norinberge whiche citie sene receyued moste sumptuous preparation eleuenth day februarye philyp schabotte admirall fraunce man great honour beyng brought suspicion kynge acquitinge himselfe admiral frauce condemned warre sauoye beefore mentyoned longe mooche inquisityon hys demeanoure condemned extortyon treason depriued al honour dignity ample without hope restitution committed prison uincen farre fro paris william poiet chaucelor frauce gaue sentence mellon iudgement notable men iudges lawe fraunce albeit sentence geuen sort wont euer dissolued altered yet kynges authoritie longe cleane released ye shall heare afterwardes time also maurice son henry duke saxonie maried agnes daughter lantzgraue moneth marche diuers prince state resorted greate assemble regespurg regenspurge themperor taried certen space thither came also lantzgraue great company almost atthende marche nexte daye wente themperor garde receiued right gentlye duke saxonie sent thither honorable ambassador diuines among melanchton bishoppe rome also came caspar contarene right famous cardinall present prince elector brandenburg friderick otto henry paulsegraues william lewis duke bauier henry duke brunswike charles duke sauoie george marque brandenburge philip duke pomerane moreouer bishop mentz salisburg breme bamberg spire auspurge eistet constance luther boke agaist duke brunswick hildessene brixie passaw aboute time came forth brought regenspurge boke martin luther vehement written vulgare tounge duke brunswycke last boke metioned duke inuectiues duke saxon lantzgraue booke set forth late called duke saxo heretike rebel cain monster eesope hauing nether vertu qualitie body yet mind luther also selfe maketh god doth laughe contemne luther thinking concerne estemation answereth sharpely saieth sclaunder asmuch aduersaryes take vpon title churche diuers sundry argumentes brought proueth haue cleane forsaken trew church comparison made sheweth bishoprike rome hathe altogether defyled corrupted trew doctryne chryst antechrist manye yeares synce daniell apostle haue prophecyed obiecteth vnto flye lyght though speake muche lawfull counsell yet dare abyde yf youre church holy sayth afearde counsell nedeth reformation yf nedeth cal ye holy ye also redresse youre holynes neuer desyred counsell refourme churche god hathe already sanctified worde pourged romishe fylthynes restored trew doctrine howbeit life doeth answere profession neither perfourme dede muche bounden wishe also complaint prophetes apostle whilest liued felicitie shal happen vnto v timr deliuered synfull body prison shall obtaine like condition wt angel desyre counsell thentet church might openly protest desyre counsell heard doctrine contrary doctrine christe might condemned men beyng called agayne mighte knowe folow trewe religion christ nowe ye obiecte vntd v rebellio disobedience false euen testimonie state imperiall know prince obeidient themperour thinges beyng called assemblie go warfare haue bene euermore ready ye raile thus v obey theperours decres condene doctrin glad geue god thankes shewing obeidience way thing dew vnto god ought giuen themperor god client god hath giuen gouernement themperor god client ouer realmes nation alone gouerne church worde neyther doeth admit man societie honor themperor hath ynough concernyng thadministration common weale vnto office hath god appointed prescribed limites procede doeth inuade vsurpe vpon god iurisdiction duke brunswike written inuectiues amonges thinges luther reised vp tragedye religion motion duke friderik enuy albert arch bishop mentz bishoprike madenburge wherunto luther answerynge sclaunder saieth commeth duke brunswicke suggestion mentz dissembleth know whan knoweth best shall declare cause original al busines seuenteth yere grace aboue thousande moued luth writ papistes fyue hundreth iohn tecell dominicke frere caried pardon sell germany tecel themperor maximilia condemned die commaunded drowned riuer inspruck intercession duke friderick whose chaunce time escaped daunger say amonges thinges taught howe great authoritie yt bishop rome yt although deflowred yt virgin mary gotte hir wt child power forgeue hi money moreouer onely forgeue synnes past also euer man listed commit herafter within came blasphemie frere tecell forth boke armes title bishop albert wherein pardoner wer comaunded diligently setforth people vertu iudulgences wherfore knowen tecell hired said bishoppe make outrageous sermon albert lately created archbishop mentz vpon condicion shoulde redeme palle rome owne costes costly stole palle charge thre bishoppes citie wer deceased within short space bertolde iames uriell ouer chargeable colledge beare great burthen often time palle stoode good xxx thousande crownes euer came home dere coulde bishoppe rome sell sory piece clothe money marchantes auspurge disbursed meane get money pardon wherfore pay albert deuised kinde gaine bishop graunt yet one halfe shold brought rome buildyng peter church time knew none gere therfore wrot bishoppe mentz humble wyse exhorting woulde inhibite crier answered one worde bishoppe brandenburge beyng also moued admonished cease bring selfe danger propounded certen theames contrary tecels within fewe dayes caried ouer germany gredely red many men complained pardon especially tecell taught neuer bishoppe yet doctor durst gainesay tecel feared men bishoppes thunderbolt name began spoken founde one length worlde resist vaine glory verye pleasaunte scarsely vnderstode name indulgence met fyrst originall cause motion whiche came duke friderick proceded bishop mentz practise collector briber frere tecell wherfore anye thing nowe nippeth let thanke himselfe therfore cause trouble gaue moste holye father leo tenth time cursed excommunicated manye place triumphe ouer neyther anye man vnlearned luther cursed pope practise style write thought assuredly fyrst bishoppe would assoile condemne tecell canon lawe maketh whiche teacheth plainely iudulgences deliuer soules purgatory lo whilest loke ioyfull sentence rome striken thonderbolt condemned wicked aliue began defende doynges settinge forth many bokes insomuche matter brought laste assemblie thempire thus wollen threde wherof palle made breede matter contention nowe fast wolle halter strangle pope wrought suche strength bishoppe rome dau ger strangled withall seyng let impute fault selues impudently excessiuely handled matter maye well laughe sleue dwelleth heauen hath strike would suffer great wickednes raigne longer hath brought people yt darkenes egipte cleare light pleasant syght sonne palle often mentioned geuen onely archbishop syngular benefite fewe bishoppes whiche numbre bishop bamberge germany one made thys maner makynge palle ceremonie feast agnes uirgyn whiche xxi day ianuary time come agnus dei messe two white lambes laide vpon aultar afterwarde deliuered subdeacon peter churche put forth pasture whan shering time commeth clippe woll mingled woll whan sponne fine threde made palles past three finger brode hange downe shoulder midde breast reines backe like stoale eche ende thinne plat leade breadth beyng thus wouen wrought caried body peter paule certen prayer beyng said ouer left al night next day subdeacon receaue againe keps diligently vntil time archbishoppe hathe nede one proctor sue deliuered many ceremony haue cariage therof inioyned remaine aboue one night place ware whiche neither costely curiouslye wrought archebishoppes redeme bishoppe rome wonderfull money lawefull weare predecessor euery one bounden purchase newe selfe rome againe case become patriache metropolitan another churche throughe promutation meane althoughe bought one yet must necessitie bie another againe suche kinde pillage greate complaintes complaint pillage haue bene often made nation shewed fourth boke chiefly germany yeare lorde thousande fyue hundreth xviii tyme leo tenth assemblie auspurge cardinall caietan exhorted maximilian prince turkish war went state pay money cleargye theyr partes tenthes answer made yt hope obteine thecclesiasticall person manye way newe policy pilled poled courte rome people anye thinge shoulde imposed woulde make great exclamation haue oft geuen theyr money thys fyeres set duke bru swike purpose maruell consumed whither money goeth gathered yearly germany tolde sundry fyers kindled late saxonie whan diuerse malefactours apprehended taken sundry place examination testified howe hired money captaines officer henry duke brunswike set affirmed last breth cause therefore matter lantzgraue thambassadours saxonie accuse duke brunswicke emperor regenspurge exhibite writyng seuerall confession euery one make fyers ioinetly william brunswik accuse brother henry sore kept many yeares pryson whan part commen together began sit fyft day aprill theperours name maner propounded trauaile paine alwayes take treatie regenspurge publike weale might well established longe discourse done aswell appeasynge controuersye religion reformation churche also defence thempyre cruell inuasions turkes fine themperor demaunded chiefly protestauntes would geue leaue chose certeine conferre herein trust nothing shall concerne preseruation countrey whan graunted xiij day aprill appointeth friderike paulsgraue thys chosen themp talke iulius pflugius iohn eckius iohn gropper philippe lanchton martin bucer iohn pistor treate oppinions controuersie make reporte bringe prince againe two twentie daye aprill calleth vnto gyueth great charge handling matter giue nothing affection pertialitie set apart onely haue respecte vnto god glory full modestly excuse themselues require al mete might appointed sauing eckius said rashnes eckius well prepared fournished themperor dyd instant take vpon content also intreate would assigne presidentes disputation others bee witness hearer matter commaundeth fridericke palatine granuellan bee governours willeth theodorycke countie manderschit eberhart ruden henry hasie fraunces burcarte iohn figius iames sturmins beare witnes came together xxvii day april fridericke palsgraue admonisheth collocutours seriously go matter conferre together frendly granuellan exhibiteth booke written boke presented collocutours sayd delyuered themperour certayne good well learned men fit reconcilement themperour woulde thentent might haue lawful argument matter treat shoulde reade ouer booke also waye looke shoulde allow therein commende contets boke rest correcte booke contayned article following creation man fall integritie nature freewill cause synne originall synne iustification man church token authoritie notise woorde repentaunce fal authoritie churche discerning interpretyng scripture sacramentes order baptesme confirmyng lordes supper penaunce absolution matrimony vnction bond charitie dignitie churche authoritie establishe weale publicke image masse ministration sacramentes discipline churche bothe minister people protestantes letter frech king suche wer persecuted gospell moneth may protestantes wryting letter fro regenspurg frenche kynge entreate tyme fraunce profession gospell wer partly prison partly exile partly hyd corner led miserable lyfe many receyued fauour incase woulde abiure require woulde release condicyon declarynge howe heynous matrer wounde conscience cause thys persecution sentence geuen agaynst merindolans prouince president bartholomew chassanie lawyer beyng terrible cruell beyonde measure put poore men wonderful feare withstanding full execution therof differred tyll tyme persecution thys yere balle playe comparison whiche followed foure yeares shalbe recited hys place whylest thynges done regenspurge duke cleaue hauing themperour hys heuye duke cleaue goeth priuely fraunce lorde possession gelderlande goeth priuely fraunce appoynting would haue hym day place wher going way mete hym tyme therfore arryued paris aboute thende aprill receiued kynges officer conducted throughe orleans sixte daye maye came kyng ambose towne turin riuer loire imbracing none otherwise father would owne sonne sent word immediatly kyng nauarre hys syster shoulde repayre vnto hym expedition brynge theyr daughter wer time gascoigne wer coommen kyng began entreate maryage albeit parentes greatly lyke yonge mayde also somewhat vnwyllyng somoch owne iudgement contempte hym whispering perswasyon sertayne whych dispysed germanye rude barren comparison delycacye pleasauntenes fraunce yet vanquished kynges authoritye whiche iudged affinitie fit hys pourpose last gaue place wherfore ides iune maryage solemnised kynge hymselfe duke marieth daughter nauarre leadyng bryde hys nece churche cardinall turnon played prest kynge gaue goodly dyner ther thambassadours roome englande portugall uenise saxonye themperours made excuse fewe dayes duke retourned homewarde leauing yong spouse fraunce mother woulde haue remayne tyll wer rype yeares man dukeof cleaue came fraunce kyng enlarged admirall spake sent hym home hys owne house moneth may commaunded admirall restored hym come vnto hym receiued gently restored hys former dignitie called wer hel light agayne straung example seldome heard made sentence geuen agaynst hym princypal iudges hys realm cleane frustrate partlye hatred constable thoughte partly requeste madame destamps whych allyed admirall new affinitie therfore memorancie counstable loued thadmirall egall oute constable put courte kynges fauoure themperours passage sayed beyng contempt gotte hym home led priuate lyfe ruled kynge wholye hymselfe alone fourtenth boke sleidanes commentaryes concernyng state relygion common weale duryng reigne empyre charles fyfte argument fourtenth booke processe communication treated order establyshed churche sondry aduyses aunswers bee gathered eckius dispray syng booke presented accuseth hys fellow collocutours themperoure hauing intellygence turkes commyng remitreth thys colloquie counsel fregose rincon thambassadours french kynge greate turke taken slayne wherupon bastarde maximilyan arested turke taketh possession cytie buda theperoure arryueth argiers plage germany great calamity austriche supplication prince austriche kynge ferdinando myght haue gospell wherunto aunswereth ouerthrowe hongary assemblye holden spire oliuier beeing french kynge made longe oration cardinall maron pope ambassadour offereth counsell trcent luther wryteth booke intitled sermon soldiours comparyng papistry turkes alcorane warre beyng proclaymed betwene frenche kyng emperour marten van rossem inuadeth brabante decrces made fraunce agaynste lutheranes farell preacheth mentz aboute ende aprill disputation colloquie lerned men regtnspurg began shewed yon eckius vnpatient froward abhorred booke mislyked hys fellowes lyttell fell agewe coulde bee yet went fellowes conferred hym al thynges certen place boke exhibited throughe conference amended common assent coulde agree churche authoritie therof sacrament body bloud chryst recytall synnes satisfaction vnitie order thecclesiastical minister sainctes masse vse whole sacramente single lyfe booke deliuered vp themperoure corrected diuines protestantes written theyr mindes vpon forsayd opinion leafte controuersy last maye themperoure commendeth theyr good endeuour lyketh well incase matter herafter require exhorteth shew like goodwill dilygence eyght day iune consistorie prince state maketh relation hathe ben done howe farre haue proceded howe collocutours haue handled matter dilygentely haue reconcyled dyuerse weyghty article doctryne touching rest yet agreed vpon diuines protestantes haue opened theyre myndes exibiteth vnto ether boothe wrytinges requiring shortly may bee woulde consulte thervpon vtter theyr mindes either moreouer would consyder howe state weale publike well ciuile ecclesiasticall maye ought reformed hys parte leaue nothyng vndone herein doubtyng bishop legate also inclyned senate prince consisteth moste parte bisshops therefore nomber preuayled whyche worse parte ouer cometh nomber voyces bothe reiected booke exibited themperoure also whole treaty collocutours reason therof coprised writing somewhat extremely tyme electours certain prynces loued common wealth would assent therto another wryting framed delyuered themperoure second day iuly wherin doo admonyshe hym advocate defendour churche doe communicate whole matter bysshops legate accordyng decree hagenaw especially article collocutours haue agreed vpon bee wayghed dilligentlye whether bee anye thynge eyther sence woordes agaynst doctryne godly exposytours also custom church moreouer incase thyng darkely spoken may declared done hymself make reporte state opinion mynde touching wold hande protestantes woulde contented instructed resydewe article controuersie yf obtayned matter referred either generall counsell el prouinciall sinode germanye amonges state wer sertayne hyndred reformation relygion thought motion whole treaty referred bisshops legate themperoure aunswered vii day iuly supposed collocutours wold haue vttered theyr myndes playnly especially consyderyng booke long asmoche stick herein wyll follow theyr counsell know legate mynd euery poynte thentent omit nothynge conserneth hys dewtie protestantes also declare vnto themperour wryting theyr mynde open full doctryne reconsyled shew harde accord reste lyke case saie kepe selues confession auspurge touching third request emperour cocerning ciuil gouernment meanes restore thecclesiasticall function comen wealth say howe lawes yt made xi yere since auspurge must put vre execution shew thecclesiastical function may restored gospel taught sincerely according aunciet lawes minister church may chosen cosent people bishop doe retaine styll hades ciuile ministration asmuch old custome selues neither wil appoint others execute spiritual office finde reuenewes minister churche may frely permitted mary yt foule bying sellyng whiche sondry sortes simon magus called simony may vtterly taken away goodes may distributed simon must take awaye law made long since prescribe chyldre brought vp invertue yougth learne first principle christia doctrine notable offedours expulsed ye comunio church til come amedement magistrate duty herein abolishe al idolatrie thecclesiastical iudgemetes might censours maisters maners apointed enquire diligetli behauiour minister people faultes vice themperour told doth comunicate whole matter bishop legate nd requireth instantly state comon wealth chiefly church myght refourmed pope legate wherunto legate answered muche protestates certen opinion swarue comon consent churche yet hope fine wil come way againe diligent cosideration whole cause thinketh mete determinatio made touching matter whole treaty referred byshop assuredly wyl either generall counsell meane fitte tyme deuyse thing controuersie shal profit whole common wealth chiefly germanye afterwarde intent might seme desirous refourmation calleth home hym al byshops geueth lesson demeane selues al thing gouerne family haue care flock comitted charge beware errours appoint learned preacher resiste bestow benefice vpon mete persones ought imploy churche goodes vse poore spende riot superfluous vse howe se yougth brought vp good litterature knowledge diligence protestantes iu teaching child tongue thing protestantes exceadingly yt meanes allure yougth vnto infecte doctrine dutie bishop warne paretes yt thei sede child suche place daunger heresie diuers lyke thinges delyuered wryting bysshops desyred also themperoure xii day iuly reporteth state aunswere made cause appeareth nomore determined asse bly concernynge relygion turke maketh great preparation sea lande inuade christendome thinketh chieflly requisite treaty brought ende decree bee made concernyng religion peace ayde turke wherfore requireth know theyr mindes whether thinke expedient article doctrine collocutours haue accorded shalbe receyued till generall imperyall counsel thentent controuersy religion whiche haue many yeares bene tourmoyled may somewhat abated residue yet agreed vpon may hereafter easelye brought vniformitie wyll go streight way byshop may certenly knowe trust shortly wyll retourne germany se common wealth prouided always thinges nothing preiudiciall decree auspurge whan diuines protestantes red two forsayd wrytinges diuines prote aunwer yt popeslegate contarene aunswer one accorde shewe doth wrong say considering learning loked much better thing hande also exhorteth prince punishment crueltie reproue therfore exceadingly byd thinke wil euer allow errours thei nowe condemne time retourne vnto churche whiche defendeth manifest vice whan contarene meane tyme heard aunswere diuersly taken thaduise certen sendeth state third wryting wil assent ye article newly accorded shalbe receiued vntil cousell referreth al thinges general highe byshop next day ides iuly prince electours make prince electours answer themperour answer themperours demaunde saye howe contented article agreed vpo receiued vntil time cou sel expediet auoiding incouenie ce hereafter wilbe also great helpe vnto agrement hope rest myght tyme accorded desire shew fauour herin shortnes time wil suffer yt tha according fre messe wold deuise wt bishop kinges might wt al expeditio cousell appointed couenient place germany either general prouincial wold sende legate thether obteined haue truste shall wold retourne againe germanye declare fidelitie countrie hathe doone hitherto establisshe peace quietnes protestantes desyre themperour wolde commaund article religion al ready accorded enacted taught shal truthe opened shalbe waye amende disease churche also wolde take awaye abrogate decree auspurge vnprofitable concorde lestwyse leaue suspence opinion concernyng counsel wil permit bisshop clietes iudges therof sorte ought haue declared heretofore remayne opinio percase maner counsel wil ther assemblie state germany comaundement wil declare doctrine prince amonges bisshops chief two bretherne duke bauier henry answer popish prince brunswicke declare theyr aduise themperour seuerally many vice sectes heresy dissentions germani also place maner christendo ouerflow could holpen counsell shoulde alteration religion ceremony thai many yeares continewed could nowise geue theire assent especially considering bisshop legate doth promise counsel selfe moue herein presently say determined sticke old religion cou sels doctrine forefather hath continewed apostle tyme vnto day alledgeing moch matter great pourpose thinke expedient differ cause religion vnto counsell especially bisshops legate opinion residew city whyche nomber protestantes collon mentz spier wormes tully hagenaw regenspurg schwinfurth colmaria semund roteburg dyuers others whan excluded cousultation prince wolde geue copie aunswere complayne herof themperoure ofte requestinge myght hindered theyr ryght many content article agreed vpon shoulde receyued whan themperoure hearde men opinion maketh new propositio recytyng euery thyng order whole matter cannot determined certenly stande great daunger turke time farre spente sayeth referre matter couusel wherof bisshops legat hath put vndoubted hope himselfe also hande bisshop promiseth also retourne shortly germany desyreth protestantes wyll meane tyme attempt nothyng el besydes thinges wherin diuines accorded warneth bishpops deuyse bishop inioyned reforme church meanes wherby euery one maye reforme owne church intent ther way prepared comon redresse mind themperoure moste parte al men commended thinke inete bisshops legate geue also ernest streighte charge bishop redresse pourge theyr church protestantes concernyng conciliation doctryne thynges promise according theyr dewtie require may lawful prince ther propounde church article nowe accorded haue hearde eckius presumtuousnes eckius abhorred bothe booke exhibited themperoure also collocutours wherefore conference whan booke agayne restored themperoure matter debated counsel prince lying sick feuer sendeth epistle prince effecte neuer lyked foolyshe booke wherin fyndeth many errours therfore ought admitted custome olde father church layde syde stepes phrasis melanchthon well perceyued moreouer sayeth sawe booke whiche fellowes corrected restored themperoure laye sycke wer red vnto hym certen opinion lutheranes moche lesse allow wrytyng presented themperoure boke neuer saw thing knowne iulius pfiugius iohn gropper whiche thought concerned estimation desyre presidentes hearer conference witness whole matter would defend theyr honestie againste sclaunders eckius informe themperoure matter publicke writing gaue vnto bothe goodly honorable report affirming haue donne herein beco meth honest men mentioned cause religyon referred generall prouinciall counsell germany contarene vnderstoode xxvi day iuly wrote state prince requiryng last might crossed cancelled controuersies religion ought determined suche maner counselles belonge vniuersall churche someuer determined suche case one nation none effect wherfore shall shew greate pleasure bisshop head churche counselles yf dede omitte vnto agayne woulde bee displeasaunte case would styre vp great stryfe offence onlye germany also country doeth admonisshe bothe commaundement bysshoppe also hys owne dewtye day prince make hym aunswere howe bysshop maye auoyde offension case call counsell whyche hathe longe promysed yf state germany bee suche muste necessitie fynd waye salue sore therfore require earnestly wold hys wysdome gentlenes cause byshoppe remedie might founde moreouer diuines protestantes doe confute letter reason protestantes confute letter reason contarene longe wrytyng proue manifestly apperteyneth vnto prouinces establishe god trewe seruice religion done themperour causeth decree made red xxviii iuly referreth conference learned men whole treatie vnto counsell synode germany state imperial hys iorney italy promiseth intreat diligently bisshop roome counsell yf neyther generall prouinciall counsell obtayned wyll call convocation thempyre within xviii monethes quiet cause religion deuyse bifshop shall also sende hys legate thither chargeth protestates attempt new thing besydes article alreadye accorded bisshoppes clense church theyr faultes enormity decree certen article religious house shoulde defaced churche goodes shoulde bee put prophane v man allured contrary religion iurisdiction iudges chamber whiche thinges whan protestant dyd mislyke themperour certen priuate wryting declareth emperours priuat wrytiug protestantes seuerally opinion herin doctrine yet conciliated doth prescribe vnto measure monkes house wold dede bee pulled downe yet mete bee reuoked godly reformation lyke bee thought churche reuenewes man iurisdiction oughte intysed theyr religion bee mayneteyned yet shall bee lawefull receyue come vnto vncalled furthermore decree auspurge concernynge relygion doubtfull cause common quyet suspendeth tyll cause determined eyther counsell assemblie commaundeth shalbe reiected chamber contrarye relygion lawe shalbe ministred vprightly vnto men tyme thynges confyrmed vnder themperours seale promise hym ayde agaynste turke whose commynge bruted daylye ambassadours hongary austryche commen thither greate intreaty required ayde sodayn ayde almaignes sent hongary co duict friderick countie fursteinberg thys assemblie themperoure thirde day iuly al state greuous complaynt wyllyam duke cleaue emperours complaynte duke cleaue possession gelderland exhibiteth also booke vnto wherin declareth hys ryght tytle sayeth willed hym haue ben tooke contrary waye signifyinge couertly fraunce sayd present ambassadours cleaue excused theyr prince proceded declare title themperour xiseth vp departeth xxi day iuly prince state go themperoure intreate prince make intercession duke cleaue duke cleaue request hym wold receyue tuition thempire permit case may decided fredly promise take paynes thynge case cannot make ende beseche hym make clayme recouer right law wherunto themperoure maketh aunswer iohn nauie forasmoche assemblie called common welthes sake thentent dissention discorde taken waye germany myght restored quyetnes herin hath moch tyme ben consumed yet nothyng concluded reason contention diuersitie myndes vnto greate griefe hinderance hys owne affaire sayeth marueleth greatly cause properly hys wel agree thus sendeth awaye withoute displeasure next day raymunde frenche kinges ambassadour longe oration written reciteth oratio frech ambassador cause expulsing charles duke sanoye day accused kinge emperoure al state durynge assemblie frenche kynge sendeth cesar fregose italyan gene anthony rincon spaniarde exiled ambassadours themperour turkes sayling riuer po towards freche ambassador intercepted thimperiall uenise wer taken flayne abont kalendes iuly time william bellaye kynges lyeutenaunt piedmount beynge sertifyed thynge maruelous circumspecte industrious immediatly aduertiseth kyng also fyfte day iuly wryteth turryn alphonsus daualus marque piscare gouernoure millan lumbardie woulde see kynges ambassadours wer taken might restored knewe certentie hys menne apprehended el cause shoulde trewes broken made thre yeares past thintercession bisshop rome required might restored eyther first knewe el dissembling knewe hapned marque maketh straunge though knew nothing matter pourge himselfe sendeth counte frau ce ladron ambassadour kynge langeus certen epistle whych wrote marque eleuenth iuly would doubte sayeth counsell whole worlde speake diuine langens letter alphonse matter aptely euer kinsman auncestre thomas aquyne yf experte diuinitie soom youre familiar perfit priuie murther alphonsus hys graundfather called indicus sonne rodorick spaniard maryed great inheriter house aquinas alphonsus cosyn germane fernando dauall piscare worthye captayne xx day iuly king answereth alphonce letter liner towne burges admonisshing hym regarde hys honour estimation sheweth hym vnles restored neglect iniury done hys men many wer letter sent fro betwene bellaye marque matter nothyng el done whan daualus moche searche sayd could fynd nothing herin perseuered king moreouer ambassadour complayned themperour regenspurge whan receyued suche aunswer wolde declared manifestly enough warre wold insue therof chaunced time george austriche maximilian bastarde son archebishop ualencene came spain george austriche apprehended lyon retourne flaunders lyon apprehended cast prison reueng rincon fregose aboute tyme frau ce son anthony duke lorayne maryeth christine daughter christierne kynge denmarke dowager millan frenche kynge tooke thys displeasauntly moche yere daughter lorayne maryed renat prince orenge whiche depended wholy themperoure whattyme themperour helde counsell regenspurg king fernando besegeth offen buda layeth battery wherein ferdinando besegeth buda wydowe iohn uaynode yong sonne stephen infantes tutours noble realme desyred turkes ayde wherfore turke sendeth thither liuetenant armie whyche came offen iuly longe commeth power wer fernando men repulsed almaignes bohemers morauians leuing siege withoute greate ouerthrowe armie discomfited losse also pestum towne ouer agaynste offen residew wer glad saue themselues runnyng away thend august turke sendeth presentes infante stephen cloth golde goodly horse letteth shew hys mother howe desyrous see childe requyring sende hym vnto hym hys tente woman sore affrayd whan might otherwise doe thaduise counsel sendeth hym hys norice accopanyed greate nomber nobilitie receyueth hym right gently sendeth word quenes counsellours woulde haue buda deliuered vnto sayeth able kepe agaynste enemie shoulde driuen come ofte hither armie would painful charg able therfore better custodi affraid owne daunger haue word say forthwith captain ianizarens appoynted enter towne neither could quene receiue thing accomplisshed whan possessio towne vnarmed citezens require also haue ye castell deliuered vp handes wherin quene turke messagers sent betwene comforteth permitteth son enioie tra siluania whan therfore sodely packed vp stuffe departed conducted captaines soldiors ye turkes perour turkes two sonnes came offen second daye septembre entring churche newly hallowed geuing thankes god lucky successe retourneth agayne campe leauing garrison offen peste leadeth home rest armie way deliuereth lascus leaft prisoner belgrade went offen takyng fregose rincon frenche kyng sore offended acte ambassadour poline signifyed whole matter vnto solyman sessians dou regenspurge themperour goth streight italy end talketh bishop rome luke whilest armie toke shipping gathered almaignes italian spaniardes winter hand bishop could put feare sayling although heard ouerthrow geuen ho gary thend might vex turkes quarter fully resolued go foreward wayinge ankers hoysed sayle emperours torney barbarie porte uenery keping course corsicke ilandes baleare xxiii day october arriued argier citie barbarie sea coaste nombre footemen xxii thousande hys horseman littell aboue thousande vantewarde spaniardes led farnando gonzago uiceroye sicilie battel germanes emperour reerewarde italian knyghtes rhodes camillus columnas daye themperoure arriued nexte daye wether fayre sea calme thyrdde great tempest distroyed hys ship daye arrose greate tempeste contynuall rayne letted warlyke enterprise muche emperoure losynge verye manye shyppes hys munition hys fournyture beesydes two three thousande hys menne enforced departe without pourpos length retourned spayn moneth nouember sir henry kneuet ther tyme ambassadour king henry eyght lost syr henry kneuet escaped drowning verye narrowely owne ship ready synke lept receyued vppo oare shippe thomas kneuet kinsman hys recouered shyppe thus affaire sea lande well affrica europe doulfull ende yeare also noysome germany reason contageous sicknes especially aboute rhine amonges others strasburge plage germani rhine died capito basyll symon grineus men excellent learnyng thone great diuine thother philosopher great fauourer scripture themperour departure germany tooke order fridericke palatine shoulde prince electours treate duke cleaue restoring vnto hym gelderlande sende theyr ambassadours admonishe hym boothe hys owne priuate perill also publicke disturbaunce sayeth bothe ryght heyre tooke possession lawfully also content matter tryed law beseching wolde suffer hym susteyne wronge perswade themperours mynde vnto equitie whan themperour imbarked hym selfe italy leaste granuellan sollicite bisshop counsel set order comon weale sene sore tormoyled sedition newes came fraunce december themperours losse argiers ther many merye harte ioye fraunce temperours losse many men stamped murther rincon fregose sayde tyme comen reuenge king fernando euill lucke losse peste offen calleth asseblie hys state prage chief citie boheme laste amonge thynges nobilitie austriche xiii day dece ber putteth vp supplicatio kyng wherin first haue good nobilitie austrich put vp supplication gospell fauoure offer haue maynteine hys prosperous estate dignitie lament vnfortunate state comune weale theyr owne condition whiche haue nere vnto turke cruell enemie also late conquerour wherfore saye howe muste looke remedy chiefly wrath god may appeased offended men synfullnes sendeth great calamitie whole body common welth parte cleane sounde al honeste discipline cast syde aswell priuate common welsprynge enilles yet contempte god worde chiefe cause god doeth scourg plage v seene saye proue othe sacred prophane history god hathe often time greuously plaged great florisshing kingdom lighter sinnes graffed v naturally idolatrie contempt hys word people iewes wer led awaye captiue kingdom distroyed dolatry assiria babilon contemnyng prophetes newe religion worsshipping themselues deuysed length vtterly distroyed hierusalem quite ouerthrowne crucifying sonne god triumphante empire world time past babilon persia grece subdewed turkes haue cleane lost theyr religion lawes como welth theyr dignitie selfe cause day maner toke christianitie remayning wher partly forsoke partlilothed god benefites fel horrible darknes filthy bondage whether sode alteration turkes maintened warre sixe hondreth yeres aboue beefore conquered grece whiche happened lengthe tyme beyng ofte prouoked warned wolde neuer amend heaped vp sinne vpon synne yf man compare kingdomes wer power dignitie wherein florisshed many excellente wittes rude beastly common welth turkes shall fynde syns no floud neuer chaunced greater calamitie yf stronge mightye nation able resiste weake people turkes wer beginnyng god thus auengyng synnes people maye looke dede gyltye fault much worse case matched anenemie strong measure see god doeth plage v chiefly party wyth warre famyne pestilence plage god set austriche germany cruell enemie hathe taken late offen chiefe citie realme hathe brent spoyled land bohema miserie haue suffered sixtene yeres howe moche blod hathe bene spilte many thousand peopele led waye miserable captyuitie certenly turkes power increased far exalted aboue kinges cause obteyneth oure handes maner contynuall victory perceyueth self bee turke scurge god scourge god man able escape vengeaunce seing therfore synnes great many haue truste vnto howe shall defende selues agaynste assuredly one remedy thinges handes god god geueth taketh awaye empire whiche woundeth god offereth word plageth healeth prouoketh v repetaunce offering v knowledg word thing dede doth euer plageth sent ionas prophet niniuites forgaue repeted loked mercyfully vpon nabuchodonosor kyng assirians followyng counsell daniel certenly moste myghty kyng knowe none meane remedye god worde may purely taught people exhorted amendement life entent ful confidence may boldely withstande turkishe violence herein consisteth oure saluation serue god ryghtly wherfore seing manye errours crept churche whiche tyme disclosed lately counsel empyre diverse opinios wer agreed vpon certen tyme peace graunted religion byshop commaunded refonrme church beseche hyghnes geue commaundement gospell preached chiefe article doctrine iustification sincerely especially article iustification whiche teacheth synnes forgeuen christ agayne men excited vnto loue charitable workes whiche true fruictes token fayth moreouer let made afrayd synne accustome selues geue god thakes mere mercy delyuered christ synne death hell made inheritours heauely kingdome desyre may receiue lordes supper maner primatiue church also byshoppes comaunded according decree empyre newly made redresse amisse churche appoincte mete minister instructe people reiecte true preacher haue euer done
