heretofore let grace thinke make sute vnto either seke libertie intende tyme disobey cofesse whole saluation consisteth christe knoweledge gospell must adourned godly liuing acknowledge bounden dutie shewe vnto obedience farre forth goodes lyfe wyll extende seing doe humbly beseche suffer v enioye benefite last decree suche shall followe fourme religion v rehearsed indaungered therfore shal haue faith full minister church whiche nowe many vacant boyde men shall hardines warre moste terrible ennemy vnto whome ingratitude wickednes god hath geuen many victory conquestes hitherto noble state austriche put vp supplication foure twety men honour ten city wherof uienne one next neighbour stirians carnites ferdinando ferdinando desfateth request uobles hetherto aunswered calamity mentioned ryght hartely sory doubteth plage sent synnes people therfore hath oftener admonished minister churche exhorte people amendement lyfe moreouer sayeth howe neuer god worde ryghtly taught according traditio settyng forth apostle interpretours churche hath receiued allowed neuerthelesse chargeth religion alter nothing tyll suche tyme matter fully determined generall prouinciall counsell germany el conuocation empyre thynke decree regenspurge concerned thynge wherof meaning catholickes remayne olde protestauntes religion whiche followed tyme reconcilement tyll one counselles appointed within eightene monethes seing may permitte subiectes thyng contrary desyre againe fewe wordes true religion christe maye auaunced noble resterut te good preacher brought daunger otherwyse let hym neuer loke haue victory lucky successe turkes hande litle dyed bysshop numburge whose steade strife bisshop ricke nu burge college chose iulius pffugius mentioned prince electonr saxon contended myght doe withoute consente reiectyng flugins substituted roume nicolas amstorfe noble house doctour diuinitie wittemberg whome luther stalled moneth ianuary set forthe booke dutche wherin declareth howe flocke christe ought comitted pffugius ennemie pure doctrine pffugius thus repulsed complayneth state empyre howe wrongfully put ryght prynce agayne aunswereth howe gyfte belongeth properlye house saxon reciting many olde presidentes great antiquitie alledgeth amonges cause wherfore suffer bee byshop also one openlye againste confession auspurge ouerthrowe hongary said emperour calleth assemblie state spiers brother ferdinando begynne moneth ianuary appointeth ioyneth assemble spire assistaunce hughe monforte iohn nauie prince presente marque brandenburge electour fredericke palsgraue albert duke megelburge ernest marque baden byshoppes mentz wormes spier constance hildessem residue sent ambassadours tyme assembled nynth daye february kynge ferdinando emperours absence propoundeth maner cause assemblie whiche brief consulte howe turke myght kept hungary ayde touchyng assemblie regenspurge whan iohn gropper ambassadour archebyshop collon retourned home comended gropper co mended bucer bucer exceadingly sayde metest others take hande reformation religion bothe well learned louer peace pure lyfe byshop therfore whiche knewe bucer well enough thought vse helpe sendeth hym february come hym bonna verey gentlye receyued namely gropper intreated hym goe hym collon tyme lycenced bishop departe come agayn whan sent wyll declare hereafter moreouer time also beheaded catharine haward englad king maried mayde founde troden showe wrye defloured gone irelande office beynge called home againe whan quene taken seruice beheaded also certein others partly concealement partly lyke offence deathe kynge king englad maried syxte wyfe marieth syxte wyfe catherine parre bene wyfe lorde latimer syster marque northhamton assemblye spiers frenche kyng sent ambassade chiefe wherof fraunces oliuer chauncelour alenson presence state whan consulted turkyshe warre theioration freche ambessrdour fourtene daye februarye made longe oration begynnyng whereof sekynge wynne theyr fauour reciteth howe yeare kynge vnderstandynge turke woulde inuade hongarye loue bare vnto germanye sent ambassadours immediatly perswade myght cotrary emperours men toke italy yet certeinlye knowen whether theibe dead oraliue wherby truce broken also lawe armes certein encourage germaines warre turke defence ho gary al christientie alledgyng albeit great power perswasios warre turke yet maye ryght well vanquyshed example iohn hunniades matthie kyng hongary scanderbeg lorde epirus tamberlane emperour srythias al whiche haue wonne honour haude also themselues uienne fewe yeares past vse diuerse perswasions pricke forward contrary wyse affirmeth whiche geue counsell doe well consyder state germany howe full dissention daunger warre myght ensue myghtyer crueller ennemye whole worlde one better furnyshed thynges belongynge warres neither warre finyshed one battell two euer requyreth newe freshe men continuall marneylous greate charge force power germany dede exceading great yet turkes ten tymes greater whiche passeth litle losse two thre hondreth thousand men lose one battell daunger whole countrey leuie grudge dissention mindes therfore aduise attepte warre turke neyther seke recouer hath already gotten hongarye feare mischief case tyme inuade germany stande vpon honour bende force stoutely giue repulse otherwyse medle vntill suche time shalbe fully throughly accorded matter religio like case partly already namely chiefest article iustificatio faith workes certenly without perfit cocorde state thempire long endure especially turke stil inuading romains became lordes al world much power force armes certe craft policie policie romaine establishing empire loke natio thei purposed subdue vnto empire thei wold euer practise weaken ciuile discorde time wold maintein thone parte faction till last thei vanquished meane people carthage asia french men grekes supplated thus also germains deluded tiberius time moued war italy britaine englande escaped yoke vnderstode subtill fetch always comon perill powred ciuile hatred vpon ennemy meanes length concord england romains selues subdewed philip also king ye macedonia craft conquered grece setting together theares men athens corinthe thessalie ottoman firste emperour turkishe nation toke bythinia dissentio among christen prince last occasion turke inuaded europe coquered thrace al grece morea yea turkes haue thre hondreth yeres wonne stil discorde treason howe turkes acheued empyre time citie constantinople taken italy ful sedition whilest one sorte wold called gwelphias gibellines whiche name themperial popyshe faction chaunced lately rhodes hongary occasion nede recite thus indede turkes poore vile gwelphias wibellines barbarous nation creping ye corner scithia haue increased dissention atteyned great empire whylest eyther light grekes opened gate europe yt faithles gene haue transported sea helespote prynces peloponesus brother falling variaunce sent one destroye whilest epyrus ayde mysians conspyred hongarians owne accorde dyd moue come therfore mainteine common lybertie must fall vnitie concorde may thynke whylest selues sytte styll doe neglecte beynge denyded sectes faction foreyne nation wyll take car hande sayeth kynges aduyse counsell whiche desyred accepte good parte hym loke amitie frendshyp byshop sente thether legate iohn morone byshop mutma beyng demaunded kyng ferdinando emperours deputy byshop rome opinion pope ambassad mynde xxiij day marche speaketh wyse last yere whan emperour went africa passing italy co ferred hyghe byshop concerninge turkyshe warre generall counsell sythe matter weighty emperour made great haste nothynge determined granuellan remayned italy whome case debated afterwarde declareth howe byshoppes mynde euer hath bene warre vpon turkes wil sende ayde fyue thousande fotemen case emperour come fielde hym selfe halfe nombre lykewyse cotent shalbe counsell holden germany neyther age beare wyll ought present also pope suspecteth germany farre iourney alteration ayre wyll permitte therfore lyketh better mantua farrare bolognia la gras placence whiche ample city fyt suche purpose howe beit none wyll please wyll refuse kepe trent whiche towne nere vnto frontier germany woulde haue begonne whytsontyde shortenes tyme hath differred ides auguste praying al displeasure set aparte woulde wholy applie selues hereunto king ferdinando emperours deputy catholyque prynces geue hym thankes meter place maye germanye regenspurge collon saye howe contente trente protestanntes doe neyther allowe bysshoppes counsell place anye mention made thereof decree openly pronounce contrary whan frenche kynges ambassadours coulde preuayle state inclyned turkyshe warre sawe emperours men lothed suspected presence ende assemblye departe halfe displeasure trent alpes riuer athese towne farnado hys dominion thre dayes iorney syde uenise two uerona chauncelour dutchie alenson retourned home kyng bega streight wayes prepare war albeit already effecte restored admiral vsed hym frendly yet lest herafter preiudicial childre causeth whole matter comprised writing restoreth possession dignitie fame protesteth hee committed neyther treason yet extortion releaseth geueth hym condemnation seuen hondrethe thousande crownes commaunding letter enrolled paris place remayne matter recorde twelfte daye march whan french kynge tyme besydes paris castell uincenne word came ye night sode tumult soden fear frech courte though enemy themperours contrie shoulde make incursion contrie uermandoeis picardie whereuppon prince chaunced time bee sent thither al hast duke uandome guise aumall niuerne diuerse others great nomber gentleman whan came al hushte neyther saw heard man many men sayd thys brute reysed people might perswaded themperour sought warre wherof kinge self wold accopted author whan already vtterly determined shalbe declared herafter forasmuch state germany haue shewed great ayde decreed commaunded army agaynste turke armie leuied ioyned power fernando might resist turkishe force recouer lost leading ordering wherof common assent also themperours pleasure committed charge ioachim marque brandenburge prince electour continently departing spier prepareth selfe iorney war gathered polle money germany graunted magistrate might cause impose taxe agreed moreouer demaund ayd suises prince especially king denmarke italian furthermore decreed obserue peace reise tumult within limites thempire xi day april assemblie dissolued maner time saxonie ther grew greate contention betwixte elector saxon duke moris hatred betwene prince electour duke moris succeded henry father lately departed contention lymites certen towne maurice manifestly mayneteyne cause pflugius suite hys fredes matter vtterly lyke brede ciuile warre eyther vp armure yt mediation ye lautzgraue appeased beginning displeasure betwyxt whiche increased tyme wrought deadlye wounde germanye shalbe recited place certenly many men marueiled maurice would earnest bitter agaynst brought hym vp whome father may thanke theyr good fortune certen cousellers duke george thought haue set forwarde matter whiche neyther loued religion yet prince electour whan decree luther oretion field made men prepared selues warre luther set booke vulgare tongue exhortation warre whiche dedicated vnto philip lantgraue hathe declared cause wrote contrary argument yong day ye warre turkes nothing elles resiste god whiche vseth hym scourge afflicte v whiche sentence leo tenth amonges thynges condempned byshop rome ofte mynded procure masse monie germany vsed euer collour gather turkishe warre shewed reason moued hym amonges others christen man ought reuenge resiste euil suffer thynges according saying christe leauinge thy rote agayne emperour excited vnto warre head christendome protectour churche defendour faithe tytles false vayne glorious iniurious christe allone defende churche iniurie certen kynges prynces moste bytter ennemies true doctrine therfore concludeth turke warred vpon resisted diuersitie religion robbeth spoyleth maketh vniust warr pope pared yt turke bringeth shameful example lyfe coparison made proueth yt byshop rome nothing better tha turke alcorane hath byshop decreetales quenched doctrine gospell whiche doeth force doth byshop curse thei worke reproche vnto matrimony abide punishment contempte god lawe ordeined holy matrimony time god geueth ouer filthy lustes burne detestable desire worke wickedly order nature finally speakig turkish power admonisheth carelesse warfare knowe thei haue moste fierse ennemy diuerse suche lyke thinges treateth first boke time state thepire request thempe king ferdinado decreed war copiled worke said warlike exhortation sermon thentet minister churche followed warres myght haue forme order howe teache exhorte first therfore sayth men may vnderstande thought turke scripture speaketh two houge cruell tyrantes shall destroy christendome two mighty tyrantes laste daye iudgement one false doctrine whome prophecied daniel paule verely byshop rome power force armes saye turke whome daniel seuenth chapter speaketh pleasant lyfe loked therfore wylbe christian let plucke vp harte loke peace quietnes pleasauter life fro henceforth miserable tyme prophecied come let v comforte selues comming christe finall deliueraunce whiche immediatly afflictios shal appeare let v knowe certentie al woodnes malice deuyll powred wholy vpon v turke neuer tyrante practyse suche crueltie doeth expoundeth seuenth chapter daniel whiche foure beastes coming sea declaring turkishe empire described litle horne whiche sprang vp betwene ten horne fourth beast albeit wonderfully increased yet power like romaine empyre prophet doeth describe foure empyres turke shal force romaine succeade order last empyre rome therfore shall none may copared greatnes romayne asmuche daniel attribute vnto three horne whiche plucke ten violence henceforth shall proceade muche three plucked long synce asia grece egipt whiche beinge three greatest prouinces empire turke possesseth whiche limites prophet hath included wherfore good hope henceforth shall possesse prouince empyre nowe busy hongary also readye inuade germany last acte tragedy may bee last act yt turke shall inuade country thynke euer shall haue quiet possession hathe asia grece egipt prophecie playne manifest treateth partes prouokyng chiefly repentaunce exhorteth ready wylling obeye magistrate commaunding vnto warre employe goodes herein also serue wt body prisoner also whiche cousolatio prysoners turkes eyther nowe turkes handes hereafter shal come captiuitie comforteth many perswasions admonisheth well ware fayned pretensed religion turkes heareth saye howe many haue professed christ doe owne accorde falle religion hath certen shewe vertue holines suffer bondage patiently serue maisters faithfully though thei prophane wicked neyther runne away fordo selues vnpatientnes lothsomenes estate beare alwayes memory peter paule wryte dutie bounde seruauntes tyme shal attempte warre christian hasarde lyues rather serue vnder murtherers make warre sainctes daniell sayeth shead innocent bloude therefore muste chiefly beware partaker great mischiefe wickednes unto oration annexeth maner praying turkysh fury ende discoursing vice reigneth tyme sortes men sheweth howe germany whiche corrupted wholy infected longe continewe prosperitie fourme prayer prescribeth oeuerlasting father haue verely deserued sore afflicted prayer luther punnyshe v thyne owne selfe lorde thy wrath displeasure according thy great mercy muche better v falle thyne handes men ennemies thy merci vnspeakeable infinite haue certenly offended transgressed thy commaundementes thou knowest heauenly father howe deuill byshop turke haue rightnor cause punyshe v haue trespassed nothyng thou vsest scourge whippe v haue mo way one al life time styred vp v saie haue quarell v would rather euer example offende moste greuously idolatry false doctrine lye disceiptfull craftye iugglynge murther thefte extortion fornication adultery sorcerie myght offende maiestie thy name thing thei wishe confesse honour god father thy sonne iesus christe lord holy spirite one euerliuing god offence wickednes whiche greuously hate persecute v forsake fayth fal vnto lore tha loke displeasure hads uouchesaufe therfore loke vpon v god father send remedy thyne aduersaries whan doe tormente v tormente doctrine professe thyne sathan abyde wylbe worshipped thy place thy worde set asyde goeth feede v lie turke also steade thy sonne iesu christ wold place mahomet nowe yf thys synne professe thee father thy sonne holy ghost trewe god certenly arte thou synner whiche teachest v requyrest dewty v wha cause persecute v hate afflicte thee also awake therfore god take hande thy selfe aueuge thy sacred holy name defyle deface neyther suffer thou iniurie hande punnishe synnes vice seke quenche thy worde v doe thou shouldest reigne neyther shouldest haue people whiche might serue honour thee nowe touching ofspringe encrease turkes many haue written nedeth note thing therof place originall turkes smal beginnyng haue maruelous encrease first emperour accompted othomanne aboute yere lord thousand thre hodreth succedeth orchanes amurathes fyrst transported armye ouer sea hellesponte europe inuaded thrace baiazethes cyriscelebes moses mahoniethes amurathes mahomethes baiazethes selime solyman tyme alphonse marque piscare mentioned sendyng booke prince germany accuseth markes piscare accuseth frech king blameth frenche kinge whiche troublesome tyme comon welth goeth styre vp stryfe thentente might hinder noble enterprise themperoure al state pretendeth lyght forged matter anthony rincon ce fregose intercepted vnto thing hath chauuced could long diligent searche fynd frech kinge whan knew thereof declareth exceadinge great iuiurie done haue ambassadours cruelly destroyed kinges purgation thinge hathe ofte complayned sore bisshop themperoure hath requyred might satisfysed herin vayne seing vnworthie act without greate shame dishonoure name neglecte second maye addressing hys letter senate paris thende sayeth god maye illumine heartes graunt v constancie fayth bring ere way saluation sende v peace throughe recompence iniuries haue susteyned vsurping right outrage donne oure messagers ambassadours dispayre haue peace must nedes haue warre would graunt v victorye request people go prosession pray church fyt preacher cause therof recyted cogregation moreouer case ther thinketh rightly oure fayth religion neither promise amendement commaund suffer openlye offence longe sendeth duke longuill prince cleaue leauing ther power somer season conduicte martyn van rossen looked occasion doe exploicte meane season kalendes iune bisshop appoynted connsell trente agaynste fyrst nouember time commaundeth repayre counsell called trente thither patriarch bisshoppes abbottes suche lyke eyther right priuiledg haue interest preset counsel permitted speake minde exhorteth also themperoure french kyng eyther wolde come selues send theyr proctours commaunde bisshoppes bisshops germany inuiteth aboue others theyr cause chiefly theyr requeste payne trauaile taken moneth iuly frenche kinge moste hatefull woordes proclaymeth warre themperoure wryting freche king proclaimeth warre publysshed geueth subiectes libertie spoyle distroy contries sea lande meanes euer might littel duke longeuill martyu rossen made inuaston brabant wonderful terrour men vnprouided commyng vpon sodayne lyke haue taken andwerpe duke languile martin van rossen invade brabant louayne wantyng thinges necessarie munition could make battery marching forewarde whiche way euer wente diftroyed al fyer sword extorted many thus making theyr waie force august ioyne themselues kinges sonne charles duke orleans warred tyme land luke force foure hondreth horseman sent kynge denmarke besydes danuillier uirton iuey taken also lucemburge chiefe citie kinge hym selfe maketh warre syde marchinge foreward perpigusan beseged strong armie besegeth parpignan towne ruscinon mountaynes pyrene moreouer moueth warre piedmount conduicte william langey also border flaunders gouernment duke uandome assayled enemy fyue sondry place wherby iudgement many ben better haue set vpon one prouince whole power thende also declared attempted parpignan vayne also whan duke orleans retourned home imperialles recouered agayne except iuey occasion began fortifie andwarpe easy bee wonne kinge pourposed haue warres sente agayne poline turke entreate hym wolde sende uanie fraunce longe poline came solyman differred thyng vntil next yere duryng warre king setteth forth proclamation lutherians moreouer parlament paris chargeth printer vnder great penaltie shoulde neyther prynte sell bookes condempned suspected namely booke caluine whiche intituled institution christiane religion request inquilitour terme hym seuenth daye iuly maketh decree preacher shall admonyshe people doe duty churche know lutheriane one thinketh amisse religion present hym worke god moste acceptable minister churche order prescribed whiche followe inquirie comaunded inquyre promoter whether maner rche yt lutherins knewe man would saye purgatory whan man dead eyther saued dampned iustified obseruing god commaundementes god must called vpon sainctes yt worshipping image idolatry yt sainctes worke miracle ceremony churche profite nothing lawes churche doe bynde man knowledge gospell necessarye men without exception fonde parte common people pray god latin priest ca forgeue sinnes sacrament penauuce minister pronounce benefite god whiche forgeueth synnes church bynde man mortall synne lawfull eate fleshe al tymes fourme inquisition geuen priuately priestes openly set forth proclamation wherin comaunded presented accused whiche doe neglecte rite lawes churche suche haue bookes contrary christia fayth eyther geue others reade purposely let fall wayes goe thei may founde assemble priuate house garden forge diuises lawes chruche receyue suche kynde men house garden priuie suche thyng commau ded presente within syxe dayes doctours diuinitie chosen inquisitour el stande accursed stacioners also charged thyng eyther prynted wrytten point suspected swarued fro custome churche within syxe dayes bryng none excuse taken daye acte proclaymed generall procession preseruation realme genefeua religion saynt genefeua trusty goddes borne suche solemnitie haue declared nynth booke dayes certen brent place moberte religion tyme fraunces landr e uicar crois paris taught people syncerely sayde masse branke wyne whether nature purpose knowe whome diuines conceaued great hatred thei noted certe thinges preaching propounde vnto hym article sacrifice masse instituted christe vayleable quicke dead must praye sainctes maye mediatours aduocates v vnto christe howe substaunce bread wyne chaunged article sorbe nistes consecration preastes may consecrate bread wyne whole supper lorde apperteineth monasticall vowes must kept sacramentes confirmation vnction receiued holy ghost prayer fasting good workes soules delyuered purgatory lawes churche concerning fastyng choyse meates doe bynde conscience one hygh prelate byshop churche whome al bounde obeye lawe god many thinges must beleued necessitie receyued expressed scripture byshop rome pardon doe release paynes purgatory priestes beyng neuer synfull vicious doe consecrate lordes body deadly synne must confessed priest receyue hym sacramentall absolution howe man hath free wyll wherby may doe good euyll ryse synne repentaunce howe fayth charitie true penaunce obteyned remission synnes churche counsell beyng lawfully assembled erre therfore must obeyed howe iudgement interpretation scripture apperteyneth churche thyng controuersye thynges would haue subscribe confirme seale fewe dayes aunswereth generally good godly euer holy catholyque churche hathe taught matter content aunswere attempted greater thinges afterwarde shall heare tyme also one two freers saint dominickes order preached gospell metz whan priestes shewed two frier preache gospell metz selues sore offended diuerse citezens made petition senate would forbidde promysing al dewe obedience ther came also william farell taught first priuatly citie afterwardes certein castell without tyme emperours letter brought wherin commaunded willia farell alter nothyng religion punyshe offendours people forbode heare sermon vnles preacher werlicenced byshop senate sommer infinite nombre grassehoppers came flieng germany hither parte italy wonderfull grashoppers germany italy bignes soeuer lyghted eate vp bothe grasse corne concerning duke brunswicke moste bitter inuectyues duke saxon lantgraue burnyng certen place saxony haue spoken oftener nowe vexed continuall inuasions robbery goslarie brunswicke city empire inlincked protestantes would obeye decree emperour kynge ferdinando request commaunded cease violence duke saxon lantgraue name al confederate make warre duke saxon lantgraue mouewar againste duke bru swicke flieth short space brynge countrie subiection strong castell wolsebutell standing farre fro citie brunswycke wherein put truste wanne composition taried long hymselfe whan began inuade fled eldest sonne charles uictor duke bauier forsayde castell founde sondrie letter wherby evident see thinge duke bauier byshop mentz heldus diuerse others went shalbe repeted place conuenient protestauntes wrytyng set forth declare large cause doinge shewe howe dyd begynne warre necessitie defended fellowes fourmer assemblie spier intreated kyng ferdinando emperours name would comaunde suffer goslarians lyue rest hym ferdinando followed myndes tyme nede ayde agaynste turke sendyng ambassadours warned hym sharpely surcease aunswered contemptuously proudlye would leaue whereupon ensued desension rehersed shewed kyng ferdinado spier vnlesse obeyed decree would suffer fellowes susteyne wrong ides iuly assemblie empyre norynberg decreed spier warre hogary assembly noriberg kyng ferdinando present emperours deputy fridericke palsgraue bishop auspurge fridericke counte furstemberge hugh monforte iohn nauie ferdinando propoundeth howe emperour toke good parte sente army hongary purposed haue bene warre selfe power therfore called assemblie state spaine cofutation fell great sickenes constrayned necessitie differ tyll tyme whan nowe fully resolued matter haue sent force italy burgundye brake foorthe thenterprises hys enemyes much hath cause feare perill aly also flaunders artoys wherof notwithstanding hath geuen none occasion chieflye loueth comon tranquillitie knowe well enough thenemies haue euer sin assemblie spier endeuoured leuie men suyserlande germany begin warres thus emperour mind impeached letted neyther come hym selfe send force hathe nede owne defence neuerthelesse fully mynded nexte yeare goe aboute retourne germany accomplishe warre hys mynde long intended haue sea also nauie well prepared furnisshed turke beyng assayled double warre maie bende hys whole power agaynste hongary moreouer whan cometh germany wil leaue nothyng vnattempted maye make godly tollerable reconcilemet relygyon complayning almen obey decree last assemblie sent soldiours others sente full nombre som sent foorth without money wanted also munitio furniture promysed thinges captaynes made complaynte vewed sawe whole iorney letted herby detriment daunger empire commen vnto assemblie without losse hinderaunce require nedefull time would faile comon wealth fernado toke iorney uienna come assemblye norinberge beeing aduertised war brunswick sent messager exhorte surcease comen norinberge como aduise sent ambassadours whose oration ambassador duke saxon lantzgraue try matter force armes especially time case feared lest ye turkish war behindered ciuil warrestered vp germany unto duke lantzgraue made aunswere xi auguste oute theyr campe castell wulfebuttel recyting cause enterprised defence declare thyng might otherwise haue ben doon albeit dryuen necessitie take thys warre hande theyr greate charge yet haue neuerthelesse sent ayde turkishe warre fully moche wer bounde neyther wolde fayle also dooe lyke hereafter yf men wold doe ther nede feare dissolution armie lacke many men reported mouthes letter diuers seing forasmoche duke brunswick coulde non meane quieted contemning emperours kyng ferdinando comaundement also decree empire desire misconstre doyng seeke man warre neyther doe refuse whan thinges appeased sende al force aide hogary much able make assemblie ended sixe twenty daye august penaltie set suche obeyed decree spier certein thinges warre requisite enacted prynces sauinge walter master prussia bishop bamberge eistet trente themperours deputes named haue harde cardinall contarene hys ambassade greate thanke bishoppes cardinalles contarene displesure yt pope cardinalles charged vehemente enoughe resystynge lutheranes almoste brought common welth roome daunger many blamed hym sore hys absence cardinall fregose stode hys defence retournyng germany italy came luke bisshop paule attended emperours comming goe barbarye going bisshop roome shortly created legate hys death bononie last departed thys yere thend august without suspicion poison whan frende cardinall fregose also dead little knowe well say beleued ryghtly touching man iustification man excellently learned wrote boke magistrate comon welthe uenetians moneth chaunceloure frauce chau celour fraunceput prison willia poret king comaundement went tha perpignan taken night laye bed carried prison time brute therof came paris al men reioised exceadingly foure yeres ben office offended sortes men lady kynges courte came misfortune condenation also admiral augme ted hatred said great maner assured hope bee made cardinall therfore two three monethes wold nedes take holy order thing notwithstading som saied forasmuch hatred mani might better beare escape daunger life case heat tyme breake boyle ouer third mockeri fortune chaunced frauce monethes together three mentioned constable admirall chauncelour highest degre dignitye burned mutuall mallice declared theyr ensample disceiptefullnes vncertentye slyppernes woordly thynges tyme otto henry palsegraue embraced doctryne gospell dyd heildessem tolde counsell byshop sent immediatly letter palsgraue receyueth gospell bulles therof emperoure spayne wherunto cesar aunswereth fyue twenty daye auguste fyrst co mendeth endeuour zeale towardes common wealth greueth hym frenche kyng compared vnto prodigall chylde hym selfe neuer swarued empe aunswered popo dutie sayeth ought derely imbraced hath refused paynes peryll coste counsel myght whole common wealth beyng pacified myght sette vpon turke handes contrary wyse mynded euer waye wherfore fyndeth lacke letter wonte make boaste cardinalles hys becke wherfore doubteth whether thynge trewe countreseared howe soeuer resteth vpon good conscience doinges openly knowen hym selfe hath bene ouergentle hym fauoured hym great deale muche labour hath taken many yeares vayne hath ofte bene warned dutye sondrye great iniuries haue bene remitted league hym haue often tymes bene remoued thynges waxed worse vtterly doeth abuse lenitie patience brake league gaue occasion warre hathe declared rome hathe happened since wyll vtter also frendly desirous peace hath bene hereby may easely appeare truce taken nice came talke aegnes mortes comitted self vnto yeare followyng passed fraunce great admiration without reprehension many seing hath oftener broken fayth fickell vnconstant counselles sure great daunger hazarde persone vpo fidelitie promesse moreouer knoweth certeintie thei deliberated deteine time many say rebellion gaunt must nedes passe waie nocause rebellion stired vp fewe basest sorte men al coutrey remayned allegeaunce fidelitie quene sister could haue remedied matter beit prefixed retourne germany italy moued intreaty chaunge purpose went frauce thing able proue letter letter sone noble requested thing ernestly yt rekened dishonoured case toke way fraunce tyme wt hym fraunce affirmed many time yt wold obserue truce made began complayne millan redred vnto according promesse withstandinge vnto ye promesse added thys condicyon restore hys vncle duke sauoie doe serten thinges yet syns tyme hathe practised agaynste hym sondry place germanie italy turke iohn uaiuod wyfe widdow certen noble men hongatye whose meanes turke citie offen yet meane season coulde full well cloake hys mallice promise hym greate frendshyp subtill fetche polycie myght tracte tyme set vppon hym vnware tooke first occasyon tyme hys minister fregose rincon intercepted thing enterprise fregose rincon wolde dede haue satisfyed hym hymselfe tell whiche chosen vmpere arbitrement betwene therfore dyd pretende bee cause newe trouble disturbaunce weale publicke whan prefyxed long fregose rincon attempted hys commaundemente italye turkie seruyce oftetymes donne hym knowen well enoughe wente aboute throughe treason haue broughte christen common welth great daunger therfore coulde inioye benefyte peace nicene whyche selues infrynged publycke peace agayne wente stealthe priuelye throughe lumbardie companye oute lawes whyche deathe custome countrye blameth sore marque piscare offered abide iudgment whye shoulde refuse also forsake satysfactions vnknowne certenly thinking satisfyed passed ouer barbarie sendynge hys ambassadoure commended vnto hym publycke peace queyet albeit hee made fayre promise yet attempte diuerse thinges agaynste hym germany denmarke place inteded also inuade nauarre agayne assemblie spier coulde nurryshe stryfe religion whilest promysed seuerally eyther partye hys amytie fauour indeuoured moreouer diswade state empire turkisshe warre sollycited turke sent power italye mooued warre agaynste hym brabant martyn rossenn lande luke duke orleans beefore proclaymed reste hys force hee bent wholy agaynst frontier spaine thys fruict gathereth hys dylygence whyche hath geue hym moch wil exhorted oft vnto peace furthermore hath suffered deteine arche bisshop ualencene prisoner certen noble men spayne outrageously iniuried freche men auignion hath dede bene ouermuche sufferaunce nowe therfore compelled necessitie make resistaunce tyme lefte feare hym reason moste large ample promyses also tyme prepared hym selfe turkyshe warre therfore resolued retourne germanye iniurie sure great dammage smalle hathe done vpon frontier yet moued muche thynges calamitie common wealth concernyng owne affayres muche doeth ofte breake conuenauntes muche better hym haue open warre truste truce condicions whiche fyrst light occasion wyl abholyshe make frustrate peace oftentimes disceiptful peace disceiptful meane season doeth practyse newe deuyses hurtfull common wealthe mayteyne faction wholy occupied wery hym selfe losse charge maye dryue hym resiste turke beyng disposition hym self bryngeth vp chyldren disciplyne nowe ambition vnmeasurable couetousnes increased freche king accused ambition hydde auncestours dyd vsurpe frenche prouince whyche dominion empyre nowe doeth possesse sauoye parte piedmont fortifieth verye apparente entendeth restore pourpose inuade lumbardy also parma placence luke seine also dominion church rome entent myght thus haue waye open naples sicilie doubt entente maye easely perceyued suche thynges attempteth practiseth italye brief couetous desyre conteyned within certeyn limites great infinite neyther thought euer wyll obserue conuenauntes longe thyng remayneth may take way fro others conuert owne vse disease vice mind caried raging tempeste forgettyng vertue religion hathe lyncked hym selfe league turke doeth participate onlye counselles also goodes fortune ennemye common wealth nowe also maketh boaste full stoutelye barbarossa shall come sea nauie whether thynges doe make reformation common wealth begynning counsell ought wysdome cosyder study hath bene euer shoulde bee counsell iudged bee moste profitable owne priuate commoditie therfore thing wayed cosidered deuise way reconcile appease controuersie religion germanye herein respecte vnto god glorye dignitie churche therfore let imputed kynge counsell hath euer impeched hym whiche hathe taken behalfe much trauayle payne wherfore holynes nowe disposed helpe common wealth thus afflicted ought dutie professe selfe ennemie authour trouble calamitie moueth allureth turke inuade christen comon wealth leaueth waye vnassayed accomplyshe ambition mynde moste desyrous reuenge sythe chief care christianitie apperteyneth vnto hym reason office pastorall thynge selfe doeth surely requyre longer suffer hym cause vexation trouble declare hym selfe vtter ennemye whiche thyng would doe accordyngly moste accepted al good men also profitable reteyne kynges dutie haue counsell recouer peace establyshe common wealth remedy wherin wyll doe owne dutie vnfaynedly wyll bee behynde parte fiftene booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument fyftene booke pope could accorde emperour kyng warre waxed hote betwyxt englande scotlande frenche kyng appeaseth rebellion rochelle assemblie norinberge granuellane demauded emperour ayde frech kyng certen answere obiecteth emperour many thinges fraunces landry examined bucer sent collon make reformatio pope would buye millan incenseth clergie collon agaynst archebyshop laundersey taken dure sacked assemblie holden spyers greuouse complayntes made againste frenche kyng muche herauld sent backe threatninges protestantes accused duke brunswycke recite acte doyng young damsell duke sauoye accuseth kyng frenche ambassadours set forth oration whiche haue made case bene admitted speake counsell assemblie accorde made betwyxt kyng romains duke saxon prynces graunt ayde frenche kyng emperour besiegeth saynt desier kyng englande great force taketh boloigne emperour concludeth peace frenche kynge contrary men expectation whan warre waxed hote euerye syde cardinalles sent mak peace byshop xxvi daye auguste sent ambassadours two cardinalles treate peace michaell uisense portugall emperour iames sadolete king frauce praying remitte priuate miuries commo wealthes sake frame selues vnto peace sendeth also three cardinalles legate synode trente paris poole morone emperour answereth legate presydentes counsell trente uisense also wryteth byshop almoste effecte dyd former letter vayne make peace hym wyll kepe conuenauntes therfore aduertyseth hym agayne would professe hym selfe ennemye hath often sayd would auenged breake tcuce make league turke nowe surest fittest meane establysh comon wealth letter sent away ambassadour eyghtene daye october asmuche duke longeuille martyn rossen leuied armye dominion duke cleaue emperialles conduiet prince orenge inuade gulicke distroye countrie fyre farre wyde take composition dure chiefest towne party gulicke dure taken mounten came duke cleaue mother time also emperiall armie hongary exploite done attempted vayne wynne towne pesta retourneth home infection dyed many thousandes duke maurice saxonye serued thys warre voluntarily yonge prince aboute xxi yeares age certen daye ryding campe one meting chaunce certe turkes foughte hauing horse slayne vnder smitten ground sernaunt gentel man borne lay downe vpon hys lorde body couered duke defended bare stripe longe vntill certen horseman came rescewed prince saued hys lyfe man hauing receiued many woundes caried camp dyed shortly thus ended warre hongarye bisshop sente ayde thre thousand footemen whiche wer led alexander uitellius thys tyme also began hote warre betwene england scotland occasion wherof ministred yere scottish warre betwixte england scotlande king promised mete hys vncle king englande yorke make accorde touching theyr limites diswaded hys mother certe noble came fortuned scottes yere beginning december great ouerthrowe place called solymosse whiche battell taken part lordes scotelande losse scotes taken solymosse kynge toke suche thought retournyng home dyed within fewe dayes day ides december eight day quene brought forth daughter mary whiche thinge also greatly augmente sorrowe theyr king dieth wanted heyremale yere loste two sonnes sondri place within space foure twenty houres wyfe marye daughter duke guyse house lorayne scottes werre thys calamitie frenche kynge sent monye munition kynge dead gouernement committed iames hamelton erle arrayne whiche kinges greate cosyn next place vnto hym cardiuall andrewes addickte kynge fraunce shewed henry prince saxonie selfe sonne maurice entred league protestantes death duke maurice moued herein sayed hys father coulde bynde hym neyther wolde tyed bondes father whe henry duke brunswicke expulsed sayd accused duke saxon lantzgraue theyr consortes imperial chamber afterwarde duke saro lantzgraue refuse iudgmet chaumber cited moneth december refuse theyr iudgemente thinges sendinge ambassadours thither declare vnto also protest doe refuse lawfull ordynarye iurisdiction take exception iudges themselues contrary relygion prayse decree made auspurge twelue yeres past haue confirmed othe cause dissent exceadingly beare greate mallice whiche take heretikes thinke vnworthy haue iustice ministred sodry preiudices haue oft tymes vttered bewreyed theyr hatred conuentio regenspurg decreed chamber would yeare moneth ianuary refourmed protestantes allow men also theyr rellgion might admitted nombre thing themperour graunted king fernando renewed assemblie spier appoynted moneth iune reformation meane obteined ayde turkishe warre yf ben otherwyse tolde tyme plainely wolde beare charge fro henceforth touching iudges chamber also wold refuse hereafter obey theyr decree therefore nothinge donne hitherto sayde sending ambassadours doe refuse theire iudgment agayne iudges wrytyng set forth dooe reiect refusall agreed theyr last metinge norrinberge assemble agayne turkish warre xiiii daye nouember matter differred duke cleauerecouereth dure sharpe time winter duke cleaue besegeth recouereth dure tyme frenche kynge beseged perpignan arrose rebellion rochel haue towenin pantois verey famous situated place right commodious one possessed englysh men rendred frenche tyme charles rebellion rochelle first sonne heire father iohn cause commotyon garison placed king vnder gouernemet iarnacke admirall kinsina place also aboutes vp tribute saltepittes droue awaye reproche kinges officer treasurer came thither soone kinge vnderstode sente thither new garrison horseman footemen iarnake also taketh theyre munition armure kepte gate watche warde laste day december followyng kyng hym selfe came thyther next daye settyng place iudgement whan townes men theyr neyghbours aboute laye prostrate hym besought hym mercy albeit sayeth tyme thildren occupied moste weightie affayres defence kynges oratio rochell oure whole realme al forgetting dewtie owe vnto v haue made rebellion vprore suche wyse haue iuste cause punnishe estate oure person enormitie offence myght dryue fyne yet accompt lesse honorable prayse worthye prince clemecy king frau ce extend mercy people honest hys subiectes remain duty againe set submission wyllyng myndes rigour lawe doe intende forget iniurie haue done vnto v haue consideration much errour trespasse accustomed gentlenes vpon trnste confidence wyl committe suche lyke facte hereafter el steade gentle mercifull prince shall haue seuere executour iustice owne faulte whiche doubtles ought accoupted lesse laste yeares past gantois handled extremely whan executed punished also lost liberty euer whiche example dede though myght followe without reprehension haue neyther susteyned lesse iniurie neyther inferiour vnto hym thynge whiche hath thus reuenged griefe yet much loke encrease rather loue fidelitie beneuolence subiectes tha enriched goodes substauce clerely forgeue act restore former estate notwithstanding suche thinges haue frely lyberally geuen v doe accepte reteyne euer also hath bene taken tumulte wyll restored agayne whan oration kyng ensued reioysing confused noyse audience heard moste swete plesaunt melodie steple head churche saynct bartholomewe testifying publique ioye gladnes senate made kyng moste costly supper next daye kyng beyng ready departe sayde chief people goe nowe parte realme defende ennemy defende truste assuredly wyll doe moreouer thyng apperteineth bettering comoditie citie wyll denye requeste seuentene day ianuary kyng ferdinando two sonnes came nurrenberge assemblie nurrenberge assemblie eyght daye came thether also granuellan spayne comming trente sonne byshop arras exhorted byshoppes legate conuention emperour substituted deputy fridericke palatine bishop auspurge iohn nauie seconde kalend february king fernando maketh hys proposition forasmuch certen assembly continual ayde agaynst turk hath decreed admonissheth requireth wyll condescend vpon nowe nothing nedefull wantyng reported men wyll retourne thys yere hongarye exceadynge greate power prouoked doe certen christian prince albeit country sore impouerished almoste continuall warres yet faile part great matter defend hongary austrich morauia country adioining man maner knoweth better perswasion red diuerse letter sente vnto king fernando others sondry place maner pourported thys turke prepared new armie nauie warre bothe sea land wer also ambassadours quene marie gouerned lowe cou trye themperour wiricke criechinge uiglie zwichem lawyer longe oration accused sore duke cleaue hys ayde counsell french kyng conduict treatye norinberge martyn rossenn made warre party wherfore requested reduce frame dewtie myght leaue possession gelderland recompence dommage fifte daye februarie granuellan shewed commission good themperour towardes publicke weale sayd nede recite reioysed lyttle last yere whan wed hym made oute theyr power together ioyntely agaynst turke wolde dede haue ben therepresent hym selfe prepared thynges iorney french king duke cleaue moue war agaynst hym vnloked thing certely disapoynted former pourpos force intended haue sent agaynst perpetuall enemie christianitie constrayned reteyne aboute owne defence especially seynge enemyes bragged also verey moche turkisshe nauie wherin sayd came great soccour thys notwithstandyng perseuereth styll mynd hath euer ben also declared determined spende hys treasure also hys lyfe bloude turkisshe warre agayne ayde hym agaynst french king duke cleaue wherunto zeale towardes common welth also state dangerous tyme onght perswade french king hath expulsed vncle duke sauoie oute inheritaunce vnknowen intendeth doe also vnto others astune occasyon serue themperoure dooeth let violent enterprise therfore doeth beare hym thys hatred mallice heard ryght nowe letter wer redde worketh turke practiseth germany seketh hynder turkisshe warre forasmuch duke cleaue ioyned league hym also distourbeth themperours moste worthye exploictes let saufgarde germany requisite ayde decried agaynste bothe theyr insolente rasshenes may repressed meane tyme supplication protestantes protestantes deliuer supplycation king fernando themperours deputy wherin make longe rehersal hath ben religion many yeres peace geuen norinberge iudges chamber haue infringed howe themperour made prouiso two yeres past regenspurg declared playnely hys mynde howe decree made reformation chamber vpryght ministration iustice also protest openly vnlesse decree obserued seing nothing redressed hitherto iudges chamber stil molest theyr wonted maner first theyr defence agaynste duke brunswicke secondly paying stipendes chamber therfore haue refused whole iurisdiction thing dede protested longe open assemblie wolde doe therfore yf matter otherwise reported vnto desyre geue credit constrayned necessitie thus doe vsed lawefull remedy whych law equitie selfe doeth permitte wyse procede vsurpe authoritie iudgement pronounce publycations penalty wolde also publicke weale hurtfull time throughe mallice hatred kindled amonges state theire whole treasure shalbe consumed ciuile warre fyt profitable wilbe turkes man knoweth wel enough howe harde thing althynges exasperated quyet matter maye dyuers example shewed turk increase losse christian verely doe wishe nothyng fyrme peace vpright iustice publicke quiet might stablished germany certenly dissention religion arriseth al grudg diffidence dissention springeth wel doctryne gospel god trewe relygyon prohibited errours open crime taken awaye mended also ambition lucre sake defended maynteyned therfore god beyng offended prouoked wrath thys vnthankfulnes doeth plage v greate calamity cease hys hand longe perseuer praye therfore wolde applye theyr studye hereunto lestewyse trauell matter relygion sake bee trouble moued iustice maye bee ministred men indifferentlye somoche state chamber thys present requyre accordyng olde lawes empire themprours declaratio iudgemente may reformed iudges appoynted action remayne state refusall made iudges bee charged obserue exactely fourme reformation shalbe attempt nothynge agaynst peace makinges former yeres vnlesse thyng maye thus bee ordered may haue sufficiente warraunte haue peace cannot consulte turkishe warre althoughe desyre doe anye thynge maye common welth matter beyng longe mothe debated whan bothe kynge fernando themperours attourneis sayed howe counsell alreadye appoynted ar trente themperoure also would come thyther iudges chamber coulde remoued without theyr cause hearde redresse already decreed shortely shall take effecte howe coulde denye duke brunswicke expulsed makyng claime hys owne haue lawe neyther aucthorytye make graunte protestauntes shew agayne neyther allowe counsell neyther wyll come neyther satisfyed thynges sufficiently assured neyther take delyberation notwithstandinge fernando state make decree decre norinberg fortyfying place nere turkes dominion contribution monye appoynte thirde daye iuly reformation chamber ordeynynge shoulde redressed fourme prescribed eleuen yeares paste regenspurge appointing penaltie shall refuse contribute ayde accordyngly protestantes agayne proteste doe assente vnto decree made withoute theyr aduise certen thing establisshed touching peace law great pertialitie cocerning contribution themperours cominge matter lyke tende mortal warre betwene duke cleaue prince electours state theyr ambassadours doe intreat hardely last obteyne trewes granuellan certe determinat suche shoulde stande themperours pleasure soone shoulde sette foote germanye whether wyll approue refuse meane season sittarde verey stronge towne frontier gulicke shoulde haue emperours possession vntyll declared hys mynde intercessours promysed thys also wold send ambassadours mete emperoure treate matter granuellan put greate hope theye shoulde receyue hym gentle aunswer thys treatye thambassadours cleaue chiefe whereof iohn ulatten noble man birthe well learned dyd well allowe gaue thankes intercessours theyr paynes taken meane whyle battell foughten towne sittarde xxiiii daye marche duke cleaue wanne feelde partely reason victorye partly duke cleaue refuseth truce throughe perswasion frenche kynge fed hym money waxed obstinate forsakynge treuce whan hys ambassadours retourned home newes prosperous battel brought spedely fraunce caused great reioysynge paris kynges commaundemente sange te deum duke banier bretherne theyr ambassadours make intercession protestantes thys conuentyon amonges condicions propounde thys also duke brunsewickes landes myght committed custody themperoure certen prince germany tyll matter examined herein could nothynge determyned assemblye christopher bysshop auspurge dyed soden paulsey appoynted make death bishop auspurg feaste nexte daye house stadious man learned peaceable otto truckesse suceded decree made entered recorde accustomed neyther authorytye longe frenche kynge receyued themperours letter wrytten bisshop roome therefore nowe laste aunswereth full themperoure wolde preferred hym though well deserued french kinges aunswer emperours letter church roome mockerie vayne thyng neyther themperours auncesters bee compared hys hymselfe also hym thys behalfe certenly good sonne moche prayse worthye whose armie dyd besiege vexe take prisoner father good man house clemente vii sacked chiefe citie whole world polluted church temple god immortall sondry wayes lefte vndonne kynde mischiefe fylthy luste crueltye vnto greate outerage gaue also hym selfe prettye mocke tyme made vowes supplycatyons spayne delyueraunce hys father moste streyghtely deteyned home captiue hys progenitours kinges fraunce euer syns charles martell pipine lewis haue studyed alwayes auaunce kinges fraunce addicteth pope enryche bysshoppes roome prayseth moche owne dilligence zeale common welthe thynge farre otherwyse yf bee indged ryghte throughe hys order conduite haue many thousandes christian ben slayne turkes within shorte space hongary one twyse goulfe uenise castelneufe barbarfa argiers whither tyme sayed muste nedes gooe whan deede fled leafte germany appraye enemie approchynge throughe hys faulte yong infante iohn uayuode owne brother fernando realme hongary fallen thys calamitie telleth brauerye thoughe came aegnesmortes confirme peace yf prayse thys thynge ought rather bee ascribed vnto hym whiche wente fyrste shyppe hym also sente hys chyldrene thyther wherein surely great daunger bothe hym selfe truste man also androwe de anxie hys admirall man subtyll craftie witte tooke hys iorney fraunce requeste dede fyrste hys ambassadour letter messagers craued thys hym offered hym millan alledgeth nonne cause constrayned necessitie rebellion gaunte passe waye sayeth howe consultation haue stayed hym faulse neuer came hys thought duke sauoye wronge denyed bothe hys mother dowarye herytaunce woulde permitte hym redeme nice besydes dyd euyll intreate duke sauoye frend peroure hys lieutenauntes soldiours recouered foorce armes coulde gette lawe equitie especyallye syns wrought thinges maner emperours pleasure whose vse propertye perswade kynges subiectes reuolte bryng miserye example duke bourbon sauoye prynce salarne duke henry brunsewicke also chargeable hurtful kinse folkes alies christierne king denmarke fernando brother hym chieflye whiche hathe maried eldeste syster turke hathe late inuaded hongarye taken chyefe cytye ought ascribed vnto hym hymselfe hys brother whiche layed wayte yonge heyre uayuodes sonne made warre agaynste hym aunswereth euerye poynte emperoures letter concernynge turke hys ambassadoures sente vnto hym touchynge germanes relygyon counsell seme bee faulte deserue well title mooste christian kynge geuen longe syns hys noble progenitours fyne desyreth bisshop geue credyte sclaunderous reporte hys aduersary thynke howe nothynge wyll bee glad doe common welthes sake hys churche roome little time dyed willyam bellaye langeis wee haue oftetymes mentioned man moche honoure vertue especyall ornamente death praise w bellay frenche nobilytye reason hys notable learnynge eloquence experyence syngular aptnes affayres farre vnlyke vnto moste parte followe lawe seeke onlye auaunce augemente theyre ryches noble courage thys respect onely howe myght vertue wynne trewe renowne serue hys prynce trewelye thoughe hys owne hynderaunce tolde beefore fraunces lander preacher paris whan made doubtfull france la der committed prison aunswer article propounded perseuered styll hys preachynge two three dayes easter commytted warde thys doone procuremente diuines accused hym lieutenaunte criminell within fewe day kynge came sangermane whyche little towne castell ryuer seine fyue myles benethe paris weknes kynge beyng infourmed whole matter calleth preacher beefore hym whan came thither beynge put feare mennes woordes whyche sayed howe kynge sore offended declared constancye whyche many men looked hys hande beynge caryed agayne vnto parys xxix daye aprill enforced recant suche thynges taught day cathedral church assemble senatours iudges parlamente moreouer magistrate officer parys great nomber diuines church dores wer made faste men set armure dryue waye people whan placed hys opinion recyted beynge demaunded euery one beleued therein aunswered pleased confessynge howe erred promyseth obedyence hencefoorthe acknoweledgeth article doctryne fryste diuines kynges counsell propounded vnto recantation hym bee trewe godlye sorte also handled preacher depensius thoughe greate solemnitie whan fyrste made hys retractatyon nothynge depensius driuen recante playnlye compelled daye hys sermon beefore people declare eche thynge distinctelye apertelye tyll divine present fully satisfyed fraunce liued clemente marotte vulgare tounge surmounted far al poetes eyther wee hys dayes liued also tyme prayse clements marot greate knowledge latyn tongue yet company learned menne profyted verye moche neyther thynge almost bookes poetes kneweit theyr woorkes tooke moche applyed hys pourpose thus translate certe thinges couertly tibullus propertius ouide hys owne elegy ga llus tooke marriage hercules duke farrare senate armoricke daughter lewes xij kynge fraunce translated also moste excellently fyrst booke ouides metamorphosys later dayes bente writynges holy scripture prefixed haue expressed dauid psalter frenche metre psalmes translated marot taken away sickenes finished fyfty psalmes remaine red without thadmiration hys excellent wit nothinge pleasaunte hys style nothynge purer speache nothyng apter pleasaunt hys rythme set foorthe thys yeare geneua whither repaired tyme hee myghte safelye make longer bode fraunce suspycyon lutheranisme prynted xxx psalmes two yeares parys moche diffycultye thys myghte doo beefore doctours sorbone pronounced nothynge conteyned booke contrary chrystyane fayth thys peraduenture maketh moche pourpos thought good commend name excellent artificer also nation fraunce hys memoryal shal endure last posterytie men thys opinion shall ryght harde anye man matche hym thys kynde vertue tullye reporteth cesar maketh wyse menne frayde wryte others haue taken hande argumente deede better learned doo attayne fynes perfectyon tenth booke mentioned archebisshop collon coueted refourme hys churche allowed archebisshop collon calleth convocation synode hys prouynce notwithstandynge booke went foorthe hys name conuention rege spurge bisshops enioyned bothe kinge fernando also bisshop roomes legate euery man hys owne dyocesse shoulde see godly reformation bee calleth conuocatyon hys state whych clergye cathedrall churche erles nobilitie ambassadours city matter beyng debated agreed godly holsome worke shoulde taken hand therefore appoynteth certen conceaue writyng draughte reformation shalbe espye good men bee mynisters churche thys wryting sendeth diuines collon wylleth iudge thereof scripture shew theyr opinion hys requeste sasatisfyed hauing conuenyent minister instructe people sent martyn bucer strasburg iohn gropper alwayes commended vnto hym highly hymselfe also knewe ryght wel familyar comunication commyng thither laste yere decembre begynnyng thys yere commaundemente prince beganne preache bomia towne vpon rhine fyue mile aboue collo ides march bisshop calleth newe assemblie state bomia requireth bucer preacheth bomia wolde consulte vpon godly reformation clergie assigned man pourpos rest state desyre archebishop according hys owne iudgemente hee wolde chouse mete men thynge wherfore committeth thys charge vnto bucer shoulde penne oute article christian doctrine thentent thynges might better donne bisshops boke reformatio intreateth prince electour saxonye wolde ioyne vnto hym melancthon commen iohn pistor fro lantzgraue woorke fynished archebishop sent clergie head church collon whych noble melancthon pistor come collon house requireth wolde ponder dyligently doctryne booke xxii daye iuly calleth synode exhibited vnto booke reformation requiring euery state wold chose certen whyche myght pervse booke ouer conferre hys thentent tollerable godly accorde myghte fyne bee clergie sayed vrged obstiuately bucet especially certen others appoynted late instructe people myghte bee dysplaced require tyme delyberation touching booke refuse conferre rest albeit knewe well enoughe pourpose made thys delaye yet thende fynd lacke graunteth tyme consulte spake remouing bucer hys companion refuse case man able conuicte eyther false doctryne euyll lyfe sondrye tymes offered lybertie trye beyng ready exhibite lawefull indifferent iudg wha matter therfore stayed prepare contrary booke booke called antidagma title antididagma preface booke wonderfull raylynge agaynst lutheranes affirme expresse wordes rather lyue vnder dominion turkes vnder magistrate wolde followe defend reformation author diuisor booke say gropper albeit familiar bucer two yeres regenspurge albeit comyng home thence comended gropper forsaketh gospell hym maruelously archebisshop also euerye others albeit written many frendely letter yet whan matter brought vnto poynt forsoke frendeship altogether leauynge hys prince hys preferment reuolted tentes aduersaries barnarde hagie chauncelour bothe many fatte benefyces diuines collon affailed bucerfore rattled hym vp manye opprobrious wordes requyred matter might come disputatio protested wold defende doctrine agaynste assembly hys defence also melanethon set forthe booke tyme exhortinge vnto modestie sheweth shamefull errours defende duke moris saxonye maketh certen lawes tyme duke moris maketh lawes ye minister churche obserued within hys dominio fyrst dede exhorteth preacher minister church execute theyr office diligently preache gospel sincerely shyne theyr stock honest example lyfe exhorte men prayer mutuall loue rebuke vice sharpelye sequester desperate person communion church consent magistrat vntyll amende suche thus refourmed present vnto magistrate secondly forasmoch youthe store churche publicke weale founded three grammer foundeth three scooles scooles misene merseburge porte euerye place fyndeth certen nombre scolars bothe theyr apparell common payeth also yerely stipendes theyr scolemasters thys vse doeth applye reuenewes relygious house wherin monkes dwelt suche others graunteth youthe shal remaine space sixe yeres land beneficiall uniuersitie lipsia also geueth augementation uniuersitie lipsia two thousand crownes yerely certen rasers wheat moreouer forbiddeth beggynge appoynteth yerelye somme monye certen place releue poore householder suche defloure lawes agaynst deflowerers uirgins adulterer maydes mary appoynteth thys punishement albeit sett foorthe afterwardes marye others yet shall committed pryson commaundeth aduouterers shall dye sworde noble men marie suche wyues haue accompanied beefore punnishethe thus taketh awaye theyr child borne marriage possession profites suche landes holde fee meane time themperoure coming oute spaine arriueth nauie gene xxvi day may addressyng letter thence duke saron lantzgraue theyr consortes moche alreadye sufficientlye warranted hys proclamation publyke peace also reformation chamber shal shortely exhorteth would refuse contribute theyr ayde agaynst turk whose preparation exceading greate also hys commyng credebly certifyed letter messaugers infourmed dooue conuention nauius wente vnto hym tyme also calleth counsell thempire spier agaynst laste daye nouembre departyng fro gene spake bisshop rome busset assemble spier towne riuer tare betwixte placence cremone agayne lyke case letter required proclayme hymself enemie french kynge sayde howe expedient common welth herin perseuered bisshop geuen hys sonne peter aloise parma placence whiche obteyned latelye college cardinalles exchaunge made city sometyme duke millan required emperour hys authorytie would pece monye confirme hys sonne possession pope woulde bye millan create hym duke themperoure helde millan wolde deminishe part hys ryght refuse saye moreouer howe bysshoppes intente haue perswaded themperour somme vfmony haue made nephew octauian duke millan emperour breaking talke might longer letted whan deliuered vnto cosmus medices duke florence casteles florence liburne vntill time owne custodye receyuing hym therfore two hondreth thousand ducates procedeth hys iorney came spayne created hys sonne philip kynge gaue vnto hym marriage ladye marye daughter vnto philip created kynge spayne iohn kynge portugall yere also sigismunde sonne sigismund kyng polle mary lady elyzabeth daughter fernando kyng romanes henry duke brunsewicke going mete themperour italy heynouslye accuseth protestantes cremoise whan themperour comming italy hys armie protestantes whiche lately receyued hys letter dated gene mete together sinalcalde xxiiii daye iune consulte sending hym ambassadours matter apperteyning defence kepyng dutchie brunswicke theyr league sollicite duke maurice king swecia otto henry palatine wuolfange prince bipounte bisshop munster whiche desyred receyued league assemblie ended xxi iuly moche aboute thys tyme emperoure kyng england make league league themp king england frenche kyng agaynste frenche kynge whiche ayded scottes sayde confederacie bisshop rome toke maruelous euill part therfore thoughte french frendeship nedefull hym whan themperour commen spier thende iuly protestantes sende thither ambassadours fraunces burcart george bemelberg christopher ueninger iames sturmius protest ambassad themperor admitted second auguste speake maner effecte king fernando conclusion theyr tale case might sufficiently warrau ted haue peace yf iudgement chamber myght refourmed lately decreed regenspurg yf inequalitie co tributyng may take away wil fayle beare theyr partes publicke necessity touchinge duke brunswicke theyre desyre matter maye come hearyng saye howe proue manifestly whiche firste done open iniurye city goslarie brunswicke haue benryghtlye expulsed dryuen oute hys countrey hereunto themperoure nauius presence granuellane two dayes bee required well enouge assured peace fourmer decree iudges chamber bee remoued theyr cause heard moneth october inquisitio shalbe made fault may found shall escape vnpunnished moderation contributinge made without comon assent state let consider present state publicke weale matter moste daunger vnlesse holpen time let geue theyr ayd agaynste turke lyke state doe muste hym selfe goe hys whole force agaynst frenche kyng duke cleaue thentente maye defende hys subiectes iniurye duke brunswick vrgeth sore restored therfore let saye theyr fantasye matter desire haue aunswere deliuered wryting may better consyder perour content nexte day went fro spier mentz farre ambassadours followed hym whan receyued wryting shewe granuellan nauius wherfore satisfyed touchinge peace theyr desyre cause brunswick might hearde haue comission matter archebisshop collon came themperoure spiers intreate duke cleaue vaine themp viage againste duke cleaue excepthe wolde fyrst departe posession gelderlande themperour wold heare mention peace ambassadoure saxonye hys prince commaundemente made suite duke cleaue granuellan mentz perswade dyd saye howe priuate iniurye muste bee forgeuen common welthes sake especially turk inuadeth maketh aunswer themperour wil goe fro hys pourpos inuasyon soeuer turkes shall make tolde heldesseme forsaken popisshe religion entred league protestantes ualentyne bisshop cytye hildisseme accused emperour accused heynousely chamber kynge fernando nowe also themperoure chaunged religion ceremonyes churche howe appoynted new preacher teache people put downe masse punnisshed follower olde relygyon howe haue broken beaten downe aultars fontstones also church howe haue taken theyr handes custody mouables good iuelles clergie late also haue setfoorthe gameplayes mocke deryde openly uirgin marye sainctes pourposynge forsake hys iurisdiction lynked themselues confederacie protestantes constreyned monkes others obserue theyr religyon violence wold obey haue put open shame also bannished themperour heard thys complaynte syxte daye august wryteth vnto wormes terrible threatenyng commaundeth restore relygyon thinges theyr fourmer state vntyll publicke decree establisshed matter thre dayes addresseth letter senate collon heareth certen preacher themperours letter collon labour sore remoue aunciente religion notwithstandyng haue stoutly resysted hytherto whych ryght ioyefull heare admonisshing perseuer kepe citezens theyr dewty shalbe acceptable whiche also declare dede tyme come kalendes iune bishop roome wryteth effecte vnto prebendary cathedrall churche collon care pope letter clergie colion sorrow mynd hath archebisshopppes folye conceaued greatly coforted theyr stoutenes constancy themselues also theyr neyghbours righte holsome nexte immortall god deserue thankes bothe moste noble citie also whole prouince sayfegarde therfore geueth ryght harty thankes standyng styffe cause whylest lyueth neuer forget albeit theyr dewtie yet thing self example must nedes confesse moche bounden vnto notwithstandyng nede bee constant thys cause chiefly left faynte archebyshop shoulde happely gette vpper hande wolde wreake hys tene extremly therfore let stronge stoute defence goddes name catholicke relygyon theyr owne lybertye saluation whyche wicked archeheretike goeth aboute subuerte destroye haue nede counselloure yet wolde also thruste thys spurre vnto runnyng desyreth ernestlye take good hede whiche vn woorthye name archebishop doe infect noble cytie contagion neyther take hym theyr pastoure enemie wyl fayle assist bothe hys counsell otherwyse letter dyd iohn poggius bisshops ambassadour themperour sent vnto xxv august little thys tyme french kyng goyng army uermandois taketh little towne themperours called landersey maketh french king fortifyeth landersey stronge fortification garisons aboute tyme also barbarousse turkes lieutenaunt conduit poline frenche man arriued greate nauie tolloye whiche hauen towne prouince fraunce betwene marselles nice turkes nauie arriueth prouince whan kyng knewe hys comyng sendeth duke uendome angiane force galleis assiste hym goe bothe nyce whan taken towne havon xx day august layesege castell armie castell nice beseged turkes made incursyon hongarye whyche tooke towne quinquecclese citie castell strigone wanne stulweysenburge assaulte bishop roome sente ayd wherof baptista sabella iulye ursine captianes came late whan diuines paris thus triumphed ouer lander depensius beefore sayde publyshe article doctrine propounded preacher lander whiche nombre xxv matter solenely donne paris first daye auguste people beyng called together maner trompet article recited also kynges commaundemente wer put prynte proclamation made vnder great penaltie man worke teache agaynst decree also added searching oute lutheranes diuines moreouer charge theyr studentes called bacchelaures batchelaurs others studie diuinitie follow fourme el expulsed colledge agaynste theyr doctryne caluine wrote booke whych calleth antidotum paynteth forth abooke caluine againste sorbonistes collours moch aboute tyme setteth forth booke frenche relyques saynctes thintente bothe thys age also tyme come may see case relygio falle recyteth thinges vnto knowe booke relieques sainctes wissheth done lykewyse country nombre cribbe swadling clothes bearing clothe foreskinne blud christ partely pure partely delayed water sixe waterpottes mariage citie cane galilee wyne christe made water stuffe furniture hys maundie last supper hys apostels manna people israell crosse cane nayles sponge launce crowne thorne cote shoe handkerchef teares chryst milke smocke heare girdel slipper combe ring uirgin marie sworde bucklar michel tharchangell scull iawebonne braynes fingar iohn baptiste chaire honlette massinge garmentes brayne peter body sainctes diuerse sondry place sheweth veneration people worshipped thynges whan pristes without monye let haue syght therof shewe farre verey tryfles thinges nought yf well considered haue nothing craft colloure diuised pristes lucre vase dutchelande ther two famous city thys behalfe treuers achon hither saye men wonte come two city full relicies see reliques oute hongary slauonye tyme marchauntes set forth theyr ware euery seuenth yere thauthorytie wonder mighte bee greater themperoure came mentz bomia water ther taught bucer tyme casper hedio also sent thither newly fro strasburg archbisshop man verey milde nature verey mete instruct people bothe great dauger especially spaniardes beyng thete themperour also doth wyll archebisshop ambassadours send waye melancthon departed thence also long obteynyng lycence departe hauing taken order minister church retourn home themperour wente dure tyme came towne xx auguste nexte daye sent herauld sommon towne willyng render vnto hym el wil attempte force soldiours within aunswer hym conteptuously sayinge affrayde hym good whyle sence made bayte fysshes brute went howe themperour afalsereport emperours deathe hys retourne barbarie ouerthrowe argiers suffered shipwreake drowned opinion setrled myndes cleauois would neyther credite whiche sayed sene hym scarsely spoken hym prynce hym selfe also lykewyse perswaded acerten fatall credulitie frenche men thought author forger vanitie lest cleauois relet feare themperours power fall coposition themperour receyuing aunswer whan fortyfyed camp furnished thinges xxiiii day august sone rysyng beginneth make battery geueth thassault especyally spanyardes whyche exceadyng preste wyllyng beyng often repulsed hauyng loste many men neuer ceased taken force fortune townes men suche wonte bee whan waye entrie made sword howbeit wont shewed head saint anne ladyes mother thither came yearelye greate multitude people xxvi daie iuly whyche dedicated sainct spaniardes victours caried head inclosed golde greate pompe deuoutely graie freres churche lest shoulde bee lost ruine burnyng churche towne spoyled distroyed fyre themperour marchinge forewarde rendred vnto hym gulick ruremunde stronge towne gelderlande situated ryuer rure mase mete sodein distructyon dure broughte men wonderfull feare perplexitie ruremunde goeth uenlon thither laste came duke cleaue hym campe accompanyed henry duke cleaue craueth pardon themperoure duke brunsewicke ambassadours archebishop collon time humbly besought themperoure perdon hym duke brunswicke also ambassadours ernestly intreated hym themperoure last ryseth vp appoynteth prynce orenge granuellane prescribe lawes vnto hym therefore vpon condition receyued againe fauoure seuenth daye september shall departe condicions imposed relygyon catholycke churche yf haue altered thynge let restored promyse hys fydelytie allegeaunce themperour king fernando thempire doe renounce league fraunce denmarke shall make confederacie wherin shall excepte themperoure fernando heires shall leaue possession gelderlande release people theyre othe case place place shall refuse render shall ayde emperoure recouer emperoure agayne restoreth vnto hym lande gulycke latelye conquered excepte two townes henseberge syttarde whyche hee wyll kepe tyme tyll haue somme experience hys fydelytie loyaltye whylest emperoure wente agaynste duke cleaue frenche kynge marcheth throughe champagne towardes lande luke sendeth lady iane hys systers daughter whyche despoused solemnelye maryed two yeares duke cleaue carye husbande wente full sore agaynste wyll shewed beefore howbeit obeyed kynge uncle daughter nauaris sent duke cleaue kynge appoynted vnto cardynall bellaye bysshop parys man mooste meete perswade kepe companye iorneye commen nowe soyssons goe thence kynge woorde broughte duke cleaue subdewed wherwith beeyng greatlye reioyced sawe shee nede feare thinge longer knewe wolde bee ende thereof neyther deceaued kynge newes sore astonyed retourneth home neuerthelesse procedynge taketh cytyo lucemburge aboute thende september delyberatyon fortyfyeth aboute thys tyme also henry eyghte kynge englande confederated latelye emperoure sendeth hym power men conduct syr iohn wallop capytayne laundersey beseged guisnes whyche ioynynge themperoures armye beesege towne landersey moneth october charles rosset lawyer sente emperoure mentz preacher gospel thrust oute metz tooke order senate monkes clergie obseruing olde relygion bannysshynge preacher others inclyned protestantes vnles shoulde reconcile selues within certeine tyme whan barbarousse beeseaged castell nice vayne themperoures power lu bardye sege leuied nice also approched whyche led marque piscare leuyed sege somewhat sooner tyme yeare requyred leadeth backe hys armie wynter tollon towne kynge assigned hym commaundyng citezes inhabiters auoyde thence yeare moche dissention dissencion scotland trouble scotlande mindes noble beyng deuyded lordes whyche sayed prisoner englande lib ally dismissed kynge furthered hys cause moche myght cardinall scotlande great yerely reuenewes benefyces fraunce quene beynge daughter duke guyse tooke frenche kynges parte yonge quene scottes affiaunced kynge edwarde death scottish king henry eyght wholy yonge quene scottes might affianced prince edward thing noble spake good seruyce perswaded hamelto gouernour toke cardinall besege quene certen castell makyng wrytynges confyrme marriage french kynge disturbed deuyse nobilitie also pitied moche quenes chaunce gouernoure reuolted thother syde brake theyr conuenauntes warres beganne agayne afresihe betwixt england shalbe declared herafter kyng denmarke also warre themperialles low countrye king denmarke warreth vpo perialles kyng christierne captiue axed ayde protestantes saye thys quarel concerneth theyr league prouyded case shoulde haue warre hys religion shoulde comon ayde defended duke cleaue made hys peace theperour sendeth ambassadoure kynge fraunce renounceth hys league duke cleaue renounceth frenche leage requyreth wyfe maye bee sente hym whose passage hathe obteyned saufe conduite themperoure kynge aunswereth ambassadour howe hath ben let hym hath bothe wyfe delyuered armye also sente hath ben hys owne faulte certifyed ther neyther open way passe party vitaile soeuer hath promised hath lyberally perfourmed also bounden hath donne well forgettyng noble lynage estate hathe brought hym selfe suche bondage concernynge hys nece maie knowe mynde parentes nothyng bounden hym whan themperoure establysshed thynges gelderlande moneth october came landresey exceadynge greate armye thyther came also french kynge hys whole force thynge none lyke haue commen battell frenche men vytayled towne departure frenchman ladersey went awaye nyght pryuely enemy perceiued day light length pursuing ouer tooke rerewarde slew many winter came themperour thinking good attempt whan set certen power sege luceburg dischargeth rest hys army duke maurice serued themperour landresey hys owne duke moris voluntarye mynde wherby gote moche good wyll made way obteyne hys frendship winter season duke lorayne certen others intreate peace vayne themperoure retournynge home landersey sent fardinando county willyam forsaketh frenchking gonzage uiceroy sicilie kyng england might incense hym agaynste frenche kynge haue oftentymes mentioned william countie fursteberge beyng made strau ger frenche kinge made suite granuellan come themperours fauour declare hys fydelytie leuyed certen power foote men hys owne iurisdictyon wente myddes wynter lucemburge ioyned hym selfe perours armie frenche men conduite duke longouile vitayled within departeth without thynge doon many dead colde honger shewed howe counsell thempyre appoynted last nouember wherfore protestantes assemble together franckfourd consulte thynges shoulde treate whole assemblye matter delayd reason frenche warres duke saxon lantzgraue moneth nouember addressyng letter themperoure aduertise hym howe wyll come counsell yf hymselfe wyll bee graunte saufecounduite theyr league fredes wherunto themperour aunswered fro brusseles x day decembre would come doubtles moneth ianuarye sendeth withall saufconduite howebeithe excludeth suche addicte hys enemyes promesse faythe conuenaunte signifyinge priuie espialles frenche kynge begynnyng ianuary takyng hys iorney commeth spire xxiiii day thys moneth great eclipse sonne daye tyme men beheld without great wonder yeare also thre ful eclipse moone matter dede bee wondred whyche astronomiers thre
