eclipse moone saye hathe chaunced synce tyme great charles alexander farnese cardinall passyng throughe fraunce spoke themperoure goynge towardes thassemblye tooke hys leaue hym wormes cause ambassade thought treaty peace assemblie spier exceading great booth king great assemble spiere farnando prynces electours seldome seene maner prince amonges also duke cleaue duke saxony comyng whych xviii day february lantzgraue archebisshop colo friderick paulsgraue uiceroye sicilye went foorth met hym two dayes counsel began themperour propoundeth cause leauynge spayne nowe retourned germany hath called conuention hath sufficietly declared hys letter dated gene neyther nede recyte howe moche hathe euermore loued publyke weale thynges put order home myghte warre agaynst common enemye christendome howe hath ben impeached hytherto vnknowen thys last yere procurement french kyng turkisshe nauie comen sea ligurie hath inuaded countrey duke sauoye prince thempire taken citie hauen nice greate force beseged castell vattered ryght sore albeit constrayned throughe hys armye approchynge leuye theyr siege yet haue syns attempted place thempyre spayne also nowe wholy aboute distroie together therfore matter nowe brought extreme daunger vnlesse ioyne theyr mindes power helpe feared lest germanye shall acknoweledge bewayle hys miserye al late hath often wisshed redresse euilles frech kynge mouing warre agaynst hym insondry place could neither retourne germanye ioyne power theyres turke doeth boldly inuade germany warres cause turkes prosperitie also attempted agaynste hym haue euell successe hytherto cause hathe ben fyrst hath ben aduertysed tyme tyme frenche kyng dissention relygion publycke priuate dyspleasure al degree state thempyre thynges donne therein secondlye seeth howe frenche kynges hand fyndeth fauour socour ready hath declared witnesse letter nowe also proued dede asmoche therfore styreth vp armeth comon moste cruell enemye others agaynste christen publyke weale supposeth shoulde esteme thys warre whyche constreyned maynteyne agayste hym non otherwyse attempted agaynste turke trustynge moreouer wyll onlye condemne hys practyse enterpryses also wyll french king compared turke assiste hym thentente beyng delyuered domestycall enemye maye dysplaye hys whole force agaynste turke thys expostulatyng ayd decreed turkish warre sente accordyngly wante wherof turke hathe agayne thys laste yere preuayled taken certen townes castels hongarye requyreth seeyng turke goeth wynne hongarye maye inuade germanye wolde consyder depelye weyghtye matter may haue ayde oulye defend inuade also thende thys moste noyso plage may one driuen away theyr wyues child natif contrie declaring moreouer willing ye thinges amisse shoulde refourmed emongs iudgement chamber day king fernado hys ambassadours speakig many thinges protestantes oration themperoure roades invasion turkes craueth aide immediatly duke saxon lantzgraue confederate addressing oratio theperour know saye moste victorious emperoure howe haue offered oure selues euer syns beginnynge declare moste honorable senate cause defence taken agaynst henry brunswicke yet also mynde doubtyng matter shalbe hearde shall appeare vnto weyghty iust cause wherfore dryuen necessitie lawfull hym present counsell prince howbeit see hym put hymselfe prease occupie place thys noble consistorye moche agaynste oure willes moche maye doe protest wee neyther take hym acknoweledge hym prynce thempire neyther right oures shoulde hys presence diminished wherunto duke brunswicke aunswereth streyghte waye hys chauncelour duke brunsewicke accuseth protestauntes duke saxo sayeth lantzgraue theyr fellowes breakyng god law man law infringing statute thempire faythe publicke violence open wronge haue spoiled countrey cause haue accused iudges chaber seeyng ought haue place senate thempire yf haue nowe lost committing acte worthye whose companye men shoulde eschewe muste nedes syt comon counselles protest neyther attribute place vnto therfore preiudicial case protestantes verye desyrous euen haue recited cause theyr enterpryse whole matter wrytynge leste hys complaynte shoulde appere trewe settle mennes heartes theperour fridericke palatyne nauius required forasmoch day farre spent wold differre affirming also wolde assigne day pourpos followed hys mynde prince sat counsell fortuned lantzgraue sate next duke brunswicke prince palatine iohn suner auoyding stryfe arryseth hys place sytteth downe myddes betwixte bothe protestyng shoulde bee preiudice hym familye yt thought perours request day duke saxon lantzgraue intreated fridericke paulsegraue iohn nauie wold deuise themperour duke brunswicke might come comon assemblie could obtayned themperour alledging might excluded vnlesse cause fyrst declared frenche kyng knowing certe tie french ambassade assemble spier themperour wold make greuous complaynte hym prynces determineth honorable ambassad iohn bellaie cardinal fraunces oliuer chauncelour alenso affricane malley presydent diuion whan wer commen nance towne lorayne remayne lookyng themperours saufcondict king sent spier heraulte cause letter themperour seuerall letter also prince electours wherin required saufe conduite hys ambassadours came spier ende februarye hys rich cote armes accustomed stayed granuellan vnto delyuereth kyng maisters letter written themperoure whan myghte otherwyse doe declareth cause hys comyng requyring thambassadours farre maye accordyng law armes haue saufconduite beyng co maunded tary within dilligetly watched man french herault euil receyued spier come speake hym fourth day dismissed sharpe wordes played fond part dau ger haue lost hys head whych durste presume come thyther kynge beyng enemy germany hathe doe lymites thempyre neyther worthy enioye law nation let hym retourne home therfore tell kynge thus howe ther cause herafter either may comefor nowe dede fault forgiuen perdoned themperours clemencie desert let take hede heceforthe el wil escape vnpunnisshed hath law army neyther laweful hym haue comen themperours habitation without leaue permissio touchyng letter whyche sayeth hath kyng hath well deserued christen publicke weale chefely germanye thys present state thynges themperour neyther wyll ought receyue lest hys accustomed maner writing promise eyther also others myghte disceaued aunswer delyuered vnto hym wrytten frenche thus sent back kynges letter wrytten themperour prynces certen horseman sente hym conduite nance prince made priuie many thoughte done agaynst custome thempyre thys thyng knowen ambassadours pecke trouble toke great thought retourne home without daunger vsing counsell authony duke lorayne went waye secretly nyght season retourned frauce whylest yet remayned nance ambassador retorne nighte christine duke daughter lawe sente spier thing neither could certen others might themperours nece sister intreaty teares certen commendation kind obtayne yet vayne themperour wholy bent haue warre hys counsellours sayde muste doe mayntaine hys estimation dignytie duke lorayne albeit addicte neyther long syns couenaunted myght newter yet asmoche warre kepte vpon hys frontier sawe howe coulde done without hys greate losse domage verye carefull peace ix daye februarye certen priuces themperours motion wryt letter fro spire prince letter pope bisshop roome partely commendyng hym laste yere adioyned hys force themperours rescue castell nice partly requiring moch enemye reparyng nauie tollone repare agayne nice win castell shoulde greate shame sore anoyeaunce vnto italy churche roome common welth father comon welthe hygh bisshop wolde ayde duke sanoye hys helpe counsell hys syngular wisdome wolde deuyse meanes howe cruell enemye myght expulsed nice also fro place hathe hauens holdes hys refuge thys shoulde thynge bothe god acceptable whole common wealth also moste holsome profitable diuerse perswations touching matter bishop aunswereth xxvi day february theffect aunswer thys castell nice may bee pope aunswer defended wyll lesse carefull hereafter hathe ben hytherto trustyng carefull wyll lesse mydnfull take paynes whole common welthe shall best become longe rehearsal ayde men captaynes hath sent hongary affrica agaynst turkes hath wasted treasure suche affayres ofte hath sent ambassadours oft traueled self aboute publyke weale sayeth fyne lyke commende vnto hym nice doeth commende vnto state comon welth whiche sore afflicted decayed chiefe waye helpe thys matter myndes kynges may reconciled meane heale comon welth thys welsprynge procedeth discommoditie comon welth dissention betaken awaie fourmer beautie come agayne grudge displeasure neyther heresy germany turkee hongarye soone waye made throughe ciuile discorde immediatelye sprange vp heresyes faction hatred bothe publyke pryuate hitherto hath also counsel ben letted hyndered therfore muste seeke recouer peace thexample phisitions take away fyrst cause ye disease peace warre turk put flyght counsel peace may kepte heresyes euer amisse may refourmed otherwise let thinke eyther nyce bee defended enemye part christendome kept fre daunger men shalbe wrapped calamitie distructio moneth march paulsegraue lewis prince electour departed lyfe brother fridericke succede prince electours thother state themperours aduise second day aprill sende letter swyses prince letter swiss diswade aydyng french kyng vtter decay ruine christen relygyon hathe lincked hym selfe turkes thys last yere hath conducted theyr nauie sea lygurie haue warred vpon duke sauoye taken nice yet remayne still fraunce intendiuge worke mischiefe themperour hys country wherfore require hencefoorthe suffer non theyr men serue frenche kynge thys wicked league people mahomet ought detested men taken comon enemie yf gon hym already call home agayne vse selues maye appere doe neglecte publycke preseruation whilest consulted matter propounded themperoure duke lantzgraue theyr confederate fyrst daye aprill themperoure kyng fernando al protestantes accuse duke brunswick state thempyre accuse henry duke brunswick heynous offence also recite order wrytinge harmes iniuries done cytyes brunswicke goslarye theyr consortes whose defence wer costrayned repulse vniust violence reherse howe many yeres hys whole endeuour hath ben seeke occasyon moue warre agaynst proue testimonye letter founde tolde whan expulsed hys princypall castell letter whych wrytten parte archbisshop mentz duke bauier heldus tenure letter dryue oute wissheth oft themperours comyng spaine hope therof braggeth threateneth tyme themperour come slacked matter complayneth hys lyngering delaye wayleth hys fellowes satisfyed league made norinberge neglected layeth blame therof granuellan corrupted mony protestantes raileth hym wissheth hym shamfull death demerites saieth themperour slepe awaked vseth hys name sometime clooke terrour faukners wonte many tymes shewe foorthe dead hauke feare fowle withall many letter suche lyke sorte wherin vttereth hys mynde affection red openlye moche effecte duke bauier heldus wrytten agayne henry brother duke george saxonie league protestantes altered religion saide duke brunswicke letter messagers sollicited themperour take awaye hys landes trustyng set kepe possession contrie herof wer letter also recyted furthermore declare hym wycked duke brunsewicke conte neth hys owne religion doeth contemne delude bisshoppes relygion wyll seme maynteyne proue moste euydent testimonie thys duke brunswick maryed lady mary syster ulriche duke wirtemberge gentlewoman waytyng vpon excellente beautye called eue trottine vpon husbande doted loue perswaded mayde diuers child thentent matter straunge tale saide duke bee perceyued myght vse company longer geueth counsel faine though wold go home paretes fournissheth horse charyote althynges necessarye iorney departeth thought haue gone home conueyed castell hys captayne made priuie thyng done woman two appoynted wayte vpon moste trusted eue within day came thither kepeth bed fayneth self sycke caused made image wood whiche dyd represente head necke boulke dead body partes made set lynen clothes wemen stuffed filled earth asshes might seme proportionate set image wood clothe together cloth shape couered also otherpartes wood body therfore thus ordered lapped wynding shete layed foorth floure streyght way cometh one wome parlour dore captain declareth eue dead commaundeth coffin made lay body make men affrayde body come nere hir fayne dyed plage perfume house graines iuniper sauoury thinges corp brought foorth solemne pompe caryed graye freres churche honorably buried image buryed sle e eue messe dirige freres pray al yere long desyre people theyr sermon doe moreouer duke commaundemente funerall made chapell castell sayde dyed lykewyse hys head castell woulsebutell whiche farre citie brunswicke thither came also reporte death obite exequie wyfe dutch woman trayne maydens mournynge apparell thithere came manye pristes sente oute contrye whyche dyner made monye geuen rewarde euery man somewhat olde accustomed maner amonges papistes meane tyme eue whose deathe many bewayled liueth fareth well castell stansseburge oftentymes duke visiteth syus tyme hath seuen child perswadeth hys wyfe also sygnyfye parentes frendes eue dead bruted abrode alyue kepte castell stansseburge hys wyfe also inkling therof conceaueth vehement suspicion inquyreth seruautes howe matter stoode forbad man shoulde come knewe thyng thys suspicion sticked faste mynde longe lyued wryting ofte vnto hym bewayled miserye thys fact hys recyted emonges others presence thentent men might vnderstande opinion hys owne relygion conclusion theyr accusation proue howe iuste necessarye cause attempted war agaynst hym contemnyng proclamation themperour kinge fernando disturbed publicke peace wrought kynde iniurye theyr fellowes confederate duke brunswicke present thys action themperoure willing protestantes desyred myght haue ben presente herein moued themperour easter monday xiiij day aprill themperours soldiours led marque piscare foughte battell piedmont frenchemen towne carignane lost felde french victory carignane many thousandes slayne generall frenche armie angian duke uandosme mentioned whanreport came ouerthrow many men supposed themperoure wolde haue refused treatye peace ernestly bent haue warre made preparation accordyngly duke bruswicke aunswereth accusation protestantes xxiij day aprill powryng greate heape reproches obiecteth vnto conspiracie rebellion treaso extortio societie wirth turkes frenche men touching letter founde castel excuseth well maye yf theyr closettes searched saieth might great deale worse stuffe befounde matter concernyng eue hys darlyng toucheth little reproche protestantes make aunswere agayne whan themperoure wolde suffer matter pleaded openly exhibite wryting afterwardes doth duke brunswicke xxvij day aprill charles duke sauoye agayne hys ambassadoures duke sauoye accuseth frech king accuseth french kyng besydes violence iniuryes foormer yeres sayeth hathe styred vp turkes lieutenante barbarousse beyng ayded frenche men hath taken composition hys citie nice agaynst fidelitie promesse spoyled leadyng many awaye captiuitie hath sette fyre requireth therfore would help hym thys hys extreme miserye especiallye seeyng enemy fully prefixed retourne sege castel hath craued ayde bishop roome hath graunted hym trybut whiche clergie wonte paye hym yerely verye smal reliefe thys hys pouertie scarsely possesseth tenth parte hys dominion came hym selfe counsel excuseth hym hys age longe iorney iminent daunger hys enemye saieth moreouer hable beare charge whiche hath scant somuche wyll fynde hym hys sone hys familie aboute thende aprill swises assemble bade swysses aunswer prince letter make aunswer letter state thempyre howe theyre captaynes beyng demaunded question affirme saw band turkes frenche campe hearde thynge therof woulde haue serued frenche kynge beyng moued herin doeth complayne sent ambassadours last winter coulde admitted myght haue ben hearde speake coulde easely haue confuted thys slau der themperoure refuse peace promiseth bohemers wrote hym februarie also germanes hys ayde agaynst turke nowe touching themselues somme dede bounden serue french kyng warres composition agayne league amit hym haue ben many yeres whose dominion runne fraunce done contrary theyr knowledge lyke may also happen place germany rekon beste kynges ambassadours shoulde hearde peace establyshed wherin may good wil al heartes tyme kyng england send great nauie scotlande chauncynge good wynde whan arriued thenglishe nauie inuadeth scotlad take fyrste lythe notable hauon eddenborough head cytie scotlad castell kept agaynst situation vnprenuable burnt begynnyng moneth may thys assemblie themperoure solemn ceremonie created woolfang master prusse openly gaue armes aperteynynge office whyche alberte brandenburge brother george casimire enioyed many yeres marieng wyfe vsurped hym selfe therfore oute lawed chaber twelue yeres declared sygismunde kynge poole defended hym hys cliente nowe tyme inuested haue sayed kynges ambassadoure prote ted openlye thys creation vnlawfull neyther oughte bee derogation kynge hys master vnder whose defence protection lande prusse whan ambassadours hongary recited theyr misfortune losse yeare paste requyred ayde thempyre nowe matter broughte verey extremitie yf bee nowe leafte destitute must nedes doe men wont matter desperat man blame wil accept right harde condition yea bodage selfe rather whilest men sit still loke fal present destructio frech king heraulte sent away spier letter declared whan ambassadours therfore wer retourned home ye oratio oration frech ambassadours haue state germany set forth print beginning get good say bothe nation haue one originall neither thing chaunce vnto germany apperteineth wel vnto fraunce tha cofute reportes aduersaries though king warre disturbe comon welth haue made league turke vsing certe preface appeace themperour affirme former warre begon king could obteine duke sauoie mother inheritauce later ye kinges ambassadours wer slain law nation yt king hathe league societie turke marchandise comon quiet uenetians polonias others haue albeit ther wer league betwixt wer reprehended asmoch time past abraha dauid salomo phineas child tobie captaines machabeis holy men haue league men contrarye relygyon haue done like also themperours honorius costatine theodostus ye yonger iustinian secod palaologus leo frederick first second haue vsed aide succour nation contrary religio doubtles fredericke second euen vpon shoulder saracen caried italy fro whence bisshopes rome expulsed know great power aide king hath oftener promised turkish warre hereof also bishop senate cardinalles good wytnesses cause whye turke inuaded hongarye contentyon aboute gouernemente moore provoked war affricke taking townes late turkisshe nauie came ligurian sea imputed kynge neyther maketh pourpose poline kinges seruaunt thintet barbarousse searche take androwe de aurie enemie could fynde hym beseged castell nice hys owne determination kyng dede hath taken trewes turke lyke hath tymes shewed honest hurtfull man ought blamed consydering greatest men haue also lately muche desyred state publyke weale sore afflicted kynge right sory meane maie peace recouered themperoure restore kinge thinge owne ryghte heritaunce yf brynge thys passe kinge wyll spare neyther trauell cost perill defende germanye foreine violence fourmer bookes haue hearde duke saxon wolde acknoweledge fernando kynge romanes thys conuention matter wente duke saxon set throughe kynge ferdinando moneth maye duke promised honour hym accordingly themperour agayne ratifyeth marriage conuenauntes betwixte hym house cleaue whiche euer refused permitteth case duke cleaue fortune dye withoute heyres malles duke saxon whiche maryed hys syster heires male succede yet vpon thys condicio chaunce shal agree vpo religion bande amitye fernando themperours consente promiseth geue daughter elenore marriage duke saxos eldest sonne yf reconcilemente religion may marying able latter thyng kepte verey secret closely couered eyther syde neyther lantzgraue hys fellowes knewe anye thynge thereof matter done fewe counsellours themperoure vsed granuellane feruando hoffeman duke saxon pontane burcarte king de marke also sendynge hys ambassadours fell composytion themperoure kepte hys power wynter longe chaunce myghte haue happened semed forsake frenche kynges frendeshyp turkyshe confederacye french king hate men turk societie somuch ambassadours dyd sygnyfye famylyar talke fellowes nowe wyll retourne demaundes themperoure kynge fernando matter beyng longe muche debated tenth daye iune conuention ended state thempyre albeit thoughte muche bee charged double ayde yet supposynge shoulde better warre agaynste turke yf domesticall enemie fyrste broughte vnto hys bewtye graunted themperoure monye fynde foure thousande horseman xxiiii thousande footemen halfe yere agaynst state thempire decree aide frenche kynge frenche kynge parte monye themperouce departeth hys brother fernando thentente shoulde fortifye suche place nere turkes turkishe warre come agreed moneye shouldbe gathered euerye man throughe oute germany men seased theyr landes goodes man bee exempted enacted man shoulde serue foreine prynces especyally frenche kynge magistrate permitted execut taken maner controuersy relygyon could warlycke affaire decree relygion bee treated differred tyll nexte assemblye bee holden moneth december meane season wyll themperoure appoynte certen good well learned men compile godlye fourme reformation also exhorteth prince lyke ende throughe conference made next assemblye somethyng common assent may establysshed obserued vntyll generall counsel holden germany prouincial sinode meane tyme let men quyet styre vp trouble dyuersitie relygion church also relygion euer bee maye inioye theyr commodytyes eyther partie parte goodes imployed fynding mynisters churche free schooles poore cha ber iudges chamber shall kepe theyr place vntyll tyme prefixed whan shalbe expired shall receyued nomber indifferently without respecte relygion decre auspurge action commenced agaynst protestantes doctryne sake case also goslarie minden hang suspence vntill nexte treaty anabaptistes suffer punishement long synce determined yet shall magistrate assigne learned godlye men shewe theyr errour call agayne amendemente catholickes mislyked thys decree resisted withal theyr force byshopes collon munster held protestantes also duke cleaue marque baden referred althinges theperours pleasure log disceptation deuised thys way meane tollerable party wel shortned nubre say certely wil assent howbeit prescribe themperour resyst hys authorytie cotent suffer friderick paulsgraue marque brandenburge prince electours intreated yt might thus decreed protestates desired also yt duke bru swickes case might haue ben coprised ye decree could obtayned themperour vrged eyther restore el permit vnto prouince sequestration til matter tryed therof treated duke lantzgraue present theyr departure moche theyr deputy city fyrst refused ayde french warre reason theyr intercourse trade marchandise tyme prynces assented frenche kynges cause full hatred subscribed also thoughe sore agaynste theyre willes especyally nere vnto fraunce ambassadours duke luneburge wirtemberge refused also admonysshed priuately chastened woordes alone shoulde lette good residewe whan latzgraue ready goe home came take hys leaue themperoure themperoures gentlenes lantzgraue gentle intertaynement themperoure said howe wolde trouble hym thys tyme serue agaynste frenche kynge thys cause wolde bringe hym hatred whan thys warre doone wyll goe streight waye agaynste turke wyll make hym hys lyeutenaunte generall warre whan certen modestie excused abased hymselfe vnmete suche charge haue done righte well euer nowe sayeth themperoure bothe youre selfe others doubte doe v also ryght good seruice wordes taketh hys leaue hym moste frendely beyng full good hope ioyefull themperoure moche hys good lorde whan declared certen hys frendes retourneth home touching sequestration longe moche pleadinge agreed landes dutchie brunswicke committed themperoure hyghe magistrate tyll case heard determined duchye brunsewicke committed theperoure eyther frendely ryghte lawe themperour shoulde committe gouernement contrye eyther paulsgraue electoure brandenburg moreouer duke maurice duke cleaue shall abyde thys ordre suffer penaltye breakynge publycke peace themperoure doe aduertyse duke brunswicke obeye yf punish according lawes thempire condicions last themperour propounded herin perseuered tha protestantes ratifie shalbe declared herafter asseblie ous finsshed theperour goeth fro spier metz themperoures iornoy fraunce nowe armie assembled lorayne vpon border fraunce thed may recouered citie luce burg coposition warre ther serued theperour duke maurice saxonie marque albert ether thousand horseman moreouer counte william furstemburge captayne footemen sebastian sherteline protestantes relygion whylest themperour mentz take lorayne huberte erle richlynge germane serued frenche kynge beyng brought mentz condened suffer cou tesse hys wyfe whan comen thither fel downe prostrate themperours feete coulde fynde fauoure nowe thynges prepared executio length procured maximylyan sonne kyng fernando themperour lately receyued thende obtayned hys pardon saued hys life meane tyme barbarousse eyther hys bufynes requyred orheyng perswaded kynge el fearyng leste frenche barbarossue retourneth kyng conclude peace themperoure retourneth home euer place sea syde apperteyned themperoure thempire inuadeth spoyleth bisshop rome landes refraineth lyke french kinges perswasion themperours armye marchynge forewarde taketh towne castell lyney three myles barrey thence goeth sandesyre frenche towne standyng vpon riuer marne kept stronge garrison ouer mounser landren captayne valeauntely yere beefore defended towne landersey themperour thenglishemen whilest thynges thus woorkynge death duke lorayns anthony duke lorayne departeth lyfe moch age thoughte care tooke thys nere almoste domesticall warre fraunces hys sonne succeded whiche maryed themperours nece christine sayde thys meane whyle kyng england sendeth ouer sea caleis duke northfolke one armye marchynge throughe bollonois went beseged moustrell maximilyan countiede bure themperours accorde serued kynge england immedyately sente stronge armye duke suffolke layed sege bollogne thyther came king kyngs besegeth bollogns person frenche kynge appoynted gouernoure mounser ueruyne man honoure whan themperour enuironed sadesyre army maketh batteri bretch onse made geueth thassault yt ides iuly townes men stode theyr owne defence moste valeauntelye themperialles repulsed fyue hondreth soldiours slaine fynally seconde moneth tyme landrey gouernoure slayne fall house gunner wanted pouder towne rendred durynge thys seege renate prynce orenge beeynge stryken greate peece nexte daye whan made cosyn erle nassow hys sonne heire ended lyfe without great grief themperoure tyme deathe prince drenge protestantes ambassadours lorayne myght confyrme couenauntes sequestration latelye propounded themperour fyrst rested metz tullie sendynge dyuerse letter themperour granuellan declared rause theyr commyng themperoure last excusyng hym selfe hys warlyke affayres bad go home agayne differreth whole matter next conuention thempyre tyme conuenient whan sandesyre taken themperour xxv day august marcheth styll leauing catalane towne champagnie pitcheth tentes riuer marne syde wherof laye certen bandes frenche horseman ambusshe counte willyam furstemberge whyche counte willyam taken prisoner knewe sytuation fraunce euery passage goeth foorthe nighte one man searche place ryuer myght wade ouer foorde passe theyr armie hauing pesaunt contrie bee hys guyde whan founde forde gone ouer syde intercepted frenche horseman caryed theyr campe greate derysyon withoute reproches seruinge caryed greate deale golde oute fraunce thence sente parys thyng chaunced themperonre contrary hys expectation helde hym long suspence french king swysses commen eschewed battell themperoure procedynge foorth ryuer syde dayly auaunced hys campe partyes towne eperney moche store victualles munition warlycke furniture whiche thynges leste shoulde come enemyes handes conueyed greate haste downe riuer coulde bee caryed awaye consumed fyre frenche men themselues eperney brunte settyng towne fyre wherfore themperoure withoute resistance marched castell theodoricke towne ryuer two dayes iorneye paris albeit frenche kynges ambassadours sente entreate peace themperours campe yet marched forewarde neuer lesse whan commen thus farre arose wonderfull feare amonges parys men welthe fled thence neyther coulde kepte backe kynges proclamation forbiddynge feare flyghte parisian man flee vilest sorte remayned styll therfore daunger leste greatest citie europe exceadyng ryche also shoulde euen haue spoyled uninersitie wonderfull nombre studentes al country christendom fled also king dede proclamed alienes shoulde departe immediatlye vnder payne deathe thys begynnynge september fewe dayes kynge englande hauynge sore shaken battered bollen hys myghtye ordenaunce rendred vnto hym whiche neyther hys father kynges former tyme could bollon rendred euer wynne dyd batter walles canon shot shake sondre castell bulwarkes vndermynyng whyche wynnynge stronge place common practise prince also greate heuge morter peces whyche shotte suche compasse fell ryght downe looke lyghted brake downe beefore grounde many wer oppressed ruine made rest loued theyr lyues driuen kepe caues sellars vnder earth last xxiiij day september theperour maketh peace peace concluded betwixte themperour fraunce frenche kynge whan commen castell theodoricke towne soissons peace maker themperours parte gonzage uiceroye sicilie granuellan frenche kynge claudie annebalde admirall charles nulley gilbart baiarde condicions wer soeuer hathe ben taken eyther syde syns trewes condicions peace nice restored agayne french kyng shall render duke lorayne towne asteney vnder protection lucemburg shall aydeone ioyne al force together olde relygion concorde churche maie restored frenche king promiseth ayde themperour turkissh warre sixe hondreth men armes ten thousand footemen renounceth title clayme arragonie naples flaunders artois gelderlande themperour agayne renounceth hys ryght countie bollonois perone townes standyng vpon water moreouer lowe burgundye contrie macon promiseth geue maryage kynges sonne duke orieans lady mary hys eldest doughter el daughter hys brother fernando whether wyll geue shall declare foure moneches yf geue daughter promiseth dowary brabant gelderlande lucemburge limburge flaunders holland henaulte artois namures friseland utrecht hys dominion also hyghe burgundie hys deathe maye inioye possesse yf thus doe kyng hymselfe hys chyldren renounceth hys ryght millan fortune themperours daughter dye hauinge child duke orleans departeth possession ryghte millan remayneth wholy frenche kynge themperoure ryghte house burgundie yf geue daughter fernando grau teth dowarie dukedome millan howe euer mariage shalbe accomplisshed within yeres space kynge shall wholy restore duke sauoie kynge also permytted kepe hesdin themperour promiseth whole endeuour peace maye bee made also betwixte fraunce englande concernynge duke cleaue beecause kynge quene nauarre affirme theyr daughter neuer consented marriage also witnessed contrarye solemne accustomed maner frenche kynge shall sende protestation peroure within syxe weekes thynge maye bee determyned thys peace comprised bisshop roome kynge fernando portugall polle denmarke uenetians swyses duke sauoye lorayne florence farrane mantua urbine cytyes gene luke sene prynces electours al state thempyre obedyente themperoure thys peace concluded themperoure dyschargynge hys armye retourneth home brusselles men woondred thys peace makynge euen whyche themperours frendes famylyare hym loked certenly conquest went fielde made theyr boast fewe monethes fraunce shoulde bee theyres three moste myghty enemyes fraunce kynge shoulde commaundemente three moste myghty enemyes themperoure germannes kyng englande sixtenth booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyste argument sixtenth booke p pope letter admonisheth taunteth threateneth themperoure hys sonne maketh new cardinalles clergie colon resisteth archebishop master peter bruly preachynge tournay brent quicke whilest assemble woormes merindolle cabriere named uandois sacked burnt pope notwithstandyng counsell hym called burned desyre make warre agaynst protestates luther wryteth hym paynteth hym hys collours grignian sente protestantes cause approue counsell archbisshop colon cited roome open warre betwixte duke brunswicke lantzgraue wherin lantzgraue victory palsgraue prince electour receyueth gospell bruites warre sowen agaynst protestantes colloquie ordeyned regenspurge dispute relygion broken counsell trente publysshed session beginne meane tyme luther departeth oute presente lyfe whan warres hotest bysshop pope letter emperoure roome eyghte kalendes septembre wryteth hys letter themperoure wherin rebuketh hym sharpelye vsurpinge sayeth hys authorytie intermedlinge reformation relygion whiche neuerthelesse dooeth ascribe hys owne nature malycyous perswations euell men hathe lately made league frendship threateneth thexamples dathan abiron core whiche wolde haue taken vpon authorytye moyses aaron also kyng ozias god strake leprosie wolde attempte burne incese vpon aultar telleth hym playnely hath nothing doe reformation church longe vnto hys office chyefly god hath geuen authorytie bynde loose proueth ensamples suche emperours haue aided see roome bisshoppes therof god hath euer rewarded great gyftes benefytes greate constantyne theodose charlemaygne agayne haue resisted haue enemy romish church ben punnyshed greate misfortune morys constans phylyp leo henry fourthe fridericke seconde whyche came vnto shamefull endes taken also slayne owne chyldren suche disobedience kynges emperours also whole nation haue ben plaged namelye iewes grekes one crucifying chryst sonne god others contemnyng hys vicar moreouer wylleth imitate example greate constantyne refused iudg bisshops cause notwithstandynge coulde contente vse hym coadiutour matter relygion herin head gouernour abyde hym fynally warneth fro hence pope abide superiour foorthe treate relygion assembly thempyre referre vnto hys indgement disanulle abrogate suche thynges hath ouer moche fufferaunce already graunted rebelles aduersaryes churche rome el must constrained deale roughly either hys custome nature also beare yet wil neglect hys dewtie example god plage vpon helithe prest euer eye hitherto hath vsed clementie father themperoure pope eldest sonne thys serue must feele another waye therfore let consider whether shalbe hys honour assist olde age recouerynge tranqullytie churche el fauour seke desolation thought frech king set hym wryte thus extremely made matter odious reason englysh league incense bysshop herof cometh wryteth societie euel wont swe craue hys frendship right busyly bothe letter great prince swe pope fauoure ambassadours especyallye tyme warre eche laboureth hym selfe may bee hym acceptable aboute thys tyme stephen bisshop winchester set foorth boke agaynst bucer verey opprobrious bitter wherin emonges thinges defendeth sengle lyfe yere bisshop created cardinalles christopher madruce trente otto truckesse bishop creatyon cardinalies auspurge germanes george arminiack iames anuebald frechmen fraunces mendoza bartholomewe cueua spaniardes gratifye emperoure fernando frenche kynge tyme also calleth counsell whyche ben hindered heretofore reason warres agaynst ides marche yere counsel called following themperour french king wer peace vttereth greate gladnes writte wherewith reneweth connsel beginneth place scripture letare ierusalemin dayes also cometh foorthe booke luther touchyng lordes supper wherin reneweth olde controuersie luther booke lordes supper speaketh many thynges agaynste zwinglius fellowes doctryne aunswered zuricke ryght sharpelye tolde clergie uniuersitie collon howe theyr whole force resisteth archebisshop reformation religion procedeth sendyng clergie collon arche bisshop agayne ambassadours letter requyre hym leaue attende decree counsell yf must coplayne higher magistrate fynde remedy quyet theyr conscyence pacifye god wrath lothe take waye yf goo forewarde muste nedes whan coulde thus preuayle ix daye october assemble head churche collon recyte wrytyng amonges thynges hath ben done wormes xxiij yeres past luther common asset prince condemned themperoure decreed auspurge regenspurge latelye spyer thynges neglected saye theyr archebysshop herman hathe gon new waye worke hath sent bucer apostata twyse polluted incestuous mariage sacramentary defendour opinion hym hath committed thecclesiasticall function hath appointed euery new preacher lewde euill person also fourme refourmation diuised set forth prince commaundement thinges haue euer theyr power resisted ofte desired archebisshop woulde staye vntyll counsell leste vntill conuention thempire vayne nowe forasmuche state prouince lamentable tendeth greate vnquyetnes perswaded necessitie doe flee laste remedye doe appeale bisshop roome themperoure hyghe protectour aduocate god churche committe appeale pope emperour theyr thoughtes vnto theyr tuition chief assemblye george brunswicke duke henry hys brother prouost college thynge knowne archebishop settynge forthe wrytyng sayeth cause appellation done nothynge contrary hys dewty therfore reiecteth theyr appellation trusteth wil leaue theyr enterpryses wil procede withstanding thinges concerne god glorye amendemente church agayne wrytynge confuteth theyr sclaunderous reporte luther bucer affirmeth neither priuie condemnation luther sawe print consented decre auspurge luther dede condemned rome cause hearde violently tyrannically decree regenspurge bisshops enioyned reforme theyr church sente bucer throughe meanes gropper ofte hyghly commended hym also could fynd nothing blameworthye greate tooken shoulde bee honest man themperoure amonges many chose one colloqutours man godly learned louer peace iudgement hath also rest minister churche appoynted peace concluded themperour sent bysshop arras granuellans son frenche kyng cardinall bellaye ioynctely kynge englande treate peace vayne king refusyng restore boloingue day also ambassade kynge englande duke orleans cardinall turnon ladyes frenche courte came themperoure brusselles mutual reioysyng peace themperour appoynted captaynes bandes spaniardes wynter lorayne contrie aboute themperours prouinces annexed house burgu dye many euery desyrous know gospel secretly feare themperours proclamation punnishment party towne called tournoye chiefest amonge neruians thither came frenche preacher strasburge beyng peter brulie sente one peter brulye mention made twelfth booke whan commen thither moneth september beyng gently receyued sent began instructe priuately cause went lysle towne flaunders retourneth aboute thend octobre agayne tournay nowe matter brought lyghte searche made hym throughout al cytye gate kept shutte therefore present daunger coulde longer hyd second day nouember night season serten hys frendes let downe ouer walles acorde whan touched earthe satte downe grounde one laining ouer walle softly coulde bad dew whylest thus leyned fortuned thruste stone cleaued fast morter whiche fallynge vpon hym sate brake hys legge vexed partely ake legge partely colde could styrre thence satte styll bewayled hys chaunce miserie hearde watchemen suspecting dede came vnto hym take hym carye hym pryson brute hereof came germanye senate strasburge sendynge theyr letter intreate also afterwardes ambassadours prote stantes wer tyme wormes somwhat late letter came whiche set name duke saxon lantzgraue dyspatched waye xix day februarye brulie burnte tourney maner hys executio extreme brent small fire hys torment might mutch greaeer confessed doctryne constantlye euen laste breathe laye prison comfortyng hys discyples letter fettred chaynes exhorteth constat sentence pronounced suffer transgressing themperours commaundement many yeres past themperoure set forth streit proclamation hys dominyons awaye agaynst lutheranes red euery yere twyse lest pleade ignoraunce whe sent prison examined ye freers wer diuines axe magistrate opinion hys examination sacrament altare calle messe consecratio adoration host purgatorye worshipping sainctes steewil good workes iustification image baptisme vowes confession synnes uirginitie lady wherunto aunswered verey body blud christ receiued mouthe spirit fayth neyther substannce breade wyne chaunged whan supper distributed congregation chrystes institution vulgare tongue verely consecrated euen wordes chryst still secret mutteryng wherwith priestes doe treate speake breade wyne belongeth rather inchaunters charmer vnto christianes popissh masse haue nothyng comon lordes supper seruice inuented men reproche iniurye chryst adoration bread consecrated idolatry worshipped creature place creatour knoweth fynde non purgatory sauing bloud chryst forgeueth v trespas also payne dew synnes therfore masse praiers applied vnto dead non effect also wicked asmoche instituted besydes god woorde sainctes better worshipped yf followe theyr faythe vertues soeuer cometh besydes euyll whylest lyued wolde permit worshyp donne vnto therfore ought called mediatours honour apperteyneth chryst adames sinne man nature wholy corrupted wyll weakened withoute goddes grace doe nothyng good howbeit man regenerate dooeth god motion good tree bryng forth good fruictes faith bryngeth vnto v saluation yt trust vnto god promesses beleue stedfastlye chryst sonne sake sinnes forgeuen v tradition whervnto mindes men bounden ar receyued haue image ye church thing full daunger idolatrie baptisme signe league god hath made v wherby testifieth yt forgeueth sine signe also cotinuall mortifying new lyfe ought folow baptisme thys sacrament ought receiued al men somuche little chyldren kept fro also partaker godly promission ought vow made eyther besides goddes worde el cannot bee perfourmed man howe euerye man ought daily confesse hys sinnes vnto god craue mercy moreouer yf scrupulositie trouble hys conscience axe counsell minister church hys comfort consolation auricular confessinge synnes hathe neyther testimonye scripture yet bee perfourmed tormentynge mynde ryghte peryllous perpetuall virgynitye ladie nothynge doubteth concernynge thynges fewe dayes stode foorthe wrote vnto hys wyfe others hys frendes requyred thys vsing seruyce hys syster whan condemned dye aduertiseth hys wyfe letter kynd punnishmenthe end life next daye also comforteth shewyng condicyo disciple ought better hys master geueth certen instruction preceptes lyuing diuines paris made decree relygion two yeares past recyted conuentio diuines mellon kinges comaundement mete mellon towne iland seine ten myles aboue paris kyng therby castell fountayne blewe commaunded assemble forasmoche peace concluded counsell shoulde shortely ensewe myghte consultatyon resolue vpon suche artycles churche expediente myght thought mete bee defended counsel publycke showe place al chrystendome ende whyche consultatyon thys allbeit altercation amonges greate yet wolde alter iote thynges whyche setfoorth parys example parisias diuines louaine also draw article themperoures permission set foorth article lovayne nomber xxxii secte worlde bee parysyans rehearsed doeth ye emperour hys proclamatyon confyrme ratyfye publyshynge hys letter therof day beefore ides marche diuines wrytte howe tooke thys payne wyllyngly knewe shoulde well accepted themperour hertofore requyred moche lyke thynge composytion pea agreed themperour frenche kynge shoulde vttermoste theyr power restore olde relygyon terme thynges wee haue nowe recyted seme tende ende cardinall tournon went duke orleans flauders thought haue furthered much matter luther aunswereth louain cotrary theames luther aunswereth louayne calleth heretickes bludsuckers teaching wicked thynges neyther defended reason scripture doe ad vyolence persecute fyre sworde bothe also parysians propounde onlye bare proposition prescribe wyll haue followed alledge place scripture proue incense magistrate persecution assemblie thempire woormes themperoure beynge diseased asseble wormes goute longe euer came theyre hys deputes cardinall auspurge fridericke counte furstemberg xxiiii day marche kyng fernando themperours absence propoundeth wherfore thys conuention called verely establyshyng relygion lawe peace turkisshe warre sheweth howe themperoure wysshed haue ben person hathe ben letted hitherto reason syckenes yet intendeth come soone hathe recouered healthe wyll longer hynder common consultation therfore hathe requyred hym commence thynge chieflye concernynge turkishe warre cause themperoure made peace frech kynge thentente thynges beyng pacyfyed relygyon maye quyeted refourmed force power bee prepared agaynste turke hathe declared trauell themperour hathe euer taken procure counsell fyrste wyth clement vii bononie paule iii roome gene nice luke lately busset brought passe already hande trente themperours aduise treate relygyon thys conuention attende vpon procedynge counsell yf shalbe none thende thys assemblye appoynt conuocatyon thempyre pourpos requyreth especially cosult turkishe warre aduertysed sondry letter messenger turke comming hongary greater power tha euer thentente may inuade germany let co sulte therfore whether thynke mete mooue warre agaynste hym defende onlye shall determyne signifye themperoure hath perswaded bisshop rome french king societie war trusteth also ye others protestates make aunswer behynd wherunto protestantes also archbishop collon palsgraue electour third day april make aunswer couentio appoynted chiefly religio yt fourmer conuetions entrie accesse hath made come vnto agrement therfore hope yt wholy accord wherfore wolde right gladly begin first wt matter state germany doeth require yf feare god theyr eies doubte haue good successe howbeit either weightines thing shortnes tyme el preset daunger turke wil permit yet shall nedefull decree concerning peace declared peace dede graunted religion vntill counsell acknowledg counsell trent lawful counsell counsel tret vnlawefull hath ben promised couselles thempire doe accept haue oft time heretofore declared therefore haue nede peace doe depende popishe counsell may take place til ye matter godly christialy determined firme peace bee except execution law ministred indifferentli last conuention spier decreed theyr partes redy accomplissh therfore two partes may decided wil refuse consulte turkisshe warre reste prynces state amonges archebisshopes deuise popish prince mentz treuers determine case religion shalbe referred counsell already sommoned chamber establisshed according auncient lawes thempyre iudgement geuen law written certe chosen whole nomber conferre turkish warre protestantes kyng fernando emperours deputes make aunswer howe decree made spier touchinge peace pleased well enough without exception counsel tyme called beginne shortly senate chamber also shoulde mete men receyued accordyng decree made spier seyng thus reason wolde shoulde requyre conferre reste turkyshe warre againe saye inacted spier first ther bee troubled moue relygion secondlye thys dissention accorded godly frendly disputation vppon thys foundation resteth peace germanye neyther wolde haue founde lacke yf matter myghte thus haue remayned nowe inasmoche bysshop hathe called counsell let disturbe reconcilement wherin alone hys adherentes hathe power determyne whose decree also moste men affirme foormer pacification shoulde bee finished haue nede assurance howe haue euermore refused solemne protestation bisshoppes counsell haue many yeres synce set foorth bookes declaryng cause nowe albeit non exception made thys thyng spier yet case haue warre turke requisyte first thynges quyet home people must pay monye thys warre equitie countenaunce man exact mony comons vnlesse put sure hope wiues child shal liue safely home religion euen cause doe warre agaynst turke euery man goodes comon welth trew religion may coserued warre turke meane seaso daunger home great differente betwixte two therfore haue iust cause demaund suerty cocerning chamber conteted haue sayed established accordinge decree spier touchig charge wil consult rest contended thinges fro begynning aprill til vii day maye hearing themperour taken iorney king fernando differred tyll coming also requyred meane tyme consult residew turkish matter prince present neyther protestantes catholyckes saue cardinal auspurge french kyng sent thither ambassadour grinian grinian french ambassadour gouernour prouince fraunce whose absence arrose great persecutio party ther french prouince people called ualdois aunciente custome doe acknowledg bishop rome haue alwayes somwhat ualdois pure doctrine luther florished gotte vnto gredely ample knowledge cause ofte coplayned vpon king though contened magistrate wold make rebellion kinde accusation many vse nowe day odious trewe certen townes uillages amonges merindolum one sentence geue fiue yeres paste aignes high iudgmet place cruell sentence aygnes prouince bee destroyed without respect house pulled downe village made eue plain groud tree also bee cut downe place made altogether desert howbeit though thus pronounced yet tha put execution meanes certe men perswaded king contrary amonges william bellaye tyme kinges lieutenaunt piedemount ye last yere xii day april iohn miner presidet counsel aygnes iohn myners calling senate readeth kinges letter comaunding execute yt sentece geuen letter miner obteined meanes cardinal tourno fyt sollicitour philip cortin cardinal tournon therfore receiued ye moneth januarie shewed kept tyme couenient worke feate letter red certen senate wer chosen execute matter presidente miner promised assist miner presidente aygwes absence grmian gouernoure prouince ruled common welth euery kinges co maundemet mustered men thenglish warres vsed pourpos moreouer marselles aygnes arles great townes toke vp able weare armure leuieth power agaynste ualdois ayde sente hym oute auingnon place aboutes bisshop roomes dominion wherfore fyrst impression made vpon merindolanes countrye aboute towne peruse ides april miner garded company noble captaynes commeth cadenet meane season certen centurious set vpon village two riuer druence distroying al slaughter spoilyng fyrynge dryue awaye greate nomber cattell lyke also others sondrye place time merindolaes seyng burne rounde aboute leaue theyr house flee merindolans flee woodes wooddes wonderful feare reste alnight vilage sanfalese inhabiters readye flye also bysshop cauallon deputie bishop legate appoynted certen captaynes go slaie nexte daye theygo little hide selues woodes daunger euery syde miner commaunded vnder payne deathe man shoulde ayde thynge shoulde bee slayne withoute redemption whersoeuer founde proclamation force also bisshop roomes dominion therby sayde bisshops countrie fynde great part armie wherfore wente werye paynefull jorney carying theyr child vpon theyre shoulder theyr armes theyr swaddling clothes many woman great childe comme place appoynted thither alreadye resorted greate nomber whiche lost theyr goodes saued themselues flyght long shewed howe miner came power geue charge vpon euenynge must goe thorow rough combrous place take counsel leaue ther behinde woman child fewe others kepe amonges minister churche residew appoynted go towne mussie vpon hope enemye wolde shewe mercye multytude lamentable departynge woman child beyng destitute succour sighes ther fetched imbracynges lamentation euerye man maye easely perceyue whan gonne al nyght long passed ouer great hyll leberon might see many uillages fermes set syre minerius diuidyng hys armye two partes marcheth selfe thone towardes towne merindolum hauing knowledge espiall waye meriudolans fled sendeth thother parte hys armye hunte oute came wood one soldiours moued pitie runneth toppe hygh rocke iudged merindolanes satte vndernethe casteth soldioure geueth warnynge downe two stone afterwarde calleth vnto though could see immediatly flee thence selfe time came two went mussie shew theyr enemyes approched cause minister resydew leaft woman runne way shewing narrow way wood wherby might escape daunger soone gone soldiours came streight way great rage drawing oute theyr swordes greate outcrye bad kyll heretickes neuerthelesse seyng men amonges absteyned slaughter time whan done greate outrage spoyled theyre money vittayle leade awaye theyr pourpos haue handled shamefully beyng letted captayne captayne defendeth woman horseman comming meane tyme threatened punisshment comaunded goe streight waye miner forsake filthye enterprise leauinge woman dryue waye theyr botye cattell woman nomber aboute fiue hondreth meane season miner came merindolum fyndyng without dweller spoyleth setteth fyre shewyng cruell fact miner one cruell example fyndyng one yonge man commaunded shoulde bee tyed oliue tree shot dagges goeth towne cabrier battereth cabrier yelded hys ordenaunce vsynge seruice capitayne polyne brought turkes nauie perswadeth townes men open theyr gate promisyng shoulde haue harme whyle whan soldiours lette slayne without respect eyther age womankynde many fled churche place dyuers wyne sellar castell beyng brought foorthe meddowe stripped naked slayne eche one men onlye also woman greate chylde miner also shutteth fourtye woman barne terryble example crueltye full straw hey setteth fyre burneth sely woman put theyr clothes therewith haue quenched fyre coulde ranne great windowe whereat hey wont cast barne haue lopen kept backe pickes iauelyns burnt together xx daye aprill done miner sent parte armie winne towne coste wha marching theyr way found oute tolde lyttell fled wyne sellar castell whervpon reysed outcry though ben treason soldiours called backe distroy nombre slaine within towne withoute aboute eyght hondreth infantes escaped theyr furye baptised agayne theyr enemy whan thynges dispatched cabrier sente power costa lord towne denysed citezens carie theyr armure castell caste downe theyr walles foure sondry place yf wolde doe promiseth obteine miner easelye shalbe displeasure wroughte beeinge perswaded folow aduise departeth intreat going farre meteth soldiours marche one notwithstanding firste daie yet repulsed next day assault great violence hauyng burned suburbes aboute take easely night many escaped ouer walles cordes slaughter committed ranne orchard castell woman maides fled thither feare rauissh euery one kept ther inclosed daye nyght handled beastely greate belyes yonger maydens dyed shortely meane season merindolanes diuerse others wandered woddes mountaynes intercepted eyther sente galeis slayne many also dyed honger moreouer farre towne mussie named certen went hid themselues caue vnder rocke nomber xxv bewraied smothered smoke burnt kinde crueltie omitted neuerthelesse diuerse escaped bouchery came vnto geneua place nere therfore whan report herof bruted germany offended myndes many dede swyses swiss intreate ualdois popisshe relygion intreated kynge wolde shew mercye wer fled kyng sayeth ther iust cause hym doe neither ought carefull doeth within dominion punisheth offendours aboute theyr affayres yeare men sharpe aunswer kynge sent kyng confession theyr doctryne comprysed writing wherof yt article god father creatour al thinges sonne mediatour aduocate mankynd holy spirite comforter instructour treweth church whych confession ualdois doctryne saye fellowship god electe wherof iesus chryst head minister churche wolde remoued vnlesse doe theyr dewty magistrate graunte ordeyned god defende good punnysh transgressours owe hym loue also tribute custome man herein excepted euen example christ payed tribute hym selfe baptisme saye visible outward sygne represeteth vnto v renewyng spirite mortifycation member lordes supper whych saye thankes geuing memory benefit receyued throughe chryste matrimony beyng holy instituted god ough inhibited good workes saye must obserue exercise holy scripture teacheth false doctryne whiche leadeth v waye trewe worshippyng saye ought eschewed brief order rule theyr faythe affirme olde new testamente doe protest beleue thynges conteyned crede apostle finally desyre kyng geue credyt thys declaration incase otherwyse informed trew say wyll proue yf maye heard tyme king occupyed affaire warre therfore matter slept whe peace made renewed prouocatio many brought thys wonderful crueltie shewed spaniardes themperour placed lorayne wynter season wrought moche euyll party themperours comaundement depart thence moneth aprill trauelyng strasburge whe passed ouer rhm goe sweuia austriche three thousande footemen thys tyme ended hys lyfe lewis duke bauier brother wyllyam hauynge chyldren accorded marie kepyng together deathe lewes duke bauier thinheritaunce duke brunswicke exceadyng great frendes chiefe captaynes league deuised protestates whan henry bruswicke dryuen oute hys countrey fled fyrst vnto hym thys xvi daye maye came themperour wormes next daye cardinal farnesius cause commyng cardinall farnesius coming wormes able saye thought certentie came styre vp warre agaynst lutheranes nothinge openly comynge roome passed throughe lande wirtemberge whan stayed tyme dilling towne cardinalles auspurge vpon riuer danubius torned way kyng fernando written duke wirtemberge sake wold let hym passe sassye shewe fauour myghte bee made aunswer rather wolde take waye neuerthelesse doe hym pleasure yf disposed passe waye wolde let hym sayd tooke waye came wormes one daye perour themperoure soone peace made french kyng sollicited prynces also helpe forewarde counsell thys cause sente ambassadours kynge themperours ambassadour kyng poole polle requyring hym sende hys deputes counsell trente amonges thinges sayed asmoche themperour supposed howe protestantes whyche ben euen stubburne wold forsake cofession theyr doctryne exibited auspurge also obey publycke decree counsell thinge selfe requyred kynges prince take matter hande yf doe obey bee auenged disturber publycke weale godlye relygion amonges others hath comendation godly christian kyng themperoure prayeth hym thynke vpon turkisshe warre subcribe counsell trente yf protestantes beframed amendement assiste hym hys ayde counsell also kynges haue promised king polle agayne made auswer desyred myghte see day whan chrystian kynges kinges aunswer themperour prynces ciuille warre discorde layde parte shoulde bende theyr whole power one agaynste turke wold none last concernyng counsell protestates wil doe thynges maye profite publycke weale tra quillitie churche neyther yf nede repuyre wyll greate daunger fayle themperoure hys frende alie tyme pope desyrous war wrytten rome bisshop notwithstandyng called counsell sente hys legate thyther desyrous warre agaynst lutheranes hereunto promised aide xii thousande footemen fyue hondreth horseman priuelye also hyred centurion captaynes whan shewed hym agayne howe time farre spent great good could donne yere must tary better occasyon declared immediately hys captaynes put hope next yere following morrow feast pe tecost frere obseruaunte stireth peroure warre frere obseruaunt italian made sermon themperour kyng fernando cardinal farnesius bisshop auspurg granuellan hys sermon makinge digression lutheran inueyhed moche spoken dispitefully tyme sayeth victorious emperour laste doe offyce certenly hathe ben delayed ouer longe thyng shoulde haue ben long since god hath blessed many great gyftes ordeyned defendour church wherfore extende youre power dispatche waye pestiferous sorte men lawefull longer behold sonne whiche doe thus pollute confounde althynge neyther say doe shoulde haue ben done already already saye long syns therfore may ther longer delay many thousand people thinke daunger euerlasting saluation theyr madnes whych god shall requyre handes vnlesse fynd remedye sayde granuellan moche offended thys trompete eyther fayned el sawe howe warnynge protestantes many day sermo farnesius departeth secretly nyght retourneth rome great expedition dayes luther setforth boke vulgare toungue intitled luther boke pope bisshoprycke roome ordeyned sathan booke aunswereth fyrst bysshoppes letter wherby vehement wordes diswadeth themperoure reformatio relygion lyke haue hearde place scripture bisshop doeth vsurpe establyshe hys supremacie confuteth moste aboundantly applyeth make agaynst hym booke set picture whych declareth argumente bysshop sytteth hyghe chayre hys handes ioyned stretched solemne apparel hathe asse eares aboute hym many deuelles diuers shape wherof set triple crowne vpon hys head tourde toppe others let hym downe cordes hell vnder neth hym hortyble holde bryng wood colle others ryght seruyceable staye feete may descend rightly softely longe came foorthe certene theames hys whyche heretofore disputed three gouermentes ecclesiasticall politycke oeconomike luther theme thre gouernmentes whiche sayeth god hathe ordeyned agaynste furye deuill vtterlye excludeth bysshop condemneth oppresseth gospell bryngeth vnder hys subiection lawes euen ciuile lawe asmoche forbiddeth matrymony pleaseth hym therfore calleth beast named germany beare wylde beaste wolfe together nothynge sayeth fierce cruell wherfore token geuen hearde streyghte wayes men get theyr weapon intent maye kyll yf hapely take caue anye inclosure gouernour iudges soyle wolde exempte also defende shoulde persecuted notwithstanding let disturbe hunter myght slayne lawefully selfe sorte must bisshop resysted doe attempte moue warre lyke wyld rauenyng beast aide someuer mayneteyned wil serue helpe theefe ought looke rewarde thynge deserue tha also sende foorth picture fonde dede yet prophesye thyng come bisshop hys prelate apparell sitteth vpon greate sowe manye dugges whyche luther picture pope diggeth spurres hauyng two fyngers hys ryght hand nexte hys thume stretched ryghte vp maner blesseth suche chaunceth mete hys lefte hande holdeth new smokinge tourde smell wherof sowe lyfteth vp snowte wyde mouthe nose thirlles catcheth praye derysion blamyng beast full bytterly shall ryde thee saieth spurres whether thou wylt noe thou haste troubled longe aboute counsell thowe myghtest rayle thy pleasure accuse franckelye beholde nowe thys counsell thou greatlye desyrest sowe sygnifyeth germany tryfles hys many mentaunted vnsemely hym verey modest hys reason whye thought haue greater foresyghte thynges certenly hys bookes diuerse sondry prophecyes wherof ende prooved trewe residew yet hande god meane season themperoure taketh order granuellan nauius hand protestantes touching counsel luther prophet turkish warre longe decision nothyng could concluded grinian french ambassadour vnderstode latyn tounge conprysed hys matter wrytyng vttered ignorace grinian interpretour xx daye iune somme thys oration exhort al counsell grinian nere frende cardinall tournon thought haue ben occasyoner thys ambassade ben themperoure brusselles sayde treated matter concernynge counsell thus agreed kinge sende ambassadour exhorte counsell whych themperoure already approued thys thought bee meane make protestantes affraid tyme dyeth fraunces duke lorayne leauing behynde hym yonge sonne charles chylde two deathe fraunces duke lorayne yeres olde duke brother called niclas bisshop mentz betwene childes mother christien themperours nece arrose contention aboute wardeshyp al nobilitie fauoured hym lothed woman gouernement perours mediation bothe appointed gardins yet mother authorytie chiefest dayes also departeth daughter ferdinado maried two yeres son sigismunde king polle spayne brought birth charlessons kyng philyp glad tydinges birth charles themperoures nephewe sonne kynge philip whyche cause spaniardes made greate ioye wormes dayes came worde mother childe dead themperoure wormes came marque piscare broughte hym certen chiefe inhabiters millan thought themperour determined marye daughter kynge fernando duke orleans therfore sent men vnderstande state lumbardie whiche promised geue hym dowarye whylest themperoure helde assemblie duke brunsewicke goeth frenche kinge time fridericke rifeberge leuie certen power footemen border saxonie king england henry brunswicke espying occasion promyseth perswadeth frenche kyng incase wyll geue monie shall easely fynde meanes scatter getteth hym certen thousandes crownes neyther duke brunsewicke getteth monye frech kynge letted rifeberge couerted monye receyued warre protestantes shalbe declared herafter unto conuentyon came prince sayde theperoure paulsgraue electoure came also request protestantes maketh intercession whan themperour saw wold graunt nothyng turkisshe warre vnlesse obteyned theyr requeste concerning counsell chamber sendeth ambassadoure turke trewes gerarde ueltuniche man themperoure taketh truce turke verye well learned experte toungues duryng thys conuention senate mentz maketh inquirye suche olde custome receyued easter banisshed towne founde herein culpable shewed howe clergie uniuersitie collon appealed themperoure bisshop clergie vniuersitie collo archebishop myght hereby hynder thenterprises theyr archebisshop stil proceded wolde displace preacher minister church whyche thyng chiefly requyred renewe theyr sute themperoure making hym greuous complainte therfore aboute thende conuention themperoure hys letter published wormes receyueth hys tuitio chargeth al men vnder paine outlawyng man disturbe temperourciteth archebishop religio right possession againe letter citeth archebisshop within xxx dayes come hym selfe send proctour aunswer accusation meane time commaundeth intermeddle alter thynge yf haue chaunged ought restore hys olde place commaundemente also geueth townesemen andernake bonna lyntz campene place chyefly archebisshop appoynted preacher instructe people agayne xviij daye iulye paule iii citeth hym maner pope citeth archebishop colon within two monethes appere hym roome cyteth also henrye stolberge dean cathedrall churche collon hys college whyche noble house iames ringraue fryderycke weden chrystopher oldenburge rychard rauier phylyp obersten bothe loued archebishop allowed suite rest bysshop roome dyuerse yeres paste mislyked muche archebisshop whyche chiefly longe uergeryus bysshop instinople beyng ambassadour germany comming time collon whan heard aboute reformation hys churche rebuked hym sore bothe wordes letter accused hym whan came home longe disceptation concernyng peace chamber turkish warre themperoure fourthe daye august maketh ende pleadynge manye thynges coulde determyned vnlesse prynces presente themselues prorogeth whole treaty vntill moneth ianuarye next followyng commaundeth prynces come regenspurge vnlesse letted syckenes sayeth wyll hym selfe forsomuche desyreth controuersye relygion myghte bee accorded appoynteth conference learned men foure collocutours eyther side two auditours commaundynge bee regenspurge kalendes december begynne matter assemblye prynces shall repayre thyther recyteth decree peace fourmer yeres confirmeth commaunding man attempt thing decre auspurg contrarye taketh order howe money graunted yeare turkysshe warre shoulde leuyed reserued reformation chamber differreth tyll nexte conuention parte concernynge conference learned men catholyckes refuse neyther wold assent themperoure herein reste doe refuse protestantes doe repete fourmer treatye saye faulte treated relygyon sayed beefore touchynge refusall counsell chamber inferre agayue vrge decree spyer made laste yere decree themperoures dissenteth proteste doe admit ambassadours protestantes followed themperoures campe yeare past themperour differred tyll tyme shewed whersore assemblie matter throughly determyned vpon condicions mentioned whe duchie brunswicke sequestration permitted themperour comaundeth henry ye duke trye matter law abstaine fro force armes wyll assente thereunto hereof maketh protestation tyme themperoure againe chargeth hym extremelye vnder frowardenes duke brunswick paine outlawing shold obey thorder taken disobeyed also wrote agayne bitterly raileth vppon counsellours especyally granuellan nauius content herewith secretly began gather men myght recouer lost lyttell shall heare themperoure goeth downe ryuer rhine wormes collon thence retourneth brusselles bysshop collon beynge cyted appere themperoure soeuer sende hys proctour within xxx dayes albeit olde custome germany priuelege prince electours bounden seke peroure withoute limites thempire yet sent thither proctour defende hym time warre hote betwirte fraunce england mayneteyned aswell sea lande frenche king moche doe builded forte warr fraunce england nere vnto bologne vpon sea coast intending cut theyr vitayle driueu fynde armye tyll woorke finisshed neuerthelesse fyrst discosited great deale lesse power englissh men coduite erle herforde lost theyr tentes caryage greued protestates see two kynges mortal warre together many yeres peace wherefore knowynge protestantes send ambassadours frauce englande shoulde displeasaunte neyther partye sende ambassadours frauce christopher ueninger iohn bruno nidepot iohn sturmius englad lewis bambache iohn sleidan coming amiens tenth day septeber heare death ye duke orleans departed ye day haue ben eyther son inlaw allied theperour declared wer sure bonde perpetuall frendship deathe duke orleauce tyme maryage maner appointed kept died short sickenes yong man xxiii yeres age selfe tyme duke henrye brunswicke beinge furnisshed armye duke bruswick french golde sayde hyreth bandes soldiours secretly assebled besides uerded aboute thousande fyue hundreth horseman eyght thousande footemen goeth rotburge towne beloging citie breme myghte ioyne munition hys brother archebisshop breme hys owne gether labour lost senate breme sente thyther men defende place marchynge therfore countrey luneburge moche hurte waye commeth hys owne prouince taketh castel stebrucke composition worketh moche mischief coutrie spoylyng fyreyng house sendeth worde city nexte hym brunswicke hanobrye minden breme hamburge shoulde recompence hym iniutyes done forsake conspiracie smallcald pleasure cal el threateneth vtter distruction force aboute eyght hundreth horseman thre thousand fotmen whau spoyled burned coutrie countie deckelburge fellow protestates done moch harme passed ouer riuer uisurge ioyne themselues vnto wherfore goeth besegeth warolbuttell chiefe castel dominion constrayneth people place geue hym theyr saythe othe meanetyme lantzgraue commaundement lantzgraue goeth fellowes gathereth hys owne countrey nombre seuen thousande men thre enseignes foote men aboute thousand sixe hundreth horseman thys power xxiii piece ordenauce marcheth northeme thither came vnto duke ernest brunswicke sonne philip sent duke saxon thousande horseman thre thousande footemen syxe thousande leuyed hys owe dominyon xii felde peces duke brunswicke vnderstode leavynge syege castell whyche garrison within defended manfullye tourned waye scrapynge together monye myghte gette payeth soldiours whyche readye slyppe asyde marchynge forwarde encampeth hymselfe calfelde whyche uillage myle lantzgraues campe thys troublesome state duke ericus brunswicke mother wydowe iohn marque brandenburge sonne inlawe duke henry certen others intreate peace lantzgraue saxon saye howe doe nothynge herein cosent theyr fellowes therfore doe make suite duke moris praying hym perswade lantzgraue hys father inlaw followeth theyr requeste whan came campe duke moris intreateth peace xvi daye october propoundeth whole matter desyreth myghte bee permytted treate peace lantzgraue excuseth matter dyd beefore nexte daye certen bandes horseman duke brunsewyckes came nere vnto northeme skermyshed lantzgraues horseman beynge repulsed shotte retourne theyre campe daye nyghte duke mauryce sollyciteth agayne lantzgraue hathe promysed duke henrye hys frendes take paynes thynge desyreth haue condycyons propounded whych yf duke henry shall refuse maye honestly leaue matter lantzgraue propoundeth suche condicyons doubte wolde refused duke morys sendeth chrystopher ebleb comerstrate ciuilyan make hym offer meane came worde duke brunswycke commyng hys power gette hille nere vnto lantzgraues campe lantzgraue came fyrste thyther leauynge three bandes horseman certen enseygnes footemen defende campe remoueth hys whole armye vnto hylle longe beganne skyrmishe bothe partyes whylest thynges working ambassadours duke mauryce retourne shew hym skirmishe betwirte duke lantzgraue duke henrye aunswered franckly committeth hym selfe wholy duke moris wil impugne relygion henseforth matter beynge debate froe whan duke moris verey ernest lantzgraue sheweth hym howe thys onlye way haue peace put sufficyente warrantyse relygion yelde hymselfe custodye duke morys delyuer hys whole prouince vnto hym looke duke morys shal iudge hym paye charge warre harmes donne controuersye betwixte hym cytie goslarye ratifyed condycyons dooeth latzgraue permitte duke morys intercessoure shall propounde whiche yf wyll receyue conference herin duke saxon cyties bee nere sayeth shalbe concluded thys commissyon duke morys sendeth agayne hys ambassadours whattyme retourned bryng word good hope hurly burly conflictr together ther nothing ryghtly done therfore nede trewes durynge treatye almoste nyghte lantzgraues permission trewes taken tyme tyll nexte daye nyghte meane season goeth duke morys talketh duke brunswicke myght perswade hym cleane refuseth condicyons propoundeth others farre vnlyke communication vanitie duke brunswick duke mauryee counsellours within three houres sayeth hee shall appere whether lantzgraue bee lorde worlde haunyball sayde scipio also brake truse made geuyng charge vpon lantzgraues forragers wherfore lantzgraue hearyng condicyons duke henrye propounded breaketh treatye thanked duke moris paine xx day october duke bru swicke hys counsellours proueth againe duke moris requireth maye mete agayne conuenyent place betwixt campes lantzgraue wolde duke moris proclameth warre also agaynst duke brunsewycke thyng tolde hym woulde doe vnlesse agreed peace sendynge hym hys letter mulluse thys whan farre nyght lantzgraue sent conrade hauste eyght guydons horseman aboute twelue thousande footemen ordenaunce hym selfe rest force followeth accompanyed two duke moris ernest whan day began appeare forewarde came certen strayte vppon toppe hill far duke brunswickes camp also lantzgraue resydew hys armye sore conflict reason straytnes place whych could passed one way fyght good whyle doubtefull instant lantzgraue shotynge hys ordenaunce conflicte betwixte duke latzgraue repulsed enemye takynge delyberation whan found place also wher might passe latzgraue auaunced parte hys armye shotte amonges enemyes hys greate piece duke brunswicke sendeth trompet duke moris desyreth comunication lantzgraue makynge aunswer fyrst bringeth armye setteth order battel dischargeth hys peces agayne come two messagers duke henrye making lyke request vnto lantzgraue made aunswer condicion peace none duke hys eldest sonne muste come yelde themselues vnto hym doe well good yf wyll proue sayeth doe thys shew hym conclude briefly goeth duke moris agayne father inlawe armye sayeth conueyhed hope therof peace wil saieth henry sonne shall submitte themselues vnto shall refuse wyll trye battell whan thys aunswer duke moris goeth agayne speaketh brunswicke latzgraue neuerthelesse prepareth battell styll shoutyng ordenaunce approcheth nere hys enemye stayeth aboute fyue ho dreth pass hym sendeth woorde duke morys co rade hauste canot quiet feareth lest occasyon talke duke henry shoulde escape awaye duke moris sayeth must nedes tary till haue spoken praieth hym longe absteyne little whyle retourneth sheweth duke henry plentifull teares wayleth myserye wyll render hym selfe hys sonne desyreth hym wolde vse cruell wordes towardes hym duke commen hys sonne charles uictor lantzgraue sayde vnto hym thy power thou art nowe myne thou woldest duke hery hys son yelde themselues suffer lyue longe wyll vse thee greate deale better thy desertes came thy mynde thou wouldest obey emperoure refusyng sequestration certenlye thys meane thouhadst wel prouyded thee thyne speakyng thys wyse appoynteth vnto kepers thys meane whyle lantzgraues armye lyke haue bickered enemye lantzgraue duke moris greate expedition runnen betwixte ben wonderful slaughter duke brunswickes armye pourposed depart wholy gether one companye daunger leste occasyon shoulde attempte newe enterpryse lantzgraue followeth ouertakyng vpon playne compelleth teare piece enseignes promiseth hym vpo theyr fydelytie shoulde serue agaynste hym hys fellowes within sixe monethes taketh waie theyr munition nomber xviii piece therunto belongeth marching foreward recouereth castel ste brucke sweareth people trewe hym commaundeth geue god thankes victorye punnisheth iohn schamburge otto ritberg erles aydyng hys enemie discharging hys army retourneth home thys tyme dyeth albert deathe cardinall mentz cardinall mentz sebastian husestene succedeth hym bishopricke maydenburge iohn alberte hys cosen germayne whyche hys suffragan therebe fore reporte afterwarde bruted duke maurice though disceiptefull captious woordes shoulde haue brought duke brunswicke bondage knowen setteth foorthe wrytynge sheweth cause beyng requyred duke saxo lantzgraue coulde denye recyting whole matter order declareth sustayneth iniury yet neuerthelesse intreateth maye deliuered luther booke set foorthe exhorteth prynces wolde let goe theyr prysoner thys victorye without bludshed geuen god maner aboute thys tyme countie william furstemberge whan coute willyam deliuered ben prisoner paris vntil paying xxx thousand crownes hys raunsome delyuered passyng flaunders whan declared hys mysfortune themperoure retourneth home themperoure wylleth hym espye meane whereby thys dammage may recompensed herin promiseth fauour good whan henrye duke brunswicke sone take duke saxon lantzssaue immediatly signifye themperour letter whole matter inasmoch conteninge proclamation disquieted germany newe warre require fellowes breaking publycke peace may outlawed fourme condicions sequestratio conuenaunted thys last october ye lantzgraues letter peroure lantzgraue accusing countie ritberge themperour making tion former letter whan made request sayeth duke brunswicke taken found sondrye letter great importaunce secret deuyses hys tentes shew well enough went great mischief eyther agaynste kinge ferdinando amonges others ther epistle whiche prince electour wryteth agayne hym maye vpon condicions come league cofederacy rather dewty vtter maner counsel doubtles wolde haue done promised vpon fydelytie haue kept close wherfore let hym moue hym nomore matter henforth yf doe shalbe counsell suche lyke thinges hath shew shall thynke anythynge concerneth hys person maye sende trusty man hys shal shew letter let haue copie themperour beyng tyme bruges towne flaunders syxte daye nouember sendeth lantzgraue nicolaus conricius themperoure latzgraue message heareth sorte duke brunswicke hys sonne came hys hades albeit wold haue wisshed accepted condicio sequestration yet seing matter co men poynt supposeth nedefull punishe hym moreouer breakinge publyke peace hys truste also wyll moderately vse thys victory man shall nede feare hys vyolence admonyssheth hym moreouer accordyng auncyente custome prynces doe intreate hys prisoner quyetlye honestyle neyther enforce vnreasonable condicyon vnworthye permytte matter maye bee frendelye indifferentlye hearde wherin verelye hys offyce place wyll omytte nothynge neyther hys confortes neede nowe feare anye daunger hee requyreth hym dyscharge hys armye
