obserue peace yf haue oughte saye man socyetye warre ayde minystred wolde trye lawe wyll doe herein shall reasonable conricfus thus declared xviii daye nouember lantzgraue day auswered cassels asmuch duke brunswicke hys fellowes haue moe wayes one broken imperial decree trusteth themperoure wyll playnly declare euill parte taketh thys theyr doyng one chiefest hys adherentes otto erle ritberge client hath punysshed therfore therbe also diuerse others myght iustely auenged thentent themperour men shoulde clearly see howe littell hys fellowes loue trouble hathe done nothyng hath discharged hys soldiours seeyng thus tooke hand nedeful defencion desyreth ernestyle themperoure wolde bannishe duke hys fellowes though taken yet hys adherentes bee punyshed notwithstandyng whych also wyll shew themselues styll lyke enemyes hys prisoner intreated metely lyberally touchyng rest conferre duke saxon hys fellowes ambassadours whyche tolde sente protestantes fraunce englande doe co mission tyme also theperoure sought make peace treatie peate beetwirt frauce england appoynted daye bruges ambassadours kinges mete frenche kynge sente mounser annebalde amirall kyng england stephen bisshop winchester could accorde meane season ambassadours protestantes wrought moch bothe kynges content haue treaty therfore send ambassadours frech kyng arde kyng englad cales guysnes mete mydde waye betwixt arde guysnes xxvi daye nouember tentes pitched playne felde whan ambassador protestant propounded certen codicions peace matter longe moche debated betwyxt frech wolde haue bologne restored especially vrged scotes myght comprised peace englishman vtterlye refuse matter reported letter messagers eyther kynge moche intreaty ther nothyng fynisshed wherfore syxte day ianuary ambossadours kynges protestantes depart retourne home next daye frenchemen vitayled theyr forte kyng builded nere vnto bologne englisshemen would haue letted fought together many slayne bothe party king englande warneth protestant daunger fort vitailed tyme ambassadours protestantes englande kynge waye communication tolde howe lyke haue fore mortall warre therof moste certen warned also wryte theyr confederate one hys counsellours whych hygh fauour declared moche one ambassadours naming also certe practicioners messagers whose meanes chiefly thing wrought moreouer king semed take maruelous euill parte themperour yere made peace french king moch offeded sayd made warre frenche king throughe procurement reason turkisshe league moneth ianuarye protestantes conuented frankeforthe consulted counsell trente augementyng theyr league charge warre brunswicke howe forfake archebisshop collon howe solicite themperour assemblie pire wyll graunte peace relygion refourme iudgment chaber thys couention ambassadours archbisshop collon complayne iniuryes clergye commaundementes citation bothe themperour also bisshop roome meane season paulsegraue prynce electour ordeyned euery minister church preacher palsegraue ordeineth minister hys church gospell permitteth also whole supper lorde mariage pristes tenth daye ianuary stead popissshe masse seruice sayde head church nedelberg duche tongue wherfore protestantes sending ambassade reioyse therat geuinge thankes aunswered archebisshop collon ambassadours frankelye exhorte hym also procede professe doctryne confessed anspurge doe hys endeuour nexte assemblye regenspurge peace lawe maye establysshed wherunto aunswereth hath euer desyrous peace wilbe long liueth archebisshop collo right sory thus molested especyally hys olde dayes therfore tyme shal send ambassadours themperoure clergie senate collon intreate hym wyll also sende hys trusted many yeres haue agrement religion moch seeth matter daungerously differred neither theire greate hope coulde longer delaye wisshe expectation hys subiectes therfore hathe begonne reformatyon relygion whych pourposeth anaunce furthermore professe openly seuententh daye ianuarye wesell mete ambassadours prynces electours named rhine mentz collon treuers paulsegraue cou te palatyne dominion stretche vnto rhine paulsegraue vrged archebishopes mentz treuers wolde sende theyr ambassadoures hys marque brandenburges intreate archebisshop collon fearynge get displeasure refused thys tyme rumour brute war protestantes noysed abrode themperour shoulde secretly mynde warre wherfore lantzgraue wrytyng hys letter granuella xxiiij ianuarie sayeth howe reported onlie germany also sygnyfyed oute italye otherplaces themperoure bisshop roome make preparation warre vpon lutheranes wyll maynteyne counsell beegynne warres sprynge yere howe intende set vpon archebysshop collon force lowe contrie germany vpon saxon boheme inuade high almaigne power italie themperour wil also haue ten thousande foote men certen trouppes horseman garde hym conduicte regenspurge brute spread abrode commonlye also reported head captaynes centurion wherof make theyr boast haue receyued money peroure already seyng themperoure hathe peace frauce hath also taken trewes turke affyrme many men doe maruell vse pourpose shoulde wage men warre neyther hys consortes whylest consyder peace makyng norinberge confyrmed regenspurge spier place easelye perswaded beleue shoulde bee trew especially synce haue done ryght good seruice bothe perour kynge ferdinando agaynst turke enemyes also howbeit thought good declare thynges frendly vnto hym whych sygnyfyed hym hys fellowes many letter messagers maye like thinges reported themperoure malycious person hym hys confederatours whyche maye rayse suspicion cause trouble put bothe charge doubteth wyll make hym au wer asmuche hathe ben euer hitherto counselloure peace desyreth henceforthe also wolde perswade themperoure granuellan wrote aunswer thys granuellan aunswer lantzgraue seuenth day february themperoure hathe neyther made compacte bisshop leuyed soldiours geuen money capitayne albeit yf shoulde haue force aboute hym man ought maruel thys daungerous tyme doubtfull state thynges whan kynges prynces nere aboute doe moustre theyr men shoulde reprehende hym yf fore see hys country susteyne non iniurye sayeth report vntrew also rest ten thousand men garde hym regenspurge themperoure ready take hys iorney small treyne hathe declared howe desyrous euer themperoure hathe ben peace tranquilitie germanye yet mynde styll sheweth also howe frendely gentlye hathe vsed archebisshop collon fynally wissheth vniuersal common welth namely germany thinges safe fortunate aboute end ianuary lantzgraue fridericke paulsgraue prince electour mete frankeforte auspurge receyuing intelligence oute diuerse place warlicke preparation themperour bisshop roome sent sebastian scherteline man warre sebastian scherteline addicted vnto paulsegraue lantzgraue shoulde instruct priuely al matter therfore spoken eyther seuerally brought passe bothe came thither consulte paulsegraue also accompanyed otto henry hys cosyn germane fewe dayes came thyther also protestantes ambassadours fraunce englande report ambassade ye latzgraue fellowes next day fourth day february lantzgraue departeth thence goeth archebisshop mentz newly created whiche one germane mile amonges thynges intreateth yt nexte assemblie regenspurge wold geue aduise cou sell tranquillitie germany shortly dissolued conuention franckefort decree made protestates sendyng theyr ambassadours themperour clergie collon intreate ye archebisshop duke moris saxonie league protestantes yet ambassadour christopher carlebice gentelma verey well learned immediately conuention ended went themperoure time themperoure gelderlande ben aduertysed protestantes conspyred agaynst hym franckeforte neyther wanted protestantes accused conspiracie matter setter foreward comon saying powred oyle vpon fyre wolde saye assembly state prynces kept hys contempte nauius sent peroure archebisshop collon came thence archebisshop mentz paulsgraue waye fortuned talke renarde counte solmen man warre stoute courage touching present state thynges themperoure aduertised erle tolde hym agayne thinges bruted themperoure throughout germanye vtterly denyed sayde neuer came themperours mynde much loueth peace al owne affaire set apart counsel thempire neyther doubteth latzgraue woulde come vnto hym frendly vsed hys aduyse wyse maye bothe pourge hymselfe hys fellowes happely wyll goe regenspurg know themperours mynde presently conferre hym comon welth meanes also maye suspicion distrust bee taken awaye reysed misreportes eyther side desyre come theperours speache shal dee well come small company maye declare therby fayth consydence hathe themperoure lantzgraue aduertysed hereof counte solmense xx daye februarye writeth nauius auoyd suspicion sheweth partely donne franckefurte declareth report went themperoure prepare haue warre amonges captaynes appointed marque albert leuie thousad lantzgraues letter nauius horsementhowebeit erle solmen vpon hys report affirmeth vntrewe granuellan also wryteth rather credite flyeng tale talked brode hys fellowes hope well themperour wil shrink conuenauntes decree spier especially seyng cause geuen whie doe come speake peroure refuse fyrst must conferre hys leagefrendes som wold haue present talke many shewed howe themperoure appoynted talke coll quie learned regespurg learned men regenspurge commaunded bee begynnyng december proroged daye ides december thither came sent themperoure peter maluenda spaniarde eberard billicke white frere iohn hoimester austen frere iohn cochleus diuines many hearer protestantes came bucer brentius george maior erard schuepsius diuines also soure auditours kalendes ianuary came presidentes disputation moris bisshop eistet fridericke counte furstemberge length beganne conference xvii daye ianuary presidentes speaking theyr charge thynges cocerning themselues require diuines graue holy busines wolde followe affection treate syncerely hauynge feare god theyr eye respecte concord herin promise theyr paine fidelitie vprightnes recite howe theperours comaundement doctryne protestates exibited tymes past auspurge shoulde communication treated omittynge thre first article trmitie incarnation word originall sinne two first controuersie thys laste hathe ben sufficientlye debated alreadye residewe bee treated vpon order iustyfycation forgeuenes sinnes fulfylling law faythe good woorkes deserte sacramentes purgatory praying dead veneration inuocation sainctes reliques image monasticall vowes mariage priestes choise meates holy dayes thecclesiasticall tradition churche power keyes sacred order authorytie bisshop roome bisshops generall counselles thynges declared protestantes consideryng aduersaryes matched request theyr talke treaty myght written oute notaryes thentent themperour prince may vnderstande whole matter argumentes probation eyther partie contrarywyse presidentes saye longe woorke shoulde suffice yf chiefest poyntes noted agayne saye howe nothynge whiche done maye vttered assigne forenoone disputation muche debatyng agreed two eythersyde commit al talke wrytyng laied vp cheste fast locked shewed man except rest present yet kepte silence thynges doethe presidentes agree theperoure content sayed haue comaundement behalfe protestantes also accept vpon condicion signifye theyr prince concerneth knowe haue willed wryte hereof wha thys order take peter maluada doctour paris beginneth maluenda treateth iustification fyrste daye februarie hys preface speaking muche commendation themperoure discourseth large article iustifycation scoole maner bucer interruptinge hym sayde agaynst lawe conference order prescribed themperoure confession theyr doctryne lyeth hym maye take chapter iustifycation yf haue oughte saye agaynste let hym confute order obiecte shalbe aunswered neuerthelesse procedeth concludeth attributeth muche freewyll sayde man iustifyed faythe onlye also hope charytie nexte daye bucer declareth howe article iustifycation accorded talke bucers aunswer regenspurge yeare synce sheweth themperoure resydewe prynces state decreed touchyng desyreth bee enrouled amonges recordes followyng order prescrybed themperoure repeteth artycle deuideth foure partes man iustyfyed god hys owne woorkes merytes freelye iustyfyed chryste throughe faythe tyme beleueth bothe receyued vnto grace also hys sinnes chryste forgeuen howe christe hys deathe hathe made satysfactio synnes god doeth impute fayth righteousnes thynges doeth confyrme declare testimony scripture sheweth thinges agreeth malue da confuteth hys argumentes maluenda carmelite billicus taketh place confuteth amonges thinges spoken bucer also iustification denyeth euer accorded xiii daye februarye maluenda aunswereth bucer concludeth three thinges workes doe dispose prepare vnto iustification charytie fyrme iustifying workes men iustifyed doe accomplisshe iustificatition deserue eternall lyfe whylest treatynge aboute matter xv daye februarie came themperours letter comaundyg receyue iulius pflugies bisshop numburg pflugius amonges presidentes amonges presidentes nomber collocutours additours augmented extraordinarye men none scrybes appoynted suche presydentes chosen promyse kepe sylence vtter parte conference man liuing reported themperoure state thempire thynges accorded eyther parte shall subscribe suche remayne controuersie bee noted fewe wordes letter thus recyted protestantes aunswer amonges thynges obserue poynte strayte kepynge sylence commaunded aduertyse theyr prynces tyme tyme state dysputation whereaboute moche contention whilest presydentes sayde must followe themperours comaundement protestantes agayne alleaged myght swarue commaundementes theyr prynces wherefore presydentes last wryte vnto themperoure theyr request meane season duke saxon lyked condicions disputation hearde thereof sendeth hys men home agayne vnderstande whole matter gonne bucer xx daie marche departeth also declare colloquie dissolued doone lantzgraue whiche thing presidentes tooke verye vnpatientely geuen warenynge suche presente remayne styll nowe diuerse slypped awaye exhorte charge reste wyse attende themperours aunswer saye seynge theyr chefeste fellowes gonne inuayne tarye yf disputatyon shall contynewe promyse bee absente papystes afterwarde theyr bookes setfoorthe rayle vppon betterlye cause bucer aunswereth full soeuer sayde iustifycation man treateth moste largelye wyth ambassadours protestantes sente themperoure intreate archebisshop collon ambassadours peroure archebisshop collon ioyned ambassadours paulsgraue marque brandenburge electours theffect theyr request themperoure wolde referre hys case resydewe matter relygion staye processe commenced hys clergye yf violence wronge shalbe offered hym sygnifye neglecte hym whan emperoure hearde utreyght xxvi daye februarye seconde daye march gaue aunswer nauius declarynge good wyl borne hym hytherto howe frendely aduertysed hym shoulde oughte doe whyche hathe contemptuously despysed trustynge vayne appellation whyche take place neuerthelesse takynge theyre ambassade good parte supposeth procede zeale peace reconcylement relygion contente rather theyre requeste vse thys matter aduyse counsell prynces next assemblye regenspurge whyther nowe ready goe desyreth theyr prynces wolde come thyther themselues lyke case albeit troubled syckenes yet thentente ende controuersyes myghte wyll refuse trauell payne aboute tyme dyed alphousus daualus marque piscare gouernoure millane hys place succeded ferdinando gonzaga uiceroye sicilie shewed gonzage go uernour millane counsell differred trent vntill ides march thither sent bisshop thre legate iohn marimoutayne marcelle ceruine reinalde poole cardinalles thither came also fro themperoure daye appoynted iames mendoza pope legate counsell trente spaniarde spoken moche commendation themperoure hys greate good zeale towardes counsel churche roome excuseth hys absence promyseth hys endenoure furtheraunce hys name bisshoppes yet commen oute spayne whyche themperoure called sayeth muste ascrybed farre payneful iorney thys assemblye wormes cardinalles hereunto make aunswer albeit neuer doubted themperours zeale towardes religion yet thys oration hys right acceptable much bisshop trew vycare christ successoure peter prynce apostelles conference themperoure hathe appoynted thys counsell refourmatyon publicke weale namelye germanye theyr truste emperoure wyll see bee nothynge decreed wormes concernynge relygion al thynges referred counsel shoulde otherwise auncient custome churche also lawe bothe god man infrynged moreouer shoulde euyll president wold deface whole dignytye counsell touchyng hym selfe hys presence persone ryghte acceptable therefore many long came nothing done yere certen freres made sermon bisshoppes tyme aduente preachinge freers bul perdonnes bysshop also sendynge foorthe bull indulgence ides december sayeth miserye thys tyme suche reason ouerflowyng heresyes albeit take neuer muche laboure trauell payne common welthe yet scarselye satyssye hym selfe therfore hath called counsel woundes churche myghte bee healed whyche made wicked heretyckes saluatyon men consysteth therin agayne father counsell beynge holpen prayer others maye god commended exhorteth al men generall immediately frame themselues repentaunce confesse theyr synnes priest thre day weke tame theyr body fastynge dayes presente diuine seruice case sicke geue thing poore let poorer sorte oftymes saye ouer theyr pater noster receyue sacrament unto al obeye graunteth pardon remission theyr synnes comaundeth bysshops declare thynges people seuenth daye ianuarye whan number bysshoppes wel increased begynnyng counsell beganne counsell whan commen cathedrall churche masse donne foresayde cardinalles bysshop roomes legate oration father wrytten wherin declare howe counsell called three cause chiefly oratio pope legate heresyes maye weded vp rootes dysciplyne churche maye restored peace maye recouered saye howe whole blame thys presente calamytie imputed clergie heresy warre disorder soeuer haue geuen occasyon euylles throughe theyr auaryce ambition naughtie lyuynge therfore iuste iudgment god nowe thus contemned troubled afflicted yet accordynge theyr demerytes one dooeth dutye therefore admonisshe euerye man acknowledge hys faulte studie appease goddes wrathe g esedras nehemias repentaunce amendemente lyfe vsyng herein example esdras nehemias capytaynes theyr retourne admonisshed earnestly people israel confessinge father offence shoulde call god mercye come declare theyr owne duty whiche iudges thys case howe oughte free voyde anger hatred frendeshyp geue nothyng affection ascribe honour vnto god aungels beholdeth thys congregation neyther man thought hidde therfore must worke syncerely exhorte ambassadours kynges prynces oration red decree sinod iohn fonsseca bisshop castremarine spaniarde thys al christian warned amende theyr lyfe feare god many tymes decree sinode redde confesse theyr synnes go ofte churche praie god publicke peace bisshops pristes addicte prayer also euerye seuenth daye leste whiche called sondaye saye masse make intercession hygh bisshop themperoure whole como wealth fast moreouer geue aulmouse poore head churche masse songe weekelye vpon thursedaie honour holy ghost masse time almen attentife vnto prieste refrayne talkynge moreouer bisshoppes leade sober life fare sumptuously table eschew light idle talke vse familie lykewyse speakyng apparel al behauiour maye shewe honestie much synnode hath thys respect chiefly darknes errours heresyes haue many yeres ouerwhelmed earth dryuen awaie light treuth maie shyne foorth al ther warned chiefly learned sorte consyder diligentlye selues waye thys maye best brought passe geuyng theyr voyces follow decree cousell toletane modestlye clamourouselye contentious obstinate pronounce thynges temperately quietly sitting fourth daie february wherin nothyng done seconde session synode sauing confessed article fayth daie appointed third metynge eyght aprill hearde moe comyng therfore thought good tarye authoritie theyr decree myght somuche whylest thys donne trent luther sent go erles mansfelde set agremente betwixt wer controuersie luther chosen arbiter piece lande nouer accustomed treate suche affayres onlye applyed hys studye dayes hys lyfe borne issebie towne ye erles mansfelde coulde take muche payne hys countrye came issebie whych later end ianuarye felte hym selfe skant well ease yet accomplysshe thyng came sometyme preached churche receyued also communion xvii daie februarie waxed sore sicke hys stomake three sonnes iohn luther sicke martin paulle certen others frendes emonges also iustus ionas minister churche halle thoughe weake yet bothe dyne suppe reste whylest sate supper speaking sodry thinges moued also questio among others whether life euerlasting shal know one time desyrous learne hym sayeth chaunced adam neuer seene eue whether shall knowe eche lyfe come tyme god shaped caste maruelous depe sounde slepe awakyng whan sawe axeth whence came sayeth fleshe flesshe bone bone howe knew uerely beyng full holy ghost replenisshed trew knowledge god spake thus lyke maner shall also another lyfe renewed chryst shall know perfitly parentes wyues child euer besydes adam tyme knewe eue supper whan went side praie accustomed payne stomake began increase aduise certen dranke unicornes horne wine slept quietly trindle bed stowfe space houre two awakyng goeth hys chamber laieth hym downe againe rest biddyng hys frendes good nyghte hym wylled praye god wold graunt v kepe still doctryne gospell bisshop counsell trente workynge great mischief whan thus sayed al hushte slepeth good whyle force hys disease increasing vpon hym midnight complayneth straytenes hys stomake perceyuing thende lyfe drewe nere calleth god wordes god heauenly father father oure lord iesus chryst god al consolatio geue thankes luther last prayer thou hast reuealed vnto thy sonne iesus chryst haue beleued haue professed haue loued haue set foorthe honored bisshop roome al wicked rabel doe persecute dishonour beseche thee lord iesus chryst receyue soule heauely father although taken thys lyfe albeit must leaue thys body yet know assuredly shall remayne thee euer noman take thy handes long thys prayer sayde whan quiet departure luther one twyse comended hys soule handes god though fallen slepe little littel departeth oute lyfe withoute paine hys body could perceyued thus dyed hys owne natyfe countrey whyche seene manie yeres xviii daye februarye greate lamentation many erles mansfelde desirous myght haue ben buried theyr countrey borne commaundemet prince electour honorably caried wittemberge buryed fyft daye yeres aboute lxiii borne yeare oure lorde thousande iiii hondreth luther birthe fourescore three tenthe daye nouember ryght honest good parentes iohn margarite learned hys fyrst prynciples home thence beynge sente maydeburge isenacke farre excelled hys fellowes came erford gaue hym selfe wholie studye logicke philosophye whan ben whyle makyng neyther paretes fredes priuie professed hym selfe college austen freres applyed hys studye scripture forsakyng lawe whyche studied time uniuersitie newly erected wittemberge wherefore stupicious mention made fyrste booke hauynge charge hereof bryngeth luther thyther reade diuinitie luther sent roome conuente luther sent rome hys order aboute suite hanged lawe thys yere lord mdx whan retourned home motion hys frendes commenced doctour charge duke fridericke force pletie eloquence luther eloquence dutche tongue workes doe sufficiently declare certenly dutch toungue beautifyed enryched exceadingly hathe chiefe commendation therin hathe translated latin toungue thynges thought vnpossible expresseth matter apte proper termes many tymes one worde setteth youre eye whole matter wryteth certeine place bisshop howe hathe polluted lordes supper hathe also applied masse dead sayeth hathe pearsed hys masse corner christendome also purgatorye selfe vseth dutche word whyche representeth noise wont made whan man doeth rattle shake together nomber dead men bone cast aboute amonges courage inuincible tyme beganne fyrste preache agaynst pardon knewe matter mente hym selfe confesseth inuincible consta cie luther thing therfore wrote verey lowly bothe bisshop others whan profited knowledge scripture dayly perceyued doctryne agreable god worde withstode violence hys enemy malice whole world stoute courage lyke awalle brasse remayned styll vnmouable despysynge daunger whan themperoure helde counsell state imperyall auspurge immediately crowned bononie clement seuenth terrible tempest lyke enswe seuenth booke specifyed couinfort bothe hys frendes priuately others openly applying thys pourpose xlvi psalme god sayeth oure sure castell bulwarke olde enemye mankynde taketh matter hande hys force power layeth hys munition indede power small neyther longe susteyne greate violence howbeit noble champion god hym selfe hath chosen vnto hym hathe put armure fyghteth v knowe forcertentie iesus chryst muste nedes haue victory conquest albeit whole compasse thys worlde full deuilles yet affrayde assured confidence doe looke ioyefull successe although sathangnasshe hys teethe rage neuer fiersely yet shall nothyng preuayle agaynste v iudged already throughe worde falleth downe hys armure thys worde shall victory conquest word aduersaryes take v nyll shall leaue behynde tentes armye spirite gyftes defendeth v yf take awaie lyfe goodes wife chilchildren take patiently winne nothyng therby v prepared kyngdome euerlastynge psalme whiche tyme applyed relyeue sorrowe heuynes whan translated vulgare toungue somethynge wrastynge sence made also metre set note verye consonant argument mete tune styre vp minde euer synce tyme thys psalme hathe also muche songe amonges others suche decree made auspurge ascribeth blame therof booke setfoorthe afterwarde clement seuenth hys legate campegious speaketh honoure good themperoure whose name authorytie vsed clooke reporteth hym bee blameles seuententh booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument seuententh booke iohn diaze beyng sent ioinetly bucer colloquie regenspurge murthered hys owne brother alphonse lantzgraue commyng themperours speche declareth vnto hym condition counsell whyche protestantes requyre afterward makyng excuse cannot come assemblee taketh hys leaue frendly themperour sentence excommunication thondereth roome archebisshop collon peroute couertly maketh preparation warre germany counsel trent make theyr decree peter dane ambassadour frenche kynge themperoure soliciteth certen city germany also swysses polycye vnderstand protestantes hauinge intelligente hereof take theyr weapon tenure league betwixt pope themperour recyted themperour vrged pope letteth alone turke falleth vpon protestantes castell erenberge tonauert surprysed themperoure hys letter patentes bannissheth duke saxon lantzgraue pope armye commeth ayde themperoure lyttle mention made conference iohn diaze spaniard regenspurge iohn diazius spaniarde wente thyther bucer ben many yeres student paris diuinitie sarbonites red bookes luther others dilligentlye studied scripture doctryne began waxe vyle euery day last thentent might profit much leauing paris went geneua caluine minister churche whan remained went strasburge bucer perceiued much learnyng ernest zeale monethes whan go disputation regenspurge moued senate appoint companion felow iorney commyng therfore regenspurge moneth december goeth peter maluenda knewe diaze goeth maluenda paris one amased bewayleth lamenteth see party company protestantes whiche wil trihumphe one spaniard allured vnto opinion fewe spaniardes loue gospell great meany thousandes germanes therfore bega admonish wold haue respect name shamefullye staine spot countrey honest familie diazius aunswereth hym modestly commendyng protestantes doctrine departeth tyme wha came againe fewe day accorded maluenda planteth al ordenaunce myght put hym feare speaking many thinges authoritie bisshop roome rekeneth vp large daungerous thing curse themperoure come thyther shortely aduiseth tary hys commyng perchaunce daungerous counselleth hym goe mete waye fallinge downe feete themperours confessour craue perdon hys offence promiseth furtherance hym herein wherunto diazius aunswereth stoutely throughlye sayeth howe doctryne protestantes consonant doctrine apostels prophetes lamenteth miserye spayne nat countrey great darkenesse rebuketh maluenda fellowes impugne manifest veritie geue themperoure euill counsell ernestly warneth leaue refuseth counsell sheweth hym wyl god helpe professe thys holsome doctryne wyll refuse daunger hys lyfe therefore whan maluenda sawe hym strongelye confyrmed thy commyng hither sayeth vayne shalbe nothing determined yf liste doe good openly seme boast shoulde haue gone trente metinge diazius came nomore hys company maluenda wryting letter themperours cofessour repeteth whole matter exhorteth ernestly helpe disease tyme letter delyuered spaniard marquina whiche came lately roome vnderstandyng accusation beganne excuse diazius marquins excuseth diaze knew verye wel dayes retourneth home agayne declarech matter diazius brother alphonsus lawyer roome hearde themperours confessour meane season diazius went regespurge nuburge towne otto henry paulsgraue standyng riuer thonawe twelue myles aboue regenspurge cause hys goynge thyther ouersee correction booke bucer sent thyther prynted hys brother alphonsus kyndled tale marquina haply also letter som others besides brother alphonse coeth germany immediately prepareth selfe take iorney greate hast cometh first auspurge thence regenspurge wha vnderstode diazius hasteth thyther hym marueled lyttell sodan comming declareth cause vseth maner selfe argumentes reason maluenda regenspurge whan assayed vayne traytorous mind alphonse promiseth hym greate yerely pension hys benefyces wil goe roome wolde take place nother certen dayes confesseth himselfe vanquisshed fayneth though loued doctrine gospel exhorteth leauing germany hath aboundance learned men nedeth hys trauell wolde goe italye maye profit many first shall come trent many men singular learnynge iudgement wilbe right glad hys company goe roome naples shall come passe many shalbe ryghtly instructed hym sondrye place italye occasyon doctryne maye set forth also spayne therfore prayeth besecheth hym follow aduise herein promiseth beare hys charge euer nedefull besydes diazius striken great ioye gladnes reioyseth bothe hys owne cause also hys brother sendyng letter regenspurge vnto bucer rest requyreth haue theyr counsell write agayne admonisshe hym goe hym wherfore alphosus put quite besyde hope desyreth hym leste wise goe hym farre auspurge whylest gere brewyng bucer commeth nuburge intendynge goe home sayde counselleth hym sturre one foote thence himselfe departeth alphonsus gon whiche xxv daye marche daye alphonsus went thece talked brother curtoisely exhorteth hym vnto constancie thynketh hym selfe happye man hath profited muche fewe dayes throughe hys talke trewe knowledge god prayeth hym wolde wryte vnto hym ofte promiseth good wyll causeth hym take xiiij duckates whether wolde noe thus sheding teares eyther syde departeth riding wagon auspurge sixe myles nuburge next daye tarying lettinge alphonse retourneth nuburge kill brother wagoner flattering woordes rewardes myght hym taketh waye came bying hatchet waye carpenter xxvii daye marche dawenyng daye commeth agayne nuburge leauynge hys horse without gate poste auspurge brought hym goeth towne accompanyed man murtherer commeth hys brother lodging seruant lest streyght way knowen put apparell messe ger posteth letter going knocketh dore axeth diazius vnto hath letter let goeth vp hys chamber alphonsus taryed benethe stayre foote watching man shoulde let theyr enterprise diazius awakyng hearyng saye messenger commen hys brother leapeth bed hauynge nothyng vpon hym hys clooke caste aboute hym hys nyghte gere goeth foorthe dynyng chamber next laye commeth letter delyuereth skarce lyght daye effect letter howe verye carefull daunger let hym well ware maluenda suche enemy gospell whylest diazius readynge murtherer standyng behynd backe letteth dryue hatchet hyd vnder hys clooke hys myght strake murtherer killeth diaze ryght syde hys head vp healue hauing sodainly hys braynes thus clouen sonder neuer spake worde murtherer leaueth axe stickyng styll wounde getting hym quickly downe stayres immediatlye principall master hasteth towne leaping vpon theyr horse ready gate comen exceadyng great spede bothmey bayting towne mid waye beetwixt nuburge auspurge takyng freshe horse whiche leaste pourposely come auspurge chamber diazius ded ly one claudius cenarcleus yonge gentleman cladius senaclyus sauoye murther secretly done nexte chamber perceiued nothing vntil suche time hearde spurres strike stayres whan murtherer ranne hastely downe tha arysyng came forthe sawe miserable heuy sight brute mischeuous dede facte moste horrible immediately spred abroade throughout nuburge diuerse prince seruauntes loued diazius tooke horse pursued whan comen auspurge coulde fynde cleane hope determine retourne backe agayne one whiche elder stouter reste called michell herffer rideth forthe wonderfull spede rest village werines iorney getteth came sonner insprucke declareth whole matter maiestrate whan came also longe caused apprehended accuseth murther writing prince otto henry counte palatine aduertiseth hym howe taken whervpon prince sent two counsellours fro nuburge insprncke playde case taking poste horse came thither kalendes aprill put matter doubt bring night cappe diazius bluddy hatchet slewe brother letter fore came alphosus gote leaue write fredes case stoode second day aprill whan ambassadours nuburge comen magistrate informed hym whole matter requyred myghte bee put executyon yf wyll stande denyall facte might racked magistrate referred matter iudges came murtherers permitted take aduocates pleade matter differred day daie last plaintines commaunded exhibite theire accusation latin spanisshe thys came themperours letter went regenspurge wherin themperours letter paracide commaunded surcease let processe alone brother haue hearyng matter regenspurge whe coulde obteyne none aunswer otto henry electour palatine intreate senate insprinke vpon sufficient pledge send defendauntes nuburge murther committed make excuse theperous letter time thys murther donne themperoure came spyer goynge regenspurge waye bipounte whyche towne prynce wuolfangus paulsgraue wife latzgraues theperoure visiteth lantzgraue hys daughter daughter laye chylde bed themperour went visyte geuyng moste gentle comfortable woordes dealeth great rewardes amonges woman hauyng woorthye gyfte readye hande geue ladye selfe sendeth backe spier whyther came ende marche lantzgraue admonisshed nauius sayde mete themperoure waye goyng regenspurge woord sent hym granuellan moneth februarye whan peroure utrecht vpon mase wherfore receiuing saufeco duite theperoure came spier thither came also paulsgraue lantzgraue commeth peroure electour wyllyam mansbach ambassadour duke wyrtemberge xxviii daye marche goeth lantzgraue themperoure talkynge hym priuately chauncelour whan tolde cause occasion hys comming one place germany also foreine nation reported moste myghty emperoure throughe bysshop roomes procurement shulde mynd great displeasure protestantes goeth abrut also conclusyon peace shuld haue perswaded french kyng ayde punnisshyng moreouer sollicite turke trewes may muche easelyer brynge youre pourpos passe therefore saye bisshop hathe called comaunded counsell vpon decree made haste matter myght put execution maketh v rather think report trewe see howe ernestly busyly suite procedeth againste archebisshop collon certenly forasmuche haue ayded chargeablye french kyng turk offered doe declared spier haue donne also euer aunceters accustomed moreouer inasmuche haue graunted v large warrauntes concerninge peace law bothe regenspurg spier thinges chaunce v beyonde expectation yet trust departe germany wyll cause relygion established prescripte goddes woorde prouinciall counsell germany case dissention throughly accorded yet peace whiche promised v spier wold commaunde wholy obserued suche wyse bee neyther chaunged taken awaye decree counsell hereunto themperoure aunswereth nauius howe sondrie reportes haue commen hys eares also attempte enterpryse yet wolde credite especiallye hearde hys letter written nauius nowe also beleueth muche lesse concernynge whyche spake frenche kynge man able proue hathe pea nothynge el guise fraunce braue bragge matter bee vayne moued turke trewes chiefly loue germany seyng sondrie assemblyes thempire complayned greate charge pouertye people thought best waye relyeue duryng tyme trewes myght consulte make war agaynste set order religion herein yet nothyng determyned hereof must conferre hys brother fernando counsell haue many yeres requyred nowe throughe hys greate suite labour assembled euer hathe done therin hathe donne good affectyon publicke weale perchaunce taketh otherwise well donne hathe vsed archebisshop collon frendlye coulde abyde delaye hys preparatyon warre seeth presetly man housholde seruauntes neyther doeth gather power cause whie sent supposeth man desireth peace therfore requireth declare fantasye howe relygion may appeased thinketh maye obteyned fellowes list wil appoint cousel co ferre ye matter lantzgraue speaking himselfe yf laye noble emperoure doe anye thynge welthe lantzgraue theperoure germanye maynteynge amytye beetwene state thempire certenly wold spare paine cause chiefly came hither wisshed surelye haue moe fellowes could shortnes tyme duke saxo farre iames sturmius troubled sicknes beleue ryghte well haue hearde sondrye reportes doubteles trewthe wrote nauius consultation agaynst frankefurte treated onlie howe myght bothe perseuer oure relygion also repulse vniuste violence french king shewed v affinitie duke orleans king promised ayde v many wise marueled sued turke trewes supposed lyght cause moued doe especiallye hauyng peace frenche kyng forasmuche saye done common welthes sake haue nothyng obiecte germany nede longe synce haue ben vnburthened suche charge desyred counsell treweth free godly holded germany doe counsell protestantes desyred esteme thys trent suche sufficientlye declare vnto woormes shewe waye howe accorde relygion maye withoute aduise manye fellowes perceyue well haue small thanke neyther partie yet refuse conferre counsell herein preiudiciall haue dede hope counsel others secluded bisshoppes onlye others bisshop roomes sworne men shall determyne thynges suppose synode germany shulde vnprofitable yet nation differ muche v opinion doctrine thyng farre entred germany altered therfore nothyng better yf woulde permit relygion free yet men shulde obserue peace suppose ordeyned colloquie regenspurge verye good intent heare som present freers disturber peace howe certen bitter freers call agayne questyon article already accorded naughtye lyfe withal good looked theyr handes archebisshop collon doubteles goodman euer dooeth thys matter supposeth bee hys dewtye especyallye syth decree regenspurge inioyned hym refourme churche reformatio caused made temperately might taking awaye tha nedeful church goodes altered boke reformation collon verie littel boke agreable holy scripture cofirmed testimony auncient doctours tertulia auste ambrose others wer nerer time apostle wherfore violence offered hym thys matter might awarnynge others altered great deale sayeth themperoure leaue treaty franckfurte neither beleued tale wer tolde neyther haue geuen anie occasyon shoulde haue procured counsell intent profite common welth mynding yf thyng decreed shuld wrong donne protestantes therfore euen cause appointed conferece regenspurge beginnyng wherof well case proceded archebysshop collon albeit promised surcease differ matter procedeth neuerthelesse rigor compulsion putteth ordinary curate putteth others hys pleasure handeleth clergye extremely stayeth witholdeth reuenewes customes chanons precise thynges constrayned assist clergie complaynynge vnto theyr iniuryes talke betwene counsellours shoulde preiudiciall therwith well contented hereunto againe lantzgraue beare good affection towardes germany league frendes victoryous emperoure ryght glad ioyful beseche god maye perseuer herein surely yf accordyng youre excellent wysedome doe well consyder waye selfe commoditye germanye youre magnificence youre realmes prouinces shall fynde nothyng wished state shoulde bee glad theyr supreme magistrate agayne maye haue styll louyng obedient certenly yf fortune germany shoulde weakened wylbe chiefly youre discommoditie touchyng lorde collon matter standeth euen sayde inasmuche sheparde wolde fayne haue hys flocke fedde good holsome foode thynketh hys dutye lesse therefore hathe caused fourme thereof set foorthe nowe hys aduersaryes begynnynge moste gredye reformatyon commen passe refuse drawe backewarde themperoure interruptynge ah sayeth archebisshop collo accoumpted vnlearned shulde good man refourme scarselye vnderstandeth latyn al hys lyfe neuer sayde three mass wherof heard two selfe learned readeth ouer diligetly germane bookes sayeth yt latzgraue wel assured vnderstadeth religio againe theperoure refourme bring new faith religion neyther doeth sayeth lantzgraue graunt hath receyued new relygion hathe renewed olde leafte chryst hys apostle hath displaced certen curate churche placed others aperteyneth hys charge office yf person naughty lyuer vnlearned surely bisshops parte substitute hys steade fyt within iurisdictions diuers bisshoppes many church lye uacant able saye beyng destitute curate people fedde kind doctryne gouerned discipline lyke brute beastes lyue barbarous dissolute lyfe hathe taken somwhat ignorance people lacke teachyng clergye hath thys reason hym imployed greate golde turkisshe frenche warres maner thempire prince shal cause commaunde subiectes paye therefore thys thynge deserueth blame commonlye bruted relygion hys aduersaryes inuented brynge hym hatred nexte daye paulsegraues lodging mete lantzgraue granuella nauius masbacke nauius began talke repeteth communication latzegraue others parte theperours comunication daye declareth wherfore nowe mette sheweth howe desyrous themperoure peace cause appoynted conference regenspurge sayeth diuines wet waie aunswered lantzgraue theyr departure thence yet knoweth nothyng duke saxon aduertised letter vnreasonable condicions offered begynning whan might neyther haue theyr scrybes wryte see copye treaty yet permitted write thyng home hearde also howe vntemperately freers collocutours freers vile lyfe learnyng handled matter wolde ouer throwe article reconciled tooke awaye hope concorde dishonest example life offense many whether theire diuines departed therfore dispayre matter yet knoweth certenly called thence talked granuellan fyrst speakyng much themperoures good nature loue peace partely excused condicions disputation prohibited sygnifye oughte home sayeth done without themperours commaundement lantzgraue exhorting thynges set side wolde come present matter commendeth decree made spier yere paste concernyng peace order lawe declareth prouinciall counsell germany moste expedient accorde quyet religion asmuch italyans spaniardes frenchemen dissent farre germanes doctryne hys opynion generall counsel shuld little porpos withstandyng soeuer matter fall though none agrement made yet sheweth ought obserue peace decree spier mighte abolisshed state relygion suche germany whoso wolde assaye extinguish muste distroye innumerable thousandes whyche shoulde bothe exceading great losse themperoure force germany hathe auaunced also nation loue chiefly turkes greate reioysing commoditie decree spier sayeth granuella made time neyther fault themperoure force log knowen well enough priuate counselles seuerall natyons ther hath ben redresse made vice maners faithe religion mention made thinges full disse tion sectes touching faythe one opinio wherfore disceptation concerneth germanes al chrysten people lyke case moste parte diuines frowarde men stubburne obstinate case diuines stubburne obstinate dipatched therfore muste prynces noble men skannyng therof certen meane waie relygion founde oute selues permitte religion free suche contrary opinion punisshed imprisonment purse seeyng themperoure desyreth chiefly concorde maye wyse graunte thyng vngodly yf thynges permitted common people shoulde magistrate liue saftie doe vnwisely sayeth lantzgraue reason weightie matter fellowes beyng absent notwithstanding cause matter handled preiudice wyll procede suppose themperoure made decree spier good intet aduersaries content suffer promised maye nowe go backe theyr wordes agayne inasmuch gaue themperoure stronge ayde agaynst frenche kinge truste surely thyng agreed vpon confirmed seales shal broken moreouer nothyng ought let prouinciall counsel professe faythe apostle counsell nice athanasius oure diuines agreed vppon chiefe principall article ther dede controuersie amonges cocernyng lordes supper nowe appeased none confesseth body blud christ truly receyued anabaptistes dauidians know besydes dede doe punnish therfore nedeful foreine nation shulde present thinges shalbe determined neuerthelesse gaue themselues knowledge trueth chieflye wished certen meane opinion shuld establyshed men honour doe greatly resist thinke ca hardly donne diuines sincere preaching gospel whole supper lord marriage priestes might permitted tyme paste paphuntius perswaded counsel nicene suppose concorde might establisshed know place men constrayned come oure religion suffer contrary sondry doctryne selfe place compell man kyll man spoyle hym hys goodes case men relygion myght remayne harmeles dominios might haue theyr church seuerally assuredly coulde contente myne owne parte suffer youres haue theyr church lyke case rule dominion asmuche wyll graunt desyre also haue oure doctryne equiualente therefore looke sayde decree spier prouincyall counsel germanie doe take best also bee man sayeth granuellan worlde loueth peace assuredly themperoure indede bishop roomes pleasure wyll swarue one heare breadthe equytye hath kept also decree spier without greate offence partye also bisshop ea nauius doe sustayne smal displeasure cause counsell prouinciall cannot see shuld iudge al men doe vnderstand scripture one sorte conference learned men appereth smal hope doubtles som meanes muste bee founde article indede accorded agayne moe yet cotrouersie moreouer accorded bucer doth interpret largely thyng selfe permitteth yf shoulde nowe reste easy iudge wolde state thempyre lengthe lyke righte well sayeth themperoure ought compell pope dutie lantzgraue saye howe themperoure hangeth bisshop sleue wolde god myghte brynge bisshop hys dutye tymes paste bisshoppes roome honour themperour theyr supreme magistrate emperours ar bounden othe controuersies god woorde oughte chyfe iudge whyche obscure che minde men wolde frame themselues accordynglye sheweth vnto v synne prouoketh v repentaunce amendemente lyfe preacheth vnto v chryste hathe taken waye synnes worlde whose name also god father called vpon woolde graunte v hys holye spiryte uerelye thys faythe doctryne hathe euer styll remayned churche lordes prayer crede apostle dyuerse songes beesydes accustomed church doe instructe v benefite chryst neither must consyder greatest multitude weneth ende scripture trewthe ierusalem also time diuerse apostle disciple wolde haue heathen people receiued gospel circumcised peter paule iames barnabas contrary opinion errour residew shewed abrogate yoke lawe whyche tyme greatest beste thinges please sewest parte congregation gaue place obeied iudgement right verely doe prescribe nation couet germanes might agree within themselues treate meane way could cotent swarued decre spier concernyng establisshment peace lawe thynges sene may establysshed god woorde maye wold haue also cosen frend paulse graue hathe ben many assembly knoweth muche matter past speake hys opinion herin speaking themperours good disposition mynde paul graue sayeth howe conference regenspurge well muche purpose begonne renewed article already accorded decided thinketh myght come tollerable agrement rest themperoure sayeth granuellan desyreth acocorde verie muche hath ben ofte repeted excepte establysshed surely redounde dammage publycke weale albeit themperour hath thus muche profyt thempyre albeit hath hys health also yet loue germany hathe taken iorney hath taken secret counsell eyther french king others neyther commeth craue ayde prouyde generally men bothe fraunce englande leuie great force men whiche greatly suspected moreouer theperour hath doe spayne reason death hys daughter inlawe yet thynges set part goeth assemblie yf prince come thither shall doe alone much calling cry hyn refourme thinges yet wyll come place appoynted consultation therfore doe well lordes speaking paulsgraue lantzgraue whiche two chiefest wolde goe thyther albeit sayeth lantzgraue themperoure hathe greate reuenewes thempire yet asmuche hathe ayde alwayes thence agaynste turke agaynst frenche kynge others dignitie thempire getteth hym great authorytie profit hath peroure germany amonges kinges may leuye alwaies force power hys pleasure maye assemble greate armyes germany others maye doe lyke muche thys estemed aduersaryes clamorous yet wyll follow good cousell bothe allowed ye decree spierand article accorded fyue yeres synce regenspurge desired haue enrolled matter recorde admitted also al reasonable condicions laste conference contrary wyse none al neyther wolde brought coformitie open protestation wormes refused communication go regenspurge charge greate also matter controuersye betwene electour saxonye duke lantzgraue arbiter beetwirte duke saxon moris theyr counsellours determyne put arbitrement neuerthelesse wyll sende ambassadours assemblye large commission thus departing fewe houres commeth nauius agayne lantzgraue telleth day talke hath pleased themperour solliciteth come hymselfe regenspurge also enquireth hym whether wolde talke agayne themperoure daye euenyng refuseth whan came themperoure geueth hym thankes nauius fyrste came thyther secondely theperoure thanketh lantzgraue seeth paulsegraue bothe desyrous concorde howebeit supposeth collocutours wil retourne againe regenspurge yf doe wyll sende agayne meane tyme requireth wolde come hym selfe assemblie though begynnyng yet towardes later ende hym selfe hath verely affaire layde parte taryed three yeres germany thentent myght quyet wherunto lantzgraue aunswered departure colloquitours hearde thys daye hath also recyted cause wherfore thinketh done yf desyre fellowes content diuines contrary parte doe retourne agayne hys also shall tary thence selfe may goo thyther hath ben great charge warre brunswicke hath lately maryed daughter chosen vmpere betwene duke saxon goe thyther great company hys absence hys countrey might daunger confederate duke brunswicke prisoner sayeth theperour hys intent burthen hym vnnecessarye charge desireth hym ernestlye come supposeth howe hys presence wolde whole consultation saxon others myght couraged cause shoulde thing affraide duke heuries fellowes neyther power greate thoughe shoulde attempte thynge yet wolde let suffer man shal disturbe publycke quyetnes lantzgraue agayne recytyng cause saieth promise nothyng neuerthelesse wyll sende ambassadours whiche shall trauell peace whych yf thynges obeye gratifye hym desyreth hym take displeasauntelye neyther thynke obstinacie mallice feare godes displeasure thys lyfe tyme verey shorte vncerten therefore must thinke euerlastingnes themperour againe speaking hys owne paine taken sayeth matter saxon maye differred therfore let hym come set lettes parte hym selfe beyng present myght bothe counsell cause hys league frendes shewe themselues tractable meane beginning treaty maye reasonable lantzgraue complayninge dyuers ayded duke brunswicke maketh briefe rehersall whole matter howe taken sayeth duke morys doe susteyne great iniurye light person borne styre vp trouble amonges friderick spedius tolde yesterdaye yf wolde heare hym spedius blabbe wold open certen secret priuie deuises nowe working asmuche trusted man refused talke hym wylled hym sygnyfye vnto hym wryting thinges wold haue tolde hym presetly whan lantzgraue declared theperour maruelous angrie spedius wherfore thys communication amonges lantzgraue lantzgraue taketh hys leaue emperoure takyng hys leaue themperoure bad farewel ryght frendely went thence hedelberge home themperoure went streyght regenspurge selfe time saye kalendes aprill ambassadours protestantes assemble wormes consult whole matter themperoure sent awaye lantzgraue gently receiuing letter hym meane tyme reported matter duke saxon xxiii daye aprill depart myght consulte matter regenspurge whyther must go imperiall assemblie thys conuention rauespurge entred league protestantes eight daye aprill thirde sytting father counsell thyrde session syneode trente trent recited bokes olde new testament comaunded taken sacred holy parte iote omitted olde common translation bibell commaunded vsed church scooles also decreed man interpret holy scripture owne sece vnderstanding al follow herin cosent church aunciente father moreouer printer commaunded prynte set foorth nothing consent ordinary bysshop furthermore forbidden ye man shal vse termes testimonyes scripture triflyng thynges vayne fable superstition inchauntmente witchecrafte also ralyng slaunderous libelles daye appointed next syttyng seuententhe daye june themperours ambassadour oration emperours ambassadour tyme fraunces toletane spoken much themperours prayse declared moreouer howe ioyefull daye themperoure wherin bishop rome comenced counsel sheweth ioyned commission didaco mendoza hauing caught ague retourned uenise olde ambassade promysing hys seruice sayeth must praye god wold long continew consent myndes bisshop themperoure godlye holsome publycke weale intent vice refourmed euill weedes plucked vp rootes lordes felde maye receiue auncient tillage eleuenth daye aprill bisshop addresseth hys letter hierome franch sent backe swysses vnto bisshoppes sedune chur certen abbottes partyes howe hathe called prelate christendome generall counsell trent reason represente pope letter bisshops sedune chur churche swiss shoulde come thyther chieflye people nation vnto hym derely beloued rest peculiar child see apostolicke defendours ecclesiastical liberty tret commen alreadye verey manye bisshopes oute italy frauce spayne nomber encreaseth daylye wherefore semely dwell farre shoulde preuente nere hande greate parte theyr people infected heresyes muche nede counsell wherefore let nowe dilygence recompence thys slackenes get thyther immedyatelye delaye set parte vnlesse wyll incurre penaltye lawes prescribed cryme neglectynge theyr dewtie playne dysobedyence reste shall hys ambassadour tell vnto prayeth geue credyt clergie uniuersitie collon followed theyr suite roome theyr archebysshop verey ernestlye wherfore bisshop roome xvi daye aprill asmuche forgettyng hys owne saluatyo hath offended diuersesly agaynst ecclesiastical rule doctrine agaynst tradition apostle rite ceremonyes christiane religion church accustomed cotrary censure leo archebisshop collon exco municated pope tenth setfoorth luther fellowes doeth excommunicate communion church depriueth archebishopricke al others benefice priueleges dignity commaundeth people hys iurysdiction generall fro henceforch obey hym releaseth also theyr othe whyche bounden hym commaundeth hym sylence awardeth hym pay contrary parte costes mage collon ioyned byshops liege utreiche uniuersitie louain sentece imprinted roome moneth august themperour came regenspurge infourmed whole matter presydentes theperoure commeth regenspurg conference toke going awaye diuines euill parte dispatching hys letter throughe germany complayneth greatly therof exhorteth prince moste ernestly come themselues protestantes came ambassadours thyther came duke moris ericke duke bruswicke iohn albert brandenburge bishoppes trent auspurge bamberge wirciburge passawe hildesseme aboute thende maye came also kyng ferdinando second daye iune ye protestats goe themperoure complayne murtheryng diazius desyre murtherer may suffer accordyngly themperour murther diaze vnpunished sayeth wyll consulte wyth hys brother ferdinando moued also maketh lyke aunswer protestantes ambassadours paulsgraue archebysshop collon mu ster norinberge regenspurge norling thirde daye themperoure calleth al state declareth cause callynge thys conuention hath complayned muche absence prynces fyndeth hym selfe lesse greued collocutours sodaynely broken departed wherefore inasmuche coueteth greatlye relygion myght set staye germany desyreth theyr aduise counsell herein moreouer iudgment chamber maye refourmed vnburthened charge therof fynally sheweth howe relyfe quyet germany hathe throughe meanes frenche kynge taken trewes turke one yere seeyng trewes commeth oute october nexte brother king ferdinando telleth broken also already knoweth wylbe ende therof supposeth shalbe fayne whan tyme requyreth geue hym ayde whych heretofore promysed wyll defence thempyre mynister helpe counsell able prince electours wonte consulte conferre together thys tyme ambassadours mentz treuerse forsake ambassadours collon palatyne saxon brandenburge adiuision amonges electours reuolt catholickes conference approue counsell trente exhorte themperoure wolde maynteyne perswade protestantes bothe wolde goe thither also submytte selues vnto decree iudgement synode protestantes desyre themperoure wolde establyshe fyrme peace vpryghte iustyce wolde referre cause religion laweful counsell germany assemblie thempyre conference learned men vpon certen condycions shew counsell trente hathe ben promysed decree thempyre whylest consulted aboute matter behold brute warre protestantes bruted brode themperoure kynge ferdinando bysshoppe roome made greate preparatyon warres insomuche themperoure peace fraunce trewes turke thys yere oportunytye tyme semed fytte work theyre feate certen bysshoppes themperours confessoure bysshop roome practysed thought amonges others haue greate occasyon hereof wherefore whan themperoure fullye resolued haue warre ix daye iune sendeth cardynall trente greate poste haste roome message bisshop procure ayde promysed two dayes dispatcheth awaye captaynes chieftaynes money goe leuie men incontinentlye commaunded marimilian erle bure bring low country al force could get bothe horseman fotemen commau deth also marque albert marque iohn brandenburge falsehod marque albert iohn brandenburge wulfangus master order germany gether bandes horseman two though protestantes religion marque iohn also league yet asmuche themperoure sayde howe attempted warre religion agaynst certen rebelles promysed hym seruice marque iohn maried duke bruswickes daughter prisoner lantzgraue ambassadours protestates troubled heare matter taking care comon daunger germany desyre state thempire wold goe themperoure intreate wold haue warre vaine especially ambassadours mentz treuers vtterly refused lantzgraue lantzgraue circumspecte good espialles euery sedyng oft letter regespurge aduertised intelligence sondry place admonished bandes horseman whiche suspicion warre hyred shuld styl reteyned newe taken vp prouyded asmuch theperours demaundes prete ded likelynes warre lenitie desire peace thoughte verely shuld haue ben warre yeare tyme thing self declared brute vayne whan nowe germany also italy power leuied moreouer force spaniardes approche xvi daye iune goe themperoure place full warlycke motion inquyre hym whether thynges hys commaundemente asmuche reporte goeth myndeth warre agaynst turke foreine prince maruell ende thys preparatyon tendeth ambassadours collo palatine hereunto themperoure appoynted nauius make aunswer loue hath imbraced germany euer synce fyrst emperoure nede recyte nowe wyll also neyther hath pourpos peace iustice maye obserued pyre state may reconcyled herein shall obeye hym commaunded looke good wil hym shall doe otherwyse sayeth howe must procede accordyng hys ryght authorytie nexte daye addressyng letter theperours letter city protestates dyuerse city league protestantes especyally strasburge norinberge auspurge ulmes doubt sayeth know well enough howe derely beloued germany common countrie v al hathe ben alwayes trauell paynes haue taken charge haue great dammage realmes kyngdomes thintent weightie daungerous dissention religion might appeased wherin doubtles haue sought myne owne priuat co moditie alwayes indeuoure offence taken waie germany might quiet decree doe testifye oft renewed albeit certen doe enterprete thynges otherwyse doe falsely ascribe vnto contrary moreouer thys gouernemente common welth haue euermore especyall care preseruation free city shulde oppressed certen whyche yf myghte fynde occasyon brynge theyr pourpose passe wolde fayle thing suppose wyse haue marked former actes nowe though certen men haue oftentymes attepted diuerse thinges hynderaunce boothe state also theperours crafte yet asmuche could without greate sturre redresse haue suffered hytherto good hope surelye shoulde lengthe reape fruyte thys pacyence lenitye profyt publycke weale whiche doubtles commen passe men secrete wonderfull polycyes letted thys agremente certes thys cause eyther loue relyon respect god glory vnder certen pretence holynes wherwith myghte cloke theyr wickednes myght oppresse state bryng theyr goodes landes theyr owne handes reuenewes haue vsurped already violently deteyne greate iniurye many nowe haue brought matter thys passe iustyce set asyde feare nothyng shoute office moe wayes one raseshely demynisshe thys intente certenly maye subdewe state thempyre especyallye cytyes partely force partely craftie meanes whose talke maketh beleue thynge certenly trewe whan bragge credebly infourmed threate also wil attempt force warre agaynste thyng wytnessed many theyr forged sedytions famous lybelles picture setforthe reyse sedition inflame people againste therfore haue hope euer shulde lenitie pacience waxe better amend leaue insolent faccios certenly hitherto haue littell profyted meane many yeres become nothing al better also worse themselues obstinate rebelles desperate whiche thing certenly tendeth distruction publycke weale vnlesse remedy found wyll come passe germany shall fall hys auncyent lybertye moste greuous bo dage tyranny maye neyther beare suffer anye longer neither ca meane excused though wold wherfore thintent dygnytie may preserued peace iustice maie consist vertu strength iminent daunger may repulsed empyre youre heades haue prefixed bring disturber common welth theyr dutye restore germany olde beautie lybertie intet myne thought good sygnifye vnto shuld geue credite vnto haply shal brute broade pourpose otherwise doe assure vpo honour doe none respect haue declared therfore trust also faile herein bothe boldnes may repressed youre dignitie may also recouered shall thus doe bed looke goodwill handes wil declare incase send ambassadoure touching like thing effect wrote also duke wirteberge daye wherein letter dited granuellan nauius calle vnto ambassadours city beforesaide speaking euerie seuerally maner one sort saye warre ment prepared cyties againste certen rebelles haue committed treason infringed themperours authoritye haue taken possession certen prince bishop whiche dede occasyon wil spare city neyther wherfore looke shewe theyr fayth allegeaunce peroure ayde enemy themperoure haue cause displeasure agaynste vnto wissheth well let wryte thys whome spede exhorte theyr cyties remayne theyr de wtye themperoure also wryte vnto like wise sende ambassadours daye trent ordeyned statute trente abbey monkes chanons learned man appointed reade lecture diuinitie herunto benefyce assigened steade pension man admitted office reading whose learning maners lyfe bishop abbot certayne preachyng gospel nothyng lesse necessarye readyng selfe bisshops al prelate churche commaunded instructe people yf haue lawful impedimet substitute others shall moreouer headpristes pastoures people charged ye lest euery sondaye declare vnto men thinges necessary saluation exhort vnto vertu feare vice syn penaltie appoynted neglect dutye bisshops also admonished note dilligentlye thinges taught incase heresy absurde opinion sowen abrode vse remedie lawes prescribed decree made originall synne saye whole spot thereof taken decree oryginal sin awaye baptisme remayueth dede baptised motion synne concupiscence albeit paul sometyme calleth synne yet done synne dede properly inclineth sinne uirgin marye comprysed thys decree obserued tyme paste ordeyned bysshop sirtus fourthe name nexte daie limited sit xxix iune sixtus fourth make decre wherin excommunicate heretickes whyche teache uirgyn mary conceaued oryginall synne daye consecrated churche roome memoryall conceptyon oughte kept holy thys decre written part byshops law called extrauagates foresayd counsell sitting peter danese ambassadour french king made oration speakynge oration frech ambassadour danese many thynges desertes godly zeale kinges fraunce towardes churche roome begynnynge kynge clodowey declareth howe kinge fraunces descendinge progenitours kynde dewtye inferyour lynked leo tenth continuall bonde amytie likewyse adrian clement paull third whyche tempestuous storme religion hathe ben well ware alteration hath ben within hys dominion wold haue whole iudgement matter referred church albeit hys owne nature moste mercifull yet hathe put greuous tormentes certen priuate rashenes haue assayed diminyshe state church dillygence seueritie hath obteined deliuereth vnto fraunce peasable wyse new strauge doctryne auncient custome olde discipline confyrmed hathe alwayes thought profytable publycke weale church shuld one namely bisshop roome successour peter vnto others head myght referre theyr doynges hath ben euermore carefull thys magistrate myghte styll kepe supremacye albeit hath often time large offer ben moued contrary vnderstandith kynge england followe thexample hathe shewed hys eye yet coulde neuer bee remoued hys pourpos late whan counsell called hearde howe certen father assembled forthewhich commaunded certen hys cheife bisshops repayre thyther whan decree made brought fraunce appointed hym fellowes come declare hys lykyng opinion touchyng therfore fyrst request wold one establishe generall thyng relygion freche kynges qu ste followed beleued agayne thecclesiasticall person wolde prescribe moste sharpe disciplyne lyfe maners euer shal decree let put doubte hys commaundement shall obserued fraunce moreouer muche kynges fraunce haue done muche churche roome wolde suffer thyng dimisshed altered possession wherof kynges fraunce haue euer synce lewis surnamed pius sonne great charles finally frenche church whereof hathe patronage left hym hys elder wolde confyrme ryghtes priueleges lybertyes letter mentioned credite also came lazarus schuendius strasburge ye xxiiii daie iune waye spoken rest cytyes aunswer strasborough peroure senate sendyng hym awaye long wrote vnto peroure made directe aunswer lazarus saye straungenes difficultie thing concerne others lyke case nowe saieth beareth loue germany geue hym great thakes besecheth hym perseuer suffer hym selfe styrred vp ciuyll warre complayneth moreouer certen doe theyr de wtie neither shew theyr dew obedience sory heare yet trust none theyr religion culpable greate crime fault hath ben v saye relygion hath ben accorded knowe ryght wel noble emperoure howe willinge confyrmable haue haue recontilemente bothe fyue yeres paste regenspurge also synce tymes certen others thaduise perswasion bishop haue refused referred althinges roome bisshop intendeth violece power reteyne styll greate errours whyche arrose pope tyrante thys dissentio church doeth handle matter al thinges maye comit cause vnto iudgment wherby may wel perceyued susteyne wrong yf man shulde lay blame v thys controuersye appeased obiected vnto shulde seke plucke church goodes theyr owne handes vnder pretence relygion vnfrendly sayde haue heard knowen cesar oure fellowes coulde suffer longer monkishe lyfe theyr dominion growen farre order howe haue conuerted clergie abused churche goodes better v fyndyng scooles releuing poore agayne well knowne howe men contrary relygio heape vp churche goodes abuse voluptuousnes yet nothyng spoke furthermore selfe haue made decree bothe regenspurg lately spier common quiet goodes oughte vsed nowe incase man hathe obserued measure herein doubte yf called forthe heard speake wolde abyde iudgement geue none occasyon germanye shulde therefore layde waste warre obiect men haue subuerted ministration iustice ignorant moste mightye emperoure wherfore haue coplayned iudges chamber howe ernestly haue desyred redresse whiche albeit hath ben ofte promised yet neuer came effecte therfore preseruation peace displace lately spier takynge order howe chamber shoulde hereafter established order alwayes cotent obeye declared wormes oure aduersaryes vtterlye refuse sayde rather haue iudgement therfore blame matter imputed vnto finally could neuer perceiue euer oure league fredes aspire couet office wet aboute oppresse others el boasted threatened woorke kynde violence certenly beleued thynges beate head byshop roome minister hatred beare relygion howbeit doe suppose haue perceyued good wil towardes warres haue foreine nation wold god incenseth nowe agaynste v borne euer good doe goodwyll protestates toward peroure warres either ben attempted al el much soner ended nowe sedition warres haue chaunced germany synce emperoure haue demeaned themselues towardes howe frankly oure men haue geuen theyr ayde agaynst turke openly knowen chiefely defence youre country austriche forasmuche therfore doubt state free giltles crime whych reported vnto yf might heard able declare theyre innocency others moste ernestlye requyre merciful emperoure father countrie loue god preseruation germany beseche laie aside thys great preparation call iudgemente heynously complayned vpon hyghnes accordynge auncient maner predecessours accustomed whiche trust omitte yf thus doe put doubt shall soone perceyue haue suffered iniurye beare greate good wylles towardes thys consultation beholde beseche miserable state germany reason continuall dearth thynges also terrible cruell enemye turke consyder fydelytie bothe theyr elder haue shewed auncetours also vnto kyng ferdinando brother whan bothe agaynste turke youre enemy haue sent aide tha haue donne whyche doe refuse doe nowe also ponder weye selfe mortall warre thys wylbe calamitie euilles shall redounde therby innocente people chyldren infantes woman suche lyke doe theyr perswasion whyche mainteyning theyr rule power doe malygne heape euylles ciuill warre men brynge matter passe noble countrey germany parte therof vnto doubtles moste addicted beynge wasted owne force sore afflicted able longer resyste withstande turkishe violence wherfore ryght humbly beseche youre excellencye wolde complish oure request shall take steade great benefyte yf shalbe man matter hearde refuse obey contrarye lawe equitie allowe doynges wil asmuch lieth v ayde high prince magistrate geuen v god euermore showe dew obedience duke moris came regespurg xxv daie may theperoure secrete talke duke moris long much talked themperoure priuely departeth xx daye iune theffect theyr communication thinge itselfe shal declare whan ambassadours protestantes saw thinges tended warre violence neyther could daunger eyther consult thynges nedefull wryte home theyr state coueyhed themselues one another retourned home ides iune themperoure sent hys ambassadour iohn muschet treasurer hygh burgundie swysses preface speakynge hys loue themperours anbassadour swysses zeale towardes common wealth namely germanie desire peace sayeth therbe certe prince germanie vnder pretence gospell doe many thynges seditiousely subuert al lawes iudgement nede feare doe whose boldenes hath far proceded attepte thynges agaynst office dygnytie threaten war violence non otherwyse lyke hys absece intende inuade oppresse common countrey whyche consideration constrained moue warre dignitie hys place office maye repulse daunger commo welth restrayne outerage neyther distrusteth god enterpryse supposeth also state whose welth consysteth herein assiste ayde ad counsel wherfore requireth wold otherwyse perswaded hys aduersaryes hatefully spitefully deuyse many thinges agaynst neither atempt matter theyr perswasion permit ought done theyr limites wherby enterprise might impeched hindered warre taken hande welth al germany non cause let remayne therfore olde amytie league betwixt doe nothing contrary suffer hys shall whan occasion shal serue wyll shew loue fauoure dede hathe done hytherto whiche thinge may diuersely perceyued chiefly thys neuer made league kynges state comprised city hygh germanye duke wirtemberge hearing themperours aunswer geuen cyties wirtemberge puton armure nauius specifyed immediatly sendyng letter duke saxon lantzgraue captaynes league shew nedefull donne promiseth al theyr aide fidelitie doe leuie many bandes fotmen able make felde fyrste al men theyr armie deuided two partes one company duke wertemberg conteining xxiiij enseignes foote men amonges wer many noble gentle men hyred city assembled ulmes xxi day iune marche gunsperge nexte daye whan mustred encamped seuerall place theyr captaines iohn hedecke scherteline balthazar gutling sebastian besserer mathew langemantell iohn harder ioyce roseberge doe fyrst bynde power city othe maner charging follow obey scherteline vntill prince selues come captaynes confederacie going dukesmen done lykewyse appointe hedecke captayne sorte done balthazar gutling noble borne oraiion balthazar soldiours counsellour duke wirtemberge consente reste speaking hys prince soldiours derely beloued fellowes saieth sathans uicar bishop roome intendeth againe kindle fyre shall inflame burne germany natyle countrey v vtterly distroye bothe wonderfull hatred beareth trew relygio also desyre vengeauce calamytie receyued fourmer yeres almaignes rome taken sacked doe moue herunto therfore hathe styred vp charles puissaunte emperoure attept warre prince state ar lincked godly league trusting violence great crueltie shall copell seruice obseruaunce theyr wicked deuelish religion reported certentie howe proude detestable bodslaue deuil hath leuied already small force bothe horseme foormen wil send theperoure heare treweth also yt approching spaniardes euilles enswe comon countrey foreine soldiours distructio mischief euery man vnderstanding may easely perceiue therfore prince state forasmuch knew dewtie repulse al violence iniurie fro people theyre dominios also trauel forsee desceaued false religio run daunger euerlasting danatio wholy prefixed god help defend war moued beyode al expectatio also contrary conenauntes promesse therfore haue hyred others moe al spede might asmuch chieftanes leage yet absent wilbe heare within dayes noble prince wirtemberge duke ulriche thentent meane time whole matter may gouerned order neyther yt enemie may espie occasio hurt v hath appoynted captayne iohn hedecke man noble house parentage wherfore hym shall obeye demeane selues thinges worthye notable fame whiche oure elder tymes past haue goten sondry battels foughte foreine nation without much mahod bludshed may also bequethed oure ofspryng posterytie al otherthynges shal committe almyghtie god doubtles iuste cause godly defencion prepare suche meanes v vnto diuine maiestie shal seme good expedient told howe protestantes ambassadours departed regenspurge whan longer place consultation armie leuyed haue shewed asse bled ulmes consult donne wherfore xxi day protestates letter uenetians iune adresse theyr letter duke state uenyse complayning iniurie bishop roome desyre wold suffer hys force passe theyr dominion bishoppes power shulde augmented shew example fourmer tyme people italie may loke dispatche theyr letter also moste noble men germany admonishe doe stop soldiours repare vnto agayne rhatia tirall sore vexed commyng foreine soldiours laste day iune exhort letter suffer passe hereunto promise ayde also assistaunce cytie norimberge saye cannot haue skante sufficient defend theyr owne frontier moreouer commaund scherteline second daye iuly inuade enemy wer mustering vnderneth alpes finally send ambassadours swiss shewed cardinall trente themperoure sent hastely inpost roome wherfore leage beetwyxte pope emperoure solliciting league whiche conceaued penned xxvi daye iune decreed vpon couenauntes forasmuch germany hathe nowe many yeres perseuered great errours somuch great dauger feared therby theschewing wherof counsel called trent commenced last yere past moneth december protestantes doe reiect saie concerneth nothyng therfore hathe bishop themperoure god glory preseruatio publycke weale chiefly germany concluded betwene selues vpon certen codicions fyrst dede themperoure shall prepare armye althynge nedefull warre moneth iune next enswyng furnished thynges refuse counsell maynteyne errours reduce forte armes olde relygion obedience holy see yet endeuour proue al meanes yf bring passe without warre make peace composition shalbe preiudiciall hurtefull churche relygion bisshop besydes hundreth thousande dukates whyche hathe alreadye defrayde shall laye downe muche uenise whych hys lieuetenauntes shall imploye vpon warres vse yf warres shall receyue hys money agayne moreouer shall furnyshe themperour warre twelue thousand fotemen italian fyue hondreth lyght horsmen hys owne charge halfe yeres space ouer power shal place lieutenaunt captaines centurion fortune warre finished end syxe monethes take commoditie therof shalbe lawfull themperoure yere byshop rome permissio take one halfe church goodes spayne moreouer shalbe lawful hym sell much abbey landes spayne shal amounte summe fyue hundreth church goodes spayne imployde herein thousande dukates thys mayntenaunce warre yet vpon condicion laie againe mortgage mutch hys owne landes thing strauge shal make sufficient warrantise arbitrement bisshop man wyll impeche let thys theyr enterprise hym shall ioyntly resyst bothe theyr force one help theother bothe bounden thus doe longe warre shall indure syxe monethes besydes warre shalbe finished shall free euery man ioyne hym selfe vnto thys league partaker charge gaine composition also shall senate cardinalles confyrme spoken iune vnderstande moneth iune thys present yere wherin bothe haue subscribed leage coceaued copie thys confederacie bishoppes legate hierome frach shewed swiss shalbe declared place aboute thys tyme peace concluded betwene fraunce englande peace betwixt frauce englad french king permitteth kyng englande enioye bologne vntill suche tyme hath payed hym hys money dewe tyme hery dolphin daughter borne called isabell better confyrmation frendeshyp kyng england desyred godfather fountstone sent hys deputie fraunce sir thomas cheynie knight lorde warden cinke porte also cardinal saint andrewes cardinall scotland slaine scotlande hys owne castell aboute diner tyme slayne certen gentleman whose brother euyll intreated lutheranisme murther fled englad third daie iuly byshop rome sendeth letter swiss threatning vpo kindnes frenship ben betwene pope letter swiss predecessours bewayleth som disceipt deuil law breaker plucked apostolicall relygion fro deare child bosom armes teares crocodile louing father notwithstanding great gift god many haue perseuered costant faith towards god church thintet verely others talke wicked men haue ben disceaued haue exaple set eye length conuert vnto religion forefather great token god goodnes discention religio peace themselues wherin place occasion hath ben great sedition tumultes whiche appease hath euer since first bishop vsed al ye gentle remedy could deuise also fled last refuge calling generall counsel trent towne
