germany within limites wherof euil sede heretikes hath chiefly increased vnto whiche towne might safly com defend matter yf wold trusted inso sacred senate alwaies christen kinges nation haue attributed much assemble many bishoppes instinctio holy ghost shuld treate religio man wold wicked wold submit selfe great authoritie shuld incontinently casting awaie wicked opinion imbrace iudgement catholicke church hath also opinion reason theyr concord home hath good hope many haue continewed faithful constant obey cou sell rest set purpos certen credulytie haue ben broughte errour dispyse authoritye counsel thing wold doe come vnto counsell vnto certen heauenly senate ouer god himselfe presydent exhorteth moste ernestly hathe donne also sayeth howe hathe ben greate grief hym dyuerse germany yea number called prynces whyche doe proudely insolently contemne counsell also bayte cursed raylyng wordes saye wil obey decree therof chiefly sory cause contumacie disobedience obstinate persos dryuen attempt matter warre coulde longer pope attempteth matter force armes suffer ye losse many soules whych theyr heresy perished dayly yet oppression christian wherof belogeth office pastorall dignitie degre wherin placed whyleste thynkynge vppon remedye prayed god shew hym waye chaunced luckely themperour prynce godly zeale offended like faultes maner thought good auenge cause religio wicked heretikes force armes intercession meanes counsell graunted vnto germany semed vnto refused contemned dispised also authoritye wherfore occasion offered euen god tooke holde right gladly prefixed self noble myde themperoure wel owne treasure also church rome shuld otherwise handel ye thing negligently slackly ther doubt god wold require hades father soules somany child wer lost throughe falsehead heretickes cause doeth open mind counsell vnto maye see carefulnes vered may ioyne theyr prayer god religion haue verely many godly actes neuer non noble wil kepe olde amitie god elder haue shew churche rome hathe euer olde loue fidelitie yf godly cause wil geue theyr ayde assistaunce thing desireth grealy wold doe ambassadours protestantes vpper part germany come ulme baden conuentio protestantes ambassadours swiss swiss declaring message delaied ye moneth august requestes wold suffer foreine soldiours passe countrey wold permit men serue war thing required time also brunswicke goslarie hildessem hanobrie commaundement duke saxon lantzgraue rase wuolbutel chief castel duke brunswicke hitherto kept garniso paulsegraue prince electour paulsgraue axeth cause warre hurly burly maketh suite themperoure regenspurge ambassadour sir wuolsie affesten knight knowe cause war preparation made desyreth also leaue warre besech geue licence intercessour cause day themperour maketh aunswer granuellan nauius hard know cause war concerneth reciteth thinges effecte letter city pretence mouing war obey haue practised thinges germani forein nation vnder pretence religio wilbe bounden lawes take men goodes possesons bothe sacred prophane styre vp state rebellion reiecte decree thempire woorke altogether crueltye kynde tyrranye therefore purposeth thys warre appease relygion displeasure lyke case restore peace libertie vnto germany shal dewtie defend protection disturber ye comon quiet oppressours libertye punnish sore extremly according theyr demerites aunswer themperoure palsegraue seketh reconsile protestat themperoure paulsgraue tenth day iuly brought day sendeth duke saxo lantzgraue duke wirtemberge declaryng common daunger hanged ouer germany especially straunge soldiour war waxe mortal besecheth condescend graunt much maye albeit likelynes thinges sharpe sorrowfull holde yet supposeth case wold make submissio theperoure follow mynd certen thinges wolde agreat furtheraunce bryng matter concord thinges wherby perceiueth themperoure wilbe appeased fyrst wil craue perdon theyr offence secondly hath thing vniustly ameded fynally yf possesse ought man wold permit themperoure shall thynke mete wherin maye doe good promiseth hys fayth trauaile meane time duke saxon lantzgraue soden tumult chaunced much vnloked duke saxon lentzgraue prepareth war especially themperour lately departed frendly fro spier aduertised whole matter great diligence gather theyr force also warne fellowes lyke suffer theselues diswaded craftie counsel certe whan assembled take counsell fourthe daye iuly sendyng letter themperoure haue heard saye mercyful emperoure ambassadours sent comaundement regenspurg time heard preparation letter peroure warre fellowes league religion sollicite dillygently wold force germany susteined domage albeit aunswered tyme myght wel suspect somthing yet wer good hope yt war ben moued v state thempire much called asseblie sent ambassadours thither ful authoritie also consulted vpon demaundes shewed aduise much could suspect displeasure moreouer aunswer youres doeth cocerne thynges past yet come whilest saye establishe common welth accordyng youre authoritie punnishe shalbe disobedient wherfore could thinke published demaundes made aunswer wold haue prepared war lengthe whan manye coniectures chyefely youre letter adressed certen prynces city also wordes granuellan talke nauius perceyued youre purpose punyshe certen prynces disobedyent brute euerye warre bente agaynste v tooke dede heuely greuousely becommeth v lesse thought good sende thys epistle pourge oure selues fyrste truly able affirme oure leagefrendes haue alwayes dorne common charge imposed vpon v others whan also haue gonne free moreouer ayde desyred last assemblie spier found meanes graunted perfourmed oure selues seruices donne shulde charged disobedience doeth greue v also muche displeasaunt bytter wolde haue wished surely ben also reasou shulde fyrst haue ben accused hearde commen hande strypes oure accusation ben thus blased abrode shulde bothe easely haue proued owne innocencye cofuted theyr sklaunder v haue thus coplayned louingly dealt v bothe lately spier also fiue yeres synce regenspurge openly knowen v obiected rebellyon dede vnworthy omytte youre request put possession dukedome brunswicke arbiterment one yere paste daunger therby haue lost oure lyues goodes furthermore ignorant time wer created emperoure frankefurt sort bound selfe thempyre promised moste sacred othe howe theperoure periured doynges shulde accordyng lawes empyre wha crime obiect vnto v shuld layd man charge intende worke violence agaynst v oure matter hearde knowen committe vnto god shall heare matter doe accuse v shal make aunswer men shall vnderstand bothe suffer iniurye also instigation roomish antichrist wicked counsell trent attempt war intent doctrine gospell also libertie germanye author war may oppressed wil proue none cause co dicion state thinges requyreth shuld thus muche declare vnto shall take therfore part ben great deale pleasaunt v haue gratifyed approued fauour dilligence themperoure seueth iuly writing theperours letter archebishop collon letter archebishop collon welth germany sayeth saye common quiet right equitie dignitie office libertie thempire may recouered thynges dede certen seditious person haue almoste expulsed comon welth vnlesse restrayned wold take cleane waye constrayned attempte war may reduce theyr dewtie muche heare saye goe aboute euer allure others fellowship commaund fyrst throughout whole prouince let proclame doe foresee man serue war vnlesse serue captaynes suche shall haue commission shewe secondly yf gonne foorthe already serue call againe immediately commaund tary home attende vpon commaundement suche obey punnish extremelye demeane youre selfes maye perceyue loue quyet germany except thus doe know certentie shalbe great daunger losse haue letter whan archebishop receiued published place commaunded shuld obeied besydes gaue commaundement shulde praye church god hys mercy wolde tourne awaye greate daunger nowe hanged ouer germany tyme protestantes sed ambassadours kinges fraunce england newely reconciled making suite ayde duke latzgraue wrytten thus themperoure priuately sayd yt ides iuly set forth publicke writing also wherin theperours polycie declare howe thys warre made againste religion bee themperours intent vnder serten pretence rebellyo though wolde punnysh fewe myght plucke awaye fellowes league one muche easelie length subuert hereof bryng manye proues reporte kynge fernando granuellan nauius others spake priuately regenspurge verelye contempt counsell cause thys warre moreouer saye howe themperoure sent commaundement rauensburge whyche lately receyued doctryne gospell within dayes shuld sake theyr enterpryse el wolde geue theyr citie landes deuyded amonges soldiours messager called backe letter waye leste shuld come forthe brode war agaynst relygion forasmuch also byshop rome hath geue sentece ye archbishop collon reformatyo doctrine hath depriued cardinall auspurge firebrand thys warre hys dignitie theperoure maner doeth threatneth doeth yt sufficietly declare cause war co mon brure theyr drift yt cardinal auspurg hath set matter fyre shall throughe violence substituted hys place reported moreouer bee vanquished bandes soldiours shalbe placed partes germany whych themperours name shall see decree counsell concernyng relygion maynteyned put execution furthermore wrytten dyuers men howe archebysshop toledo chiefly prelate spayne geue great summe monye thys warre wold haue donne ben religion wel knowen also maner decree made auspurge xvi yeres synce tyme themperoure protested could abyde thys secte doctryne luther distroye vtterly wold bestowe hys force treasure lyfe blud also yf oppressed god forbid shuld quickely appere whether wolde spare thys religion wolde rather slaye ministere churche inforce theyr wyues child restore monkes freers relygious rabbell themperoure may lawfully worke force agaynst state bannish man cause behearde bryng foreyn soldiours within bondes germany chaleng hym self inherytance succession belonginge thempire bounden condicions hath confyrmed othe yf lawful doe otherwise state publycke weale could long endure cause displeasure shulde haue agaynste cannot worlde perceiue touching saieth duke saxon euer dissention betwene brother fernando wholy quenched two yeares paste spier nerer frendship lady elenore daughter kynge ferdinando promised freely eldest sonne could agree religion themperoure cofyrme tyme shoulde retourne home assemblie sent owne lodging granuellan nauius moste large wordes offered good wil frendship child whole countrey great cryme haue commytted synce time inted crueltie doubteles matter eue haue shewed refuse bisshoppes counsell incurred displeasure reason wolde shulde imagine thinges againste house saxon knoweth death maximilian mine vncle duke fridericke hauing crowne imperiall offered hym hys voyce duke fridericke chosen emperoure meanes gaue vnto hym omitte meane tyme many benefites house saxon hathe imploied house austriche case offended putting iulius puugius bishopricke nunburge haue bookes setfoorthe declared ryght tytle patronage themperour wold appoynte indifferent iudges offered abyde theyr iudgment nowe concerning owne parte sayeth lantzgraue throughly reconciled hym fyue yeres synce regenspurge intended fewe yeares past haue warred certen bisshops afterwardes helpe cosyn duke wirtemberg recouer hys owne thys euer haply besydes agaynste lawe wrytten decree thempire eyther priuely apartely geuen wrytinges made therof co firmed handes seales therfore deuise imagin cause thys grudge againe whan spake nowe lately spyre shewed hym selfe frendelye bothe wordes countenaunce could perceyue sparke displasure couenaunted fyue yere synce regenspurge shuld attept thyng herafter agaynst duke cleaue shuld meddle matter moued war agaynst kept touche promise time receyued duke agayne hys fauoure whiche uerlone perdoned yt serued assisted hym ayde yf take euill parte absence came selues rege spurge haue bothe made oure excuse duke hys ambassa dours presente talke hym spier lybertye germany state ye publicke weale yf must haue warre therfore whan bothe others heretofore also conuention nowe regenspurge many prynces absent warre brunswicke bee blamed lawfull men saue selues violence haue often lawsul repulse violence tymes desyred sondry assembly hys vyolence myghte restreyned wordes letter could obteyne nothing yet letter whych fernando request wrote herof duke henry openly wer letter inclosed wherby myghte easely perceyue neded obeye others letter founde castel wuolsbuttell subscribed kinges owne hande foorth commynge nede case lyke seueritie ben extended duke brunswicke themperoure sheweth nowe vnto v albeit haue deserued ben warre asmuche impugned v profession gospell doe susteyne greate hatred coulde winke hys myscheuous actes theperoure knoweth commytted prouince taken gardience defence take hande offered selues abyde order lawe arbitrement hym appoynted yf would haue taken way forsaking arbiterment contemnyng themperours order attepted new warre wolde haue tryed matter v lawe way ben easy enoughe conuict iudgement obeyed shulde themperour haue iuste cause put lawe execution nowe shulde thus doe hath al finally time duke son taken themperoure neuer demaunde thing v therfore cause wherfore accused negletynge oure dewtie case shoulde bee ascribed v though shuld impeache law haue muche wronge asmuche many yeres receiued iudges chamber whych hated religio bitterly iudges cha ber papistes iudges copositions set part gaue sentence v fellowes matter religion also ciuill cause wolde let v haue iustice myght doe euen order lawe necessarely lawfully refuse suspected aduersaries protestyng wold declare large cause refusal chosen iudges therfore nothing imputed vnto v halfe moreouer two yeres past decried spier chamber shuld establyshed vprightly canot ascribed v fellowes vnknowe themperoure last yere asseblie wormes ther man resist decree themselues whiche wyll seme loyall obedient prince intent verely oure aduersaries myght oure iudges also doe heare moreouer layed charge much blame worthy seke allure vnto v certe nobilitie maruell reproued matter founde proued hath ben alwaies maner dayes oure forefather ioyne vnto gentelmen owne coutries bishop also though wersom fault therin therfore lawful moue warre v cause leage betwixte thre house heard albeit league heritaunce betwene house saxon brandenburg hesse themperour excepted yet ought taken abuse authoritie wherfore let albert iohn brandenburge cosins haue promised serue themperour v consider theselues dilligently doe remeber othe wherwith ar boude wold shuld haue knowledg warninge also clientes take wage vnder war neither excused haply wil say theperour pourposed punnish certen prince disobedience knewe themselues howe thing imputed v iustly themperoure accused v crime reason wold haue requyred could haue confuted shulde haue neded vse polycies sollicite fellowes withdraw themselues v yf coulde haue shewed offence wolde haue forsaken v theyr owne accorde cause ben good wold haue biden commo daunger furthermore tyme rest gaue hym ayde two yeres synce frence king promised warre shulde finished wolde goe hongary hymselfe agaynst turke nowe doe turkes inuade hongary place ther aboutes great force power dede reported many doubteles therbe party offen pest great garnisons turkes poore men liues yt countrie neglected cast vnto theyr enemyes praye meane seke howe make slaughter germanye thynge maye swymme full theyr blud professe chryst seing trust surely moste men pitie lament case wil assist aduersaryes whiche seke extinguish doctrine gospell haue donne others place theyre dominion bring v extreme bondoge wilbe content reasonable wage rather followe oure campe wherin romish antichriste adherentes whose chyfe endeuour thintent papistes thys euen slaughter germany maye establish agayne confirme theyr wicked deuelishe doctryne asmuche muche intreatinge peace beyng crime yet couicted enforced warre defend selues violence trust god assist treweth agaynst lye thys hys cause wilbe hygh emperour enseigne bearer againste wicked deuises bishop unto verely doe commit whole matter beseche hym confounde cruell counselles blud thirster euer auaunce maiestie glory hys name daye wryte iohn marque bra denburge bothe league protestantes protestates letter iohn marque bra denburge owne letter proued agayne priuate confederacie olde tyme admonishe hym weare armure agaynste doe accordynge conuenauntes bonde league otherwise vtter whole matter declare openly farre agaynst hys dewtie hys doynges whervnto aunswereth serueth themperoure doeth denye forasmuce hath put oute doubte warreth religion indede protestantes league meane confession auspurge touchyng pryuate league therin themperoure excepted expressed wordes seeyng cause shuld offended hys seruics saye doeth ought agaynste hys faythe promyse aunswer geuen set foorthe publycke writing amonges thinges confute sayed confession auspurg proue hys owne letter bou den helpe theyr leagefrendes yf matter shuld come suche passe albeit man pretende fayne cause war agaynst theperoure doeth wherfore admonish dilligently alme chiefly captaines soldiours yt serue vnder hath broken faith ye ides iuly bishop publishing wryting speaking much care zeale towardes ye pope bull protestantes common wealthe men saluatio counsel begonne alreadie obstinacie heretickes contemne refuse haue moued warre agaynst godly men exhorteth men generall fast praye vnto god confesse theyr synnes euery man chose ghostely father lyste receyue sacrament intent god intreated may prosper warre themperoure haue nedefullye attempted roote heresy restore peace churche albeit themperoures intent leuying power euery place secretly might diligece protestantes leuying theire armye might set vpon protestantes wer prouyded yet theyr dilligence greate courage men cherefull defend warre xvi daye iuly lantzgraue felde hys men withstanding lowe duchland coute de bure maner hys whole armie readines neither certenly knowen wold first inuade lantzgraue marched hys owne countrey sent william eldest sonne xvi yeres age strasburge exceading stronge lantzgraue sent hys sonne strausburg citie departure home duke brunswicke prysoner sent word wold geue hym hearyng wolde open vnto hym tyme deuysed thentente pourpos thys warre lantzgraue supposed said craft eyther lesson owne offence get hym libertie refused talke hym wolde vtter man hym selfe alone fyrst explocte protestantes highe fyrst enterprise protestantes germay agaynst enemie vnder alpes reported sondry messagers yt bishop power hauing already almost passed ye alpes approched nere germany thought good preuent thus standeth case come oute italy passe trent iusprincke towne king ferdinando fro thence two wayes goe bauier eyther downe riuer oeno copsteyne el ye left ouer middes alpes kynge fernando hathe almost going oute alpes castell erenberge situated vppon exceadyng hyghe castell ereberg mountayne nature place reason straitnes holownes waye headlong pitchehill stepenes looke dowewardes hath passage maye prohibit beit neuer great armie passing way wherfore moneth iuly thither wet sebastia scherteline meane power commaundement protestantes ambassadours asse bled ulmes sayde waye takinge fiessa towne cardinalles auspurge standeth riuer leyche tenth daye iuly taketh also foresayde passage castel composition made soldiours garriso within intent haue marched alpes haue taken also insprucke fortyfyed strong garryson shulde haue kept way wherby come italye germany shulde haue shut vp themperour hauynge eyter soldiours vitalles partyes thys greate tumulte commaundement king fernando men wer called armure countie tirol came great power insprinke vnder leadyng fraunces castelalte gouernour trent leauing gariso defend towne kept way sherteline retireth passage wherfore scherteline placing soldiours castell erenberge towne fiessa retireth hys force repareth armye assembled high germany aboute riuer danubius called duche thonaw armie counte hedeck led taketh dilling towne castell bishop auspurge composityon sweareth trewe hym xxiii day iuly aboute tyme maurice bishop eistet sendeth ambassadours chieftaynes warre praying wold spare promiseth also geue passage hys prouince vitaile couenaunte beneth dilling towne donauerde whiche sommoned render refufed donauerde taken time armie came ordenaunce plated yelded vnto protestantes meane season duke saxon lantzgraue marche forward theyr armie passing frankome whan bishop wirciburge put sufficient suertie stoppe theyr vitaile wente ioyned theyr fellowes tyme theyr campe ambassadours marque brandenburge prince electour duke moris sent permission treatie referred matter theyr fellowes nothing donne certen ryche men dwelt auspurge packed vp theyr short endes gonne citie brute wente lent themperoure monie ambassadours tha ulmes sending theyr letter messagers senate auspurge shewe howe vnworthye dede admonish ernestly wold sorsee like ben hereafter senate maketh aunswer howe long geuen monie interest maner shuld vnoccupied knowing warres suppose geueth hys monye lone none shalbe suffered doe vnpunnished maye know al time themperoure regenspurg besides thre thousand spaniardes fiue thousand themperours power fotemen almaignes seuen hundreth horseman power commen time sent spaniardes hongary whyche peace concluded french kyng wintered lorayne went germany hongary shewed laste booke peace lately made betwene fraunce england chauced luckely protestantes almaignes serued french king came vnto coduite counte bichling george recrode client lanzgraue theperour yt xx day iuly letter patens doeth outlaw ye duke saxo duke saxon lantzgraue ar lawed theperour lantzgraue beginning accompteth large paynes hath taken hytherto yt germany myght throughly quyeted decree hath made force shulde man kynde matter al thinges might law custom agayne sheweth state thempyre bounden fidelitie ought perfourme thinges saieth neglected iohn fridericke electour saxonie philip lanzgraue hesse certen rash boldenes haue tymes muche laye hindred oure trauaile paynes taken publicke weale neyther haue ben obedient haue selues resisted v haue also intised state doe lyke make vnlawful co spiracies lantzgraue certen yeares past pretending cause knew attempted war som chiefest state thempire inuading dominion extort agreat somme monie together set vpo prince thempyre cause knowen droue prouince kepte selues haue also gotten theyr owne gouernmet sondry bishoprickes office well ecclesiasticall ciuile lordes wherof auncyente custome vnder iurisdiction thempyre haue theyr place consistory amonges state yet also thoughe haue ofte complayned sued v assembly deteine styll seruitude haue also spoyled many theyr goodes yerely reuenewes receyued theyr tuition clientes subiectes others nowe lately also throughe certen singuler boldnes haue sollicited diuers state come thys conuention thintent myght let procedynges brynge v contempt thinges doe much boldely contemne iudgementes neyther acknowledge feare magistrate throughe theyr fault hyghe iudiciall place thempyre taken awaye lawes kepe silence long tyme hathe ben iustice ministred great losse domage many straunge example suche hathe ben hearde worste worke thynges protestantes accused treason vnder goodly pleasaunt name religion peace lybertie vse clokes couer theyr doinges desyre nothyng lesse eyther agrement relygion germany peace libertie certes proue neuer place scripture lawfull obstinately resiste theyr hyghe magistrate case contrary manifest aswell holy scripture also autenticke historyes auncient professours christen doctryne confirmed faithe wordes also theyr dedes death obey heathe prince wherfore doubtles ought much lesse denie v theyr dewtie vnder pretence religion denie declare euidently theyr intente take fro v crowne imperiall scepter oure authoritie vsurpe theselues haue confounded thinges oppresse religio law peace lybertye thus auaunced hyghly new honour possession bring men vnder theyr tyrany wordes testifye ful malicious threatninges also famous libelles picture dispersed place great mockerye contempt name moreouer haue made league againste v conuenticles haue also styred vp forein kinges v secretly aided theyr helpe cousel ther somme olso cantel haue attempted induce yt turke germany thing rather credited shuld verey fitte commodious pourpos wherfore theyr doinges breake theyr allegeaunce owe vnto v infringe dignitie oure office reiecte decree neuer estemed otherwyse yf made thys intent others myght repulse violence fro selues permitted doe iniurie therefore haue fallen moste heynous crime treason condygne punishement suche offence lawes prescribed theyr doinges beknowen nede declare albeit yt authoritie yt haue might haue punnished long synce according vnto demerites yet loue peace auoyde trouble haue fauoured verye muche graunted ofte many thynges also became v herin haue oftener hurte owne conscience minished oure authoritie well prouyded others thus fyue yeres synce regenspurge deale moste gentlye lantzgraue two yeres past spier duke saxon thys hope verely beyng vanquished great lenitie pacience clemencie shulde length leaue theyr vngodly deuises shuld nede extreme remedy dede perceyued good abused gentlenes inasmuche contemning decree thempire breaking conuenauntes procede obstinately throughe licencious lust rule take men landes possession wilbe bounden lawes seke subuert whole state ye publicke weale certenly vnlesse first put silence neyther relygion accorded partes comon weale established refourmed constrayned vse agaynst authoritie god hath geuen v theyr rebellion manifest insomuch themselues cannot denye agayne woorke violence abyde iudgment therfore doe outlaw false rebelles seditious treason giltie disturber co mon quiet prefixed punnishe haue deserued thintente maye haue libertie afterwarde establish common wealth doe suche thynges properly concern office therfore straytly charge commaunde man ayde case neither take theyr parte shall doe wyse shall curre daunger lyfe goodes let happely gon already serue retourne soone possible let men geue theyr ayde vnto v fynde let cauillation throughe league priuate conuenauntes make thinges frustrate moreour release nobilitie common theyr dominion theyr allegeaunce othe wherby bounden assure saftye yf doe obeye suche shall refuse punnyshed lyke sort xxii daye iuly gerarde uelduuiche sente agayne regenspurg costantinople fro whence lately retourned theperour whan nothing could determined prorogeth conuentio thepire vntil ye kalends february next yere following bishop rome letter sent heluetias pope letter swysses haue shewed whiche bishop legate hierome franch receiued sent lucers writeth also hym selfe xxv daye iuly thre dayes synce deliuered vnto hym letter bishop senate cardinalles albeit maner effecte wer hys former letter yet conteyne somewhat sendeth nowe copie spede nexte conuention shew principal forasmuche league whyche lately nowe ende iune bishop themperoure made leafte also aspace others come confederacye moreouer couuenaunted themperoure shoulde trye whether hys aduersaryes enemyes churche roome myghte haply warre reduced theyr dewetye amendement bishop doeth ernestlye require wolde pronounce expresse wordes whether wilbe thys league whether wyll obey decree counsell trente haue appoynted hym daye nexte assemblie baden wherein make hym aunswer hys former demaundes therefore hathe nowe wrytten also entente maye consulte meane season therefore dooeth beseche blud sauioure chryste wolde dilygently consyder themselues noble famous acte thys wylbe howe profytable theyr ofsprynge yf wolde bothe helpe quenche fyre germany approue also decree generall counsell bishop vttered cause league summe men suppose pope bringeth emperouro hatred bee donne hym craftie polycie myghte thys meanes put themperoure narrowe shyftes certen tooke verey displeasauntely themperoure pretended cause warre shalbe declared herafter thys time alberte sonne duke bauer maryeth ladie anne daughter kyng fernando duke cleaue lady marye hys daughter duke cleaue mariages broyle warres longe looked daughter nauaire fraunce vayne sayde byshop roome graunted hym lycence marye wherefore maryeth bothe mariages solemnised regenspurge myddes vprores tumultes warre eyther maryage concerne newe bonde amitie daye syttyng appoynted father trent haue hearde end iuly matter defferred till begynnynge nexte yere hys place shalbe declared trent besides cardinalles bisshoppes legate cardinalles trent pacher spaniard foure number father tret archebishops xxxiii bishop two frenche fyue spanishe one slauonishe residew italyans doctours diuinitie relygious xxxv others yt professed religion twelue parte spaniardes amonges foure archebishops two bare name olans magnus upsalya robert uenaut scotte chaunced thus wha king swecia receyueth gospell gustaue kynge swecia nere vnto denmarke altered relygion yere lord mdxxxvii iohn magnus archebishop upsalya mislyked alteration forsaking countrey fled vnto roome came thyther meane company afterward going uenyse became suffragan patriarche citie fyne waxing werye state retourneth roome beyng broughte exigente verey lowe ebbe tyme solde hys horse maner putte awaye hys seruauntes bishop roome placed hym hospytall holy ghoste wherin ended hys lyfe full poorelye hym hys brother olans unto bysshop gaue archebishopricke gothlande thoughe precincte church roome commaunded hym counsell geueth hym xv crownes moneth paye hys bord scotte whan infourmed bishop archbishopricke armacane irelande obtayned hym name title therof scotte blynde yet saye masse also wold ryde post wherfore bishop wolde haue two counsel ostentation though two nation farre gothes iryshemen acknowledge hys authorytie verey dede nothyng shadow bare name thing mentioned duke moris priuate talke themperour departed rege spurge whan comen home king fernando followyng shortly goeth vnto hym prage fyrst daye auguste theperours letter duke moris themperour sendeth duke moris regenspurge copie proscription rehearsed writing letter commen people reporteth maner thynges comprised table lawerie allied vnto outlawes kinred affinitie nere may haply claime som ryght theyr landes possession chargeth ernestly assist hym force wynne theyr country yea get self soone holde owneryght el wil come passe shalbe catche euer neyther shall ryght consinage compactes profet hym thynge agayne contemnynge hys emperours commaundemente shall incurre penaltie others doe commaundeth also gentelmen people obeye hys proclmatio serue theyr prynce faithfully vpon like penaltie letter written duke moris commen also brother augustus whole armie protestantes letter duke bauer protestantes comme riuer danubius duke saxon lanzgraue counsellours warre wryte theyr letter willyam duke bauer iii daye august speake much theperours preparation war nede knoweth whole matter albeit haue omitted kynd dewtye towardes themperour supposed ben cause displeasure yet haue hearde longe synce bothe aunswer also talke others intendeth war though disobedient yet neither conuict crime haue done wrong beit offece trew imputeth yet lawful case examined attempte matter force armes enterprise agaynste ryght lawes thepire couenaunt custome former time theperours matter state hath euer accustomed examined opely knoweth many yeres hathe ben meanes deuysed germany myght lose libertie without doubt thys warre also tendeth suche ende albeit haue alwayes hitherto perceyued desyre mainteyne common lybertie although lately promysed manye thinges touching good wardes sent word wold suffer foreine soldiour passe countrey yet reported vnto hath geue waye already also vitayle munition whiche thinge greueth lyttel suppose perswaded false sclaunders theyr writinges lately setfoorth declared aboundantly iniuriously emperoure dealeth howe many couenauntes aswel publicke priuate thys one thing broken trust yet defece lybertye assist hys ayde counsell especiallye seynge put hope samethynge nowe lately hys messager therfore shall doe well comaunde themperours soldiours depart townes roene ingolstad el permit place manye theyr men also geueth free safe recourse throughe hys countrey relieue victualles assure hereof wryttynge albeit thynke wyll saye naye yet desyre aunswer within syue dayes yf shulde otherwise doe muste doe theyr counsell shall serue seuenthe daye auguste machlin veraye fayre towne theperours brabant gunpowder lay tower vppon walles catching fyre lyghtning first ouerthrewe towne foundacion lighted vpon house lightenyng caused struction machlin within citie without aboue fyue hondreth pas circuite wherof brente ouerthrowen many shaken piece tourned vpsydedowne house many heuge exceading great stone flewe threscore pas violence powder tearyng sonder house shakynge breaking glasse windowes euery strete defaced maner whole citie singed tree turned vp rootes calamitye perished two hondreth person aboutes partly co sumed fyre partly ruine fall house stone tyles ouerwelmed besydes sore wounded yet escaped death wherof nomber great many two dayes three somme foure dayes found drawen sellars caues vnderneth grounde wherunto fled diuerse dead whiche perished eyther honger lacke breathe lyue fynding theyr vitayles layde vp susteyned theyr life moreouer great nomber horse beastes wer burnt vp stable wal itselfe toure stode throwen downe flat grounde aboue two hondreth pas length ix daye august swiss mete agayne baden fourth day maketh aunswer protestant swyses aunswer protestantes ambassadours appoynted tyme mentioned swiss suche wer popishe religyon sayde sory warre moued betwene themperoure neyther anything rather wished peace therefore wolde intermeddle warre fro incline themselues either partie howbeit wolde kepe foreine soldiours suffer passe thorow theyr dominion staie owne men home muche lyeth cause haue geuen strayte commaundement already man goe foorth serue warres attend vpon magistrate pleasure looke defence theyr countrey yet notwithstandyng many gonne warfare haue take wage thing great grief therfore desyre discharge suffer retourne home agayne besydes former demaundes protestantes requyred moreouer wold enter confederacie themperour bishop roome ayde men wherunto bisshop especially moued wold assist whych wer constrained defend vniust warre repulse violence reporting many thinges bishop iniquitie wyll rule counsell iudge also holdeth place set iniurye vpon occasyon speake death iohn diazius deathe diazius vnpunished shew destable murther daie vnpunished much commended many also though worthy great rewarde thing warning daungerous vnmete come suche place theyr aduersaties haue al gouernement amonges bishop tret lately made cardinal depely bounden bisshop moe wayes one asmuche protestantes theyr force water thonawe themperoue whiche yet fully fournished begynnyng august leauing regenspurg garnison went landshut towne duke bauers riuer isara pitcheth tentes without walles duke saxon lantzgraue theyr felowes sendyng theyre protestantes proclayme war agaynst peroue letter donauerd eleuenth daye august declare mynde towardes hym maner lawe armes last moneth saye made purgation letter emperour charles suche thynges accused albeit reason wold eyther shuld haue layde side warlike furniture least haue declared cause warre hearing v speake lykewise shuld haue accordyng custome thempyre fayth promised othe yet forasmuche doe neuerthelesse procede also compelled put armure beare thys vniust violence muche vnworthy personne nowe seke extinguishe doctryne gospel lybertie thempyre sondry actes may proued knowe youre selfe maner consultation haue nowe many yeres roomish antichryst foreyne kynges myght eyther ioyne incense agaynst v agayne without aduise prince state thempyre haue taken trewes turke contrary quite youre promesse tyme germany gaue ayde two yeres paste agaynst frenche kyng affirmed warre beynge finished wold goe selfe armye agaynst turke nowe haue made composition hym verely thintet myght better accomplish thyng haue intended agaynst v nowe thys conuention regenspurge haue set newe collour face matter speakyng much youre owne industrie zeale comon wealthe countrey germanie contumacie certen others whice doubtles done intent might seuer v one another ar confederated relygion able charge v faulte neglectyng dewtie distrusting cause haue sommoned v appere come aunswer senate thempire yea somuche name party crafti themperoure yet meane season wryting letter dyuers prince city dissembled ful craftely though attempted warre religion punnishe certen rebelles manifest enough shoote relygion appereth herof sufficyently sollicited bishop counsell wherin besydes clientes adherentes man maye haue place libertye speake fewe somwhat franke speakyng lybertie exiled counsell meane founde called awaye worse placed theyr steade maner decree also ye father tret haue made knowen al men wherfore cou sell hath ben often promised assembly thempyre shewed laste yere wormes thinges sayde shuld nowe repeted moreouer pourpos copell v approue counsell proued bishop letter lately sent heluetians wherin complaineth sore diuerse germany reiect authoritie counsel sayeth cause attempteth warre also prefixed warre matter sayeth howe chaunced hym luckely therefore wold imploye therupon force treasure churche roome hys owne also wherefore seeing bishop hathe vttered pretensed pourpose youres wold haue cloked coloure doubt longer pricke relygion certenly knowe oure selues faulty nothyng eyther wold shuld heard openly wel aunswer concerned office example predecessours haue called v senate prynces lykewyse haue hearde oure reason neyther become thus vse v call v assemblie propound common wealth axe aduise counsell meane whyle prepare warre agaynste v kynde thing thys leaue turke bend furye rage warre againste v thoughe greate deale worse truste assuredly god impeche hynder thys vnworthy facte grudge displeasure betwene youre brother fernando v wholye forgeuen cadame uienna regespurg spier therfore maye paynte set matter muche lyste yet knowe certentie cause trewe relygyon shuld oppressed germany lose lybertye wryte dede diuerse go aboute perswade though desiered greatly doctryne gospell myght auaunced opinion vniuersitie louayne confyrmed iudgement agayne execution godly men within realmes dominion article uniuersitie louayne confideracie made romish antichrist declare shew well enoughe intente verely euen myght recouer establysh agayne kynde papistrie quenching trew doctryne professed auspurge seing case thus made league pourpos myght perseuer thys relygion defende ioyntely together although man el shuld preted cause displesure agaynst v dryuen necessitie stande oure owne defence whyche bothe god lawe also lawe nature doeth permitte graunt v albeit reason enterprise nothing bounden therfore neded declare vnto part mynd yet assurance renounce allegeaunce dewetye wherby bounde wold deminishe ryght commoditie pyre rather preserue mainteyne therefore protest openly solemuwyse mynd purpose repulse v thys warre fellowes godly honest cause ought refuse perill sent letter yong gentelman trumpeter maner theperoure woulde receyue protestant letter themperoure hys campe landshut whiche refuse receyue also cummaunded paine theyr life cary agayne added moreouer man hencefoorth came vnto hym shoulde insteade chayne golde rewarded haulter deliuereth vnto table prescription saied geueth table prescription streight charge delyuer theyr prince sent thys epistel debated howe themperoure shulde termed spoken duke saxon wolde haue geuen hym name themperoure otherwyse lawfull warre hym lantzgraue contrary minde eyther soothers vpholders saing length thys meane waye diuised shulde call hym vsed place themperoure consult whither goe sayde landshut themperoure experte knowledge countrey shewed howe must goe fennes wayes narrowe oftentymes space myle coulde goe one horseman alteryng theyr purpose determine goe regenspurg themperoure leaft garnison munition bothe place commodious incampe themperoure wolde come rescowe beseged myght trye matter hym playne felde wherefore remouing theyr campe march foreward howebeit verey flowly maner aboute tyme whyche ides pope armie commeth peroure august arriued landshut italian bishoppes force ryght welcome themperoure beyng aduertised espiall progresse hys enemyes sente diuers sondrye messagers exhortynge make haste footemen teen thousande fyue hundreth demilaunces ouer al bishop made hys nephewe hys sonne octauius farnesius general hym serued many noble captaynes alexander uitellius iohn captaynes said armie baptiste sabello ssortia palauicino fridericke sabello paullus uitellio iuly ursine alexius lascaris hierome pise iohn mary padowaye niclas plumbine niclas petilian power also cosmus medices duke florence sente two hundreth horseme conduite rafe balion hercules duke farrare hundreth alphoso bastard brother bishop ioyned octauius cardinall hys brother alexander farnesius espie themperours doinges also aspurre vnto hym prycke hym forewarde yf nede required whan farnesius departed italy shulde saye reported wolde make suche slaughter germany hys horse myghte swymme bludde lutheranes longe came also spaniardes themperoure called naples millan aboute syxe thousande olde expert soldiours theyrechieftaynes philip lauoye prince sulmone aluar sandey alfonse uiues iames arzie themperours lieutenaunte capitaines peroures armie fernando toletane duke alba ye next place hym iohn baptiste castalde cardinall auspurge head commissioner vitayle serued themperour also maximilian austriche emanuell philiberte sonne duke sauoye ericus duke brunswicke philip sonne duke henry prisoner george duke megelburg george duke brunswicke brother henry man church friderick furstemberg renard solmen erles diuerse others tetes protestates iohn ernest duke saxon brother prynce electour prince protestantes cape iohn fridericke electour hys sonne philip duke brunsewicke hys foure sonnes ernest albert iohn wuolfange fraunces duke luneburge wuolfang prynce anhalde christopher henneberge george wirtemberge albert mansfelde hys two sonnes iohn uolrate lewis oetingen sonne name william furstemberge christopher oldenburge hubert bichling iohn hedecke erles moreouer recorde rifeberge eyght enseignes swiss wherfore whan force commen together besydes power cosite de bure brought oute lowe countrie emperoure remouyng hys campe marcheth towardes regenspurge knowen many beganne suspect wolde meyssen saronie wherfore made bridge transported theyr armye ouer ryuer thonnawe marched little waye towardes norgouia intellyngence themperoure wente fro regenspurge ingolstad tournynge againe ouer rough vneuen wayes repare dannbius leste themperour shuld take nuburg thre mile aboue ingolstad donauerd shoulde haue waye open lande wirtemberge whan comen nasielse nexte daye lantzgraue wente foorthe greate company horseman take vieu ingolstad knowyng themperours armye hearde fewe spauiardes laye therin garrison lantzgraue rioeth foorth espye wold haue prouoked escarmouche whylest marcheth appere certen horseman prynces sulmone charge beyng geuen dyuerse slayne partes yet moe hurte taken knowen taken themperoure wolde encampe daye ingolstad thys facte lantzgraue electour saxon toke displeasauntly greuousely yf doe lyke hereafter without makinge hym priuie protesteth wyll departe marchynge foorthe little waye theyr whole armye suche order yf shulde haue foughte battell retyred theyr soldiours theyr campe nyght followyng men theyr fyrst slepe spaniardes enter campe counte hedecke laye appoynted vnder duke saxon kyll spaniardes inuade protestantes cap number hundreth hys fotemen lost dyuerse owne men also wherfore greate vprore throughoute campe whych reason darknes also encreased nexte daye whyche xxix august certen centuryons captaynes sente oute vieu situation theyr enemy campe upon horseman italy breakyng ambushe gaue charge sodaynely many slaine cyther syde retourned agayne without theyr pourpose wherfore nexte mornynge lantzgraue accompanyed fewe others chosen oute whole number goeth foorthe knowe certentye fyndyng foorde horseman sent oute hym sayde nonue retourneth backe duke saxon sheweth hym howe horseman maye passe riuer laste daye therefore auguste agreed setfoorthe mornynge soone daye appered take hygher grounde tymes paste stoode watche tower ingolstad plant certen piece ordenaunce shoute theyre enemyes campe see yf perauenture prouoke themperoure battell far foorthe nyght duke saxon aduertysed lantzgraue twyse sondrye tymes themperoure departed hys campe smoked geuynge credite reporte sente foorthe whilliam schacht fyue bandes hys owne hersemen kepe foorde make brydges munition footemen shortly followeth hys whole power munition greate haste commen watersyde schachte shewed hym howe themperoure remoued oute hys place sente duke saxon intellygence hereof marcheth hylle beforesayde planteth part hys ordenaunce placeth hys menne also lefte hande ryghte duke saxon whan commen thyther hys companye eightenth booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument eyghtenth booke erle bure passeth rhyne meanes archebyshop mentz counsell lantgraue allowed set vpon emperour switzers wyll meddle warre wherfore duke lantgraue sollicite bohemers aunswer fully accusation dissemblinges emperour remoue theyr campe cutte waye erle bure peter strosse kepeth promyse lende money touruert rendred emperour duke maurice holdeth assemblee state duke saxon vnto whome lantgraue aunswereth duke saxon countrey set fyre destroyed hongarians duke moris surpriseth certen townes fourtene martyr brent meanx protestauntes hauyng leuied campe pursued duke witteberg certen city make peace emperour father trent establish article institution man death kyng henry eight gospell fre passage englande marque albert taken prysoner duke saxon whan maximilia erle bure metioned assembled al power erle bure leadeth army themperour coulde lowe coutrey foure thousand horseman ten thousand fotemen emonges certen bandes spanyardes italian whiche serued kyng england warres fraunce marching forwarde brabat moneth august passeth ouer rhine aboue beneath mentz whersoeuer coulde get shipping notwithstandinge protestauntes layde power syde leading christopher oldenburge riseberge shuld haue stopped passage archbishop metz thought haue holpen much matter whole armie protestauntes come forsaid place shot al ordinauce themperours cape terrible euen ther lantgraue calling duke saxo ye counsellours captain war gouernmet alone bould profitable counsell lantgraue saith time restored duke wirteberg wold first vndertake geue charge vpo thenemy wt ii legios bring ye pioners cast treches done assaile wt whole force power herein whilest thopinios diuers diswaded thing ful peril others misliked yt ther wer dauger feared townes men great store shot munition horseman also first charge giuen nothyng attempted whiche thing doubtles much reproued many errour thought cause beginning cause protest misery calamitie emperours victory farre excelled horseman emperours campe intrenched lowe ditche small force time emperour susteined shot brunt day next night followyng well fortified campe better confidece might endure easely stormes came saye great daunger emperours harte feare emperours campe courage wonderfull good declared token feare selfe also boldened others exceadingly offered take suche part emperour solicited switzers treasurer burgundy shewed last boke unto requestes aunswere made assemblie baden holden moneth august mentioned wil infringe league swiss aunswer emperour haue house austriche burgundy moreouer wyll call home agayne suche gone forth warfar vnlesse shall obeye punyshe accordingly thus aunswered nyne townes popysh religio zurich berne basill also schafusians muche emperours byshoppes letter importe one cause warre againe muche copy emperours byshoppes league shewed byshoppes ambassadour spake playnly warre attempted roote religion protestauntes tolde emperours ambassadour would take deliberation makyng aunswere attende vntyl suche tyme emperour aduertised whether would permitte kepe styll religion safitie whan emperour harde emperour swiss gospeller seuen twenty day august addresseth letter cape ingolstad haue made answer rest haue done perceiue cause supposeth yt done ye craft aduersaries heareth former assembly bade went perswade wt though moued war punish rebellious prince certe city thintet yt ye bishop aid ye doctrine ye gospel also ye libertie germany might oppressed hereth moreouer thei haue sollicited aid agaist also concerning league wherof vnderstandeth haue put good hope next assembly shal make direct aunswer touching cause war much haue vnderstaden wel priuate letter writte vnto also hath published opely nedeth repeted hath ether molested man religion sake giuen occasion rebellion shewed proued yt streight wayes fro beginning preparatio vnto war treated fredly gently diuerse also tha decent person men meane estate degre nether excuse rebellio yt byshop rome doth assist prince italy certen also germany diuerse gentleman right noble house emonges som religion league protestauntes ayde wil venter liues spend blud war whiche doubtles thei wold case matter stode seditiouse profestautes one another person falsly report yt haue alwayes gone vnder pretece religion resiste hygh magistrate oppresse religio libertie germany bryng al state subiectio many doings well knowen nedeth declaration verely vnder swete name religion haue allured cofederacie ye chiefest city germany force ought vsed religion force furniture haue gotte landes possessios others also go worke compelle prince subiects take partes disturbe many religion inforce another kinde lyfe cast also diuerse pryson fetter threaten cruelly robbe spoyle church thyng selfe declareth cause couet haue league meane made stronger might easely accomplyshe pretensed purpose doubted also perceiue thinges vnderstande ryght well incommoditie discommoditie may loke societie seing matter thus inasmuche ar ignoraunt good also cause warre trusteth wyl refuse league kepe soldiours home call home suche gone serue warre vnder set penaltie doe nothing contrary auncient league example residue obserue peace amitie shall redounde theyr owne prayse shalbe hym also ryght acceptable vnto letter wryte sort answered thambassadour desire accept good part delay answering asmuch affirmeth war nether oppresse religion yet ye libertie countrey say none wyse tha shal become gone confynes warfare done without leaue knowledge oft time chaunceth maner call go forth without licece time retourne home punish moue swiss likewyse duke saxon lantgraue sollicited bohemers thei made aunswer protestauntes sed bohemers appered wel yt myndes alredy perswaded thaccusation king ferdinando whan perceiued letter end august wryte shewe manifestly war attempted religion sent vnto bokes whiche haue bene lately set forth concerning require worke displeasure last signifie vnto intend time also thei publish wryting wherin say aduertised credit worthy bishop antichrist rome instrument pope hireth men poyson deuil authour war certen yeres past hired minister set many townes fire saxon hath sent forth impoysoners infecte welles standing water thintent war yt sword distroy may dispatche poyson wherfore admonish vniuersally al chiefly owne subiectes waite narrowly men apprehe ded put torture whan shall haue tried mischief suffer accordingly within fewe day duke saxon sonne iohn william letter published geueth warning coutrey yt take diligent hede selues lately far fro weynmar town turing certen italian taken suspicio cofessed diuerse others money giue rome byshops name yt shuld fiering poyson much hurt germany possible might cocerning outlawyng themperour sent copy therof ye duke ye protestauntes answer table outlawery lantgraue haue shewed wherfore wha receiued cape ingolstad ye secod day septeber ye defece honor estimatio answer log wryting highly comendeth zeale good wil tomany nothing dissimulatio since time first chosen emperour hath always sought meanes bring bondage verely cause leauing spaine countreis hath retourned oft germany bene importunate charge like sort speaketh religio purpose hath bene alwayes ye hauing oportunitie might oppresse sincere doctrine oft say grauted peace vnto v emperours crafte towarde protestant religio craftely time vntil giue money serue publique v necessity thempire called decree made doubt question helde matter long suspence till made peace french king taken truce turck bishop espiyng time conuenient appointed counsell trent concluded vpon league hereof wil bring probation fiue yeares past regenspurg made decree religion wher diuerse pointes misliked declared minde large gaue v wryting sufficiently assembly deputy king ferdinando cofirme yet two yeres since co uention spier whan mention made therof sayd remeber declaratio last yeare co uention wormes byshop hildesseme said openly al prince themperour promised catholikes yt decree spier shuld take place frech warres monethes past went conuention regenspurg granuellan spake sayth lantgraue presence paulsgraue counsellours ambassadour duke wirteberg decree spier applied vnto time themperour longer mainteyn state sixe yeres past hagenaw king firdinando whan sheweth commission emperor decree made fear catholiques said vnto v decree obserued made fear turkish warre time nede ayde thinke goodly cause fetch supplant v felowes confesse craft selues wherby licked v money therfore playn intended alwayes distructio religio late cofederacie declareth taried time serue purpos wold appere haue ye matter lawfully decided euer wt v yt shuld submit self ye bishop rome cousel might sufficietly declared bokes set forth purpose maintain execute decree counsell accomplishement wherof longe sollicited certen forrein prince fearing lest mean set top cleaued religion pretended cause fained rebellion might withdrawe fellowes whan vanquished chiefest myght compell residue obey commaundement albeit brother thought kepe maruelous secret subtill craftie counsell yet singular goodnes god commeth lyght dayly bishop himselfe ambassadours declared switzers cause warre copie league wherby manifest alone al professe doctrine lyke daunger indeuour restore papistrie place let men iudge therfore truly matter handled lately conuention regenspurg went perswade cocluded also appeasing religio would vse lawfull quiet remedy tolde hym selfe sayth lantgraue lately spier dissimulation emperour league byshop affirmed granuellan verely fatherly mynde affection zeale loue peace wherof speake muche euer man heare lyke thing wold perswade prince quite contrary whiche hath long prefixed minde know right well dutie prince owe vnto emperour againe ought perfourme vnto bounden hym againe bounden also vnto v wher cause heard doth outlawe v seketh put v besides lades possession breaketh bonde ciuile lawe wherby patrone bounden againe cliente nowe chargeth v rebellion nothing selfe knoweth doth v wrong euen cause saith lantgraue gaue thakes lately spier haue omitted diligence appease religion sayth prepared warre punyshed certen state purse denie iust cause neuerthelesse openly knowen mediation lewys paulsgraue richard archbyshop treuers matter quietly ended self also writing letter taken matter displeasauntly yet muche discharged mine armie signified required time spake sixtene yeares synce auspurg made purgation suche sorte king ferdinando friderick paulsgraue certen others contet satisfied wherfore ought make mattir part occasion warre restored ulriche duke wirtemberg intercession george duke saxo archbishop mentz matter reconciled composition ratified regenspurg vpo faith assuraunce toke away cleane abolyshed al displeasure speaketh also ye warre duke brunswick cause therof haue expressed wrytting moste frequent audience empyre self also present declared large two yeares paste duke tyme made answere emperour refused heare confutation wold heare examine dewly whole matter aduyse prince haue taken ordre thing certenly desyred ayde frenche turkyshe warre purpose let slepe wold haue put garden herein fulfilled desire wormes content frederick paulsgraue cosin iohn simmer kepe gouerne prouince v taken vntill tyme matter lawfully decided determined done assured v duke brunswick also assent wryting letter charged hym earnestly obeye cotemning commaundement raysed warre v taken therin appereth wryting set forth duke maurice therfore nothing warre contrary dutie nothing lawes herein appeale egall iudgement sene fauour beareth religion albeit duke brunswick contemned commaundement rashely although tyme heard sequestration spake themperour many lewde opprobrious wordes yet duke bruswi bitter enemy ye protestant moste bitter enemy religion althyngs vnpunyshed sayth haue brought certen vnder subiection farre otherwyse haue ofte made aunswere dede may wel verified whiche hath brought vnder iurisdiction diuerse prouinces empire also byshoprikes present warre hath assembled noble gentleman might al lure distruction verely graunt haue receiued diuers tuition fidelitie daunger doctrine gospell defende suppose duty god commaundeth succour afflicted none haue nede many yeares nowe helpe defence taken lutherians thing concerne religion defend haue always exhorted geue magistrate right honour due obiecteth v haue exhorted som repare assemblie vayne absurde ambassadours wer lately assembled wormes went regenspurge commaunded al thinges set part go also assemblie unto assembly thempyre ether haue comen selues always sent ambassadours concerning sayth chamber iudgement hath ben ofte confuted heretofore moreouer maketh mention heathen magistrate declare might resist hym haue done duty also ought haue geuen euer auncesters haue accustomed great losse hinderaunce hath cause complaint shall appere shall recite certen ambassadour frenche kyngs sent vnto hym french ambassador disswadeth emperour warre lately occasion fell talke warre saieth great enterprise taketh hand aduiseth consider selfe great force germany muche daunger thing perchauce one two haue offended may meane founde pacifie matter without warre wherunto made aunswere nedeth pacifieng matter wil conquer germany hazard euer hath worlde emperour co quer germany power therof great nedeth muche feare twenty yeares synce hath layde foundation matter oftentymes haue giuen hym ayde sondry many warres lately also kyng self haue bene great charge many asseblies empyre moreouer sondry warres haue lost great number strength decayed al theft thinges hath done intent germany might distitute power voyd force strength therfore tyme commodious worke feate heard talke mouth ambassadour honest man worthy credit reported vnto v impute cause war v seing hath intended long tyme whan priuate persones drowned dregges romish religion stande decree conuenauntes wold haue done duty asmuch hath broke chief obedience dew vnto god let ascribe faulte vnto selfe considering intedeth destruction religion libertie geueth occasion wherby may resist good conscience case lawful resist proued sacred prophane history god authour vniust violence god anctour wrong nether bounden otherwyse fulfyll condition whiche created emperour grauteth hath agreed v priuatly v great pleasure heare wherfor doth moue war matter faithful agrement made proued haue committed rebellion ether composition thus case standeth made decree wormes xxv yeares past set forth proclamation luther imbraced doctrine appointed moste extreme punishmet acte warre intendeth put execution crown scepter neuer coueted content owne landes reuenewes praye god feare may kepe maynteine true sayth haue oft geuen ayd lately two yeares synce kyng fraunce whiche desert benefit ought dede forget al displeasure though reconcilement bene made neuer reported euil opinion vertu haue al way commended hym highly famous libelles picture nether haue diuines yet others set forth hym yea diuines learned men haue euer extolled great prayses exhorted people sermon praye god preseruatio perauenture haue set forth somwhat byshop rome cause inhibie vilaynously slauderously cochleus hadamar white frere collon haue rayled v fellowes diuines euen regespurg whan rable papistes assemblie holden appease controuersie manifestly knowen obiecteth vnto v conspiracy conuenticles wherin doth v great iniury thinges borne bred germany men far void suche crafty deuises haue bene wrought v many yeares past first bewray selues howbeit might defende selues vniust violence made league denie defende selues iniury wherfore made haue two seuerall writinges declared fiue yeares since saith lantgraue went emperour regenspurg granuellan sayd chauncelour emperour nothing offended league could content also receiue many would speaketh darke wordes though haue moued turke inuade germany shall thing selfe confute haue always giuen ayd turke yea euer progenitours haue done suche tymes bounden couuenauntes kept whan diuerse others whiche promysed ayde perfourmed nothing haue heard already brother haue deuised turke might oppresse sodainly v fellowes ayde giuen lately publique decree fraunce promysed whan warre finished would go streight turke made peace enemy without knowledge whose money made warre behold bedeth al force v goodly matter se munition brought austriche warre germany meane season suffer hongary ouer runne turkes sedition cospiracies treason wherwith chargeth v none nether ther cause war rehearsed sayth hath graunted v ouer muche wynked doinges grudge conscience fayned also desire long since haue made warre emperour pretended war long v could impeched hitherto necessitie constrained differre till quieted duke cleaue king fraunce turke hys mynde hath bene extreme moste greuous execution godly men coutreis declare also agreed v heretofore first perceiue done intent dispatched affaire might entent dispatched affaire might inted warre wherof assuredly coulde suspecte nothyng sayth lantgraue reason great good wyll humanitie shewed lately spier time also nauis wylled chauncelour case talk might kept secret finally ende accusation pluck fellowes v therfore ascribeth vnto v tyranny extortion disturbaunce clergie vndeseruedly punysh extortion murther dominios extremely therby haue purchased small hatred selues lately innocent man iohn diazius cruelly detestably murthered neuer man beginning worlde vntyll day fratricide brother appreheded accused certen prince made request horrible fact myght punyshed insued therof matter selfe declareth imputeth cause displeasure trouble vnto v decree wormes decres wormes tro pet warre cause together wherunto aduersaries cleaued moste sure foundation especially duke brunswick whiche made confederacie diuerse conuentio auspurg maner decree made openly knowen certenly cruell fierce wordes ther pronounced caused v make league cofederacie daye byshops adheretes haue bene euermore busy v al assembly would haue compelled v choise meates holy dayes owne makyng moreouer permitted emperour auspurg whan promysed v faire largely appoint preacher knowen wel enough wicked ignoraunt men assigned office auncient custome custom thempire asseblees thempire wha prince minded retourne home thassemblie may emperours leaue father sayth duke saxon tyme auspurg could obtaine licence departe heard also reported case prepared goe yet stayed wyll albeit vncle friderick done muche hym yet would neuer long father liued confirme hym dukedome decree wormes religion seing therfore cause warre manifestly knowen desyre men geue credit contrary defende v common natife countrey subiectes clientes hath released allegeauce owe vnto v doubt wyl duty vnto v bunden protestautes letting slippe occasio fight ingolstad sayd remayning thre dayes whan emperour meane season fortified campe strongly fourth day septe ber remoued thence might encountre protestauntes remoue campe erle bure stop passage notwithstanding said nede go seke enemy sight eies pitched next tyme neuburg fortified garnison two day marched donauerd tenth day september encaped besydes uending towne erles oeting sending thence espialles bring intelligence erle bure perceiuing emperour sent aduertisement erle turning way marching norinberg regenspurg came emperour ingolstad safitie wherfore protestauntes frustrated hope third day returne vnto donauerde hether came vnto christopher counte oldenburg friderick rifeberg two legion erle bichling fiue enseignes foteme meane tyme emperour remoued campe nuburg whan aide came souldiours garnyson rendred towne emperour pardoned al taking stipulation shoulde weare armure nuburg dred vnto ye emperour report went emperour would auspurg wherfore germaines passe ouer thonawe let iourney whan leauing garnison nuburg marched toward marxeme returne back former campe tolde sent ambassadours ayde fraunce englande vaine king fraunce dede excused matter hauing made peace ye emperour sayd could beit would haue emperours fraunce de ed ayde ther protest power increased desyred peter strosse floretine man war exceading riche lende thre hondreth thousand crownes intent might easelier doe payeth great somme money ought content asmuche strasburg auspurg ulmes became suerties goeth forth iohn sturmius sent ambassadour fraunce prince campe donauerde whan came thither honorably receiued departed suche sorte would assuredly defray money tyme came shuld disburse could found fraunce many men suppose wrought policie cardinall peter strosse disceaued ye protestates tournon hatred bare religio wyshed aduersitie protestauntes chief authoritie king thende september protestauntes write zurick berne basill schafusians shew themperour intedeth prote write swiss gospeller daunger shal stand also case get victory consider whether wisdome declare selues ennemies emperour byshop rome inuade emperours countrie next wyll doe promyse ayde fidelitie wherunto make aunswere howe rest ye swysses lyke case haue league inheritauce house austriche burgundy whiche aunswer protestates countreis haue wyne bread corne whiche league selues infringe swiss fellowes whiche contrary religion haue iuste cause assiste emperour kyng ferdinando ope strayte passage alpes whiche haue great labour shut vp closed ioyne ennemies moreouer wynter hande albeit would neuer fayne yet great thing yeare leaue owne countrey naked feared leste others would take possession meane season therfore muche better tary styl home shall fellowes styre haue already declared vnknowen beare ryght good wil wyshe prosper owne harte desyre howebeit thinke mete enter great daunger therfore desyre take good parte emperour remoueth marxeme donauerde fyndyng place conuenient encampe tourneth left hand thyrde daye october marcheth monheyme fortuned great myste escoutes sent knowe whiche waye emperour went brought contrary reportes fine whan lewys erle oetinge brought certen worde passed great part armie ouer ryuer wernize followed immediatly two clocke none towardes nyght pytche tentes passing halfe myle emperour hitherto came vnto messenger city norling seing themperour nigh required ayde aunswered emperours protestates campes nere together frankely nex day myste forewarde led duke saxon latgraue middle ward george malspurg rifeberg rerewarde duke saxon marching forwarde fiue legion many troppes horseman approcheth nere vnto thennemy ryding pricking coursing vp partes whan waxed clere themperour perceiuing ye vantwarde kept ye way towardes norling rereward come yet sight auaunceth al horseman though would geue battell lantgraue therfore mids time ye whole armie enemy made towards asketh cousel aduised folow ye duke saxo reward yet far behind departure sawe shuld like fal lapse ennemies thought good depart sending messegers haste forward cal back duke saxo kept hilles vpon stired midway betwixt army ye riuer egra dede smal yet hard passe ouer especialy themperour wold haue foughten battel unto riuer come erle bure power whan like shuld haue ioined battel themperour calleth back comaundeth straitly go thus returned campe protestauntes pitched far fro norling next daye certen troupe themperours horseman ryde nere vnto enemy gaue hote skirmysche conflict hurt albert brunswick sonne duke philip going vnaduisedly wel tippled albert brunswick hurt caried norling died long emperour remayning certen dayes sendeth meane tyme octauius farnesius owne force almaigne fotemen munitio take donauerd fortune fauoured man deuise settyng forwarde night whan come thither sone day appered auauncing ladder scale townes men yelded selues souldiours garnyson fayne donauerd rendred saue selues flyght done themperour marcheth donauerd protestantes intent haue assaulted emperour campe departure altered yt purpose thought themperour intelligence therof espial day duke alba sent demaude lantgraue kept much hilles mountaynes cometh downe plaine fielde trye matter battell lantgraue sent word howe duke alba rauteth ye latgraue fellowes fiue dayes together plain fieldes ingolstad offered battell would fight bicker norlinge taried whole daye whylest done sweden fell great alteration saxonie emperour deuised alteratio sauonte duke maurice regenspurg ferdinando prage emperour commaunded inuade enter possession electours saxonie lantgraues countreis specified wherupon duke maurice first beginning warre retourning home regenspurg calleth conuention chemnice al state within dominion cosulteth nedefull done counsell know certenly emperour duke maurice consulteth protest whether wyll permitte kepe religion safely secondly marque brandenburg electour make intercession case may assuraunce religion intercession wil take place exhorte much bounden al matter besides religion obey emperour would sit quiet hire power defende countrey unto thing promise ayde chouse syx whole nu ber assiste time aduise counsel whan themperours comaundemet said came vnto hym king ferdinando also mustred men hongary leuied power boheme holdeth another assembly state fridberg eight day october reciteth ye former treaty sayth aduise marque brande burg haue solicited duke saxon lantgraue permitte yt might intreate matter haue earnestly admonyshed also perill thing would ponder diligently yet dede haue receiued conuenient aunswer libelles set matter come hand stripe haue bickered together haue sondry smal coflictes albeit yt thei haue diuers time required ayd yet forasmuch themperour hath giuen sufficiet warrautise religio therfore hath following cousel stired nothing hath kept soldiours ye defence prouince conferred matter cousell wt six chose time troublesome perillous yt say thei ar able beare great burthe wherfore request assebly called theperours comaundementes brought vnto hym shewe sore moste importance sorte case neglected whole countrey therby like come wounderfull daunger moreouer bohemers theyr fellowes prepare warre comen countrie al ready purposing inuade prouince duke iohn friderickes albeit hath first letter ambassadours last al going selfe also intreated king ferdinando contrary yet could obtayne nothing asmuche also supposeth done themperours commaundement neither may neither lieth power resist would dede right gladly ciuile warre appeased turkish violence might repressed beit knowe sorte coutreis lincked together hope succession howe hath siluer mine also comon prince electour suffer thinges plucked away house saxonie siluer mynes comon ye duke saxon come straungers handes great grief moreouer whole coutrey lieth intermingled per celles case foreine soldiours inuade cosyns prouince daunger lest countrey shuld also sustain great hurt therby se also good forein nation remaine party seing matter thus desyreth also brother augustus name would way whole case diligently help ayde counsell eftsones wyl omitte nothing shalbe duty ta agayne matter debated condescended immediatly aduertyse duke saxon lantgraue emperours commaundement preparation kyng ferdinando desyre auoyding destruction would permitte duke moris myght enter possession countrey shuld eschew vnreasonable request duke mauris counsell forein warre kepe safe religion whan matter appeased great deale easely obtayne agayne handes tha others therfore writing letter effect eleuenth day october thei desire way selues whole matter coformable counsell doubtles best may troublesome tyme geue requyred also latgraue letter would perswade prince electour take ye way duke moris wrote also letter ye lantgraue father lawe much like inportaunce foreine soldiour hande sayeth howe must necessite prouide saxony ouerrunne promyseth hym muche good wyll amitie sheweth desyreth nothyng sayeth moreouer kyng polle wyl petitioner emperour thyng glad heare wherfore let hym content exasperated wordes lykewyse perswade electour neyther refuse submit self emperour maner waye come reconcilement wil also helpe make peace conuention fridberg iohn william electour sonne saxonie whan heard preparation kyng ferdinando sending ambassadours requyreth duke moris according league inheritauce wold ioyne force saue common countrey daunger duke moris sayth hath spared payne matter might haue bene appeased seing hath take labour vaine armure may nothing supreme magistrate whome also aunciet league doth except song euer ye protestautes heard emperours going donauerd nex day ther purpose go lawging towne vpo riuer thonaw thre mile aboue donauerde night whan vncerten whether emperour gone forward leaue back many said daunger lest take norling vale remsie inuade lande wirtemberg altering purpose remayned one day toke scherteline displeasauntly likewise thinges going auspurg scherteline departeth protest auntes citie sent forth warres leadeth away ye garnison lawging returneth field meane season themperour marching forward fro dona uerde taketh coposition dilling hochstet shortly lawging gundelfing ye riuer brent wherfore hauing gotten possession water thonawe great co modities serue purpose leauing algarniso lawging emperour winneth riuer thonawe whan passed ouer brent pitcheth tentes village sontheyn ye way ulmes thre myles ye place xiii day october protestates length remouing campe whan heard emperour kept iourney towardes ulmes nex daye came sieng town riuer litle aboue sontheim water mids betwixt army staied yet pitched tentes espie certen horseman top next hyll amongs whiche theperour self rode forth wt duke alba escoute abroad day duke saxon ye forewarde hasteth spedely toward enemy sendeth also worde lantgraue make haste hym time enemy fled slacketh matter tarieth lantgraue hyll thought lost occasio taking emperour loste agayne moste goodly oportunititie well foorde ryde ouer ryuer one brydge al party though emperour peraduenture escaped yet chief captaines bene great distresse thei selues afterward ar reported haue hid emperour omitting iourney ulme lest leuing enemy behinde back lose vitall thonawe goeth another way worke ides october next wood laieth ambusche thre thousand arcubusiers whan prince eulmone offered warlike pollicie ye emperour skermysche light horseme charge geuen infayning fled allured wood side thei breake thebuschemet discharge seing lantgraue came streight wayes rescue company dauger fowre bandes horseman wherfore sore conflicte day till night field piece brought bickering whyle duke saxon abode armie case emperour tumulte haue assaulted campe might ready gyue repulse whan wold take place emperour attempteth matter camisade night chouseth whole nombre fotemen almaignes spanyardes pollicie comaundeth put whyte shirtes ouer harnesse appointeth also horseman duke alba captain sendeth forth night sone watche set myght go styll closely enemy campe selfe immediatly followeth rest power whan came thither perceiued nomber watchemen increased vp armure wherfore enterpryse vayne muche vnderstode matter espiall fewe howres wante forage vytayle pestilencein emper campe tyme yeare continual rayne died sore themperours campe tyme also cardinall farnese departeth campe homeward certen bandes italian horseman emperour also cause compelled chaunge place retourne old cape besides laweging daye kalendes nouember unto letter state duke moris dated fridberg xi day october sayd lantgraue answereth xx day ye moneth hartely sory lantgraue aunwereth state duke moris warre attempted countreis muche common daunger doe ioyne force together example elder doe consider warre religion semeth hym great maruel seing byshops letter ye swiss league made betwixt emperour shewed vnto heluetians byshops commaundement doe opely testifie plainly declare since league made great force haue commen emperour italy italian taken affirme certenly purposely sent warre lutherians moreouer fellowes religion war much cruelly handled others spoyling firyng robbery woman maydens wickedly defloured yong chyldren infates crueltie wrought papistes haue handes fete cut euen hatred doctrine emperour hath warraunted religion dissimulation case demaunded whether would luther religio submitted authoritie decree byshops counsell doubte craft would sone appere wherfore let truste promesse affrayd themperours sentence outlawyng marueleth greatly knowe lawfull hym doe vnlesse party first bene sommoned conuicte iudgement greatest grief noble house people saxonie shuld thus deuided one mynde would ioyne force together daunger feared might easely repulsed hath verely talked electour herein nothing agreable waye whiche shewe chaunge fortune require lyke duke moris doubteth would refuse also would counsell contrary wherfore doth lyke theyr cousel worse duke moris hath lately writte sory heare bruted shuld couet possesse cosyns prouince reporte vntrue iniurious therfore praied credit whan receiued letter contented excuse thought matter shold sease vpo coutrey thei se men would iudge desireth therfore would impeche thing done otherwyse forreyne warre ciuill also wil ensue vpon case susteyne iniury reason emperours proscription neither fellowes stande case helpe wilbe ende therof hard iudge therfore let indeuour house saxo hesse deuided duke maurice doe assiste fellowes shalbe chiefly honour welthe also wrote day also moris like effect admonisheth waye emperours proclamation outlawyng cal remembraunce electour haue done father duke george vncle made wil themperour possesse whole prouince vntil brother proie benefites duke moris forsake protestauntes religion knoweth benefit receiued moreouer duke george gaue vnto father yearly pension ther feare least woulde haue denied hatred bare religion protestauntes promysed hym came passe would liberalitie gyue hym asmuche yearly wherfore let hym surcease enterpryse attempt nothing duke saxon prouince without loue leaue otherwyse shall want fellowes ayde ambassadours pole dede emperours campe haue signified duke saxon haue done condicions suche sort make nothing peace lyke importauce councellours warre wryte duke moris state proteste force done yt duke saxon wyll neglecte iniury electour selfe made none aunswere tyme shall declared hereafter day also lantgraue counsellers write proie letter city city maydenburg brunswyck breme hamburge goslary hildesseme goting hanobrie embeck minden duke pomerane duke luneburg prince anhalde shew daunger toward saxonie chiefly electour vnto whose frountiers ennemies comen already beginning cometh kyng ferdinando hath enforced bohemers vnto warre duke maurice taketh parte pretendeth cause emperour hath outlawed howbeit haue sende duke moris medle shall duke saxon wante helpe muche whole countrie standeth present daunger duke asketh helpe ayde mynde haue delyuered hym part armie haue together ennemie far good hope matter shall shortely tried mayne battell wherin welthes consist thinck wysdome present make selues muche weaker fetche ennemie molested warres auaunce whole force seing ye case standeth thus require name wold sende ayd fotemen sone wittemberg weinmar also rest money dew league pay vnto electours sonne counsellours case co mon whan fellowes ouerrunne lyke misfortune wyll soner chaunce vnto haue spoken bohemers serued fardinando dede howbeit full sore willes reason aunciet bohemers serued duke sax vnwillingly league house saxon agayn said war nedeful many thought electour also wrong
