ferdinando brought sent power hogary silesie might constraine whether wold horsmen hongary commonly called hussares exceadyng hussares rauenous cruell kynde men wherfore leuing force also whan passing owne limites sebastian weittemulle general armie sending letter xx day october proclameth warre duke sarons people certen yeares past prince seased ferdinando depute proclaimeth saxonie handes abbeye dobrilug renou ced lately fidelitie emperour confederate breaking league betwene bohemers house saxon albeit thing requireth declaratio muche outlawed emperour yet lest thing might appeare omitted would discharge geue aduertisement tyme ambassadours protestauntes assemblie ulmes common co sultation wher saxonie came diuerse message state thing electour sending letter xxvii day october chargeth ambassadours ulme declare whole matter fellowes require consider case asmuche duke sarons request hys fellowes hath spared peryll paine might defende higher part germany distruction counsellours warre day past sent worde city saxony helpe hym wil vncerten though would yet feareth greatly shall able resist great multitude enemy daunger lest euer ready enemy wyl haue inuaded countrey thinges therfore let require fellowes first asmuche great grief discommoditie extremitie leaue longer destitute wyfe child people wold geue counsell herein moreouer would graunte ayde wherof lantgraue counsellours warre haue put hope already finally make peace ennemy haue recouered yt hath lost hereunto ambassadours aunswere franckly chiefly intreate would tary armie tyll emperour shall haue broke vp campe wynter shewe daunger departed ferdinando maurice doe wrong promyse ayde say ther doubt fellowes prince state wyll according league faithfull helpfull hym wyll conclude peace haue recouered owne case thought good would also lyke maner lantgraue counsellours warre haue done signifie much duke maurice trust also vndoubtedly suche state co federacie saxony wyll doe dutie herein forsayd xxvii day october duke maurice wryteth duke maurice letter electours letter dresda prince electour emperour hath commaunded hym doe peryll matter consisteth hath heard lately letter state countrey muche emperour hath assured people concerning religion therfore determined intent emperour may satisfied ryght also may remayne vnto hym whole aduise counsel fynde meanes lande prouince doe come handes straungers doth owne also brother augustus name denounce hym tyme come shall agayne reconciled emperour kyng ferdinando wyll refuse wyll suffer state iurisdiction shall treate betwyxt order whole matter selfe wordes writeth also iohn william electours sonne warneth hym see letter adressed father conueyed meane whyle bohemers nussars make inuasion uoetiande next cositrey electours sleying spoyling electours countrey nuaded burning rauishing measure bohemers taried long sayd serued vnwyllyngly eleuenth day nouember forsakyng enseignes slyppe home euery man hongarians bohemers slyp away others ferdinando hyred ioyne selues vnto duke maurice taketh rendring first swiccauie ecne berg aldeburg moste parte electours townes sweareth vnto hym sauing gothe isenack wittemberg newes therof brought themperous campe styred vp great ioy gladnes emperour declared great peale ordenaunce accustomed dayes emperour chaungeth campe againe lyke cause chouseth commodious drye ground myght somwhat refresh poore souldiours releue also vitaile others moste part counselled souldiours might retire vnto place wynter selfe opinion continew armie field maintaine warre men moste part cried vpon duke duke maurice ali men maurice whiche serued sknekyshely whome oughte haue honoured father maner ye authour requite vnthakfulnes ther came forth reproche dispraise libelles verse moste bitter whiche charged falsefying fayth treason moste ingratitude muche wold nothing herein intreaty neyther wyfe father lawe thing knowen publisheth wryting purge excuse selfe sheweth maner religion countrey hath promised people furtherauce religion hath founded certen scholes saith emperour hath assured people hym prince also concerning religio preseruation lybertie germany neyther wyll thyng done violently cause maye lawfull wyse appeased accordyng vnto many decree empyre already enacted wherfore geueth credit promesse letter ensample prince whiche serue hym doe home campe also warfare professe religion suche familiar hym dayly sight may easely knowe mynde case perceiued thyng without doubt would tary hym bishop aydeth done bicause warre attempted chiefest aduersaries errours authoritie neither muche considered moueth emperours minde maketh warre wherfore seing religion assured seeth cause obey themperour al thinges christ commaundeth geue god also emperour whiche trauell payn hath taken matter might without ciuile warre haue ben pacified vnknowen emperour kyng ferdinando diuerse others peace could graunted emperour sent streight comaundement sease vpon landes iohn friderick also kyng ferdinando hauing leuied force hongary boheme austriche ready inuade would intreated sent armie taken already certen syluer mynes whiche common betwene cosin hym dryuen necessitie prouide got resydue inuaded purpose first declared boeth lantgraue duke cosyn also sonne seing desyreth man mistake doyng credit suche thynges shall haply reported duke maurice nothing coucious hym mainteyning religion wylbe constant hath none respecte thinge landes dignity house saxon shuld come straungers handes tyme began persecutio fraunce persecution fraunce town party called melda ten mile paris byshop therof former yeares willia brissonet desirous purer doctrine appointed good preacher instructours people excluding al freers tyme cause diuines sorbone procured daunger shewed constancie refused enterpryse notwithstanding remnaunt doctrine remayned mindes many yeare thre score townes men consulting matter chouse selues preacher worde assembling priuate house whan sermon ended certen dayes receiue lordes supper order gospell christes institution thing could long kepte secret especially sythe dyuerse also came countrey wherfore beyng taken whan together put pryson examination caried paris carte receyuing sentence death caried home agayne fourtene bounden seuerall stake burnte quicke one tyme residewe whypped bannished retournyng home warde paris one commeth runnyng next village exhorteth perseuer ende wherfore beyng apprehended suffered lyke punyshement others ther brent put torture intent vtter fellowes follower theyr doctrine could extorte nothyng many supposed done pourpose breake amitie knitting betwene kynge protestauntes duke maurice letter defiaunce duke saxon delyuered campe syxt daye nouember fourmer booke haue shewed howe byshop xvi daye apryll gyuing sentence agaynst tharchebyshop collon appealeth fro pope archbyshop collon depriued hym al ecclesiasticall office nowe heard fyrst therof certentie fourth daye nouember hymselfe mentioneth fewe dayes settyng forthe wryting declaryng cause acknowledge byshop hys iudge accused already heresy idolatrie appealeth sentence vnto lawfull counsell germany whan shall begynne sayeth wyll persecute suite byshop protestauntes ambassadours whiche shewed assembled ulme aboute ende october whan could agree sentence moneth nouember went campe gienge consultation might easier propounded muche fellowes religio geue ayde cofederates luneburg pomerane certen others rest state city saxonie helpe muche nothyng brought fraunce reason soldiours doe dayly slippe awaye tyme yeare discommodities armie deminished must chouse one thre thynges eyther geue battell departe field retyring soldiours place may wynter el make peace truce matter debated condescended make mention peace assigned adam trotte cause electour brandenburg accesse marque iohn brother breake matter emperour whiche espiall knewe throughly case discommoditie lately receyued glad tydiuges saxony propounded verey harde condition determined reste force beyng led saxonie thousande horseman eight thousande fotemen wynter certen place coste charge duke wirtemberge city vpper partes germany thre twenty day nouember retyre makyng fyrst decree ambassade sent fraunce englande two twenty daye ianuarye mere agayne frankefurte thus warre gouerned nothyng luckely whiche misfortune vnlucky successe protest warre thought principal cause matter wrought order wyll one duke saxon lantgraue authoritie egall chaunced many goodly oportunities disceptation omitted whiche authoritie canot beare equalitie also decreed placyng soldiours came none effecte whan many refused contributaries longer emperour intelligence theyr departure maketh forth horseman immediatly vnderstande iourney shortly commaundeth duke alba erle bure followe selfe also goeth forth horseman germany leauing fotemen comaunding remayne moste part protestates already campe reste al nyght lantgraue albeit led forwarde day yet taried duke saxon either ten guidons horseman fiue hondreth guners stayed vpon hill plated redy field piece thus abiding ennemies whan almost darke night emperour calleth back went also softely forwarde tyll came campe besydes heydenem lande wirtemberg escapyng moste present dauger emperour peril protest geuen charge whiche fewe nomber comparison ennemies bene either taken slayne let saye selues afterwarde themperour knewe force supposed many mo tha nothing hasty night commaunded fotemen marche forward followe intent verely might haue foughten next day said goyng secretly away night nowe come army wherfore emperour retourneth campe made abode two day refreshe soldiours supposed wold wynter franckonie fertile plentifull countrey thought preuent therfore taken rendring bophing norling cositie oeting dingelspulle hasteth great expedition roteburg citie empire standing riuer duber lantgraue going duke wirte berg deliuered force duke saxony retourneth home kalendes december came franckfurt duke saxon although wanted senewes warre yet marching forwarde army battred gemund towne sweden hath rendred causeth senate geue somme money whiche gathered euery man twelfth daye duke saxon acteth mony papistes december came army frankefurt getteth nyne thousand crownes imposeth archbyshop mentz fourty thousand proceding styll handleth ryche abbot fulden certen others romishe religion sorte lantgraue returning home sendeth letter duke maurice sonne lawe signifiyng wyll come wyll assure saufe conduite woulde intreate peace betwixt duke saxon duke maurice doeth assure dede sendeth letter therin many condition thought good goe sent ambassadours herman hundelsuse henry lersuer laboured matter ernestly yet could nothing co cluded whilest maurice said might accorde wtout perours cosent duke saxon army ready wold haue delay yt wold attept war therfore whan hope peace lantgraues soldious retourne home howbeit recrode brought fotemen almaines fraunce sayde remayned styll duke whan emperour rotburg sendeth away erle bure gyueth hym charge fynde meane get franckefurte ides december wryting letter thence ulrich duke wirtemberg al beit saith war certen emperours letter duke wirtemberg yeares past lantgraue attempted brother kyng ferdinando taking dukedome wyrtemberg reason would haue punyshed extremely yet forgeue al iniurie penaltie shewed fauour nowe late begynning warre although desertes farre otherwyse muche exercise tyranny vpon owne people also ouer certen state city empyre neither obey lawe iudgement sente ambassadour man honour whiche shold declare vnto cause war enterprised also requyre sit quiet loke fauour handes al thinges neglected regarding allegeaunce owe vnto v haue associated self outlawes confederate haue incurred lyke cryme rebellion haue done first hast taken certen townes brother ferdinando state myne also empyre vpo soden men owne faction content whan thinges workyng denounced warre v certen mallaparte boldenes moste opprobrious wordes haue hurte fame estimation goyng take v degree hyghest honour dignitie deniyng vnto v fidelitie streyghtways conspiratours durste leade forth armie v doynge outtrage vnto many clientes brother ferdinandos myne wherby haue fallen penaltie whiche dewe vnto periured outlawes conuictes hygh treason seyng thus haue iuste lawefull cause auenged moste extremelie accordynge demerytes yet accustomed clemencie myserable people maye spared strayghtely charge commaunde immediatlye vppon syghte hereof doe submitte vnto v selfe countrey haue world without condition exception may ordre vse pleasure vnles shall obeye shal persecute thine sworde fyre letter whiche sent foure dayes synce doe content v neyther sufficient pourge excuse thyne offence sendeth copie letter vnto subiectes also chargeth obeye hym longer sende ambassadours vnto hym know pleasure releaseth also allegeaunce othe wherby bounden hym wyll doe wil prouide sayth shall lyue better state hereafter threatneth lyke punishement time emperour wrote duke alba armie border countrey wyrtemberg duke ulriche goyng castell tuel standing vpon high hyll without region emperours letter delyuered vnto hym way xx day duke letter submissio themper december wryteth vnto hym moste humbly great submission brought thus hygh displeasure hartely sory neither could thing haue chaunced vnto greuous diuerse intreated selfe also acknowledge faulte craued pardon good hope displeasure haue bene appeased hope reteyneth styll hath tried experienced clemecy wonte vse towardes suppliauntes hereof armo example one shewed many yeares since vnto certen prince whiche happely gaue somwhat occasion displeasure hath done case wold haue heard ambassadours doubteth woulde haue wrytten muche gently wherfore craueth mercy besecheth christes sake forgeue hym worke extremitie hym beyng myserable prince yet poore subiectes tyme came vnto emperour men armes naples numbre fiue hundreth leading iohn baptiste spinello emperour goeth marching hale towne sweuia vnto lately reconciled thether came vnto hym fridericke paulsgraue paulsgraue asketh pardon themps prince electour ayded protestautes foure hondreth horseman whiche came vnto ingolstad wherfore goeth vnto emperour sheweth hym done resist fulfyll league wherby bounde duke wyrtemberge themperour taketh vp sharply accompting much done blameth sore neuerthelesse remitteth offence warneth hereafter recompence fault errour trusty fidelitie alitle warres whan paulsgraue intended haue set ordre church sent paulus fagius learned eloquent come strasburg hedelberg paulus fagius might guide doctrine gospel shew way vnto others successe emperour begonne quite dasshed fewe day came ambassadours ulme ulmes reco ciled emperour made submission craued pardon reconciled citie chiefest force authoritie al sueuia wherfore breaking fro felowes great matter writing letter fredes thende december signifie cause emperour prest haue beseged city roud vtterly forsaken fellowes sawe man helpe able defende great power moreouer certen chiefest confederate sued vnto emperour priuatly reconciled emperour condempneth hondreth thousand crownes twelue piece ordenaunce put citie ten enseignes fotemen meane whyle erle bure inuadeth lantgraues dominion liyng aboue franckfurt towne castell darmestat wynneth partly force partly surendrie fireth castell spareth darmstat wonne people none defended inhabitauntes company taken coutrey passeth franckfurt hope wynne violence especially tyme yeare soldiours euyl plyght sendeth away parte army passe ouer rhyne willeth tary mentz whan thought nothing lesse returning home behold franckfurt sending ambassadours offer render thes fra kefurte render therle bure say wilbe commaundement without tariyng turneth backward entryng town armie bringeth subiectio emperour gentleman plain nature whan senate gaue supper iested reported rendryng lightly timourously saiyng howe darmstat worthy inhabite franckfurt remoued dwell darmstat towne comparison franckefurte village howbeit cause amonges others sawe howe ulme duke wirtemberg reconciled fearing lest marte taken welth standeth neither thei ignoraunt mentz wormes laboured emperour either citie selues haue fro sending ambassadours receiued againe emperours fauour paying foure score thousand crownes whan duke saxon come armie frotiers xxii day december sending letter state duke maurice made aunswere sayeth electours letter state duke maurice letter bearing date xi daye october purposely would tary se ende hath ben done meane tyme openly knowen howbeit reason cosynage league amitie amonges v benefites toward prince certenly loked suche thing either yet woulde neuer haue thought euer would haue vsed people suche sorte h hath done much lesse wold geue suche counsell shoulde tende destruction whole countrey owne dommage also thinke tyme semeth vnto conuenient wherin vttered craftie deuises counselles certen contriued many yeares since god alwayes repressed consider selues acte whan counselled duke george disherite brother hys brother chyldren contrary religion make emperour king ferdinando heires vnles would professe restore byshops religion wyl legacie toke place whole inheritaunce reduced brother henry doctrine gospell reteyned chiefly wrought meanes industrie league frendes albeit professing religion entred league also wrytynges made sygned aswell owne also sonnes name yet muche fyrste hope frustrate moue much might swarue couenaunt whan departed hys sonnes also followed steppe father vndoubtedly counsell like inheritaunce willes descended vnto henry sonnes also frendshyp henry litle greue full ofte haue assayed might vntwyned neyther enterpryse altogether frustrate could bryng passe whylest liued haue last obteined sonnes especially maurice conceiued mynde moste hope vertue frendshyp fiue yeares synce long made magistrate styred vp whiche deserued handes suche wyse matter wanted great daunger albeit tempest blowe ouer mediation lantgraue bonde made suche thyng attempted hereafter matter ordered party according thaunciet league yet haue absece perswaded hym brother augustus sease vpo prouince thing assuredly greueth muche wryting receiuing ryght frendly letter signifie suche thinge againe would nothyng herein request lantgraue fellowes calamitie innocent people subiectes greueth calamitie saxony exceadingly whome bringing foreine cruel barbarous soldiours hath plaged robbery spoyling murther greueth also minister churche preacher ar euery driuen put flight yea virgin matrones defiled autragious crueltie doubt god wyll one auenge muche greueth troubleth handlyng thing trayterously spitefully vnloked attempted cousell vndoubtedly whiche example traytour iudas hyred vnto bribe rewardes cause preteded take possession landes charles hath commaunded ferdinando vrgeth hym cosinage nere aliaunce league conuenauntes whiche commen house ought preferred far aboue theyr proclamation touching al thinges concerne religion charles ferdinando agreed long synce crime ascribed v false ar troubled religion commaundement doe moue doth vnworthines thing selfe moue consider whether prince might lawfully execute wicked commaundement grounded reason brought counsel cankred mind long synce corrupt affectios prince liked dukedome better equitie selfe true iudgement otherwyse reason would haue shewed muche condempned came aunswer outlawing prescription lawes decree conuenauntes wherby bound empire maurice also might easely haue sene ben lawfull obeye wicked wylfull commaundemet shuld haue regarded preseruation cositrey rather walke fotesteppes wicked doeg duke maurice followeth doeg fayned necessitie dutie cloke couer fact neither maketh matter saye woulde haue done suche thyng ferdinando approched lande armie matter farre otherwyse hath bene reported credible men first selues maurice craftie subtill counselles moued thynges emperour ferdinando regenspurg also prage tyme self hereafter wil bring lyght moreouer done commo assent mischeuous acte contriued fewe chosen whole nomber nowe therfore muche goodnes god retourned home armie fully determined requite prince lyke thankefulnes attempte thinges whiche requisite defence recouery prouince whiche thing verely reuenge vpon especially whiche authours mischeuous counsell according wickednes hereof shal wel vnderstand cruell iniurie wrong haue susteyned greueth suerly matter come passe sory dommage common countrey sythe beginning commeth thing selfe requyreth defende myne owne violent wrong proteste euyll euer shall hereafter come therof imputed also fre misdede wyll trie innocencie shall lawfull wyll vse courtesely gently king denmarke ayded yt protestates king denmarke albeit cofederate yet gaue ayde protestauntes emperour remouing hala hailbrune receiuing townes men fauour sendeth duke alba inuade lande wirtemberg sayd taking condition imposed yt du wirtemberg certen place rendryng doth verey muche harme sute paulsgraue duke wirtemberg third day ianuary reconciled vpon condition muche sicke let sende ambassadours make submissio desire emperour mercy thesame shall doe persone within sixe weakes shal obserue emperours decree concerning common wealth shal giue ayde duke saxon latgraue assist emperour proclamatio outlawry set forth may put execution shall permitte emperours ennemies haue nothing doe within precinct dominion shal make league time wherin emperour kyng ferdinando house austriche shal comprised subictes shall fortune serue theperour king ferdinado house austriche shall punishe moste extremely moreouer shall bynde nobilitie othe none serue oft shal please theperour passe countrey shall make way thinges munition whiche fellowes haue left within prouince shall deliuer euery piece furniture towardes ye charge warre shal pay thre hondreth thousand crownes one half hande residue within xxv dayes assuraunce shall deliuer asperge kirchene schorendorffe emperour may place garrison pleasure shall compound suche hath iniuried warre shall stande emperours arbitrement sonne shall followe custome court high burgundie whan shall haue matter lawe party shall auenged vpon subiectes whiche haue rendred vnto title kyng ferdinando remayne vnto hym whole within syxe wekes sonne christopher people doe confirme ratifie brother george shall inioye benefite peace time thynges drawen wryting third day ianuary said ambassadours duke ulriche balthasar gultting lewis frauenburg iohn fesler ciuilian fift daye came hailbrune falling prostrate themperours feete saye howe duke letted sicknes come hath gyuen charge make excuse howe confesseth fault openly wonderfull sory fence committed desireth god loue might receiued mercy extremitie shewed poore subiectes doth ratife condition peace also sone able come selfe requyre wyll neuer forget great benefit hereunto emperour maketh aunswere nauius forasmuch acknowledgeth faulte asketh pardon satisfied sayth howe wyll mercy spare people pardon offence obserue conuenauntes henceforth omitte dutie came ambassadours memming bibrach rauensburg kempten isnen making humble supplication desyre pardon thecities protestates send ambassadours yt emperour fault haue offended saye imputed partly owne errour partly occasion others flie vnto refuge vnto welspring mercy beseche woulde forgeue restore olde estate deminishe nothing priuileges fredome emperour byndeth othe faithful vnto henceforth obeye lawes state doe forsake league duke saxon lantgraue ayde kynde thinge make league henceforth done taketh mercy condepneth citie meming fifty thousand crownes came emperours emperour wyll heare tion religion presence desired assured haue religion chasiged nauius emperour vsed chiefly interpretour suche matter warned wise make mention therof incase emperour would surely ascribe certen distruste hym beginning warre declared mynde sufficiently therfore let holde content requyre assuraunce thought done intent lest haue nay might appere thing intended emperour published letter shold grau ted expresse wordes shold offende byshop rome whose purpose warre doctrine protestauntes might vtterly extinguished day arose rebellion gene house rebellion gene agaist yt hous aurie aurie prince wherof tyme androwe expert man sea liued emperours auauncemet chiefest comon welth chief captaine ringleader vprore counte fliscane amonges others murthered cosin androwe iohannine aurie great courage erle flisca chaunced slippe sea drowned thought would haue bene blacke daye muche euyll done whan gone fellowes conspiracie shranke away immediatly streightwayes tempest followed great caulme emperour affirmeth farnesians authours enterprise especially byshops sonne peter aloisse duke placence shalbe declared place sitting father trent whiche shuld haue ben ende iuly adiourned vntill tyme xiii day ianuary tyme father assembled cathedrall churche maner make decree iustification man condened affirme since fall adam man hath fre wyl decree ye counsell trent iustification man iustified fayth christe imputeth rightuousnes say iustification nothing el confidence god mercie forgiueth sinnes christes sake saye necessary man beleue assuredly doubte synnes forgeuen nombre god elect suche agayne saye man able kepe commaundementes god though iustified whiche saye iustification receiued kept increased thorowe good workes whiche baptisme affirme iustifications lost recouered fayth sacrament penaunce saye penitent synner hath offence wholy forgeue remayneth punishement neyther worlde lyfe come purgatory finally whiche affirme decree derogation god glory merites christe whan duke saxo coming armie duke maurice fortifieth lipsia garnison burneth suburbes tyme came ther aboue thousand horseman hongarians xiii daye ianuary began siege townes men defending selues duke saxon segeth lipsia moste valiauntly ende moneth enemy departeth without purpose howbeit towne nomber shot went thicke hayle wonderfully rent torne vtterly defaced duke saxon departing thece recouer shortly al lost countreys thuring meyssen also wan duke maurice townes sauing lipsia dresda bringeth also possession byshoprike magdeburg maurice loseth townes halberstat making composition byshop iohn albert daye assayled lipsia kyng ferdinando commaunded bohemers shoulde take armure goe ayde duke maurice obeyed dede retourned home without comaundement wherfore king ende ianuary comaundeth likewyse common prage whiche citie moste authoritie party desire senate sue ye king wold stay comaundement bohemers refuse warre saxony libertie suche honestly obey cause shuld haue warre prince electour saxon moste thinges religion one moreouer hath always shewed selfe lyke noble prince aided turkes wherunto ferdinando made aunswer amonges thinges howe warre attempted religion rebellion say howe hath geuen great aide turke matter far otherwyse sent messenger ye turke monethes past might procure moue war hongary boheme shuld take longer truce infringe grauted intet thing might haue better successe would fayle inuade contrary syde whan themperour vnderstode matter went saxony aduertised sondry letter duke maurice sendeth certen bandes horsmen fotemen ayde leading marque albert comaundeth force spaniardes italia follow wherof sandey marignane wer captain marque albert departeth fro hailbrune copany ix day ianuary themperour also remoueth marque albert sent ayde maur fro thece ulmes ye way liudaue esling recociled byshop rome told gaue sentece depriued tharchbishop collo ecclesiastical fuction wha thus gaue away al right authoritie self tyme vnto adolphe erle schauenburg adolphe substituted herman archebyshop collon whome fewe yeares archbishop amoges others chosen vnto coadiutour wherfore byshop sending bulles warneth state ye countrey accept acknowledge archbishop moreouer vrgeth themperour shuld execute sentence archbyshop beyng sondry time admonished leaue enterprise sayde euer could safe conscience emperour hauing almost nowe gotten victory sendeth collo ambassadours philip lalenge gouernour gelderlad uiglie zwicheme lawyer calleth assemblie state whole prouince comyng certen daye shuld forsake archebyshop herman goe coadiutour vnto whome shewe al fidelitie obseruance high prelate clergie dede ready graunt vnto occasion hereof nobilitie many clergie also noble house againe ambassadours city declare lawful forsake thei haue long tyme obeyed many yeares founde good godlye prynce vnto whome owe fayth allegeaunce othe matter stickyng harde poynte duke cleaue next neighbour auoyding trouble sendeth cousellours thither make intreatie whiche long much decision obteyne clergie wyll quiet tyll suche tyme state may declare whole matter archebyshop wherfore theodoricke manderschitte william nuenarie erles chiefest nobilitie sent vnto hym singular wisdome eloquence perswade hym compassion people leste whole countrey distroyed warre would content geue place tyme therfore released men othe allegeaunce herman leueth byshoprike forsayd coadiutour whome loued owne brother doeth succede hym xxv daye ianuary archebyshop brother named fridericke tolde tenth booke bene byshop munster nowe prouoste bonna also depriued office gropper share lyke chaunced counte stolberge dean collon defended archebyshop ryght constantly gropper spoyle friderick whole prouince commaundement newe byshop religion agayne altered euer bucer set forth quite abolyshed whan ambassadours protestauntes bene frenche kyng went englande myght bring passe nowe king henry sore sicke disease increasing departeth life thend ianuary ye xxxviii yere reigne wha legacie death henry eight kyng england made son edward ix yeres heire substituted daughter mary first wife elizabeth secod wife howbeit died condeneth thomas ye duke norfolke whose authoritie always gret vnto per beheaded erle surrey sonne speaking certe wordes ouer muche suspected king liyng sicke death insued alteration religion hereafter shall heare albeit expulsed dominion alteratio religion bishop rome authoritie albeit death acknowledge chief head churche albeit comon prayer ye churche detested tiraut kyng hery banished pope popery antichrist yet kept still popish religion hereto fore hath ben declared caused sonne well instructed childhode whan depart appointed counseilours nombre xvi amonges edwarde erle herford yong prince vncle unto whome afterward supposed would moste faithfull comitted chefest part protection rest counsailours honorable style geuen called protectour kyng realme also created duke whan king geuen duke somerset dutchie somerset loued gospel indeuour also might receiued moued king nephew imbrace like case herein companion helper thomas cranmer archebyshop thomas cranme primate england canturbury man notable learning primate england time also dieth wyfe king ferdinando quene anne mother many child emperour maketh funerall ulme meane season auspurg moued example fellowes auspurg make peace themperour owne daunger together hauing intercessours fit purpose amongest others anthony fugger receiued emperours fauour condemned hodred fifty thousand crownes xii great piece ordenaunce furnyshed fynde garryson within theyr cytie ten enseignes footemen citie captaine scherteline serued many yeares wage whome emperour sherteline moste hated themp kyng ferdinando hated chiefly takyng castell erenberg vpon alpes wherfore albeit senate intreated muche yet seing emperour stifly refuse wyse wold accorde constrayned flie countrey went hole family constaunce citie ye border swisserlad siege lipsia electour brandenburg intreateth peace sending ambassadours requyreth myght permitted take electour bra denburg intreateth peace vp matter electour content duke maurice blaming sore ye made sharp war ye sixt day ye length answereth somwhat straugly whan saw towne able hold thennemy wherfore marque immediatly doth signifie latgraue praiyng hym perswade duke maurice muche ciuile war saxony well appeased vnles publique war themperour shuld cease also desireth would geue minde unto rather perswade sheweth great daunger standeth fellowes part already recociled themperour duke wirtemburg hath accorded vpon moste straite condition theperour prepareth new army much alone able long resiste great power admonisheth yt wold refuse submit self condescende vnto condition selfe hath coceaued sent ambassadours much many cause themperours minde sore irritated thing selfe requireth certen humble submission craue pardon wherfore let hym haue respect selfe chyldren common multitude dryue nayle head neyther bryng matter extreme daunger wryteth also effecte duke saxonie emperour lytle protestauntes departed nouember appointed certen leuie theperour leuieth new army streight wayes newe armie make warre next partes saxonie leste state city ayde duke lantgraue ouer armie whiche nombre xxi thousande fotemen thousand two hondreth horseman made general ioyce grunninge gouernour selande compell conrade erle deckelburg league protestauntes city osnabruge mynden erle lippen certen others obeye co maundement take castell ritberge marche thence breme moneth february serued emperour philippe ebersten erle christopher urisberger frideriche spedie whan electour saxonie hearde emperours successe addressing letter elect saxon lettern strasburg senate strasburge xiii daye february signifieth vnto howe hath recouered owne wonne almoste duke maurice countreis thuring meyssen caused nobilitie sworen vnto hath allotted vnto ye shoprick maideburg duke wirtemberg part yt city vpper germany haue compounded themperour vpon condition moste vnreasonable omitting mention religion haue promised themperour ayde fellowes hath chaunced vnto beyond al expectation altogether repugnaut maner ye league heard say remained constant great pleasure wherfore let holde fainte doe becometh confederate thing require let defende maintein selues ayde swiss french king desire assuredly shew alloue fidelitie letted domestical warre wherin god make ende comoditie shal want helpe ambassadours state city saxony already assembled maydenburg treateth matter conuention appointed franckfurt trust perfourme dutie especially city wil forsake cofederatie ides february cometh strasburge ambassadour frenche kyng mendoza spaniard exile promiseth mendoza ambassa fre che kyng strasburge largely senate already decreed send themperour ambassade peace departed thing done ambassadours theperour iames sturmius matthie pharrer marke hagie cause ambassade going ulme thei know certentie vpon condition themperour might co pounded themperour counsel anthony bishop arras father granuella gone besanson nauius time chauged life death whose roume afterward succeded george selde ciuilan death nauius annexed reaso much busines germany iohn marquard bade harry hasie bene consellour paulsgraue lately prince bippount right expert matter germany kyng ferdinando intent myght styre vp bohemers kyng ferdinando moueth bohemers warre refused serue saide sixte daye february marcheth forth ferdinando sonne commeth letmerice frontier towne boheme tyme taried day two noble state realme longe oration muche duke maurice desyreth helpe exhorteth put armure wel auncient league betwene people also theperours clictes diuerse say libertie herby infringed promiseth assurace yt shalbe hinderauce time come state whiche present say determine nothing consent rest require therfore shortly call altogether certen others promise seruice duty gouernours townes vnto whome king gaue thakes others declared large time stande question thing selfe requireth present remedy ennemie time warre shalbe finished wyll refuse call assemblie deminishe part liberty wherfore let stande content follow length fearing displeasure whan king taunted somwhat sharply thei gaue assent also case thei serue persone promise finde others ye ides february nobilitie men prage writing letter pray king muche perseuereth comaundemetes new straunge example xx daye marche wold comaunde state prage case assemble determine thing desire take displeasauntly reciteth done letmerice promiseth assemblie xviii day april warneth meane time attempt nothing neither assemble together wyse fourth day thus wrytten league bohemers thei make league maintein libertie marque albert come saxony duke maurice assigned lie towne rochlice reuenues wherof lantgraues syster wydowe daughter lawe duke george knowen iohn fridericke prince electour aldenburge three myles kalendes marche sendeth ernest duke luneburge uolrate erle mansdfelde certen guydos horsmen recrode legion foteme night selfe rest armie followeth next morning day lyght horseman sent escoute set vpon watche toke rest fled town suburbes foure enseignes fotemen accompanied certen horseman winig roclice going forth sone day appered giue ye charge hauing repulse retourne back suburbes whan electour come rereward shot ordenaunce town next hill foteme also entring perforce fyred suburbes forsaid enseignes fotemen flye awaye brydge horseman also riuer mulda wherfore fotemen already possessed suburbes go assault towne lusty courage wynne spoyle taketh ordenaunce ye ennemy whylest thing thus working marque marque albert take prisoner albert seketh whiche way might escape taketh ryner intercepted ye duke luneburg brought prince electour garrison within town six enseignes fotemen putting selues ringe ye helpe horsmen stand defence vanquished multitude taken striped armure wha made promyse serue duke saxon fellowes six monethes let go without rausom horseman poursuing iiii enseignes footemen escaped ouer bridge slea great numbre part italian spaniard marque albert kyng ferdinando emperour good thousand fiue hundred horseme ten enseignes foot men xiiii field piece thei fought breake day tyll none duke saxon lost many men amonges wuolfie theodorick man noble courage beyng stryken gunne lefte lyfe fewe dayes nombre slaine within town accompted thousand without town ryuer thre hondreth conflict electour albert prisoner retourneth aldenburg signifieth whole matter boheme sheweth wil nothing league desireth haue punished attempted subiectes sword fyre duke wirtemberg condicioned sone might sickenes come make submission emperour commeth therfore ulme moneth marche han duke wirtemtemberg craueth pardon emp yet recouered sitting saddel emperours permission asmuche could remoue bowe self cousellors kneling desireth pardoned fault promising henceforth aldew obediece whan themperour hereunto made gentle aunswere departeth immediatly war saxo goeth norling whilest duke wirtemberg wise made submission great resort concourse people hauing therof knowledge came thither flocking thicke threfolde thre forsaid place land wirtemberg emperour placed garrison good part spaniardes nyntenth booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument nyntenth booke father trent make seuenth session emperour hauing accorded strasburg marcheth forth armie fraunces frenche kyng dyeth shortly kyng england counsell trent diuided duke saxo taken battell notwithstanding condemnation death remayneth constant religion wittemberge rendred vniuersitie destroyed suite made agrement lantgraue coming emperour stayed prysoner kyng ferdinando appeaseth prage commotion naples reason spanish inquisition coronation frenche kyng described citie maidenburg outlawed assemblee holden auspurg peter aloesse pope sonne murthered duke somerset wynneth great battell scottes whan prince protestauntes vanquyshed city made afrayd stryfe aryseth imprysonyng lantgraue request made father retourne trent pope suche gone boloigne le grasse stode styf opinion muche great disordre counsell trent third day marche seuenth seueth session trent ye sacramets session father trent condepned al suche either say fewer sacramentes church tha seuen al christes institution deny one dignitie say externall signes grace rightuousnes receiued christe faith deny grace geuen receiuinge say baptisme confirmation order imprinted soule spirituall token marke neuer scraped ye al men haue lyke authoritie minister accustomed ceremony churche administration may omitted altered whiche say doctrine churche rome mother maistres al others concerning baptisme sincere whiche saye uowes made baptisme importauce rather derogation faith haue professed say confirmation idle ceremony tymes past nothing el instruction youth deny vertue instinction holye ghost present confirmation ascribe cofirmyng child byshops take fuction priest decree made ecclesiasticall benefice byshops prelate church ecclesiasticall benefice lawfully begotten yeares maners learning sufficient man estate degree soeuer enioy byshoprickes one possesse many may kepe styll whiche liste within one yeares space shall put away rest suche haue cure charge soules selues resident neyther let substitute others place vnlesse tyme haue declared cause absence byshop hath allowed whose part shalbe forsee people neglected priestes offence punished vice reigne amonges straitly corrected xxi day aprill assigned next assemblie whan king ferdinando come duke maurice dresda eight day marche writeth bohemers howe iohn friderick prefixed inuade therfore let take hede matter obeye weittemulle whome hath appointed deputie absence ambassadours strasburg whiche sayde went strasburg compounde themperour ulme returning home senate mislyke condition prescribed emperour sent agayn coclude throughly traueling fynde emperour norlyng liyng sicke gowte xxi day marche making submission thei reconciled condition tollerable neyther emperour charged garrison content xxx thousand crownes demaunded aboue xii piece ordenaunce prince electour brandenburg ernest suter lantgraue also preferred matter kyng ferdinando condition moste vnreasonable allowe without exception al condition offered lantgraue decree empyre enacted hereafter shuld geue one sonnes pledge release duke brunswicke henry sonne stande emperours arbitrement ayde hym electour saxonie fellowes certen centaynes horseman eight enseignes fotemen propre costes charge space syx monethes submitte hym selfe emperour cofesse faultes openly condition refused vnlesse mitigated muche honour assente vnto signifieth letter frendes rather wyll abyde fortune soeuer happen themperour daye accorded strasburg departed norlinge towardes nurrinberg next day adressing letter state duke maurice much saith iohn friderick outlaw retourning home flight hath recouered place whiche maurice prince electour toke commaundement sutch also brother ferdinando seased party vnder tuition boheme entred verely vpon iourney represse boldnes rebellion wherfore first foresee suche place wherby shal passe armie want nothing necessary souldiours wel vsed moreouer contemning others comaundementes perfourme vnto prince al loue due obedience dede haue done hetherto euen intent haue taken warre hande fiersenes oppressed peace quietnes may recouered daye also wryteth counsellours gouernours prage prefixed auenged vpon iohn fridericke according vnto demerites let prouide therfore campe may vitayled countrey xxiiii marche noble city boheme whiche lately made league whan assembled prage determined make warlike lawes suche requisite warres nede requyre committe chief gouernment caspar phulgius tyme king ferdinando duke maurice brother augustus came caspar phlugius captaine bohemers armie force priccie whiche bohemers toke displeasure thei entred already vpon frontier wherfore requyre ferdinando letter woulde suffer straunge nation inuade countrey example straunge perillous wryte moreouer duke maurice brother augustus departe immediatly limites without hurt doyng otherwyse wyll doe counsell shall serue wherunto ferdinando aunswereth xxvi daye marche howe shall nede feare come party intent might ioyne selues emperour nowe approching againe wryteth prage bestowe superfluous coste duke saxon retyred electour sent land boheme ambassadour nicolas minquit renew auncient league falling sicke way whan duke saxo sendeth ambassadour boheme able go prage wryting letter desyred sende credit may treate coclude whan letter receiued noble men boheme wryte duke saxon prage xxviii daye marche signifieng minquit required howe desyrous gratifie herein graunt reason would howe beit impeched reason troublesome tyme present disquietnes duke maurice brother come force boheme intending doe mischief procurement kyng ferdinando praying take though would league renewed wyll kepe perseuer olde amitie well already renewed wyll also doe indeuour shalbe confirmed sone may therfore power lenied force prepared refuse breake league moue war hym require therfore yt case duke maurice procede wyl vouchsaufe ayde shal daunger great wyl refuse venter vpon preseruation saye ferdinando nowe priccie thence wyll marche armie uale ioachime reported ar purposed fewe day marche armie leade thether nede shall require last day marche sauing one wryte ye lordes morauie exhorting according mutuall league bohemers letter morsuians would take armure come spede intent common countrey may defended wicked sodomiticall kynde men spaniardes hussar buggerers emperour kyng ferdinado bring fraunces frenche kyng whan reigned xxxii yeares ended lyfe last daye marche rambolet death frech kyng whiche dayes iourney paris whome sonne henry succeded man xxviii yeares age immediatly sendeth costable anna momorancie space sixe yeares liued priuate life fauour restored former dignitie great estimatio againe chiefest authoritie partly grow fauour partly displaced committed prison alteratio court fraunce cardinall tournon anebalde admiral grinian gouernour frenche prouince duke longeuale bayarde poline especially whiche bene kinges darling madame destampes death kinge fraunces chaunced vnfortunately studentes learned king frau ce fauiour learning loued liberal science man better shewed liberalitie auaunce long vse custome gotten muche knowledge dining supping talke commonly learning moste earnestly vsing many yeares ye purpose iames coline learned knowledge man vulgare tonge moste eloquent peter castellan two learned whatsoeuer wrytten bokes poetes historiographer cosmographer moreouer knew perfitly whatsoeuer aristotel theophraste plinie suche like haue wrytten nature plantes herbes beastes metalles precious stone dayly vse hearing remember wont also deuise muche mathematical science reason oft scripture table stoode alwayes notable men eche degree muche talke inferred sondry argumets harde one would alwayes propounde matter might euery man lawfully case thing knowen example also desire kyng excited men vnto great diligece might reasoning deserue prayse owne tongue always accompted right eloquet graue throughout grece italy notable library kyng frau ce sought copied workes olde writer made goodly librarie whiche yelded certen notable bookes afterwardes keper wherof castellan alitle death sent duke saxon lantgraue mayntenaunce war eyther hondreth thousand crownes tyme departed ye mony scarsely deliuered tyme also ambassadours protestauntes retourne england fraunce myght finishe vp rest matter lyke found kyng henry whan fyrst arriued retourning thence fynde king frau ce extremely sicke wherfore happened also reste emperours good fortune two moste mightie kynges neither wanted oportunitie many men supposed wyll also impeche hynder enterpryses died maner one tyme force emperours whiche oppressed certen noble men death two kinges happy emperour taken citie mynden sayde went marching breme ende moneth ouerthrowe lost chief captaine warre grunninge gouernour selande whan power bremers increased accesse hamborough men urisberger ouerthrowe emper armie death grunning chief gouernment remouing campe fetching long circuite fennes lay way began beseige citie syde thither came shortly also ericus duke brunswyck emperour ides marche sent away norlinge intent leuie newe power horseman fotemen leade party emperour remouing norling norinberge went thence egre towne king ferdinados border boheme king sondry time admonished citie prage weapon residue state therof aduertised fourth day aprill wryte againe cause haue put armure led forth armie defende countrie vniust violence especially absece pray intreate themperour war duke saxo suffer case may frendly debated desire also haue parlament promise time emperour coming egre vi day april whan ferdinano maurice come yt day writeth state boheme empe letter state boheme repeting briefly writte moneth sheweth seketh duke saxon wherfore let bring forth vitayle furnishe corne retourne home concerning religio nede feare war hath molested religio tyme commissioner prage dispatching letter partes warne state moste earnestly would put armure come haste possible desend countrey matter brought extreme daunger ferdinando eleuenth aprill aunswereth ferdinando bohemers last letter egre lyke effecte maner emperour therfore let leaue enterprise el wil fynde meanes represse rashenes wel enough intreate duke saxon lyttle maruell hath deserued neither emperour yet lande boheme touching request parliament wyll doe herein shall become hym meane tyme duke saxon taketh duke maurice fridberge misen towne ryuer albis tyme father trente remoue part counsell trent flitt banonie bolonia la grace neither session wherein treated sacramentes made decree al cause departure sayde ayre place greatly holsome opinion hierosme fracastor phisition father counsell byshop rome therfore threscore duckates moneth emperour toke matter moste displeasauntly commaunded byshoppes diuines hys dominion remoue thence one fote wherupon parte counsell trente parte bononie tyme emperour marched norlinge norinberge erle bure whiche kept frankefurte twelue enseignes fotemen foure hondreth horseman sent came thither whan come agayne franckefurt xii daye aprill putteth two two executed frankefurte death wherof one iohn uerden towne william gelluse subiect lantgraues cause execution sayde sent lantgraue bye smyth keyes one gate set town fyre foure sondrye place dryue iron nayles canon great piece might shot whylest others quenching fyres helpe fellowes slaye erle bure familie consull senate infecte welles town poyso especially serued erles kitchin whiche court came forth wrytting pourporting howe confessed pryson cospiracie perseuered wha led execution lantgraue pourgeth hym selfe lantgraues purga affirmeth synce tyme franckefurt came emperours handes hath attempted nothing co futeth crime obiected many weighty wordes sondry time dede comaunded geluse vnderstad way themperour counte bure marched armie thing case thei vaquished sharpnes torture extremitie ye payn haue spoken unreasonable torment isaperillous matter yt false haue iniuried others also desireth wrasted disdayne hatred racking torture exceadeth meane vncerten perillous probation wherof nominated fellowes conspiracie whan place execution declared innocetes xiii day april comissioners prage wryte againe state realme warne ernestly cleaue vnto league haue house saxon complayne also diuerse haue infringed ye already wherfore thei commaunde henceforth man offende daye sende letter king ferdinando beseching neither themperour wold offeded warfare moreouer war electour saxony first mutual league secondly desireth matter might come hearing selfe day ferdinando sendeth iohn byshop olmuce certen counsellours parliament ferdinados ambassad bohemers prage whiche assigned xviii aprill maketh excuse come againe requireth abolishe newe league laye part armure weapon otherwyse counsell holden free denied tha ambassadours comau dement shuld treate obey procede prescribed determine thyng referre al themperour daye departeth egre whole armie accompanied empe iourney duke saxon brother ferdinando men armes syxe hondreth hussares thousand ten enseignes fote men also two brethre maurice august like force whan marched continually ten dayes together length xxii day april commeth nere vnto misen duke saxon hauing intelligence therof forsaketh towne whan fyred bridge pitcheth tentes nere mulberge riuer albis emperour fearing lest haue retired wittemberge strongest chiefest town dukedom sawe nede make haste commaunding therfore armye marche forewarde whan reposed selues one daye xxiiii day apryl come water mornyng tymes duke saxon placed certen contrary banke field piece let emperour neither make brydge finde foorde transport armie also might defende brydge whiche selues ready made boates small vessel time thei sawe emperour come whole army force spaniardes nomber thousand rushed water great violence vp chynne holding armes aboue water shot fiersly piece caste fyre bootes partly burnt therewith litle litle shrinke away banke towardes myddle streame certe spaniardes threwe selues ye riuer naked carieng swordes ouerth warte mouthes thus swymming ouer moste syde lay holde bootes caried downe streame saxon broken rest bridge although shot many piece wounded sore yet bryng away vessel suche others themperour brought hym cariage made bridge ouer riuer fotemen cariage might passe tourmoile thinges ye duke saxon time hearing sermon sendinge cariage followeth self marcheth toward wittemberg themperour sawe ye whole matter rested spede finding foorde first comauded hussar emperours celeritie ouerta king yt du light horseman passe ouer goeth hym selfe also horsmen complete armure tariyng nothing al neither carriage foteme hasteth stil thre mile beyond yt riuer albis ye wode lochan ouertaketh prince electour encouraged men exhortacio vnto battel giueth yt charge army deuided two partes yt forwarde duke alba lanoie anthony toletane baptiste spinelle duke maurice rerewarde led themperour king ferdinando two sonnes duke sauoye sonne duke saxo might wel haue resisted force perchaunce haue discofited case empe fighteth battell duke saxon whole armie together great parte hys force wittemberge strong garrison left euery place william thumserne power absent neither could al rest put ordre great expedition themperour wherfore legth vanquished wt greater nomber multitude whan fought till night selfe receiuing wound left cheke defendyng self mafully taken brought first ye duke alba duke taken fighting presented theperour whose sight wha come yelde self prisoner saith merciful emperour desiring may kept vsed lyke prince thy emperour sayeth shall handle thee thou hast deserued ferdinando toke hym vp sharper wordes chargeth sought dispossesse hym chyldren euer hym taken also ernest brunswick duke philippe sonne electours eldest sonne although sore wouded yet escaped came wittemberge prysoners nomber great escaped flight nomber foure hondreth recouered wittenberg refuge amonges whome counte bichling recrode horsme following chace make great spoyle take munition cariage duke sent duke alba comit ye duke saxon duke ernest brunswitck custody alphonse uines time emperour came nere vnto misen xxii april agayne next daye day passed riuer fought battell certen day sunne loked pale dimme inuironed certen darkenes perdigieof sunne sight sorrouful greuous beholde muche whiche great way saxonie knewe nothing matter iudged pourtende signifie great trouble obserued germany also fraunce england dede many thousandes testifie ferdinando ambassadours sent ye conuentio prage haue spoke peres realme hearing demaundes make answer haue made league put armure neither done amisse ye custome boheme determine send ambassade king ferdinado might declare yt also require intreate themperour duke saxon tofore thambassadours sent came newes fro king ferdinado themperours victory duke taken chaunging purpose promise corne vitayle desire king make meanes themperour al armie may led hongary turcke whose comming report went daily kinges also might moued vnto yt societie war thing may brought passe thei wil behind wt partes whan yt duke saxon taken themperour marcheth witteberg came thether armie iiii day may duke condempned lose head thre day condemneth iohn friderick lose head saith treason whan heard therof shewed signe token minde discouraged aunswered thought emperour would haue dealte neuerthelesse prefixed determined desireth haue certen knowledge intent maye take order matter concerning wyfe child prince electour brandenburg heard battell taketh iourney immediatly comming cape sixt day may doth mitigate emperours mynde altering sentence saued duke lyfe wherfore emperour propoundeth condition duke confirmed xviii daye may redemed life amonges others wrytten also euer condition wherby duke redemed life counsell emperour decree concerning religion approue would wyse assente perseuered herein respected daunger emperour commaunded part crossed blotted rest condition renounce dignitie electourship selfe chyldren permitte emperour dispose pleasure deliuereth vp emperour wittemberge gothe second fortresse dominion yet may take way stuffe prouision sauing munition third part vytayle emperour permitteth soldiours garrison departe yet without enseignes duke saxon frely releaseth marque albert without rau restoreth thinges taken emperour againe setteth libertie duke ernest brunswick taking first promesse fidelitie duke saxon restoreth suche thinges warre tyme haue bene taken away erles masfielde marque prusse solmen renouceth title maydenburg halberstate halle promyseth obey iudgement chamber imperiall whan shalbe established themperour geue towarde charge therof assenteth duke hery brunswick sonne shalbe deliuered neither wyll commence action forsaketh league made emperour king ferdinando neither wyll make fro henceforth wherin prouinces fellowes shal comprised emperour doth confiscate landes geueth brother ferdinando duke maurice yet duke maurice shall paye yearely hym child fifty thousande crownes emperour thinke good duke saxo promission maurice shal kepe still town castel gothe al profite howbeit shal rase castell fortifie towne muche duke saxon greatly indebted intent debtes may payed whiche dew league smalcalde duke maurice shall geue child subsidie hondreth thousand crownes moreouer shall paye suche debtes depende vpon landes confiscated geuen emperour meane shall suite controuersies betwixt haue finall ende duke shall attempte nothing haue serued emperour warres yet kyng denmarke shall obserue lawes statute emperour state empyre shall decree muche released execution bodely punishement shall remaine henceforth custody themperour sonne prince spayne goodes mentioned child shall vse enioye people also ratifie condition peace peace exempted albert erle mansfield child counte bichlinge ringraue recrode thumserne neuerthelesse shall discharge armie within moneth shalbe therin comprehended thinges conditioned emperour campe wittemberge syxte daye may summoneth assemble thempyre ulmes state empyre mete ulme ides iune intent make league sendeth thether ambassadours cardinall auspurg marque iohn brandenburg lirane henry hasie doeth kyng ferdinando unto whiche commissioner prage kyng ferdinandos letter bohemers lately sayd concerning league made though newe thyng custome countrey ferdinando aunswereth campe w emberge ides may plainly new straunge enterpryse whiche appertaineth vtterly iniury moreouer declareth haue attempted absence many wayes haue rebelled sondry reason goeth proue league made emperour wherfore chargeth commaundeth abolyshe defeate restore vnto euery man seale againe deliuer copie league ambassadours unlesse obeye accordingly wyl doe counsell shall serue albeit emperour accorded duke saxon said yet garrison kept wittemberge nombre thre thousand soldiours citezens also refused rendre except prince selfe commaunde townes men feared chiefly oultrage souldiours whan might see maner towne walles hurte countrey especially spaniardes hongarians duke saxon therfore xxi day may whan brother hys sonne certen counsellours came towne hym doeth release othe warres commaundeth departe thence thre day ended whan commaundement geuen townes men make request emperour would bryng foreine soldiours witteberge rendred made promesse kept gaue moreouer authoritie kepe suche shuld prease enter without expresse commaundement whan surrendred ye duchesse saxon sibille cleaue going forth sonne husbandes brother cometh campe making supplication moste humblie besecheth themperour plentifull teares good duke husbande emperour enterteined ryght curteously put good comfort licenseth duke go citie remayne eight dayes wyfe child daye souldiours issued wittemberge duke saxon commaundement whiche xxiii day may emperour sent almaigne foteme leading nicolas madruce two dayes king ferdinando two sonnes came towne accopanied electour brandenburg duke maurice see making long abode retourneth campe none also emperour hym selfe entreth whan come castel saluteth duchesse comforting wylleth good chere shewed death fraunces frenche buriall kyng fraunces kyng xxiiii day may buried churche saint denis consecrated buriall kynges two sonnes fraunces charles wherof one departed xi yeares past two yeares since sayd remayned vnburied hitherto meane season funerall preparing kyng fraunces picture certen space appareled riche array hys crowne scepter ornamentes layde vpon bed wherunto certen howres dynner supper serued lyke solemnitie accustomed lyue garmentes taken away mourning apparell put continually present xlviii monkes suche commonly caled begging freers sange mass diriges hym without ceasing dead corp set xiiii great taper ouer stoode two aultars wherupon first day light tyll noone sayde masse continually also chapel iust wherin burning innumerable taper lightes chariot wherin coarse caried went xxiiii freers many taper went fiue hondreth poore men mourning apparell euery man torche besydes noble fraunce present xi cardinalles funerall sermon made peter castellane byshop macon whome mentioned amonges thynges declareth howe king prefixed buylde college wherin artes tongue haue bene red taught sixe hondreth shuld haue bene founde learning vse assigned fiftie thousand crownes yearely shewed duke ericke brunswick went breme howbeit xxii day may departeth siege defend owne coutrey spoyling urisberger whiche led part armie first agreed vpon place mete againe power duke chaunceth vpo ennemies duke erick discomfited force hamburge came ayde bremers fought sore till within night fine duke erich discomfited driuen backe horseman ye riuer uisurge lost many men neuerthelesse selfe escaped lost munitio comming emperour layde faulte urisberger came helpe bremers fellowes counte albert mansfelde erle hedecke thumserne conrade phenninge diuers others duke saxon codicioned emperour al force slipped away whilest thinges electour brandenburg duke maurice intreate diligently lantgraue intent thing might conueniently duke maurice electour brandenb intreate lantgraue accoplished sende lipsia emperour would wyse submit selfe without condicion deliuer castels munition also retourneth home without concluding thing day cometh weissefelse foure mile lipsia next day waye ryding talked christopher eblebe condicions propounded fortune estate knew sayth emperour might intreated suffer retourne home againe let haue one castels furnished ordenaunce could content common quiet rase reste deliuer munition accordingly sayeth eblebe wyll reporte tale vnto duke maurice within fewe dayes wyll eyther repare vnto agayne aduertise certetie hereof letter meane season desire surcease deuises going therfore vnto duke maurice long retourneth letter hym fro duke maurice electour brandenburge bearyng duke maurice letter lantgraue date fourth day iune campe wittemberge whiche importaunce sone vnderstode mynde eblebe became agayne peticioners emperour haue obteyned doth copie selfe condition peace whiche eblebe bryngeth declare muche condition tollerable doubte wyll admitte especially considering great dauger standeth aduise therfore refuse submitte hym selfe emperour without condition nedeth feare lest emperour shuld burthe great thinges deteine prysoner wyll become suertie matter thing chauce vnto besydes whiche conteined copie peace shall receiue eblebe deteyned styll captiuitie wyll refuse abyde fortune called vpon child wyl offer selues make recompece religion shall haue assuraunce yt marque iohn haue already seing muche composition shalbe hym selfe also common wealth expedient hartely require hym would come withall expedition bryng duke brunswick sonne receiue co ditions followe assuraunce fidelitie herein let afrayd prysoners taken way beare daunger whan shall entred way shall mete horseman shall conduite saufetie copie peace submitte self prouince emperour without condition come emperour selfe humbly require pardoned behaue self emperour henceforth obediently according dutie obserue suche decree emperour shall make preseruation common wealth sende ayde turke suche tymes prince forsake confederacy namely league smalcalde deliuer emperour suche kynde wrytinges make league tyme wherin shall comprysed emperour king ferdinando forbid emperours ennemies come within dominion emperour lyke punishe man shall take vppon hym defende shall geue emperour leaue passe hys countrey whan thing shall require subiectes shall serue warres againste emperour kyng ferdinando punyshe extremely suche serue present calle home againe xiiii day forsake enseignes vnles obey make forfeate goodes whiche shall come emperours vse charge warre shall pay emperour within foure monethes hodreth fifty thousand crownes suche castelles fortes hath saue zegenheme cassell shall rase grounde garisons captaynes yt shall place shall sweare true themperour hereafter fortifie piece consent emperour deliuer emperour immediatly munition gunnes whole furniture whiche emperour shall graunt many shalbe sufficient defence place whiche wyll permit kepe obey iudgemet chamber emmperour shall establyshe beare part towades charge set libertie hery duke brunswick sonne reder vnto prouince release subiectes othe compounde harmes done restore suche thinges hath take marque pruse fro others force attempte nothing king denmarke others either ayded toke emperours part shal deliuer prysoners serued vnder emperour without raunsome shall aunswer men wyll trie matter lawe condition shall sonnes also confirme shall nobilitie subiectes lykewyse shall obserue conuenauntes shall apprehende delyuer emperour thinges electour bradenburg duke maurice woulfange paulsgraue sonnes lawe become suerties except accomplishe premiss lantgraues son lawe promesse bende ioyne force whan receiued perused thinges common aduise consent state lantgraue admitteth yet desyred declaration diuerse pointes sixte day iune whan emperour remoue campe calleth souldiours witteberge immediatly duke maurice putteth daye calling consulles senate castel saith demishe parte priuileges liberty causeth sworne wittemberge principall towne electourship whiche emperour lately geuen maurice confiscating iohn friderickes witteberge town electorship landes said townesmen nobilitie desire duke maurice would repare scoole whiche fallen tumulte war promiseth commaundeth countrey men scoole fallen whiche fled sent againe promiseth stuffe building wheate seede bread corne poore frely lende vnto rest putteth iulius perflugius possession byshoprike numburge displaceth nicholas amstorfe instituted duke iohn fridericke mentioned xiiii boke moreouer lazarus schendie sent force men rase castel gothe also deliuer marque albert captiuitie laste wynter archebyshop maydenburge made composition duke iohn friderick geuen place prouince chaunge fortune emperour also clergie toke euill parte coadiutour assigned fridericke sonne prince electour brandenburg kyng ferdinando retourning campe wittemberge lande boheme stayed whyle letmerice frontier town thence beginning iune wrote letter al state boheme wherin complaineth league saying made wherfore commasideth forsake thing euery man wryte vnto seuerally mynde therin knoweth many haue falle lacke experiece mynded pardon moleste man suche haue comitted high treason princelyke maiestie whan state come ulme emperours ambassadours named recite long circustaunce greatly treatis ulmes emperour king ferdinando haue traueled peace germany aswel publique also priuate affayr ye duke saxon latgraue hauing respect haue rebelled selues also procured others like breaking al lawe equitie haue tourmoiled al thinges germany therfore hath theperour bene driuen reason office dignitie attemp warre without great dauger life losse goodes harmes rebelles outlawes haue done lordship mentz maydenburg halberstat eistet auspurg fulden stolberg mansfeld citie gemund warre wel knowen asmuche themperour seketh meanes germany might haue quietnes thinketh verye requisite league made cocerning peace therof mynde also king ferdinando come cofederacie thintent present tumulte shall hereafter aryse maye lightly repressed euen commoditie comon cou trey omitte diligence loke againe lyke cosultation interrupted vehement plage wherfore length remoue auspurge themperour prefixed holde great assemblie shalbe declared hereafter whan themperour taken order thinges wittemberge remoueth hale saxony towne riuer sale go thence hesse vnlesse lantgraue compound wherfore lantgraue standing perplexitie whan sawe better remedy trusting assurauce duke maurice marque brandeburg taketh iourney xviii daye iune cometh hale euening ryding middes betwene duke maurice electour brande burge lantgraue commeth emperour hale whiche went mete hym numburge one houre came thether also duke henry brunswick ben prysoner sonne charles uictor second sonne philippe duke erricke brunswick ouerthrowen battell came thether sayde next day mornyng christopher carlebice comming lantgraue exhibiteth composition peace subscribe added emperour myght interprete euery article therof wherfore lantgraue asmuch yt copy thelectour bradenburg duke maurice sent sheweth byshop arras might subscribe therunto saith omitted negligence wryter vrgeth thesame folowed mynd tha doth bishop arras require yt asmuch wil haue assurauce religion duke maurice thelectour bradenburg ar assured warraut promise theperour yt wil obey ye decree yt cousel trent contrariwyse saith neuer thing mentioned coteined yt coposition peace rather want themperours warraut also shuld nede make assurauce wha log cotended threatnings also geue themperour already set hal taried tooke delay displeasauntly therfore let make spede lest peraduenture coceaue extreme displeasur ye last latgraue subscribeth wordes wold obey decree fre godly general cousel wherin shuld aswel reformed yt head rest mebers like case duke maurice marque brandenburg shuld thei promised shrinke one whit fro doctrine professed auspurg done v clock none whan themperour set vnder cloth estate home lodging two electours beforesaid bring latgraue wha came nere vnto themperour falleth vpo knee next chaucelour guntherode reciting writing followeth lantgraue kneleth emperour asmuch sayth moste mighty emperour lantgraue fourmer war hath sore offended highnes haue iust cause auenged hartely sory therfore promised submitteth self wil pleasure also moste humbly besecheth great clemecy pardo fault redresse outlawery dew offence restore old place receiue al thinges faithful protectio wil accept stead gret benefitie wil declare vnto fro henceforth al fidelitie seruice dew obedience perour paused taken deliberatio answereth unto george selde albeit hath deserued moste greuous punyshement openly knowen emperours aunswere hym selfe also confesseth yet contente owne benignitie asmuche certen prince haue intreated shall escape outlawerie punishmet hath deserued nether suffer perpetual imprisonment indaugered furthermore composition peace prescribed pardoneth also nobilitie subiects kepe conuenautes wil acknowledge henceforth great benefite present submission maximilian austriche philibert prince piedmount duke alba marque prusse byshops arras numburge hildesseme duke brunswicke henry ericke charles philippe ambassadours rome boheme denmarke cleaue certen hauon townes besydes many others nobilitie lantgraue whiche thought bene saufe well geueth emperour thakes suffered hym lantgraue driuen net vnwittingly knele long arrose vnbidden litle whyle marque brandenburg cometh sheweth duke maurice must suppe duke alba lodging yet could ye latgraue perceiue nothing wha thei came duke alba thei suppe supper duke maurice marque fall talke duke alba byshop arras meane passe away time lantgraue playeth cardes whan nowe far night duke maurice marque brandenburg call vnto aside mouth eustace schlebie declare vnto haue al life time dealt faithfully becometh prince doe haue promised thing haue perfourmed diligetly lobed also haue founde like fidelitie others duke alba byshop arras tel ye muste remayne night prisoner greatest grief lantgraues captiuitie euer chaunced howbeit speake ye emperour selfe truste shall deteined sayed loked thing soner tha haue happened howe came thether trusting vppon assurance knowe wel enough howe bounde chyldren wherfore let discharge bonde promesse whan must nedes tary duke maurice diuerse marque cousellours abode al night next day go themperour make greuous complaint shewe howe much concerneth estimation case conceiued least suspition world matter neither would haue counselled haue gone thether neither woulde euer haue come shoulde haue lost libertie wherfore require haue consideration intercessours let hym goe libertie whiche thyng haue promysed hym vpon fidelity emperour sayeth dede made promesse restore againe vnto libertie immediatly meaning herein kept per petual prison went counsellours chiefly byshop arras long sharpe contentio shewe lantgraue may departe ryght gladly saith may conducted home safely two prince intreate agayne saufe conduite al vain two dayes shewed must wayte vpo emperour forth vtterly refused doe sayeth wyll go one fote vnlesse drawen forth violence duke maurice marque intreate exceadingly beseching wold refuse go perswade take righthad presence diuerse noble men make promesse yt wyl departe emperours courte deliuered ryding forth numburg go emperour make suite thre dayes whiche xxv iune sende vnto carlebice followe themperour desire take displeasauntly hath vtterly forbidde yt thei shuld thei wil send spain neuerthelesse c fifty crownes payd make assuraunce performe rest couenautes thei perceiue much shuld deliuered within fourtenight thei wil shortly ryde thassemblie auspurg wil omit ernest paine diligent suite hym toke chaunce vnpatietly saith yt paiment mony rasing castels wil deuise care trusteth loke thei promise shalbe performed warde passing border thuring wt spaiardes wha came greuetalle sheweth duke alba ye letter saufecoduit assurauce obligatio saith perour grauted nothing ye intercessours perpetual imprisonmet tha saith ye lantgraue measure ende may captiuitie haue wtin time shal expired although saith detein prisoner xiiii yeres loger yet shal theperour nothing promise ye intet might soner recouer libertie log paieth al monie defaceth castelles deliuereth ordenauce nomber battering piece emperour gate partely duke saxon partely nober great gun re take fro protst duke wirtemberge city vpper germany great reported nomber fiue hondreth wherof sent afterwarde diuerse millan naples spaine residue bestowed sondry place lowe countreis belongyng house burgudy monumentes token victory lantgraues captiuitie ebleb noble gentlema messenger betwixt toke moste heuely many men iudge thoughte ebleb dieth sorowe sorowe died shortly emperour intended warre vpon citie magdeburg riuer albis two dayes iourney benethe wittemberge maner compounde agree time henry frenche kyng toke vp men germany sebastian uogelsberge ten enseignes fotemen matter emperour suspecte wherfore cause thought also supposed thei might repressed meane departing hale toke iourney hygher partes germany xxvii day iune sedeth marque marignaue aide brother ferdinando eight enseignes almaigne fotemen tyme ferdinando letmerice attending oportunitie tyme worke purpose hearing themperours successe taking ye lantgraue ye kaledes iuly wryting letter prage comaundeth castell prage sixt day iuly make answer came thither force declareth open consistory ferdinando cometh army prage whole doynges past howe many wayes haue trespassed saieth howe haue comitted offence treason commaundeth answere vnto euery pointe humble wyse submit selues pleasure desire trie matter neither lawe otherwyse wherupo king whan ferdinado sonne august brother duke maurice certen others suters x daie iuly propoundeth coditions next assemblie shal vtterly abolishe ye league made pluck euery ma seale deliuer vnto al charter writing bohemers subdued ferd fredom priuileges thintet may correct shal like graunt vnto confirme deliuer also al ye writinges cocerning fraternity fellowship yt diuerse haue ministred occasio trou moreouer deliuer vp castelles fortress iurisdictions customes againe wrytinges ye league haue made others also iohn fridericke excise bere promysed thre yeares payed henceforth continually bryng munition warlike furniture castell priuate armure towne house shall thus doe sayeth wil spare multitude except diuerse whiche wyl reserue vnto punishement haue deserued deteyne prysoners commoditie common wealth whan matter reported common released fifty prysoners cocluded certen nobilitie beyng sent appere daye prescribed sentence pronounced lose life goodes certen city noble men followyng example prage submitte selues without condition caspar pfluge whome confederate said made generall condempned treason proclamation made could bring quick dead shuld haue fiue thousand crownes rewarde next conuention whan disanulled league broke seales obteined maner demauded whilest emperour triumpheth germany ther arose sedition naples yt spanish inquisition sore seditio naples cause wherof peter toletane uiceroye would spanish maner inquire euery man faith religion citezens toke vnpaciently whiche lothed spanyardes gouernmet also muche slaughter partes within cytie spanyardes length preuailed reason kept fortes castell wherfore put death residue banyshed spanishe inquisition whiche vniuersall day first ordeined party king ferdinando quene elizabeth iewes whiche baptisme kept still lawes ceremony nowe since name luther published broade practised men generall neuer little suspected sharply sodainly selfe dayes seuen cardinalles fraunce cardinal frau ce sene rome kynges commaundement go rome commaunded remain till thei receiue aduertisemet thought done intet meanes byshop might wholy inclined kynges frendship fortune dye already foure score yeare olde myght chosen fauoured kyng fraunce howbeit saide wrought thorowe policie conestable get way might rule king alone maner wold kinges heles whethersoeuer went byshop litle sent legate fraunce hierome romane moste large commission graut many thynges whiche forbidden also lawes decree counsell created also cardinall tyme charles guise sonne duke claudie archebyshop rain knew kyng delighted much ye freche king purchase amitie offreth mariage bastarde doughter ix yeres age orace farnese bishop granchilde sonne emperour remouing hale cometh bamberge nere might greater terrour bohemers strengthe vnto brother whilest third daye iuly calleth assemblie empire comaundeth mete auspurg assemble auspurg first day septembre prince selues persone residue ambassadours full authoritie saieth letted warres helde couention kalendes february last past determined regenspurge hath authours trouble custody would longer differ corrupt member commo wealth may healed consultacio shalbe suche matter haue bene treated vpon wormes yeare synce regenspurge conuention haue bene ulme infectio plage place chaunged also mentioned bamberge goeth norinberge receiueth fauour certen city saxony xvi daye iuly publisheth wryting wherin declareth hath bene done lantgraue vpon condition hath pardoned carefull leste many haply ignoraunce worke violence landes subiectes therfore request doth straightly charge commaunde men absteyne haue matter trie ye lawe self duke maurice intreateth liberally diuines wittemberge tyme duke maurice sendeth melanchthon pomerane cruciger diuines wittemberge receiueth ryght gently lipsia speaking muche zeale towardes religion committeth vnto order church scoole also requiring procede wonted maner appointeth stipendes selues wryte sendeth away without great rewardes pomerane litle boke set forth commendeth highly
