liberalitie gentlenes frenche kyng succeded father kalendys aprill xxv day iuly cometh rain crowned coronation french king maner therof receiued cathedral churche thr cardinalles led hyghe aultar kissed relickes saintes enclosed gold said prayer goeth supper supper retourning making prayer againe whan confessed synnes priest departeth goeth bedde next day sendeth certe nobilitie intreate abbot saint remige would bring boxe holy oyle whiche say came heauen resorte churche called douzeperes fraunce twelue nomber byshop rain landune langres beauuois noion twelue peres fraunce challon kyng nauarre duke uandome guise niuerne mompenser anmalle represented duke burgundie normandie guienne moreouer erles tolouse flaunders champaine byshoppes chosen two langres beauuois also two cardinalles go fetche kyng churche whan came chamber certen prayer sayde lift vp kyng liyng bedde ceremony accompanied multitude priestes leade church conestable beareth sworde drawen king tyme prayed ye aultar led byshoppes seate meane whyle tyl boxe cometh archebyshop rain finished prayer conteyned boke ceremony sprinkleth holy water kyng reste whan worde brought boxe coming whiche absence ye holy box sent heaue may sure abbot prior monkes brought sitting vpon white hambling palfrey accompanied monkes hys order noble king sent sayd archebyshop byshops goeth mete churche dore crosse borne ther receiued boxe deliuering hym gage restore againe whan came agayn aultar king rysing seate doeth reuerence archebyshop goeth reuestrie solemnely decked pontificalibus cometh forth taketh othe fidelitie whiche auncient custome kynges bounde churche king led aultar two byshops putting garmetes kneleth downe girded sworde thei terme hath consecrated many prayer archebyshop prepareth oyle redines whylest priest synge seruice prayeth softly kyng lying grusselyng groud annointeth kinges head breste shoulder elbowes either arme saying accustomed prayer done kyng hath put new garmentes like minister church annointed palmes handes layeth king appa eled like deach handes breste putteth hallowed gloues call archebishop putteth rynge vpon fynger deliuereth sceptre ryght hande selfe moment chauncelour calleth forth douzeperes presence archebyshop taketh fro aultar crown charles great whan peres haue touched setteth kinges head bringeth king roiall throne whiche made higher place whole company noble followyng hauing ended prayer kisseth likewyse peres noble making great shoute acclamation pray god saue kyng reioyce men harte trompettes blowe gold syluer throwen amonges common people goeth archebyshop masse gospell done king carieth ye aultar certen piece gold bread wyne wha masse ended receiueth lordes supper maner go al dyner vse purpose intet nothing disquiet coronation kyng would seme haue hired almaigue foteme conduite uogelsberge afore mentioned meane tyme emperour demaundeth residue state imperiall money charge warres whiche sayeth chiefly attempted sake welth germany moreouer nobilitie suche serue protestantes put fine throughout germany somme money emperour empe e acieth money germany leuied prince city aswell catholikes protestauntes amounteth aboue xvi hondreth thousande crownes appereth accomptes made also perour refused rebelles vtterly denied fauour amonges others doctor george wittemberge albert erle mansfelde iohn hedecke erle lewys counte oeting father sonne punished sort gaue landes clerely sonnes friderick wuolfange whome fidelitie seruice done hym fauoured erle oeting exiled wyfe rest child tourned euer came strasburge wandered vp downe many yeares sondry place vntil alteratio time came emperour forgaue shal spoken hereafter furthermore emperour letter publyshed outlaweth maydenburg also king ferdinando maydeburg outlawed warre attempted countreis doth exact money ye protestauntes especially city fleseth auspurg ulme great money commenceth processe duke wirtemberge whole dukedom though broken fidelitie conuenautes made four mer yeares neither auaile thing lately redemed peace emperour vpon strayte condicions lykewyse cardinall auspurg doth extorte also citie great quantitie gold moreouer cardinall trent asketh money saying howe ayded kinge ferdinando men recouer passage alpes taken sayde scherteline themperour also moueth swiss vnto newe league yet doeth exempte basill zuricke schafuse certen others sayd apperteined emperour moueth swiss league emperour one assent make auswere haue league alredy house auslrich burgundie wherunto cleaue surely confederacie none make loke agayne also end iuly emperour cometh auspurge duke saxon prysoner lantgraue left donauerde garded spaniardes whiche dyd many thynges dayly contempt mockery armed assemblie ga ison citie armed assemble x enseignes sotemen countrey round force sparnyardes italian whome voyde free meming payde thirty thousand kemptem twenty thousand crownes besydes came nether germany syx hondreth horseman whome emperour bestowed coutrie nere vnto citie twelue enseignes spaniardes whan wyntered whyle bibrach led party border lake brigantine wisseburg town norgouie wyntered seuen hondreth horseman naples gerarde uelthuiche went turke sayd xvii boke retourneth emperour xii daye auguste hauing made truce fyue yeares emperour came auspurg taketh head churche certen others self leaueth rest senate people chaplaines wold saye seruice church pourged hallowed church new halowed againe many ceremony suspended polluted lutheranisme emperour appointed preacher cathedral churche michell sidonie suffragan archebyshop mentz amongest thinges made diuerse michel sidonie great masmonger sermon sacrifice masse whiche set forth print church came maner none citezens catholikes reported offered money porer sorte come present seruice assemblie maruelous great prince electours amongest adolphe archebyshop collon duke maurice thither came also kyng ferdina cardinall trent henry duke brunswick duke cleaue lady mary emperours syster niece duchesse lorayne wydowe kaledes september began sytte whan maximilian austriche emperours name made short preface emperours secretary declared wryting thinges decided whiche chiefly two religion might accorded controuersies appeased chamber established lawe ministred wherin requireth geue theyr faithful aduise counsel tenth day moneth peter aloise byshop rome sonne paule thirde slayne placence home house shortly peter alois pope sonne slayne ferdinando gonzage emperous lieftenaunt lumbardie taketh citie newes hereof within fewe dayes came auspurge matter reported emperour story sayd communicated also prince deliuered vnto wryting whole discourse redoundeth infamie disprayse peter aloise thus case standeth wrytyng specifieth whan exchaunge made peter aloise created duke placence parma many thinges cotrary lawe equitie rigour offended sortes men amonges others depriued hierome palauicine hierome palauicine landes possession eschewe daunger fled creme towne belonging state uenise caste wyfe chyldren pryson matter like growe great co motion cardinall trent bare good wyl ye house farnese letter wrytten intreateth matter ye duke aunswered frowardly sonne octauius came trent retourning emperours campe homeward unto whome cardinall declareth whole matter desyring peticioner father promiseth letteth vnderstande hierome may receiued againe fauour wyll come hym selfe humblie require pardon feared leste contrary faith promyse greater mischief wrought cardinall small trayne goeth creme sendeth hierome come speake fearyng treason came knewe assuredly cardinall whan thei talked conferred together cardinall promysed largely trauell cause take iourney together cardinall sent one two company aduertise duke comming doth cotrary octauius signified sende playne worde howe restore albeit messenger sent men graue witty spake many thing mitigate fury yet perseuered styl wherfore ye cardinal whan brought palauicine agayne creme retourneth trent nowe certen nobilitie whiche hated hym also conspired death hiring certen desperate murtherers wayte occasion many tymes seuerally come abroade conspiracie ye pope son garde eche pretende priuate enemy meane season euery demaunde men priuely whether thei wilfaith fully take parte reuenging wrong done vnto sayd duke stewarde promyse seruice also kyll lorde tyme father paule third wryteth vnto take hede selfe tenth daye december starres prognosticate vnto hym great misfortune day byshop much geuen astrologie also negromancie certenly affirmed pope negromancier whan duke receiued father letter feare carefulnes whan day come goeth castell horse litter great company view fortification towne begone conspiratours also whan coulde accomplishe thing desired staye whan retourned home wayte vpon bene duty goe nombre xxxvi whan come horselitter castell plucke vp drawe bridge immediatlye mo shoulde followe approche swordes drawen calling bitterly tyraunt sleye within horselitter murther tyme chaplayne maister horse fiue almaines garde runne vp downe castell spoyle altogether finding great treasure somme mony whiche appointed fortificatio citie meane time great concourse people castel inquiring matter ment heard suche noyse cry within make aunswer aboue haue kylled tyraunt recouered aunciet libertie citie could hardly make beleue thing whan citezens warraunted liues assured pardon hange dead body chaine ouer walle swynged whyle fro let fall ditche people came running iobbed hatred citezens towardes peter dagger spurned fete great mortal hatred bare cosulting matter aduertise ferdinado gozage letter sent post chau ced geue selues wholy theperour tuitio desire haue ayde sent al spede sending thither garrison hast taketh citie sweareth true themperour writeth al thing themperour desiring know pleasure herein parma wer also moued submit theselues vnto themperour sending letter ye byshop rome say wyll stil remaine vnder obeysaunce refuse father slayne doe homage sonne octauius acknowledge prince somme newes reported sent vnto emperour wherof state made partaker others declare matter far otherwyse saye pourposly done fewe howres murther comitted gozage ye gate citie wt garrison affirme nothing soeuer matter al confesse yt peter aloise wicked mischeuous fellow bokes italia recite vngracious detestable lustes amonges whiche one others moste notable wherby saide haue enforced buggered monstrous lustes hym cosmus cherie byshop fanen ayde seruautes helde whiche filthie acte inwardly greued caytif shortly died sorow shame thing suppose gaue poison vtter wretched dede themperour bishop notwithstanding loued sonne derely applied whole study auaunce honour oftentimes heard lewde prankes toke greuously reported wold say learned vice shewed father counsell leauing trent remoued bononie emperour take high displeasure coming auspurge cousell trent two partes caused senate prince wryte byshop herein wherfore xiiii day ianuary sending letter declare perillous state germany whiche saye might haue bene eschewed remedy bene founde disease time wite general counsel themperour hath oftener one ben suter might haue procured ye within precincte germany intent byshops countrey chiefly cocerned might present iurisdictio gret expedient yt shuld especially tyme far charge legth themperours industrie whan man wold come mantua uicece cou sell dede called begonne trent without border germany rather belogeth italy ye cause also germanes came neither could especially time war whan al wayes passage stopped closed vp tempest blowen ouer shippe hauons mouth men brought good hope besides al expectacio counsel shuld thus remoued rather diuided wherin preseruatio co mon wealth consisteth greueth litle ye dauger like ensue therby xxvii yeres hath germany ben tormoyled newe pernicious sectes opinion byshops maner beare authoritie dissolute oultrage cofusion thing innumerable thousandes daunger saluation briefly pestilent euill infected corrupted whatsoeuer clere state thempire plucked sonder obserue frendship amoges selues many great euils refuge apostolicall churche wherfore hartely pray euen wealth germany would restore counsell whiche would nothing myght loke hades ca see whence seke remedy stormes tempestes arrise euery syde whiche repulse god hath ordained holy churche rome certen bulwarke rocke moste strong let haue therfore consideration requestes thinke lesse may except prouide contrary meanes deuises may founde dispatche matter rest pray take thinges good parte duty state tyme compelleth wryte dayes also englyshmen vanquish scottes maigne battell slewe many thousandes muskelborough field conduict duke somerset kinges vncle cause warre lyfe kyng henry witte scottes would geue quene wyfe vnto king edward promise victory englishe nation wan great part scotlande enlarged limites farre concerninge emperours demaundes men one opinion electours clergie vrge counsell trent without conditio ambassadours ye paulsgraue duke maurice marque brandenburg refused sobeit fre godly wherin byshop iudge release byshops othe diuines also might haue licence reason decree already made retracted prince state desirous counsell might continued protestauntes going thether saufeconduict may heard constrained obey decree counsell themperour hearing al mindes xviii day octob answereth desireth al submit selues cou sell treateth paulsgraue duke maurice seuerally shuld geue assent paulsgraue dede put feare vnlesse consented reason protestauntes intised feared late offence yeare sore throughly healed duke maurice coueted yt lantgraue father lawe shuld deliuered also muche auaunced late ye emperour sawe wel must nedes thing wherfore wha themperour messenger set betwixt promised largely good wil towards desired instauntly would committe thing fidelitie last xxiiii day october consente therto rest city whiche sawe daungerous matter submitte selues decree cousell without exception granuellan hasie intreate longe muche meane whyle bruted throughout citie howe franticke wyttes refused thyng whiche prince approued heard moreouer threatnynges scourged worse late fine meane founde emperour satisfied also assured called emperour saye parte correcte aunswers prince delyuer hym wryting wherin testifie vpon condition doe admitte counsell emperour hearynge tale aunswereth seldie howe verey glad ioyfull example others referre matter vnto hym geue co sent reste attribute vnto desyred assente reside auoyde displeasure woulde finde faulte sentence prince yet leste thyng preiudiciall hereafter declared wryting sort lyked counsell tyme come myght remayne testimony myndes ende october tyme came thyther kyng ferdinando also electour brandenburge emperour therfore immediatly beginnyng nouember sent cardinall trente rome poste moue byshop call agayne synode trente moneth nouember christine wyfe lantgraue sonnes certen choise counsellours letter letter ye lantgraue themper wrytten prince state empyre declare meanes taken hale commyng thyther vnder saufe conduite muche condicions ye emperour prescribed could ought perfourmed accomplished monie payd duke brunswick son set libertie al letter confederate exhibited oth ye nobilitie assurasice ye suerties made al munition deliuered fortes rased moreouer much thei ready neither refuse thei pledge theselues vntil time ye rest fulfilled also wout gret grief vexatio mind se miserable case went hale suche case might haue kept castelles honest tyme force ennemy also emperours commissioner whiche sawe thinges afterwarde testife compassion people chose peace war wherfore moste hartely praye intreate emperour behalfe fynde meanes shortly restored libertie may retourne home case longer teined would doubtles vtter decaye health haue better successe sute lantgraues wyfe came selfe auspurg selfe also duke maurice electour brandenburg solliciteth prince sue whiche thing knowen emperour intercession made xxv day noue ber declareth ye state heareth report made empe aunswer state vnto much talke men diuerse wil declare vnto plain truthe matter reciteth beginning ofte whome lantgraue bene sued howe aunswered al shuld yelde submitte without condicion rase castels deliuer munition tolde duke maurice marque brandenburg neither suffer toe condition wherby lantgraue submitted hymselfe bodyly punishement deteined perpetual prison punished goodes composition peace prescribed thing none hope put beare witnesse declareth howe came hale submitted hym selfe vnto hym howe hath bene synce intreated nothyng promesse tale emperour daye state reporte duke maurice marque next daye make suche aunswer neither blame themperour answer du maurice marque greatly herein neither wyll much contende whether fault counsellours matter mistake someuer matter common quiet peace germany perswade latgraue whan suspected nothing imprisonment captiuitie come vnto hale desyre pardon refuse condition peace hath lost libertie kepte prisoner hitherto without ye great peril health much yt honour estimatio euery seeth wel enough therfore require petitioner intreate themperour yt would rather haue consideration haue done faithful seruice empire lantgraues offence suffer runne obloquie sclaunder restore vnto libertie especially synce conditios maner fulfylled emperour put ryght good assuraunce rest thus therfore one voyce assente made intercession lantgraues wyfe intreated lady regent emperours sister meane auailed nothing duke maurice marque brandenburg sayd bound lantgraues sonnes dede obligatorie longe deteined emperour sendeth iohn lirane latgraue norling whether ye spaniardes caried willeth deliuer wrytinges assurasice dedes obligatory saieth custody emperour requireth w itinges lantgraue kept sonnes counsellours albeit shuld write yet vain thei told came away would departe vnlesse first deliuered neuerthelesse might knowe emperour certen tyme deliueraunce would coulde deliuered emperour contented aunswer taketh seruauntes except one two moste ende nouember peter martyr floretine leauing strasburg taught fiue yeares great commendation hauing leaue senate peter martyr goeth england goeth englande sent archebyshop canturbury kinges commaundement appointed reade diuinitie lectour oxforde compaignion iourney barnardine ochine sene beyng great estimation amonges italian eloquence vertue forsaking monasticall kinde lyfe gaue selue doctrine gospell coming first geneua auspurge set forth certen sermon print muche tyme syxe article made life king henry sayd xii boke disanulled reformation religion englande acte parliament image picture remoued church beginning reformation ix day december cardinall trent presence byshop great senate cardinalles propoundeth matter commaunded oratio cardinall tret many weighty wordes declareth peril paynes emperour hath taken counsell matter brought vnto passe sayeth industrie authoritie state wyll obeye counsell wherfore requireth goddes loue name emperour kyng ferdinando whole empire comaunde father bononie retourne trent finish vp worli begon ryght necessary comon wealth ouer send ambassadour two germany aduise meane howe lyue well may establyshed till ende counsell may reformation olergie finally let consider also decree byshop chaunce departe tyme counsell whether authoritie election shalbe father counsell cardinalles leste happely matter shall come passe may styre vp newe commotios fift day cardinall trent thus playd oratour iames mendoza emperours commaudement audience speaketh lyke effect sayeth byshop make delay excuse hath commaundement calling hym ambassadours kynges prynces shuld openly proteste counsell corrupted daye xiiii daie december oratio bishop rain pope archbyshop rain made cardinall somer sent frenche kyng rome made long flattering oration byshop cardinalles prayse kyng fraunces kynges frauce chiefly commendation henry newe kyng sayeth nothing degenerating moste noble progenitours beareth zelous affection churche rome maketh submission louing freche king contendeth ye emperour eldership obedient childe offereth hym selfe bosome also first begotten sonne churche chief captaine christian nation promiseth defence maintenauce dignitie hereof imploye al force power realme owne treasure person roialle many suche thinges full great assentation frenche kyng vnderstading well rancour malice byshop bare mynde slaughter peter aloise saw remouing counsell trent displeasure increased iudged tyme couenient wherin might frame thinges commoditie purpose wherfore sending oftentimes ambassadours byshop promised assistauce incouraged strengthened mynde whan byshop heard requestes cardinall trente mendoza sayeth wyl consult father boloigne also make relation thing vnto christen prince wherfore whan cardinall trente could get none aunswere retourneth home leauing mendoza whome emperour commaunded finishe vp rest xvi day december byshop wryting chief legate counsell iohn pope letter legate mary mountane cardinal signifieth cardinal trent also iames mendoza demaunded emperours name conference cardinalles thought mete conferre also father counsell leste thyng done rashely intent decree already made aswell remouing counsell also reste myght wholy remayne therfore sayeth muche carefull welth germany emperours sake would haue long delay commaunde calling assistaunce holy ghoste declare whole matter father answere shalbe made emperour wryte hither spede cardinall montane commaunded bryngeth matter counsell wryteth agayne byshop albeit counsell lawfully remoued fro trent bononie albeit session father daie decree made remouing synode al openly warned repare boloigne although father wryting letter trent admonished louingly take iourney yet remaine vntyll daye whiche thing verely aperteineth contemt counsell offendeth many therfore father see howe sauing dignitie estimation synode consulte retourne vnlesse suche trent first come bononie ioyne selues residue acknowledge authoritie ye counsel againe nedefull father put assurauce germany submitte selfe counsell allowe decree therof either made already heafter shalbe sort retracted man moreouer muche brute goeth shalbe counsell people agreable father desyre also haue assuraunce behalfe take place order maner counselles synce apostle tyme vnto day shuld chau ged desyre also know shalbe assured yt may safely frely remayne whan shall thinke good departe thence man let finally assuraunce also requisite whan certen cause semeth good moste part may lawfull father go el remoue counsell furthermore whan shall appeare matter sufficiently aunswered whiche counsell called father may libertie surcease make ende thinges whiche father great deliberation whan called grace holy spirite haue answered vnto requestes praiyng holines take good worth whan letter deliuered byshop xxvii daye deceber masse sendeth emperours ambassadour mendoza senate cardinalles sheweth synode boloigne hath answered whose opinion pope mendoza emperours ambassad saieth misliked either cardinalles consonant right reason part nothing would wyshe germany emperour witnesse nothing concerned dutie good pastour moste louing father hath bene omitted perceiueth dede emperour king ferdinado state empire require supposeth howe desire suche wyse may stande peace commoditie nation libertie churche whan mendoza sawe howe bishop toke company boloigne counsell fully mynded haue protested contrary immediatly intercession certen cardinalles deane college content aduertise emperour aunswere awayte letter differre protestation vntill xx day whan therfore mendoza signified whole matter emperour byshop also made aunswere former letter germane byshops kalendes ianuary wherein commendeth vertue interlaseth owne prayses amonges pope letter byshops germany sheweth desyrous hath bene euer counsell first called mantua uicence last trente whither came many bishoppes nation fewe none germany moreouer holsome decres made proftable commo wealth departed thence without knowledge yet doeth defende doinges lawefull defende doinges lawfull furthermore discourseth pope ignoraunt thinges large cardinall trent mendoza demaunded emperours name whose requestes asmuche agreable would answere aunswered emperour finally say feared lest slacke meanes wyl found moue muche hath omitted part duty whome god hath placed seate dignitie hyge watche toure haue charge whole slocke especially go astraye rest againe may newe deuises shalbe attempted pope watchman authoritie sea rome christ selfe architectour therof tyme layd foudation ye church rome prognosticate great stormes enterpryse haue lucky successe feareth christe hath buylded vpon moste strong rocke diuers haue heretofore attempted lyke thinge whome god consta cie romish church hath made example men beholde day whiche affrayde plage punishment others set eye sore lameteth case destruction ensue howbeit exhorteth chiefly remayne perseuer still faith vertue constancie haue perfourmed hetherto suffer counselles take place couentions dignitie churche whan therfore byshop synod assembled boloigne dwelt stil opinion emperours emp ambassad sent boloigne le grasse ambassadours cause sent bononie frau ce uargas martin uelascus xvi daye ianuary wha desyred senate come cosistory present cardinall mountane xliiii bishop prelate churche uargas reciteth commission wherin emperour geuen fellowe authoritie pleade whiche also exhibited lately beginning speake interrupted cardinal montane president counsell commission wrytyng emperour calleth counsell conuention bononie wherfore sayeth cardinal mountane albeit assemble bounde heare oration forasmuch pope legate ye emperours ambassad commission exhibited doth concerne holy synode yet lest man haue cause complayne refuse heare yet vpon condition pleading neither hinder v profite shalbe free v neuerthelesse continew procede counsell appointe suche punishment al disobedient rebelles holy lawes constitution determined emperours ambassadour uargas desyreth haue recorded empe ambassad ye father common recordes impeched letted could speake first afterwarde much saith haue already sene emperours letter credit wyll declare commission appeare treat matter weighty also whole common wealth christendome earnest prayer beseche would shew equitie men iudge certenly case wyll obstinatly perseuer opinion whiche vncircumspectly haue one embraced wyll tourne maruelous calamitie common wealth surcea e ordered themperour thinges shal luckely succede thing men better may vnderstande shall repete whole matter depely shal appeare fowly shall erre vnlesse alter pourpose gret good wil ye emperour beareth commo wealth herein wil adde word wil treade fotesteps commaundement haue receiued agayne cardinall mountane also sayeth president malapertnes ye legate sacred counsell deputed legate paule third bishop rome successour peter uicar christ earth also reuerende father procede cou sell lawfully remoued trent vnto god glory saluation mankynde wherfore desire emperour alter sentence assiste v matter commaunde disturber counsell vnto silence ignoraunt euer let impediment holy counselles deserue moste greuouse punishemet prescript lawes euer matter falleth terrours euer threatened yet wyll cleaue fast libertie dignite churche counsel also whan uargas openly recited letter commission fellowe uelascus readeth protestation beginning raccomted oftentymes letter protestatio counsell emperour hath desired counsell leo adriane clement last paule third time germaines erneste suters paule third first mantua uicence finally whan could kepte place appointed trent assent emperour state muche place commodious italian spaniardes french men germaines wanted thinges nedefull therfore time seate chosen synode byshop sent thether cardinal parise morone poole emperours name also came byshop arras father granuellan iames mendoza tyme semed byshop conuenient enough matter differred againe came newe legate rome mountane crucei poole cardinalles emperour thesame mendoza fraunces toletane ambassadours prince came also others partes repared trent great nober time emperour warre germany chiefly defence maintenaunce religion suche could rule reason might compelle force armes time hauing lucky successe warres maner vaquished called way againe contemned counsell tyme beholde whiche vsurpe vnto name legate see rome sodenly without making byshop priuie say selues faining cause tell propounde remouing counsell geuing scarsely tyme consulte departe trent great haste many worthy vertuous father assent sayd cause flitting reasonable protested would remaine trent meane season emperour going saxony vanquisheth ennemy albis taketh captaines warre battell submission neuerthelesse warre finished desired byshop oft letter messenger sent woulde commaunde father retourne boloigne trent otherwyse would matter daungerous called conuention auspurge wherin emperours request prynces state whole cosent approue cou sell trent promised wold obeie condition whan obtained sent forth cardinall trent rome whiche might declare thinges byshop senate cardinalles name whole empyre myght require continuaunce counsel trent commaunded thing also iames mendoza ambassadour byshop toke delay aunsweryng thought mete first consulte receiued answer ful craftie subtile captious eftsones aunswer emperour vnsittingly starting hole backsteppes declareth well enough little careth common wealth proue cause remouing ther neded witness worthy credite emperour kyng ferdinando prynces sending letter moste honorable ambassadour declared opinion state cocerning cou sell omitting testimony byshop would rather geue credit vile abiecte persones howe many tedious painful iourneis hath emperour taken counsell emp carefulnes counsell costes charge hath bene shall thinges lost upon moste weightie necessarie cause request ye emperour suite germaines assent christian prince counsell called also comenced trent wherfore publique authoritie al state cosented therto may holden el cause remouynge thing inuented excuse uerely certe ague infection ayre herein followed aduise certen phisicios chiefly maydes authours remouing counsell cooke howe trifelyng vaine cause thinge selfe ende declared saye departed making byshop priuie letter wrytten vnto aunswer sent emperour testifie farre another thing certenly ought haue remoued chau ged place without consent emperour vnto committed charge tuition counselles went hastely away reiected suche sayd ought first aske aduise emperour byshop must nedes haue remoued lest haue obserued decree holy counselles haue remayned within border germany intent germaines whose cause chiefly hande myght come counsell safely nowe haue ye chosen bononie citie middes italy subiect churche rome whether assured germaines come therfore haue chosen decaye reproche vniuersall weale counsel myght either dossolued handled vsed pleasure emperour therfore requireth moste earnestly wold retourne place whiche contented men especially synce thinges safe quiet neither remaineth cause feare whiche thyng shall refuse doe name commaundemet emperour proteste remouing counsell vayne vnlawful whole doyng voyde none effect also testifie ye answer fond full lie ye comodities yt hereafter shal insue comon wealth ar ascribed vnto affirme moreouer haue authoritie remoue counsell asmuch haue neglected publique health men emperour protectour churche wyll take charge therof far forth may lawes decree holy father whan red thinges deliuereth copie protestation written requireth maye recorded matter recorde cardinall mountane consent father speakyng grauely declareth well vsed mountane striken fury taketh god witnesse saieth howe ready dye rather suffer suche example brought churche euer ciuile magistrate wyll pleasure comptrolle counsell emperour dede eldest sonne church neyther lord maister college legate see apostolicke refuse presently reder accompt first vnto god also byshop ambassade within fewe dayes protestation shalbe aunswered maner effect tyme mendoza whan letter come emperour wherby commau ded procede proteste rome byshop cardinalles callyng therunto cemmaunded ambassadours foreine kynges prince twenty booke sleidanes commentaryes concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument twenty booke treaty controuersie whether lande prusse belong kyng poole empyre pope maketh ample aunswere protestation made mendoza wherof emperour aduertised leauing hope counsell begynneth set forth interim protectour englande wryting scottes ample wyse demaundeth quene uogelsberge beheaded emperour campe wittemberge gaue duke maurice ryght electourshyp nowe createth solemnity bucer refuseth subscribe interim pope himselfe co demneth interim lykewyse electours prynces certen also refuse al though emperour caused proclaimed duke saxon prysoner great magnanimitie refuseth lantgraue letter set forth name maketh semblant consent therunto deliuered whilest masseis abolished england city townes germany sollicited accept interim aboue others strasborough yea threatchynges fourmer bokes declared howe albert house brandenburge homage kynge polle howe altered state comon welth prusse therfore outlawed chaber againe howe kyng polle commo assembly empyre oftentymes sued emperour state muche cliente would reuerse outlawerie nothynge obtayned vnto daye great victory emperour feared lest matter haue come daunger kynge polle vnto assemblie sendeth ambassade chief wherof stanislaus lascus moneth ianuary deliuereth emperour senate prince oration wrytten effect wherof howe cause prusse bene oftentymes debated oration kyng pol ambassadour muche hath bene alwayes differred vntyll assembly nowe comaunded agayne declare kinges truste yt inasmuch haue al time made getle answer ye cause self rightful haue consideration mynde hym yet iudges prynces worthy honour reuerence first sayeth wyll speake diuerse thynges order prusse intent thyng may manifest time pait kynges polle gaue great part prusseland order knighthode dutche land vpon codicion beginning thorder knight duchland might haue seruice enemy christendome vnthankefull breakyng conuenauntes tourned force ther owne lordes oftentymes warre oftentymes conuenauntes renewed reaso antiquitie requisite rehearse whiche maner chaunced memory shall recite kyng casimire father vnto sigismunde subde wyng great battell brought condition peace victory king casimire amonges thinges accorded henceforth acknowledge kynges polle magistrate geuyng fidelitie othe afterwardes certen maisters order brake conuenauntes geuynge selues tuition others whiche albert brandenburge one bounde conuenaunt doe homage vnto kyng uncle within half yeare wold wherfore kyng albeit loued peace yet necessitie constrayned attempte warre albeit neuer ioyned battell whole force yet roades made fyryng spoyling escharmoushing much harme done muche alberte weake came vnto kyng take truce selfe tyme came force germaines ayde hym whiche cause departed without concludyng began renewe warre long beyng forsaken dyd dissemble constrayned sadues intreat peace whiche one concluded mediation certen conditioned geue fayth kyng othe doe thynges becommeth faythful trusty cliente certen therfore lande prusse hath euer synce memory tyme fyrst receiued albert receyued tuitio king pol christen religion lawe armes also sondry conuenauntes aparteyned realme polle others haue made title claime hath ben arrogancie wrong ye maisters thorder kinges permissio germains borne haue oftentimes intitle others ryght prusse whiche thing assuredly hath bred muche distention betwixte germaines polonians caused also decree wherin duke albert outlawed ryght haue outlaw man cliente yt came iudgemet sited iudges ded kynges commaundement vnto whome faulte imputed case outlawed cause acknowlegeth king magistrat vnreasonable man suffer punishemet duty wherfore triumphat emperour state noble king doeth hartly requyre vniust vnlawfull decree outlawery prescription may repressed neither cause man thynke ye kyng would ambition desyre enlarge kyngdome bryng prusse vnder subiection hath refused goodly prouinces haue bene frely offred come suspicion matter certenly coutrey much worth vnto hym myght honour coulde content forgoe sith doth properly belong vnto dominion wyse doe cause oftentimes trouble cotetion hath rise euer prusse belo geth pole faulte maisters order shewed god dede hath often plaged bolde enterpryses thinges knew ryght well noble emperour king ferdinado grandfather maximilian remembring iniuries father friderick receiued made faithfull promyse kyng sigismunde tyme met uienne promised well owne name also woulde geue maner ayde vnto order dyd maximilian newe example followyng trade auncestours emperour sigismunde metyng wt kyng ladislaus gradfather king maister much also promised aide ye emperour friderick great gradfather war emperours kynges pole order knightes ioyned force power casimire father king sigismund matthie kyng hongary foresayd order one cofederacie although kyng casimire let impeched ye warres ordre could sende themperour fridericke time ayde men yet ayde wt monie much couenat wherby euident order hath always ben enemy ye hous whiche hath euer bene linked polle bondes league affinity wherof king sigismude requireth haue consideration case order thinke selues bounde fight christian faith religion nothing prusse round doe professe christiane religio therfore must seke vnto place may exercise selues many yeares hierusalem possessed barbarous ennemy defence whiche place said order time past instituted constantinople also kept nation lieth worke busines thought ouer olde far many strong city christendome wonne lately worthy knyghtes go thether thei might either recouer loste defende rest fro ennemy delight ciuile warre euery man may iudge howe vnworthy name thus case standeth order hath bene alwayes without order whiche disordred order knightes cause also expulsed prussie boheme lyke wyse well nexe hondreth fiftie yeares past yet hath man hetherto desyred place whiche expulsed common vacant geuen polle sement fit molested herein whiche ought moste fauoured albeit order hath offended many yet hath done moste hurt realme polle sauing first scarsly maisters order duty contrariwyse moste part leauing barbarous ennemies haue tourned weapon magistrate kynges poolle yt haue brought confederacie also tartarians cruell kynde people mortall ennemies christian wrytten michell cochmester wherfore man would make rekening cosider ye paine perilles charge warres tumultes battails slaughter desolation wherof order hath chiefly bene cause shal find yt hardly much worth ye kinges desire myght one ende euils man attempte warre albert duke prusse kyng wyll altogether sit styll see hym take wrong muche uncle hym patrone threateninges menace brought kynges eares whiche doubtles sory heare loueth peace quietnes chiefly concorde christendome howe case man shall attempte violence wyll dede vnwillyngly put armure yet wyll doe defende desyreth frendshyp prynces chiefly moste mighty emperour kyng ferdina wysheth continue euer hath often time heretofore intreated letter messenger prescription decreed duke albert might abolyshed done hetherto doeth muche impute vnto aduersitie tyme nowe alwayes made playne lettes taken awaye supposeth haue occasion perfourme thyng whiche haue right franckely promysed whan one lettre two haue signified ready wyll power gratifie hym case order wyll cease steare vp warre trouble trusteth example progenitours kepe assuredly conuenauntes maximilian fridericke empeperours thing haue commission apperteineth city danske elunige albeit vnder dominion polle yet called assembly empyre wherfore kyng requireth vsed hereafter synce man besydes hath doe may henceforth suffered vse owne lawes whan emperour heard demaundes made relation therof state empire geueth copie oration wuolfange marque prusse xxiii daye ianuary maketh aunswere vulgar tongue certen preface saith resteth oratio marque pruse whole controuersie matter whether prusse vnder dominion polle empire shall proue later true matter shalbe easy determine thus standeth case moste triumphant emperour moste mighty kyng moste noble prince state shall declare foure hondreth yeares past whan publique war attempted barbarian whiche vexed sore men religion throughout al asie affricke order wherof speake instituted whiche emperours haue liberally originall order knighthode auauced high byshops also confirmed knyghtes ordre space certen yeares kept great warres party vniuersall christen weale fine hauing great ouerthrowe discomfited dispersed sondry place time duke muscouia fortuned conrade duke moscouia greuously assayled prussian ennemies christen religion whan longer hable mainteine warres defende selfe sued first byshop rome setting forth celestiall immortall rewarde maner would incourage men warre adioyned order gaue countrey culmen borderyng vpon prusse rather encourage gaue al land prusse holde euer dede gift emperour friderick second confirmed permitted herman salcie maister order moue warre prussian subdue inioye lande euer yeare lorde cc xxvi thus verely order ayde emperour byshoppes rome prince empyre continewing warre space liii yeares last conquer lande prusse bring christian religion beautified certen college byshoprikes builded therin also castels city might party walle fortresse empire refuge nobilitie germany hath parte region remained gouernement vnto yeare saluation cccc l parte therof tyll albert brandenburg tyme lituanes tartarians together made warre polonians moscouites knightes remembring profession order toke armure cleane disconfited lituanians inuading far within limites cause long time peace amitie polonians vntill suche time certen prince lituania created king polle auenge losse shame nation moued prince lituania made king pole warre v sodenly ayded barbarian muche hurte men repulsed put besides great part realme ioyfull ende warre muche made complaint counsel constance came forth decree suche part polle men helde lawe armes restored thus beyng againe reuiued forgot benefit receiued renewed warre contended certen prouinces order belonged dominio polle albeit intercession two kynges hongary boheme matter taken vp yet sore brake agayne last case referred emperour sigismunde approued fourmer composition kynges made howebeit king polle could reste thus attempted warre agayne whiche xxiiii yeare accorded composition peace tournie whan ladistaus king whiche composition peace forsaketh suite strife neither calleth selfe lord inheritour prussie byndeth successours within one yeres space come crowne shall sweare accepte ratifie peace compelle byshoppes state realme take othe euery tenth yeare othe renewed also codicioned tyme king polle shall hereafter moue warre vpon maister prussie people bounde obeye assiste hym peace continually kept either partie composition confirmed two hondreth seales shewed yet ye peace indure aboue xiiii yeares yeare lorde mcccci people making people rebell rebellion conspired maister albeit byshop rome emperour fridericke thirde outlawe albeit maister desired ye matter might heard yet litle regarde lxx townes castels revelled one daye unto conspiracie ioyned selfe kyng polle casinure father sigismunde brought v vnto suche perplexitie lewys erlinsusie maister order constrayned feare present daunger moste constant man might doe case intent might hepe still prouince also saue selfe accorded vpon condition moste vnreasonable without authoritie either byshop emperour yet state empyre coditions peace amonges thinges maisters prussie fro hence forth shal within sixe monethes chosen magistrate come condition peace betwixt ye king polle knightes vnto king polle othe acknowledge hym souraigne shall ayde hym men shal also receaue order aswell polonians germaines shall admitte beare office suche landes shall wynne hereafter homage kynges polle whiche condition verely cocerne priuate losse rebuke order also publique domage reproche empire nobilitie germany wherefore since time haue bene maisters considering vnreasonablenes thing haue made greuous complaintes hereof byshops rome emperours yet haue bene constrained sweare certenly prussie remained tuition empyre till friderich saxon albert brandenburg maisters order would homage kynges polle neither byshop emperour confirmed coposition king casimire yeare ccccc emperout maximilian assemble auspurge made decree wherin commaunded geue fayth empyre appease controuersie maximilian appointed daye passawe yeare x sending thether ambassadours could nothing concluded wherupo ensued last warre moreouer albert selfe xxiiii yeares past conuention norinberge prince empyre place amonges others signed decree made wherfore euident king polle hath right prusse lawfull prusse belogeth yere albert withdrawe self vnto tuition protection nowe ambassadour reproueth ordre vnthankefulnes breakyng conuenauntes herein doeth v wrong proued olde wrytinges scarsely haue kinges polle kepte touche promesse v euer wryting sene confirmed mo seales ye wherby accorded king ladislaus might assuraunce made yet breaking seales wryting warre renewed v recompence restoryng vnto sarmatie great part lituania named certen emperours fourmer tyme sayeth offended order truthe farre otherwyse sigismunde sequestre strife geue sentence v tioned also gaue v ayde enemie againe emperour fridericke tyme people rebelled said shewed v fauour might banyshed cospiratours cause helde assemble ye empyre norinberge conuention decree made ayde v lyke good wyll fauour maximilian v neither would sweare kyng polle therfore owne name also whole empyre wrote sondry letter kyng sigismunde made decree v right honorable oratour procedeth waye mockery demaundeth v recouer hierusalem like place surely cleane without experience could taunte againe neuerthelesse reason honorable audience wyll refrayne wil aske question first ye kyng polle doth recouer place prince moscouia hath taken fro within fewe yeares whiche comparison muche prussie againe great fortune doeth defende owne limites dayly inuasions tartarians uerely plage breaking fidelitie sayeth order tymes past expulsed boheme thus saye knowe vnlesse example would shewe myght also lawfully spoyle v goodes tourne v landes possession distruction ye tyme touched order pearsed also lande boheme extended vpon chiefly commotion boheme doctrine john husse followed olde religion tyme great tumultes reysed doctrine john husse dur order hath warred kinges polle confesse euer gaue occasio warre denie vtterly neuer attempted warre either defende right el recouer owne sayeth haue made league cartarians may well verefied manifest haue vsed ayde men professe christen religion againe situation countrey declareth easely whether tartarians lie commodious nerer v whiche spake laste city danske eluinge grounded vpon reason eyther citie dominion belongeth germane empyre neither hath kyng polle title whiche hath obtayned rebellion treason citezens may proued sondry reason seyng matter thus moste redoubted emperour mighty kyng state honorable besech ye sentece already geue may put executio obtein handes ought equitie cause dignitie empyre state religion honour comoditie nobilitie germany ambassadour polle prepared contrary wryting exhibit whan reason heard partes certen chosen whole nobre examine matter whose determination sentence pronounced albert maynteined yet consideryng great difficultie would execution referre emperour shortly kyng sigil munde departed pure age whan reigned xlii yeres sonne vnto king casimire sayde death sigismsid king pole thre brother wherof ladislaus kyng hogary boheme father kyng lewys anne iohn albert alexander whan reigned order father casimire leauing behinde child passed ouer gouernment yongest brother sigismunde unto whome nowe succeded sonne name maried ye daughter ferdinando kyng romaynes shewed mendoza fourmer boke protested rome concerning counsell wherunto halendes february followyng byshop calling senate cardinalles made aunswere tyme mendoza thou pope aunswer mendoza saidest emperour commaunded thee make protestation counsell thou madest v right sorowfull diligently wayed letter thy commission comforted agayne first wyll speake cause grief heuines maner protesting euill example chiefly vsed suche either reuolted wholy dewe obedience haue begon wauer therin therfore greue exceadingly whiche haue alwayes borne fatherly loue emperour becommeth pastour church haue euer desyred concord greued senate cardinalles much muche time loked nothing lesse emperour hath made warre aduersaries ennemies churche hath done ayde myne armie albeit mendoza thou semest esteme thys lyghtly yet ought accepted great benefite warre finished ye pope army ayde exceading great sente muche far surmounted abilitie power holy treasure came moste season thing therfore could lesse loked victory obtained lately emperour rendre vnto suche fruicte godly zeale beneuolence uerely ende warre beginning protesting certes hath chaunced vnto prophet complayneth lokyng gather grape fynde wylde beries haue euer synce tyme first called dignitie pastorall earnest study tilled cherished themperour moste noble plante myght haue plentifull vintage enterpryse hath almoste taken away fro al hope fruicte thou hast heard cause grief heare also relieued thou though thou hadst authoritie geuen thee proteste sacret senate hast vsed neither vnto v honorable mete condigne emperour letter comission one worde sheweth themperours wil thou shouldest thus procede say one worde intent thou mayest better vnderstand geueth authoritie thus emperour comaudeth deputy boloigne proteste thus legate whiche haue chaunged place counsel thou didst perceiue done thou woldest vse maner protesting also presece herein hast thou passed bondes thy comission thou hast perceiued mendoza acknowledge last hauing warning themperour comaudeth yt protest v presence legate yt autours remouing wherfore theperour hath done herein duty teperate prince hath stayed within bondes limites wold ye protestation shuld made knoweth lawfull iudge al suche cause refused haue heard matter shuld haue iust cause protestation thou doza taking way yt thou shuldest haue done didst desire examine matter requirest yt shuld disanul ye decree made remouing counsel comaunde greatest part father geue place ye remained tret thing deminish thauthoritie whole cousel ben much reasonable yt trent thei cause coplaint father boloigne shuld haue made vnto certenly wold neither haue refused requestes tha yet wold preset therfore certen yt themperours minde cosonat agreable fact haue cause giue god thankes ruleth minde thys sort may reioyce selues thou thy self mayst glad thy prince sake albeit yt saide already foudatio pleade fallen yt nede answere thy protestation yet lest ye silence might appeare acknowledge thine accusatios thing send many especially ignoraut cofute first time yu hast set marke rhine eies yt thou mightest declare negligent draw backward seke delayes yu cousel shuld holde theperour carefull common wealth uigilaunt industrious wholy addicte kepyng counsel thou procedest speakyng thy pleasure assuredly doe nother ought enuie emperours prayses thou haddest stayed empe prayses set ye pope fyre nothinge aunswere muche thou doest extolle hym depraue laude commende hym thou myghtest bryng contempte whylest thou sayest hath desyred counsell also prodecessours byshoppes rome thing selfe requyreth aunswere thee thys alwayes emperours mynde desyre counsell myght holden mynde haue bene euer well agayne elder yeares haue desired thyng moste honorable cardinalles tell whiche nomber tyme whan chosen byshop continued mynde styll hauing leste occasion world called cou sell first mantua uicence thether came none hether fewe legate sent taried halfe yeare lokyng bishop whiche summoned sending broad letter messenger partes howbeit thou sayst city commodious nation repare tret fit pourpose al men knowe trent compared vnto neyther quantitie plentie thynges therfore incommoditie place let warres prynces nowe consyder whether feruent behalfe emperour whiche letted counsell warlyke tumultes byshop whiche euer peace maker neuer ayded prynce warre sauing emperour warre whiche semed open way vnto counsell whether emperour constrayned warre brought vnto wyll dispute certen counsell let warres come vnwillingly vnto comparison contention prayse vertu al dewe vnto god alone thou mendoza hast geuen occasion tedious warne thee cosider euery yeare byshoprike marke wel care study haue taken verely two thinges haue bene euer eye make peace amongest prince kepe cousel herein haue spared neyther coste payne myne olde age neyther doest thou reproue thyng counsel blamest legate remoued boloigne without knowledge moreouer doeth offende thee call congregation father boloigne counsell thynkest susteyne iniurie therby remayne trente euill thus men speake howe counsell remoued trent bononie wherfore doe dutie vpryght iudge ought call tyll knowe otherwise contrary probation especially sythe moste parte byshops gone legate thether lesse parte thou affirmest greater ought preuayle doubtfull matter euident counsell hath power remoue el whether lawfully remoued wherin al cotrouersie reserue vnto self iudgement comaund thyng whiche offered meane tyme doe attribute vnto congregation name counsell thou affirmest causers remouing vnto addicted thynkest thou thynge worthy reprehension thou praysest suche remayned trente bycause fauour consider daunger herein thing wonte arryse dissentions scismes vnto churche moste perillouse tyme byshoppes withdrawe selues obedience hygh prelate vnderstande addicted suche factiouse wyll take parte whether right wrong verely knowe none suche haue none partakyng part father towardes child pastour ward flocke neither hath chaunced yet suche controuersie counsell neded suche addicted vowed men requyre byshoppes chifly prouide libertie conscience gaue especiall charge legate whan went vnto counsel thei shuld se wyse byshops shuld haue cause coplain taking away libertie geuing voice finde much fault also perswaded requestes theperour king ferdinado al ye state thepyre gatherest hereby ye take care germany especially whan theperour hath great labour pain brought passe suche lately swarued church refuse decree ye cousel might continued trent certes neuer refused determinate wordes myght retourne trente may lawfully done without offence nation desirous health germany hereof euident twyse haue called counsel thither twise counsell called trent twise sent legate whiche first tyme space seuen monethes loked chiefly commynge germanes parise morone poole cardinalles thou knowest thy selfe howe came none tyme thither came emperours name granuellan byshop arras selfe mendoza witnes great patience men abyding rest ende therof muche selues would tary albeit legate intreated last one thre myght remayne example others yet alledging certen excuse departed many dayes agayne two yeares tyme commodious thei met againe sent legate thither mountane crucei poole cardinalles thyther came also fraunces toletane remembre howe longe expectation many monthes consumed vaine tofore could begynne come matter many holsome decree made know fewe came ther chiefly neded remedy byshoppes came none al fewe sent proctours briefly appeared signes token would come amendement whan many resorted thether spayne fraunce italy prouinces germany whiche next others hardely came one nowe saye state germany otherwyse emperour whose power authoritie nowe augmented doth vndertake case retourne trente germaines wyll followe decres counsell beleue mendoza true thou sayest germaynes mynde doe playnely submitte selues counsell euer yet woulde taken though passed greatly place synode holden sticke vnto trente vnlesse finished firste began wyll saye germany vndonne take hede doe whylest bynde v walles one citie doe iniurie holy ghoste olde tyme god ordeined hierusalem peculiar place wherin wold worshipped pleased tha wha ceremony shaddowes lawe abolyshed sauiour christ sunne rightuousnes shone forth would serued place therfore bryng newe bondage whan would compell v place seyng germany cured nedefull counsell kept dane gothians britans vexed lyke disease euery haue generall counsell kept owne countreys assembling counselles much consideration lawes made whiche doe make prescribe byshoppes father whose commodity chiefly respected father must prouided forwel proued sondry example counsel haue oftentymes bene holden countreis heresy sprange vp whether vnreasonable thing germaynes take vpon appointe place counsell election libertie taken away nation declare bitter protestation neded nowe rest saye howe auswere made vnto emperour vnsitting full lye grounded neither vppon ryght reason thynges vnreuerently spoken herein thou doest v wrong thou bryngest reason aunswere thee distinctely howe suppose greueth desyre decree may ratified well assured shall repare counsel maner order pleading styll reteyned whiche hath remayned churche apostle tyme vnto daye finally saufe conduicte ready demau de nothing straunge vnreasonable wont prouided wel lawes byshops also emperours nowe saye whatsoeuer incommoditie shall arryse tyme come emperour wyll ascribe vnto also negligence wyll take vpon hym charge church uerely far forth god wyll geue grace wyll demeane selfe wyll geue iust pope may weake negliget cause thought negligent matter cocerning churche neuerthelesse fortune imbecillitie man nature shall offended negligence maye styre vp sharpen emperours dilligence succour churche staye hym selfe within precincte limittes prescrybed followe herein rule ryght lawes holy father finally concerning chiefe point protestation contende remouing counsell vnlawfull muche effecte controuersie theron dependeth take vnto self examination therof vertue power authoritie committe hearing moste worthy cardinalles parise burges poole crescent commaunde meane tyme whylest examine thing man euer attempte thynge contrary also charge father aswell bo nonie also trent haue thing saye alledge matter within moneth lest seme point hinder commoditie germany wyll refuse sende myne ambassadours thether suche may cure infirmitie people shal vnder stande vnthankeful emperour besydes whan iudgement ended case shall appere wel remoue vnto boloigne deuise meanes synode may cotinued trent fewe wordes fine auncient religion may agayne restored germany cardinall trent retourned auspurge said whan emperour hearing talke also receiuing letter fro mendoza dated rome ende december sawe small hope counsell xiiii daye ianuary declareth matter ye state case standeth hath signified ambassadour mendoza make protestation rome concerning remouing counsel shal done wyll gette copie wryte albeit hope counsell vtterly neglected yet reason ye long delay whiche like come betwixt thinketh requisite necessary meane tyme meane founde conserue peace germany haue dede committed vnto hym charge matter thinketh expedient whole nombre chosen fewe good well learned men haue hereof wyll also appoint certen consult wherfore requireth wylling hereunto al affectios layde asyde cosider commoditie comon wealth euery also reconcilement made let call remembraunce howe dissention germany moste florishyng region others mirrour spectacle al nation beholde let consider moreouer toke muche trauel pain counsell might continued trent ded duty singuler zeale comon coutrey therfore dyuers chosen treat matter coulde agre whole matter referred themperour wherfore appointed certen penne article doctrine ceremony reformation clergie auctours interim iuly pflugie byshop numburge michaell sidonie iohn islebie agricola xviii yeares past defended doctrine protestauntes melanchton brentius wrytten seuenth booke therfore wryte ihon isleby reuolte boke article secretly whan bene log printed sondry tymes length exhibite emperour wyl shewe hereafter ioachim electour brandenburg whiche laboured sore reconcilement deuising first iames sturmius intreated senate strasburg letter cause religion would sende vnto bucer asmuche byshop withdrawen cousell emperour taken way great hope reformation whereupon bucer sent taking iurney priuely ende ianuary whan came almoste auspurg bucer set stayed tyll prince sent hym former boke declared englyshemen ouercame scottes mighty battell scottes would relent chaunge pourpose trusted frenche kynges promesses duke somerset protectour england rest counsell first day february wryte vnto long exhortation vnto peace albeit say requisite coucell england wryte scottes beginning procede whiche cause inferiours goe worse albeit possesse great part dominion yet admonishe wealth preseruatio last yeare battel prouoked peace amitie declared mynde yt wryting suppressed captaines gouernour realme suffered come handes may wel selues care full litle chaunceth vnto wherfore shall also vse disceiptfulnes suffer vnderstande part wyll counsell wryting openly proteste haue omitted part dutie englande hath oftentymes kepte warre scotlande exceading great doubt ciuille war betwene englande scotland shall reade history heare feates done would maruell muche people one countrie langage shuld great dissention amonges themselues woulde accompt thing chiefly wyshed whoale ilande might meane agree one ruled one gouernement al men confesse redier waye unto mariage way god hauing compassion vpon hath shewed offered moste goodly occasion bosome kyng whan broken promesse ouerthrow battell died shortly whether sorowe cause thre child two sonnes daughter indede might haue ben let yt ther shuld haue ben made attonemet betwixt v god toke away maner one day whan thei infantes left one inheriter daughter borne litle ye death father vnto v hath geue king great exspectatio edward sonne heire vnto hery ye eight se bond prepared perpetual euer lasting amitie betwene v hath bene oftetimes wished eight hondreth yeares past chauced neuer good opportunitie deny hinder peace amongest meane say wold procure selues lordship bondage ye haue letter sent ye last yeare past sufficiently cofuted take god witnesse ye king minded ioyne moste assured frendshyp shal refuse prouoke v againe warre frowardnes vnto whome shall faulte common euilles ascribed haue promised daughter heyre realm mariage king common assent parliamet writinges made confirmed common seale realme many daughter scotlande assiau ced yt king england great assuraunces deuised cotented put pledge till came lawfull age wrytinges custody perpetuall witnes againste whiche thinges hamelton erle arraine gouernour realme present president also chief doer cardinal saint andrewes certe prelate clergie put gouernour scotlanda leage breaker feare terrour shewed hym agayne great hope waye broke faith conuenauntes whome assuredly euer euils chaunceth meane tyme whole blame imputed haue lost many fortes castelles battell foughten wanted many thousandes men haue farre inuaded realme chiefly ascrybed vnto hym ende length doe loke obstinacy vuloyaultie hauyng victory offer peace possesse great part kyngdome yet make england common men vanquyshed wont suffer great ignomie tyme vnited people haue victorye forsake lose name owne nation doe frely graunte vnto refuse receiue yt auncient name britaines common nation thing loue god v performed men iudge haue iust cause warre whan shall knowe liberall reasonable honest condicions could take place set open always come vnto frendship neither expulse quene realme wil also establish daughter england intende abrogate lawes englande fraunce emperours countreyes also vse sondry lawes seke hinder peace doe put suche feare prouide owne commoditie pleasure care wealth tourne awaye eye mynde consider state common wealth haue mayde inheritour realme must doubtles mary length therfore shall eyther maryed one owne nation foreine prince mary home ryght title remayneth yet neuerthelesse vnto v whole thinge wyll styre vp ciuile tumultes dissention take straunger ye shal haue v continual ennemies miserable ye quene mary straunger moste miserable bondage shall ye serue foreine nation must seke ayde farre force shall sent spoken hurt wyll howe prowdely arrogauntly wyll deale thus wyl perswaded ayde defence consisteth whole preseruation wyll take quene prince trasport whether lyste shall haue warre syde may shall wyll wholly addicte defende care leaue vnto v pray fortune sende soldiours cap shall prescribe commaunde thynge shall well done wyll haue prayse therof misfortune chauce whole storme shall lyght neckes lose lyfe bloud daunger also dauger vse forain aydes vse foreyne aydes domesticall example may teache brytaines people ilande sente saxon tymes paste ayde expulsed countrie dryuen mountanes britanes expulsed yt saxon fennes tyme dwelte betwyxt englande scotlande pictes fierse warlyke people whome scottes defended ennemy pictes yt scot length oppressed name remayneth daye happen frenche men frankonie grekes longe synce hongarians memory whan vsed ayde turkes c gothians tyme paste meane wynne italy lumbardes whole countrie nowe called lumbardie longe ye wyse proue insolent pryde arrogancie foreyne soldiour compare infinitie rable euylles mariage infinitie honourable peace herein set eye maner example nation nere coutryes vnited maryage vnto v emperour charles fyft meane possesseth spayne burgundy frenche kynge meane hath annexed litle brytain vnto crowne frauce lyke also doe nation two wayes whereby warres finished either force victory two way finish war el mariage hate force doe admit whiche offered whiche conuenaunted graunted ignoraunte diswade holsome counsel uerely certen clergie gouernour realme also take hede lest whiche ofte haue broken fidelitie lose whole libertie leste beyng corrupte brybes hyre rewarde treason delyuer vp castelles fortes straungers whiche thyng whan shall doe wyl fayne wordes doe intent shall defende v dede thei assured ayde may selues brydle lyste seeth case realme shall stande miserable wretched frowardnes inclosed euery side dccean sea walles ditch strong agrement mindes amongest v wanted nothynge hyghe felicitie myght establyshe moste florishyng monarchie thys waye moue nothynge leste wyse let calamitie lately receyued mysery nowe hanging ouer headdes perswade let feare goddes vengeaunce also moue god reuenger faith conuenauntes broke detesteth al desire warre plageth greuous punishementes desire quene conuenaunted waye peace whiche god infinitie goodnes hath shewed followe wyshe also wold walke steppe obtain nothing protest necessitie must attempt warre god conduite whose worde voice contemne wyll prosecute right sword fire wherfore good men amogst sory calamitie countrey whiche thinke faith promyse kepte obserued may come vnto v safely whosoeuer shall shewe loue fauour trafficke also marchaudise may frely vsed amongst v kyng hath lately prouided set forth proclamation intent might token beneuolence towardes shall perceiue benefite wel imployed intendeth bestowe vpon greater hath comaunded thinges signified name ye former boke shewed sebastian uogelsberg brought french kyng germany ten enseignes foteme autumne retourned home discharged bandes serued ye frenche kyng emperour toke greuously displeasautly seking occasion commaunded lazarus schuendie se could apprehende commyng wisseburg hous toke brought ausburge uogelsberg appreheded streight way put vpon racke examined torture diuerse others suspicion though fauoured frenche partie although valeaunt stoutnes body mynde vttered nothing tourment yet reported haue bene societie rebelles haue broken emperours proclamation deuised crafty counselles condemned die two ceturions iames mantel wuolf thomas wherfore ye seueth day february brought forth marketh place foure day came thether certen enseignes fotemen ar mure great resort people whan come higher place executio loking bold stoute constacy death courage asmuch nobleman degree loked wyndowes house euery side saluteth great reuerence speaking kinde life declareth hath heretofore serued emperour warres sayth cause death yt last yere brought frenche king force men time crowned rain uogelsberg goodly comely personage shewed toke al terrour feare death allured men beholde heheaded ceturions named two iudges gaue sentence whiche followe emperours court campe alwayes one biruiesca spaniarde germane niclas zinner lawyer blamed schuendie though bene circumuented thei setforth wryting declare wherfore executed excuse schuendie affirme nothing emperours comaundement proteste accusation false tyme fraunce chiefly paris burning persecution persecution fraunce renewed lutheranisme contrariwyse englande consulted vtterly abolishe popish masse themperour sayd geue duke maurice dignitie electourship greatest part duke saxon cou trie campe wittemberge conuentio publique solemne ceremonie putteth inpossession receiueth tuition empire thing promised tha done xxiiii day february theperours birth day cerimony sorte market place buylded pauilion bordes great breadth wheruto ceremonie wherby duke maurice created elect went vp step thither came themperour thre clock none accopanied ye prince electours goeth fro hence house putteth solemne robe prince electours thence cometh forth sitteth vnder cloth estate likewise euery man place backside ouer themperour vpon stage placed trompetters cometh forth ye first band duke maurice runne horse themperours pauilion maner ye meane season duke maurice wt band staieth right ouer accompanied nober prince next xii trompetters immediatly issued band hery ye duke bruswick wuolfage prince bipout brother ye elector palatine albert ye yog duke bauer whe thei coursed horse ye place said alight go vp per hubly require hi yt wold auace duke moris ye commo benefit thempire ye digniti electorship themperor cosultig wt thelectors maketh answer tharchbishop etz yt cotet case wil coe hi self demad ye whe receiued yt answer duke moris cometh riding forth wt hole troupe wer born x enseignes wt armes many regios wherin desired inuested wha come vp themperor kneled vpo knee desireth hoier earl masfeld sent brother august make ye like request wherfor themperor answereth tharchbishop metz chaceler thempire forasmuch haue hi faithful seruice wil geue vnto duke moris heires male none brother augustus heir body thelectorship saxonie al ye lad iho friderick much excepted alredy gra ted childre afterward tharchbishop metz readeth ye oth wherwt thelectors boude wha duke moris reciting sworn themperor deliuereth vnto sworde wt ceremony putteth wer full possession geueth thakes promiseth al fidelity obeisace bauers armes metioned whe duke moris receiued themperor wer thrown amogs people accustomed al thing might duke iho friderick behold house lodged wtout fail market place bucer set auspurge came last thelector bradeburge boke finished shewed copiled religio marque deliuereth bucer marque bra denburge fended wyth bucer desireth subscribe whe red ouer yt saw bishop rome doctrine therein established said could allow thelector toke displesatly much feded wt iudged wryting moderat islebie perswaded hi granuella also vrged bucer messegers wold subscribe promised hi ample reward whe might preuail bucer daunger large promise bega threate returned home wtout dager sor throughout al lad wirtemberge bad spaniardes said month aprill tharchbishop collo lately made priest sag first masse term wherat themperor king ferdinado prince great nobre maketh moste sumpteous dinner time also came auspurge muleasses king tune muleasses kinge tunnes whome emperour xiii yeres paste restored kingedome expulsed barbarous shewed ninth boke eldest son put eies vsurped crown wherfore like miserable exile came hither themperor barbarie log came thither also secod sone boke copiled religio treateth first ye state cotents interim fal redeptio christ charity good work ye cofidece ye remissi sinnes church vowes authoriti ye minister ye church ye high bishop sacramets sacrifice masse memorial inuocatio intercessio saintes memorial haue died godly comunion annexed sacrifice ceremony vse sacrament thing amongs others taught yt workes besides comaudemet god godly honestly wrought comoly called ye work superogatio comeded worckes superogatio canot wtout distrust imbecillity beleue yt sin forgeue ye church hath autority interprete ye scripture oute together setforth doctrins power minister ye law iudge doutful matter general cousel make lawes yt ther one high bishop aboue al residue prerogatiue grauted peter vnto gouernment vniuersall church committed christ yet bishop also haue part cure euery church yt cofirmatio chrisme receiued holy gost yt may resist deceit ye deuil flesh world bishop minister sacramet sin must rehersed priest come memory satisfactio cosisteth frutes repetace especially fasting praying almosgeuing cut ye cause sinnes temporal punishment ether taken away mitigated holy vnctio hath bene church since time apostle yt ether might help body mind self firy dart deuil wherfor must vsed time hour death apeareth draw nere mariage contracted wtout coset parets ought ratified yet childre admonished sermon yt folow thaduise parets christ last supper institute ye sacramet body blud first might receiued faithful holsom meat soul secondli yt might offred vp memorial death ther al ii sacrifice christ one blody vpo crosse thother wherin vnder ye form bread wine self two sacrifice christ terimistes offred vp vnto father body blud deliuered apostle successers ye memorial vnto world end ye first makind reconciled god father yt blody christ represeted father yt shuld agai deserue yt remissio sin yt might apply vnto selues recocilemet prepared ye death christ yt sacrifice wherin celebrate ye death christ ye morial saint must renued yt may make intercessio v god father help v merit must also remeber dead comend almightye god prescribed yt old ceremony accustomably vsed baptisme stil obserued xorsisme renouncing cofession faith chrisme moreouer yt ceremony masse ther nothing chauged al town great church ther saide daily ii mass least country village one especially holy day yt cano inasse nothing altered al rest obserued thold vsage yet thing crept yt may geue occasio superstitio let take away let vestment ornament vessel cross altar cadels image kept stil certein monumets let ordinari praiers godly singing psalmes abrogated wher take away let restored let obit dead kept maner thold church also sainctes holy day yea let worshipped also vnto decreed yt supplicatio shuld made day easter witsontide let water fotstone hallowed solene maner let riot refrained thintent stir vp mind godly exercise certen daie let fast abstain fro flesh finally though wer wished yt ther diuers many minister church foud yt would liue chast yet yt many haue wiues euery wher whiche forsake nether altred without great tumult therfore must tary herein decre generall counsel likewise interi permitteth priestes kepe wiues stil coteted bear yt receiue lord supper vnder kindes yet shal reproue others yt contrary vnder ether kind body bloud christ conteined wholy sort boke setforth last shal heare pened beginninge oft corrected euil copiled boke ofte corrected copy yt bucer saw somwhat purer wherfore ben tost log much among state thempire set also rome albeit yt al papistry maner therin established yet asmuch certe thing wer permitted contrary part thought first expediet make bishop priuy openet themperor cardinal stoudrate note inaduersios priest hath take ordres shuld mary execute note interim bi ye bishoppe rome stil holy ministry neuer hard yt vse receiuing ye lord supper vnder kind abrogated nether hath autority permit yt liberty sauing ye bishop rome sinode yt folowers ye old religio boude vnto doctrins lutheranes wil forsake opinion thei refused ii mass ought vnderstad ye lutheranes yt singing psalmes ought restored al place yt holy day must celebrate ye memoriall patrone church suche priestes already hereafter shalbe muste abstayne fro mariage spedy restitution church goodes iurisdictio must made robbery manifest nether must folow herein thordinary proces law determin thing euidet execute matter regal power whe cesure inferred tharchbishops metz treuers collen vnto deliuered answer theperor directly sort especially vrge restitutio declaring right necessary christe religio shuld maintained place wher abolished shuld restored moreouer comon peace ca otherwise established wherfore chiefli prouided yt religious house wholy restored much spoil extortio manifest must go spedeli work yt god seruice may withal spede recouered finally desire take thing good part protectio defed mebers church iii elector wer opinio especially thelectors dary opinio ye paulsgraue duke moris yet ether cause shuld gainsai themperor rest prince whiche wer part bishop answer like maner iii archbishop city ther great accompt made themperour therfore ides maye calleth state preface speaking zeale towardes germany saieth perceiue manifest argument thing self ye neither peace established law iustice ministred vnlesse cotrouersie religio first appeased hath many peares sturred vp thempire muche grudge dyssention hatred discorde ciuile warres hath bene verely cause many couetions cofereces haue often sought remedy meane time germany also natios people christedome hath cotageous infection pearsed much ther appereth present remedy general cousel legth request procured holde tret moued also ye beginning conuentio submit selues thauthoritie charge might comitted vnto v ye meane seaso deuise godly meanes wherby might liue quietly ye meane germany cotetatio cofydece youres vnto v tha also right acceptable time therfore gaue selues wholy vnto carefulnes demauded opinion perceiued without great grief mynde disagrement religion thoccasion former euils vnlesse foresene hereafter wylbe wherefore thought good leaue matter troublesome state vntyll decree counsell oughte broughte moderation especially sith yt oftentimes new sectes arise whilest podering thing certain high degre nobility desirous peace louers comon weale exhibite v wryting theyr opinio cocerning religio promise due obeisace receiuing wryting deliuered certaine good learned deuines yt shuld among selues consider al thing diligetly perused made report wel vnderstand impugne catholike religion doctrine ye lawes costitutions church two opinion excepted wherof thone mariage priestes thother lordes supper said wel deuised establish concord germany thing dousles vnto v shuld acceptable ioyful thing could happe se al state mindes agreable follow one forme religion seing eue require haue obserued hitherto ye lawes custome ye catholike church great comendation perseuer ye alter nothing haue promised v heretofore also haue chauged religio desire earnestly passe wt thother state professe religion yt el cofyrme doctrine order boke euery poynt follow step hereof besides ordaine nothing stay within boundes limites neither wryting preaching attempt thing contrary obedietly atted decre general coucel may shortly possible wil indeuor wt al diligece ar occupied thing wholy coceaue forme reformatio clergie wha spoke thus secretary accustomed comauded boke red ther tharch craft tharchbishop mentz prouing interim bishop metz occupieth ye chiefest place amog thelectors seking thopinio stats shold ariseth vp wer name al ye rest geueth vnto theperor much trauel pain care diligece loue coutrey imortal thaks asmuch thei haue already comitted thing fidelitie paine hath take therin saith reason yt wt willing mind acknowledg thesame obey decre thaks geuing peror take comon assent cofirmatio wold admit none excuse shall herafter declare comaundeth boke set forth print latin duch also iiii day declareth stats wt much labor cost hath restored peace vn germany thing self requireth yt also prouided time come supposeth veri mete necessari great treasure money beleuied certeine place kept common treasurie fortune time anye commotion arrise within empire without may alwaies readinesse fewe day passed betwene kynge ferdinando raccompteth waightie cause whiche king ferna requireth monet state selues vnderstand wel inough nede recited sendinge ambassade made truse turke fiue yeares wherof one past albeit hath commaunded men nothing contrary yet requireth neuerthelesse geue aid haue already promised intent breake couenauntes may easely resisted inasmuch doth fortifye frontier townes stronge garrison also negligent behalf
