therfore purposed fortifye place kepe garrison intollerable charge warres former yeares hable sustaine greate burthen wherfore requireth whilest truse shal indure would pay mony yerely imploid vnto v concerneth quiet preseruation meane time maximilian eldest sonne king ferdinando departinge auspurge goeth spaine maximilian marieth hys cosen take mariage lady mary emperours eldest daughter cosin germane cardinall trent sente wyth fewe monethes duke alba ende maye horsmen nalpes norgouia come contrie neare vnto strausburge remaine space three monethes hardly expressed arrogantly vsed selues many time woulde come citie neither wanted thinge great suspicion duke moris long emperours decree setforth departeth thece marque ihon brandenburge brother ioachim electoure goeth emperour kinge ferdinando standinge iohn mark brand refuseth interim besecheth fauor matter speakinge somewhat seruice towardes saieth vppon affiaunce chiefly serued last warre assured touchinge religion emperoure sheweth howe consente state imperiall saieth man oughte swarue replied againe assented aunswered plainly could good conscience praise decree still vrged promesse couenaunt whan emperour might preuaile commaundeth departe whiche men suppose done cause least example talke cofirme mindes others wherfore day towardes euening taketh iourney homewardes dominion altered nothing prince electoure brother indeuoured alwaies please themperoure made assistaunce yet paulsgraue hauing emperoure time good lorde ambassadoures city suche confession auspurge vrged intreate mighte firste aduertise senate intent might answer according vnto mindes thing permitted emperoure commaunded wuolfgange prince bipount costace duke swebrig house palatine ambassadours come selfe whan came doth instaunt confirme decre saieth knoweth none religion saue borne brought vp vnto day wherfore requireth haue consideration saieth wil herein whatsoeuer maye safe conscience emperoure time letteth departe afterwarde vrged sharply letter messagers shall rerited place whilest senate auspurge consulted emperoure placeth souldiours throughe citie righte famous minister church wuolfgange musculus seinge musculus departeth berne godlinesse go wracke senate tunorouse could approue booke departeth thence berne swisserland hale sweuia ihon brentius greate daunger two yeres past time protestantes retourned labor perill bre tiu home emperour came vnto hale much daunger little emperour came thither beginning decembre certain spanish souldioures comming towne went straightwaies vnto house require let el threaten much cruelty beinge receiued many thinges fierselye arrogantlye wherefore biddeth wife family hauing none place repare get hospitall house city little followeth selfe leauinge one home geue vitailes thinges necessary next daye commeth noble man spaine cleargy thrusting oute dores kepeth whole house self going studie searcheth thinges whan founde certaine letter wrytten brentius frendes concerninge trouble time seketh procure much displeasure whan vttred countrye men wherefore followinge aduise frendes cold sharpe winter nighte conueieth self country least presence hinder citezens emperoure come thither shewed clemency semed nothing offended anye kinde doctrine taught brentius last retourned thither executed srunction vnto time emperoure woulde haue men receiue decree made concerning religion beyng commaunded many learned men thorowout germany declare thought boke albeit vnderstode pleannes god line bre tiu owne daunger yet thintent might perfourme hys duetie cogregation pronouceth contrary scripture declareth writing yt came bishop handes granuellan themperours name coma ded thambassadours hale finde meanes might brought bounden auspurge beinge admonished freindes steppeth side countrey longe commeth hale bande spanierdes captaine wherof goeth immediatly house brentius seketh euery diligently might find pray cary away part stuffe conueied frendes alies vnto another place thus therfore whiche taught xxvi yeares exiled wife also thoughe greuous sicknes whereof died shortly banished withall family wherefore wife childre banished pore wretch wandred vp downe vi child knewe become haue refuge men sore afraid spaniardes thing augmented disease sorow knewe meane become husband whan ulrich duke wirtemberge hard misery brentius selfe great daunger yet gaue relief secreatly family furthermore city sweuia following moste parte emperoures authority promised accomplish commaundement wherfore preacher euery remoued diuers place least commit thing vnworthy profession andreas osiander godlie preacher flee cause leauinge norinberge wente lande prusse spire woormez ether one fled also saue selues william earle nassowe suffred erasmus sarcerius depart ye cause moreouer duke fearfulnes yt duke wyrtemberge wirtemberge whose country garrison spaniardes euery hath bene saied whan commaundement came emperour caused boke setforthe recited pulpit commaundeth man thing contrary man wil say masse geueth liberty chargeth subiectes disturbe priest putteth awaye minister church would allow boke amonges whome erardus schueffius emperoure constancy duke saxonie granuellane bishop arras moued duke saxon captiue obey decree followe doctrine boke setforth albeit assaid fair promise shewed hope deliueraunce yet perseuered constante opinion laste yere saithe amoges condicions whiche emperoure propounded wrytten also shoulde approue decree shoulde made counsell concerning religion whan perceiued coulde induced terroure feare pearill assent released condicion neuer moued thing concerning religion whiche certenlye toke steade great benefite cased hereof waighty burthe al condition emperoure pleasure determined parson goodes suffered easelye better wil trusting henceforth shoulde permitted kepe religion free muche vrgeth againe commaundeth subscribe heare protest yt brought vp youth reading holye scripture confyrmed beleue doctrine agree throughly wrytinges prophetes apostle neyther conuicted erroure whiche cause verelye bothe father certaine prince exhibited time past confession doctrine comprised wrytinge referred lawful counsel considering therfore god hathe illuminated knowledge word lawfull forsake truthe knowne vnlesse woulde purchase self euerlasting dampnation wherfore nowe admit thys decree forasmuch dothe manye moste waightye doth agaist coscience procureth hell fyre place dissent holy scripture condempne doctrine iesu christ haue professed hitherto word speach allowe know naughte wicked thinge el painted glosynge wordes delude deuine maiesty emperoure also thing wickednes committed sinne holy ghost wherof christe sinne agaist holy gost hath diligently warned v shall neuer time forgeuen seinge conscience tied bondes earnestly mercy god gaue vnto mankinde oblation sone pray beseche emperoure would take displeasure refusal reteine doctrine professed auspurge soules health setting thinges parte imagine howe miserable life may made partaker life ioy euerlasting heare say moreouer howe reported emperour diuers though nothing regarded religion sought vaine glory thing el know beseche thing coulde happen worlde wished especially thus grose bodye liberty retourne wife child quiet rest home take god witnes also time shall take accompt v doinges respected duke godly mind nothinge el throughe true worshippinge god might enioy inheritance heauenly kingdoe thing hartely desire emperour would certainly beleue fully perswaded thinges hath bene alwaies ready gratify euer shalbe infidelity promesse haue made kepe becommeth iuste man borne noble parentage furthermore beseche remit displeasure lengthe deliuer continuall captiuity reported first prince lead life prisoner perseuered thus constant immouable began hadle somwhat hardly toke bokes scripture cruelty shewed sax prisoner commaunded day forbidden abstaine fleshe preacher also whome emperours licence kept vntil time whan sawe present daunger hanginge ouer head chaunged apparel conueied self awaye priuely time came abrode emperoures court letter lantzgraue saide haue wrytten emperoure saieth hath commaunded wife cou selloures fulfil reast condition satisfy complaine warre past againe saieth hathe boke wrytten religion albeit manye thinges doth wel vnderstand canot affirme scripture yet somuch ground thinges antiquitie authoritye holy father make self wiser doth allow wryting wil deuise also subiectes shall obserue offereth faith seruice whether shall warre turke bishop rome forain kinges swish el wil vse germany besecheth loue christ saintes would lay awaye displeafure set liberty hath bene deteyned prisoner whole yeare suffred punishmente inoughe brought extreme misery moreouer assuraunce geue two sonnes pledge vntill fullye satisfied whatsoeuer way shall prescribe ready accomplishe preuailed nothing praiers ofte time kepers spaniardes remoued fro place place first donauerde norling hailbrune whilest masse set vp germanye put englande thobstinat mind winchester hale sweuia whilest emperoure attempteth thinges germany masse abrogated englande acte parlaiment longe apprehended stephen bishop winchester contended lawes whiche made kinges noonage none effect commau ded yere kepe house come abrode newlye enlarged whan thoughte haue thaimged opinion made sermon king counsell whan declared minde committed warde emperoure xiiii day iune commaundeth red vnto cleargy fourme reformation call ecclesiastical reformatio emperour contained chapiter following ordeininge office ecclesiasticall state monastery scholes hospital house ministration god word ministration sacramentes ceremony masse ceremony churche discipline cleargye laietie pluralitie benefice visitation saintes excommunication amonges thinges setfor chiefly come take holy order diligentlye examined belief maners learning especiallye heresy spread abrode chiefly time whether beleue catholicke apostolicke church rome doth beleue inquisition manner commaunded made paule prescribeth thirde chapter firste epistle timothe paule amonges thinges admonisheth minister church shoulde husbande one wife could well gouerne house obediet faithfull child cleane omitted man admitted office bishop except first priest promise receiue reast order shortly possible bishop take cure shepe fede doctrine sacramentes also visite ofte church ouersee minister theyr dutye wolues wortye flocke monasticall life instituted againe place left scholes nothing taughte excepte agreable catholike church sacramentes ceremony churche ministred latin tounge least people vnderstand come contempte canon masse remaine whole spoken softlye intente tremblable misteries maye retaine theyr aunciet dignitye accustomed ceremony nothinge aultered treblable misteries ye masse salte water hearbes paschall lambe newe frutes also temple church chappels chalice aultares coopes uestmentes uessels belonginge churche hallowed throughe prayer againste deceites deuill inchantmentes taper shall burne churche incense sacrificed moreouer supplication made church dedicated sainctes let cleargye liue temperatelye sobrely eschue whoredome let put awaye concubine el punished ciuile magistrate shall assiste byshoppes reformation made manner discipline ecclesiasticall liberty may wholye mainteined let saintes euerye diocesse put vre againe kepte twise euerye yeare wherein shall inquisition made euerye mannes manner vice suche may otherwise reformed excomunication shall excommunicated let al men flee theyr speach companye receiued againe communion humbly desire forgeuenesse promesse amendment reformation red day saide bishoppes little deliberation confirme saye shortlye come home kepe saines howe diuers thinges desire bishoppe rome maye moued geue assente boke also put forthe printe shewed ambassadoures city howe signified matter home whereas strausburge whiche chiefest longe euer aunswered emperoure calleth vppon granuellan xxviii day iune sendeth ambassadoures whereof iames sturmie menes made strausburge shulde receiue thinterim principall henry hasy interpretoure saieth howe knowe sorte state requested emperoure put truste deuise meane mighte obserued till counsell whiche thinge hathe done accordinglye hathe caused learned men compile booke al prince fewe excepted chiefest city haue approued wheras certaine others intreated themperoure might aduertise theyr senate home grau ted hathe loked euer sence aunswere hath heard nothinge hitherto somewhat offended therefore hathe commaunded knowe theyr meaning whan declared cause longe scilence exhibite theyr aunsweare letter addressed emperoure senate howe wished nothing might gratify thinges theyr citezens perswaded case throughly admit decre shuld bothe hurt owne conscience also osfed god greuously seing wisedome consider terrible thing desire christes sake waightye matter whiche concerneth landes goodes saluation soules life euerlasting would haue consideration hathe done others contrary parte woulde permit also mighte vse religion confessed auspurge vntill decree generall counsel ofte time assembles hathe bene determined compell professe otherwise mouth theyr heart thincketh wil againe foresee city nothing done vnreuerently religion euill opinion take place cause complaint geuen neighboures whan granuella heard letter saieth emperour hath alwais good opinion citie muche moste parte haue commended ratified decree made let thincke exempted commaunded admitte suche kinde aunswer therefore supplication vaiue wherefore let aunswere plainely minde senate hereunto saye matter committed emperoure ambassadours vnderstand euermore politike matter religion supposed alwaies referred counsell partes heard determination might made boke determined manner article religion whithe admit without due examination learned men part heard speake longer controuersy neither neade authority counsell wher diuers prince state haue allowed decree made maruel commoditye haue al thing permitted safe whole haue uyolence vsed religion reaso truthe fourme religion prescribed commaunded forsake opinion haue bene euer controuersy matter neuer heard notwithstanding assembly yt whole cause hathe bene referred generall counsell certainlye compel man thing conscience heauy matter yea though errour detected suppose ther many good men party yet notwithstanding may differ opinion iudgement force vsed matter decided reason truthe argumentes wherefore consideringe thinges whiche concerne religion commit vnto emperoure whatsoeuer haue desire woulde preferre vnto one suite senate know howe greate emperoures power daunger take vp case attempt try matter force wherefore vnlesse parswaded god woulde greuouslye offended confirmation decree starke madnes obey herein granuellan whan repeted former sayinges affirmeth time reconciled emperoure promised obserue thinges enacte wealth empire sort decre made aduise learned men moste parte approued therefore maye refused forso muche agreeth consenteth churche wyll take much vppon thincke se whole church doeth shoulde make departure reast ought haue altered religion common consent whole world wherefore haue none commission let know senate whether wil obey say vnderstode politike gouernement whan cause committed emperoure skilleth vnderstode howe moste part state toke thing againe saye howe suche like ambassadours estranged excluded manner consultation neither called counsell tha time cause referred emperoure wherefore otherwise take sayed yea certain prince also toke sort time made peace wyth emperoure toke vpon obseruaunce feared least fine applied vnto religion thing vnknowen sonne bishop arras also emperoures name promised whole cause religion shoulde referred lawfull counsell wher saieth decree must receiued common act empire refuse burthen common wealth presente ought copelled faith cause concerne theyr soules health life euerlasting againe whole burthen decre reast vpon godly people multitude whiche contempne religion careth nothing ordeined man oughte constrained imbrace faithe put doubte emperoure loueth peace concorde yet neuerthelesse waye taken men shall compelled againste conscience speake muche feared leaste sodaine aulteration raise vp greate commotion boke dede compiled certen learned men whome knowledge truthe dothe well appeare certaine others haue intermixed many thinges consonante scripture doctrine father proued place permitted speake haue made separation others chiefest article agree true churche wherfore desire againe letter mighte deliuered emperoure intent might aduertise senate thing haue commission say began speake angerly vrged decree made digression thinges saide howe noble fraunce made theyr boaste strausburge would admit decre thinge reported emperoure raised suspicion conclusion said emperoure required plaine direct aunswere man dede inforced vnto faith vnderstand christian denye faithe whiche professed may compelled fire wherevnto ambassadoures aunswere brute frenchman haue raised know certaine senate hath yet made decree anye thing el done sollicite seing therefore refuse deliuer letter emperoure intreat make reporte senate fire may man taken life compelled thereby beleue otherwise thus ended theyr talke treated ambassadours city seuerallye sort much like menaced threatninges assigned day shoulde make answere commaunded tarye till aunswere broughte home thinge prescribed ambassadoures strausburge touching monye emperoure required leuied chaunces come state thoughe muche againste willes approued promised also kinge fernando euery yeare duringe truse hondreth thousand crownes desire emperoure againe woulde take awaye hys garrison discharge souldiours placed ouer germanye much hurt towne country releue pore complained much thereof especially since thing quiet peaceable emperoure saieth vrgent cause wherfore time discharge force concerning hurt done emperour wil discharg hy souldioures none knowledge seing doth paye aagainste reason also shoulde anye man wronge suche lyke thinge hathe bene reported heretofore whan inquisition made coulde nothinge manner founde neuerthelesse knowe certaintye man shall escape vnpunished hathe oughte offended time also state graunte emperor maye pleasure constitute iudgemente chamber ioyne vnto iudges assistaunce selues promise beare charge treatye begonne concerninge league saide winedinge vp emperoures prouinces whiche hathe germanye lowe dutchlande belonge house burgundy vnder tuition defence empire contributaries vnto publicke affaire yet maye vse owne lawes iurisdiction germanye shall againe looke like aide defence emperoures prouinces xxi booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles syfte argument xxi booke authoures interim rewarded neuerthelesse many impugned whereof duke saxon accused constance vrged admit interim ambush fotemen laied surprise citie whiche laste receweth interim strausboroughe make theyr purgation emperoure commotion chaunseth bourdeux dispaire spiera recited conuersion uergerius scottishe quene transported fraunce maydenbourge setforth praye admirall englande beheaded strausboroughe contention byshop wittemberge accused adiphoristes wit indifferent newters disputation englande touchinge lordes supper ueruine beheaded fraunce pursute maidenburge death pope paule horrible actes description place election rome maner chusinge pope masse againe strausborough proclamation fraunce lutheranes pope iulius little cardinall last day iune conuention dissolued xix boke shewed howe emperor perswaded men submit selues counsell warrantise wold se thaction shuld lawfull nowe therefore decre made counsel shuld continued tret emperour saith deuise recommeced shortly may thing wha shalbe brought passe requireth especially clergy religion protestant come thither vnder saufeconduit wil take order promes sawefull counsel repeted whole matter shalbe godly christenly decided determined according holy scripture doctrine father affection laid apart selues also shalbe hard speak much shalbe thoughte requisite decree red accustomed especially religion strait charge geue al men obey also declared ides may iii author boke named iho islebie receiued paine taken liberal reward bothe islebi rewarded themperoure emperour also king ferdinando michel sidonie afterward made bishop merseburge saxony wherof arose iest defended bishop rome oyle chresme holy thing necessary saluation intent selues might therby better gresed auoynted long emperour sent letter prince absent especially vnto thought nede commandeth immediatly obey decre teth day iuly wryteth erasmus bishop strausburge see thinge brought passe great trauel put execution wanted conueniet minister take el wher report decree incontinentlye spread abrode farre wide uenetians make proclamation xix daye decre uenetians iuly whosoeuer haue bokes wherin thing wrytten catholicke faith bringe vnto certen men within viii day shall inquisition made suche haue deserued shalbe punished promotours promise reward kepe counsel bishop rome hath ambassadours continually kinges courtes also eies eares many se heare muche oftentimes cause decree made yet senate uenise vseth prouision suffer bishop inquisitor wisdoe uenetians matter religion rome geue sentence iudgemente ioyne alwaies officer lawyer shall heare examination se nothing done malitiouslye cruellye man within iurisdiction law made yere lord mdxxi time inquisitours vsed great cruelty pore men countrye aboute brixia though bene inchauntors medled deuil sence luther doctrine depely roted spred abrode law force stil though bishop gnashe tethe wold neuer fain haue abolished time french king send aid scotland english men amonges others ringraue force germaines emperoure banisheth earle bichlinge huberte sebastiane scherteline al one wryting shortly lawed emperor ringraue counte hedecke recrode riseberge also desireth foreine prince would maintaine gratify herein biddeth whan occasion shal serue loke like hand ladye iane daughter king nauerre affianced maried vii yeres daughter nauarre maried duke ua dome duke cleaue haue specified ioyned mariage duke uandome prince bloud royal elenor french quene sister emperor leauing frauce goeth flaunders duke de ammalle sonne duke guyse whan bene longe suter emperoures nece duchesse lorayne marieth daughter hercules duke farrare time lewes auila spaniard setforth print history germane warre done emperoure wrytten story lewes auila germains war vulgare tonge speaketh takyng marque alberte rochlice sayeth intangled wantounesse woman coulde prosper booke came forthe afterwardes italian latin frenche althoughe emperoure moste straightlye commaunded man wise impugne boke set forth concerning impugned interim religion yet diuers wrytinges published whiche condempne whole doctrine thereof warned meune beware eschewe mooste presente pestilence one caspar aquila chiefe minister church saluelde thuringie thoccasion wrote islebie retourning home auspurge gloried muche boke way said golden world toward aquila also assented hearde answereth moste vehementlye reproueth liynge affirmeth boke ful erroneous opinion fraunce also robert bishop abrincen wrote robert abrince wrote thiuterim contrary sort chieflye dispiseth boke much permitteth priestes marrye common people receiue whole supper lord taketh occasion inuey bucer opprobrious word maryinge seconde wife moreouer one romeus generall austen frier rome wrote againste purpose thus doth boke incurre reprehension euerye side themperour sent ambassadour norinberge certain others perswade vnto decre whan came way godly constancie duke saxon child duke saxon sonnes moued hereunto constantly denied wherfore returne themperour declareth whole matter wherupon themperour solliciteth againe duke theyr father prisoner complaineth sone contemne decre lately made suffer men speake theyr preaching wrytinges requireth therfore would treat content ether thing wherunto maketh answer howe lately declared cause whye hym self could allow doctrin boke setforthe granuellan bishop arras wherfore perswade hys sonnes thyng whych hym selfe quiet conscience besecheth take good part defed childre costancie magnanimiti great aduersity duke saxon beloloued almen got great loue euery wher amogs al men like saxony breme maidenburge also high germanye onlye constance borderynge vppon swiss yet reconciled themperor last obtaining saufcoduit send ambassador auspurge treat peace themperor propoundeth co stance wryte emperoure right hard condition amogs thing also shuld admit boke setforth frame religion thambassadors require haue coditions mitigated vain commaunded make answere certen day knowen senate wryting humble letter ye xiii day iuly beseche yt constrained thing soules health conscience se theyr owne daunger greate parplexitie vnlesse obey stand pearill lose life good shuld follow appetite must abide vengaunce iudgement god wherfore let spare put pore wretch great extremity especially seinge haue offeded others haue thempire house austrich suffred time past exceding great misery refuse charge ca ought performed although treasure smal substance great yet wil geue amendes viii crownes iiii greate peces ordenaunce beseche permit religion whiche haue kept xx yeres vntil decre lawful cou sel unpose heauier burthen citye hable beare bishop ihon wesel also called archbishop londen mentioned xii boke threatned sore auspurge emperor boke setforthe within day died disease praied might fal vpo yt sode palsy say haue sustained great domage loue house austrich thus stadeth emperoure maximilian aid sweuical league wherof haue spoken fourthe boke made warre maximilian warred againste swiss swiss wherfore citye constance league lieth nexte receiued much displesure swiss aided rhoetia seon samaurice whiche lately made felowes also frenche kynge lewes xii length intercession lewes sfortia duke millan matter pacified aboute yeare oure lord thousand fiue hundreth maximilian mariage mary blancke sister sfortia themperor third day august calleth consul senate auspurge diuers others ye chiefest citezens seldus ciuilian speaking muche good wil zele progenitor haue borne saith common welth hath many yeres bene euill seditiously gouerned cause wherof hath bene men none experiece craft nothing le mete haue gouernmet haue bene chosen senator wherfore beareth good city thintent euil may remedied displaceth al reproche vnto common welthes sake comaundeth name red hath apoynted emperour maketh newe senatoures senator nobre welsers relingers butgarners fuggers petingers bindeth oth assigneth vnto euery office function comandeth straitly yt loue comon welth obei decre religion vnto obedient doth also abrogate al fraternity comaundeth vnder pain death yt henceforth ther conueticles assebles abrogateth fraternity made comaundeth yt al wrytings gildes fraternity priuileges fredo immediatly deliuered new senate comaundeth state publike weale proclaimed officer armes geueth charge vnder pain death yt man impugne senate geueth thankes promiseth al due obeisace meane yt thing al gate shut souldiours set warde bene log sute many yeres betwene lantzgraue william erle nassow lordship chat length themperor day decided geuing sentence againste lantzgraue v day month themperour answereth thambassadours city constance bishop arras sendeth away withoute purpose seeth little careful peace saith wil deuise way day spaniardes said went spanyardes go costace party nombre thre thousand fotemen go straite constance departing uberlinge parte passe woodes intent springe daye time knewe people churche sermone might inuade city part againe remained woodes lokinge oportunity time fortuned iii watchman towne hearing noyse wode went see matter chaunced theyr handes whome spaniardes toke manacing deathe made anye signe token leade awaye couche selues pece grounde lake side verye closelye yet espied watche men suburbes beyond rhine geue knowledge captaine ambush laid immediatly signifieth consul ii clocke midnight consul calleth senate commaundeth al arme selues though man knew matter breake day spaniard little little appere yet fewe know nombre watchman ther againe captain watch signifieth consul prouide time whe ther dager hand wherfore yt matter debated four clocke sent oute citye aboute two hondreth citezens suburbes come forth found manner nothing begin somewhat slack beholde whan nowe daye lighte spaniardes theyr ordenaunce beate downe timber walle deuided theyr ditche middes ditch almost dry assaulte thicke fiersly watchman towne straightway also whiche saied remained woodes shewed constance assalted selues like case great force violence breake open one gate citezens fought valeauntly shoting theyr ordenaunce slewe captaine alphose uiues first incountre whan scarsely able stand force great multitude little little retire bridge ouer rhine foughte longe time hardlye laste receiued againe city ennemies battered gate sore discharged great piece walles ouer gate slue many whome tomble bridge rhine whan sawe theyr laboure vaine recule back suburbes set bridge ende fire ende townes men shoulde make salt whan fulfilled theyr filthy luste gather heape dead carcase felowes burne suburbes together man vnderstand many slaine townes men killed aboute hondreth whan alarme geuen constance manner swiss neare neighboures came theyr armure healpe gouernour theyr country time lucerna called back vnder greate penaltye hatred bare religion howe ambassadoures strausburge reasoned matter granuellan declared retourne home thasseble report whole matter senate deliberation senate wryting letter themperor frenche emperor delited frenche tonge deliteth tong ambassadours say retourning lately fro couentio haue declared vnto v hath ben done sent v boke wrytten religion log desire puissant emperor departed auspurge haue exhibited highnes supplicatio wryting wold granuellan receiue cause wryte vnto present first certely desire nothing letter strausburg emperoure world gratify thing touching decre religion thus stadeth calling vnto v deuines city haue perused ouer righte diligentlye albeit thing vtterly dissent fro holy scripture yet much written yt many thing furcher declaratio required shuld hard v troublesome receiue throughly perswaded doctrine ceremony agreable vnto god word nether ca without god displesure hurt conscience forsake alter ye duely examined men also heard hath bene custome since beginning primitiue church doutful matter cotrouersy shuld alwaies discussed lawful cousels way also semed euermore best al conuentious empire whole matter shoulde permitted godlye counsell wherefore beseche loues bloude christe shedde v decree thepire may take place thinge may kepe religion vntil thing determined thautority lawful counsel ther better way foud profitable establish peace loger indure case shal refuse request require v obedience herein desire moste earnestly yt deuines may first hard thintent may declare place iudge ye decre swarue holy scripture thei mai permitted trust assuredly yt shal vnderstad thequity cause mitigate ye decre certenly nothing frowardly obstinatly yt feare god consideration soul helth moueth v thus intreat al thinges shal demene selues yt may rightwel vnderstand howe greate estimation haue excellent maiesty letter comissio lewes grempie ciuilian sent themperour maketh like answer doth others saith none thing determined nether time stad questio cousel shalbe hard sufficietly wherfore geueth comaundement yt within month shew plainly mindes way mentioned toke place themperor letter published doth outlaw constance ther began much busines city remembrance late daunger thexpectation misery come troubled excedingly especially sith ther appered man helpe succour ther diuers also citizen leud talcke heape matter senate therfore costrained oportunity intreateth certaine prince also swiss letter meanes emperoure swiss therfore immediatlye call assembles agree romish religion promise vnder condicion shall receiue decree empire lately made concerning religion admit againe cleargy citye wherefore whan citezens sore vrge senate doth publish decre go voyces preuailed said receiued cried oute vtterlye vndone case shuld longer remain state themperors power exceading great almoste infinite neuer hable resiste whan ordinaunce made people senate aduertiseth swiss done sende ambassadours emperoure fele minde whether coulde conte suffer intercession also intreate vse mercye emperoure made suche aunswere mighte easelye perceiue liked sute saide maruailed greatly would thing suche outlawed wherefore many within city misliked alteration religion got vnto place amonges whiche ambrose blaurer chiefest minister church ther lindauians whiche dwell ouer againste constance ambrose blaurer side lake aunswered emperour righte stoutly afraid example theyr neighbour receiue decree also whan ambassadoure strausburge retourned home auspurge informed senate themperors commaundement ther called great court terme neuer wont done matter great difficulty waighty importaunce numbre iii c xx euery tribe whan gaue suffrage yt part thought mete stand stoutly receiue decre day consult theyr voice somewhat abated permitted certen chosen senatours strausburge cosult interim shuld deuise best way common welth horsme naples far city said wher themperor time departed fro auspurge thought verely yt wold haue come strausburge terror many men yt chanced lately constance wherefore many gentleman marchauntes diuers others fearinge lose substance loth displease themperor whe ye senate house renouced fredome citie wet dwell el without reprehension many emperour remouing auspurge leauing garrison alteration religion state comon wealth marched rest force ulme whan come thither displaceth senatours ordeyneth new co maundeth minister churche prison amongest whiche martin frecht refused decree religion senate wholy addicted themperour receiueth decree conuentio auspurg request granuellan desired frecht repare auspurg helpe forwarde cause religion either plugius sidonie islebie suspected ye matter city ther vocatio refused comauded declare minde thought decre made coprised thesame writing whe themperour come ulme ye senate calleth thother minister ye churche asketh theyr opinion answer shewe thing decree consta cie minister like mislike demaunded preacher auspurge haue receiued othe yet neuerthelesse preache gospell likewyse saye neither knowe haue done neither part render accompt me doinges verely first tyme admitted vocation promyse fidelitie preache doctrine gospell purely syncerely without tradition men senate nowe mislyke waye requyre release othe commau ded go home none called againe certen chosen men senate say vnto emperour day doeth arreste prisoner shal forthwith caried pallace god strengthe spirite muche pleaseth god saye wyll refuse peryll pray agayne thus departing senate house led sergeauntes courte thynkyng haue come emperour long expectation great resort people thei caried senatours house called george besser granuellan byshop arras lodged last beyng let long debate whan granuellan instaunte obey ye emperours decree declared myght doe thei taken vp wt sharp rebuke residue co mauded go litle aside tha thei assay frecht wt getle perseuered still opinion treate also rest seuerally whiche foure remained constat two reuolted granuellan byshop arras also pasius seldus immediatly thei fettered chaines caried comon geale spaniardes germaine soldiours ouer whome iohn erle nassow captain passed freight house brother george chau ced loke wyndowe desired loke freight caried pryso others well wife familie praieth god strengthe fellowes biddeth good coforte saying also caried prison xvi daye august thus deteined four day fift day wha perour went thence fast bonde chaynes caried carte kirchene garded wt cc spaniardes whan remained space eight day vnder altestege captaine germaines comitted ye custody madronio captayne spaniardes ulme came theperour spire thend moneth august whilest came one fro strasburg fetche away yt xii great piece promysed geue yt yeare day kalendes septeber byshop rome request theperour sendeth germany thre byshops fane uerone ferento comissio shalbe declared place themperour making long abode spire whan came mentz went ryuer rhine lowe ducheland leadeth away captiue duke saxon latgraue lately brought thither fro hale sueuia wha wife eftsones ben hu ble duke saxon latgraue led away prysoners suter hym put suerall boates ryuer rhine towne lantgraues called sanguner castell set vpon toppe stepe hyl whan emperour came hither benighted rode ancker setting lande watchemen commaundeth al reste remaine within borde senathe strasburge commaunded sayd aunswere within moneth whan themperour therfore come spire ambassadours sent vnto second day september iames sturmius matthew giger lewys grempe finding spire followed vnto mentz time thei geue knowledge theperour coming ye germain cousellours way serued thepe affaire thei byd follow collo yt mean time yt bishop strasburg seding letter yt clergie wtin citie yt september willeth obey decree thempyre ordeyne thyng fourme prescribed al sendeth themperours letter touching matter sayde writte tenth day iuly moreouer writeth senate also would impeche thambassadours strasburg thei come collon ye viii day september exhibite themperour senate epistle wrytten frenche importaunce al letter strasburgh themp moste triumphant emperour time recociled vnto made promise obserue thing shuld decreed albeit neuer assented cause religion handled wyse yet al thinges yt possible may ready gratifie maiestie ciuile also diuine matter perceiue wel enough highnes rest prince haue consideration doinges reason shuld folow fotesteppes yet notwithstanding beseche eftsones consider muche euery must render vnto god accopt haue iust cause careful saluation forsee yt nothing tyme conscience cause also good hope heard diuines would haue mitigated decree considering referre v counsel say matter shall debated according vnto holy scripture thus contented least shuld seme contentious obstinate refuse byshop strasburge recitueth yt interim citie may set forth order certen church wt v men facultie shal deuise hym church neither wil disturbe thing neither bid citezens repare thither yt may fre euery man followe suche religion shal thinke good hym self yet vnder condicion yt may haue church ye god worde may purely taught sacramets ministred decet ye vulgare tongue wil prouide also yt people shalbe kept order nothing otherwise done semely againe shal comaund yt holy day fasting day kept wil suffer nothing done either sermos place yt may offece vnto others much doctrine hath many yeares ben depely roted men mindes without yt hurt coscience taken away sodenly againe much meane haue shewed highnes decre may take place amogst v besech ye hartiest maner yt graunt requestes suffer v religio vntil tyme counsel shalbe thakeful duty vnto god make chiefly yt peace citie whole prouince themperour heard letter besides thinges iames sturmius great eloquence declared large made answer seldie speaking many thinges zeale towards germany long debating yt length sendeth away sorte go bishop yet vpon condition agre stande arbitrement whan themperour come brabant pleasure haue duke saxon lantgraue sent audenarde towne flauders border brabat dischargeth force brought auspurg haue spoken iudgemet chaber imperial state permitted themperour yt shuld establish first day therfore october reformatio chamber enacted renewed thre aduocates displaced suspicion lutheranisme al rest amongest thinges comauded shuld perseuer ye doctrine ye catholike church el remoued fro place began henry duke bruswicke comence suite protestates ye former war time expulsed dede conditioned wha deliuered prison othe also yt would attempt nothing went conuenaunt also tharchbyshop mentz maister prussia erle nassow reuart counte solmen others moued suit yt latgraue costance lately outlawed wher great perplexitie sawe way saue selues flee co stance geue theselues howse austrich vnto yt last refuge geue selues house austriche euer wherupon kyng ferdinando receiueth tuition sendeth thither immediatly noble man gouernour middes october propoudeth vnto condition shall acknowledge ferdinando child heyres lordes hence forth shewe vnto al faith dew obedience shall reuolte tyme neyther make league confederacie suche lawes statute ferdinando deputes shall make concerning religion matter shal throwly obeye warre affaire thei shall ready tymes ayde serue kyng ferdinando child heyres obediently rest subiectes condition afterwarde receiue othe two day gouernour calleth senate demaudeth somme comon treasure gunnes al fourniture brought accompt comaundeth also townes man weare longe sworde man presume come fortification watche name whiche ye war admonyshed citie daunger reuealed inuentory goodes taken whiche absent flit thence deteined delyuer vp publique writinges man expert therin declare whereunto euery aperteineth co maundeth minister churche depart citie within eight day moneth augustus brother vnto maurice duke saxony taketh wyfe lady anne augustus maried wyfe daughter christian king demarke couenauts mariage condicioned duke maurice assigne portion lades iohn fridericke owne inheritaunce time great co motion guienne saltpits customes head citie countrie burdewx great towne much welth lieth open sea time past vnder dominion englad also chiefly rebelled slaine ye king comotion burdeux lieftenaunt wherfore whan shrewed example shewed thing tended daunger french king sent thither conestable fraunce duke danmal power xxxi enseignes foteme wherof xi almaignes force horseman thing knowen burdeux make meanes ye conestable say yt cotented shal enter frenchme armed beseche suffer germanes come within citie made answer yt thei shuld prescribe germains serue king aswell rest therfore wil doe herein shall thinke good albeit set open gate citie yet hath keyes wherwith vnlock yt wherfore thus entred xix day october wha placed men due order also planted ordenaunce place conuenient first comaundeth citezes bring forth al armure weapon caried castel spent two day third daye began make inquisitio house house great nober slaughter burdeux sedicious persones appreheded came horrible slaughter wer executed wt one kind death also brought forth xiiii gentleme haulters neckes wherof one two executed almaine captaines made intercession rest begged pardon constable soroufull bluddy spectacle lasted xii day besides put death tyme many also condempned galees moreouer wrytinges wherin fredomes priuileges comon wealth conteined burnt themselues making fyre murthered kynges lieftenaunt constable driueth scrape vp earth wherwith couered buried without toole euen nayles finger whan thus scraped ye dead coarse graue buried againe great solemne pompe freers priestes citezens folowe nomber fiue thousande euery man candell hande came conestables lodging bere set downe stayed betwene time doe fall downe vpon knee lamentable crie beseche mercie deteste owne offence geue thankes vnto kyng hath punyshed extremely whan thinges finished ix daye nouember departe thence leauing behinde garnison tyme chaunced maruelous thing italy besydes padwey towne belonging state uenise called citadella herein dwelte citezen named frau ce spiera experte man lawe great pleader fraunces spier lawier cause wonderfull feruent zeale began imbrace doctrine gospel whan profited therin dayly declared home amonges frendes thought euery article also abroad amonges men wheresoeuer came thnig could long hidde length reported boshop rome legate whiche uenise iohn case archbyshop beneuento whan spier vnderstode perceyued easely daunger stode whan therfore taken long deliberation cosulted euery way best done last resolued sent goe speake legate wherfore going uenise confessing errour thought el said feare craueth pardon promiseth obebience henceforth legate although glad voluntary cofession yet example others commaundeth retourning home openly suche thinges hath spoken cotent albeit began euen repent yet recantation instigation frendes affirming ye whole hope also wyfe child substaunce consisted herein obeye shortly fell sickenes body minde began dispayre god mercy therfore aduise frendes caried citadella padwey might haue ready hand helpe good phisitions cofort learned men phisitions iohn paulus crassus bellacata frisimelega sone sawe iudged disase come vehement thought better remedy cosolation mynd wherfore many learned men resorted daily testimony holy scripture whiche declare vnto v great mercy god endeuoured cure mynde sayd could dede denye thynges howbeit concerned nothing muche abiured truthe knowen feare perill affirmed appointed euerlasting tourmentes minde felte sawe already neither could loue god hate exceadingly perseuered neither would nowe eate meate spier wold receiue comforte whan crommed violence oftentymes would spitte againe long recite thinges whiche eyther selfe spake men alledged holy scripture bryng desperatio tyme therfore counselles spent vaine infirmitie body also anguysh mynde increased daily caried home againe dieth dispaire died miserably state desperatio lay sicke padwey came often comfort hym amongest many others peter paule uerger byshop instinople whiche histria towne vnder dominion state uenise hath bene declared fourmer bokes howe byshoppes rome clement paule haue vsed seruice uergerius germany certes hygh fauour king ferdinando whilest hongary much whan daughter catharine borne uergerius george marque brandenburge iohn archebyshop lunden godfather fountestone reuolted byshop rome wonderfull occasion woderfull conuersio uergerius whan sent rome conference wormez whiche beginning yeare ccccc xli said byshop going make newe cardinalles appointed also amongest others priuely whispered eare yt muche familiaritie germains become lutherane uergerius heard cardinall ginucius vnto whome byshop tolde maruelously astonied intent myght pourge hym selfe goeth home countrey begynneth boke whiche intituled apostatas germany whylest confute argumentes tourneth ouer diligently bookes aduersaries pondering depely reason feleth hym selfe taken vanquished casting away hope cardinalshyp goeth brother iohn baptist uergerius vanquisshed force truth byshop citie pole reciting whole matter asketh counsell brother afrayde ye beginning lamenteth case much perswaded hym applie hym selfe searching scripture considered diligently article iustification comparinge sentence together geueth place iudgeth bishop rome doctrine false wherupon reioysed one duty byshops began instruct people istria preache diligently benefite christe imployde vpon mankynde declare workes god requireth v intent myght call men againe true religion sprang vp many aduersaries especially freers suche called obseruauntes reported thing inquisitours chief wherof anniball gryson ioyned commissio hierome mutius inquisitours agaist uergerus whiche wrote inuectiue uergerius set forth boke also wherin hatred religion diffameth germany moste sclaunderous rayling wordes whan grison come pole iustinople rusheth men house searched bokes prohibited whan spoke many thynges sermon cursed wold presente suspected lutheranisme yet promysed lesse punishment vnto suche would come amendement owne fre wyll aske hym pardon would wyllyngly cofesse crime accused others sayde would auenged fyre entringe euery house feared men wherfore founde diuerse accused selues feare refused nothyng nomber rycher sorte pryuely poorer openly constrayned confesse errour suche confessed red newe testament vulgare tongue disswaded moste earnestly abstayne hereafter common multitude whose myndes stryken feare accused one full busely without respect eyther kynred frendshyp benefites sonne spared father wyfe husbande cliente lorde patrone complaintes moste parte triflyng matter suche one reprehended superstitio hereunto added preachinges doctrine uergerius certen daie whan great audience people assembled head churche iustinople inquisitour grison whiche sayed masse pourposly getteth vp pulpet rych vestiment amongs thing intent might thrust sting time saith certen yeares past haue many stormes much vnseasonable weather destroyeth one whyle oliues otherwhyle corne nowe marreth uines eftsones cattell good cause euilles commeth byshop sort heretikes neuer loke better vnlesse first restrayned therfore next way set vpon stone violence uergerius constreined uergerius repareth mantua repaire mantua vnto cardinall hercules gunsage whome familiarly acquainted bothe diuerse rome also iohn case ye byshops legate uenetians admonyshed cardinall letter messenger longer mainteine suche man goeth trent cousel holden time make pourgation whan byshop rome knewe therof albeit rather haue hym deteyned prisoner yet least suspicion aryse namely germany though counsell free wryteth agayne legate permitte hym haue place session commaunde hym departe thence sorte repulsed wet uenise isputont yt counsell bishop legate named exhorteth al meanes would go rome whiche vnderstode dau ger refused fewe day comaunded byshops name retourne iustinople therfore went padwey whylest behelde miserable example rehearsed wherewith wehemently moued whan sene presently wrath god wherwith wretched man stryken began confirmed determined plainly forsake contrie euer go volu tary exile rather place might frely professe christe whiche within fewe monethes taking iourney countrey bergome came rhetia bordering vpont whan preached gospel also vale tely ioyneth uergerius preacheth yt gospell rhetia next vnto italy certen yeares christopher duke wirtemberge sent hym cubinga departed italy byshop polle brother dead suspected poysoned moreouer many notable besides uergerius sawe spiera state amongest others matthewe gribalde ciuilian padwey compry sing wryting whole matter whiche presently saw heard set forth printe uergerius also sigismunde gelowe polonian henry scotte archbyshop beneuento mentioned compyled booke abhominable filthynes archebyshop buggery filthy nothyng deuised nothing ashamed extolle prayse moste detestable vice others yet commonly vsed grece italy meane tyme archebyshoppes germany especially mentz collon treuers euery man owne diocese holde conuocations thintent refourme church order prescribed emperour promised prouince collon bucer taught xv boke specified diuerse minister churche maried wyues although emperours decree permitte mariage priestes tyl counsell determine yet sayed bishop collon appertained lutherians suche folowed churche rome wherfore decree made disanulleth matrimony contracted declareth maried priestes pluct fro wyues incestuouse commaundeth child gotten suche bastardes archebyshop treuers hath small prouince conteining thre byshoprykes metz tully uerdon neded suche lawe priestes place rather haue cocubines tha wyues archebyshopryke selfe appered daunger decreed fellowes iurisdiction mentz moste large vnder hym xii byshops almost hesse also win prouince therfore began instaunt vrge obey ye emperours decree like wyse archebyshop treuers also iurisdictio lantgraues sonnes ruler counsellours heard thinges deafe eares archbyshop mentz sent also frackfurth suffragan michel sidonie first hallowyng church preacheth teacheth maner byshop auspurge compelled certen priestes constante abiure religio doctrine spake frenchman sommer went ayde scottes last bryng away fraunce mary yonge quene daughter heire kyng dead beyng tha syx yeares age might inheritour scotland led fraunce thus take away englyshemen hope optaynyng yeare yt byshop rome created charles uandome frencheman cardinal maximilian austrich arryued spayne maried lady mary themperours daughter phylippe emperours sonne younge prince xxi yeares age sent father prepareth selfe take iourney leauing behinde hym cosin germane brother lawe gouerne empe sonne commeth flaunders common wealth absence whan imbarked set vp sayle xxv daye nouember arriueth gene fiftie galeis many shyppes burthen conduite androwe daurie transported maximilian accompanied great nomber noble amongest others duke alba cardinall trente fewe dayes arriuall remaineth wout walles house androwe daurie admirall meane tyme yt shippes vnlading preparation made citie second daye december entred receiued moste sumptuously furnyshed aswell money thinges mete requisite trauell lande departeth thence eight daye passing alexandria pauie goeth millan pauie great battering peces emperour taken iohn fridericke duke saxon sent thither sayde millan arriued xix daye december set vp euery place triumphant arkes pageos image honorable posy written entring ready receiue receyued milla duke sauoye ambassadours uenise florence ferrare seine tyme bruisselles died maximilian erle bure disease throte called quinancie whan phisition tolde hym saye houre death sone sawe whose name andrew wessel shewed duke manrice decree religio red departed auspurg whan come home assembleth nobilitie state propoundeth whole matter misene declaring vnto emperours mynde vrge emperours promesse also requyre instauntly may suffered kepe styll religion professed auspurge agreed diuines wittemberge lipsia called counsell wherfore met first begge celle last iuterbock thither came also iohn islebie sent fro marque bra denburg decre made thinges indifferent suche meting diuines saxony called adiaphora last conuention lipsia fourme religion written whiche men obserue vnder dominion duke maurice boke afterwardes bred much contention shalbe declared place meane tyme emperours sonne procedeth iourney passing mantua trent cometh auspurge spire passeth lad luke emperour father accompanied amongest others cardinall trent emperour sente mete hym germany goodly nomber horseman conduite duke arescot duke maurice goyng forth mete farre trent rode forth small copany see mantua uenise moste honorably interteyned senate intreated diligetly prince spain would meane emperour lantgraue father lawe whiche also signified vnto muche promysed right gently byddeth hym good comfort yet neuerthelesse admonyshynge hym dissemble matter acknowen therof tyme muche trouble partes barbarie affrica one zeriphius say arrising smal beginning ciuile warres affrica atteyning kingdome erpulsed fesanus kyng hym realme came emperour auspurge complayning misfortune desyryng ayde nicolas byshop metz son anthony duke lorayne tutour duke nephew shewed xvi boke forsaking ecclesiasticall order maried one house eckmount whiche inheritour brabant bishoprike returned cardinal loraine sorte ambassadours strasburge treated emperour collon declared whan retourned home shortly began conferte byshop callyng hym nobilitie sheweth emperours pleasure haue done commaundeth obey chargeth also straightly clergie strasburg followe propounded ouer harde thinges senate xii daye february sending henry cope ambassadour letter emperour saie howe haue treated diligently bishop strasburgs wryteth letter emperour propoundeth suche condition admit retayne thinges whiche decree lately made auspurge doeth permitte graunt muche debating haue sayeth declared vnto shall geue commaundement citezens shall obserue holy dayes absteyne certen dayes fleshe moreouer haue bene hande minister church certen suppose wil owne accorde leaue office preaching wherfore shalbe lawfull free hym v establyshe religion according order prescribed auspurge shalbe let vnto wil also commaunde citezens doe nothing contrary seing thus beseche moste victorious emperour would permitte v minister churche eue maried amongest v put v extremitie especially considering wyll shewe moderation geue none occasion offence shewed magdenburg emperour outlawed refused decree religion lately published displeasure augmented vpon emperour setteth forth new proclamation maketh praye vnto men earnestly thei maidenburg made pray god line admonisheth prince state neighbour make warre annoye meanes possible hath bene tolde howe emperour caused ye preacher ulme appreheded thei length seuenth moneth enlarged third day marche set libertie wha payd charge time yt state england waxed troublesome edwarde trouble england duke somerset yt king vncle protectour realme brother lord admiral coceiued suspicio least cotent perswaded though aspire yt crown wold bring yt king vnder custody admi england b headed wherfore comaudeth appreheded examination condened die yt xx day marche maried quene catherine laste wyfe kyng henry eight also increased suspicion muche emulation enuie woman thought haue bene greatest occasion misauenture bishop strasburge agayne warneth clergie obeye emperours decree churche sainct thomas annual reuenewes wherof cosent senate imployed vpon preacher learned men whiche teache bryng vp yougth traueled chiefly desired know tyme would obeye emperours decree satisfie expectation moreouer mete men purpose ornamentes churche yet remaining thei take time deliberation thomas cranmer archebyshop canturbury primate englande thomas cranmer furtherer learning godlines man excellent learning wholy geue good learnyng auaunce godly religio seing state germany daunger learned men sollicited sondry letter bucher chiefly paulus fagius moste expert hebrew tongue come england promising loue frendship wherfore consent senate first aprill take iurney might sowe sede pure doctrine comming moste acceptable yt kyng self bucer fagius cominto englad maner whole nobilitie people tyme staied whyle lorde canturbury sent vnto cambridge reader first day aprill philippe austriche entreth brussels wonderfull pompe father tyme ambassadours duke maurice electours brandenburg sent sollicite suite vnto prynce philippe cardinall trent great frende duke maurice albeit put lantgraue audenarde good hope yet nothynge brought passe lyttle whyle whan latgraue sickely would haue eaten fleshe certen daye forbidden captaine garded hym commyng way turneth vp dishe botome casteth meat ground tyme byshop strasburge eight byshop strasb singeth first masse yeare least taketh holy order thei terme saith masse calleth conuocation clergie taberne maketh decree commodious theyr pourpose thys sendeth messenger senate strasburge requiring reedifie aultars geue libertie appointe mynisters churche woulde release clergie othe restoore priuileges rendre agayn ornamentes church commaundeth thomistes aunswer directly whether wyll obeye emperours decree speaking first reuerence beare emperour duty vocation large declare vnto hym euery man teacheth doeth wytte diuines phylosophers logician rhetorician suche lyke whiche al profitable scole youth also necessary shewe admitted college consente senate long declaration desyre hym lowely louingly woulde disturbe order well establyshed wyll occupied thinges lesse nedefull contrarywyse ambassadours alledge howe college founded suche exercise scolars neyther ought olde order chaunged amongest whiche finde themselues greued obeye good conscience byshop surely wyl perswade thyng wylles shalbe lawfull geue place common saying let either drynke departe case senate wyl haue professours artes learning within citie reason fynde beare charge abbey landes aunciently appointed vse common treasure byshop predecessour haue nowe bene many yeares impeched iurisdictio may longer suffered thus whan much contended wordes departed without thynge concluded senate whan knew therof make intercession byshop moste gentle letter desyre praye hym would least haue consideration yought taketh great profit rypenes wyt schole thus matter letter messenger sent betwyxt long muche debated tyll laste taken vp arbitrement heafter shalbe sayde bishop whiche euer accompted mylde quiet nature thought haue done muche owne accorde instigation others hym whiche affirmed occasion recoueryng iurisdictio neglected sayd moreouer vnlesse earnest yt matter might feare theperours displea vsed chief doer case christofer welsinger ciuilian sometime student vniuersitie wittemberge againe clergie head church strasburg aduocate iohn tischel doctour yt ciuile lawe last boke mention made wuolfgange prince bipounte decre religio enacted duke swaybrig molested religion sent auspurg whome emperour pressed dry letter obeye decree muche referred matter byshoppes emperour demaundeth hym whether wyll ratifie decree whether wyll displace minister churche wil obeye wherupon writing letter themperour frenche repeteth fewe wordes done somer auspurg saieth howe retourne home set forth vnto people part decree concerned holy day fasting day comaunding obserued howe hath also red ouer diligently oftener decree religio graunteth therin many thinges consonant faith loketh eternal saluation ther many thing also differ much neuerthelesse hath charged preacher minister churche way euery thing diligently declare vnto suppose thing may instituted al one voice affirme allowe al thinges quiet conscience thought part compell worke conscience wherfore required byshops yt selues wold take order thing haue aunswered hath certified heretofore good hope nothing shuld required saith much wil haue direct answer mightie emperour wyl say myne opinio first playne trouth concerning religio rite ceremony haue bene certen yeres obserued within dominio verely borne brought vp fame haue also shewed cesar eue vntil day neuer heard kind doctrine moreouer haue bestowed study paine therin farre forth wyt able coceaue appereth plainly agreable vnto god worde must nedes confesse seing asked question least hurt myne co science litle regarde saluatio cosideratio also approue decre otherwise willing ready yt maner exaple mine auncestours thing howebeit highnes whiche supreme magistrate maye determine herein shall seme good vnto wholy pleasure beseche constrayned doe myne owne iudgement yet people vnder dominion touching minister churche desyred last letter might tary licence christening chyldren visityng sicke chiefly tyll others substitute place notwithstanding shall commaunde departe immediatly abydyng tyll others come albeit thesame shalbe great grief hynderaunce people yet shal done accordingly many gone already thinges may ought perfourmed know loialtie obeysaunce must shewed time dominion duke maurice great apparence inter confuted lubeck others religion altered minister preacher lubeck luneburge hamburge compiled boke wherin confuted full booke decree auspurge wherof chief authour iohn epine moreouer doctours maydenburg nicolas amstorfe especially matthie flacie borne citie albone slauonie nicolas ganles bende selues earnestly diuines wittemberge lipsia many little bookes set forth reprehende though deale dissemblyngly shoulde indifferent meane thynges set open waye romish religion finally adiaphora place generall rule rite ceremony al though owne nature indifferent longer meane thynges whan force opinion holines necessitie byndeth men whan occasion wickednes therby geuen flacie bene certen yeares phillippe melanchthon schollar contentio went magdeburg setting forth boke afterwarde wherin declareth cause furthermore hamburge addressinge letter wittemberge especially melanchthon doe recite call indifferent meane thynges declare case ought admitted desyryng also wryte thynge would haue comprysed vnder name intente men maye haue certen thynge followe wauer theyr myndes least name indifferent thynges geue occasion sondrye errours whiche may crepe lyttle lyttle unto ye epistle melanchtho maketh answer amogst thinges sayeth bodage borne withall annexed wickednes archebyshop mentz melanchton defendeth yt adiaphorist beginning may holdeth counsell prouinciall decree wherof setteth forth boke afterward lykewyse archebyshoppes treuers collon hath also large prouince booke amonges thynges establysheth confession admitted lordes supper vnlesse first confessed hallowyng salt water thynges exorcismes praiers prepared say vse faithful men reliques inuocation adoration saincts pilgrimage prayer dead pourgatory fasting choyse meates canonical houres terme tremblable misteries masse unto synode came maurice byshop eistet residue sente ambassadours ordynaunce hallowyng consecratyng aparteineth many matter euery seuenth daye whiche called sonday whan many people churche priest exorciseth terme first salte water whan hath mixed salte water together force holy water sprincleth people withall sprinklyng thought geue health body soule dryue awaye disceiptes deuyll clense men also thing without lyfe cast vpon grounde vpon stone throwen dead men graues priest praieth god geue vertue strength sorte also salte handled christening chyldren whan consecrate priest putteth chyldes mouth co maundeth deuil come thrise ducketh infant water oyle wherin dippeth thombe annointeth brest shoulder childe woman also childebed wha come churched first entring churche dore purified water finally serueth many v chiefly whan haue spirites nyght practise coniuryng hallowe certen prayer whatsoeuer apperteyneth apparell priestes moreouer water fountstone taper candels palmes paschall lambe terme made waxe egges fleshe chese bako flowres herbes fruictes tree vpon thynges cast forsayd water churche must buylded byshop suffragan layeth first stone foundation hallowyng church throweth salt water edified goeth thrise first sprinkleth vpper walles middle lowest crosier staffe maketh signe crosse vpon highest walles deuill approche entring churche whan certen songes ended priest stroweth ash similitude crosse done bishop staffe wryteth greke letter ash left syde crosse latin letter ryght afterwarde casteth water mixed salte wyne ash wherwith sprincleth churche agayne exhorteth people bountefulnes liberalitie lyke sorte belle vsed first forsouth must hange byshop may goe round hallowyng belle whiche hath sayde certen psalmes consecrateth water salte mingleth together wherwith washeth belle diligetly within without wypeth drie holy oyle draweth signe crosse prayeth god whan shall rynge sounde bell disceiptes deuyll may vanyshe away hayle thodryng lightening wyndes tempestes vntemperate weather may aswaged whan hath wipte crosse oyle wyth linen cloth maketh seue cross within one saying certen psalmes taketh payre sensours senseth belwithin prayeth god sende good lucke many place make great dyner kepe feast solemne wedding hallowe aultars thus take oyle cresme pounde frankesense panne hote hallowyng aultars coales salt water wyne ash hyssope one canuas clothe wipe finer softer couer fiue cross waxe chalice morter two taper finally whatsoeaperteineth furniture aultar meane season byshop priestes saye certen psalmes prayer doeth sprinkle altar fiue sondry place bestowyng water representeth ye signe crosse goeth seue tymes aultar casteth theron water tempered wyne hyssope asshes moreouer tempereth morter water powreth aboute aultar streight wayes brought forth solemnely reliques sainctes whiche sensed agayn sayde vp place byshop swingeth aultar thryse sensours deliuereth yt priest senseth continually til hallowyng al finished whan hath drawen vpon aultar thre cross oyle seuerall place powreth oyle suppleth takyng fyue small piece frankensence many cross made waxe placeth setteth fyre asshes gathered therof kept holy thinges finally anoynteth foure corner edge also forefront aultar singeth masse oyle chresme call made euery wheare maundy thursday passion weke next easter tymes past great reuerence estimation men whan luther hym others taught howe al creature cosecrated mouth luther brought cotempt popysh ceremony god tyme created whole worlde gere came contempt mockery full iugglyng trompery nowe therfore byshoppes germany hauynge wynde wyll restore bryng home agayne death lyfe touchyng makyng holy water terme decree bishop rome lawe whiche ascribe alexander fifte byshop saint peter intent thyng may credite authoritie reason antiquitie therof howe pope legate yt emperour byshop rome sent thre byshoppes germany spoken whan came themperour brusselles xxv daye may declare first commission beginning bishop rome reciteth ful care haue torne lordes cote howbeit two thynges comforte hym chiefly first christ selfe prophecie sathan assault churche yet vayne secondarely generall counsell may taken away al suche thinges wickedly crept much ye fruict cousel come already natios amogs germains yet nothing done reason diuers dissentios religio ther therfore hath partly mere motion office pastoral partly also themperours request consent senate cardinalles sent forth certen byshops whiche haue authoritie receiue vnto grace ar willing retourne bosom churche promesse al ioyful thinges clemencie great benignitie content receiue lawes prescribe benefite verely grauteth al men general degre al also crime sort excepted though haue continued neuer many yeares yet yt offendours confesse errours sinnes catholike priest suche penaunce shal therfore inioyne open confession abiuring satisfaction lawes prescribed doeth vtterly remitte forgeue hath geuen also byshoppes ambassadours full power authoritie vnlose suche bounden lutherians conuenasit promesse othe bondes absolue monkes falle heresie haue forsaken house permitte chaunging coates serue vocation churche moreouer geue pardon eate milke butter chese egges fleshe hauing pope graunteth licence eate fleshe respect place persone finally permit receiue whole supper lorde laying asyde errours shall allowe decree counsel constance whiche openly confesse muche receiued vnder one kynde vnder churche erred making decre one kynde may graunted certen tyme shalbe thought mete yet selues doe seuerally tyme place tyme whan others doe receiue vnder one kynde lastly haue authoritie compounde possessioners churche landes fruictes receiued spent wyll departe possession hencesorth furthermore punishe obstinate persones censure churche herein craue assistaunce magistrate lykewyse chouse substitute byshoppes throughout germany whiche shall put thing execution ambassadours rome followynge commission place thought moste nedefull substitute byshops wherof byshop strasburg one whome commaunded execute thinges rehersed finally receiue fauour ecclesiastical person first would forsake put away wyues saye howe went emperour haue coference hym touchyng measure maner execution vnderstode possible go vnto al place whiche nede remedy necessitie suborned others graunte indulgence terme byshoppe rome emperour sendeth immediatly byshoppes germany warneth seuerally handle matter gently peaseably first trye archbyshop meiz councelloure yt lantgraue assay al wayes fayre speach exhortation praiers come excommunication cursyng wherfore archebyshop metz addressing letter diuerse others also gouernours counsellours yt latgraue speakyng many thynges cure charge pastorall emperours fayth dilygence requyreth exhibite order sent byshop rome minister churche commaunding obeye preacher moued herein saye doctrine consonant doctrine prophetes apostle godly answer yt preacher lyfe selfe dede doeth aunwere profession yet thei acknowledge errour doctrine wherfore thei haue nede byshops indulgence haue preferred mariage filthie sengle lyfe accordinge vnto god worde neither forsake child wyues whome christ self commaundeth embrace loue fidelitie beneuolence ther church receyue lordes supper wholy done commaundement christe custome primatiue churche wyll admit alteration herein moneth may open disputatio oxforde betwene peter martyr open disputation oxforde diuines vniuersitie cocerning lordes supper presence christ body conclusion dyd martyr set vp defende substaunce bread wyne chaunged body bloud christe carnally corporally bread wyne vnited sacramentally afterwarde set forthe boke wherin presidentes disputation appointed kynges commaundemet sufficiently declare martyr maistrie contention tenth day moneth iune quene frauce crowned sainct denis accustomed cardinalles bolon gwise chattilion uandome bourbon al rest rome vi daye kyng maruelous goodly trayne richely apparrelled entreth paris king receiued paris head citie realme bene yet sene opely synce death father two day quene whyles soiourned diuers put executio lutheranisme whiche sayde behelde selfe erecution done sight king co maundeth go procession fourth day iuly comaundeth go procession euery church next day publisheth wryting prynte declaring cause therof might geue god thankes manifold benefites imployed vpo might praye god preseruation hym selfe wyfe child whole realme commo wealth comende vnto soules godly chiefly kinges frauce progenitours father lately departed whose example fully prefixed vndertake defence tuition catholique fayth religion authoritie liberty see apostolique minister churche amogest cause also one principall mygh openly knowen howe muche abhorreth whiche contrary christes commaundement contrary tradition apostle consent al antiquitie denie presence body bloude christe whiche take away vertue strength baptisme penaunce good workes sacramentes whiche vtterly co temne authoritie churche order archepreistship whiche reiecte praying adoration reliques saintes moreouer deuoute supplication might testifie opinion mynde verely example progenitours certen imitation inheritauce doeth thinke beleue opinion doeth catholique churche crede apostle first counsell nice many counselles holy father fully determined bannish realme dominion heresy long since condemned tyme partely reuined partly inuented luther carolostadius zwinglius oecolampadius melanchthon bucer caluine suche archeheretikes monstrouse pestiferous persones punishe moste extremely suche shall offende herein wryting setforth vulgare togue sendeth abroade partes fraunce commaunding go procession place declare vnto people long beheaded monsour ueruine rendring ueruine beheaded towne castel boloigne king englad spoken xv boke father lawe mouns dubees aged gouernour al boloignois one foure mreschalles fraunce codemneth perpetuall prison diuerse monethes past sollicited swiss renewe league whiche made father although emperour letter intermesse gers greatly disswade yet neuerthelesse thought expedient pourpose assente ther unto first dede romishe religion lepontians ualesians also basill schafusians wherat many men marueled greatly reason forsayd proclamation execution moste men supposed ought enter league societie whiche cruelly persecuted true religio codemned church doctours name berne zurick followyng counsel zwinglius haue shewed third sixt boke abstained fro league conuocation lipsia mentioned couocatio lipsia many sayd complained romish religion litle litle restored duke maurice fourth day iuly addressing letter lieftenauntes sayeth heareth ther many partly ouermuch carefulnes partly perswaded others feare least olde errours one restored certen minister churche busy braines troublesome persones fre sclauder hath verely sodry time heretofore declared ope wryting minde purpose sclaunders doth repete againe intent may shewe testifie hath especial care religion wherfore desireth either lightnes belief perswasio others feare alteration lay al feare aparte geue credit wryting testimonie cocerning bring vp suche reportes let thinke escape vnpunished continue howbeit decree lately made lipsia gathered certen chapter commaundement taught preached let inquire therfore learne vnderstand whether minister churche followe fourme whether reprehend sermon euer commaudeth aduertyse doubtes shall aryse repare yt diuines wittemberge lipsia thinges declared vnto people day departed ye latgraues wyfe mother lawe duke maurice whiche pined awaye care sorow husbandes imprisonment time people rebelled england two cause one landes comons enclosed people complayned rebellion englande nobilitie taken much groud whiche lay comon inclosed imparked dere priuate v others deuonshire demauded thesame also chiefly offeded thalteratio religion wold haue syx article wherof metioned xii boke restored tyme therfore flocked together armure matter ful daunger neither would admonition take place kyng cousel though moste vnwilling sende forth force disconfite sondry place certen thousandes slayne french king espiyng occasion gaped bolain lost prepareth army spedely partly force partly french king stealeth fortes surrendrie taketh certain castels fortes sea coaste betwixt bolain caleis meanes putteth soldiors bolain extremity lordes england toke misfortune greuously lorde protector ye kinges vncle gouernmente whole faulte imputed time furnished place thing necessary blame enuy increasing daily protector beginning octobre common assent noble appreheded windsore king time brought towre london prisoner lord afterward declare vnto people cause charge euil gouernement common wealth setforth proclamation print wherunto testimony euery subscribeth name amonges ihon earle warwicke principal meane french king attempteth thinges englishman themperour leadeth sone throughe king philip inuested flaunders flaunders henault artois sweareth people true loyall vnto retourne andwarp viii daye septembre themperors sonne receiued pageauntes showes sumptuous townes men also marchaunts straungers spaniardes italian germanes english men accopanied aunt regent goeth also thother prouinces receiue theyr fidelity oth tolde senate senate strausburge co pounde bishop strausburge sent ambassadour emperour abate controuersy theyr bishop wherefore themperors permission chosen certain arbitrers bothe party whan met monthe october long disceptation senate permitteth bishop iii church may establish therin religion according decree lately made moreouer receiueth cleargye faithe tuition bishop againe couenaunteth graunteth senate colledge saint thomas maintenaunce schole rest church cleargy also payeth senate yerely tribute mony thinges obtain immunity fredome emperour setforthe proclamation pearil fear mayden burge maydenburge haue declared called state saxonye aid many refused yt thother state saxony also thempire would menne lubecke luneburge consente themperors deputy going maidenburge assaied make reconcilemente vaine tune man impugne openly much outlawed euermore daunger nether might withoute pearill life good depart yt city lawful euery man trye fortune therfore senate coplaind thiniuries neighbor publicke letter setforth another wryting vnto al men general chiefly next neighbor say selanderously reported theyr purgation though arrogantly proudly demeane selues themperor thempire forsake peace wryte many contumelious thing herein sustain great wrong acknowledge charles themperor theyr supreme magistrate haue opely proclaimed nothing said misse state nether anye cause displeasure say professe gospell word ca get pardon god thother slaunders deuised forged theyr enuemies howe desyrous peace vnknowen haue bene last conuentions vnderstand also know experiece swete ye name peace comfortable thing againe euils warre bryngeth moreouer shuld greuous displesaunt theyr neighbour theyr sake daunger receiue domage furthermore confesse neyther lawfull neyther theyr power obstinately resist themperour thempire beyng dryuen necessitye defende selues theyrs iniury haue beaten downe certayne buildinges haue taken certen hold smal townes village time warre minding kepe selues shuld come hand foraine nation neyther refuse rendre theyr neighbor attempt nothing two cause chieflye wherefore obteyne peace fyrste retain doctrin gospell refuse romyshe idoll secondlye condicions peace propounded greuous also intollerable altogether cannot performed shuld betray theyr liberty geuen themperor great otto first name haue receiued theyr elder maintained vnto day reaso defended excused time come nowe also appeareth manifestly sene thing authoures booke made auspurge intended went indeuonred plucke awaye men chief article doctrine iustification force saluation called doubte also lordes supper marriage priestes moreouer teach inuocation deade men euer dependeth furthermore go restore papistry hath bene declared many excellent learned men certainly great wickednes woulde winked passed ouer silence yea god called continuall praier suffer glory name thus polluted assuredly heauye sorowful sight men violently inforced false religion idolatry minister churche cast prison wyth theyr wiues chyldren dryuen exile also myseserablye slaine much lamented albeit thinges openly sene especiallye vpper partes germanye yet men dare affirme religion impugned howe newes euer
