synce worlde began state good godly menne hathe bene alwaies suffer affliction againe many example old newe testamente declare constancy holy men vsed whan kinges prince setforth theyr proclamation contrary god word suche case alwaies force wrytten holy scripture howe oughte rather obeye god men hathe chrisostome austen ambrose holy men taught also perfourmed dede whan emperoures commaunded thinge againste commaundementes god like case present se da ger yet may otherwise must soner abide pearill praise receiue manifest error wrytten gordius martir beinge requested sayinge gordi martyr frendes whan caried execution sauinge life woulde forsake opinion aunsweared tonge ought speake thinge reproche made thing aswel apperteineth vnto al opinio bothe aunciente churche also certaine fyrste betray truthe yt hold sylence bishoppes rome betray truth whiche teache false doctrine also suche dare professe openlye defende truthe knowen wherefore whole case muste comitted god nether ought ether yt plesure fearce peril forsake professio yt ueritie set eies thexample daniel cotrary yt proclamatio king darius worshipped god wt windowes set open euerye side certes mighte haue done priuatelye closelye withoute daunger much thing concerned profession faith glory god holy name great constant courage called vpon god openlye respect daunger procured aduersaries lighted theyr owne heades wherefore beseche men attempte force warre againste whiche member true churche woulde followe herein steppe christiane souldioures former time whych dede would obey whan themperoures warres required theyr seruice againste christian proued example saincte moris martir howe greuouslye also god offended israelite afraid multitude ennemies healpe theyr weake felowes expressed boke iudges mighte doctrine al men forsake necessitye brother fellowes religion also ayde succoure doubte nothing yt good men moued thinges god liueth immortall hath full oft time past shewed mighty power right hande nowe also declare desyre also hartely would cause letter exhibited emperor king ferdinando prince state also make intercession extremity wrought wil refuse nothing may godly honestly performed require moreouer would commend vnto god praiers thend verely yt xample niniuites may bottom harte bewail sinnes hartely sigh vnto god may boldly professe doctrine gospel whiche hathe nowe xxx yeares bene preached may set forth godlines life may shew worckes loue vnto men chiefly minister church banished exiled theyr child wiues suche miserable people may kepe holsome doctrine pure safe deceites vnder pretence restoringe ceremony bryng againe whole rabble romishe doctrin month octobre fraunces duke matua sonne duke fridericke marieth lady katherine daughter ferdinando kinge romaine tenth day noue bre departeth life bishop rome paule thirde deathe pope paul third whan liued lxxxii yeres daye died released customes imposed vpon saltpits diuers thinges without sighing people certaine monethes treated emperoure restitution placence vaine liued longer thought verely woulde haue taken french kinges part euer sence murther sonne peter aloise imagined reuenged bodye caried chappell bishop sixtus remained iii day many people resorted thither kisse fete put boke italia pope iron grate manner lefte life came forthe italian booke againste sore vehemente vnder title barnardinus ochinus compiled thoughte others preface aschanius colomnois banished boke amonges thinges ouer longe recite adressinge talcke towardes callinge antichriste time innocentius bishop rome thou wast saieth committed prison prelate moste abhominable two detestable murthers committing paracidie wit poysoninge thy mother nephew thine whole inheritaunce might descend vnto set liberty nothinge ashamed sue purple sister whore made cardinal hat man greate wickednes thrise repulsed colledge cardinal owne natural sister iulia farnesia length obteined sute threatned high bishop wold longer commaundement bishop alexander sixt fearing anger displesure chose fellowship cardinal also poysoned sister youres halfe whorishe custome familye whan ambassador prouince aucona time iulye seconde bishop rome full naughtely begiled maid citye dissemblinge making beleue wer gentleman attending vpon ambassadour defloured shameful acte maides vncle cardinall aucona charged earnestly cleinent seueth prysoner citye taken nicholas quercey toke wife laura farnesia monstrus lechery pope thy nece gaue iobbe hys dagger scarre thereof remaineth daye shoulde speake thy daughter custaunce wyth whome thou haste ofte offended end thou mightest haue frelye thy pleasure thou diddest poysone husbande bosius sfortia perceiuing wickednes toke inward thoughte neuer sene mery filthy lust assuredlye passe farre emperours commodus heliogabalus may well proued many bastardes haue lot lay daughter ignorauntly whan made droncke thou sobre hast medled thy nece also thy sister daughter nowe whiche thine vngratious sonne peter aloise bishop fane shameful spoken horrible crime bishop clemente deteined prisoner castell aungele sente ambassadour emperor recouering liberty thou wouldest take thy iourney geuen bishoppricke parma thy nephew farnesius ten yeres old done disceiued neuerthelesse whan came gene fained selfe sicke marchaundise haste thou made church goodes cardinall since thou waste pope rauening made bishop liuing god filthelye haste thou consumed goodes church rome art thou ashamed haue bestowed high office gouernemente vppon thine vngratious sonne forty thousande ducat yearely muche manner thy nephew octauius speake vnreasonable substaunce thou hast wasted vpon wemen thy house vppon thy neces sanflorians thou darest make mention turkes like inuade pore italy thou doest intente thou mightest haue occasion polle people whiche vnder thy gouernmente sustaine mooste heauy intollerable burthen thou diddest sell duke farrare mutina reso thou hast aliened city parma placence church rome whiche neuer begotten bishop clemente verely ashamed thintent thou mightest enrich thine house family thou hast handled others contrary righte equity could refused beare burthen bondage thou hast persecuted warre perusines declare amongs others ascanius columnois taketh yerely subiectes ordinarye iii c ducates oft imposeth new customes one salt thinges exacteth tenthes nowe moytie fruites ought verely taken enemye christen bloud turkish nauy bishoppricke sailed costes church rome without damage long sence time barbarous entred sea wherfore secreat trafficke thou haste infidel cutteth occasion thou canst hereafter pretend yt name turkishe warre yet meane season dare bold taunt kinge fraunce kepinge frendship protestantes emperoure king england great shame thou shouldest wholy depend vpon astrology paule geuen astrology coniuratio necromantie thing denied expert science thou hast auaunced honor giftes promotios cesius marcellus gauricus portugal others thing vndoubtedly doth manifestly reproue vngodlines misbeliefe cause sufficiente enoughe whyche thou oughtest deposed thy seate many suche like thinges contained foresaid boke hadde printe let v retourne dead coarse ix day began buriall made nine day together meane assemble cardinal chuse newe pope season cardinal absent repare citye spede trent mantua cibo montane auspurge auria urbine buriall firste came thither cardinall trent mantua marriage mentioned whan word broughte bishop death funerall charge amount fifty thousand crownes xviii day nouembre masse done went conclaue call chuse new bishop fourth day december cardinal pacieco spaniard came thither trent xii day came cardinall bellay uandome chastilion guise tournon thend yt moneth bolon ambois lorayne also bourbon man great yeres frenchman many rome whome king sent thither two yeres past shewed xix boke muche come place shall misse declare certain thing ther palace rome mount uaticane ioyning church saint peter wherein dwell high bishop whan occasion serueth call senate cardinal palace amonges buildinges fiue halle galary thre score ten pas longe two chappels together make called yt conclaue one chappell appoyn e saye masse take theyr voyces foresaid haulles cardinal haue theyr mansion time deathe paule much cardinal nombre fifty four many chamber prepared conclaue tymes past many dores nowe shut vp sauinge one dore moreouer glase windowes chappels height man reach wherfore nether ayre lighte pearseth thither burne waxe lightes day night nowe haue theyr chamber builded xiiii fote wide xvi fote long xii fote depe nether brick stone timber cloth ether uiolet grene commodious others draw lotte auoid displeasure enuy euery hall hath ii rowes chamber space within limites must cardinal kepe selues family houshold stuffe euery cardinal alowed iiii seruauntes lie chamber alwaies wait vpon whilest reast make bed thinges necessarye againe xii appoynted generall whiche make cleane chamber conuey filthe ordure place assigned within compelled remain vnlesse fall sicke whan gone receiued except cardinal whan come conclaue election straightwaies chosen iii iiii cardinalles shall prouide thinges necessary answer ambassadours kinges prince haue one key gate spake nobility rome hath third haue bishop fourth master ceremony gate vnlocked comen conclaue vnlesse comming cardinal master ceremonis gate little wicket wherof master ceremony haue kay time dinner supper opened meat brought kitchins without ready certain bishop apoynted purpose search diligently euery piece meat letter conueied therin priuely doth master ceremony receiue dish deliuer cardinal seruaunts wicket man el may suffred approche neare meat serued earthen platter wine flages glasse daily brought new loke vessel serued old custom fee master ceremony gather vp right diligentlye fine bothe stuffe workmanship sold deare time watched without farre palace gate v c fotemen italian leadinge county custody yt coclaue petilia againe garde swiss serued paule thyrd light horsmen gentleman rome ambassador kinges prince last next gate bishop mentioned searcher meate defence city placed iiii souldiours coduit oracius farnesius besides priuate house cardinal noble men also certain bondes souldiors wil speake thelection albeit wonte olde time enter conclaue x day bishoppes departure yet death paule thirde matter differed vntil xix day xxix day nouembre said day cardinal entring conclaue litle euening binde vnto othe nobility rome capitaines centurion appoynted defence city resort euery man family owne chamber commaund others depart conclaue cardinal bishop priestes deacos went election certain lawes recited selues vse make according yt state time concerne fredomes priuileges cardinal first therfore othes cardinal sworne chaunce chosen byshop obserue thinges exactly moreouer wyll chuse whome shal thincke comfortable commune weale go matter second day december master ceremony ringing maner chuse pope little bell conclaue calleth al masse finished brought vnto euery cardinall chaire therin pece paper conteining name cardinal aultar chappel set table couered purple cloth vppon set chalice siluer bell table sixe stole euery cardinall wryteth voyce little paper afterward foldeth vp signeth sort name chosen doth appeare euerye man arisinge order goeth kneleth downe aultare haue prayed put paper chalice sit downe againe theyr place done two bishop many priestes many deacon sit downe vpon sixe stole fyrst bishop taketh chalice paper ordre deliuereth first deacon vnfoldeth loud voyce readeth name elected also thelectaure cardinal haue euery one paper wherin theyr name wrytten said adde vnto euery name red pronounced nombre voyces geuen accompt thus made firste priest hath also paper conteining name cardinal doth pronounce many voyces euerye man hathe nombre required paper cast againe chalice doth deacon ring siluer bel straightwais commeth master ceremony tarieth without bringing fire panne cole burneth little paper euery cardinall maye one time geue foure seuerall voyces didiuers men chaunceth seldome verelye manner theyr election nowe let v retourne purpose cardinal thus inclosed second day septebre said begin matter wet slowly heard say cardinal fraunce co ming many men supposed haue sene newe bishop rome christmas expectation vaine cardinalles deuided thre partes faction thre factios cardinal whereof one emperoure another frenche king third farnesians frenchman wold haue chosen cardinall traues saluiate rodulphe lorayne theatine imperialles pole burges carpes crucey moron sfoudrate poole saluiate great brute raised city would thing kept closely haue said yet much oft time diuers went oute conclaue eyther cause faining sicknes could kept secreate much said emperoure frenche kinge aduertised done cause cardinall poole obteined place throughe meanes cause pole pope cardinall theatine said reported smelled lutheranisme many italy others also bear witnes right iudgemente concerninge true doctrine said tenth boke time manye pilgrimes rome whyche come thyther oute diuers country nation thentent might beginning new yere commonly called yere iubeley receiue cleane remission forgeuenes theyr sinnes upon christmas euen resorted porche peter church hoping wel called golden gate haue bene opened newe bishop albeit long delay displeasaunte yet thoughte good depart election paste matter yeare iubiley standeth thus bonifacius viii bishop rome yere oure lorde cc xcv ordeined yeare iubiley firste men commaunded renued euery c yere promised vnto shuld come rome ther make deuoute prayer sepulchre peter paule ful remission al theyr sinnes death whan thys distance time serued ouer long clemet sixt reduced vnto fifty yeres whose decre also remaineth wherin commaundeth angel carry vp heauenly kingdome died time pilgrimage sixtus fourth decreed benefite graunted men euery xxv yere whan therfore yere incarnation christ md l hand paule third fewe monethes sente abrode letter vnto nation earnestly exhortinge let passe goodly occasion vnburtheninge theyr sinnes obteining kingdome heauen self also reioysed much liued vnto time sayd day wold delectable wherin deserue wel mankinde ioy effectuall fewe wekes paules ioye vain day greatly desired departed specified paulus fagius went bucer englad end nouembre died cambridge feuer quartane matter taken vp arbitrement betwixt bishop strausburge senate haue shewed bishop intended begin thing church christmasse prescribed cleargye ordre whiche followe fully furnished differred till first february thre temple senate composition graunted priestes begin againe fyrst sing theyr euensong next day masse space xxi yeares hadde bene omitted great concourse especially yong people vnto strage straunge sight neuer hard sight neuer heard see manye shauen crownes new kind apparel whiche sange man could vnderstand taper lampes burning noone dayes smoking perfuming sensours se priest minister standing aultare pronouncing al thinges strage language vsing manye curtesies sondrye gesture bowynge downe handes fast closed one castinge abrode hys armes bringing somtime turning self cry loud muttering something great secreatnes somtime loking vp loft somtime ground cannot stand stil place remouinge right hand left hand aultare crosse blesse finger breethe chalice lifte vp highe set downe againe certaine place name one quicke dead break host call put chalice knocke breaste wyth fist sigh wincke thoughe slepe wake againe eat one part bread suppe reaste wyth wine least drop remaine washe handes crosse blesse gilt patent put foreheade breast kisse one aultare another image inclosed timbre metall thinges say like yong people beheld without great maruel wonder certainly without laughter could hardly kept vnder none certain priest procured thither place maketh sermon head church wher great audience yet diuers resorted wot new thing certaine yonge man make noyse know trouble thurch strausburg whome one sergeaunts rebuked made busines though would haue caried pryson youth came al flocking suche case commonly sene arose vprore tumult euery man inquireth matter stirre vp churche wherupon preacher thought verely bene sedition raised sore afraid owne part went downe sodenly pulpit fellowes let chauncel fesed dores iron al priestes amongs certain prebendary church borne noble house sitting neare pulpit heare conueied selues also quickly knowing would come therof whole matter immediatly declared consul pretour reaste senate hearinge sermones church came haste appeass tumulte came quieted besides fewe younge men man stirred wherefore senate amonges others sent iames sturmius declareth principal clargy said senate sorye disturbaunce sheweth thoccasion therof affirmeth citezen found muche done withoute theyr knowledge prayeth take displeasauntly promiseth wil se time forward like thing happen woulde thus satisfied saye plainly wil henceforthe put theyr line daunger next day depart great displeasure leauing work begon reparing bishop tabernes complaine theyr misfortune thus therefore matter discontinued fewe monethes meane time complained emperoure whole matter shall declared hereafter many men suppose reioysed inwardly theyr mindes good occasion leaue log masse abolished decre senate liued liberty receiued theyr whole reuenewes withoute paine taking bounden daily seruice although laboure great yet occasion thoughte vnto right acceptable wherby might shake yoke bondage especially seinge theyr doinges derided contempned common people selues poynted finger hated men senate inquisition made could perceiue fault anye townes man aboute beginning february ambassador england frauce mete treat peace englishman hauing lost fortes said driuen narrow issue aboute time also protector englad protectoure kinges vncle deliuered towre wheras counsel perceiued please king wel much earl warwick chief occasio apprehension meane found theyr frendshippe renued affinitie wherefore earle warwickes sonne marieth duke somerset daughter afterward kinge gaue vnto earle warwicke dukedome northumberland frendship lasted longe shalbe declared hereafter meane season rome full faction partakinges especiallye farnesians earnest one theyr side might chosen first dede alexander nephewe paulus certatne cardinal client ioyned selues cardinalles imperial frenche cardinal gaue theyr voyces cardinall saluiate florentine alexander fearing least next session saluiate shoulde pronounced bishop reuolted french part taking firste othe reported certaintie shoulde chuse saluiate meane lengthe ihon mary mountane whome saide high president counsel trent bononie vii day february created bishop euer accompted moste earnest fauourer french partie also fernesians cause farnesius bare good saluiate reported feared least obtain dignity would cut short brother kinsfolkes much rich heaped together right wrong would auenge iniury done house paulus farnesiaus said cardinall farnesius woulde promesse good mountane whome paule third made cardinall till assured fidelitie would frely permit parma brother octauianus bishop old custome chaungeth name called iuly third name time frenche king setforth proclamation againste luthexanes penalty also appoynted iudges slacke negligent executing bishop elected departed life two cardinal uerulan rodulphe therfore french kynges proclamation lutheranes remained conclaue lii wherof xiiii frenchman ii germains iiii spaniard ii portugal one englishe man al residue italian xi romains xxii daye february iuly consecrated bishop cardinall cibon two day openeth golden gate cal wheras iuly yt third infinite nombre people obtain remission theyr sinnes said bishop striketh gate golden mallet thopenyng golden gate standeth ceremony afterward wont geue way man token honour yt thinck selues happy men may get time cardinal auspurge obteined much intreaty caried germany whilest bishop beateth gate mallet worcke men breake open crowes iron people striue may first thronge gather vp full busely morter rubbishe falleth ruine kepe precious iewels many men iested vpon fact cardinal auspurge whan heard therof saying iest cardinall auspurge intended yt mallet knock lutheranes head came rome salute bishop theyr duty duke urbin duke farrare ambassador uenise sauoy duke florence gene sene scotland fraunce also themperors bishop restore parma octauius farnesius also gaue made high gouernor whome call confalonier restored also ascanius colunnois whome paule third exiled new bishop auncient custome geueth cardinal hat ganimede nouryshed poope iuly whome list bishop iuly time legate boloigne loued yong man innocentius measure although reast mislike yea spake chose nombre cardinal receiued daily familiarity geuing vnto surname armes also bruted rome libel setforth iuppiter kept ganymede although old deforme yea bishop selfe would let tel cardinal said would recite mery mode wanton lad howe importune whilest occupied conclaue letter dute conclaue came fil thye letter take camillus olius one cardinal tua reported haue wrytten certain louer anniball contine xxvi ianuary verse wrytten vulgare tounge speaketh affection loue hym absent vseth detestable shameful wordes without offence spoken againe wherupon rose iest said filthy bishop signified come conclaue yelded kinde letter xiii day emperours letter ate thempyre march themperour addresseth leters state empire howe conuention auspurge retourned flaunders might binde people dominion sonne sent spaine purpose hys intent thing finished retourne straightwaies germany winde serueth saile al time distaunce place farre sondre therfore long sonne came spaine arriuall hole sommer great part haruest spent aboute necessary affaire albeit winter hand yet fully prefixed haue gone germany selfe time chaunced disease gout long word brought death bishop paul whersore chaunged purpose tarying thelection new bishop iuly third aduertised election also promised franckly largely good wil zele comon wealth religion thing known thought mete let slip great occasion longe wished accomplishing thing desired especially cosidering whole wealth germany consisteth herein therfore way muste deuised thinges last assembly decreed commenced may accomplished must foreseue yt cause dissention taken away certaine obstinat parson rebel straitly punished cause verelye intendeth hold counsel state unperiall wherfore commaudeth xxv day iune readye attende vpon auspurge finde manner let come selues vnlesse sicknes thinge withstanding shall bounden iustify othe send theyr ambassadours large full commission thinges concerninge common wealth thintent consultation found let delay xxij booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument xxii booke peace concluded betwixt england fraunce maidenburge make purgation wryting emperours proclamation lutheranes astonied manye marchauntes hys countryes whilest assemble holden auspurge continue counsell trent granuellan disceaseth george duke megelburge persecuteth maidenbourge going worse haue also duke moris enconues pope iuly publisheth bull straunge sorte duke moris made chieftaine againste maidenburge propoundeth condition peace againste whome also cleargy publish letter charge wherunto aunswer fully purge selues osiander inuenteth new doctrine man iustification decree assemble geue saufconduit go counsell bucer dieth england thre sunnes thre mones sene pope citeth octaulan farnese prince parma againste whome also themperoure publisheth letter patentes upon french king maketh hys excuse pope duke saxon prisoner healpeth comforteth minister church banished emperoure beginninge counsell trent order session counsel meane deuise frame article faith beginning warre parma time thambassadours englad peace concinded betwixt frace englande fraunce whan longe debated matter last conclude peace much easy brynge passe saw vnto whome contention theyrs time come profitable gainful wherfore englishman restore frenchman boloigne kepte nowe sixe whole yeares without greate maruell many frenchman pay mony peace also scottes comprised sending ambassador bothe party two kinges confirme peace new amity ye french king made knight garter england kinge england againe french order whiche verelye amonges great prince cognisaunce moste assured frendship maidenburge defaced sondry proclamation themperour xxiiii day march publishe wryting chiefly next inhabiters first proue neither god lawe man law conuicted rebellion declare put armure make warre christ selfe thirdly confute crime obiected shewe sclaunders surmised theyr aduersaries albeit saye theyr prouocation emperour hathe exiled v yet may truely affirme haue yet refused reasonable condition might inioy stil doctrine professed auspurge liberty oure elder haue lefte v minde also neither refuse anye kinde dutye ought done emperoure empire take god witnes haue geuen none occasion warre trouble couet chiefly obserue peace men ye meane true religion doctrine attaine life euerlastinge doubtles cause hatred raysed v deuised law inferioure magistrate shall impeche right superioure moreouer fortune magistrate passe boudes authoritye commaund thing wicked obeyed also attempte force resisted man thincke denye rule gouernement dependeth god againste whome anye proclamation come forthe decree made matter clearely doubt oughte reiected refused sort decre made auspurge concerning religion therfore obey woulde make v receiue mauger heades take v lighte gospel setforth romish idoll might draw v euerlasting damnation seinge case standeth thus ther rebellion right obiected vnto v euery may easely perceiue vnlawful worke anye violence v yt assaied thing wrought thend professor true doctrine might vtterlye extinguished side mighte wounded christe self al godly people al member christe wherfore defile selues wicked facte thing el may loke god vengaunce touchinge fortes village taken haue spoken last former wryting neither neadefull repeate sone shalbe assured peace restore right owner also enemy haue raised brute though vsed amonges v intermixed vncerten lechery impudet lie therfore beseche honor god yt ye defile selues innocent blud pray god would confound bloudy cousels wicked fortune war yt wold deny aid month aprill minister church setforth wryting wherein recite confession faith ye minister churche confession doctrin declare lawful inferior magistrate defend self superior compelling forsake truth speke vnto beseche themperor wold geue credit suche incense practise vniust wicked cruelty wold first truly duely examine ye whole matter finally make earnest request may haue war thinge come passe desire aid also inhabiters next trouble said fortuned head church strausburge bishop made complaint themperor senate ambassadour sent declareth ther fault wherfore themperour adressing letter bishop commaundeth renue hys worke omitted procede therin bishop taketh firste assurance othe senate ther shuld violence shewed disturbance theyr thus length clargy feast pentecost xxiiii may began cleargy strausburge renueth misteries matter day first consul certen senator wer ther thother side cathedrall church least tumult shuld raised clargy said church inclosed part chauncel go reuestry grate yron yt man could come nere thend may themperor departeth brussels sonne phillip goeth thassembly auspurge leading duke saxon prisoner leauing lantzgraue machlin long proclamation againste lutheranes departing thence ther setforth proclamation ye lutheranes written french flemish ye xxix day april sort albeit saith themperor haue alwaies indeuored thauncient true religion might within al dominion obserued albeit haue bene euermore wholly bent therrors sectes heresy haue many yeres bensowen ouer al christendom might vtterly abolished albeit cause haue setforth sodry proclamation wt extreme penalty yet hearing saye without great grief mind men dominio also stragers dwel within prouinces occupy trade marchandise haue spread abrode thinfection mischief far nere sort doutles requisite lay disease corrasine sharp medicine make diligent inquisitio offender plage maye plucked vp rote last assembly prouincial admonished state gouernors yt euery man part shuld diligetly apply self hereunto stil remain thold catholick religio especially cosidering openly sene al men tumultes commotios infection hath stirred vp speake nothing meane time losse saluation soules wherfore thaduise derely beloued sister assent oure noble make new law straitly charge commaund man whatsoeuer haue bie distribute bokes luther oecolapadius zwinglius bucer caluine bokes set forth xxx yeres past without name author register deuines louaine registre deuines louain furthermore conteined moreouer man kepe image picture made contempt mockery lady saincts nether cast breake image painted pourtraied honor saint man open house vnto priuy conuenticles wherin bothe erroures wont sowen men wemen rebaptised also conspiracy made church common wealth man either priuely apartly dispute holy scripture especially hard doubtfull matter take vpon thinter pretation vnlesse deuine aucthorised commendable vniuersity shall otherwise shalbe punished seditious person disturber common tranquility men shal die sword wome shal buried ground quick case wil forsake theyr error obstinate shall burnt theyr goodes confiscated whether punishment euer suffer againe shall haue none authority make whatsoeuer shall herein since time first began infringe thys oure law shalbe frustrate take place furthermore charge comaund man receiue house aid thing knoweth suspected heresy aduertise immediatly thinquisitour gouernour place shal suffer punishment obstinate malice throughe infirmitye haue fallen errour heresy yet haue transgressed thys talcke faith bidden law haue done nothing seditiouslye owne accord haue retourned amendement haue abiured receiued grace shal yt haue conference amongs selues matter appertaining faith religion haue suffer returned vomit conuicted vehemently suspected heresy shalbe conde ned ether tabiure open penance ye man shalbe accused heresye shal suffer one reuolted unto spotted heresy stained like crime shalbe geuen none honor dignity nether shall beare anye office common wealth unlesse man bring testimoniall curate church dwelt last let suffered haue habitation dwelling suche ought suspected gouernors peace oure client euery man prouince inquire diligently shall breake law assist inquisitoures ecclesiasticall iudges whiche founde culpable maye suffer according che fourme prescribed excepte shall suffer oure pleasure let common proctoure also know whether duetie shalbe found negligent let commaund come iudgement shall appeare haue offended let either depriued theyr office otherwise punished shalbe thought expedient besides let bishop archdeacon abbot like prelate search diligence cleargy infect disease punishe extremely know man defiled pestilence place heretickes lurcke frequent let presente immediatly vnlesse suffer punishment others promotour accusation false shal haue reward promotours one half goodes goodes dede shall exceade summe vi c crownes whatsoeuer shalbe aboue tenth part therof shalbe alotted vnto shal detect thinquisitour priuy conticles although theyr counsell shall punished thinke well religion henceforth refraine theyr company shall present followship shalbe rewarded said let punishment yt haue appoynted executed accordingly nether shall lie man power alter mitigate perceiue oftentimes done iudges offende herein shal escape vnpunished accused heresy cited appere haue fled haue bene outlawed whan haue heard copanions offence dead wont make sute may suffred make purgation much suppose crime proued meanes chaunceth retourning sow abrode false doctrin error wise done comon profit wherfore comaund yt ther place geuen request yt al wer cited haue appered sought saue selues fleing shalbe accoted conuictes person condemned shal make sute suspected fled banished anabaptistes let taken supporter heretikes iudges gouernors receiue none fauor vnles ether permissio v ye quenes sister yt shal otherwise shalbe depriued theyr proclamation printer gouernmet printer bokesellers print sel vtter thing cocerning scripture theyr aduise consent vnto charge comitted much register bokes thuniuersity louain hath reiected let ye stationer haue ye haged vp shop ope sight least either selues bier plead ignorance yt haue another register al theyr bokes yt wil obey shal lose c crown finally yt man take child teach vnles ye permission magistrat chief minister church authorised teach instruct youth nothing according form prescribed deuines louaine decre proclamed many sore astonied especially high duch english marchants occupy traffick marchandise themperors townes country especially andwarpe great nobre wherfore wer mind yt vnles decre wer mitigated thei wold remoue another place yea mani shutting vp shop purposed depart thauoyding ye dager senate andwarp also thother citezens ther saw woderful losse wold wer great perplexity andwarp astonied emperor proclamatio whe thinquisitors came thither wtstode withal theyr indeuor riding lady reget declare vnto losse shuld also whole region decre take place wherfore matter city ye decre chiefly made reaso sodry natios people appesed yt time decre traslated highe duch tog matthie flacie metio made ye former boke setteth forth sharply tateth iselebie adiaphoristes termeth assay perswade people though religio wer impugned form inquisition cal instructio conteineth ample authority lawfull cal al priuate person magistrate selues also compel oth answere interrogatory vtter know question co cerning religion nombre xxxviii wherin ar presented suspected examined amogs others whether beleue sacrifice masse auailable dead yt may deliuered hereby pain purgatory whether beleue yt peter prince thapostles uicar christ high bishop church rome yt also accopted lawfully succede chaire whether beleue lawful forsake thobedience high bishop nether heriticke scismatick whether beleue matrimony priuely cotracted lawful whether beleue lutheran buceranes suche others churche cardinal fraunce remaind rome certain space iuly elected death cardinall lorayne return home howbeit way whe come fraunce sene kinge died ihon cardinall lorayne bene life time pleasaunt gest companion king fraunces occasion robert lenoncourt cardinall obtained bishopprycke mentz afterward supposed haue holpen greatly towne metz city thempire came hand hery french king hereafter shalbe declared last session trent decreed amogs thing mo bishopprickes one kepe list forgoe rest xix boke specified neuertheles long paul liued thing put executio whe made bishop cardinal frauce obeyed dede aparence losse theyrs wheras diuers ii iii bishoppricks many others aspired yt dignity exchage made permitted inioye one steade one bishoppricke left many abbotships like promoitos month iuly adolphe bishop colon making composition senate entreth archbyshop collon entreth city pompe city colon exceading great pomp train hauing gotten together client kinred alies yt might honor theyr presence day accompanied report ii horse aboue duke cleue verely brought notable bad horsme lately daughter born wife mary daughter king ferdinando godmother fount stone emperor sister elenore french quene mary quene hongary tharchbishop colon godfather long ther arose great dissention betwene duke archbishop thecclesiasticall iurisdiction xxvi day iuly emperor beginneth counsel imperial auspurge wherin propoundeth followynge generall counsel obseruing decre religion lately made auspurge punishinge rebelles restoryng iurisdiction goodes church assebly armed also albeit yt state thing sowhat quiet prince mentz treuers presente reast thelectours sent ambassadours moreouer presente wuolfgage master prusse bishop wirciburge eistet costintz auspurge trent cambray merseburge none thother prince besides duke bauier length also ry duke bruswick matter debated part protestation moris agaist counsell content yt counsel followed duke moris deputy declareth yt allow none otherwise vnlesse whole matter beginninge may retracted deuines protestant heard yt may also haue power decide matter yt bishop rome submit self counsel occupy place iudge release bishop othe thintet may speke mind frely protestation red opely deputy wold haue recorded manner custom denied ye whole matter power tharch bishop mentz chauncelour thempire themperor afterward moued bishop counsel seuenth day august cardinall auspurge sermonne inueighed soore againste knauery spanyardes lutheranes dayes certain spanyardes mockery contempt citezens hearing ye gospell preached plaied certain partes church sort yt matter like haue tourned great tumult comming consull thing goodly meane appeased quieted thend month august granuellan death granuellan came lately bezonse towne high burgundie auspurge leaueth life withoute themperoures greate heauines reported succeded marcurine castinarie cardinal shewed vii boke space xx yeares ben chief authority priuy manner alone themperours secreat counsel working whose place function succeded sonne anthony bishop arras man great learning thabsece father wot answer matter ye common welth familier themperor mene seaso henry duke brunswick laieth duke henry besiegeth citye brunswick siege ye city brunswick born great hatred many yeres religio thing whan theyr coutry much harm firing spoiling yet could win city mediatio certen themperor comadeth partes leue theyr war pleade theyr cause thys month septembre emperours army besieged affrick towne barbarie men suppose leptis howbeit liuie maketh also mentio ye city affricanes city kept dracutus notable archpirate lately ioyned hi dracutus archpirate self turke themperor comitted chiefe gouernenient uiceroy sicilie beaten town wyth ordenaunce certain time certified dragutus comming newe army saw nede make haste wherfore tenth day septembre geueth assault bothe sea land within fewe houres space taketh force knightes rhodes vpon sea themperor day good seruice spaniard fought lad taking city africa excelled nombre whan city taken mooste part spoyle nombre prysoners great aboute viii thousand put shippes led awaye captiue sicilie sardinie place situation city said pleasant reason grene medowes goodlye situatio hilles set oliues palme tree fair springes water far thence reported goodlye corne country ample increse yeldeth plowme hath receiued cosmus duke florence sent themperor men war vnder conduit iordane ursine alastor balion winter hand vitaile coulde prouided uiceroy leauing garrison spaniard retourneth army sicilie dragutus fled turke traueling constantinople thing thoccasion new warre turke attempted afterward againste ye emperour also king fardinando whan themperour commaunded duke henry senate brunswick lay side weapon army discharged bothe party force afterwarde george duke megelburge sonne albarte younge man serued duke henry allured vnto cleargy maidenburge prelate head church gentleman borne chiefly offended city waged great reward promesses reported aide might auenge selues deny shallbe declared hereafter archbishop iho alberte lately departed wherfore promised ye gouernment ye hole prouince case could subdue wrytings laid pledge iii principal castels thus marching first ye coutry halberstat cam ye prouince maidenburge ther practising slaughter spoyling burning surpriseth towne wancelebe spoyleth setteth fire whan attepted castel vain lost diuers marcheth forward way euer wet exceding much harm wherfore ye people country village whe saw goodes cattel taken driuen away come ye senate maideburge crauing aid succor declare wyll refuse peryl coste herein senate therfore assigned daye wherin shoulde redines xxi daye september went maydenburg together husband men citezens iointly soldiours garrysons thre bandes horseman field piece furniture reste night two myles citie mornyng daye lyght auauncing campe marche streightwaye towardes ennemie came syght put selues order battell forewarde thought moste daunger stode citezens soldiours placed countrie people duke megelburge perceyuing order sodenly tournyng rankes inuadeth husbandman kynde people neyther well armed exercised feates warre vpo suche soden gaue charge others coulde tourne selues ordenaunce able rescewe therfore casting awaye weapon ouerthrowe ye maidenburgians fled myght runne fastest breaking rankes fellowes make waye open ennemy get victory moste part geuing charge chase slayne citezens soldiours many loste dyuers taken gunnes carriage al warlyke furniture came handes ennemies meane season emperour instant decree made auspurge obserued maketh greuous complaynt city maydeburg breme city remayned constant albeit bremers outlawed prince make intercession require myght haue hearyng matter whan emperour cosented adresse letter eyther citie xxii daye september prince letter maydenburg cite appere auspurge second day nouember saufe conduicte come aunswere cause sendyng ambassadours full power authoritie conclude certen woman auspurge citezen towne seing priest passe caried hoste woman perill light worde sycke man lyght borne maner maruelyng therat demaunded hym caried lyght noooe dayes saying apprehended great daunger lyfe great intreaty woman finally intercession emperours syster beyng pardoned lyfe bannyshed mary quene hungary regent flaunders come thither boeth matter also cause chiefly proclamation lately set forth flauders party myght mitigated vnlesse sayde would come passe andwarpe whiche nowe beste frequented marte towne whole worlde shoulde fall decaye lose former beautie moreouer ther great daunger place iusurrection case thinge put execution emperour hardly acconsented laste altering thinges concerned marchauntes straungers taketh away name inquisitione abhorred proclamation religion mitigated men residue commaundeth take place obserued whylest letter coueyed bremers maideburg prince state inquire emperour vpon condicions accorde wherfore propoundeth bremers submit selues vnto power humbly craue pardo forsake al league make cofederacy wherin whole familie comprised obey chaber imperial contributaries charge therof portion agre archbishop stand arbitrement suche umperes shal appoint accorde also whole clergie restore munition taken duke erricke recompence hym harmes done none within iurisdiction serue warres paie vnto hondreth fiftie thousand crownes deliuer xxiiii piece ordenaunce furnished obeye decree former co uention suche shalbe decreed may denburg imposeth maner lawes added moreouer aunswere men lawe obeye sentence geuen tyme theyr rebellion commence action man rase fortification bulwarkes receyue citie hym lieftenauntes tyme power someuer brynge without condicion paye two hondreth thousande crownes publication theyr goodes ratified possessours thereof disturbed reporte battell maydenburge immediatly sowen abroade farre nere within syxe dayes brought emperour auspurg many men thought bene almoste vndone beholde publyshe wrytynge fyrste daye october wherin recite whole matter saye haue lost aboue two hondreth citezens souldiours whiche appered nede comfort selues confirme others god say thei would meane trie constancie infinite goodnes towardes v doubt nothing albeit shal thus wholy perish oppressed yet euil therin much better abide thextreme peril forsaking profession truth reuolte romish antichrist either feare certen couetousnes ambition relent submit selues cousel tret admit allowe wicked decree made auspurge doubt life life euerlasting shall suffer greuous tourmentes except retourne amendemet know also god hath appointed aduersaries boundes limites shall passe wherfore desire men wold ioyne praiers attempt warre v oppressed selfesame calamitie shall redounde vnto al germany without respect seing case standeth thus certenly zeale loue preseruation natiue countrey require ayde assiste v whiche doctrine ye gospel afflicted maydenburg ouerthrowe incontinently many prepare selues vnto warre amoges others duke maurice electour brandenburg cosyn marque force bent maydenburg albert henry duke brunswicke moreouer whole nobilitie also called vpon bring horseman many supposed force leuied intent duke megelburge myght expulsed contrey first deede certen would seme haue taken armure cause straie farre wha assembled eight daye october marchyng forewarde incamped farre citie syxt daye nyght runne forth great clamoure euen ditch gate citie proue townes men coulde durst doe beyng repulsed great shotte loste many theyr men retyred selues campe hyghe displeasure waye set fyre poore lazarus house cleane contrary lawe armes next daye bickered agayne whan townes men made saley full courage dyuerse others many also nobilitie repaired thither hatred duke brunswick expert men warre worthy captaines xii day october truce taken certen ambassadours came yt citie treate peace vayne whylest ambassade againste may denburge thinges working yt state tharchbishoprike maydenburg amongst clergie principal mete hale xv day october sende ambassadours themperour prince thempire wha came auspurg x day thei accuse moste heinously senate people maydenburg somuch duke maurice taken vnto ye power yt duke megelburg also selues sent ayde neither lyeth abilitie susteyne great charge long require yt prince woulde finde meane quenche common flame shortly may soldiours may paide also naughtie outlawes punished tofore recouer againe strength courage late ouerthrow el wil souldiours reuolte thennemy thing wilbe moste present daunger ar next al state also intende nothing el destruction yt high magistrate wholy addicted steire vp people rebellio throughout whole empire demaunded ayde viii foteme cc horseme day red aunswers bremers senate maydenburg made yt prince letter befor said yt bremers first declare greatly thei alwaies haue desired peace emperours frendship ofte haue sued vnto peace ambassadours also yt king denmarke city ye border ye sea shew strayte condicions offered yet thende may appere much esteme themperours authoritie saye wil refuse sende ambassadours promyse may haue religion libertie permitted contente thing maydeburg answer maydeburgians fourmer assemblie empire made great sute emperour peace condicions imposed intollerable saye synce tyme haue susteined great dammage ende measure wroges repulsed violece yet moderatly cause hatred couet retayne trew doctrine flee idolatrie concernynge daye prescribed commaunded sende ambassadours full authoritie fynde none wyll go sorte moreouer george duke megelburg hath lately moued warre confesseth openly doth commaundement emperour thempyre nowe also ennemies armie lieth citie may remoued ambassadours well assured shall may reporte demaude vnto refuse sent beginning noueber dieth ulriche death ulriche duke wirtemb duke wirtemberge suite hanging stil kyng ferdinado sayd sonne christopher succeded emperour receiued aunswers two city concerning bremers thinketh good tary asmuch say wil come touching maydenburge much thing farre otherwyse say aunswer frowardly maner contemptuously requireth procede consulting determided chiefly wold waie diligetly requestes state byshoprike herein thing whiche may commoditie dignitie thempyre prince state perceiued right well would neuer pacificatio made vpon condition wherfore thei require gentle thinges might propounded emperour perseuereth cruell decree magdeburgians purpose length albeit many willes namely city assente vnto promyse ayde againe desire emperour first self would cotributory herunto secondly case warre selfe would appoint generall charge comit duke maurice seme good vnto say ye charge war must borne yt mony already leuied v affayres como weale themperour replieth charge ben ye fourmer war ye might restore peace vnto germany requireth haue cosideration therof touching duke maurice wel pleased saieth yt knoweth man present time yt fit yt charge diuerse cause yt mony shuld taken comon treasury doth allow permit yt muche take fro thece within certe time restored yt mony gathered vse exhorteth followe thing wt whole indeuour yt may punished according demerites sheweth may thus yt citie inuironed wt treche bulwark made siege cotinued til thei subdued vnlesse yt licecious obstinat rebellion repressed se gret dauger shame wilbe thempire thus therfore duke maurice whiche busied self herein said comon asset made high duke maurice general war generall warre charge war appointed lx thousand crownes monethly hodreth thousand crownes payed charge past concerning counsell emperour affirmeth prince shalbe continued againe trent easter doeth byshop promyse yet doeth meane season vrge decree auspurge commaundeth declare cause vnto hym order wrytten two yeares synce religion reformation clergie obserued archebyshops electours saye howe haue omitted nothing yet wholy cause letteth fully accomplished exemption priuileges certen deputes electours absent say haue applied thing diligently long continuaunce tyme hath bene hinderaunce religion sodenly plucked men myndes nede instructed men might litle litle accustome selues thorowly perswaded thesame decree dissenteth much holy scripture nothing violently altered without trouble sedition man costraine ye prechers ther would man serue yt churche hardely one found wyll abase selfe hereunto state syngle lyfe condition lordes supper residue prynces state romyshe religion alledge cause yt cause decre obserued scholes wherin yougth ryghtly instructed minister churche diswade people decree want priestes negligece magistrate saye moreouer thing hinderauce many spiritualtie liue vitiously many inuey rayle vpon decree made bokes reproche vnpunished iuly byshop rome oft treated emperour eight day nouember sending forth bulles calleth pope iuly somoneth counsell cousell affirming coincident office call directe counsel coueteth also prouyde traquillitie germany hath alwayes ben obediet church byshops rome earth christes uicars wherfore let men repare trente first day may whiche either ryght custome priuilege haue interest suche paule thirde hath called tyme somoned counsell place daye shall counsell continued thei repare trent fore contemned fortune either age sicknes affayres commo wealth himselfe present yet legate president bulle sent themperour duke maurice made chiftayne attempteth thing great force buylding vp certe bulwarkes souldiours myght wynter therin thende nouember assayleth citie whiche citie diuided thre partes maurice besegeth maydenburg wherof one whiche called newe surpriseth nyght scalyng walles gate neither drumme went trompet blewe tofore brought souldiours citezens reised vp clamour many found armure put sworde rest taken spoiled expulsed wherfore citie intet might take away ennemy commoditie sendyng forth souldiours burne part agayn part whiche called sudeburg sette fyre also receiuing townes citie tyme came lazarus schuendie campe duke maurice myght emperours name gyue counsel tyme erle hedeck saxony whome emperour hedeck mansfeld discomsited duke maurice outlawed two yeares past mentioned albert erle maunsfeld leuie bandes souldiours city sea coaste ayde maydenburge duke maurice therfore moneth december goeth vnto part armie scattereth allureth vnto foure enseignes men also counte decke shall heare ix daye december emperour long proclamation heinouse word inueieth empe proclamatio maydenburge maydenburge commaundeth man ayde straightly chargeth captain soldiours whiche within citie within fourtene day letter deliuered departe citie geue knowledge hereof vnto duke maurice absence lazare schuendie obeye promyseth pardon appointeth extreme punishement citie albert erle mansfelde whome emperour dede banyshed tourned al possessios tyme perseuered fidelitie frendship iohn friderick duke saxon howe emperour left lantgraue machline taking iourney auspurg declared duke maurice marque brandenburge earnest suters might deliuered aunswere made also sonnes cou sellours demeane selues yet might deliuered kepers also said vnto caried spaine wherupon requireth ayde sonnes admonishynge faith duty owe vnto hym lantgraues son sue father commaundeth sue duke maurice marque brandenburg yelde selues prysoners according forme obligation fulfill promise sonnes obey herein sending ambassadours earnestly oft admonish sue one whyle ioyntly together another whyle either seuerally selfe tyme messenger sometime presently excuse matter declare expedient either father euer bring newe reason wherby trust may deliuered without daunger therfore desire forbeare whyle geue respite ye emperour moued latgraue lirane deliuer obligation declared whan sued vnto sendeth lazare schuendie sonnes counsellours commaunding henceforth neither comence action sue duke maurice marque brandeburg also sende vnto suche maner wrytinges surcease sute vnlesse obeye threateneth greatest punishment may deuised yet vayne moreouer releaseth letter prince bounde pronou ceth fre bonde wherfore whan lantgraue lantgraues purpose sawe hope fully prefixed make escape might deuiseth sondry meanes seruauntes sent hesse gentleman good house afrayd daunger sought delayes last perswadeth two conrade bredesten iohn rommelie waye hesse vnto machlin layed post horse whiche might leape vpon escape matter came light certen man told one frendely machlin within fewe houres maister shuld libertie going one reported captaine garde moment deuise fleing bewrayde instant haue fled al matter dashed two seruauntes slayne hand others taken beheaded selfe caried straiter pryson emperour knewe therof toke displeasautly wryting letter duke maurice marque brandenburg signifieth bolde enterpryse apperteineth iniury hym dominion saith wil sore auenged haue geuen either aide counsell herein copie letter sende william lantgraues sonne amongest thynges saye case suche parte played henceforth wyl stande bounde yet neuerthelesse duke maurice seuerally comforted deliuer father promyseth spende goodes life bloud also sayeth ther shalbe tyme conuenient yelde selfe whan state thinges shalbe suche displeasure certen lesse feared xix daye december fotemen horseman maydenburge appointed watche issue citie midnight might oppresse issuyng victory maydeburgians stoute courage ennemies vyllage farre enterpryse daungerous yt must passe theyr ennemies campe yet chaunsed luckely ennemy could armed thei taken uillage set fyre diuers place put ouer harnesse white shirtes maner camisado many ennemies resisted wer slayn wer many noble gentleman diuerse fought house set fire burnt uery many ye nobilitie wer taken immediatly brought citie two hodreth lx horse morrowe sone daye appeared retired home warde way met troupe horseman whiche led duke megelburge laste duke megelb take prisoner geuing charge whan horseman pressed fotemen gaue onset back take brought citie euen whiche first begon warre dayes also came spaine auspurg maximilian marimilian cometh spayne austriche emperours sonne law created king boheme absence called home father king ferdinando betwene emperour great contention succession empire whiche cause also emperour sayde haue sent syster cotentio empyre betwirte emperour ferdinando mary retourned thither moneth ianuary might meane departed thence september emperour knewe commoditie annexe germany inheritaunce coueted establishe sonne whiche reigne ouer many large diuers region sure fortresse kyng ferdinado hauing respect thought nother expectation commoditie child ought diminished herein moreouer maximilian prince great towardnes could speake sondry language especially highe dutche prince like maners excelled muche fauoured beloued letter wherby counsell denunciatour haue said byshop promulgat rome latter ende december thing offend many whiche many thynges whiche myght offende men myndes sorte sayth part gouerne counselles calleth hym selfe christes vicar haue action continued repeted beginning chalengeth self place authoritie president semeth call thither order thinges also emperour whan letter deliuered hym sayde haue noted right well haue required suche thinges somwhat rough might altered fearing thought least germaines affrayde thinges mariner rockes would either refuse sommoning el fynde let delay busines great labour brought passe wyll affirme true suche maner couselles ar wont kept secret trwe manifest obteined nothyng fourme spake byshop published one worde altered yea suppose dyd sette pourpose might feare awaye germaines counsell come came might haue intrapped certen snare certenly paule thirde reported haue vsed policie haue sayde ix boke learned espialles ye protestauntes could beare refused calling counsell would vrge propounde thinges chiefly knewe myndes moste offended man may aso perceiue bull iulius whiche framed paule thirde dayes duke maurice electour brandenburge offer condition peace maydenburg thei maidenburg moued der requyre render selues shewe fidelitie vnto archebyshop thus wyll doe shalbe permitted haue retaine religio doctrine exhibited time past auspurge shalbe nothing deminished priuileges lawes lyberties fortification also citie goodes shal remayne safe violence offered vnto man moreouer promyse make intercession emperour wyl abolysh sentence publication verely vpon condition prince city also may humbly desire pardon deliuer xvi piece ordenaunce hondreth thousand crownes end may inioye goodes already confiscated somme mony saye laye debource restore vnto clergie goodes concerning hurte done either syde touchyng habitation clergie ceremony cathedrall churche selues take order intent emperour may easlier perswaded garrison receiued citie tyll emperour haue confirmed pacification rest condicions shalbe accomplished soldiours shal iniury thei selues wyll forsee case emperour refuse thinges wyll haue souldiour immediatly restoring vnto citie safe euery point founde senate refused make surrender receiue power citie moneth december state byshoprike maydenburg thiefly clergie set forth wrytinge writing clergie citie vulgare tongue senate people mayde burge saye howe haue aunciently right apperteined iurisdiction archebishop proued letter otto first emperour many thinges saye haue proudly presumptuously done chiefly burcarte gunther archebyshops reduced dutie haue suffered condigne punishment history may declared ye tyme ernest house saxon albert brandenburge byshops composition made controuersies kept conuenauntes ofte byshops common assent state decreed thyng profit common wealth alwayes drew backwarde sought meane howe myght rule rest tyme cardinall mentz reciued iohn albert cosyn coadiutour would allowe also toke hym title honour due vnto hym although oftentymes spoken ye agayne whan succeded byshopryke death cardinal albert would neither take hym byshop geue hym fidelitie herein perseuered longe liued albeit noble men ofte time intreated therin intent myght obteine gouernment whiche may easely appere vnto man wyll consyder doinges albeit bookes set forth intent reyse commotion go perswade people though nothing offended though clerely faultles though stoode dauger truth sake religio matter far otherwyse religion hath let nordisturbaunce although thei possessed yt church iurisdiction actes clergie much sayd would aunswer lawful cousell suffered thinges patiently content therwith made conspiracie entring league whiche thing lawfull doe consent archebyshoppes would haue inforced v theyr religion wherof doth well appere sought religion goodes churche yt wrought might vnder honest pretence couer cloke treason rebellion full many seditious thinges haue thei wrought emperour state empire neither recited shall touche thynges whiche properly apperteine vnto v foure yeares past breakyng faith conuenauntes wherby boud v thei gaue v defiaunce entring house toke goodes expulsed v also cast prison wherof dead rest doe remaine captiue thys present bete house euen groud brought townes landes gouernmetes subiection fortifiyng citie strongly might safely rebelle imposed commo people payment mony monethly certen charge church house religion partly rased partly defaced casting downe belle ye steples made gunnes toke vp dead body monkes priestes also noble men cast vpon rampares image aultars grauestones haue cowched layde walles church standing thei haue put downe god seruice ornametes precious iwelles wrytinges monumentes euer founde church spoiled beating priestes minister churche fistes scourge droue holy place yea aultars haue sondry place exacted new tribute cleane contrary custome countrey yea haue broken fury sepulchre founder great otto emperour domestical euils contented herewith inuaded byshoprike halberstate spoyling college hamersleb plucking priestes yt saying masse aultars wouded stewe polluting thinges hallowed trode hoste consecrated vnder feete disguising selues monkes apparell whan done many thinges great oultrage mockerie returned home loden spoyles boties certen wall rampare yt countrey made gret cost right necessary party cast without cause burning cutting vp bridge might passe moreouer haue sought take away liues also preset insomuch ye neither remaine house fredes without gret daunger whome suspected geue v lodgyng would breake house night take goodes cary away diuers nobilitie captiue also put vpon racke yea haue spoyled noble matrones virgin striped apparel euil intreated thei haue brought daunger life haue kept handes also fro yonge babe child briefly suppose like example crueltie sene amongest turkes man wold make estimate aswel goodes haue gotten also harmes done v shal finde yt least mount aboue viii c crownes speake nothing meane season contumelious reproches raylinges ye famous libel picturs haue set forth contept mockery perour state imperial iniuries also haue susteined fully xxvii yeares haue cast stone v throwen vpon v filthe stretes haue gone citie haue oftetimes made clamorous outirie v driuen v place place many tymes also nyght haue set house gate fyre stone broken glase wyndowes finally kynde outrage hath bene omitted foure yeres since ye xxvi day iuly wha ye request yt consul assembled college required v first shuld professe religion yt secodly yt towardes furniture ye war within eight dayes paye xx thousand crownes entring churche citezens reparinge thither thruste priestes violence shut vp churche dores demaunde inferiour sorte priestes great mony wer able pay wer driuen citie exile selfe sorte also haue handled rest clergie entring vpon landes goodes whiche thing verely haue transgressed lawes god man also broken conuenauntes faith geuen megistrates may chiefly thanke v landes goodes time lately george duke megelburge interteined force whiche defended also beseged citie bruswick nomber thre thousand without knowledge marched coutrie may denburg halberstat wonderful presumption issued citie intent purpose first discomfited ennemy might bend whole force brunt war v yea vtterly distroye v two tunnes full haltars hired certen hangman swordes thei might hage head howbeit goodnes god chaunced far otherwyse wer eight thousad men discomfited slayne aboue two thousand slaughter citezens amongst many innocet people partly force partly flattery allured vnto eight ensignes taken al munition furniture goe ascribe cause warre vnto v say duke megelburg moued warre impulsion false oftetimes also battel sent ambassadours peace wishe non thing tyme reconciled themperour woulde restore vnto v olde tranquillitie quietnes muche refuse peaceable wayes deteyne force iniurie castels townes village driuen seke meane wherby may recouer thynges inferre alledge purgation forged fained commonly knowen haue disturbed hindred religio whan lately noble prince duke maurice lectour brandeburg offred reasonable coditios proudly reiected making salee truce time assaulted night certen auciet gentleman home owne house done displeasure slepe bed coming whan hardly escaped awaye half naked rauening distroying goodes spoyled wyfe chyldren theyr apparell threatening ofte death left starck naked muche one nobilitie comming thither chaunce couered woman owne garment certenly oultrage dyd nyghte fewe wordes expressed haue also made aduaunt openly may loke restitution vayne highly auaunced landes goodes haue accustomed selues finer kynd lyfe neither easely brought render agayne men goodes matter thus seing add vnto iniuries former yeares contempt also vtterly bene vpon distruction could recite worthy actes though somewhat briefly wherfore meanes founde reduce agayne dutie man ought maruell therat soeuer loue ciuile common societie men chose stomake muche lesse ought succour aide sort thei accused litle sending ambassadours torge duke maurice helde asse blies concerning warre many dayes moneth senate maketh answer opon wrytinge howe suppose state byshoprike make complaint procedeth altogether answer yt citezens clergie greueth say gospell taught sincerely amongest v wickednes disclosed dignitie decayed chief cause hatred thinges haue pricked forwarde accuse v falsely emperour beyng outlawed myght muche subiecte iniury assuredly haue offende emperour nothing inioying religion libertie nothing may haue handes dede bounde archbyshop citie yet vpon certen condition shall disturbe v liberty condition haue broken aduersaries counselled archebyshop iohn albert demaunde certen newe thynges accustomed therfore refused geue fidelitie yet great cause alledge hym faithful selues greued tyme former yeares sawe waye prepared hym archebyshop rather haue excluded vnto subiect bounde point longe conuenauntes former time obserued refused kinde dutie swarued resisted hereof grewe sondry displeasure verely latter yeares whan new wayes inuented exacte mony prouince spake ope asse blies declared vsed byshops former time although al uayn diuers ye state chiefly clergie great part pray yt frowardnes obiect v went citie yt clergle forsoke yt citie owne accorded incensed certen pryde whan sawe duke saxon latgraue subdued supposed tyme come wherin might accomplishe mynde obteine gouernment come filthy kinde life certely expulse albeit preacher sermon reproue abhominable liuing yet dwelt safely amongest v many yeares euen lately certen inhabite citie bene disposed haue wrought violece harde done attempted nothing whan state thinges constraimed feare power ennemie called together fellowes cathedral church much light gospel reuealed god also requireth profession requyred dilligently doue many tymes selues woulde choyse experte diuine whiche myght teache goddes worde cathedrall churche boeth selfe godly wold also helpe greatly increase mutuall loue beneuolence betwene citezens refused selues prouided thyng ennemie hande already inuaded limites requyred would paye v certen somme mony sende letter citie remayne v inioye owne possession long departed citie beyng requyred v sende theyr ambassadours certen day salsie whome might treate proudely reiected talke wherfore whan vttered malice spitefull hatred v also constreyned requite lyke case remayned v trouble myght haue bene auopded burned malice v many time distruction forged new diuises must necessitie take armure defence vnlesse taken townes village bene place refuge left enne seing reuenewes church mayden burg persecute ye church may rightly imployed defence religion false doctrine idolatrie neither doeth thing want example fourmer tyme themperour hath dede outlawed v desert haue heretofore oftener declared fortune state common v prophes apostle godly folke afflicted prosessinge veritie finally christe selfe profession yt truthe afflicted seditiouse rebelles moste hurt full men others haue intreated emperour cocerning religion liberty hitherto labour vayne ende belonge deuises former wrytinges haue sufficiently declared verely thing self speaketh ment wicked papistrie may restored controuersie hath oftentimes bene brought comunication certen conuetions haue ben cause principall pointes neuer satisfied thambassadours sayd comission stretched far assuredly greueth v exceadingly man shuld susteyne damage cause yet godlyme doubt thinke doe iudge thinges suffered rather confession truthe thynges must suffered truthes sake shuld forsakn seing christ hath log prophecied incomodities insue vpo profession hath also appointed euerlasting rewardes leaue wyues chyldren possession sake truste certen large promesses certenly relent feare owne daunger feare displeasure procure vnto selues euerlastyng damnation vnlesse repente thing whiche aduersaries impute vnto v may rightly ascribed vnto lyue fylthie shamefull beastly lyfe place thei beare rule citezens hardly desende chastitie wyues daughter toke common litle monie suche extremitie fayne dyd unto whiche speake custome aunswere myght made yf spoken playnly rampare wherof make mention whiche yet belongeth nothyng cut sonder commune commoditie meanes therof many tymes hath hurte bene done countrey whan thei taken botie spoylers wont escape waye retyre selues daunger theycrie haue intreated euill gentleman neighbour euer haue done behalfe haue bene constreyned doe whan yeare suffered iniuries many whiche saye concerning woman maydens vtterlye denie nobilitie taken prysoners released seruaunts without raunsome matter quieted emongest v coposition enlarge exceadinglye accoumpte harmes done name eight hondreth thousand crownes shuld shew againe much mysery thei haue brought v picture suche thinges haue bene set forth priuely mo place one al blame layd v certentie haue straightly commaunded setting vp letter openly man attempte thyng presumptuously emperour prince certen also haue therfore bene punished haue bene bookes also set forth amongest v denie wherin idolatrie impugned many men conscience erected confesse ouerthrowe good wyll god vtterly distroye v alure v amendemet life certenly thei died honestly godly glory god holy name preseruation common wealth god woundeth healeth doubt god seeth tyme mercifully loke vpon affliction also punishe aduersaries neither chaunced thing fortune pretende intised hereunto george duke megelburg large giftes promesses yet meane tyme crafty policie called state byshopryke stasfort consulte meanes might driue robber themselues called cositrie proued letter hired soldiours yea boaste glory care greatly common hurte dammage beit susteyne losse hinderaunce yet saye howe lande grounde remaineth possessio time therfore word brought v towne wanslebe sodenly taken spoyled brent great nomber also village distroyed muche came runing vnto v countrey husband men woman maiden plentie teares desiring aid could assuredly fayle although thing good successe yet doubt god thanckfull seruice saye pike thanke intent oppresse nobilitie state byshoprike starhe lie proued haue euerntore honoured nobilitie haue indammaged suche haue done violece toward men haue passed fro vnreasonable iudge impute thing vnto v crime blame worthy touching reporte swordes founde battell fained thing haltars collar denie vse right necessary wagon cariage manifest condicions peace offered duke maurice marque brandenburg could admit cause moste weightie case yelded receiued power easy vnderstande haue bene state religio common wealth also god infinite mercy hath opened vnto v knowledge gospel befeche graunt vnto v great benefite perpetually whiche promise v assistaunce herein howe credible also wyll perfourme whan selues wauering myndes religion study please men aduersaries may recouer goodes damage done party may egally borne refuse retourne citie agayne set vp idolatrie meanes suffer thei say impediment v religion certenly wanted wil therunto haue cause geue god tha kes yt sent shrewed cowes short horne body dead men intreated thei report defence plucked certe church nere vnto citie many body founde wholy cosumed coueied place buried deper permitted vnto al men kinred foud might transporte whether would theperour otto first moste false shameful lie deuised prayse great otto ignorant honour due chief magistrate especially speake theperour otto many worthy actes moste earnest defendour protectour yt libertie germany seruice call holy godly complaine haue disturbed church nothing lesse holy cocerneth high reproche god theselues log caried citie vestimentes chalice ornametes wrytinges publique monumetes kepe safely haue abolished falsly accuse v moreouer priestes wer whipped theselues spoiled church caried pray el college monastery hamerslebie neuerthelesse belogeth therfore assaile last yt ennemies place refuge therin deuided boties take fro felowes v wher adde moreouer men many thinges insoletly outrageously forged monkes cocerning iniuries say done vnto citie thus standeth matter xxv yeres since wha eight day easter whiche called palm sondaye hand fond trifling ceremony laughed ye comon people thether resorted whose folyshe ceremony rashnes boldnes proceded brake glasse wyndowes suerly punished v banished iniuries knowe none neither haue euer brought v wherfore haue done nothing contrary promesse coposition neither haue geue aduersaries cause warre seing matter thus desire geue credite sclaundrous reportes lament chaunce costreined defend warre yt attepted v thintent might mainteine ye pure doctrine gospel liberty receiued elder thinges also godly kinges magistrate fourmer time machabeis men stoute courage haue refused perill daunger wishe peace moste chiefly aboue al thinges denied v hetherto wherfore log sore afflicted inuasions nere neighbour could repulse fro v vniust violece wherby haue also ye better confidence suche haue prouoked iniury wil iudge war cocerne nothing stande awe feare god reuenger al vnrighteousnes self cause hath stired vp trouble v wyl shortly wrap vp also great distresse peril many couet retein maintein pure doctrine letter wherwith byshop rome called cousell themperour fifth day ianuary comaundeth red senate state prince exhorting wold prepare theselues day king ferdinado informeth state yt truce time turk waxe busy hongary build castel within dominion went surprise castel zolnock fortifie garrison also haue made inrode transsyluania wherof verely hath geuen none occasion doth al truce taken may obserued case turke shal refuse desired haue aide geuen told xx boke stephen byshop winchester cause apprehe ded englad perseuered opinion wold neither allowe statute already made suche shuld made hereafter cocerning religion kinges nonage depriueth byshoprike yeare moneth ianuary comitted warde andrew osiader sayd went prusse set forth time new opinio affirming newe doctrine osiander ye man iustified faith rightuousnes christ dwelling v saith luther also opinion rest diuines fellowes stoutly impugne affirming said luther false many monthes death left ample goodly testimony preface first tome melachthons boke wherin treated comon place holy scripture therfore inueieth melanchthon maketh also luther aduersary one opinio moreouer conference made proued manifestly luther taught cleane cotrary matter say yt doctrine pestiferous saith yt iustification fayth cosisteth bloud death christ wherby redemed iustified matter handled great cotentio self verely pretended said though luther ben opinio ye meane time made auaunt amongst adherentes written yt luther melachtho made copiled diuinitie aristotels doctrine sauereth fleshe ye spirite albert duke duke pruisse addicte osiander prusland desired yt first yt matter might haue ben appeased mediatours perswaded osiander much debating became opinion comaundeth aduersaries depart dominio amongst ioachim merlin must nedes packing although ye citezens also wome child besought yt prince right hubly might depriued pastour osiander taught many yeres norinberg much come dation neuer made busines semed al thing folowe luther doctrine long liued whan themperours decree religion forsoke norinberg went land pruisse reised vp questio many supposed yt durst neuer long luther liued chiefly prouoketh witteberg confute thinges sayth wil defend opinio whosoeuer impugne thesame taunteth melanchthon bitterly whose opinion al learned men part namely saxonie reproued bokes set forth rebuked time moste troublesome disturbed congregation hadled vngodly melanchthon man great modestie learning yt al men offended exceadingly certen booke melanchtho best learned modeste contendeth albeit mankinde ben lost sinne adam yet shuld christ haue bene borne neuerthelesse eight day february dissolued cousell thempire therin made themperour decre forsomuch saith decree auspurg great dissention religion meanes better appeased general godly fre counsell yt former assemble state haue submitted selues vnto counsel therin perseuer shalbe cofirmed ratified thing also self promised wil procure trauell diligence eche thing may orderly rightly done sithe bull byshop rome apperteyneth vnto christian realmes prouinces suppose verely kinges ruler remembring dutie obeye furder godly busines thuttermost power soeuer also shal become therin aduocate church defendour counselles yt performe al wil repare cousel whether haue chaunged religion wil graunte saufe conduicte yt may remayn propoude thinges shal thinke concerne ye quiet conscience shal may safely retourne home againe garded comon coduct moreouer indeuour yt whole matter shalbe treated determined godly christialy al affection set apart according holy scripture doctrine yt father yt wel ciuile ecclesiasticall state may reformed errours false opinion cleane taken away intende moreouer remain within limites thempire least neare thintent defende cousel may come vnto thende wished fruict therof may redoude vnto al men may chiefly comoditie germany wherfore require exhort al prince state chiefly clergie haue altered religion cleaue ye confession auspurg according byshops bul prepare selues come thither furnished least complayne yt ouermuch haste supplanted el admitted sufficiet declaration cause said assure saufe conduict bring passe shalbe heard much shalbe requisite state haue alledged sondry reason decree former conuention auspurg concerning religion reformation kept al reuoke mine owne consideration wil know eche man seuerally impediment therfore let euery man see yt matter may come rehersall also decreed ye first day april thambassadours thelectours syx prince shuld mete norinberg consulte howe mony yt warre maydeburg mony taken comon treasorie war maydenburg shuld restored whatsoeuer shall determine comaunded like force ben enacted full assemble thempire much war shuld concerne welth al germany shalbe lawfull euery magistrate taxe yt people yt cause againe case citezen thempire straunger shall ayde maydeburg tha doeth theperour also promise charge concerning iurisdiction goodes churche themperour saith wil forese yt sued concerneth wil minister iustice vnto euery man shal recouer inioye decreed ayde king ferdinando turke although vnwillingly suche ayde promised former conuention finally therles mansfelde hedeck mustring men last wynter intended aide maidenburg sayd emperour chargeth comaundeth yt case souldiours assemble hereafter part germany prince state next shal immediatly ioyne force together subdue queche yt flambe force violece selfsame time henry frenche king receiueth faith tuition octauins farnesius mortal ennemy octauian farnese cliente frech king ferdinando gonzage themperours lieftenaut lubardy ye slaughter father also nere vnto placece theperour held fearing least shuld able kepe parma owne force craued foreine aide receiued ye citie garrison frenchme theperour toke right displeasauntly especially bishop rome shalbe declared hereafter day gaue theperour sentence lantgraue contie lorship diece conde ned contept answered said lay power answer muche might coferfrely wt cousellours awayting harkening ye custody came light would haue made escape lately shewed man might haue accesse speake wt without witnesse xxviii daye february bucer ended life death bucer cambridge buried honorably celebrated wt thepitaphes lerned amongst also wer two noble yong men house suffolke brother whose mother duchesse al time whilest sick also wed al fauour beneuolence bucer woman earnest zeale towards religio day byshop strasburg maketh greuous coplaint ye senate preacher complainte bysh strasb letter written though shuld styre vp yt people put priestes hazarde line wherfore requireth yt thinges may reformed el counsell shal serue x day march king ferdinado sone maximilian depart fro auspurg vnto
