time thei stode termes theperour reget flauders thambassadours also breme depart length without peace making meane time maideburg diuerse coflictes skermishes ofttimes wold townes men issue whan riuer elbe ouerflowed ye ship yt made brought vitayle vp streame time diuers wonder sene saxony amongest thinges thre sunnes many mones one pale colour woders saxonye red bloud maydeburg desired aide city sea coaste uolrate iohn sone erle manstelde vain thennemies build bulwarkes riuer elbe aboue beneth citie laying ship either side wel maned kepe townes men fro sayling oftentimes fought also wha wold driue away cattel townes men daily turned pasture citie xi day april ye byshop pope accuseth octauian farnese rome boke set forth sore accuseth octauius farnese time saith receiued parma ye high gouernment promysed fidelitie wold neither addict seruice none prince receiue forein power parma licece time appered bend towardes alteratio oftentimes admenisted duty frendly intermessages brother alexader cardinal answered yt time somwhat straugly sending letter threatned wt moste greuous punishment doe otherwyse afterward aduertised kepte conuenauntes well became ryght sore offended shoulde worke suche iniurie whome auaunced great honour benefites nowe therefore although might straightwaies determine matter euident yet thintent may vnderstande oure great humanity wil commaund within xxx day appeare rome answer accusation make v good assurance henceforth neglect wil euen condemned treason periury greuous crime landes goodes euer hath co maund publicke common require herein themperors fidelity wil aid punishing commaund yt man aid thing may day come thaction counsel commenced wer counsel trente cold commen thither warre parma hand matter adiourned first day septembre thambassadors prince met norinberge moneth april toke ordre new contribution mony siege maidenburge albeit themperoure commaunded afterward proclamation yet ther exceading great difficulty thing men vnwilling paye siege long appeared end wherfore duke moris also treated oftwith townes men peace fist day maye time come campe safe conduit matter long much debated self present fewe monethes duke maurice taken seruice counte hedecke whome emperoure outlawed erle hedeck frende maidenb made gouernour lipsia zeale vnto religion hatred bare themperour wished wel maydenburge counselloure peace war beinge finished duke moris might attempte greater thinges euen entred theyr head deuise war moued afterwards themperor shalbe declared place notwithstanding coulde agre vpon peace ouer hard condition propounded set purpose many suppose whilest duke moris differred time soughte oportunity enterprise length geuen french king proclaimed war emperor shalbe said hereafter meane season rose great rebellion campe maidenburge want paiment certaine monethes wage neither came prince octauius rome whan cited aided french kinges garnisons toke hand defend parma wherfore emperour xiii day may publishing letter much saith duety good wil towardes yt bishop church rome couet perform thing den forsee least occasion greater commotion arise italy place whilest consider vpon iust cause bishop moued hath omitted nothing octauius might dutye haue committed thys charge fernando gonzage canot self present yt shal aid bishop name wherfore wil command al louing subiects throughout lumbardie yt obedient war none otherwise tha self yt indeuor anoy thenemy muche possible therfore gonzage beginneth war first spoyling country war parma betwixt themperoure french king segeth city parma bishop rome mirandula therle mirandula french parte except cooped might haue holpen greatly prince city parma twenty day maye bishop rome wrote swiss louinglye like taken vnto name iuly second loued intierlye well also purposed louinge immitate example fotesteps hitherto dede hath bene occupied sondrye waighty affaire publick weale hath lesure declare thaffection mind yet hath borne still perfect memory apeareth chiefly ii thinges first custody body hath chosen citye garde nation secondly hath done also ye boloigne lagrasse trusting industry fidelity also much counsell called latelye first day may begon trent occasion geuen wryte vnto wher therfore presence great help furtherance godly nedeful worke exhorteth much yt prelate church within iurisdiction liberty wanting next session first day septembre rest shall vnderstande hierome franch knight ambassadour whose faith diligence hath many yeres ben wel tried matter hand greatly contetation wil send belog one principal bishop may treat touchinge counsel large thend may emperoures sonne departing auspurge italy returneth spain wente maximilian cosin brother lawe fetche awaye wife mother two child meane time kinge fraunce appease bishoppe senate french king excuse pope cardinal declareth rome ambassadoure mounsour de thermes hath receiued tuition octauian prince parma deserueth reprehension thys thing proprely belongeth vnto king succor thafflicted moreouer hath sought priuate commodity matter whatsoeuer hath done haue done church rome sake thexaple progenitor haue ben beneficial others many time also defeded force armes seing parma patrimony ye churche careful forsee shuld come men handes cause great cost charge daily wherfore desireth earnestly wold take part leaue opinion hath conceiued shalbe great comodity comon weale refuse satisfaction chuse warre peace self seeth greatly wil damage daunger italy europe also certen treaty religion may continue wherefore concerninge moost pearillous commotion shal arise hereof counsell already called assemble necessity muste dispersed troublesome time sende none bishop realme vnto trent thinges ther fault laid willing offer condition peace also take protesteth openly howe bishop trusting thaid promesses themperor nothing sterse minde pope iulye mileder thys ambassade xvii day iune duke moris graunteth againe safeconduite maidenburge send vnto ambassadours concerning peacs taking theyr iourney conducted marque alberte finde duke moris pirne towne meissen retourned home semed worke slackly come themperors name propoundeth condition yelde selues without condition humblye desire pardon shal make leage themperor king ferdinando austriche burgundie shal obserue al decree thempyre shall aunswere law recompence cleargy domage done cast theyr fortification rampires admit theyr city garrison cc soldiours shall receiue themperor kinge fardinando theyr deputy time wyth power someuer brynge deliuer twelue greate piece ordenaunce paye c crownes confirme condition oth thinges although able perfourme yet vtterly refuse thintercession counte hedecke little little thing remitted themperor sending letter germany especially state ye protestant religion sufficiently assured safeconduit exhorting trent first day maye inasmuch war parma day counsell differred first septebre said admonisheth yt come wise promising equity faithfulnes albeit ther many profession yet confer together thing hath ben chiefly necessary either yt dispaired touching successe thing el feared themperors displesure yt waxed faint hearted entrance daunger amonges ye city strausburge sent messagers enquire thinge yt nere also far wer purposed herein certenly duke moris gaue comaundement philip melanchton confession duke moris melanchton shuld pen tharticles doctrine shuld exhibited openly whan boke finished prince commaunded al diuines minister church mete lipsia viii iuly wheras red approued conset al ordre also toke christopher duke wirtemberge caused brentius compile boke argument albeit sence either wryting one yet wold duke moris haue boke exhibited self least many together propound thing common themperour might conceiue suspition conspiracy made neuerthelesse seding bokes fro wirtemberge approued saxon boke saxon boke wirtemberge diuines strausburge ether whan red agreed time shuld serue ther shuld sent counsel certen prefer defend thing duke wirtemberge thexample father made muche ihon brentius excellent learning vsing aide restoring godly doctrine also restored ministration humanity duke wirtemberge ward brentius church made president stutgarde xxv day iuly marque albert thabsence duke moris reiecteth thinges trompetter maidenburge answered condition peace propounded pirne duke moris day taken ouerthrow bickered greater force euer viii day august ther like haue bene greate sedition city letter wer brought soldioures wherein conteined ther wer certen senator wold betray city thenemy amonges henry alman wherfore soldiors flocking together cal whe came saith iniury refuseth punishment ca proued affirminge inuented ennemye thing hable power force armes might bring passe craft policy againe whan hole senate become surety matter appeased certain nombre citezens souldiors chosen whiche shuld marke manner letter henceforth sent fro eight day duke moris adressing letter ye duke moris letter emperour emperoure declareth verely content safe conduit geuen neither doth greatly find lacke therin heareth say decre made cou sell constance inquisition shoulde made againste heretickes suspected heresy haply called counsell repaired thither sentence shoulde pronounced although emperour graunted safeconduit decre remaine common recordes like decreed practise deede burninge ihon husse came thither safeconduite emperoure sigismunde seinge canne sende none trente vnlesse prelate graunte also safeconduit whole name counsel time past done counsel basil next vnto bohemers feared former example would come burnt child fyre dreades thither time vnlesse first receiued publike safeconduit whole counsell request therefore ether authority fauour would obteine theyr handes except might like case assured wer time past basill ought preiudiciall profession suffered man theyrs trauel thither cocerning bohemers ihon husse brent costantz warre insued therof haue spoken ye third boke decre made costantz next counsel holden fift yeare vii yeares time foreward euery tenth yere father assemble basill muche bohemers yet reconciled matter treated betwene letter intermessagers towne egre made draught safecoduit yt father wold admit bohemers said woulde refuse come sent declared theyr ambassade father approued fourme set theyr feales sending vnto withal frendly letter exhort prepare selues time safe conduit also emperour sigismund shall come vnto may take iourney fourth session yeare grace mccccxxxii maner assuraunce father shalbe shewed boke followeth wherefore whan duke moris warned hereof counsel maketh sute themperor vrgeth prescript basil last moste conuenient time protestantes case maner al one bohemers much like cause counsel tret called time past basil wit heresy might roted peace tranquillity mighte restored common wealth vice taking away church might refourmed xxvi day august yt morning sermon doctours preacher churche auspurge nombre ten sent lodginge bishop arras euery man self come thyther others knowing nothing matter commaunded stand apart speake together called hall sate bishop arras hasie seldie malueda certain others ordre one interrogatory minister auspurge seldie talke commaunded propoundeth question whether lord supper much co tained vnder one kind vnder moreouer many sacrament beleued finally taught forme prescribed themperor thre yeares past wheras promised wel senate state make aunswer euery man self seuerally christ institute whole supper whose prescript followed holy scripture found two sacrament baptisme lordes supper receiued fourme doctrine dissenteth holy scripture spake bishop arras great coler thinke themperor may constancy prelate wel deuine matter ciuill make lawes prescribe certain order themperor may dispute say haue saied fourme neither receiued certenly allow waxed also angry ful furye taunted sore rebuke whan also spake sacrament seldie ciuilian interpretoure rebuke thus sent comaunded tary led keper bestowed euery man place might come together sent certaine chiefest senatours whan commen let altogether commauded within iii day preacher shuld depart city sonne setting hereafter preach within limites thempire farre emperours dominion stretcheth speake none frendes kinsfolkes nether tell man cause preacher exiled departure wryte man within city signify done thinges constrained ful sore wils holding vp finger ceremony promise othe senate commaunded shutte vp church dores wherin luther religion taught til emperor contremaund sort also dealt afterward scolemasters city meminge others sweueland also sent come thither forbidden teach also retourne home againe wheras one alledged wife neare time deliuerance therfore besought earnestly might permitted se bishop arras turning towardes company calleth saith wife harlot thus therfore beinge compelled depart caused great heauines city citezens shewed pleasure could giftes liberality duke saxon also prisoner whan hard therof comforted intermessagers also holpe mony theyr departure cause emperor proceded thys wise thought first stirred vp hereunto many secondlye inquisition made found preacher let decre religion toke place finally heard report consent agrement diuines saxon sweuelad strausburge readiest way thought exiled end father trent might haue lesse victory easily case hardly haue anye aduersaries send therfore thus driuen oute banished fled partly swiss partly place brute thinge blased abrode made manye men fraid chaunced man douted also done place behold whilest men feare french king maketh warre againste themperor french king warreth vpon themperour withall taketh certain ship flaunders carieth away fraunce spoyleth piedemount turrin surpriseth many townes amonges cherie san damians conduit brissake touching shippes intercepted imperial writing setforth report whan themperour loked nothing lesse warre commaunded hys subiectes sit quiet french captaine poline chaunced vppon though caried quene scotlande signified vnto honoure sake olde accustomed facion shuld vaile bonnet strike saile hailse shoting ordinaunce thing whan done beinge vnarmed fradulently circumuented caried awaye many men great maruel king durst great good fortune prosperity emperor renounce frendship yea sayed haue chaunced emperour contrary expectation warred againste duke parma yet would seme therfore enemy french men whome made peace seuen yeares king sawe howe side octauius self shuld also wounded yt alredy intelligence ye turkes wer sailing sea intelligece intermessagers duke moris affected muche emperoure thought imbecillitye bodye disease retourned ofte longe life attempted thing stout courage manner time turkish fleete whan assailed malta vaine surpriseth tripoli city affricke blame hereof emperoure laying together french king sendeth ambassador prince city cotrarye tale ye king emperour germany affirming done craft policy king sone knew therof ercuseth matter saith cause turkish warre emperor restoreth city affricke according promes king fardinando doth hold fortify castel zolnocke standing frontier hongary within turkishe dominion denieth pay yearely tribute attempteth new enterprise transsyluania confuteth emperours narration wherin declared tripoli lost treason aremount french ambassador contrary narration confyrmeth letter great turke whilest thing wer bruing day consel came first septebre day ther present besides bishop italy spaine tharch bishop mentz treuers great ioy gladnes appered al long came also tharchbishop colo themperor earnestly moued presetly ye cousel auspurge also letter messagers yt shuld ther exceld al others dignity welth power part yt bishop germany coprised vnder theyr dominio wherfor thincking tary log sold altheyr horse reseruing made theirprouisio houskepig log seaso thither came also yt bishop straus uienne costintz chur numburge others let affaire age sicknes whan obtained licence sente theyr proctours bishop rome name cardinal crescet president ioyned commission tharchbishop counsel renued trent sipount bishop uerona themperor sente thither fraunces toletane hugh earle mounforte william pictaue diuers also place king ferdinando hongary making therfore assembly head church call session first day septembre whan masse done accustomed ceremony finished sodely came french kinges ambassadoure abbot bellosan letter indorsed conuention trent french kinges letter counsel deliuered bishop legate red superscription question arose shuld call conuention rather counsell vnlesse could shew commission letter neither red yet receiued exceading great clamour raised especially spanish bishop affirmed commission comprised letter bishop legate ariseth calleth side father reuestry matter decided indorsinge mighte taken good part condescended heare therfore whe red letter priuately wherin king briefly signify grief iniury done required credite ambassadour sit downe againe reading letter openly make answere kinge vnder name conuention doth signify counsell take good part neither therefore conceiue sinistrall suspicion great king hath title mooste christen case mind wil otherwise take letter wrytten commaunded declare message reciteth long oration wrytten first king rehearseth treated ambassadour paulus thermes bishop senate cardinal meanes hath nothing preuailed notwithstanding opened alwaies vnto peace saith bishop iuly thexample predecessoures ought appease controuersies prince hath kindled exceading great fire time ought least haue done whan doubtlesse state christen common wealth sore afflicted seing matter thus much dealeth sharply roughly theldest sonne church protesteth saith likewise done rome first troublesome tumultes warre may send bishop realme vnto trent taketh publike general cou sel rather certain priuate conuention instituted profit common wealthe vtilitye finally nether man within realme bounden decree therof declareth also furthermore wil vse suche remedy case require like matter progenitor haue accustomed euer sounde sincere mind towardes religion church rome neither wil comit thing worthy iust reprehension much burthened thiniuries hatred certain without desert otherwise present therfore let take protestation good parte communicate vnto doctrine testimony action thend may certify prince people christendome concerninge whole matter wheras saith wil vse remedy progenitoures thus standeth like region also fraunce bishoppricke abbotship vacant called chanons monkes fre election chuse meane benefice electiue terme bishop patrones bestowed moreouer maner sutes controuersies touching benefice matter church wer decided within euery prouince bishop rome couetousnes reseruatyos graceser pectatiue increased began subuert election reseruatios grace expectatiue name haue deriued gaine rome selues called also rome sutes euen fyrst instaunces call beginning alteration chanced fraunce time king lewes ninth resisted stoutly yeare lord cc lxvii made law thold custome shuld reteined nether tribute shuld cause paid bishop rome law verely force many yeares lengthe violence bishop preuailed far christendome stretcheth published foresaid grace reseruations chargeable men vntill synode basill toke away kinde pillage restored aunciente lawes contribution election prohibited firste frutes paid decre counsel king france charles seuenth thaduise counsell ratify yeare cccc xxxviii confirmed proclamation eugenius fourth pronounced counsell frustrate none effect said first boke bishop succeded reiected decre said scismaticall dede pius second sendinge ambassadoure lewes eleuenth sonne charles seuenth moued earnestly abolish confirmation king asketh counsell senate paris moost famouse fraunce maner consisteth wholy lawyer repeting many thinges great antiquity declare bishop former time counsel finally progenitor clodowey charles yt great phillip deodate lewes ninth philip le beau lewes hutine ihon first laste father grandfather haue herein determined except thauncient lawes obserued wil come passe say al thecclesiastical ordre shalbe brought confusion fraunce shalbe lesse populous whan many shal run rome shalbe much impouerished church many sumptuous building france shalbe neglected fall ruine touching mony matter vnles father confirmation decree basill maye sum mony caried rome force shalbe caried yerely fraunce vnto rome ten c crownes let thinges passe time pius second bishop haue bene vacant least twentye bishopprickes haue paid euery one aswel first frutes charge vi haue fallen abbotships lx euery one haue paied two thousand benefice haue bene void aboue two hondreth whiche haue paid v c crownes piece moreouer within realme hondreth thousand parish aboue infinite quantity gold hath bene gathered deuise bishop rome walke therfore father fotesteps swarue decre basil certainly counsell senate king ouercommen bishop either authority policy would neades abolish confirmation vniuersity part apealeth fro pope chief worker matter cardinall baluen great fauor king bishop rome corrupted kinges procurer also vniuersity paris whome much concerned resisted stout courage appealed fro bishop counsel afterward lewes twelfth great emnity cause iuly secod matter brought counsel laterane fraunces firste succeded lewes concluded length leo tenth vpon certaine condition bononie taken millan verely bishoppricke abbotship vacante couent dede haue thelection therof king shoulde within vi monethes nominate man bishop rome whome thought worthy office therfore thing amongs others king henry ambassador signified vnto remeady king wise wot bridle bishop dissention put practise confirmation decre basil espectally time thondrebolt greatly feared time paste muche realme fraunce large rich also rome without great hinderance want reuenues therof signified would longe shal hear remeadye also time paste vsed king fraunce tharrogancye poope boniface ye king fraunce phillip le beaw boniface eight wheras commaunded war sarazen refusing excuse forbad shuld take mony church within owne realme king driuen necessitye warres vnlesse obeyed suspend church assembleth noble state paris reciting wronges boniface whan bishop prince nobilitie demaunded confessed held al landes reuenues liberality benefit commaundeth henceforth ther mony conueid rome causeth alwaies passage watched diligetly wheras senate paris made thaccompt much bishopprickes abbotships vacant pay said say vnderstand former time paimet dubled exceadeth yearely reuenues much many beneficed men reason great exaction leaue buls handes banckers within realme fraunce xii archbishopprickes aygnes uienne lion narbony tolouse burdieux auxi burges tour roan rain sen twelue archbishopriks fraunce bishopprickes aboute lxxxxvi vacation whereof terme caried rome wonderful gold tharchbishopprickes verily thre score thousand crownes thre hondreth thaccompte made time lewes twelfth time letter red father say howe shalbe answered next session case ye king wil acknowledge counsel trent thinges nowe treaty admit much may lawfully therfore graunte testimonye instruction action whan day next session appoynted xi octobre euery man returneth home ii clock none semeth mete place declare manner ordre publicke session whan day came father vse speake assemble house bishop legate stil ye cathedral church vnto lodging stand souldioures either side way foure hundred fifty horsmen mo ix clocke commeth forth legate crosier cardinall trent goeth lefthand follow commission tharchbishops prince elector ambassador themperor kinge ferdinando ioyned together afterwarde residue bishoppes euerye man ordre whan last come church souldiours discharge piece repair market place temple kepe warde till counsell breake vp moost part taken vp country maye prest ready day towne self also doth kepe many whan come church heare masse done decree counsel recited day also assigned next session come also ambassadours haue ought say hard reason diuers sondry many busy ceremony vsed matter thaction delated til far day lengthe beinge finished legate retourneth home pompe sittinge bishop legate hath chief place next cardinal trent legate copartner tharchbishops elector lefthand sate thambassadors themperor prince middle fourmes sit archbishop bishop prelate euery man order came second day septembre theames geuen deuines deuines theme geuen discusse reason vpon wherof euery man may speake mind thintent next sitting may determined pronouncing sentence meane prescribed cleue holy scripture tradition apostle receiued approued counsel authority holye father vse breuitie abstain superfluous vnprofitable question eschue frowardnes contention co cerning ordre agreed deuines shoulde speake order speaking first bishop rome sent secondly whome emperor sent forth moreouer bishop legate permitteth searching truthe saye confute false opinion might read ouer maner bokes deuines great nombre spaniard italian germanes whome bishop rome themperour also sister mary sente whome also tharchbishops collon treuers bishop spaine italy broughte wyth unto whome referred knowledge al matter nether lawfull others suche profession taken degre doctorship speake thing yet fauor archbishop colon treuers admitted ihon gropper lawyer ihon delphe batchelor diuinity doctor much certaine former sittinges yere xlvi yeare following made determination original sinne iustification frewil vii sacrament new law terme general also baptisme confirmation particularely condescended al standing force decre shuld procede rest first dede sacrament thanckes geuing wherfore certain theames wer deliuered deuines self word shuld search try whether heretical mete condened holy senode theames collected oute bokes luther zwinglius bucer others deuines vse matter sort assemble daily house byshops maner making ye article faith legate space many hour obseruing thordre foresaid euery reasoneth said theames without interruption yet submit al saying iudgment church rome none protestats wer ther place open indifferently men bishop legate residue father many time ther preset deuines speake wordes sentence euery man registred scribe time men done reasoning accustomed done monethes space bishop resorte bishop rome legate examine maner making ye decree sentence deuines whiche scribe noted euery nobre natio wer chose certen perusing ouer al opinion might therof make doctrine thinge determined beleued euery poynt co demne contrary doctrin errours call wyth greuous sensure yet many word al thinges fine related whole assemble throughly agreed come vnto open session said decree red openly done bishop demaunded whether allow answer please well deuines declare theyr opinion euery matter bishop mitred men haue authority determine thing thus decreed commaund sacred holy call decree canon thinges dede thus done outwardly better acquainted romish matter wil affirme article doctrine written rome bishop commaunment sent legate time deuines may reasoning folow prescript ordre bishop finedeth ther diuers many bishop also therfore commonly spoken fond prouerbe holy ghost commeth many time rome tret inclosed male cause verely bishop sendeth ofttimes letter poste signifying holy ghoste pope commaundemet legate woulde haue done fourth day septembre erle hedeck commeth maidenburge duke moris mitigate condition propounded thought mete proceade treatye meane truse taken also prolonged many day shall hereafter declare french king hauing mind alienated french kinges wryting agaynst pope bishop rome publisheth wryting speakinge many thinges thiniury done vnto cause warre parma whye receiued octauius tuition commaundeth vnder great penalty mony henceforth conueied rome considering sinewes warre consisteth mony madnes mony subiectes maintaine force aduersarye strengthen power peculiare office bishop rome appease controuersies king verely paule ye third almost worn age came nice ligurie make reconcilement betwene father themperor iuly followeth cleane wates hauing lately called counsell necessary dede common weale hathe stirred vp war surely set purpose mighte exclude french church one principall ther holden lawful counsel wherin therrors prelate minister church mighte refourmed faultes amended proclamation king openlye proclaimed paris vii day septembre whereas day ther hainous proclamation setforth cruell proclamation againste lutheranes lutheranes whiche partly confirmed like decree former yeres partly semed diligently enough writte sharpned omitting nothing concerneth great seueritye wil vtter thing promised great reward whiche thing dede king thought haue done intet might bridell hereby fraunce desired haue alteration religyon leaste reason thys dissention hys bishop take ouermuch libertye againe least whiche beare reuerence churche rome shuld conceiue apinion minde altered concerning religion finally bishop self senate cardinal might see might receiued frendship whan wold themperours court came forth wryting wherin recited original cause warre parma iuste occasion displeasure bishop rome hath octauius earle mirandula vnquiet mind frech king seketh manner occasion bendeth whole force maye impeche defeat noble enterprise themperor beit themperor nothing moued withall thinges wil much couragiously stoutly procede octauius prete ded though come necessity thobeisance tuition french king thiniuries laying wayt ferna gonzage confuted wrytinge cause feare occasion geuen selfe hath ofttimes laid wait life gonzage recited placence came hand themperor peter aloise bishop rome bastard sonne whan obteined pirma placence gouerned common wealth cruelly like wicked lustes pope sonne nero accomplished wicked lust vpon wome men also wherfore slain home murthered citezens could longer abide great crudelitye townes men yt saw present daunger prepared case shuld come iurisoiction bishop church rome refuge saue gaue selues themperor especially consideringe also howe fre citezens empire therefore moued gonzage desired mighte receiued themperors tuition otherwise wold prouide aid succour elsse wher therfore vntrue shuld faine selfe fraid themperor hath imploid many benefit vpon farnesians hath chosen octauius sonne law gaue father aloise city nouaria euer honored hym dignity marque great hath bene vnthakfulnes time chiefly whan pretence frendship aided punishing certain rebel germany whole endeuor haue taken gene lumbardy verely tumult slain ful wickedly amonges others ioannine aurie man excellente vertue whilest themperor faithful seruice repulsed pearil country came forthe answer thinges purgation french kyng french kinges name wherin made mention themperor haue frendship bishop rome paule thyrde gaue vnto sonne peter aloise title degre marque toke vnto octauius sonne peter sonne law preferred sonne alexander many ecclesiasticall promotion afterward made league bishop wherin prouided decre senate cardinal made concerning gouernment parma placence themperor shuld confirme house frenesians time themperor made war germany prete ded cause dissention twixt ye pope emperor though moued war religion punish rebellion certain deuise displeasaunt bishop saw meane went priuate affair procure self rule gouernment neither disceiued iudgement war almoste finished whan themperor great neade frenesians seruice declared plainly bare bishop great good euen lieftenants lumbardy fixed eies mindes surprise placence long procured certain murtherers whiche slue peter aloise chamber townes men heard murther committed souldioures brought themperors name take castel themperor priuy act yet ben reason death bishop paule shuld haue restored city churche rome hathe onlye restored hath also gone take parma sonne law euen hand deuise whan bishop yet liued muche paulus beinge sore vexed minde thinke vpon vnkindnes departed life afterwarde wer murtherers take parma spake theyr mind fernando gonzage waged slay octauius whan therfore brought distresse whan saw whome loked healpe also father lawe laye wait take bothe landes life also requireth aid succor could deny humbly crauing xxiij booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument xxiij booke father trent enter matter graunt safeconduit come counsell french king accordeth pea disswageth swiss goinge thither composition made maidenburge vnder certaine condition part city germany send counsell ambassadours duke wirtemberge might harde duke maurice hauing last time sent ambassadours emperoure deliueraunce lantzgraue obtaining nothinge delay secreatly resolued make warre monke bishop uarady whose meanes king ferdmando taken transiluania slaiue themperor letter sendeth appease archbishop assureth self duke moris make fayre weather sendeth ambassador counsel whome thothers ioyned make request safeconduit theyr deuines aboue contrary parte iudges counsell obteining nothing departe vpon brute preparation warre theyr prince would make father counselare discorde newes came takinge auspurge fled al crescencethe pope legate fel terrible feare admitteth consolation death duke moris pacification assembleth state dominion thend septembre comaundeth repaire wittemberge thither also maidenburge send ambassadours couenaunted tenth day return home conuoy marque albert haue showed howe duke moris letter required deuines might haue safeconduit whole counsel emperor therfore commaundeth ambassadoures preferre matter father bryng passe wherfore xi day octobre commen ther decree trent lordes supper sitting wherin fyrst rehearsed exposition doctrine corporall presence christ sacrament thanckes geuing manner institution therof transubstantiation call worshipping adoration sacrament reseruing hoste cariyng sicke preparation man may receiue worthely al christian forbidde beleue teach otherwise decreed cannon recited wherein theames condempned said collected oute luther workes others notwithstanding gratify emperour leaue foure vndiscussed whether necessary saluation commaunded goddes lawe men receiue sacrament vnder kind whether receiueth one taketh le receiueth whether church hath erred ordeining priestes shoulde receiue vnder bothe kindes residue whether sacramente oughte ministred vnto child also touchinge theames synode shoulde determine thinge saied protestantes desired heard haue safeconduit graunted therfore haue longed greatlye hitherto theyr comming hope returne auncient concord church graunt safelye come safely retourne differ determination question fiue twenty day ianuary may fore day repair thither declare haue say treat also touching sacrifice masse argument like thinges read openly sort theyr aduersaries made request heard thinges wheras neuer thought suche matter besides duke moris man moued emperoure hys sute framed sort said matter much waighty would haue propounded intent thing thus pronounced man may make coniecture nothinge affirmed two thinges one muste neades either request duke moris coldlye slenderlye preferred vnto el haue vsed matter craftely negligentlye thing like true safeconduct sent duke moris would haue selfe assuraunce men bohemers time paste wrote safeconduite wordes negligently safeconduit father trent setting neither signe seale publicke lawful germaines indifferentlye repaire vnto counsel matter treated either full assemble certain commissioner propound confer reason shal thinke good either talke wryting without contumelious wordes reproches whe wil depart return home consideration ye counsell grauteth safeconduit farforth ye apertaineth moreouer shalbe lawfull wel sinnes past hereafter committed although heinous sinell heresy may owne pleasure chuse iudges selues eleuenth day octobre mentioned made certain lawes vnder title reformation whiche concerned theyr iurisdiction session decreed xxv nouembre wherein shoulde treated penaunce extreame vnction also electoure brandenburge ioachim sending ambassadour christopher strasie doctour ciuill law offered duety obeisance certainly thambassadour spake manye thinges large great good marque bra denburge statereth counsell wil prince answer haue taken much pleasure hear whole oration especially part wher prince submitteth self wholy counsell saith obserue decree truste thing hath nowe presently spoken perfourme dede deathe ihon albert whiche archbishoppricke maidenburge wealthy large gouernement committed fridericke sonne thelectour brandenburge whome colledge desired archbishop matter impeached could broughte passe rome thelectour ioachim protestantes religion openly knowen great let wherfore auoid suspicion ambassadoure sent fawning vpon prelate omitted poynt exquisit diligence ther peace concluded wittenberge beit siege leuied immediatelye yet frendly metinges betwene xii day octobre ye self time duke moris constraineth chat people countrye duke moris seaseth vpon dominio chat hesse wer iii yeres past themperours sentence taken fro lantz graue prisoner sworne vnto consent latzgraues sonne reason league inheritace saith betwene house hesse saxon default heir male one house succede thother man doubted concerned iniury themperor geuen sentence new commotion marueled would thend therof emperor court manner talcke made knew therof time duke somerset vncle kinge englande apprehended seconde time lorde duke somerset apprehended paget lord gray certain others ihon duke northumberlande chiefe rule gouernemente cause apprehension reported duke northumberland said howe laid wait life law newly made deathe amonges eight day octobre bishop rome created cardinall george martinuse bishop wardin high authority hongary common people named monke thordre paule first hermit french ambassadour commaunded attend answer xi daye octobre king would acknowledge counsell haue tould certes came yet counsel name setforth wryting king first recken vp loked ample thing hand sondry cause comminge counsel writeth yt french king messenger red letter conceiued inward sorow fallen expectation yet forsomuch neither touched gilt conscience haue geuen none occasion displeasure haue yet laid aside thold hope wherfore thopinion hath conceiued though counsel called priuate profit least take place worthy sinode cause calling counsell propounded cause calling counsell bishop also paule thirde verelye heresy mighte roted oute schole discipline amended peace restored church plaine inoughecan ther godly christianlike thing done heresy spredde throughout germany manner country great calamity counsell redresse cause also end theyr doyng thinges referred poynt let therfore permit bishoppes realme godly busines neaded feare least might suffred speake frely thought lately ambassadoure bothe quietly patiently heard whan told ioyfull newes seing priuate man heardwith lei tie man beleue shuld denied vnto publike parson placed high dignity though send man yet shall counsell neuertheles haue bothe dignitye authoritye lawfullye summoned iust cause restored signified would vse remedy progenitoures done supposed would neuer procede farre reuoke thinges taken away abolished time past great commodity kinges fraunce seing god hath highly auaunced indued great benefites truste verely wil nothing wherby shuld seme vnthankeful ether towards god mother holy church let haue respect progenitor title surname christen king finally father king fraunces honoured former sinode sending thither bishoppes ambassador men excellent learning oughte walcke fotesteps fresh domestical follow exa ple remit priuate displeasure common wealthes sake themperor bishop exhorted swiss shuld counsel vaine bishop dede treated hierome francke saied french king gaue charge vnto morlet ambassador french disswageth yt swiss fro counsell shuld indeuor perswade send man thither morlet fineding difficultye herein sendeth uergerius expert man affaire rhoetia axeth counsel furnished argumentes shortly setforth boke eschuing counsell morlet beinge thus instructed came vnto thassemble baden alledgynge reason perswaded longe sence forsaken papistry also residue swiss euen desired wherfore none came trent rhetia cam thither bishop rome commaundement thomas plat bishop chur whan rhetians vnderstode aduertisement uergerius bishop rome intended howe would recouer authority amonges called home againe spaniardes wer land wirtemberge sent time themperor sent italy serue land wirteberge delyuered spaniardes warre parma theyr departure whole country deliuered greuous seruitude wherwith ben oppressed space fiue yeares onlye castell asperge emperoure reserued self placing garrison almaines day also henry hasie emperor commaundement traueling throughout sweaden euery wher chaungeth state common wealth ordeineth newe senator dischargeth also preacher scholemasters vnles wyll obey decre religion latelye done auspurge mentioned duke moris duke wirtemberge commaunded article doctrine wrytten shuld exhibited also senate strashurge ioyned selues vnto theyr wherfore duke wirtemberge sending two ambassadoures ihon theodoricke pleninger ihon hecline commaunded thambassadour wirtemberge counsell exhibite openly confession doctrine say also deuines shuld come shal treat al thinges plentifully defend may haue safecoduit according decre basill sone came trent almoste end octobre go vnto earle mounforte exhibite vnto commission theyr ambassade shew theyr prince name would propound certaine thinges counsell talke tended end thoughte good repair bishoppes legate seinge confer thing wold apere shoulde attribute vnto chiefe right authoritye iudgemente wherin perceiued preiudice hinderance matter wherfore come wryting letter theyr prince fary answer pleasure herein meane season deuines reason theyr manner question propounded concerning penaunce vnction third day nouembre counte hedeck sent duke moris came maidenburge calling captain souldiors place pacificacion maydenburge without city made ful end wrytinges matter drawen sealed soldiors dede assured safe conduit might safely depart viii daye month sone discharged priuelye reteined hired againe duke megelburge pacification released duke moris purposely woulde owne name condition peace humbly craue pardon themperor shuld nothing house austrich burgundy submit selues chambre obey last decre auspurge answer al law cast fortification city themperoures pleasure admit theyr city themperors garrison time set open theyr gate pay l crown themperors cofers charge warres deliuer themperor xii great piece ordenaunce set liberty duke megelburge thother prisoner whan soldiors garnison wer gon citye daye nombre ii fotemen hondreth horsmen duke moris sent v enseignes footemen nexte day senate going forth mete entreth city wt hys whole army receiueth al thobeisance themperor thempire self bene chiefe captain warre leauing garrison leadeth away reast causeth preacher sente counselloures faccie carlebice mortisie complaineth iniurye done reason bokes picture setforth though shuld haue forsaken doctrin gospel though haue moued warre city constant professing true doctrine wherfore hath iust cause offended would followe affection thinges remitteth common wealthes sake requireth wold henceforth exhort people amend liues honor magistrate commaundeth also praiers openly made emperoure selfe magistrate saith moreouer howe presente counsell holden trent wherin exhibit confession godly doctrine well owne name also prince state let pray therfore god would prosper turn good whole action counsell raile againste haue accustomed deliberating vppon matter make answer dede set forth picture iudge worthy reprehension certaine dominion haue space iii yeares swarued pure doctrine gospell cannot denied bokes monument extant city besieged gospell easy proue man consider fyrste author warre admonishinge people haue omitted nothing wil also hereafter counsel assembled quench verity wherin romish antichriste obteineth highest place none otherwise pray god may confound breake dissipate enterprise deuises good thinge loked theyr handes conditious peace dede spread abrode certaine well assured liberty religion duke moris also rather city open themperour thend declared afterward sorte maidenburge deliuered besides thexpectation many got selues great praise renowne amonges foraine nation much manner alone throughout al germany declared theyr example thing constancy may moreouer noble fame consta cy maiden burge thend theyr misery thentry beginning warre whose aid counsel afflicted shalbe declared whilest duke moris city declared sufficiently intent wit wold hazard life deliuer father inlawe neither dissemble next daye moued certen man sent ambassadours emperour ye deliueraunce lantgraue also ioyned herein king denmarke many prince germany shall heare hereafter vnlesse could bringe passe fully determined attempte thing force duke maurice intedeth war vpon emper already compact french kyng touching sent priuely iohn fraxinie byshop baion man well acquainted germany vnderstode tongue emperour appered nothing moued thinges wholy addicte war parma treaty counsell trent tyme also maximilian emperours sonne inlawe coming spaine arriued gene wyfe child frenche men sayling porte marseille bording certen shippes toke spoyled cause whereof said bee horseman king ferdinando sent italy receiue conduicte sonne comming spayne ayded ferdinando go zage certen warlike exploicte frenchemen also vnder pretence amitie entring hauon barcelona take away galley six shippes burthe furnished thinges necessary vse nauigatio maximilian certenly imperialls recite certe inuectiue wherin complaine iniuries frenchman peace broken prince intreated emperour conuentio auspurg case might present least wold far place cousel thing grauted said vnto wold remaine vpo border thempire shewed wherfore departing fro auspurge beginning noueb came inspruck thre day iourney trent thought haue done bicause cousell also warre parma nere al thing shuld done diligence shortly xxi day noueb iohn sleidane ambassadour citie strasburg iohn slefdan ambassadour strasburge counsell came trent yt might ye comon cause ioyntly wt duke maurices duke wirteberges ambassadours vnto citie ioyned themselues esting rauesburg rutelinge bibrach lindawe gaue commission treate also name frankefort chiefly norinberge sent may doubted ulmes hadde chaunged theyr religion prescript emperour auspurg place preacher bannished lately sayde could well sende howbeit though chaunced senate would haue done nothinge herein emperours consent moneth nouember byshop rome one daye created xiii cardinalles italian wont pope createth xiii cardinal prouide garrysons defende selues whan xxv day noueber come father placed seates accordingly decree recited penaunce sacrament instituted christe necessary suche baptisme fall vnto synne agayne decree penaunce also seuerall sacrament baptisme table saluation shipwrake hath chaunced wordes christe whiche geueth apostle holy ghost ought vnderstande power forgeue sinnes sacrament sinn shuld forgeuen thre thinges required contricion confession satisfaction contrition dede true profitable sorrowe prepareth man vnto grace confession maner secretly recite synnes prieste bee ordeyned goddes lawe necessary saluation sinnes whiche come remembraunce circumstaunces rehersed confession ought euery yeare least chiefly tyme lent absolution bare ministery wherby remission sinnes denounced act iudicial priestes though neuer synfull haue authoritie geue absolution byshoppes doe reserue vnto selues certen case offence whiche priestes assoyle well done although crime remitted yet punishement therfore released satisfaction consisteth worke fayth penaunce eyther god sendeth vpon v prieste inioyneth el owne fre wyll chose vnto selues synnes clensed concerning temporall punyshement satisfaction wherby synnes redemed goddes seruice prieste hath power bynde lowse therfore may inioyne penaunce hym confesseth synnes muche concerning penaunce decree extreme vnction sacrament instituted christe geueth grace remitteth synnes comforteth sycke vse sacrament wherof spake saint iames apostle seniours also wherof made mention aunciet yeares priestes thei minister sacrament doctrine commaude celebrated obserued suche teache beleue wyse deteste accurse pestilent wicked next daye session brought duke wirtemberges letter ambassadours whome commaunded procede assession xxv daye nouember shoulde exhibite confession doctrine wrytte therfore letter brought lyttle tyme late long season next sitting earle mounfort also absente goe cardinall trent saye haue certen thynges whiche prynces name propounde counsell howe haue bene done laste session letter came late occasion paste wherfore requyre whiche germayne borne would loue countrie prynces sake also whome knewe case bring passe father called together myght declare message moste ample wordes promiseth great beneuolence howe wyl preferre matter byshops legate sayeth howe agreed amonges father man shal propounde thyng openly vnlesse discipline amongst father first knowen maner thyng frenche ambassadour cause decree whan lately ope sittyng reysed vnsemely vprore clamorouse outcrie wherfore inquireth effect requeste desire matter shewe letter comission wherby vnderstanding exhibite boke doctrine letteth departe time put hope within fewe day thing might take effect next daye calleth againe saieth howe hath conferred legate whole matter better credit also shewed letter comission sore offended shoulde thynke exhibite wryting thynketh thus whiche ought dutie reuerently receiue obeye rule order doctrine woulde prescribe theyr elder whiche thynge absurde vncommely aunswere coulde get none thys present yet woulde bee hande wyth hym agayne biddeth also good comforte within fewe ambassadours wirtimb deluded dayes tyme maximilian austriche approched nere cardinal going forth mete mantua admonisheth ambassadours wixtemberg much must nedes departe thei repare toletane emperours ambassadour vertue office authoritie may profite greatly right gladly euen sake whiche hath comended matter vnto followyng counsell spake vnto promising gently many thynges departeth whan thei came againe second tyme began make excuse reason disputation diuines nowe haue wher father must present whiche finished would espie occasion thought receiued muche like aunswere cardinall done least shuld take awaye hope heard hereafter alledged cause especially considering bothe howe emperour hath procured counsell permitted publique decree empire euery man myght frely propounde matter soeuer wold meane season ambassadour strasburge goeth emperours ambassadour william pictaue absence erle monforte muche lyke condition authoritie sheweth commission ambassade maner custome sayeth sent thither ye intent might conferre consulte residue profession auspurge howe controuersie religion doctrine myght appeased publique quiet established taking copie commission whiche sayde would sende emperour speakyng many thinges doctrine dignitie counsell like dede learned man oratour offered seruice diligece laste nouember tyme diuines theames deliuered touchynge sacrifice masse terme myght speake myndes maner mentioned howe duke maurice sent ambassadours emperour thambassadours mauris marque brandeb emp lantgraue declared ioyned ambassadours prince electour brandenburge wherfore admitted speache aboute begynnynge december whan theyr prynces name done theyr commendation knowe saye moste redoubted emperour distresse ar moste noble prince electours duke maurice marque brandeburg oration ye deteyning lantgraue wher thei chau ced beyond expectation whilest singuler industrie wolde procure vnto easye honorable victorye demynysh charge warre restore common countrye peace quietnes thing hath ben cause also haue ofte intreated sometime ambassadours somtime person wold haue cosideratio set lyberty time verely added moreouer case ye requyred assuraunce besydes suertyshipp wherwith wulfegange countie palatyne people hesse bounden wolde refuse unto requestes made aunswer christopher carlebyce iames schillinge sent laste vnto deliuer hym appeare action emperiall assemblee whiche hande myght againe promised nothing el kept conuenautes deteined prison perpetual occupied affaire could selues come assemblee moued agayne counsellours letter auspurg writing againe cause offended wyth might deliuer pronounce free bonde wher bounde lantgraues sonnes wherfore determined moue highnes againe woulde haue come selues knowe howe letted war maydeburge marque also sicknes therfore wold haue thing done v first dede whan pleasure lantgraue submitte self vnto without condition receiued intelligece byshop arras mynde verely admitte obserue condition propounded deliuered vnto nowe haue ben perswaded render selfe sorte assuredly nedeful declare vnto shold neither deteined prisoner farther burthened pacification prescribed therfore ye prince assure thing also cousellours vnderstode right well desired yt certe article yt peacemaking might declared vnto also requested yt might staied matter aboue vi day ye thing signified ye bishop arras thinges also prince maner obteined would albeit treaty case vnderstande men one sorte muche whan came contrary promyse committed warde yet neuer blame cesar neyther stode termes therfore counsellours sauing whan lantgraue coming signified vnto come vnto numburg tha spake selfe sayde perswaded admitte condition propounded co ming far wold permit wold go mete moch come thither vpon ther fidelitie besought might otherwyse burthened pacification comprised thing selfe graunted frankely went forth brought hale last treatie ther mention made shoulde detayned prisoner lantgraue kepte prisoner againste leage made thing thei suppose owne men also testify namely bishop arras onely conference seldus whome many time ded associate vnto coditions admitted humble submission prince beleued verely shoulde haue bene released immediately many cause thought fyrst bycause youre counselours made mention imprisoment chiefest point peacemakyng diligetly marked ye lantgraue doubtles aboue al thing agayne pacification many thing contayned cannot perfourmed captiue prince onely libertie made submission pardoned offence promysed abolysh prescription geue letter reconcilement moreouer ye content suertyship wherby prouided case obserued couenauntes people present captiue suerties force armes shoulde compell dutye certeinely thing purpose al together superfluous ther supposed haue suffred punishment owne body neuer thought matter yet cousellours made mention therof vpon truste cofidence sent thing shoulde chaunce vnto besyde promysed bound sonnes abyde lyke fortune shoulde minde opinion also cofirmed time submission duke alba badde lantgraue supper bedding hospitalitie maner prince custume germany could interprete thing shoulde goe duke alba house vnto prison shoulde accompany bring thyther conceaued leaste susspection lantgraue blod supper kepte prisoner world matter shoulde beleue euer wolde haue done seing prince empyre electours borne moste noble house wolde neuer haue imployed seruyce sorte tyse noble prince nere friend kynsman distresse themselues bring prison neither knew thing therof till supper ded duke alba fyrste say vnto howe muste remaine castell custodie howsoeuer ded good mynde sayd begenning moch bounden fidelitie may easely perceiue case great long suite suerties put shoulde longer detayned howe greuous harmefull wolde chyldren kynsfolkes se also mightye emperour co sydering come germaynes race asmoch ye lantgraues sonnes poursue theyr ryght vrge yelde selues captyue fourme obligation mete doe maintayne ther honour estimation according auntient accustumed manner nobilitie germany haue none excuse vnto prince although eyther ye power sue dede obligation haue taken waye peraduenture lantgraue neither copositio geuyng faith occasion haue shewed deteyned prisoner certeyne wearynes impacience long imprisoment hath sought som meanes obteine liberty perchauce minister haue attempted thing kepers prince doe besech preiudicial somoch reason ther obligatio ar great perplexitie ye nexte almighty god may delyuer moch vnknowe vnto stroke vpo rock moch haue certen inteligence good fidelitie duty time aduersitie employed land good lyfe bloude commoditie followyng herein fotesteppes auncesters moste hartely earnestly require would releasing captiue succour haue respect herein much lantgraues doinges vnto honour exceadingly especially since fewe family haue progenitours house austriche burgundy spared neither coste perill case feare least set libertie kepe conuenaunt highnes knoweth well enough whan matter shal come issue nobilitie people hesse haue promised othe prince haue done likewyse suertishyp require assuraunce haue made offer diuerse tymes heretofore nowe also haue geue v authoritie treate matter moreouer concerning condition suche might streight wayes accomplished suppose lack founde castels sodainly rased knewe wel cause doubted matter would holde lantgraues sonnes excused furthermore lacke founde wyll whole indeuour may cotented satisfied wherfore thei themselues haue time father grandfather done thing hath bene acceptable either emperour maximilian rest progenitours thinke may doe perfourme thing tyme come may pleasat ioyfull desire moste effectually woulde suffer nowe receiue fruicte would cause hope promesse appeare whiche first made hale numburge last also auspurg intent verely maye honor heceforth muche industrie courage may reioyce sidelitie seruice thei haue done hath bene well imployed largely rewarded otherwyse nowe obteyne nothing may coniecture moste puissaunt emperour discommodities wyl sue tyme shalbe enforced answer matter declare innocecie hope vndoubtedly graunt requestes whiche verely accept high benefite also lantgraue sonnes frendes shall euermore endeuoure may requite benefite bycause thing doeth muche concerne estimatio haue also intreated prince make intercession whose ambassadours se haue done intent thynge whiche could yet obteine prayer messegers letter myght bryng passe commendation fauour praye take parte tyme thus spoken deliuer vnto hym letter ferdinando kyng romaine albert duke bauier brethre duke luneburge wrytten behalfe lantgraue name ye prince intreated lantgraue prince sent ambassadours friderick electour palatine woulfgange prince bipounte iohn marque brandenburg henry iohn albert duke magelburge ernestus marque baden christopher duke wirtemberge ambassadours streight way oration rehersed whan shewed co mission duke maurice say marque brande burg electours wher deteining lantgraue great perplexitie sayde would make sute oratio price abassadours emp highnes hym moste mercifull emperour intreated prince would sue intent treatie myght commendation importaunce whiche dutie verely could iust cause denie great frendshyp alliaunce amongest considering therfore matter thus hath bene sufficiently heard either ambassadours longer deteyned shulde greatly obloquie defamation haue promised fidelitie prince whiche haue sent v praye beseche ponder thynges dilligently suppose concerne also dignitie honour estimation preserued neyther thinge chaunce vnto greuous blotte redounde noble fame whiche doubtles wyll come passe vnlesse captiue deliuered wherfore moste instauntly require intercession praiers maye take place may shortly deliuered especially since hathe acknowledged faulte humblie also craued pardo bene nowe deteined captiue long season chiefly great necessitie two prince electours requyreth tyme handled matter right faithfully would gratifie fell pecke trouble albeit peraduenture treatie errour committed thinges wel vnderstande yet conuenient comly clemencie preferre equitie extremitie regarde muche captiue fatall necessitie electours deale frankely example progenitours euer great respect care dignitie prince imperial verely redounde honour amongest almen also excite shewe vnto fidelitie beneuolence make preste willing doe thinges sake king denmarke also sending ambassadours maketh intercession maner like effecte emperour fewe dayes maketh aunswere empe aunswer ambassabours muche matter weightie requireth deliberation meane season mention made vnto hym duke maurice certen weightie cause wyll shortly repare muche hauing wrytten letter loketh dayly therfore bycause matter may beste treated whan present differ vntil may retourne home vnto prince shewe name remember intercession vse matter may vnderstand comendation lightly estemed long william lantgraues eldest sonne came lantgraues son cometh maurice duke maurice bycause put hope intercession made certen moneths past since ye ambassadours toke iourney inquireth done saieth ambassadours denmarke came late till emperour went auspurg insprucke thing delayde againe sheweth answer emperour made bycause desireth speake differreth matter till albeit lothe present leaue countrie yet tendreth case greatly sayeth determined go hauing first receiued letter sayeth answer vncerten doubtful neither see good loked ye meane whyle father estate miserable pineth way sorrowe lothesomnes pryson whome may meanes leaue destitute bothe bycause duty also promesse therfore let hym indeuour bryng passe within certen shorte tyme made direct aunswere done neyther marque brandenburge may take displeasauntly sued comauded answer obligatio cocerning iourney wold shuld take delibe knoweth whether wysdome thinges thus handeled countenaunce certen counsellours whome duke maurice woulde make priuie deuise since firste began treate counte hedecke tyme allured part force told fourmer booke would scarsly let owne cousell know thyng matter muche none vnderstode wherfore fraxineus ye frenche ambassadour came made whan therfore receiued answer themperour fixed minde make warre taried seasonable tyme yeare touching forsayd theames began dispute seuenth daye december sixt daye whiche shortest daye wynter maximilian entring trent wyfe child receiued byshop rome legate maximilian entreth trent byshops spayne italy diuers also germany yet electours brought spayne olyphaunt inde whiche kyng portugall geuen rare spectacle beast often sene germany next daye fortuned yt iohn gropper whome spake dispute waxed hote inue ed railing groppes sore melanchthon bucer though dead rayled moste bitterly germain spaniardes italian great deale temperate whiche thing decree thempire also lawe selues made verely matter treated affection set aparte without rayling wherfore day iohn sleidane occasion talke spake emperours ambassadour pictaue complaineth permitted haue suche libertie sayde cleane contrary willes also mindes father haue bene moste earnestly admonished thei abstayne albeit perchauce prouoked example aduersaries whiche haue nowe many yeares triumphed kynde yet take suche order shall emperour wold also loth occasion offence shuld geue cardinal dalmatia slayne owne house xviii daye december byshop wardin hongary lately made cardinall slaine home owne house suspicion conspiracie turkes authour murther iohn baptiste castalde italian whome emperour sent hongary assiste king ferdinando ayde counsell sfortia palauicine also present byshop rome heard murther appointed certen examine matter also doeth excommunicate parson aboue named whan wydowe iohn uayuode sawe yt coulde hardely defende transsyluania made conuenaunt king ferdinando permitted haue gouernment deliuering armes ornametes realme retourned lande poole meane therfore ferdinando possesseth maner transsyluania helpe byshop wardin appered afterwardes attempt newe deuises aspire gouernment lost life shewed fourmer boke preacher minister churche expulsed fro auspurg wherfore moste part church distitute priest without great grudge people supposed senate caused emperour thus therfore feared least heate would somtime breake length whan sought long much foud one caspar huberine whiche professed fourme doctrine prescribed emperour certen bokes wrytten concerning religion whiche alwayes wel commended euen luther selfe nowe altered mynde affirme came auspurge began preache feared mutinie people christmas began wo der many red bokes soldiours well suche beseged maydenburg defended wyntered thuringe aboutes much harme especially men churche amongest others also archebyshop mentz whose limites reache vnto place tharchebyshops mentz treuers collon herewith offended damage receiued yt sawe also chaunce might redounde vnto determined retourne home sending bothe letter messenger emperour matter emperour desired greatly haue counsel continued answering third day ianuary letter saith xxi deceber come handes bycause commaunded empe letter byshops eleciours fraunces toletane treate suche matter wryte vnto againe much ye byshop arras declared vnto procurer certen thinges sorte name thought bene satisfied much heare say vnpleasaut brute reised intende retourne home thought good admonishe wryting geue credit althinges reported although hath ben certen tyme brute though feared leaste commotio hessia yet credible informed thing deuise fewe whiche greater part also discommendeth wherfore rather thought selues wilbe mindful othe fidelitie wherby bounde also dutie whiche owe common wealth neither trusting thinges vncerten take great daunger vpon moreouer haue sent intermessagers vnto prince state city thereaboutes haue searched diligently matter shoulde euery man goeth haue founde men obsequious dutie surely haue geuen none occasion offence man duke maurice dede went reporte also long since whiche peraduenture original hereof bene captaine bandes whiche rendring maydenburg assembled together hurt certen place wryting letter late sending ambassadours also promiseth al endeuour euen present two ambassadours shal go hence morrowe cou sell trent furthermore hath signified selfe repayre vnto certe weightie necessary affaire knowe certen reportes wyll either daye morrowe furthest take iourney hytherwarde maydenburg finally maketh large ample craft dawbyng promesse loialtie obeisaunce ought loke nothing hande honorable case fayth worlde yet remaining seing bloud birthe germayne brought beleue attempte imagine craftie deuises concerning bandes wyly begy ed maydenburg haue heard many complaine certen state carefull least remoue campe worke greater mischief vnderstode lacke paiment wage flocke together worke oultrage sending ambassadours gouernours comaunded thei see wyse mony leuied paie wryting letter also duke maurice became suertie money owyng soldiours may discharged bycause bounde loue chiefly peace tranquillitie germany nowe therfore loke maner euery moment done suppose verely shal slippe awaye without dammage man mutinie trouble appeased case whan payment made armie discharged easely perceiued deuise hande shall also take waye whiche haue head present nowe touching reportes brought vnto whiche many dede yet doubtfull ful contrarietie al suppose imagined moste part ennemies according olde maner lightnes spred abrode disturbe counsell peace germany truste god suche priuie conspiracy shall last come lyght haue ende according demerites since rendring maydenburge thinges quiet germany prince state louingly obediently demeane selues towardes certenly see cause new mutinie ought imagined preteded ignoraunt men ought circumspecte especially time sturres foreine nation suspicion least dauger neglected againe neyther cleane voyde care diligence wyll let passe deaf yeare thinges reported haue maner place espialles inquire euery matter herein spare neyther coste king haue long armes trauell howe make full determinatio thing vpon euery light reporte selfe wysdome consider vndiscrete thing shuld nowe leaue counsell vnlesse extreme necessitie vrged wyse committed considering howe great furtheraunce consisteth presence feared least departure counsel dispersed also religion selfe shoulde vtterly peryshe wherin verely bothe common saluation men priuate commoditie resteth consideryng case standeth thus hartely desyre lordes mentz treuers altering counsell doe yet take iourney lorde collon make great haste exhort ernestly perseuer styll generally require occupie chiefest place amogest state empire would helpe one ayde counsell declaring amonges selues brotherly loue beneuolence meane tyme wil kepe diliget watch common wealth muche able polycie power seke quenche tyme flambe shall haply arise intent ciuile euils oppressed force increased forrein warre may easely defended hauing country quiet traquilitie recouered may altogether applie affaire christian commo wealth yet neuerthelesse would aduise suche counsellours officer haue left home prouide thinges nothing chaunce vnloked conferre counselles fredes neighbour trusted wherin may also profite thing gladly tumulte thinke wyll may muche ready euer chaunceth seing great distaunce betwixt v shall pleasure case shall wryte vnto suche thynges hence forth shall haue intelligence shall whatsoeuer shall thinke concerne common wealth wyl let vnderstande haue oftentimes promysed wyll dede perfourme defence tuitio day erle montfort returned trent unto therfore go ambassadours wirtemberg declare howe haue brought nothing passe hitherto cardinall toletane much fellowes ambassadours present emperours persone require yt theyr prince demaundes might heard receiued good aunswer almoste dispaire thynge pourposed goe home prince lately commaunded case longe delayed ambassadour also strasburge declared commission erle monfort done pictaue also toke copie commission diuines disputation ceased father assembled dayly searching opinios might make decree shewed contrie germany chosen thre bishop collo uienne nuburg iulius pssugius whilest occupied affaire prepared al thing ye next sitting vii day ianuary come thither ambassadours duke maurice whome emperour written litle wuolfie coler leonard badehorne ciuilian coming byshops whome spake well chered vp chiefly emperours ambassadours thought nowe doubte duke maurice whiche followed peaceable wayes thyrde daye came declare message thabassad du maurice come counsell emperours ambassadours first recite howe diuines come sufficiently assured counsell cause prynce sende man dede right wel affected towardes common wealth desyreth much waye concorde might foud therfore fully resolued sende owne suche good men louers concorde doubteth diuerse others wyll lykewyse may done requestes first shall come may haue saufeconduicte according fourme decree basill bohemers assured tymes past surcease action meane tyme tyll come shal come fourmer actes may retracted daie appointed session adiourned may counsell wherin nation people may assemble byshop rome take vpo hym authoritie president submitte hym selfe counsell release byshops othe men voyces counsell may free iudgementes intangled whiche thynges also whan shall thinke good wyll declare large assemble father make requeste thing may done shortly may diuines haue already taken iourney come least fortie myles waye tary nowe tyll called tenth daye ianuary sayed howe ryght glad comming also woulde preferre thynges vnto father signified also whole matter emperour gratifie duke maurice aduise counsell father maurice feared emperour aunswere myldly frendly requestes moreouer duke wirtemburge heard certentie knewe duke maurice sent thyther commau ded ambassadours tary tyll next session exhibite theyr wrytinge sent also wrytinge howbeit brief tenure maner request duke maurice wylled put vp also confession doctrine ambassadour strasburge commaunded attende till either duke maurice men came certenly knowe wold come whan come therfore communicateth cause ambassade sheweth thinges stode vnderstandeth againe commission ambassadours wirtemberg case comen al notwithstanding long came followed vrged chiefly therfore intreated diligently thre archbyshops electours cardinall trent greatfrende duke maurice emperours ambassadours common wealth sake would wylling selues also perswade rest father herein none ambassadours would go legate crescentius fellowes legate least thei appere attribute thing bycause sent followe emperours mynde satisfie decre empire therfore vsed ambassadours high chief magistrate intercessours present time came newes ye within day duke maurice wold come emperour whiche made al men better hope great deale willing moneth beheaded lodon ye duke somerset vncle said king englande certe frendes michel stanope sir duke somerset beheaded rafe fane sir myles partrich knightes reported done procurement duke northumberland wittier sorte began euen feare good king whome kinsfolkes dispatched waye sawe open daunger treason duke somerset dead duke northumberland put king newe chamberlaines amonges sonnes kinsman whan daye next session hand emperours oratours sending thambassadours duke maurice declare thei haue done father cause thei haue obteined saufeconduict wyshed also thaction may discontinued differred vntill come may present al nation people assembled lieth father perfourme counsel lawfully somoned although al come yet standeth neuerthelesse ful strength dignitie suche decree made reuoked let consider selues howe vndecent thing belongeth reproche infamie great assemblie let diuines come shall matter hearde also intreated moste gently thyng offende done without reason see selues ouermuche aggrauated haue free libertie departe whan wyl desyre earnestly would geue thynge tyme couet haue thynges graunted one moment whan shall come action may dyuerse thinges occasion obteyned whiche appeare nowe harde father saye desyrous reformation wyll fayle doe dutie longe sore diuines comming vnto whome wyll shewe good wil fidelitie haue thynges propoude great importaunce desyre may begynne intent occasion may come forth also whiche requyre moreouer touchyng submission byshop rome desyre thyng qualifie father see perceyue som high dignitie may reprehended ought dede redressed yet must procede fine deuise emperours mynde wyll thinges ritely lawfully done finde daily experience howe fayre dissemblingly must treate byshops legate verely must vse singular dexteritie deale policie wherfore let nowe contente selues suche thinges grauted surely without great trauell obteyned fynde meanes diuines may make haste neyther publique priuate cause omitte parte dutie whan come hytherto deliuer vnto saufeconduicte whiche byd reade sende againe xxii daye ianuary thus sending awaye selfe momente maurice ambassad sent awaye call ambassadours duke wirtemberge first make excuse touching fourmer tyme moste weightie affaire father nowe haue anythyng doe ready thesame sayd haue long tyme nowe thinges propounde hearde spede assone dimissed sende ambassadour strasburge speake effecte declared briefly wherfore sent reason coletane vnto whome spoken present sayde nothing el saye loked dayly letter fro home immediatly duke maurice ambassadours come commaunded wryte home comission attende senate would haue done howebeit required meane tyme matter whiche ambassadours duke maurice preferred vnto would vse selues myght come forthwith open treatie saide againe howe certen thinges ambassadours duke maurice duke wirtemberge whan thing shalbe done let hym vnderstade may signifie citezens verely greatly wyshe concorde emperour also applieth whole endeuour study desire muche also thaction might beginne doubte god wyll assiste moste honest enterprise whan done ambassadours saxon wirtemberg strasburge hauing coference together way fourme saufe conduicte whiche receiued muche wrytten euery chapter decree basill ye men might see especially suche thynges concerned weightie matter hard discerne place dissented whan saufeco duict altered therfore perused ouer streight waye perceiued chiefest place partely altered partly omitted saufeconduicte time past geuen bohemers thinges amongest others shuld haue also authoritie decide matter al matter cotrouersie holy scripture order primatiue churche suche counselles interpretours agreable scripture stede iudge might vse owne seruice home nothing shuld done contept reproche doctrine wherof first thirde laste cleane omitted second chiefest thing dede sore altered whiche thinges considered selues deuise new fourme following fotesteppes decree basil meane tyme toletane sent seruaut twyse ye paper fearing appered ouermuch diligece neuertheles procede last wha thing finished duke maurice ambassadours come againe vnto toletane comparing thone thother shewe lack find therin began stomack matter right sore offended content ye whiche great labour dilligence obtained suche come assured sufficiently chiefest point wherby prouided may safely come safely goe thinges serue nothing purpose concerne maner treatie cousell thing might great deale better determined time diuines present make aunswer may passe bodes comission may receiue saufeconduicte contrary basill two dayes father assemble house byshops legate themperours ambassadours call thambassadours duke wirteberge day sayd would doe whan brought comaunded declare message shewed comission made brief preface bring forth confession doctrine written deliuer scribe counsel maner said also diuines come prince whiche treate thing aboundantly howbeit vpo coditions first yt cosent party conueniet iudges shuld chosen shuld heare diuines reason iudge vprightly matter yt cotrouersie asmuch prince perceiueth yt doctrine diuines doth ye part disagre ye doctrine ye bishop rome bishop whiche ar many wayes boud thinketh vnreasonable al right susteine ye parsone either plaintife defendat shuld chalenge selues thauthoritie iudgement secondly decreed thassembles thempire auspurg counsel shuld continued althinges godly rightly done euermore take prince thinges decreed counsel fourmer yeares ought haue force law thinges repeted fro beginning right reason whan two men go lawe thing whiche decreed whan one hath iust cause absent taken ferme stable moreouer seing many dcerees made fourmer also counsell contrary holy scripture also many olde errours established prince requireth none authoritie ye al thinges may come dew examinatio article coprised writig exhibited together wt cofessio doctrine wha done answer made father wha sawe time shew opinion thus dimissed thesame daye euening sent like wise thambassadours duke maurice whan came recite long oration ye demaundes prince like sorte late ye franke speache maurice ambassad father emperours ambassadours sauing ende pithie wher said moreouer ye seruice order vsed popish church true religion countrefeated thing shadowe religion whan made end thoration answered selfsame wordes ambassadours wirtemberg amongst thinges greued moste yt religion described vile conteptuouse name afterward well knowen thambassadours intended haue vttered message openly publique assize auoyde knew certenly wolde heard priuatly either must thei nedes el leaue al ye comon treatie brought confession doctrine written philip melanchthon showed comaundemet thing know cause thei present next day ye xxv ianuary thopensassions bishop legate brought church ye pompe rehersed nober soldiours much augmeted also greater resort people sodry place supposed treatie thesame day shuld notable whan masse ceremony fully finished recited pulpit protestates cause whole matter differred till xix daye marche whiche day good time propound matter frendly grauted counsel trusteth wil come obuinatly impugne catholique faithe zeale knowe truth fine admitte obeie decree ye churche schole correction haue ouer larger saufeconduicte lack founde furthermore next sitting treatie shalbe sacramet matrimonie third daye whan nothing came forthe al ambassadours duke maurice fellowes demaunded fraunces toletane chaunced dine day copie thesame saufecoduict spoken openly made gentle answer wha thre day past thambassadour strasburg ye request residue goeth vnto pictaue coplaineth sixt daye wherin heare nothing longer delay saufeconduicte sufficient nowe time tracted certenly diuines wil come suche time magistrate contented saufeconduicte saide howe faulte marueiled toletane thus differred chiefest place amongest would go talke doubted matter dispatched ye day thing whiche learne wolde thus went last daye sauing one ianuary within fewe houres al thambassadours commaunded come house toletane deliuered euery copie saufecoduicte signed vnderneth scribe counsell also ye earle monfort pictaue beginneth talke first dede excuseth delay made speaking much zeale great good wyll emperour admonished diuines might come possible diligence whiche trusted doubtles would hauing receiued saufeconduict go apart reade ambassadours ye protest deluded place whiche amended session finde nothing altered wherfore come againe
