complayne therof lacke finde euery point thambassadours saxon desire also know answere father haue made requestes thesame wirtemberge againe speaketh pictaue touching saufe conduicte answereth desire men might haue authoritie decide ouertimely whan diuines present ye worke selfe many thinges may fortune vpon occasion graunted whiche nowe refused would holy scripture shoulde iudge euery controuersie man whan arriseth strife thinterpretation scriptur vnto shuld credit geuen soner cousel scripture dome thig without life also politike lawes muche papistes esteme scripture mouth iudge must applied therunto may wel perceiued mout verely voice councell maner hath bene alwayes obserued since apostle time whansoeuer arose doubtful matter would vse owne seruice home indede openly grauted neither yet prohibited least thing contemptuously done religion doctrine nede feare straightly prohibited emperour wold haue father also hate suche inteperauncie seing thassemblie made peace vnitie immodeste opprobrius wordes shall vnpunished unto ther request make maner lyke aunswere lately sitting al treatie disterred cause vntill tyme decree made againe repeted pray disgrace many notable men promyse become suerties yt whan diuines shal come shal heard althinges would haue bishop rome brought subiection released asmuche belongeth properly hymselfe ye father determine nothing matter declared concerning requestes thambassadours wirtemberge muche sorte iudgement father like also wherfore intreate would small matter suffer occasion long wyshed accomplishyng moste holy thyng letted dispointed wherof doubtles nation europe shall receiue fruite would indeuoure perswade magistrate diuines might come spede thei time worke greater benefite common wealth whan ambassadours againe replied vrged thing chiefly reason suche susteyne parte suite iudge matter controuersie length departe thus receiue copie saufecoduite vpo codition sende magistrate whiche would immediatly expedition neither wyl faile matter much lieth nother dispaire also coming thambassadours duke maurice sende copie hand thambassadour strasburge wirtemberge carie copie going home firste daye february prince permission long sent others hereafter shall heare litle tyme came diuines duke maurice norinberge amongest malanchthon diuines come norinberge commaunded remaine tyll ambassadours sent saufeconduict trente fewe dayes come thither forbidden goe attende til know prince shal make wt emperour vnto whome said go whan decree confirmed counsell house theames wont deliuered diuines next disputation shewed synce last sitting cleane omitted wherof reported cause mo tha one yet sayde commonly done protestantes sake beginning february whan one duke maurice ambassadours ambassadour strasburge went forth pleasure see hether part italy uenise whiche sene italy treated emperours ambassadours much supposed diuines would come right shortly whiche opinion auspurg ye whole intreatie might differred vntill father would patiently beare smal delay tharchebishop treuers black freer ambrose pelarge certen holy day whiche vii february expounding yt place gospel cockel mixed yt wheate said amonges thing bitternes freer pelarge againg yt protestauntes thyl cockel must destroyed sorte maner yt might done without losse wheate appliyng sermon heretikes whiche signified worde cockell reported thambassadour duke maurice rayled bitterly heretikes said also faith promesse kepte haply made therfore made diliget inquisitio goeth cardinal trent authoritie emperours ambassadours complaineth heard freer called confessed dede spake heretikes generally distroyed fyre sworde hanging meane case may done without great hynderauce publique commotion concerning promesse kepte within spoken neuer worde done haue incurred penaltie losyng lyfe breakyng decre counsell call ambassadour reciting freers purgation bid hym loke nothyng father fidelitie vpryght dealing thyng also blabbed lyghtly whiche neuer thelesse straytely prohibited ought moued therewith whether freer belied knowe certenly auditours beinge demaunded duke maurice letter ambassadours sayde thynge day brought thither yt letter duke maurice dated last ianuary signified ambassador thinges obteined father hitherto vrge together preparing self go shortly emperor amongs thinges treat also matter presently also diuines come moreouer ambassador diuines certain prince city amonges named duke pomeranes cosins copy letter thone thambassadors felowe yet retourned iourney sendeth cardinall trent brixna lately gon thither seruiceable emperor also loued duke moris reason muche familiarity dearely well chiefly wished counsel might procede toke heauely dissention growing wherof ther much talk cause thambassador sent letter wherwith knew comforted verely receiued letter doubted length began take comforte hope well wrote againe thambassador sone duke moris shall come insprucke go thither immediatly great way reason amity frendship betwene thoughte could perswade peaceable way letter subscribed wyth duke moris hand also annexed letter theyr commission exhibite nede required neglected long tharchbishop treuers refresh self departeth trent homeward xvi day february said themperor geuen leaue sone might recouer health come thither yet left frier pelarge ther might present al action tharchbishops mentz collon brought goinge mile two way tourned lefthande toke iourny insprucke wher themperor lay shortly many began mutter counsell shoulde proroged duke moris making league frech brute war themperor king prepared warre vpon themperor rumour great first increased daily secreatly one sent trent themperor vnderstad pleasure also came one thither themperor thinges kept close seconde daye marche whiche ashewedensday bishop rome legate settinge vp paper churche pardon walles whiche call indulgence pardones graunteth remission sinnes al men generall specially bishop ambassadoures deuines whiche either haue confesse sinnes time prescribed go certaine church trent day appoynted saying fiue pater nosters fiue aue mary praiers pray god concord prince consent vnity church lucky successe counsell great benefit geuen high bishop iuly third careful health soules yt men may wel enioy trent rome wherfore many ran daily church bishop others especially spaniardes obseruing difference day attributed religion one le time great taciturnitye saide ambassadoure strasburge inquired themperors ambassador pictaue state thinges said brute went counsel shoulde proroged vntrue themperor would haue wise proceade continue action also ther hath nothing bene done late theyr cause whiche haue put father hope comming diuines beginning marche whan duke moris aboute thend february called backe deuines norinberge brute raised come themperor whe passed certain way iourny retourneth home beginneth take munsters nexte boke shalbe recited thing wer knowen sondry messagers came daily one another matter doubt archbishop mentz colon vnto whome came lately great plenty vitaile nether partes germany prepared selues horsbacke great expedition eleuenth day march depart dawning day wheras ouer nighte bishop rome legate accompanied residue bishop italy spaine came vnto bid farewel day came thither new ambassadours duke new ambassador wirteberge wirtemberge werner munchinge hierome gerarde ciuilian go next day themperors ambassadoures shewing commission wryting desyre haue answer theyr prince demaunds exhibited father xxiiii ianuary say moreouer deuines wil ther within dais declare large confession doctrine yt lately put vp whole assembly wherat meruailed greatly know cause except wer one made thing ready take iourny purposed go home necessity must tary ther ful sore answered must deuise haue conference matter father loke shall hear let vnderstand meane tune duke moris ambassador great distres carefulnes wer supposed haue handled matter craftely haue bene priuy prince doings haue plaid together dissembler againe affirmed neither knew thing home yet receiued letter thence knew way retourne home daunger muche sawe longer taried daunger xiii day march depart priuely coulde assone day apeared speding hastly brirna axe thaduise cardinall trent best done last thone thambassadors came trent made longe abode iuspruck prince name ye rest made intercession themperor latzgraue hauing first receiued except disceiued safe conduit came insprucke made purgation themperors counsel proueth made priuy war sort credit thece goeth straight home thother taking iourny carnia returneth saxonie tharchbishops mentz collon approched nere vnto inspruck honorably receiued themperor sent mete amonges bishop arras talking long much emperor alone spede iourny matter required hast vi day thambassadors duke moris diuines wyrtemberge departed trent came thither iiii diuines duke lirtemberge wherof brentius one ii strasburge wherfore thambassadors immediatly repair earle monfort name diuines vnto cummen praye deuise fellowes father may answer theyr demaundes action may begin next day xix march appoynted open session said father asseble house bishop legate thambassador kinge portugall lately come thither shewed comission solemne manner receiued admitted father done comon session adiourned first may thing ther none done thinges wrought priuatelye duke wirtemberge confession duke wirtemberge caused yt meane time ye confession doctrin ambassador exhibited setforth print wherof first thambassa also diuines brought certain copy wherof though many sight yet great deale moe wanted bishoppes legate reserued self wryting openly exhibited xxiiii day ianuary would hardly suffer read thing firste knowen much whan commen forth printe diuers bishop italy spain diuines sought diligetly althoughe perauenture one intente legate crescentius taking displeasauntly blamed sore certain learned phisition trent hadde sowen abrode suche kinde bokes also thearle mofort dissembling matter one whit spake sort though transgressed condition safeconduit said openly assured daunger oughte also eschue occasion offence two day priuate treaty legate house pictaue sheweth ambassador strasburge night whe reasoned together certaine houres treatye commenced case would haue thing propounded father fellowes wold fail herein also appoynteth hour wherfore next day xxii march thambassadors duke wirtemberge strasburge resort house toletane whan pictaue begon talk thambassadors wirtemberge said desire fyrst coming namelye might haue answer demaunds long since exhibited thing done may better procede vnto rest wher many word fro appeared euidently stick whole treaty shoulde let thereby ambassador wer commaunded make recitall ca obtaine thinges required yet thintent may appeare knowen howe greatly desyrous theyr prince peace concorde againe treatye matter shoulde longer delaied moreouer obey emperoure fulfill decre thempire contente admit diuines disputation preset prince name howbe vppon condicion graunte part theyr right hereby thinges may remain safe whole vnto theyrs agreable lawes customes decree thassemble auspurge whan pronounced forme protestation deliuer vnto wryting depart place whan called againe others commend say perceiue rightwell wholy bent concorde seing next consultation say concerning manner treaty desyre know opinio touching thambassadors go side consulted matter declare vnto haue found two wais wit ether deuines may hard touching decree doctrin made counsell el confession doctrin presented father also setforth print may laid forth amonges euery chapter therof decided ordre theyr diuines commen intent yt may large erpound declare doctrin comprised boke answer impugne semeth vnto readiest way know way better also thambassador strasburge said magistrate city red wryting doctrine wirtemberge approue professe sent diuines thither whiche ioyne selues confession diuines wirtemberge defend commaunded shew confirme name city fellowes wherunto answeared wer forward wrought plainlye sincerely also state strasburge city ther vnto annexed haue ioyned selues doctrine right glad geue harty thankes withall expedition wil signify themperor doubtinge desirous hear touching treaty deuines manner disputing deuised shortly aduertise thopinion father therin dais wher kept silence bishop numburge departed thence residue also germane bishop wer ii remaind said prepare selues take iourney thambassadors went monfort heare father answered thing nothing el say father yet made none answere whan mention made bishop departing said howe bishop numburge went themperoure ther come certain commissioner thither saxonie treat peace duke moris much yt country one principall beinge hereunto requested could say nay residue said knew nothing much emperour desyred greatly counsell might procede selues also applied hereunto theyr wordes dedes least men dispair thinge nexte day xxvii day march thambassador strasburge goeth themperoures orator pictaue tolde howe state busines suche muste return home therefore desired knowe shoulde reporte home deuines matter occasion entred againe talke manner treaty affirmed verely procede thordre lately prescribed might conueniently hand masse thinge next discussed matter semed vnto mete first discided come vnto ye rest saith speaketh selfe priuately fellowes haue willed thother inferreth againe howe like deuines haue accustomed debate thinges beginning ordre creation fall man originall sinne terme iustification faith workes finally sacrament ought nowe also permitted vse ordre moreouer daye wherein deliuered safeconduite end ianuary theyr promise deuines hard matter wher ought perseuer subuert altare nature thinges vnlesse former thinges well determined disceptation last depend firste purpose could agre thinge betwene selues answereth touching iourney may graunted themperor hath commaunded suffer depart much talcke alledgeth hathe whatsoeuer also remaineth shoulde done diuines commission wryting biddeth go thearle monfort shew letter commission verye gently biddeth farewell wisheth wel retourne whan thearle montfort sene commission said dede would businesse required yt might longer remain much time must serued letteth frendly depart next daye whan ready depart themperors ambassadours send thambassador strasburge deteyned pictaue beginneth speake wher yesterday wer agreed might depart haue diligently considered thing conferred heades together geue leaue depart nowe matter brought yt passe frute time spent loked thaction commenced bishop legate sickly thinge might determined self day therefore muste still remain depart instaunt father wold offended know hath ben certain monethes present themperours commaundement also suche man may depart magistrate haue commaunded ought exhibite letter thintent mighte excuse themperor said commau dement senate owne matter required alledging certain cause vnlesse wer ye said wold stirre one fote thauthority senate whych would haue remain ther longer also honour request hereunto cause self moreouer whiche loueth reason ought obtain howbeit since deuines commen may much better absent especially seing thing remaineth admitted thaction also thambassadors wirtemberge assist deuines cause common lately declared matter earnestly constantlye handled possible senate substitute place hath ready aduertised departure hence ther replieth againe willing least abide long till thaction commenced hand perchance legate crescentius recouer health yet folow cause felowes commission shal execute thing whan could neither excusing intreating preuaile thing fleeth last remeady vntill time purposelye reserued said others wer protestant might lawfully theyr safeconduit depart thence time last saith toletane dede neither let may depart howbeit could declare themperor hath commaunded also selues would haue done thus therfore departing commendeth vnto cause deuines also father dissention amonges selues bent al one way spaniard neapolitan sicilia whosoeuer wer themperors part chiefly spaniardes themperors ambassador wer importune thaction might continued bishop rome client supposed spaniard wet reformation court rome sought find let delay much chiefest bishop germany reason ciuill tumult wer departed ready loked also occasion much rather daily letter messagers reported duke moris confederats already armure french kinge also cardinall tournon treated diligentlye bishop rome peace toke effect much yt french king war time themperor man doubted sake also counsel dissolued wherfore themperors ambassador knew feared thing laboured chiefly thing coueted might bring passe thambassadors protestantes thys little perceiued afterward certenly knowen blasphe gray frier thend march certaine graye frier expounded epistle paule romaine great audience oftetimes octasion railed bitterlly luther felowes waded far said knowledge christ yet liued honestly haue obteined saluatio also meaning saint paule second chapiter foresaid epistle whan certain deuines protestant heard speke opely deliberatio take comon assent write requestes protestantes deuines themperors ambassador last day marche declaring intent sent verely expound defend confession doctrine exhibited complain ther none action commenced decree counsel already made haue manner nothing el bitter reproch detestinge doctrin professe also daye gray frier spake many absurd thing openly contrary consent church exposition thold doctor also poured great aboundaunce railing word doctrin church many say dothe thing wil ye father yet se wt assent teacheth hard thonly cause wer sent hither might verely spectakle laughing stock others compelled hear daily thiniuries reproches theyr doctrin ther doubtles nede haue taken iourney hand thing might haue ben declared wryting wherfore earnestly require according office authority would bring passe father would last declare lack find confession exhibited may againe also openly hard matter letter thambassadors receiue getly say glad also haue occasion ministred vrge matter thintent legate crescentius refuse may treat fellowes father also frier left reading excusing matter sicknesse first day aprill duke moris league frends laid siege duke moris taketh auspurge co position city auspurge toke third day composition boke foloweth shalbe declared v day aprill ambassador duke wirtemberge beinge sent house toletane came brought co maunded two diuines brentius ihon marpache strasburge pictaue beginneth declare first owne good zeale legate sicknesse vnlesse present neither fellowes yet father wold thing fault hath bene procede sheweth also hereafter omit manner diligence hereof maketh protestation thothers whan consulted say know rightwell good diligence howbeit loked certain answer demaundes might haue signified magistrate sith matter thus must take cou sel best selues said againe matter brought poynt neither ought taken though ther wer hope action remaining aduertise magistrate signify vnto case thing stand wel done according duty nether doubt shal hear therof wil maruel long delay surceasing take also euill part howbeit requireth take paciently tediousnesse day meane time trauell may haue direct answer unto say gladly sake acconsent next day great expedition came messagers letter auspurge taken howe prince marched straightway toward thalpes stop wais passage wherefore commaunded take armure county tiroll bandes soldiors hired commaunded repair insprucke wer bishop germanye father fle fro trent departed thence ther remained deputy bishop spier manster whan newes broughte immediatly bishop italy flee carying baggage riuer athesis wherfore thambassadors wirtemberge herewith moued time accord councell nowe slipped away come themperors orator shew cause purpose go home diuines also dede first sore say howe may assente therunto except themperors pleasure knowne might preuaile require haue cause departing deliuered writing signed hand thintent may make excuse themperor father pictaue demaunded also haply theyr departure father shall proceade thaction shall diuines say wherunto thambassadors conferring diuines vppon matter say wil make answer viii day aprill early morning deliuer vnto wrytinge recite time confession doctrine answer protestantes ambassador exhibited wherfore diuines came haue vain sollicited hitherto might receiue answer prince demaundes vnto day ther appeared hope action also ther war raised yt bishop germany also italy depart state intangled trouble loke nothing present moreouer bishop germany absente perauenture expediente anye progresse shoulde made time hereafter chance wherin busines may treated wel ordrely suppose prince wanting diuines moreouer thinke thus ther many decree made also former counsel might wel reproued case lawfully hard father procede herein thought doings wil like reast neuerthelesse case ether decree already made may amended may hereafter decreed consonant holy scripture ther doubt receiued obedient hart thing vnto doutles sorowful certain place confession exhibited hath bene declared wryting verely iudge good godly also whan time shal serue declare large pray therfore take good part departure say dede might vertue safeconduite depart thence time list bounden make man priuy much haue manye time proued gentlenes wold omit kind duety thus therfore taking leaue departe aboute none time fewe hour met cardinall trent whiche rode great poste hastr brixna trent whan heard wirtemberge inquiring brentius spake vnto gaue gentle wordes two day met king ferdinandoes daughter went insprucke brunecke towne alpes bordering limit uenetians father shewed drue one line spanish bishop dede semed others diuers mindes counsel trent diligente diuers also germanes pretended thoughe thing required much reformation mind yt thought best al others schole correction maners church refourmed al superfluous excesse ambition dishonest example liuing shuld taken away euery man resident church eche man shuld haue one benefice man permitted haue mo furthermore purposed also include within certain limites power refourmation papistes bishop rome attribute vnto court great authority ouer realmes like thinges comprise word reformation thinges acknowledge belong proprely vnto touching religion doctrin acknowne none error yea decreed church erre counsel could erre thought verely aduersaries would fine reuolt obey counsel apeareth manifestly epistle written french king form safeconduit thing also increased hope opinion iudged professor doctrine least many dead banished spoken sweuia also common amonges whatsoeuer concerned religion within fewe monethes determined chief article ther remained two lordes supper matrimony article doctrine ready discussed father basill attribute whole iudgement holy scripture wrytinges agreable ye counsel basil purer tret men would iudges selues expoundinge scripture neither woulde admit place decree basill thambassadors restored chaunginge wordes decre determined also follow tradition thapostles euerye doubtfull matter whansoeuer destitute scripture bosted lefte thapostles deliuered hande hande disputation deuines oft time noted caused also ambassador whan receiued safeconduit themperors oratoures thend ianuary protest tradition thapostles vnderstode wrytinges annexed newe testament story foure euangelistes shewed first maye appoynted daye session last session yt cou sell father remained dispair thing assemble together discord kinges prince proroge counsell space two yeares longer case dissention appeased xxix day aprill nowe bishop rome agreed french king day themperors ambassador depart thence also legate frenche kinge hathe peace ye pope rome crescetius deteined sicknesse abode still feared vision night said fel sicke began dispair also life notwithstanding frends also phisitians comforte neither disceiued iudgement disease increasing died uerona thend cousel right stoutly renued thought ende counsel trent verely restore romish doctrine shortly establishe besides legate rome cardinall trent ther wer preset lxii bishop wherof viii wer germanes fiue twenty spaniardes two sardinia four sicilie one ho gary bishop agria reast italy diuines xlii xix spaniard germany flaunders death pope legate xii occasion legate crescentius fel sicke purposed haue spoken suspicion might deuised mallice much frendes family went comfort whan laye sicke thus report thought mete adde xxv day march ben much occupied wryting letter bishop rome continued trauel til night whiche time arising might refresh self behold saw greate blacke dogge going glistring eies eares hanging almost ground went straightway slipt vnder table astonied amased whan legth cummen againe self calleth vpon seruaunts vtter chamber commaunding bringe light beate dogge whan coulde found neither yet next chamber toke great thought fel sicke shewed lay death bed also reported haue cried oute manye time seruantes driue dogge came vppon bed xxiiij booke sleidanes commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charies fyfte argument xxiiij booke duke moris publisheth letter state thempire hinder enterprise doth marque albert french kinge also publisheth nammge self protector germany taketh metz lorayne marcheth vp strasborough thence retireth hagenaw whither came vnto sondry ambassador beseching stay army king retireth armye oute germany duke moris company hauing straites thalpes putteth themperor flighte little enlarged duke saxon publishe letter auspurge whereb yt restore minister churche preached gospell whilest duke moris wente passaw treaty peace marque albert practiseth great cruelty againste nurinberge constraineth make theyr peace vnto meaner prince peace sondrys thinges declared aswell letter ambassadoures pleased certaine condition seine reuolt themperor cometh strasborough goinge besiege metz laste assemble thempire gouernment warre maidenburge common assente emperoure state committed duke moris haue declared warre continuinge space one yeare hauinge armye hys commaundemente began seke meanes howe deliuer lantzgraue father lawe seinge longe time sued themperor matter vaine wherefore compelling chattes othe true makinge peace maidenburge sendinge ambassadoures insprucke former boke mentioned entreth league frenche kinge assuraunce made either side pledge geuen thoughte good wrytinges setforthe declare cause warre thentent might win therby good wils many moreouer marque albert brandenburge going priuely fraunce king withdrewe self wholy businesse meane season souldiours aswell defended maidenburge beseged wintered mullusie place aboutes muche hurte northusians herfurd whan themperor demaunded cause therof duke moris whole war bene generall answered tumult want paiment wage pr ded cause wher dede serued secreatly bounden oth might better perswade self time sente ambassadoures throughe insprucke trent whiche might obtaine safeconduit diuines come propound certaine thinges counsel afterward commaunded diuines follow whiche goinge farre norinberge taried loking letter foresaid ambassadours mentioned sent also ambassador emperoure christopher carlebice ulrich mortise tary comming border bauier whose aduise counsell might vse treaty furthermore commanded lodging prepared inspruck self toke iourney whan gone two thre day iourny waye sending thence insprucke moste gentle letter alledging certain cause excuse returneth home thus tracting time whan driuen day day beginning spring time hauing called backe men due season began take muster soldiors winter time gathered secreatly addressing letter vnto ye state thempire saieth ther nothing world deare concord wisheth chiefly agrement religion according doctrin prophet apostle wherof aduersaries haue many time put v hope priuately also publike decree nothing performed constre misse promise decree also abrogate take cleane awaye also haue spoken vnto certen vnlesse followe procedings let trust greatly leane former promise time promise wer made state time wise must obey el refuse muste punished contented wordes haue stirred vp also forein king prince state profession haue inuented sondry cause bring hatred whilest blame v religion certen thing wheras thing self declareth care religion haue alwaies eie throughe thoccasion dissention religion might aspire gouernment theyr craft sene men whiche vsed mighte wholly rote oute abolishe true religion former yeares setforth expounded auspurge matter wherfore haue place exiled preacher minister church oute limites thempire tarye neither decree lawfull counsell yet bishoppes rome neither begin thing execution wherfore althoughe force armes shoulde repulse seruitude minde conscience oughte man blame much thing apperteineth god glorye alone auaunce defende worde committeth whole matter vnto pr yeth god graunt constancy true knowledge vntill liues end thing wherof intendeth speake co cerning lantzgraue father law certainly v yeares seconde cause war since ioachim elector brandenburge put hope themperors name lantzgraue mighte perswaded come submission humbly craue pardone emperor themperor shoulde require besides conteined pacification conceiued would frendly let depart wheruppon sent theyr letter geuing faith vnto sonnes thing chaunced theyr father otherwise well would abide fortune therefore came vppon faithe vnto hale asked emperor pardon afterwardes supped duke alba til far night pleasantly time lantzgraue deteyned prisoner sidelity would haue returned lodging beyond al men expectation deteined caried prison wherin hath nowe remained manner fiue whole yeres without exceding great misery although sonnes nobilitye subiectes haue confirmed pacification albeit self marque brandenburge wuolfgange paulsgraue became surety vnles perfourmed couenaunts wold deliuer custody albeit according forme couenaunts mony condemned paid artilerye munition deliuered castels fortes rased henrye duke brunswicke sonne sette libertye letter confederacye exhibited muche nothinge required yet coulde neither suite marque brandenburge lamentable teares wife whiche pined deathe sorowe prayer people intercession prince preuaile thinge vnto daye hathe ofttimes spoken themperor diuers men haue sinistrall opinion hath intreated earnestly haue respect honoure estimation would graunt benefit elder done vnto progenitor desert also towardes king fardinando woulde sette libertye thing could moue nothinge yea constrained captife answer matter lawe prison plead cause lying fatters done lawe especiallye matter waighty speake nothing meane time suspiciously howe rashly handled matter straunge example neuer hard germany verely vnder pretence law might little little tourn child theyr landes possession bring suche distres shoulde hable maintaine theyr state dignity thinge come passe toucheth much reason alliaunce hope succession hath house hesse thing dede might thought wonder craftes pollicies manifest sight al men whiche doubtles tende vnto ende monarchye hath ben many yeares framinge maye lengthe established third chiefe poynt concerneth men third cause common natiue country germany whose state doubtles miserable contrary lawes couenauntes forain souldiours brought within limit thempire whiche haue many yeres ben setled euery wher bothe towne country consumeth men good exercise al kind filthy lust moreouer many time ther new wais inuented get mony auncient liberty diuers way infringed neither state prince electours case spared thambassadors foren king sory thing loue wealthe germany prohibited come anye publike assembles clean manner thempire finally bodage germany altogether wroughte men maye broughte shamefull straight bondage thing doubtles posterity ofspring may haue moste tuste cause detest cowardise slouthfulnes time wherin moste precious iewell goodly ornament liberty coutry shuld lost seing therefore case standeth thus laste awaked william lantzgraue sonne phillip whoe iust sorow father miserye hathe raised makinge league french king thenemy seketh also depriue hath determined deliuerace latzgraue duke saxon maintaine honor recouer liberty men attempt matter force armes therfore doth exhort man disturbe enterprise al men professe put good assuraunce otherwise man one meane aduersary wil take ennemy iohn albert duke megelburge subscribed also letter chiefly preseruation religion forsomuch duke moris said howe warred cause also marque albert bra denburge marque albert letter agaynste emperoure publisheth wryting manner effecte complaineth liberty germany oppressed ene duety ought maintain auaunce saithe ther holden counsel wherin assembled subuert truthe also many assembly empire wherof end certaine corrupted bribe faire promise mony maye gotten subtile fetche heauye burthen germany vtter vndoing germany wrought chiefly cleargy consistory empire surmounte nombre matter brought yt passe effect al counsel dependeth almost one mannes pleasure neither gentleman germaine borne annexed empire great reproche assuredlye hinderance germaines ought state weale publike much better call none assembles mony shoulde frelye franckly geuen whansoeuer comaunded required shuld ther losse time besides great charge shoulde spared suche like craft also seale thempire commen straungers hand foreiners theyr pleasure abuse damage germany yet ther man al dare bewail thing vnlesse wil enter high displeasure nether yet germanes matter sutes dispatched log delaid much many men complain much state thing germanes nede learn laguages case selues anye good sort wher tholde custome germany prohibited man may serue anye foreine prince warres protestantes reconciled ouer aboue greuous penalty wer constramed admit vnworthy condition great mony arose protestant client seruing theyr warres burthen also laid vpon state prince nothinge offended thoughe warre bene made common wealth commauded pay mony recompence charge warres intent verelye yt ther sinewes force lefte germany like sort ciuill controuersies moste waighty matter committed publick iudgement thempire vnto commissioner may power either establish displace great prince againe prohibited prince maye set owne image coyne newe senator made euery towne empire bondage imposed manner vppon germanes constrained suffer forreine souldiors country whiche bothe verye much harme bring many men beggery also practise al kinde arrogancy lechery hath ben hard land spared although promised better fidelitye seruice done themperor howbeit time deteined reason warre maidenburge matter common wealth absent soldiors wer brought country notwithstanding officer desired much contrary thus certainly prince whiche former war protestant preseruation dignity put great hazarde liues goodes haue receiued goodly recompence boke lewes auila setforth story lewes auila protestant war matter done war naughty lying fellow whilest speaketh germany coldly disdainfullye straungely though barbarous vile nation whose originall skarcely knowen vnworthinesse thing much boke printed setforth certain especiall priueledge themperor verely many thinges excused letter sent throughout germany self song hath ben songen many yeres thinges tend hitherto say accordinge state time decree must altred men muste obey present counsel el suffer punishment wheras certen prince haue taken armure repulse ignominye seruitude hathe also promised aide fidelity yea life also protesteth openlye desireth man aid aduersaries men woulde endeuoure fellowes defend commen cause although many perchaunce followe contrarye parte yet let man promise self better thing aduersary may vanquishe shall state condition germaines common case anye manne beare armure againste felowes wil persecute sword fire goeth brute saieth fellowes thoughe wold bring germany forein nation euen turk selfe false absurd sclaunder madnesse procure greate daunger selues theyr countrye vaine also diuers report though shoulde attempte warre enriche selfe hathe serued nowe manye yeares emperoure kinge ferdinando hereby hathe soughte gaine rather praise honor without great losse substaunce hath also large offer made contemned refused hathe fixed minde warre wherin liberty former dignity may restored common country warre fortune ouermuch authority clergy prohibited holy scripture infringed weakned man ought blame therfore certainly chiefe bishoppes empire haue bene occasion al euils yet intent college founded chiefly nobility shoulde distroyed vice beinge taken awaye thinges amended borne maye remaine vocation auaunced also wherunto furtherer contente suffer selues perswaded otherwise enemy king frenche kingsletters fraunce also letter setforth saithe hathe respecte chiefly religion established may profite publike weale chiefly frendes therfore immediately death father restored scotlande former dignity renued league swiss recouered boloigne broughte againe old inhabiters citezens dispersed hither thither theyr landes possession hathe made peace also king england entred perfite amity whilest occupied matter emperoure secreat deuises hath imagined many thinges distruction oftner hath geuen occasion warre beit common wealthes sake priuatelye also relieue people would attempt nothing winckinge iniuries gaue minde whollye establishmente realme quietnesse afterward aduersaries ascribed certaine timerousnesse cowardlinesse meane season broughte vnto greuous complaint prince state germany whiche saide occasion sought partly religion partlye turkishe warre punish rebellion bringe bondage craftye counsel dissention faction mainetained germanye impouerished longer doubted goeth make monarchy selfe house austrich thing verelye conceiued inwarde sorowe common originall either nation also old amity frendship euer continued ferme inuiolated long might themperoures crafte policye state haue alteration germanye lose liberty perceiueth well damage daunger realme germany fortresse strength fraunce also whole christian commo welth germanye ye fortresse christendoe therfore hath desired oft earnest prayer wishing either nation force ioyned together might stay selues nead afraid man hope thing appeared yet many craued healpe coulde see meanes mighte succoure empyre rente torne sondre consultation waighey god righteous iudge hath shewed goodly way octauian frenese duke placence parma whome themperour bishop rome iuly laide waite required aide declaringe al iniuries hathe perswaded take vppon defence countye mirandula came also complaintes prince state germany required might enter league said howe meanes onlye common wealth mighte restored howe iuste waighty cause whiche prince attempte warre recite may vnderstande theyr owne wrytinges notwithstanding let euery man way selfe whether vnsatiable couetousnesse oure aduersaries dothe geue moste iuste occasion griefe whiche destroyinge wealthe empire swepe theyr owne coffer treasury burgonians nowe inuade treuers gelderland wirtemberge coutryes oppressed bi emperoure make inuasion country destroyeth latzgraues dominion diuers way lyke sorte themperor excludeth ambassador thassemblies empire prohibiteth manne may serue foreine warres putteth death noble capitains worthy seruiceable men amonges others uogelsperge whose execution self beheld auspurge thintent mighte satisfye bloudye minde mooste euill example shoulde prouoke hyre men greate reward slay serue warres assuredlye fewe wordes expressed craftes oure ennemies vse iudgemente chamber consistorye empire admitted placed meanes may bring passe obtaine liste doubtles blame euils imputed thys kinde menne especiallye iudges chamber cause verely could deny ye germains requiring aid therfore hath made league yt also determined imploy vpon warre force royall parson neither yet doth looke anye priuate profite gain therby minedeth thinge germany beinge restored ihon fridericke duke saxon lantz graue deliuered whome hathe detained prisoner longe vnworthy captiuity maye win praise renowne immortall time past flamminius deliuering grece bondage neither cause man shoulde feare anye force violence much attempteth warre liberty wholly endeuoure man hurt vndeseruedly let truste therefore promesse whiche confirmeth vnto faithfully geue creadit aduersaries say purpose afflicte plage cleargy intendeth matter also receiueth al defence tuition annoy yet league frendes libertye recouered put good hope many men letter concord churche shall may also restored lawfull meanes whan ambition priuate lucre farre remoued euer may helpe hereunto gladly thing wherof thought good admonish thend may vnderstand purpose wherfore requireth iuste warre necessity attempted wealth germany would impeche hinder confederate otherwise man cleane voide loue duety oweth country intend make resistaunce wil destroy sword fire albeit shal vnwillingly yet shalbe naughty corrupt membre must cut reast body least hurt infection sorte restrained harme rest may know ambassador ihon fraxine bishop bayon hath sent vnto pleasure vnto whome praieth geue creadit wrytinge beinge set forth print vulgare tonge ouer head bonnet betwene two dagger wrytten badge tharmes liberty liberty vnderneath title kinge named selfe reuenger libertye germany prince captiue badge cognoisaunce many say foud old coynes vsed slue iulius cesar saieth themperor assigned reward coulde slay certaine captaines thus standeth case themperor proclamation lately setforthe againe wordes mooste waighty outlawed rinegraue recrode riseberge scherteline dede serued french king haue said appointed foure thousande crownes rewarde could bring forth either quicke dead furthered cause muche whan league made going germany prested souldioures broughte fraunce scherteline dede whan sued many yeres vaine coulde intercession man reconciled themperor king fernando manner constrained fled french king letter kinge prince dispearsed abrode germany raised hope manye feare carefulnes duke moris wrought thinge dissimulation first march holdeth assemble state dominion amonges thinges propoundeth sued lantzgraues sonnes present self may longer seke delay disceine expectatio therfore wil go vnto kepe faith promesse let therfore meane time obey brother august whome hath made deputye absence let gather force defend country nothing chaunce vnto vnprouided thelector brandenburge present treaty sommoned appeare lantzgraues sonnes permit shoulde next processe appeare discharge bond retourneth home duke moris hauing put ordre thinges home duke moris goeth field appoynted certain counselloures assiste brother auguste goeth small company force saide country turing marching forth abideth lantzgraues sonne departed fro home burggraue meyssen call henry noble house plauians chauncelor boheme name king ferdinando treated diligently reconcilemet latzgraues sone leading forth armye came erlebache eightene daye marche also french ambassadour fraxine bothe request franckfurt letter amonges thinges receiue garrison emperours city beit answered neither plainlye purposelye yet much must go forward none thing done sixt daye ioyneth duke moris commen wyth whole armye thre dayes schwinfurt duke moris declareth vnto king fardinando woulde make intercession signified plainlye letter ambassadoures thoughe authority emperoure treat yea touching deliuery father therfore making priuy french ambassador refuseth condition requestes king fardinando heard thing determined march great expedition roteburge dingelspelle norling donauerde roteburge marque albert ioyneth selfe hys power bothe horse men fote men whiche waye euerthey wente broughte citezens theyr subiection displacing whiche emperoure chosen ordain newe magistrate exact also mony munition auspurge kept great garrison selfe day certain piece wall rampeare fallen downe marched exceading greate iourneis laste daye marche reasted much night season came thither firste daye aprill midday making roades declared selues ennemies citye foure enseignes fotemen sente peroure townes men fourth day rendred city wer permitted depart sommoned city high germany amonges also norinberge commaund auspurge thend aprill also vrge wuolmes whiche nine mile auspurge aide thinges come theyr society aboute time prince salerne occasion falling oute uiceroy naples reuolteth emperoure prince salerne reuolteth themperor goeth fraunce whilest thinges done germany frenche kinge marching forth huge army surpriseth tullie uerdome townes thempire border fraunce inuadeth lorayne sendeth yong prince fraunce aboute nine yeres age though lady dowager mother intreated neuer frenche subdueth loraine much contrary promiseth daughter mariage whilest king self occupied affaire lieftenaunt constable anna memoraunce led uantward surpriseth metz famous city thempire tenthe day aprill whan bothe garrison within small french men made fair promisses saide howe kinge made warre maintaine theyr liberty time frenche king went owne pale aboute eighte day marche sendinge vnto letter messagers desired would prepare vitaile yt might passe theyr country armye promisinge benenolence vsed minister cardinall lenoncurt bishop citye cardinall betraied citye metz setforth good zeale senate conestable also wrote vnto moste frendlye whan came neare vnto citye force desired let obteined next day master gate al fortification thither came also afterwardes kinge selfe xviii day aprill remaining four day taken thothe senate people appoynted mounsir gonorie theyr gouernoure commanded armure deliuered caried one place citye fortified likewise doth townes named loraine sending messagers strasburge haganawe place neare bishoppe strasburge required aided wheate uitaile whan auspurge taken said thold senate restored themperoure displaced liberty geuinge voice restored also people prince contederated marched towarde woulmes refused theyr league whan came thither xii day aprill ride aboute citye whan shot greate piece damaunde satisfied iniuries done summe three hondreth thousande crownes denied becommed enemy duke moris goinge thence wente lintz towne austriche mighte vnderstande kinge farnando condition peace said emperoures consent meane intreat peace afterwarde emperoure exhorted letter chiefest prince germanye woulde assaye quenche fire deuise meanes peace whiche woulde againste diuerse required aide thei able nothing great power comforting myndes answereth hopeth wel treatie peace commenced shall haue lucky successe neyther faile common weale whan woulmes bene beseged six day prince xix day aprill remoued stocach towne hegouia receiued mony french kinges name thre monethes conuenaunted gamey marchiane frenche pledge deliuered nantoliet died waye prince pledge fraunce germanye pledge whiche gaue frenche kyng christopher duke megelburg philip lantgraues sonne last aprill prince retourne thonaw certen myles beneth woulmes meane seaso marque albert burneth townes village belonging woulmes extorteth money taketh castell helfesteyne situated high hill placeth therin garrison towne gissing nere vnto whiche thre myles fro woulmes certen village condemneth paye xviii thousand crownes wha duke maurice come lintz propoundeth deliuering lantgraue father lawe condition peace offered duke moris appeasing dissention religion doctrine wel ordering common wealth peace made french kyng fellowe confederate outlawes receiued agayne fauour ryngrane others named also erle hedecke whiche fourmer yeares gaue hym selfe tuition duke maurice sayde howheit emperour appointed rewarde lyfe least offende duke maurice thought unto demaundes ferdinando maximilian sonne sonne lawe albert duke bauier also emperours ambassadours maketh aunswere howe emperour content lantgraue set lybertie yet warre maye cease immediately touchinge religion common wealth well pleased matter determined next conuention german emperour lothe frenche kyng shoulde herein comprised neuerthelesse duke maurice may knowe sorte wyl accorded outlawes may also taken mercie case wyl obeye condition offered emperour moreouer ferdinado requested whan peace concluded duke maurice would helpe hongary soldiours slippe away frenche kyng wherunto whan duke maurice aunswered sayde could determine nothing without consent fellowes departed xxvi day may mete againe passawe whiche towne betwene lintz regenspurge ryuers thonawe oene mete thither come also prince intercessours deputy maydaye lantgraues sonne iohn albert duke megelburg leade armie gundelfinge lye eight whole dayes together lokyng duke maurice retourne austrich whan come next daye armie munstred lawginge towne otto henry pausgraues coutrie oto henry recouered also recouered prouince possessed emperour expulsed byshop auspurge countrie verely otto paulsgraue ioyned hym selfe vnto league thence goe towarde alpes chaunced tyme kyng ferdinando obteyned truce whiche beginning xxvi daye may ende eight daye iune meane tyme themperour leuied power fote alpes whiche assembled towne rwe hurly burly byshop auspurge cardinall ryche nowe susteyned great losse sayde went rome myght obteyne byshop new promotion benefice wherwith might fill vp sinkes agayne iudges chamber imperial flie away spiers iudges chamber slie frenche king prince forsaide wrytinges signified plainly displeasure ascribed maner blame trouble frenche king came armie ye border loraine saberne third day may foure myles strasburg town belonging bishop requested strasburg ayde armie thinges necessary whiche cause ambassadours sent vnto sarburg seuen myles strasburg whiche offer certen quantitie wheate wyne peter sturmie fridericke gotesseme iohn sleidane conestable accompted nothynge whiche offered albeit ambassadours departed hym suche sorte would aduertyse senate make reporte vnto hym yet sente nexte daye two gentleman spedy aunswere speakyng muche kynges great good wyll zeale towardes germany also intent kyng moued warre verely might restore libertie germany oppressed request much soldiours nede many thinges might bie citie artificer might suffered bryng forth ware sel within campe wherunto senate made answere suche matter weightie importaunce nothing wont determined consent whole state whan matter shalbe debated wyll sende agayne ambassadours declare mynde whan thus sent away next daye ye ambassadours sent campe saberne whan heard speake offered tha also declared cause soldiours might permitted come within citie conestable began speake displeasauntly makyng comparison conestable chideth wt strash partiall iudges kynges benefites also emperours iniuries gaue sharpe language conclusion talke nexte daye shoulde heare kyng hym selfe speake whiche would affirme al nowe sayde morrowe ambassadours sent kyng whome cardinal loraine duke uandome conestable reporte vnto hym talke haue conestable two seuerall time offer many rasers otes thei wheate also wyne beseching king olde amitie ye kinges fraunce haue state strasburge also owne humanitie would take good parte offer haue great force soldiours within citie great nomber people also fled thither countrie citie spare corne haue theyr prouision kyng fyrst conferred counsell began selfe declare cause came germany selfe effect conestable daye saying vitayle moste necessary denied man would paye vnles wer ennemy ye soldiours want wyl fynd waye howe come inconuenience wold come therof euery man may easely perceiue thing whiche offered kyng dede refused would haue deliuered bread thabassadours corne vpon coulde agree departed matter concluded whan ambassadours retourned senate made decree muche parte wheate whiche citie spared much bread made myght place theraboutes ambassadours alledged conestable kyng also state citie condicio time suche thence nothing loked case thyng myght gathered countrie belonging haue right gladly ye senate decre least extremitie shuld wrought vpon plowman people countrey whiche could sodenly gotten townes village citie caried campe litle whan countrey loraine citie metz taken strasburge immediatly toke vp nomber fiue thousand souldiours defende citie agayne pulled many aswel publique priuate buildinges citie cut downe tree orcherdes euer let prospecte might succour ennemie moste nede began fortifie citie great displeasure frenchman later communication conestable dissemble ambassadours thought howe certen hope like certen face frendship entred metz also haue bene shut strasburg whan knewe citie exceading strong sawe moreouer thinges prouided diligently defence chaunging purpose thought tourned way remouinge campe seuenth day may marched towarde haganawe wisseburg hither came vnto ye king ambassadours paulsgraue electour archebyshoppes request prynces kyng mentz treuers commissioner duke cleaue wirtemberge whiche common wealthes sake lately assembled wourmes whose requeste kyng would absteyne spoyling countrie spare poore people muche protesteth make warre lybertie germany woulde staye armie shuld goe wold great losse dammage empyre requyre hym geue mynde wayes peace whereof bothe haue alreadye made mention emperoure wyll doe also hereafter truste shall well writeth entring league desire consider herein honour estimation reason othe faith owe empire able perfourme yet endeuour generall peace may established furthermore require moste instauntly would spare dominios strasburg whiche fre citie empyre mediation marque albert would intreate gently byshop wirciburge selfsame tyme xi day may letter brought ye king fro duke maurice wherin wrytten maurice letter kyng done lintz duke maurice required moreouer yt kyng wold haue also comprised treatie peace would declare vpon condition would accorde emperour whan letter receiued kyng vnto whome thing thought haue chaunced vnloked two dayes remoueth campe leauing germany marcheth agayne towardes loraine departure aunswereth ambassadours prince named hath already obteined kinges answer ye prynces thyng whiche came army germany captiue prince shall deliuered cause warre therfore hath wonne honour enough chaunce tyme hereafter wherin germany may requyre ayde wyll spare neither paynes coste perill nowe leading backe army intendeth retourne home chiefly ennemies haue inuaded fraunce concerning complaintes poore people hartely sory howbeit good order taken armie licentiouse soldiours wyll alwayes harme notwithstanding taketh moste dilligent hede bothe little harme done possible also offence moste straytely punyshed touchyng whiche wryte emperour peace loketh certenly handes paynes force dilligence germany released misery wherewith laye oppressed nowe must well forsee doe dishonestly lose theyr libertie hym restored theyr request touchynge strasburge saye naye withstanding tyme army ye soldiours citie vsed great presumption arrogancie towardes men whan king entred germany emperours power low countreis conduict martin van rossem spoyleth chapanye marten rosseme inuaded champaignie fraunce burning destroying toke towne asteney standing ryuer mase belonging duke loraine lately surprysed ye frencheme thought one cause kyng retourned armie another misliked duke maurice doinges againe hope failed hym strasburge whan remoued wisseburge ambassadours came kyng sent suite swiss kyng swiss king ferdinado hath region ioyning heluetians called sontgouia enseme chiefest countrey afrayde partes intreated swiss aucthoritie fauour kyng would make intercession wherfore request charge takynge iourney commended king also city nere vnto colmar seletstat strasburg saying countrie linked vnto great amitie nerenes therof also chiefly serue maner wheat muche nedefull displeasure done whiche shall feele also unto whome kyng maketh aunswer xx daye may besides bipont howe doth forgeue ensem wyll release suche soldious haue prisoner touching reste whome spake neuer ment euill albeit souldiours strasburg receiued men somwhat roughly gate put back came thither bie thinges yet wil forsake amitie therfore euen sake intreate meanes nowe possesseth lorayne shall nere neighbour wyll nothing maner neighbourhead loketh good wil dutie also saberne ambassadours sent king ye senate basill thesame matter vnto whome also made gentle aunswere shewed duke maurice howe departed lintz kyng ferdinando also whan conuention done went immediatly emperour inspruck infourme matter duke maurice retourning campe marcheth fellowes toward thalpes said whan came almost perswasio frech ambassadour determined set vpon soldiours whiche emperour leuied partes ye xvii daye maye far fiessa towne situated entring vp alpes ryuer leyche sendeth forth espialles vnderstande ennemie maner bryng worde howe kepe straytes narrow passage moutaines haue fortified themselues hurt meanes wherfore prince sende forth certen horseman chosen whole nomber whiche riding almoste ennemies campe intercept diuerse bring away prince whome vnderstande many thynges next daye marching forewarde skirmyshes ye prince ye eperialles fotemen hauing two ho dreth horseme go fiessa time thei farre rewe come vnto straytes whiche kept emperours soldiours nomber eight hondreth two field peces upo geuing charge whan entred ye straytes ouerthrowe ennemies slipping away flight made inca ped rwe feare tremble prince pursuing spede geue charge vpon also finally put flight wherof thousand wer taken slayne drowned ryuer leych lost also one enseigne next morning go castell erenberge wherof haue ofte made mention whan fortune would taken fortresse standing vnderneth castel wonne straite wayes passage moreouer surprised diuerse peces great ordenauce furnished clyme vp stepe pitchell hill vnto castell albeit layde many erenberge take agayne weapon yet toke surrender castell xiii enseignes fotemen wherof ix taken iiii escaped whiche thre germaines one italian taken thre thousand lost fewe owne men rebellio moris cap duke maurice great daunger whan woulde haue marched forewarde soldiours vnder riseberge would vnlesse might haue extraordinary paye wynning castell duke maurice sayd reason commaunded al apprehede seditious felowe clamorouse rest rest make towardes pykes also duke morisuye slayne handgunnes muche moste spedy flighte could hardely saue life xxi day may two legion sent alpes inspruck whiche thence two dayes iourney al horseman left one legion fotemen fiessa rwe defende kepe passage next daye duke maurice felowes prince followyng ioyne army fotemen zirley whiche two great myles insprucke emperour heard ereberge wonne departed sodenly night awaye insprucke brother empe sleeth away nyght ferdinado lately come thither perswade peace sayd alpes go trente tourning left hande came uillace towne carnia riuer draue whan little set libertie iohn friderick duke saxon bene fiue yeres prisoner least ennemies shuld ascribe vnto duke saxon set libertie glorie whiche thing dede prisoner also hym selfe woulde wha libertie followed emperour neuerthelesse whyther soeuer went selfe tyme quene marie emperours syster helde assemblee achen lowe ducheland make league prince duke cleaue dede excuseth matter ambassadours adolphe archebishop collon comming thither entreth league house burgsidy likewise doth byshop luke george austriche whan duke maurice came insprucke thinge soeuer founde empe staffe spoiled emperours spaiardes cardinalles auspurge spoyled kyng ferdinandos citezens goodes harme done muche remayned thre day vnto truce whiche treatie peace taken mentioned duke maurice went thence passawe prince marching way came ye xxviii day may retourne fiessa afterwarde menssengers well name also duke maurice publyshe letter auspurge effect sorte saye ye ennemies truthe haue alwayes done indeuour godly preacher oppressed romishe idolle might restored yought brought vp errours false opinios might litle litle increase thing manifest nedeth demo stration euen time whan sticke proteste sought religion wrought force pure doctrine might cleane roted caste godly preacher pryson crueltie godly preacher citie also compelled othe great vngentlenes departe limites empire albeit othe wicked therfore grounded vpon lawe reason yet least sclaunder might aryse haue called home agayne selfe preacher scholemaisters whiche aduersaries exiled thinking dutie doe wherfore suche sorte bannished sayd clerely release bonde othe wherunto force violence contrary lawes thei bounde restore vnto libertie ioyning citie also place according vocation teache god worde syncerely according confession tymes past exhibited rightly godly bring vp yougth learning trusting vnto defence tuition comaunde also man moleste wordes iniuries though contrary faith geuen inasmuche deserte profession truthe haue liued many monethes exile doubte good men wyll lamente chaunce accompte worthy good wyll fauour much absence haue preached citie men suspected vnconstant insomuch may conueniently haue called agayne reason contrarietie teachinge require senate put silence demeane selues decree may stande ful stregthe authoritie whan prince thus proclaimed seuenth day iune fift day restore minister prince restore ye minister ye churche churche place geue agayne authoritie preache great reioysing contentation people duke maurice retourned lintz marque albert going parte armie doeth much harme spoyling burning wuolfgang maister almaigne order call hym whan exacted mony inuadeth countrie norinberge fift day may taketh composition lightnaw castell standyng fiue myles citie towne ioyning armie two thousand horseman xix enseignes fotemen nexte daie sending letter norinberge marq albertes armie albeit frenche king saieth prince co federated haue declared wrytinge sufficiently large thought common wealth thei bent recouer libertie germany religio also vpo hope confidence good men wylling myndes woulde imbrace enterpryse would also force indeuour thesame whiche many haue done dede yet haue neyther declared mynde pourpose heare haue sent ambassadours assemblee appointed auspurge prepare thinges defence plantyng ordenaunce walles bulwarkes hiring force soldiours make auaunt wyll perseuer vttermoste extremitie credible informed maketh beleue hetherto haue sent ambassadours peace whiche notwithstandinge haue done bothe prince city therfore wryting kyng prince confederated doth manifestly declare suche either shall resiste enterpryse thesame shall taken ennemies againe muche adioyned warre ende bryng whose limites come dutie leaue behynde backe fortified place whiche force saleinge feared therfore haue taken whiche yet haue satisfied expectation castell lightnaw whiche great annoyaunce campe preseruing souldiours garrison whome neuerthelesse might haue otherwyse vsed bycause chief thing yet remaineth require frenche kinges name fellowes wyll make direct aunswer purposed doe defence libertie germany stablishyng religion let vnderstande tomorrowe may knowe thyng loked sorte ought accept howbeit tyme duke maurice fellowes schwinfurte whiche xxvi daye marche sayde demaunded norinberge faith societie munition vitayle great somme monie muche debating condition omitted tyme paied hondreth thousand crownes promysed peace well selues fellowes letter deuised moste ample wyse nowe therfore tyme marque albert assayled make complainte bycause duke maurice yet retourned lintz lantgraues sonne wrytynge agayne thyrde daye may gundelfynge byddeth good comforte fift day whan duke maurice retourned wryte promisse kepe conuenauntes saying acte marque cleane besides expectation neither like indeuour may recouer wyll also call back immediatly suche ayde haue lent whan norinberge receiued letter marque albert wrote againe day signifiyng thing duke maurice prince promised composition saie cause sent ambassadours wherfore earnestly pray beseche hym wyll restore fully castell taken gratifie fellowes herein thre dayes wrote againe muche doth know haue compounded yet concerneth frenche king muche vnto whome lesse addicted others requireth haue saufeconduicte credible man whome wyll sende citie se instrument accorde followe mynde let se neuerthelesse although duke maurice fellowes meanes diligently intreated contrary xi daye may wryteth againe frenche kinges name especially doeth charge within fewe houres would aunswer playnely whether wyll obedient receiued suche aunswer would towne castell lightnawe spoyleth burneth ouerthroweth maketh euen grounde whan exacted mony townes men caused sweare true subiectes hym cosin george friderick also marque brandenburg besegeth citie wherfore lantgraues sonne calleth agayne two guidons horseman whiche let hym haue woulfgange maister order commaundeth come vnto wherwith sore offended attempted therfore cruell warre whan burned spoyled hondreth village dominio albertes crueltie normberg thre score ten maners fermes citezens church also setteth fyre moreouer exceading great wood whiche serued also inhabiters therby tymber firewood burned therof aboue thre thousand acre proclaymed open warre others aboutes wold obeye nobilitie others chiefly ye byshop bamberge wirtemburg whome also case droue moste vnreasonable condition verely bishop bamberge saue hymselfe prouince present bamberge redemeth peace dearelye daunger bought peace wonderful loss fayne geue xx townes signory within iurisdiction made hym wrytinges xix daye may also permitteth haue wardes clientes byshop dirtemburge payde hym two hondreth twenty thousand crownes also taketh vpon hym promyseth paye debtes whiche amounted summe thre hondreth fiftie thousand crownes city sweuia hauing compassion vnworthie lamentable fortune norinbergians whiche lately assembled auspurge sayd nomber xxvi ambassadours chosen whole nomber make intercession especially auspurge whan come saufeco duicte norinberge alledging many reason exhorte peace tell takyng strayte passage alpes castell erenberge declare state hongarie italie suche ayde succour loked man exhibite condicions propounded marque albert geue thankes good wyll paynes taken declare howe marque hath cause war also treated duke maurice felowes condition suche partly able perfourme partly meanes excused emperour kyng ferdinando saye wyll abyde extremitie commit matter vnto god knowe selues cleare contented iudged herein emperour prince also yea next frendes kinsfolkes marque selfe whan intercessours reported thinges agayne marque duely placed wordes termes apte conuenient relented nothing also threatened moste cruell thynges fourth daye iune aduertise letter mynde set crueltie howe could bring reasonable condition nowe marque shoteth ordenaunce citie much violence one night maketh batterie ouer put terrour burneth one suburbes tyme came campe hym george thanberge william schacthe sent ambassadours duke maurice lantgraues sonne make peace taking ambassadours city whiche dispayre matter el mynded departe long laborious treatie length perswade partes conclude peace marque armie lately augmented iob dalbeck christopher olde burge norinberge hath peace ye mar erles duke maurice wryting letter senate signified moste greuously offended marque doinge yet could remedie condicions peace paye two hondreth thousand crownes deliuer sixe great piece artyllarie thinges furnished beare fauour prince confederated auspurg hym selfe againe restore suche thinges taken wherfore xx day iune leuied siege moste famous mightie citie maner germany best furnished thinges especially moste strongly fortified marque full lusty courage reason thys lucky successe xx daye iune wryteth letter albert wolmes woulmes campe wherin conteined howe norinbergians exceading great hinderaunce hym vanquished receiued condition peace would fellowes shall comaunde nowe therfore determined besege also far otherwyse muche streightly late fortune fauour pourpose spare mankinde past seuen yeares olde except thei retourne time immediatly sending ambassadours fully satisfie league frendes also make purgation rebellion lately committed wyll doe herein comaundeth sende playne worde brynger letter unto whiche letter aunswer briefly whylest saufe longe haue lyfe wyll doe suche thynge demaundeth frenche king passing germany army deuided thre partes came last walderfing whiche litle towne dutchie lorayne ye riuer sare vniting armie xxv day may marching forth passing ouer riuer mosel tyme came ye freche king destroyeth themperour coutrie lande lutcemburg distroied spoiling burning prouoked example rosseme selues reporte recouereth towne asteney voyde soldiours defende marten rosseme retourned home againe pitching tentes taketh little towne surrender called danuillers also iueye one ye chiefest fortes town count mansfield ernestus gouernour whole countrey floure youth al taken prisoner afterwarde towne spoyled outragious soldiours kinges reporte let v retourne duke maurice treate peace said gone passa repeting treatie lintz thassemble passawe first iune propoudeth declareth al thinges large themperours ambassadours kyng ferdinando albert duke bauier byshops salisburge eistet chief prince germany ambassadours also cleaue wirtemberge many others besides complaineth state thempire whiche chiefly ought coplain te prynces elect free gouerned straungers thauthoritie prince electours deminished many thing done aduise knowledge certe thinges also plucked away alienated fro thempire howe meanes deuised thautoritie electing theperour may take comon assembly electours voice maner neglected priuate conuentions electours certen feare omitted liberty infringed whylest chamber imperiall receiueth appeale contrary auncient custome controuersies state imperial purposly maynteined neuer accorded either partie haue susteined losse dammage howe emperours courte man hardly heard speake neyther matter exactly knowen chiefly vnderstande tongue muche losse costes tyme also open assembly matter handled nothyng frendly man propounde ought common wealth taken euyl parte germany sore impoueryshed beggered ofte dayly conuentions home oftentymes many thynges neglected neyther yet publique state whyt amended yea made worse intricate strayghte proclamation prohibited man serue foreyne warres suche reconciled bounde shall warre emperours countrey plucked empyre protestautes warre serued lordes according dutie punished purse war remained theperours frendshyp commaunded paye also landes goodes put sale vnlesse payed immediatly ambassadours bicause assent commaunded vnder paine death shuld departe court foreine soldiours haue bene oftentimes brought germany last warre beinge finished distributed hither thither prouinces whiche haue done many thinges dissolutely vitiously haue gloried conquest germany haue sayde annexed emperours patrimonie head city buylded castelles fortes howe muche ordenaunce warlike munition mockerie caried germany foreine nation howe diuerse men certen ambition haue caused armes ye prince germany set vpon ye gunnes made themselues though taken set forth bokes emperours priuilege whiche sounde great reproche infamie germany though coquered brought bondage common assemblees vnder name emperours prouinces certen men placed amonges prince state wrought secret deuises ber augmented may preuayle nomber voice howe foure yeares past ordeyned iudgemet chamber imperial lawes made fewe wer published great hynderaunce many especially protestauntes religion vtterly excluded benche wherfore thinge selfe requyreth lawes better skanned next conuention suche lyke thynges propoundeth muche chiefly concerne emperour requyreth redressed hande empyre restored fourmer dignitie others permitted delude contempne intercessours conferring together iudged nothinge amisse requestes howebeit intent emperours dignitie mainteined might much easely perswaded thynke many thynges whiche concerne reformation state publique may ryght well differred tyll generall conuention empyre present french ambassadour fraxineus oration frenche ambas thyrd daye iune made oration prince betwene frencheme germaines old time name francons knowen tha nitie frechme germaines great lykenes life maners ye germains thesame people whiche romaine time past called brother frenchemen francons planted selues fraunce natios vnited one empire one prince lawes afterwarde whan alteration chaunced thempyre deuolued germains duke saxon emperours originall kinges fraunce continual amitie frenchme much philip king fraunce caused ye auncient league whiche could scant read olde antiquitie therof written golde letter layd vp holyer place verely without iust cause league amitie co mon wealth either nation dede moste florishing certenly force germany tha great prescribed lawes hongarians bohemers polonias deanes also italian ye kinges frauce maintenaunce religion haue warred many time thennemies christendom saracenes turkes asia affricke europe haue moste noble victory chaunced time vnfortunate whan certen emperours newly entred germaines worthy ye dignitie haue forsaken amitie ye kinges fraunce haue induced great calamitie common wealth sore plage god benefite healed noble house duke lutcemburg whiche haue issued certen emperours men great vertue linked moste assuredly kinges fraunce father themperour charles fourth died battell kyng fraunce like good beare also prince austriche amongest others albert firste neither promesse threatening hyghe byshops could brought warre fraunce thynges reciteth intent may see howe euell certen councellours minister moste puissaunt emperour charles fyfte prouyde common wealth whylest worke thys thinge plucke sonder one two moste excellent nation also craft subtiltie haue brought passe longe synce moste noble prince kyng fraunces iudged ennemie cause harde owne priuate gaine exceading great hinderasice common wealth harde amitie two nation infringe libertie germany buylde vp kyngdome doeth hereof sufficiently appeare libertie germany restored ye power fraunce nowe affrayde force fraunce importune doe muche vrge spanyshe yoke bondage verely whiche intreatie tribute obteyning peace turke vnder colour religion obedience haue brought dissentions faction germany ayded power germaynes haue warred germany whiche haue exacted money men made state empyre miserable placing garrison spanyardes vnarmyng armaries openyng waye confiscation matter brought passe bothe seale empyre iudgement chamber also ryght libertie assembly depende vpon pleasure byshop arras example equitie suche get liuing serue foreine warres therfore executed outlawed great rewardes set forth dauger murtheryng omit meane season many murthers lecherous actes spoylynges robbinges townes especially handlyng religion whiche hath bene one maner diuers according tyme certenly euer hath bene done many yeares nowe tendeth ende contrary lawes empyre kyng ferdinando herunto eyther compelled el fayre promesses allured prynces also certen feare terrour subdued prince spayne might made emperour shuld noble courage way opened ye prynce spayne emper wyshe death rather beholde ye lyght ye sun suche distresse misery assuredly man imagined coward barbarouse thyngs would moue wherfore man ought maruell ende ther arrise prince amongest duke maurice thelectour saxony thought part euen ye hazarde liues recouer ye libertie natife coutrie selues able power sufficiet sustein charge alone haue desired ye ayde king frauce doubtles setting part ye displeasure former yeares hath made partaker al fortune hath also imploied selfe wholy busines making league wherein amongest thinges prouided thei may copounde ennemie kinges consent howbeit duke maurice although tied bonde yet ye weale countrie followe mynde kyng ferdinando requiring hereunto hath lately demaunded moste christian king could content haue peace whiche thing chaunced vnto dede som contrary expectation considering benefite great supposed matter touching shuld haue sent far haue deuised presently neuerthe lesse setteth much publique tha priuate profites would deny nothing prince confederacie wherfore woundes comon wealth may healed ought henceforth assuraunce made yt breake captine prince may released vpon suche condition league expressed moreouer case olde league fraunce empire new confederacie also made late prince may confirmed yt may take place euer thines saye may brought passe well affected towardes common wealth wyll assent gladly treatie peace also wyl giue god hartie thakes aduise helpe hereunto hath wanted touching priuate matter much emperour deteineth many thinges force hath made warre vpon iust cause king thinketh reason ye hath first done wrong first seke also make satisfactio verely althoug neither distruste force yet cause demeane selfe yt may well perceyued desirous peace willing also gratifie duke maurice hereunto prince aunswere howe recitall antiquitie repeted fourmer memory cocerning coniuctio frauce prince aunswer oration germany right ioyfull lesse pleasaut heare kyng preferreth common wealth aboue priuate comodities prince confederate may conclude peace emperour profite one nation also europe whiche afflicted ciuil discorde ten deth distruction suche condition peace kyng requyreth doubte may obteyned emperour tyme also trouble thinketh well common wealth wyll haue libertie germany deminished good hope moreouer wyll shortly delyuer captiue prince olde league renewed newe confirmed king wysdome vnderstandeth conuention great matter finished neuertheles wyshe vnfainedly amitie hath bene alwayes betwene bothe nation may remayne ferme vnuiolable suche priuate suite hath emperour myght appeased couet chiefly also wyll refuse paynes trauell therin kyng affirmeth emperour deteineth diuerse thinges ar signifieth plainly hath thinges lay clayme thinke reason shewe thing mynded preferre controuersie emperour meanes therin desire much kyng would accept thinges good part nowe concerning alliaunce betwene germaynes freche men haue spoken eight booke whiche frenche ambassadour speaketh house lutcemburge house luceburg thus standeth erle lutcemburge henry sonne named henry whiche made emperour seuenth name sonne called iohn whiche mariage made king boheme aided philip ualose frenche kyng kyng englande edwarde third goyng hym selfe hym fielde battell battell cressie foughten englishman victory slayne amonges others lefte sonne called charles whiche afterwarde made emperour fourthe name father wenceslaus sigismunde whiche emperours sigismunde also kyng hongary boheme procurer counsell constance albert austriche whome speaketh sonne raffe emperour whan emperour obserued perfit amitie albert austriche philip le beau kyng fraunce notwithstanding byshop rome boniface eight wonderfully incense vnto warre duke maurice besydes deliueraunce father lawe vrged two thynges chiefly one suche matter annoyed libertie germany whiche hym selfe recited name kyng ferdinando maximilia sonne intercessours themselues shuld nowe forthwith examine according lawes custome germany determine another peace myght graunted religion man molested therfore tyl suche tyme whole cotrouersie fully reconciled way thintercessours discomend themperour ambassadours declareth lacke findeth therin thought reason bene faithfull therfore chaunced extreme miserie first recompesed losse much debating time diuerse pointes mittigated agreed ye length third day july emperour shuld answer directly war cease meane time wherfore thintercessours wryting letter xvi day june exhorte themperour vnto peace whan yt castel ereberg taken afterwarde inspruck spoyled shewed howe prince retorning thalpes thende may came backe fiessa marching fro thence xix day june pitched tentes eistet ye byshops town bordring vpon bauier ther whole army longed sore duke maurice coming without great thought carfulnes comming thither length sheweth case matter stode laste daye iune retourneth thence passaw post horse might daye appointed fellowe prince remouing campe next morning fourth day came roteburg whiche towne nere vnto francony riuer duber marque albert neuerthelesse pursued enterprise hauing driuen citie norinberge make marque albert warreth himselfe peace compelled also nobilitie state party comaundement albeit mainteined common cause first writing set forth professed yet league wha siege ulmes leuied went priuate affaire whether would wynne hym selfe alone soeuer chaunce warre geuen hym myslyked duke maurice doinge el moued frenche kynge bent otherwyse notwithstanding toke faith commaunded perfourme fidelitie also felowes afterwarde inuading prouince arch bishop mentz ryuer meyne doeth exceading muche harme burning spoyling demaundeth hym wonderfull summe money diuers made intercession neither yet could thei agree vpo summe archebyshop fyrste synkynge hys great artylarie rhyne fyrste daye iuly fled awaye saue hym selfe selfe tyme also
