marque albert whiche lefte nothynge vnattempted wylleth archebyshop treuers deliuer vnto chiefest castell dominion whiche situated riuers rhine mosell mete vpon hyghe hyll naturally strong commodious sayd howe required freche kynges name conferred counsell sent worde yt could accomplyshe request herein muche prince intercessours latter part aunswere made frenche ambassadour mentioned sayd howe thought reason kyng declare required emperour ambassadour kyng aduertised whan armie besydes eistet xix daye iune wryteth agayne kyng hath attempted war none cause double freche kinges aunswer thin tercessours profit whole common wealth chiefly restore libertie germany sore opressed tyme certen prynces long muche requested hym assuredly sought priuate gayne selfe therein may thing selfe beare witnes taken nothyng al germany bene harde haue done permitted prince also warre frely list albeit meane tyme hymselfe laye styll armie riuer rhine ennemies inuaded fraunce yet remoue tyll aduertised duke maurice suche thinges myght obteyned peaceable meanes whiche warre attempted whiche thing knowen litle glad whan sawe thinge procede harte desire aduise counsell first prince neglect goodly occasion neither disceiue seluws others abused moreouer muche shewed notable token good wyl fidelitie amitie nation might assuredly established thintent may afterwardes haue better leasure se vnto comodities comon wealth duke maurice hath demaunded sorte would accorded opinion sayth howe ye emperour moued warre without iust cause kinges fraunce wont desire peace ennemy especially suche one neither power thing inferiours propounde thing vnlesse certen hope obteine yt seeth cause touching selues supposeth wil require nothing may stande honour dignitie loueth againe estemeth case may se treate como peace whole worlde would sake geue ouer great parte right contented also shall bothe heare determine requestes emperour refuse doe likewyse wysheth greatly cause might conuention sone might may shall men vnderstande much loueth common wealth also howe farre truthe thinges whiche bruted aduersaries cocerning turkishe league thinges take place consultation referred discretion neither obteine league amitie germaines whiche good deserte loked blame ought imputed chauce trouble arise letter red prince first day iuly whan duke maurice come passawe day morowe brought emperours aunswere king ferdinando whan prince set sayd howe emperour dede written mynde assente many thinges muche nedefull declare expressely thing hath aunswered rest neuerthelesse thintent may appere greatly himselfe desireth peace howe well wysheth vnto germany wyll go great expedition emperour doubting shall perswade wherfore desireth ernestly duke maurice woulde content expect long may goe come whiche shall passe eight day moste whiche thing refused immediatly king importune vayne duke maurice calling vnto prince ambassadours saith selues know right well whiche haue bene present priuie doinges space maurice weary delayes moneth hath lefte nothing vndone might eyther study trauel worke conclude peace doubted yt wolde assuredly witnesse wt wher fore requireth yt would still beare good helpe como cause germany may graunte respite long treatie suspition fellowes already wherunto whan made gentle aunswer comending good desire king ferdinando themperours name would make playne determination suppose soeuer emperour would confirme ratifie unto ferdinando answered brother geuen authoritie would take muche paine trauell fro might wyse passe bodes prescribed shewed prince intercessours letter wrytten xvi day iune exhorted themperour peace unto whiche letter last iune thempe empe letter intercessours rour answereth uillace time first receiued crowne imperiall hath euer desired peace yea wisheth nothing el wherfore cause comend greatly vnto whiche thauthours comotions thei wold requireth faith owe vnto touching owne priuate affaire sake graunt muche concerning whole pacification hathe wrytten minde brother king ferdinando whome shall heare al thinges unto letter write aunswer emperour againe fift day iuly time king ferdinando returned emperour howe thei request desire came first vnto treatie muche rather promised doe thing commo wealthes sake haue exceading great labour carefulnes diligence founde way peace wherfore beseche eftsones moste intierly would haue respect comon countrie many chiefest state thempire keping faith vnto haue already susteined great calamitie nowe condicion thinges suche occasion deliberation brief prince state especially suche nere fire although would neuer faine perfourme vnto al faith loialtie yet constreined consult meanes may spedely esche present calamitie distructio case refuse peace inteding make warre wyll doubtles moste greuouse perillous alteration arrise therof germany whiche afterwarde wyll redounde prouinces also wherfore ther nothing better would content selfe condition peace whiche wyth great trauell haue procured especially since ye chiefest pointes first approued lintz fourme fotesteppes whiche treatie haue followed herein againe muche suche thinges whiche properly concerne dignitie pourposly referred co uention thempire ende may gently quietly treated day wherin done duke maurice departeth thence whan come fellowes maurice retourneth fellowes xi day iuly tyme incamped mergetheme sheweth done saith howe kyng ferdinando ryden poste emperour supposeth shortly sende counsellours whiche shal bring full determinate aunswer doubtfull state thinges least sit stil nothing bycause franckefurt garrison emperours xvii enseignes fotemen thousand horseman leading conrade hansteyne hessebye small daunder condescended goe thither wherfore whan done much harme woulfgange maister prusse burning spoiling countrie time marching forwarde lande archebyshop mentz xvii day iuly come fracfurt prince intercessours ambassadours sent immediatly duke maurice fellowes theyr campe ambassadours whiche might mollifie myndes perswade peace whiche siege george duke megelburge adioyned vnto duke maurice euen first men moued warre maydenburge slayne great piece tyme began firste george du megelbu slayne besiege franckfurt prince confederated desyre great quatitie batteryng piece paulsgraue electour sayeth nay one twyse whan myght none otherwyse chose threatened come whole armie gaue eight best furniture kyng ferdinando retourning passawe daye xiii day iuly declareth intercessours emperours mynde euery thyng uerely matter concerning empyre whiche sayde duke maurice propounded shoulde condition peace offered emperour heard certen commissioner seuerally men generall whole assemblee empyre agayne cause religion quietly remayne vnto next conuention empire conuention shall seme good done therin henceforth common aduise state cofirmed ratified themperour also ye xi day iuly answereth thintercessours last letter yt like haue letter hath brother king ferdinado treated wt diligently accept dede would gladly haue pleased part diuers cause letted whiche declareth brother lieth cofirm approue al thing indifferetly wher thoccasion comotion diuers without al desert falle much calamity yt sory one man liuing yet hath chanced confidence put hope wherunto shuld trust although set vnto certen chief prince yt shuld remedy euil growing beginning yt tumult promising al indeuor yet minde therfor yt whatsoeuer shuld propouded wold alow ye thing cocern hole empire thinketh reso shuld referd publik asseblies time verely shal bring forth iust coplaint wil fail duty verely hath omitted hitherto sith yet hath request ben brought vnto neuertheles ought haue ben done war ben attepted could co iecture thing shuld required much le geue instructios ambassador set passaw thei shuld answer euery poynt dede thoffice dignity person intedeth self presetly wher therfor aloweth al thing yt many perauenture go perswade ther cause shuld reprehend yt intercessor ought rather perswade exhort resonable moderat condicios especially since se doth hardly leaste necessity costraind attempt war intendeth folow nether may chuse case ca deuise reasonable conuenient way peace seing case sta deth thus trust yt wil declare fidelity rather chief magistrate shuld geue ear contrary theyr duty haue made league theyr ennemies raised vp comotions perceiueth ignoraunt euils approche neare whan army brought forth ioyn battel exceadingly moued loss common weale chiefly thinnocent people therfore minedeth peace hath done alwaies wil refuse condition reasonable ascribed vnto mean season whilest consulted condicions set vnto ii seueral time certen state susteind great loss ther truse al time intercession wheras time marque albert afflicted diuers ye coulde withall euen beginning euer treatye peace moreouer answering neuer made delay perseuered way first propouded afterward altred answer might haue bene much soner plainlye made yea shronke treaty lintz wherof selues make mention al thing might haue ben concluded log since wher therfor se minded towards ye commo welth earnestly requireth together brother fernado vnto hath opened self wholy thei wold bring resonable coditions therin haue respect welth dignity thempire certenly wil vse lenity peaceable wais fro henceforth hath done hitherto yt abhorreth much al ciuil war case peace vpon co dicions established loketh fidelity whyche bounden answered also king fardinando letter french ambassador red vnto prince said peace french king obserued diligently although many thing arrogantly proudly yet hath dissembled common quietnes albeit promised ambassador largely pretended thing made war sea land proclaimed hathe offered condition ready duke moris electoure name bring reasonable condition peace former actes agreable wold refuse ther certen determinate thing propounded drift wher hath laid blame breaking peace saith way concorde muste set open also moreouer seketh purge self turkish confederacy though wrong done al wholy forged ye case shal require may brought light shewed comentaries aremont frech ambassador wrytten co stantinople thambassadors comme taries intercepted memorial sent king one coste ce turion ther forth comming also sene letter turkes lieuetenant hongary sent time prince confederated others intercepted wherby appeareth euidetly yt causer hurt turkishe nauye last yere motioned also like might haue ben done yere right sory ther harm brief intente purpose emperours turkes also vtterly vndoe brother ferdinando thintent may afterward bring whole common wealth chiefly germany extreme danger distres wel thinges agre fair promesses care taketh wealth germany man may easilye perceiue thinge selfe declareth minde chiefest state thempire wer yere sore vexed afflicted vtterly distroid many others wer pearil danger yt help germains linketh selues certain place thempire wer brought tirannical power nowe also fortified whole blame ascribed vnto seing therfore case standeth thus cannot see credit may geuen ambassador letter vtterly forged fained dede opinio ben much better haue reiected haue receiued kinde answer consider al thing diligently douteth shal perceiue ambassador intendeth goeth forsomuch wryting maketh preset treaty thinketh nothing nedeful answer xiiii iuly king ferdinando sente henrye noble house plauians burgraue meissen chancelor boheme vnto camp frankfurt coming duke moris xxiiii iuly matter wer debated duke moris admitteth peace last parswadeth peace wherfore last day iuly cotrary many men expectation concluded whole matter hereafter ye shal heare amonges reason perswade one also let consider self vnles receiue condition danger standeth bothe emperor hath puissant army also duke saxon ihon fridericke whome themperor hauinge inlarged incontinently send home let lantzgraues sonne also co sider pearill shall bring father prisonner also whole prouince gunnes paulsgraue elector constrained lend saide whan peace made wer receiued towne least come hand marque albert monthe iuly french king hauing taken certen townes duchie lucemburge said brought armye artois french king dischargeth army without notable exploict done end might relieue army trauel infection dischargeth power self returneth home hauing fortified place taken garrison fortification ouer al thing made gouernor duke guise prince great authority fraunce commaunded duches loraine widow depart country neare themperor sister xii iuly came strasburge ther remained certen dais husband sister also comaunded yt french king depart strasburge came also driue fro cou try ye forenamed wuolfgange master thorder knighthode germany consistory thempire hath next place tharchbishops marque albert ioyned self way felowes marque albert scourge priest going franckfort leauing siege goeth rhine subdueth wuormes spiers exacting mony also munition way someuer went priest either wer fled away el chaunged apparell dissembled theyr profession order time army came neare vnto frankonie bishop ther abouts thother prelate ordre sought saue selues flight tharchbishop mentz fear marque gon longe xxv day iuly came fleing strasburge lodgyng ther one night passed ouer rhine bishop spiers aged man fled saberne wher died long bishop wuormes mediatio paulsgraue returned home paid xii thousand crownes whan taken city said marque albert xxviii iuly sending letter senate strausburge requireth fellowes may request strasbo haue accesse theyr city al time ther place garrison whan neade shalbe shew fidelity well hys also french king name war saith moued reuenge al germany nether shal honest profitable resist enterprise intent maye bring passe therfore hath fellowes ioyned together answer strausbo al theyr power senate two dais wryteth many yeres haue wished thing true religion christ also thanciet siberty might florish throughout al germany end haue bent doinges counsel also haue alwais imploid hitherto mony good ye mind also nether wil time fail either wealth dignity comon country much able time performe know moreouer thys theyr bounden duty oth fidelity bounden yt emperor seing nedeth declaration theyr wil king fraunce also time alsatia demaunded thing wryting wherof maketh mention setforthe prince confederated sent shewed vnto wherfore desire accept satisfaction work violence coutry self instant marque albert aduertised duke moris intended make peace leuing spiers garrison returneth army franckfurt renueth siege duke moris hauing made peace forsaken pitching tent thother side town side riuer meyne vppon higher ground somwhat whence might commodiously beat town ordinaunce pacification toke displeasantly spake euil word duke moris would comprised therein condition peace prince confederated shal leaue theyr armure xii day august discharge army may serue king farnando neither annoye themperoure germany day also lantzgraue set liberty condition peace shalbe deliuered castel rinfelse hath vpo rhine putting first surety obserue couenaunts geuen emperor hale saxony also whiche time became surety duke moris thelector brandenburge wuolfgange duke sainebricke renuing obligation entre bondes suit lantzgraue hath earle nassow lordship chat shall examined prince elector suche also bothe plaintife also defendaunt shal assign matter whiche afterward themperor shall chuse sixe shall determin case yet matter discussed within two yeres space within sixe monethes emperoure shall holde assemble empire consult chiefly howe meaue dissention religion may best appeased meane time men shall obserue peace man shall molested religion euer shall decreed concerning manner appeasing religion common assent state authority emperor wit controuersy may quieted godly rightfull way firme stable unto iudiciall place chamber empire shall admitted also whyche protestantes religion thinges proprely concerne dignity libertye germany ought intreated conuention thempire otto henry paulsgraue also permitted frely enioye lande dominion warre many geuing faith prince confederated haue bouden selues vnto shall free bondes theyr owne men haue sustained domage warly tumulte shall commence none action therfore haue done yet shal part themperor state nexte assemble deuise meane whereby maye receiue recompence loss haue receiued concerning french king much matter thempire concern nothing shalbe lawful declare vnto duke moris priuate action hath themperor yt maye related themperor outlawes receiued mercy attempt nothing hereafter themperor thother state also serue french kinges warres retourne againe germanye within three moneths cleane forsaking seruice shal breake peace shall iudged ennemye unto thinges prince wer ther present chiefest dignity deputy others subscribed pacificatio deuided passaw whiche signed also themperor whan peace concluded fraxineus frenche kinges ambassador retourneth home certenly king toke composition greuously hearing lantzgraue great daunger excepte compact made assented sent againe pledge safe germany third day august duke moris ye lantzgraues sonne departinge frankfurt go two seuerall way man hesse thother leadeth army donauerde sendeth downe riuer thonawe hongary turke inuading legion vnder leding riseberge passing ouer riuer moene went marque albert withoute greate care prynces feared least themperor woulde take occasion hereby dimisse lantzgraue marque albert liyng frankfurt might haue bene comprised peace would marque albert refuseth peace ix day august departeth thece trasporting army ouer rhine ineampeth besides mentz broughte citezens subiection thend iuly themperor returning uillace insprucke eight day departing thence marchinge throughe bauier almaignes bohemers italian spaniardes beginning iuly arriued gene conduit duke alba xx day august came auspurge tharchbishop mentz wha wandred certain day swenia sone vnderstode emperor comming taketh iourney thither present time sene procurement aid french king cast garrison spaniard pull downe castell begon ther builded themperors commaundemet recouer theyr former libertye meane season marque albert imposeth great mony thecclesiasticall person especially mentz spiers whan could leuied reason many wer fled spoyleth church either city began take lead cathedrall church spier request senate surceased mentz burneth bishop castell standinge rhine owne lodging fiue church moreouer shippes yea laden wine wheat calling away souldiours ther placed garrison marcheth towards border treuers xiii day august herman archbishop collon pure aged man ended life natiue cou try deathe herman archebishop colon wish end desired many time wished either might setforth doctrin gospel put good order church prouince liue priuate life sometime frendes admonished much enuye shoulde procure vnto self alteration religion wonte make answer could chaunce nothing vnto vnloked minde established againste might fortune came noble house earles weden lantzgraue set liberty couenaunte taking iourney homeward whan commen utrecht towne standing mase commaundemente quene mary regent flaunders presente attached againe committed custodye spaniardes kept v yeres cause hereof riseberge serued lantzgraues sonne went force vnto marque albert said wherin quene said peace broke therfore might let depart knewe themperors pleasure therein duke moris said comminge water thonawe xxii day august sendeth army footemen downe riuer horsmen lande selfe priuate affaire rideth home poste mineding shortly return againe whan marque albert came frontier treuers george holie captain themperors brought ten enseigns fotemen defend citye kepte oute townes men refused haue garrison bringeth men lucemburge marque xxvii august sommoneth towne rendred vnto next day receiued marque albert entreth treuers bestoweth soldiors city place aboutes bishop meane season castel said situated rhine moselle mete neither prelate ordre themperor remaininge certaine day auspurge displaceth senate whiche prince lately ordeined abrogateth tribe restoreth state common weale senate established minister churche remoueth thre reaste permitteth teach minister according fourm order confession auspurge thinge declared pulpit made many meright glad xxv day yt moth august wheras yeare manner day exiled haue xxii boke declared departing thence first day septembre leauing behind garrison vi enseignes fotemen two day came wuolmes army wente waye till came border wirtemberge done sake wuolmes least theyr country shewed themperor greate fidelity sustain new domage day themperor departed auspurge sente awaye ihon fridericke duke saxon goth home hys owne house duke saxon gentle wordes promised largely beneuolence towardes next day toke hys iourney homeward latzgraue also released fourth septembre retourneth home sixt day time came forth fourth tome luther worckes whiche melanchthon making preface reioyseth much duke returne highly commendeth constancy vsed time aduersity meane time marque albert treuers church shut vp remaining viii day whan burned certen abbaies castel bishop far towne leaueth city garrison xii enseignes afterward marching towards sircke towne duchie loraine midway betwixt metz treuers xiii day septebre passeth ther army ouer riuer moselle inuadeth land lucemburge thence retourneth loraine euery wher doth much harme attending se manner condition french king would offer sore afflicted bishop franctonie recited whan themperor approched neare sued bishop dothe discharge compactes chargeth stand seke recouer theyr owne doth permit also norinberge exhorteth defence theyr country would make league thinge wryteth sweuia inhabiters rhine others aswell prince city wherfore foresaide bishop state norinberge fortify selues afterwarde league time marque albert emperor comming went loraine bishop bamberge aboute end august septembre recouered townes forcheme diuers others themperor passing land wirtemberge held way toward spiers whan came bret themperor goeth wyth army toward lorain town prince palatine altering purpose tourned lefthand marched towards strasburge coming vi mile fro city came vnto ambassador iames sturmie friderick gottesseme lewes grempre intreat ambassador strasburge emperor would spare country lead army another way neither self would enter city wt great power alter thing comon wealth right gently receiued saith knoweth rightwell worthely valiauntly city hath lately shewed selfe benefit haue done whole empire thing wil beare perpetuall memory dede wil declare occasion serueth much bounden afterward excuseth diligently sodain coming reason ship bret marque albert newes came frenchman inuade alsatia also time yt yere requireth expedition may come thenemy sone possible wherfore wil lead army long citye wherinto self wil enter owne family taking dinner wil tary ther one night whan therfore xv day september cummen certaine village mile without city whole army destowed country abouts remaind ther v dais time themperor entreth strasburge cariage conueied rhine wherin small difficulty assone day commauding army march forth self great company none came city neuer sene louingly honorably receiued senate chance passe headchurch whan came thither alighted led priestes making ther small abode went straight dinner senate presenteth gift custome city praying accept good part answereth right acceptable whiche spoken certaine dais past cocerning good wil towards theyr stout gouerning theyr state doubtfull pearillous time repeteth townes men haue hurt done without city soldiors orchardes heritage saith right sory somuch vnpossible saue al vpright amonges great multitude praieth take patiently chiefly warre made thempire afterward toward euening entring way hagenaw tourned next village ther reasted al night time strasburge going metz commaunded thambassadors forain prince followed court go spier remain time sir richard morisine knight sir richard morisine ambassadour england marque antonius ambassadour uenise spoil soldiors ambassador edward vi king england amongs learned hath worthy name state uenise marcke anthony amulie also self well learned great fauorer learning dais themperor staid city man would beleue hurt souldiours ye country heauy sight se pore husband wiues child come running citye spoyled euer matter complained vppon duke alua senate saide sory would se like shuld done henceforthe yet preuail nothing way euer wet manner spoyled thinges duke alua lieftenant generall whole armye manner complaintes brought vnto neither might man suffred speke themperor thought haue thing sai meane season frenchman conduit duke guise fortify chiefly metz nancey also conuey thither al wheat forage country ther serued themperor tho marque brandenburge alphonse duke holst brother king denmarke philiberte sonne duke sauoy outlawes refusinge condition peace remained still fraunce duchesse lorayne expulsed oute country deathe caspar hedio andrew osiander spake themperor vncle strasburge went brabant xvii daye monthe october died caspar hedio chief minister church strasburge day also died andrew osiander coningsperge town pruse sea coast themperor remoueth hagenaw landaw ther making abode xvi dais faire weather without great wonder many length taketh way metz xxii day octobre besiegeth city uery many citezens senator permission frenche themperor besegeth metz men went way loraine strasburge marque albert border lorayne towne pontamosse l ensesgnes fotemen smal power horsmen wher french king could agre vpon wage aswell time past also time come mediation certaine reconciled themperor marque albert reconciled themperor pardoned offence prohibiteth action commeced enterprise warre ratifieth compact made bishop bamberge wirciburge releaseth warfare hongary sake pardoneth earle oetinge father sonne whose misfortune mentioned likewise albert earle mansfeld sonnes thing known duke danmalle brother duke guise sent lorayne great power horsmen king least yt marque stode doubt worke mischiefe purposed set vppon nowe french men secreatly plucked one legion fote men conduit riseberge reuolted frech king afterward attempted reast army also purpose want mony made naked destitute men thei mighte put flighte shame duke danmalle counsell ihon fraxine bishop baion whan exhorted likewise gaue charge whole force fotemen want paye refused fighte wherefore whole trust horsmen whome marque speaking frendly exhorting valeaunte set vpon fortune albert ouerthroweth french men fauored bold enterprise breaking throughe maigne battell ouerthroweth putteth flighte far mo nombre slayinge many euen nobilitye fraxine bishop escaped away flight duke danmalle receiuing thre woundes taken fourth day nouembre duke de anmalle taken prisoner whan marque albert obteined victorye came metz duke danmalle prisoner pitcheth tent riuer moselle time healed prisoner wou de sent germany kept lieuetenat also protestant war george noble house lichteberges adnertiseth bishop bamberge compactes confirmed themperor admonisheth kepe promesse restore vnto townes commaundeth captain also vnles recouer force armes self time themperors army low country inuadeth fraunce taketh hesdine strongest castell party certaine time french king recouereth sending letter germany taunteth emperor bitterly exhorteth kepe amitye mindful benefit receiued theyr liberty restored time iudges chamber imperiall whose fleinge haue spoken retourne spiers emperoure yet remained dedehoue whiche towne riuer moselle foure mile beneath metz twenty day nouembre came campe chiefly city maruelouslye beaten shot violence wherof great noise thondering thereof greate battery metz hard strasburge also iiii dutche mile beyond rhine strasburge metz xviii great dutch mile duke moris said went army hongary king fardinando time retourneth home time uolrate sonne albert earle mansfeld made duke brunswicke driuen country warre henry duke brunswicke maner driuen whole countrye duke henry therefore commeth emperor metz complaining misfortune desireth aid time counte mansfelde serued vnder marque albert whilest yet frech party whilest themperor besiegeth metz wuolfgange maister almaigne order taketh towne eluange ritch promotion ecclesiasticall whiche sued manye moneths fellowes prebend colledge haue authority chuse prouost commonly call whan therfore chosen one noble house sory passed vpon soden surpriseth place known duke wirtemberge whome fellowes colledge besought defend righte leuieth men immediatly setting forth cold winter season recouereth easely besides winneth town two till recompenced charge soldiors french men wer besieged make many sale oute especially mar albert camp amongs others lichteberge lieftenaunt sore wounded winter sharpe frost snow althoughe themperor exceadinge great army yet abstaine assault attempted thing mine vain whan time ye yere let therunto thenemy also knew espial ther defeded city chosen captaine commen noble house ye chief duke guise defended metz gouernor duke guise time lieuetenauntes marque albert hired souldiours commaundemente bishop bamberge complaininge therof thimperiall chamber xxix day decembre obtaineth letter wherby albertines wer comaunded lay away armor wuolmes recouering castell helsesteine expulsinge garrison marque albert lefte rased downe harde ground themperor enforced thextremity cold winter thend decembre dispaire thinge leuied siege remouing thece dedehouie returning flanders comaundeth certen legion remain countrye treuers amonges whiche also marque albert cold sicknesse themperor lest third part army french men xxii day ianuary go procession church metz geuing god thankes theyr good fortune next day searched al lutherian bokes citezens house hangman brente openlye duke guisse leauing ther deputie returneth frace moneth captain marque albert wone many thing bishop bamberge siege metz leuied whan marque albert wintred treuers til themperor paied wage moneth february returning germany bishop bamberge xvii day moneth obteyneth newe letter cha ber wherof one commaunded agayne thesame thother inioyned nobilite franckeconie norinberge paulsgraue electour iohn friderick duke saxon next neighboures helpe thende moneth february french king puft vp pride metz defended setteth forth wryting printe french kinges wryting themperor vnto state empire verye stinginge hatefull emperoure goeth aboute bringe hatred contempt also verely nowe feared whose power readye fringed craft many yeares detected whiche also sicke diseased hardlye kepe life doubtles wil alwais one mind towards wit frendly liberall diuers whiche haue receiued greate benefites haue shewed selues verye thanckefull yet wyll therefore renounce frendship reast marque albert aduertised commaundement chamber imperiall wryteth manye letter bishop arras duke alua emperoure selfe signifyinge bishop go aboute howe breake couenauntes muche hathe ratified compactes made requyreth ther maye penaltye appoynted vnlesse obey afterwarde sendinge messager chamber spier declareth bishoppes haue broken couenauntes themperors commaundemente also wherefore requireth woulde suffer none action commenced againste woulde abolishe letter whiche aduersaries obtained wherunto make answer theyr partes duety minister law vnto men coulde denie bishoppes also requiring longe confutation requireth el case sustain losse shal haue good cause require amendes recompence hand themperor xiii march wryteth answer letter emperours letter aunswere marque albert marque albert ratified compacte deny paied also men theyr wage liberallye owne greate hinderaunce gaue residue nothinge woulde haue bene righte glad bishoppes woulde haue stirred matter cause sent ambassadoure perswade since haue refused haue appealed also prince elector chamber imperiall seeth well inoughe denied especially consideringe howe diuers state haue conceiued suspition spreade diuers brute case accomplishe request co maunde kepe couenauntes woulde saide wronge shoulde increase suspicion office minister iustice indifferently vnto men prohibite wronge violence therefore way matter maye frendly taken vp doubteth self ponder matter diligently wil take way intent matter may easely purposelye broughte passe appoynt owne kinsman duke bauier wirtemberge shall meanes matter bishop verely diuers sondry letter haue complained greuously neuerthelesse trusteth refuse treaty controuersy betwene duke brunswicke nobility hath committed hearinge ye matter ihon marque bradenburge hath appoynted also duke bauier wirtemberge end matter betwene therles deting father sonnes manner time tharmy counte mansfeld shrank away thambassadors ihon friderick duke moris met together accord two letter coyne stamped vsed stil name elector ii sword crosse tharmes tharmes electorshyp electorship themperors permissio fortified castel goth thing duke moris toke greuously coplaineth therof state opinio al deuise meanes peace wherfore said ambassador wer set yet vain cardinall lenoncourtes ambition time also robert bishop metz cardinal lenocurt addict french king came metz chalengeth selfe hole iurisdictio saith belogeth prince themand ordeineth newe senate placeth nombre diuers cleargy fortifieth marsey little towne standinge frontier germany fortificatios garrison french men letter wer intercepted wherein desired king would permit haue iurisdiction whiche bishoppes predecessor haue intent ordain new senate receiue none shall wholly addicted el come passe emperor part shall remaine others shall depart thence doubtlesse woulde great hinderaunce vnlesse suspected personnes cleane remoued let loke kepe city quiet possession desireth declare hart good wlil towardes euen cause chiefly came party receiued bishoppricke might notable seruice marque albert hedelberge paulsgraue elector sente foresaid letter iudges chamber time came also hedelberge themperors commaundement duke bauier wirtemberge pacification thither came also duke cleaue matter longe debated whan bishoppes offred wonderfull summe mony especially bamberge might haue townes quiet intercessor also approued condition marque would haue couenauntes obserued themperor also confirmed wheras time captaines leuied horsmen saxony assured certen mennes aid departeth nothing done intercessor sore offended bendeth selfe war publishing wrying xxvii march repeteth whole matter order complaining mooste greuouslye aduersaries breaking theyr promesse confuteth reason whereby bishoppes alledge maye alienate nothing church goodes sheweth driuen necessitye defende hys righte force armes bishop wirciburge ther self bamberge sente deputy grudge controuersy betwene duke wirtemberge maister almaigne order mediation prince appeased man recouer townes paid xxx thousand crownes second day aprill whyche easter daye duke moris came also vnto prince hedelberge vsing greate expedition thre dais returneth home againe poste prynces intercessoures make league maye defende selues iniurie therin coprised also archbishop mentz treuers whan marque albert refusing condicions wente hedelberge gather armye bishoppes bamberge wirciburge procure letter cha ber archbishoppe mentz paulsgraue duke moris maister pruisse duke saxon duke wirtemberge lantzgraue norinbergians theyr neyghboures commaunded assist second day may duke moris suspected marque albert supposed also pricked owne assuraunce maketh league duke brunswicke promiseth aid bishoppes norinbergians meane season marque spoylinges burninges marque albert albert hauinge leuied power marcheth forewarde country bishoppes state norinberge destroyeth burninge spoylinge taketh citye bamberge head towne countrye threatneth warre nobilitye frankonie vnlesse obey surpriseth schuinfurt towne imperiall fortifieth garrison norinbergians hold certain townes castels benefite realme boheme intreated king farnando might leuy certaine horsmen hys dominion defend place king content permitted gather fiue hondreth marque comminge intercepteth taketh also certaine foresaide townes castels againe side henrye duke brunswicke drawen vnto greate parte counte mansfeldes army phillip sonne moueth warre againste neighboures inuadinge border country bishoppes munster minden cosin also duke erike brunswicke state breme extorteth maruelous great monye aboute tune controuersy duke cleaue archbishop collon certaine iurisdiction mediation paulsgraue bishoppe treuers whiche met bacheracke throughly appeased little beginning monthe iune paulsgraue tharchbishop mentz thambassadors duke bauier wirtemberge themperors comaundement mete franckfurt aboute warre franckonie emperoure ambassador ther coute conigsten therle solmen hery hasie king ferdinando theralso diuers wher bishop brged emperours abrogation marque cofirmatio thelectors admonish ambassador signify vnto thintent may aduertise whether wil haue take place themperor xvii day iune maketh answer wheras last yeare past hard composition marque albert bishop sute request certen abolished comaunding bishop kepe matter euil president compell man suche subiection duety thempire afterwarde whan marque albert would none otherwise accord excepte former composition ratified eschue conuenience like insue vpon germany serued time present much armye readye counte mansfeld also name gatheringe newe power saxonie self troubled french warres could suppresse neither ther al germany hable one day abide force made peace hope verely shuld quiet afterward especially prince kinsman trauell thing certe ly god sente good successe metz deuised meanes wherby shuld haue ben satisfied muche good seruice warre much desirous gratify siege toke place assaid howe make concord hedelberge wher marque refused condition ther propounded hath moued war displeasaunte therfore assigne thys conuention franckfurt reported vnto attempteth warre againste bishoppes certen others also thing greueth exceadinglye done also contrarye compactes time receiued fauoure promised faithfull seruice hereafter bothe thempire yet would least obey coulde contente forget thinges past selfe also suspicion diuers wrongfullye done wherfore let indeuoure wyth theyr force make pacification require declaration matter shall mooste acceptable matter concerninge empyre nothinge henceforth theyr aduise counsell lengthe departed fro frackfurte wythoute matter ended aboute time also themperors commaundemente duke bauier wirtemberge others assemble lawginge might pacifye father sone co tend inheritaunce earles detinge father sonnes euer since protestantes warre vnto siege metz lewes father eldest sonne name haue wandred vp vncertenty warred themperor landes possession themperors permission sonnes fridericke wuolfgange whiche contrarye religion whan came treaty father accuseth moste ingratitude prynces laboured matter diligently yet coulde nothing determined xxv booke sledaines commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument xxv booke warre beginning piedmount duke moris marque albert desiaunce loyne battell wherin duke moris slaine marque lost field augustus brother succedeth duke moris iohn fridericke maketh reclaime hys landes time nine martirs executed lion good king edward englad dead sister mary proclaimed quene popish bishop restored dignity marque albert hauing lost field henry duke brunswicke surpriseth towne holse banished disputation england sacramente thaultare lady iane proclaimed quene beheaded greate execution done england blessed death duke saxon wife alberte exiled worketh greate crueltye marye quene englande maried kinge phillip cardinall poole geueth full absolution england assemble auspurge many excellente parsonage condemned englande wholy reconquested pope intent remeady might founde trouble tumult germany emperour month may calleth assembly thempire xiii day august whan besieged citye terwen dominion fraunce end aprill xx day iune taketh terwen rased assaulte spoyleth burneth raseth ground constable sonne taken king englande sendinge honorable ambassade space certaine monthes intreated peace bishop rome vain month may ihon duke northumberlad death lord protector kinges uncle ye chief lady iane suffolke maried buylford dudley gouernment saide marieth one sonnes lady iane suffolke daughter lady fraunces whiche nece kinge henrye eighte sister frenche quene time kinge edwarde greuouslye sicke warre also piedmont hither partes italy kinge edward sore sicke war italye emperour purposed recouer sene sendinge thither power naples vnder conduit uiceroy peter toletane wheras died turkish nauy whiche prince salerne going fraunce ioyned self sailing sea grece italy soldiors retourned home repulse neare domesticall daunger marque albert kepinge warre franconie duke moris fellowes send army thither marque therfore leauing garrison schuinfurt place whan euerye exacted monye hasted greate expedition saxony leading away many pledge oute dominion norinberge bamberge captiues whan co men arustet ambassador ihon fridericke duke saxon intreat would hurte country promised right gently kept marching limites erfurde spoyleth manye village duke moris amased soden comming sente armye franckonie saide commaundeth nobility also thother state put armure hyreth many coulde mar maketh war saxonye marque passing countrye oute doinge anye hurte whan came halberstat taketh gate imposeth cleargye greate summe monye burneth destroyeth countrye henrye duke brunswicke beinge aided duke ericke nobilitye brunswicke duke brunswickes armye whiche saide gone franckonie conduit phillip sonne whan attempted schuinfurte vaine saw ther pearill home retourne saxonie likewise souldioures duke moris whereof earle hedecke leading ioyn wt duke moris northuse much ye marque tourned downe prouince minden duke moris thinckinge woulde haue gone throughe hesse againe made inuasion franconie northuse marcheth embecke mighte preuente ende ioyninge force together incampeth countrye hildesseme osterode first day iuly also chau celour boheme henrye plauie kinge fardinandoes name king fernado proclameth warre agaynste albert proclaime warre againste sending abrode theyr letter themperor say former yeares hath common assent consent prince state established peace throughe empire gaue commaundement action euer man try law worcke force violence certainly state germany hath bene nowe certaine yeares nowe sore afflicted ciuill warres doth much require peace quietnesse wherfore time arose warre lately within limit empire kinge ferdinando healpe others indeuoured toke paine warre appeased lengthe prince consentes chiefe captain warre finally emperoures permission concluded peace wherin prouided amongs thinges nothing done contrary suche also dager shuld aided assisted peace marque albert refuse also wryte openly certen renowmed prince teded great reproche dommage germany worthye called treason peace making wordes declare sufficiently minde beare natiue country wha spoyling burning distroied countrye lieth rhine wheras good successe fraunce themperor army prepared throughe intercession reconciled vpon respect would confirme youre composition bishop bamberge wirciburge straightwaies abusinge confirmation themperor permitted shew violence haue youre minister manye time put feare either prelate terrible threatninges saying would inforce tharmies earles mansfeld oldenburge obserue couenauntes men letter proued also mighte bring passe soldiors discharged ye siege metz leuied commaunded retourne againe beginning aprill put matter arbitrement themperor king ferdinando prince cl referred controuersy iudges chamber lawes thempire namely hedelberge offered suche condition prince intercessor also themperor letter approued yet refusinge offer haue inuaded prouinces surprising certain place haue spared spoile gentle woman practising spoilinge exaction mony haue fired many castels townes uillages spoylinges al buildinges burning cruelly men place aswell theyrs state norinberge publicke law empire league also lately made assist haue taken oute sondrye place townes men citezens greate yeares age vnweldie pledge mony imposed haue caried aboute lower partes saxony cruelly tirannically way soeuer went moreouer righte haue proclaimed warre agauist nobility franckonie taken sthuinfurt town imperiall fortified garrison whyche thynges doubtlesse haue raised vp wonderfull trouble terrour place furthermore haue spared king fardinando bounden wardship league inheritaunce yet throughe certaine desperate rashnesse haue made rhoades border boheme also haue sore afflicted possession kingdom graunted time paste composition norinberge diuers honest men also iurisdiction haue partlye slaine partly brought extreame pouerty misery guidons horsmen king licenced norinbergians leuy defence theyr country wrong man haue set vppon taken spoyling horse armure haue compelled retourne home furthermore kepe certaine traitoures kinge hathe outlawed rebellion speake wordes reported full threatninges kinge bohemers yet hathe king geuen none occasion hath euer auanced commodity meanes coulde entred country one yeare past full like ennemy yet ignoraunt frendly wrote vnto shuld amend fault also beware henceforth part saith duke moris life complaint moris vpon marque al neuer gaue occasion displeasure haue rather bestowed vpon many benefit yet last yeare whan peace concluded departing franckfurt common welthes sake king ferdinandos led army hongary turke remember meanes soughte allure men opprobrious wordes gaue soldioures others time speaking pacification passawe called betraying germanye meaning frend henrye plauie moreouer ignoraunt thing attempted laste winter whan hongary destruction country army earle mansfeld duchy bru swicke whan wer reconciled themperor manner wordes stinginge bitinge also howe threatning contumelious ye spake againste prouince siege metz know werethan campe whan retourned home siege leuied demaunded letter matter mind towards answered proudlye yt whatsoeuer haue spoken others remembre deny thother made answer gether certaintainty therof wryting matter hedelberge alledged certain thinges great parsonage intent suppose might cause suspect distrust wheras gaue great regard matter aduised counselled bothe letter intermessagers obserue peace also desyred know self loke hand wryting letter thelector brandenburge spake somwhat temperatly yet wher come pacification passaw signified plainly enough howe affected towards long declared also dede certen last letter required woulde call backe army tentes confederate franckonie intent verely vnlesse mighte haue occasion war againe shortly led army country brother augustus wher geuen v knowledge ther cleane contrary thaunciente custome germany make boast hurte went men report far otherwise yet much ascribe necessity knowen fast marched weary souldiours wer knew rightwel case attempted force shewed violence ben harde haue resisted army faint weried traueling haue called home franckonie doubtlesse purpose haue set return haue souldiors let saye moreouer passyng country thuring spoiled certen village city erfurd vnder tuition denye owne letter wrytten brunswicke soldiors also haue slaine diuers brother country neare vnto bichlinge toke two gentleman whan appealed vnto bette whippes cast prison yet could broughte attempte warre required letter exhorting peace wherof treaty franckfurt inquyred minde towardes fellowes bitterly angerly answered appereth letter neither woulde vtter minde yet accused treaty franckfurt suspected whereof could gether none otherwise determined continue warre frankonie yea occasion serued spare neither fellowes also denounced erfurde immediatly declared also others besides many others displeasure bishoppricke halberstat themperor knowe hathe committed protection imposed great monye spoyled theyr colledges country neuerthelesse also archbishoppricke maidenburge likewise comprised vnder tuition haue exacted monye northusians mullusians henrye duke brunswicke whome haue made league righte honest dede duke mor league duke bruswicke repugnant treatye passawe haue persecuted sword fire sone aduertised letter league reast fellowes thinges doubtles correspondent certain former letter therfore although king ferdinando fellowes greatly desire peace especiallye germany euer sence pacification passaw indeuor al thinges may quiet especially party thing also manye nobility brunswicke serue camp testify yet much haue remoued war party declare manifestly whan inuade fellowes intet moreouer muche brute yt hyring greater force though others ma name hable find except permit robbe spoyle worke mischief list much frankonie prouinces also stand great danger selfe dissemble whilest saye brynge passe man el shall better case cause say muche leaue place vnto concorde king fernando fellowes seing next dager constrained put armure repulse v violence iniury end may deliuer natiue countrye recouer publike quietnesse lawes empire permit inioyne v also high court chambre imperiall commaundeth v aid assist neighbor fra konye althoughe time leuye men pretend themperors name yet knowe assuredly forged famed hath declared mind v also shortly shal know thincketh since enterprise attempted common wealthes sake therfore neaded declaration mind yet thintent shall ignorant protest hereafter thinge selfe shall require dissolute tirannicall cruelty may suppressed verelye oure owne name oure fellowes vnderstand hear testify blame calamity shall chaunce warre wholy imputed vnto come reasonable condition nether doubt also euerliuing god assiste rather seke safegard countrye goeth destruction warreth natiue country time letter deliuered campe marque albert ambassadoures electoure brandenburge sente perswade peace whan red letter cosulteth matter captaines demaundeth whether take part affirming calleth yong getleman brought letter tourning talke thy prince saith hathe thrise broken faith hath done wickedly thys fourth fact sort let come hardly wil proue tell name mar annswere duke moris wordes geueth certaine crownes rewarde sendeth waye ambassadoures intercessor shall nothing say theyrnothing saith may retourne home whan therfore perceiued waight warre sendeth duke ericke brunswick emperor third day iuly signifieth vnto policy marque albert sendeth emperor certen ther wer many aduersaries raised againste whiche indeuor couenaunts kepte also might expulsed al land possession reason new conspiracy able proue certen prince elector chiefest germanye haue conspired chuse newe emperour cause bishoppes sore long iudges chamber prayeth hym therfore would offended shall attempt ought aduersaries also bryng hym hatred allure mo vnto haue reysed brute though hath conspyred oppresse libertie germany doubtlesse haue certen prynces obiected vnto hym letter caste abroade germany sent byshop arras howe verely intent hyreth armie myght accomplyshe wyll duke alba shall brynge sonne prynce spayne germany next conuention empyre may denounced successour empyre kyng ferdinando fully perswaded entryng league ennemies hath proclaimed warre againste hym hath verely excused vnto many ryght dilligently suspicion increaseth dayly therfore subiecte vnto great perilles daungers maner cause wyll forsake frendshyp wherfore humbly besecheth hym wyll bothe ratifie composition byshoppes also defende hym wyll doe wyll brynge vnto hym whan matter shall agreed vpon ix thousande horseman hondreth enseignes footemen meane tyme norinbergians byshops absence marque albert inuade dominion bishop absence inuade counitie publishyng letter blamed sore norinberge broken fayth conuenauntes entrynge league faulse byshoppes imbraced agayne popishe doctrine wherunto afterwarde setting forth boke make aunswere recite whole matter order euer synce yeare howe cruel warre hath kept made compacte hym howe emperours permission consente made league byshoppes aboute howe hathe refused mooste reasonable condition offered byshoppes againe moued warre agaynste howe tyme bothe league made also commaundement chamber ayded theyr fellowes inuaded agayne theyr countrie lately amongest others hys wycked actes recite rare example suche crueltie hath bene hearde hauyng taken two townes dominion altorfe lanse shut townes great crueltie mar albert men also people could fynde countrie eattell set fyre sondry place chiefly gate pourposing doubtlesse burne vp fire say chyldre woman chylde many sicke persones able breake walles escape miserably brent touchinge saieth altering religio declare false league made repulse violence careth religion well knowen many also haue many thinges saye behalfe noble familie commeth certen prince kinsman wyll temper selues fift daye iuly sigismunde kynge pole marieth lady katherine daughter kyng ferdinando bene wyfe duke mantua ten yeares synce maried syster mentioned xv boke edwarde syxte kyng englande prynce vndoubted excellent hope syxt daye iuly knowen death good kyng edward abroade departed lyfe consumyng disease beyng xvi yeares age exceadynge great grief good godly men death ensued maruelous alteration thynges englande shalbe declared hereafter bruted abroade poysoned certenly europe kyng great expectation many yeares chyldhode excellently well brought vp instructed vertue learnyng vertues edward sixt latin tongue greke frenche also loued doctrine gospell exceadyngly gaue vnto learned men enterteinement succour germaines italian frenchemen scottes spanyardes polonians tyme army farre sonder saxonie battell fought betwixt duke maurice mar albert marque come ouer water weser nynth daye iuly none ioyned battell theyr force longe fyght duke maurice whiche excelled horseman victory hym selfe beyng striken dagge bowel died within two dayes marque came hanobrie safitie slayne aboute foure thousande maner al horseman taken exceadyng many henry duke brunswycke loste conflicte two sonnes charles philippe nexte daye came fiue hondreth horseman boheme sent kynge ferdinando duke maurice lantgraue also sent duke maurice seuen hondreth horseman tyme therfore together one campe lantgraue duke brunswick byshoppes maruelous chaunge contrarietie thinges duke ericke brunswicke maried duke maurice syster ayded marque alberte many menne thought tyme lyke kinge ferdinando gaue ayde marque albert emperour incourage strengthen marque duke maurice howebeit emperours letter whiche hereafter shall recite importe suche kynde thynges frenche kyng sayde haue treated newe deuises duke maurice ryght sory death duke maurice caried tente nyght wryteth letter byshop wirtemburge fellowe warre wherein declareth whole matter saieth howe victory sore wounded supposeth albert fliyng admonysheth hym therfore commaunde wayes layde hym certen place may intercepted suffered passe euer owne state ende shal good conscience toke hande warre myght suppresse disturber recouer quietnes germany buried fridberge towne meissen fourtenth daye battell henry father yong sonne albert xxxii yeares olde vpwarde presence thought great cause victory el supposed marque haue wonne fielde maurice wan yt fielde lost lyfe many horseman fled taken ennemies brought vnto hym battell liiii enseignes xiiii guidons whiche duke maurice dede spent owne lyfe yet ouerthrewe force power marque battell neuer able gather mayne power whan corp went lipsia ioachim camerarie made oration funerall speakyng muche commendation rekened vp wonder woders death went death droppes bloude styckynge vpon leaues tree moste importune barkynge dogges werieng one neyinge horse hearde clatterynge clankynge harnesse certen thynges full terrour againe owne tente ouerthrowen whirlewynde residue standing still touched certen wordes owne forespeaking prognosticating death come certenly touching red droppes commonly sene diuerse place euen strasburge aboute beginning iune tyme fell vpo bowes grasse tyled house stone tyme flie wonderfull number butterfly sayde howe bloudy droppes came againe others iudged pourtede signifie thing betwene duke maurice marqes albert one age bene great frendship betwixt maurice marqu albert alwayes great frendship could derer frendes thei serued emperour thre warres together frenche protestauntes warre maydenburge fourth laste warre attempted emperour displeasure arysing sayd amitie length doulefull sorouful ende tyme duke maurice died brother augustus denmarke wyfe kyng father lawe wherfore nobilitie state doe retaine parte armie defende countrie xii enseignes fotemen fiue guidons horseme residue discharged moste part retourned home funerall xviii daye iuly marque albert wryteth letter nobilitie people duke maurice late marq letter yt state maurice went coutrie saxon passed without harme hostilitie mynde duke maurice hath hurt men dominion also intent gratifie certen wicked periured bishop renounced yt auncient league betwene familie ye house saxon maner cause strauge example made warre whiche thing dede muche selues haue furthered enterprise cleane emperours comaundement therfore must see hym selfe howe may recompence domage receiued therfore renounceth league amitie emperours armie turwen ouerthrowen marching thence artois moneth iuly toke castell hesdine assaute slayne oratius farnese frenche kynges sonne lawe manye nobilitie taken amonges whome death orace farnese hyghe mareshall fraunce marchian dwelleth foreste arden newes battell saxonie brought empu within fewe dayes xxii daye iuly aunswereth duke ericke brunswicke whome marque albert sent sayde howe little sory displeasure growen farre muche rather controuersie bene appeased vnles feareth least wyll come euyll passe empyre also marque albert especially since many chiefest state doe set fote herein haue made league therfore aduise request al spede laye downe theyr weapon deuise meanes concorde marque content wyll deuise contrary parte shall surcesse also distrusteth shall perswade earnestly desyreth refuse doe otherwyse case standyng doth nowe vse seruice least increase suspicion reysed already whiche doubtlesse vnto hym hath nothyng derer peace tranquillitie empyre greuous displeasaunt begynning moneth auguste augustus augustus brother hesre du maurice duke maurice brother commyng home denmarke fewe dayes consultyng counsel taketh othe people amongest others wyttembergians true hym heyres male none remain retourne fidelitie iohn fridericke chyldren case obey emperour obserue compactes fourmer yeares obedient lantgraue done saluted prynce electour calleth assemblee state appere hym xx daye auguste xvii daye moneth marueilous great earthquake towne mesen whan assembled lipsia daye many duke auguste bryngeth question fyrste whether ioyne hym selfe newe league kyng ferdinando prynces byshopes prosecute brother warre marque albert secondarely forsake league ought auenge brother death finally meanes may compounde iohn fridericke absence sendyng letter noble required dignitie electourshyp possession taken awaye myght wholy restored hym effect consultatio counsell obserue peace electour brandenburg treate pacificatio hereof order made although king ferdinando henry plauie chauncelour boheme treated earnestly duke auguste concerning league conuention duke saxon sending againe ambassade iohn frederick demau deth landes dignity demaundeth owne sharpe wordes state dominion vaine auguste sayed howe bounde doe would sticke compactes conuenauntes emperour made whan take yet would refuse treatie assemblie henry duke brunswicke desyred ayde duke auguste marque albert whiche hyred new bandes soldiours death duke maurice duke saxon sent thone sone iohn william brabant emperour might restored maner time nobilitie state dominion sent thyther ambessadours also absence duke auguste emperour wold accept prince commended duke saxon sent ambassadours also kyng ferdinando kynge denmarke matter meane season bishop wirtemburg besegeth schninfurt kept garrison marque albert sayd byshop bamberge norinbergians whan whyle beseged collebach leading away power ioyne selues counte plauie whiche layed batterie towne hosie belonging marque monethes ix burnt lion whan diuers bene pryson yeare article propounded nyne burnt lion al presence christes body lordes supper purgatory masse priuate auricular confession ceremony praiyng virgin mary dead supremacie bishop rome free wyll iustification workes authoritie churche byshoppes monasticall vowes choice meates vnction confirmatio image aunswered euery point constantly one sorte seuerally alledging testimony scripture whylest pryson letter comforted one also frendes church wrote euery thing done tyme lewys marsake one prysoners warre alledging many thing lewys marsake holy scripture inquisitours preset demaunded whether part read bokes scripture asked knewe thinges gospell kinges liftenaunt also sayd onely two euangelistes matthew iohn two blasphe yt lieftenaunt paule also sowed together certen fragmentes patch doctours churche attribute paule authoritie wold set epistle esopes fable whan marsake inferred agayne godly testimony vocation office paule especially chap epistle galathians maketh nothing matter saith beareth witnes self unto suffer hym hangeman put haltar neckes maner marsake whome iudges comau ded led without bande necke sayed vnto cause better mine wil geue chaine also dubbe knight noble excellent order alluding ye accustomed maner kinges tyme wyll honour auaunce frendes make knightes owne order geue chayne golde token honour fiue studied losanna frenchemen dede borne founde fiue studets losanna charge liberalitie lord berne whan therfore heard taken vnderstode dau ger made diligent sute ye king desiring thei might geuen vayne kyng alledged might doe lawes cardinall tournon thought haue bene occasion hereof spake litle death moste noble prince edwarde sixte kyng england consumptio moneth ianuary fell sicke sicknes increased carefull realme religion conferreth counsell matter inquireth vnto whome chiefly committe gouernmet albeit king henry father wha died appointed next succession vnto mary elizabeth sayd yet muche selfe lawefull yeres accoumpted lie power make heire especially seing moste men doubted lawful birth syster mary also byshop rome religion haue gouernment sawe howe great daunger least present religion subuerted realme also gouerned straunger wherfore deliberatio agreed chose lady iane suffolke daughter lady frauces nece kinge henry eight whan rest counsell maior lady iane london lordes realme allowed archebyshop cantorbury primate englande sent court myght subscribe whiche refuseth doe vnlesse maye first heare kyng speake wherfore admitted speache whan reasoned matter familiarly laye asseted earnestly required hereunto whan kyng departed whiche syxt daye iuly sayd fourth daye lady iane proclaimed quene proclamation openly set forth howe kyng edwarde consent noble moste weighty cause disherited lady mary lady elizabeth systers lefte succession realme lady iane nobilitie common toke moste displeasauntly muche loue lady mary hatred duke northumberlande man maner doubted authour counsell intent meane myght conuey kingdome house whylest thinges workyng lady mary fleeth norfolke thence castell framingham suffolke wryting abroade ayde taketh vpon quene knowen duke northumberlande assembleth power setting forth londo marcheth towardes consent reste apprehende meane season counsellours remayned citie perceiuing harte people force norfolke suffolke resorted quene mary chaunging myndes pourpose proclaimed quene mary kepe lady lady mary proclamed quene iane pryson newes came campe al moste parte bycause serued wylles hated duke reuolte whan letter commission came frammingham thei take duke cambridge xxv daye iuly bryng agayne citie vncredible rebuke railinges ye people receiued hym whylest cal traytour parracide others murtherer moste innocent kyng much thought haue brought sonnes wyfe roial crowne arose suspicion imagined thynges longe layde wayte kynges lyfe apprehended sonnes brother certe noble kynges scholemaister sir iohn cheke knight great vertu learning yet discharged afterwardes put maner lsuing came quene mary london entring holde call towre deliuereth prison duke norfolke bene almoste seuen yeares captiuitie gardiner byshop winchester tunstall bishop duresme certen byshops popyshe religion whiche bene put byshoprikes restoreth fourmer place certenly yt byshop winchester although bookes set forth defended king henry tyme diuorsed selfe lady katherine mother quene mary ix booke mentioned yet nowe obteined place chauncelour whiche winchester made chau celour highest degree dignitie lady katherine alledged byshop rome licence iuly second confirmed matrimony kyng againe sayde naught therfore sent byshop winchester byshop rome clement might pronouce thesame frustrate comming thither moneth february xxix yeare importune suter bishop rome prouerbe helde woulfe eares coueted gratifie kyng also feared themperours displeasure aunswereth wyll wryte themperour true licence vnder seale might shewed assenteth dede requireth haue two monethes appointed matter whan tyme shalbe runne gardener requireth ye licence might compted vnlawfull thought byshop rome straunge also vnreasonable seketh gentle wordes satisfie kyng ambassadour tolde hym playnly vnles might obteyne kynges request would great hinderaunce see rome agayne emperour kyng ferdinando xxvii daye aprill ambassadours declare grief expostulate byshop clement fauoured kyng onermuche would haue matter iudged englande also appointed procurer large ample commission whiche treate followe cause name rome wherfore byshop commaunding last campegius retourne home reuoketh suite selfe much rather vnderstode cardinall yorke kynges new loue said duke northumberland condemned ix booke xxii daye august duke northumberland co demned treaso beheaded whan brought scaffolde made oration amonges thinges exhorteth people perseuer religion whiche receiued forefather wer hand hande iudgeth cause calamitie hath come englande longe tyme nowe incostancie hys death chiefly since death king henry seperated reste body christianitie many yeares nowe bene contrary opinion pretended leaste vtterly forsaken popish doctrine cause nowe spake thus saye put hope pardoned albeit reste talke finished sayd spake thought yet ther affirme sory saiyng time loking round perceiued succour sawe begiled suffered time one sir thomas palmer knight professed doctrine gospell thomas palmer moste constancie duke condened said rebellion treason albeit great suspicios ye geuen king poison yet nothing al examined matter sentece pronouced hym metion made therof peter martyr florentine haue spoken whiche going england six yeres past kinges sending reader diuinitie lecture oxforde whome many made muche excellent learning vertue wanted also euil willers wherfor king dead commaunded styre one fote thence without pleasure quene firste knowen cary away thyng vnder great penaltie case doe otherwyse content obeye whan sawe longe delayed wryteth counselours realme concerning state ought offended requireth accuser might brought forth matter examined wherupon permission came london fyndeth archebyshop cantorbury patrone frend whome popysh preacher costancie archebyshop cantorbury reysed brute though vnconstant wauering though commaundement masse restored cantorbury though promysed selfe thing quene bragged al disputatio knewe immediatly set forth writynge pourge selfe sayth terten priest vnknowyng hym sayde masse cantorbury denieth thing also yea protesteth quene wyll geue leaue proue actes kyng edwarde concernyng lordes supper article doctrine consonaunt holy scripture romyshe masse cleane repugnant institution christe declaration wherof desyreth great nomber euen fewe amonges peter martyr ayde assiste hym muche contrary parte adourned religion commendatio antiquitie saiyng hath continued aboue thousand fiue hondreth yeares affirmeth thei able proue wil proue doctrine whiche kyng edwardes day set forth yet obserued england natiue auncient religion instituted left v christ apostle whan publyshed wryting london fift daye september peter martyr tyme came thither oxforde sayd aduertysed hym whole matter commendeth sheweth ye wyll refuse neyther paynes peryll herein beholde whylest expectation archebyshop cantorbury committed pryson also archebishop bishop caried prison yorke rydley byshop london h byshop worcester certen byshops profession gospell sermon made quene mary counselles commaundemet atcheued crowne moreouer hughe latimer also apprehended whome kyng edward deliuered tower layd father doctrine meane tyme peter martyr albeit perceiued dau ger yet nothing offended lawes realme trusting innocencie thought good departe obteyned leaue wherfore whan brought passe receiued passeporte signed quenes hande came werpe thence collon strasburge whence went firste englande litle hym bernardine ochine health written signified germany emperour haue geuen coucell auntes daughter quene mary gouerne mercy alter religion marie without realme dau ger case chaunge religion knewe best men whether dede affirme ende selfe declareth farre otherwyse euen doctrine gospel straungers comaunded departe natiue countrie men caste pryson romyshe religion wholye restored shalbe declared popishe religion restored englande hereafter first daye october quene mary crowned longe began parliament london conuention empyre emperour called xiii day auguste shewed beginning boke proroged first october moneth ianuary battel wherin duke maurice slayne henry duke brunswick marque albert euery selfe make selues strong gather power warres reuiued betwixt brunsw marque albert byshoppes state norinberge fed duke henry wyth monie men moste parte marueled marque albert whence al store wherfore spoken commonly quene mary emperours sistes supported mony emperours folkes denie vtterly maruell fonde thinke tyme mony brought duke brunswicke somewhat late great daunger whan marque intelligence therof practised soldiours forsake hym abode delaye moste impatiently luckely selfe momente whan heate mutine began ryse x day september brought remedy tempeste appeased duke henry better assuraunce fel coposition duke ericke cosin whiche ennemy kyng denmarke long since sent ambassadour saxon matter duke augustus sonne lawe length helpe electour brandenburges ambassadours reconcile hym marque albert conditios duke augustus neither albert reco ciled augustus prosecute brother warre ayde ennemies marque albert shall marque doe shall chaunce leade armie nere vnto limites duke augustus shall go forth without harme duke auguste shall beware tyme dischargeth armie thei go marque ennemies finally league inheritaunce whiche betwene house saxon brandenburge renewed shortly may next day whiche xii september marque albert leadeth armie brunswicke chaunced vpon ennemies far without citie geueth charge vanquished nober especially none duke brunswick xx enseignes footemen discomfited put flight albeit left ennemy bluddy victory battel retourneth brunswick meane season thei great distresse whome coute plauie companion besieged hoffie towne sore battered shot marque vanquished battell rescowe came beinge dryuen penurie want thynges render vp towne counte plauie sweareth townes men true hym chyldren leaueth garrison one enseigne fotemen great ordenaunce haue spoken turkishe flete unto whome turkishe naute taketh iland corsica ioyned selues certen frenche captaines setting forthe marseille maner dayes take iland corsica belonging state gene fewe townes excepted howe emperour toke castell hesdine force said ye raseth done terwen french king meane season leuieth armie amiens attendeth tyll swysses whiche sent come whan hesdine ouerthrowen emperour ende auguste mynde attempte dorlans whan constable heard therof espiall leadeth forth great number horseman part footemen spedely set vpon euer thei aware putteth flight slaying takyng many tyme swiss come beginninge september ten thousande footemen kyng went vp water banke wherof standeth amia commeth corbie thence sending certen guidons horseman runneth towne bappam though would besiege seuenth daye september sendyng herault armes cambraye requireth certified harte townes men beare towardes hym large towne belongyng byshop aunciently empire warre whiche freche king attemteth cabray emperour made frenche king neuter town indifferent tyme emperous parte king therfore sendeth worde wil nothing couenauntes wyl let citie set open protectour pire ready serue thinges wel themperour yt gouernour yt town signified ye matter emperour made aunswer muche frenchme spoyling burning distroyed al coutrie yt take ennemies message came againe emperour kynge making roades began assaie citie certe day wher nothing preuailed middes september rayseth campe pitcheth tentes two myles emperours campe whiche ualencene towne henault nere vnto riuer scalde tha approcheth nerer certenly thing like haue come batell yt end king approched nere yt emperours fortification loste many men retourned army xviii day september departing distroyed far nere fire matter wrytten priuatly vnto frendes frencheme dede saie howe emperour would fight imperial deny king retourning home dischargeth swiss moneth discharged garrison sixe enseignes fotemen whiche emperours commaundement bene yeare auspurge sayd fourmer boke tyme also met hailbrune ye paul graue archebyshop mentz duke bauier duke wirtemberge archebyshop treuers duke cleaue came ambassadours present name king ferdinando byshop passawe pestilence firing paris sommer rage yt plague made great slaughter paris meane time diuers burnt also lutheranisme king darling whose husband tyme past bene gouernour normandy woman wydowe two sonnes lawe time prisoner duke de anmalle mareschall marchian sayed raunsome duke de anmalle marque albert demaundeth hondreth thousande crownes aboue habilitie wherfore brute went might king list yt ende might make monie without owne hinderaunce obteined kynge geue landes goodes condemned heresie custome fraunce kynge taketh lyfe suche condemned goodes also tyme therfore praye obtayned many saye brought daunger wyll certenly affirme commeth passe many tymes fraunce place bloude innocent persones pleasure also gaigne many bloud innocetes gaynfull many marque albert ouerthrowe battell retourneth brunswicke little haue sayed vnderstode espiall duke would besege citie making longe aboade gathered vp horseman could commaundeth abide comming turingia sending kinsfolkes ally ayde whan holpen hasteth turinge fifth daye october vsing great expedition beyond al men expectation came weymer ryght gently receiued iohn fridericke remayning two nightes myght refreshe souldiours trauaile laye scattered broade coutrie marcheth towardes franckony tyme erle plauie fellowes beseged towne named birnt hearing comming leuied siege gote bamberge accompanied great bande horseman goeth forthe xi day october espie done hosie town lately loste soldiours garrison chaunced vn warely without gate pleasure altogether carelesse wherfore fynding occasion exhorting men valiaunt ryding vpon spurre setteth vpo quickely putting flight followeth entring gate whan town men reioysing sight presence came running slewe moste parte founde great piece artillerie certen others whiche call field piece without cariage furniture enemy caried awaye furnished make batterie birnte leauing ther enseigne foteme goeth blasseburg chief castell came awaye brunswick duke henry beseged citie battered sore shot brunswick beseged byshoppes norinberge whiche supported armie sendyng hym worde repayre duke henry demaundeth citezens foure thousande crownes whan refused souldiours vnlesse payde wage woulde beare none enseignes afrayde owne daunger promyse geue hym muche lengthe leuieng siege whan appoynted soldiours daye whan shoulde payed taketh iourney turinge knowen duke saxon iohn friderick yet made one goeth selfe thre sonnes gothe leauing wife weymer wel health duke henry furnished duke brunswletters saxon take iourney sending vnto letter albeit sayeth haue iust cause good occasion also certen yeares past reuenge iniuries fourmer time done vnto yet muche emperours custody haue attempted nothing either subiectes child haue permitted thing lawe iudgement contented fourmer iniuries haue holpen late also ayde counsel albert brandenburg disturber germany vttermoste ennemy whiche knowe certentie although wrought secretly wherfore case army shal doe hurte countrie cause coplaine therof yt beginning selfe duke henry determined haue playd vtter ennemy albert uolrate erles mansfeld last yeres war howbeit thintercessio duke august sought vpon matter appeased iohn fridericke receiuing duke brunswickes letter began treate wt ambassadours mitigate minde shuld come weymer two guidons horseman fiue enseignes fotemen residue armie placed ye coutrie therabout hither came prince minquice chaucelour declaring comissio perswaded throughly du brunswick reconciled duke saxon quietnes required great monie doth partly remit remaining two day without hurt departeth frendly xviii day october began disputation londo quenes comaundement presence christ sacrament altar terme matter reasoned six day disputatio england without opprobrious wordes one romsh dictrine doctor westo proloqutour demeaned himselfe disorderly decreed thend parliament wyll declare end october michael serueto spaniarde executed geneua many yeares since set forth diuerse bookes amongest serueto spanyarde burnt geneua thinges trinitie vtterly repugnaunt yt comon consent church whan length came yeare geneua ye senate certified comau deth aprehended appointeth caluine wrytten minister yt churche haue conference wherfore great bitter disputation amongst would many tymes tell caluine lied immodestly senate least thing done weightie matter rashely asketh counsell touching opinion doctours berne zurick basill schafusians make aunswer thinges redounde god high contumelie wold forsake opinio also opprobrious wordes cursed speakinges defende condened die whan came yt place execution william farell exhorte hym would call vpon christe eternall sonne god wed token repentauce yet defend cause vnto people many men ascribed blame death caluine setting forth booke reciteth opinion matter declareth heretikes may punished death laste sauing one october iames sturmie man moste iuste wittie beaultie nobilitie germany excellent gyftes mynde notable lerning departeth life strasburg wha layne sicke quartaine space two moneths past thre score thre yeares olde dayes reynold poole englisheman borne cardinal comming rome goeth germany emperour reynold poole cardinall whan come frontier paulsgraues countrie receiuing newes emperour sent vnto hym mendoza retourneth dilling whiche towne byshops auspurge water thonawe attendeth till shal heare emperour duke brunswicke departing weymer seuenth daye nouember came fellowes campe whiche lichtefelse towne belongyng bamberge whiche towne placed soldiours marque albert ix enseignes fotemen selfe bene little birnthe counte plauie fellowes beseged tyme great piece artillerie came norinberge wherwith towne myght battered makyng surrendrie tenth nouember yelde selues ennemies hades taking certen captaines let goe reste without armure enseignes done go colembach towne marque albertes batter sore townesmen perceiuing able defende ennemie carie goodes houshold stuffe castel blasse burge setting house fire flie thether selues also thus fine ennemy entreth towne kylling diuerse founde quencheth fire spoyleth reste lefte afterwardes whan coute plauie taken surrendrie castell lichteberge townes biruth hofie rased walles besegeth castell blasseburge chiefest forte marque kept great garrison tyme frenche men going priuely piedmount vpon soden take uercelles uercelles surprised towne turin whiche spanyardes kept thought selues hardly able defend nere millan gonzago emperours lieftenaunt approched also power spoyled towne retourned home due season laden boties long signified written uenise place solyman emperour turkes hanged eldest sonne mustapha suspicion treason reporte turck hanged sonne mustapha murther committed procurement seconde wyfe whiche coueted haue sonne auaunced succede father haue spoken archebyshop cantorbury quene iane thre sonnes duke northumberlande brought barre archbyshop cantorbury others condemned moneth nouember codemned suffer treason according custome realme thei caried pryson intercessio certen reserued
