sebastian scherteline whome ofte mention made whose death emperour appointed great rewarde last boke declared tyme reconciled emperour king ferdinando recouered goodes suite byshoppes consortes iudges chamber imperiall solemne ceremonie fyrste december outlawe marque albert brandenburg disturber publique quiet empire dispatching marque albert outlawed abroade letter hither thether set vp openly permitted lyfe goodes spoiled al duke henry brunswicke leauing counte plauie ye siege blasseburg sixt day december goeth power schuinfurte whiche towne dede situated banke riuer moene marque kept strong garrison duke ayde soldiours came norinberge forcheme marque albert suspectinge matter firste vitaile euer place thereaboutes brought towne burnte buildinges intent might take away occasion besieging ennemie tyme yeare wherfore duke henry without exploicte done hauinge lost also many men tyme marque saleed fought retourneth home great company passing countrie iohn fridericke without harme whan marque albert vnderstode outlawed chaber sueth emperour would reuerse iudgement sayeth howe may let execution lawe refuseth iudgement corrupted bribe rewardes maketh protestation wryting set forth iudges commaud next prouinces empire se thinge executed tyme holden englande parliament al godly lawes good edward repealed state realme muche kyng edwardes tyme actes made lordes supper ceremony ministration sacramentes mariage priestes election byshoppes ordeining minister churche fourme praying like thinges parliamet enacted statute take place men followe religion whiche obserued death kyng ry moreouer man moleste disquiet suche priestes ministrs churche shalbe ordeined hereafter furthermore diuorcement quene katherine quenes mother pronouced haue bene onlawfull finally debated amonges noble concerning quenes quene mary affiauced emperours sonne mariage greed espoused emperours sonne king philippe whome went report marie cosin daughter emanuell king portugale aunte elenore whan agreed vpon emperour sendeth cardinall poole cause emperour would haue hym staie germany many supposed least bloud roiall well beloued countrie haue bene let mariage stede byshoppes whiche sayd thrust prison created others tyme full confirmation matrimony emperour sent moste honorable ambassade englade might affiaunce quene mary kyng philippe absent chief ambassadour counte de egmonde arriuinge london beginning ianuary treated matter fewe dayes bryng passe common realme toke matter moste greuously diuerse also nobilitie laiyng heades together commotion kent rebelle chiefe authour rynge leader hereof syr thomas wiat reysing rebellion kente made greuous bitter oration quene counsell mariage straunger wyll procure realme englande perpetuall moste miserable bo dage seke also true religion extinguished may agayne establishe papistrie kente countie sea coaste nexte vnto fraunce reason citie cantorbury right famouse brute commotion brought london xxv daye ianuary long heard also henry duke suffolke reysed vp men lecester shyre wherfore quene assembleth power coulde ouer whome maketh generall thomas duke norfolke lately deliuered prison ende moneth meting enemy rochester bridge forsaken soldiours faine duke norfolke forsaken men saue himselfe flight much payne came london wherfore amongest tumultes emperours ambassadours mitigate rebellion daunger together first day february take shipping depart daie came quene citie london making oration greuous complaint wiat declareth intent loue beareth vnto quenes oration yt common yelde hall sayeth howe hath determined nothing mariage without consent counsell hath liued good part tyme mayden doteth mariage would remayne kynde lyfe styll case noble common iudged mete shoulde bee realme daunger bycause mariage ful slaughter moste greuous wherfore let perseuer doinge theyr dutie assiste reuenging treason wicked person dutie doe whiche haue commaunded lawefull heyre father common assente bee quene whan thys wyse pacified appointed certen defende citie assigneth erle penbroke haue charge abroade nowe wiat proclaimed heraulte armes rebell traytour realme bryng hym greater hatred read requestes sent vnto quene wherof fyrste saye would haue quene custody lawfull determine concerning mariage either reteine displace counsellours pleasure third daye proclaimed pardon comon people would forsake captaines authours rebellion would bring wiat prysoner appointed great rewarde duke suffolke also accompted nuber traitours wheras daye conspiratours came nere vnto citie quene cutteth two london bridge ouer ryuer temse least go next day thei come southwarke supposing citezes would haue ioyned holden garrison meane season duke suffolke taken parte realme erle huntington whome duke suffolke quene sent horseman whan confederate spent two day citie traueled syde vayne taking way passe ouer temse king stone ten mile aboue london marche towardes citie laste wiat felowes intercepted power whiche quene sent erle wiat taken committed priso penbroke committed pryson next daye whiche seuenth daye moneth proclamation made vnder payne death euer receiued rebelles house brynge forthe present immediatly fewe dayes duke suffolke brought prysoner london xii daye february duke northumberlandes sonne guilford dudley lady iane wyfe duke suffolkes daughter lady iane husband beheaded kyng edwarde sayde admitted quene beheaded contrary lawfull succession aspired crowne lady ianes mishappe maner men lamented vertuouse lady wel brought vp learned chaunce great calamitie none cause verely tha refused kingdome offered made oration people godly modeste calling god mercy iesus christe toke clothe one gentilwomen couered face bound eies offered hangeman necke striken self daye corteney erle deuonshire whome quene fewe monethes deliuered long captiuitie agayn taken vpon suspicion conspiracie made londo westminster quene many caried execution nobilitie fewe also escaping amongest worthie knight syr peter carrew fled fraunce duke suffolke also duke suffolke beheaded xxi daye february beheaded whan bene condemned foure dayes whylest thynges done englande sibille cleaue wyfe iohn fridericke duke saxon foresaed xxi daye february departeth sibille duches saxo departeth weymer xi daye prynce hym selfe whan layen whyle sicke died bothe true knowledge god suerly whan wyues tombe making churche commaunded certen place reserued hym syde therof shortely followe neyther disceaued opinion thyrd daye marche ten clocke noone whan heard sermon liyng bed callyng vppon god mercy commending spirite vnto god flitted godly end iohn friderick myserable life heauenly countrie nowe composition made betwene hym duke augustus kyng denmarke sendynge ambassadours sayd made great intercession much diuerse almost half yeares disceptation tyme matter appeased vpon condicions iohn fridericke departeth electourshyp meissen townes mettell mine duke augustus disceasing without heires male thinges retourne duke saxon heires male meane tyme duke saxon may vse name armes electourship well sealing letter coyninge monie duke augustus also graunteth hym sonnes certen townes gouernementes debtes behynde certen fourmer yeares whiche duke maurice payed sonnes payeth downe summe hondreth thousand crownes redemeth also castell end made betwixt augustus towne conigsperge standing franconie layed morgage bishop wirtemburge xl thousande crownes restoreth duke saxon sonnes finally league inheritaunce house saxon fourmer yeares infringed renewed established agayne composition iohn fridericke lying deth bed long ended lyfe confirmed wryting seale commauded sonnes doe likewyse wherfore noble courage vanquishyng euilles misery wherinto chaunced died prison custody foreine soldiours wheruto appointed notable benefit god set libertie retourning home wyfe child owne religion ended lyfe moste peaceably leauing sonnes subiectes peace quietnes wyfe also duchesse hauing owne wyshe left earthly mansion godlines wyfe often tymes saied coulde content dye harte might first se husband safe libertie many time pray liuing god many teares sighinges daye ended lyfe duke august sonne borne named alexander dayes rest straungers englande yea many natio forsakyng countrie alteration religion quenes proclamatios conueye selues germany wherof tary wesell franckefurte many also strasburg iohn alascus polonian noble man borne brother hierome man excellent learning went thence wynter iohn alasco diuerse others demarke ther frendly receiued reason contrary opinion touching lordes supper thesame cause denied dwell lower partes saxony came length emden towne east friseland remayned fourth day marche quene england set forth ecclesiasticall lawes wherin comaundeth bishop officer receiue man suspected heresie holy ecclesiastical lawes englande order rote cleane heresy abolyshe al naughtie pestiferous bokes prescribe order scholemaisters preacher take awaye maried priestes wyues benefice inioyne punishement condigne misdoing yet suche cosent wiues wil proteste make diuorsemet handle gently suche amende also restored moreouer prayer common supplication sayde latin tongue olde custome holy day obserued ceremony fourmer tyme restored bigge child christened confirmed byshops taught scholes howe helpe priest saye masse serue aultar tyme kyng englande henry eight banished byshop rome sayd ix boke made lawe amongest others man admitted office ecclesiastical dignitie except would first proteste solemne othe successours also supreme head englishe churche ouer whiche byshop rome hathe authoritie neither thinge byshop citie rome whome wyll haue nothinge doe whiche othe quene whan published thinges nowe release also chargeth byshoppes henceforth required man secretly sorte restoryng supremacie bishop rome speaketh co mon prayer thus kyng father commaundement procession sayde vulgare tongue wherin god prayed amonges thinges would deliuer sedition conspiracie tyranny byshop rome fourme therfore set forth print ye quene nowe commaundeth abolished long lady elizabeth quenes sister lady well learned co mitted lady elizabeth co mitted yt tower tower thought priuie fourmer conspiracie ende marche ennemies marque albert retourne siege schninfurt moneth aprill came germany england men great learning sir richarde morisine knight whose ambassade haue spoken fourmer boke sir anthony coke sir iohn cheke knightes kinges scholemaisters went italy thither came also iohn pomet byshop winchester whiche reason alteratio religion displaced likewyse diuerse others time force duke florence byshop rome besieged sene peter strosse frenche kinges name defended citie vnderstanding siege sene certen thinges espiall set vpon sodenly slew great nomber notwithstanding restoring strength continued siege wherfore frenche kyng hyreth thre thousand swiss ayde besieged duke florence fiaunced daughter ascanio byshop rome nephewe meanes deuised auaunce hym mariage day gouernour millan ferdinando gonzago sent came emperour brabant thither came also babtista castaldus whome emperour sayde fourmer yeares sent ambassadour hongarie middes aprill sir thomas wiat executed london suffered excusinge lady elizabeth death wiat erle deuonshyre diligently affirmed priuie conspiracie also archbishop cantorburye bishop london hugh latimer caried first windsore oxford disputed diuines vniuersity also cambridge perseueringe theyr opinion committed prisone time againe quene helde parliament wherin propounded two thinges chieflye concerning owne mariage restoring supremacy bishop parlamet england rome wherof obteined first vpon certain condition nobility chiefly againste coulde perswade cardinal poole bene certen time themperor wente french kinge counsellor peace preuailed nothing thend aprill marque albert receiuing lx thousand crownes sendeth away duke danmalle prisoner wher little lost holansperge fortresse dominion long themperor sending letter bruissels winter outlawed chamber outlaweth complaininge worke much mischief vnpunished commaundeth wordes waighty prince state chiefly nexte put proclamation outlawrye execution met twise roteburge treate peace wheras nothinge concluded themperoure decreed againste state assembled wuormes al belonge prouince rhine comon assemble thempire yt shuld holden auspurge haue spoken oftner themperor impeched sicknes also warres could ther king fernando request taketh charge vppon prince desired come excused selues reason troublesome state germany themperor ready sent thither thassemble auspurge certen counsell also chosen cardinall auspurge purpose time cause aboue named man came matter differred til time conueniet marque albert written certen thinges spitefully bitterly norinbergians though former war priuely aided french king fellowes paid mony though shuld haue great suspitio themperor also bishop theyr fellowes spoken contumelious word shuld fauor french king themperor yt selues attepted war yt able yt bishop shuld kepe couenants though shuld seke destroy al nobility though shoulde haue broken theyr promise expressed signed wryting though haue made wicked cruel warre people dominion thoughe corrupted iudgemente chamber bribe called also traitor theyr country dispersing abrode libel therof throughe germany knowen norinbergians whan taking holansperge found certaine thinges lyke wrytinge city norinberge marque albert sort xviii day may make answer large addressinge theyr wryting vnto state confute al thinges ordre verify thinges recite vpon conditio gaue monye duke moris fellowes declare author warre euen time say prince intercessoures met hedelberge vautcurrers leuied muche power possible mighte saxonye proued aswell others also letter one currier william grumpache wrote vnto xxix march king ferdinando duke moris duke bru swicke imploid theyr force yea liues blud theyr country would doubtlesse haue made horrible destruction waste oute germany driuen byshops franckonie condition vnreasonable co position emperor made frustrate gaue leaue recouer againe theyr owne wherfore bishoppe bamberge wan againe certaine townes gouernments longe receiued againe emperor fauor euen time reason high treason onlye landes possession life also might haue bene taken fro lawfully afterward emperor commaundemente made league defence oure prouinces e reconciled emperor obteined confirmation compactes made yet vppon condition true empire emperor permitted violence time siege metz wrote home hys captain feare bishop vnlesse wold restore taken worke force violence monthe ianuary followinge makinge inuasion recouered manye thinges force armes wherefore bishop bamberge admonished fellowes aide according theyr league neuerthelesse least thing rashly sondrye letter intermessagers exhorted marque albert peace answeringe contemptuouslye opprobriously said amongs thinges mo ennemies honor praise win beginning march long began yt treatye hedelberge whan ther refused moste ample large condition kinffolkes ally intercessor exhorting vnto peace went home leuied army sollicited moued againe bishoppes last professe selues enemy last yere first aprill wheras self hath moued cruell warre straunge example hath bene heard germany goeth charge v crime assuredly vntrue neither ther euer like thinge complained vnto v soldiours haue omitted kind cruelty chauncing time find plowman field hanged vp father sonnes manner oure face haue inforced woman liue haue also digged vp whan haue bene dead last yere ye moneth may certaine gentelman franconie nicholas eglofsten inforced yelde vp castell conrute cruell actes marque albert burne also fineding ther fortye country men minister church commaunded ha ged vp orchard adioyning castel caried away wife mother prisoner wente aboute dede excuse matter letter nobility franconie nothing purpose also intreated prisonners men pledge bamberge whiche haled saxonie declare hath deteined prisone bothe demaunded vnreasonable summe mony mooste greuously tormented vppon racke also sterued honger cold many died residue hauing limmes starke deade reason cold wer faine haue cut taken away wheras certain nothing either paye raunsome liue forbad shoulde haue meate geuen souldioures warde vanquished lamentation pitiful cry somtime cast piece bread drye moulded longe kepinge cattell brute beastes vnlesse extreme honger woulde haue touched died want meate yt som made piece mony theyr frendes yet hardly could therfore get little straw water wherfore certaine staruen honger thurste onlye terrible darknesse also stench prison mids thordure uermen venemous beastes whan thus perished ye coarses wer drawn remoued fro thece lefte aliue increased prison stench howe gently haue intreated prisonners captaines certen centurion euen suche deserued worst v haue rendred selues without condition may knowen owne testimony howe vnwilling haue peace may well appeare two last treaty roteburge know moste noble prince either wer selues sente thither ambassadoures althoughe susteined wonderfull losse calamity already outlawed yet former conuention made offer wold leaue warre demeane selfe well henceforth woulde trye matter law would also lay part oure weapon put matter tharbitrement prince intercessours iudgement themperor state empire offer made bishoppes aduise consente ambassadours king ferdinando counselloures also prince intercessoures loue peace added moreouer state franconie confederacy would promise restore prouince shoulde cease warre side kepe peace henceforth publication behalf frustrate whole controuersy committed frendly lawfull treaty contempt mockery called intercessor enemy procurer saide woulde suffer selfe broughte suche distresse neither couet haue outlawry yet reuearsed would also put hazard reaste spake many like thing rashly opprobriously threatninges highest meane lowest degree proued letter printe holansperge nexte assemble althoughe offered largely yet nothing rather inclined peace yea went craftes policy neither commendable princelike request intercessor committinge whole matter emperor certen prince promised attempt longer warre compromise themperor sending letter bruissels fourth aprill ratifye willed state frankonie leaue warre also co mit cause care fidelity marque albert intent ful craftely appeareth thinges folowed yt might staye themperor shuld comaud certen prouinces thempire put outlawry execution self also might haue space leuy army gatheringe time place haue oppressed v vppon soden god benefit matter detected letter time intercepted sent hither thither chief captain ce turions wherin hath admitted treaty roteburge purpose meane season may prepare self set vpon enemy nowe thintercessors shal haply require forsake enseignes let obey kepe together wise scatter abrode excuse let alledge cause haue many month wage owing therfore may depart paid say remaine party without hurte til haue receiued theyr mony hitherto appertaine also letter wherin commaundeth chieftaines wyth delay set vpon al men whosoeuer whan treason therfore brought light wheras men demaunded ambassador sent roteburge whether would stand compromise could haue certain answer aduise king ferdinandoes ambassador wer constraind commit matter vnto god first themperor thempire oure letter sent themperor time declare seing matter thus much euery man may easily perceiue thinges haue truelye rehearsed hitherto driuen manye railinges reproches displeasure repulse fury violence haue obeied commaundement high chief magistrate therefore beseche men loue vertue honesty hate violence iniurye consider diligently vnlesse sentence geuen shoulde put execution boldnesse repressed great daunger hangeth ouer v also wherfore let man aid assist geue succoring place refuge becommeth noble prince loue country wish would impeche thexecution commaundement selues also would se thinge executed vttermooste theyr power woorke herein others may made afraide example also geue creadite hys famous libel slaunders sette forthe agaynste v shall againe attempt anye thinge againste v hym wyth theyr aide counsell requyre moste earnestlye marque albert receiuing mony duke danmalle said hasteth saxony hiringe soldiors monthe maye goeth schuinfurt priuely tenth daye iune viii hundreth horsmen vii enseigns fotemen dawning marque al goeth suinfort day entreth towne side besieged wer great penury al thing third day whan spoyled towne night leadeth al soldiors aswel horsmen fotemen nombre xviii enseignes artillery leauing ward al kepe gate taketh iourny kitzing town standing beneath riuer moene whan light day thenemies perceiued gate vnfurnished sound tropet prepare selues euery man follow pursue diuers chiefly soldiors duke brunswick wer commaunded enter towne spoile destroy left wherfore chief captain gouernours field least delay taryinge reaste marque albert haue time escape set towne fire diuers sondry place driuen depart repair vnto tharmy albeit marque gon certain hour yet letted hindred thordenaunce yt could make speade staide forewarde bickereth reast tharmy approching whan saw self weake great multitude exhortinge men make best shift euery self accompanied flight horsmen goeth spedely sight swimming ouer ye riuer kitzing escapeth losing munition cariage viii day castell blasseburgh chiefest fortresse rendred vp came handes king ferdinando chauncelour boheme counte plauie beseged continually dead little thus therefore marque albert expulsed driuen dominion whilest thinges done franconie henry duke brunswicke lower partes darony compelleth diuers aswell prince city many nobility pay mony vnder subiectio duke megelburge duke luneburge prince anhaldes earles mansfelde part also bishop power hauing discomfited marque taken schuinfurt punished right sore roteburge towne imperiall counte henneberge amonges others thus bent except might recouer charge warre said appartained men pretended worke much violence mediation matter appeased war ceased manner time charles duke sauoy depriued great part dominion tolde tenth booke departeth oute life leauinge sonne philibert heyre death charles sauoy serued themperor warres many yeares king fernando setting forth late proclamation commaunded subiectes nothing altered sacramente thanckes geuing thold custom receiued lordes supper contented thone kind terme noble gentleman city wheras diuers time sued herein require humblye theyr letter alledginge manye teasons might permitted receiue whole supper lorde according commaundement institution christe custome primatiue churche unto letter theyrs xxiii iune king ausweringe uienne full little letter king fardinando subiectes lord supper thought saith would haue called question proclamation mine haue found cauillations therin met subiectes perseuer thauncient true religion obedience catholicke church without man obtain saluation receiue sacrament chiefest others law custome church neither corrupt opinion certain curiosity pride also swarue duty owe church also magistrate verely mind effect proclamation nether new thing commaunded old ordinaunce hath ben brought wer vnto progenitor emperor king duke austrich also whan began gouerne common wealth deduced vnto time diligently becommeth christen prince obserued sondrye time people also inioyned shoulde remayne wherfore supposed would haue attempted thyng proclamacion thinges contende alteracio lawes liberty myght remaine vnto whole certenly new deuise lately conceaued certayne opinion also reasoned large though lawful iudge commaundementes whiche chiefe supreme magistrate though ought ryght permitted certen yeres diuers accord contrary lawes church haue taken vpon priuately vsurpe question harde ful difficulty also affirme doubtles thincke therupon whan time make answer may well perceiued tender little saluation people meane time loke al obediece trust wil nothing proclamation unto state state make aswer yt kinges letter afterward answer wryting say haue oft time spoken sauiour christes commau dement puissant king repete institute supper plain manifest word sort self prescribeth might receiued al men nether lawfull man mortall alter hys institution may proued also manner thauncient churche vsed day haue crept little little euen counsel constance graunteth ye instituted christ wher therfore thys cocerneth saluation certainly neither curiosity pride hath moued v vnto wherby truste rather refer consultation commaundement christ apostle consent primatiue church consciece shuld burthened thing might please besech honor god glorye name oure saluation acknowledge moste gladlye high magistrate geuen v god nothing world may ought loke hads lie v one matter desire fauorable v byshop wirciburges dominion ther abbay moke called newstat abbot therof ihon frise thabbot newstat accused herisye came suspition lutheranisme fift day may cited come vi day wirciburge answer vnto certain interrogatory question whether lawful sweare whether anye man bounden othe whether lawful make vow chastity pouerty obediece interrogatory ministred whether manner vowes binde whether becometh better minister church mariage singlenesse whether ther one true apostolical church whether spouse christ continually gouerned holy ghost whether alwaies discern true holsom thyngs whether reason head christes vicar called rightly ye church rome whether bokes testament cannon lawful true whether holy scripture ought expounded mind holy father doctor church counsel thopinion luther others lyke sort whether besides scripture ther nede also tradition apostle like whether faith aucthority obedience oughte geuen traditios holy scripture whether ought obay ye ciuill magistrate politick matter holy thing thecclesiasticall ordinary whether ther vii sacrament churche whether child oughte christened whether oughte christen latin tounge salt oile water charactes exorcismes whether baptisme cleane putte awaye originall sinne sort concupiscence remaineth loseth name sinne whether breade chaunged consecrated body wine blud christ vertue wordes priest pronounceth whether remaine althoughe receiued whether sacrament sort consecrated worshipped whan either borne aboute honor christe caried vnto sickfolkes also reserued pix whether christ worshipped vnder forme bread wine whether christ wholly vnderneath either kinde whether confession sinnes prepare man worthy receiuing sacrament whether masse true continuall sacrifice whether yt cannon masse reteined whether sacramet confirming vsed whether ther iii part penaunce contrition confession satisfaction whether priest may forgeue sinnes hath confessed whether priestes onlye haue authoritye keyes whether soules good men loue v whether pray god v whether ought pray vnto sainctes whether sainets holy day oughte obserued whether relikes sainctes oughte worshipped whether soules godly yet repurged relieued mass praiers fastinges almose dedes whether place purgatory whether time lent time fasting appoynted churche oughte obserued whether day church forboden ought abstain fro eating flesh whether people ought stirred vp vnto religion ceremony ceremony godly whiche unto dothe make answer xxvii daye may large althoughe confirmed sayinges testimony scripture doctor also yet condemned xxv iune depriued function thend iune french king marching army chapaigne frenche kinge muadeth themperours country mariburge taken taketh way riuer mase inuading emperor country ioyning tournay surpriseth amonge many thinges townes bouine dinaunt spoyleth raseth castels taking mariburg fortifieth munition garrison themperor going bruissels hys army commeth namures town riuer sabie v mile beneath dinant french king appeared haue desired battell whan time tracted tourneth henault taketh biuse town castel quene mary lady regent flaunders wher house pleasure spoileth burneth destroyeth country farre neare spoyling burning commeth siege rentie towne border artois emperor comming whose army wholly assembled siege leuied light conflictes skirmishing either side moneth august wheras manner time kinges armye italy conduite peter strosse set vpon themperors power wherof gouernor marque marignan receiued great ouerthrow uery many swiss slain said wer sent thither king meane time emperor sonne phillip xix day kinge phillip arriueth england iuly arriueth england nauy oute spaine fourth day euening commeth winchester quene taried going cathedrall churche wyth nobility receiued bishop winchester certaine others emonges prince duke alua next day goeth quene talking long much verye familiarely seconde daye kept holy iames patrone spain mariage solempnised ther themperors ambassadoure affirmed openly howe themperor geuen sonne mariage kingdom naples afterwardes departing fro thence last entred london head city greate pompe solempnitie moneth august certen state thempire mete wourmes themperor called vpon thexecution marque albert expulsed country went first loraine fraunce wher king denied intertainmente feared least attempt something least shoulde make roade alsatia party neare vnto prouince rhine thend septembre sent certen guidos horsmen border loraine kepe passage last without exploict done returne home without domage wher lay moneth octobre assemble frankfurt cause unto conuention wer broughte letter marque albert wherin complaineth enemy last war speaking much yt bishop arras taunteth spitefully amoges others bishop treues strasburge also lantz frenche kinges letter graue calleth bloudy horsmen laye waite hys life letter also red name frenche kinge wrytten dutch tonge first day octobre speaking thold amitie fraunce germany eunemies wholy addict saith infringe certen yeres past wrought matter far father declared enemy neuerthelesse two yeres since state thempire miserable cleane order forgetting offence past declared plainly good bare following fotesteps progenitor soughte euer auaunce honor dignity proued euer offered wronge aduersaries haue many way gone aboute plucke liberty goodes also time haue deuised sondry policy exact mony haue also kindled faction betwene noble house knowe rightwell albeit case standeth thus yet procurement heare say howe certaine state dede neighbor verely loked thing haue moued warre wher haue proclaimed doubtles great maruel much dede quarrell betwixt v commonly spoken marque albert though shoulde aide receiue wrong inasmuch shewe fauor old frendship whiche saide hathe bene alwaies betwene v also hath bene euer custome entertainment kinges fraunce prynces aduersity especiallye germaines shoulde haue safe refuge succoring place much pleasaunte surely se honor home thinges safe wel se thus discomfited expulsed destitute succor would haue wished also chaunced calamity least wise might reconciled vpon reasonable condition much fault mine aduersary brought distresse hathe pronounced thing frustrate hath ratified shuld suspition hauinge compassion misfortune shuld geue aid thempire neuer came thought neither maye assured nothing lawes amity wheras youu ought loke nothing el peaceable frendlye require againe circumuented craftes neither loue either make warre selues aid men monye theyr endeuor maye make theyr priuate affaire common rather obserue amity take condition offered intende herein require aduertise plainly bearer hereof moreouer according thauncient custome pacification passaw ambassador shal come next assemble thempire may haue safeconduit unto made answer horsmen sente frontier loraine concerned none iniury towardes done intent case marque albert make anye sodaine inuasion enterprise mighte disapoynted touching ambassadoures safeconduit muche haue commission hereof aduertise theyr prince distrust herein shall reasonable thend octobre themperor geueth ouer sone phillip thempeor geueth sonne phyllip dukedom millan dukedome millan sendinge messagers inuest herein accustomed ceremony french kinge leuiynge siege rentie said long discharging swiss placed reast soldiors garrison themperor far hesdine yeare toke ouerthrew said espying place conuenient began new fortification towne thintent might bringe passe maintaineth army whiche monthe nouembre destroyeth picardy spoyling burning farre amia wherefore whole force violence warre lighted vppon pore miserable people either side afterwarde themperor discharging reast armye interteined still legion two self time french king set new power italy amonges others certaine almaignes relieue sene whome emperor force duke florence besieged hotely xii day nouembre holden parliament england cardinall poole comming oute brabant wheras certen ambassador commen england co duit cardinall poole arriueth england amonges lord paget xxiii nouembre came london right honorably receiued place whersoeuer came immediatly restored blud house inheritance common assent conset king henry eight displaced v day came parliament house presence king phillip quene wha shewed cause ambassade exhorteth return comunion church restore holy father bishop rome due authority wil graunt vnto clemency gentlenes admonisheth also geue god thankes hath geuen king quene finally wher haue restored house inheritance taketh great benefit saith much bouden restore heauely court coutry wisheth al thing whe spoke effect goth part ther bishop winchester chancelor repeting oration many word exhorting vnity concord saith bouden geue god great thankes vnspeakable mercy hath raised vp prophet owne sede whiche honorable cardinall wholy inclined vnto saluation next day nobility common approued thoration request cardinal poole drawne fourme petition wherin beseche king quene would make intercession supplication repented sore scisme haue denied obedience apostolicall seat haue consented decree made henceforth wil commaundemente quene euer lawes statute may abrogated parlament wherfore mooste humbly beseche theyr highnesse wold meanes bring passe absolued sinnes censure whith haue committed againste lawes church may receiued england returneth vomit penitent child bosome christes church henceforth may serue god obedience sea bishoppes rome glorye name increase theyr owne saluation day whan king quene cardinall poole present chaunceloure standeth vp pronounceth openly state determined concerninge request bishoppe rome legate afterwarde dothe exhibite supplication aforesaide comprised wrytinge subscribed kinge quene beseching receiue opened deliuer againe chaunceloure reade demaundeth companye whether contente herewith whiche whan hadde affirmed kinge quene arrise deliuer cardinal whan red exhibiteth vnto letter commission red men mighte perceiue authority geuen bishop rome assoile maketh oration declareth howe acceptable thing vnto god repentaunce much thaungels heauen reioyse penitent sinner alledging purpose manye example geueth god thanckes hath put minde desirous amendement done arriseth likewise king quene knele vpon theyr knee calling vppon high power mercy god besecheth loke mercifully vppon people pardone offence affirming self sent therfore highe bishop christes vicar geue absolution lifting vp stretching forth cardinal geueth yt lordes absolution hand manner blesseth whole multitude assoileth go chappell geuinge thanckes vnto god playing organes sounding tropets token shewed mirth gladnesse time accustomed knew cardinal poole talke manner liuing marueled much loked manner stuffe hand xviii day decembre themperor addressing letter fro bruissels vnto state thempire upon waighty vrget cause saith marque emperor letter marque albert albert last yere outlawed iudges ye chabre condemned treason haue certen knowledge letter set vp openly also came fro v afterward muche perseuereth obstinatelye troublesome seditious purpose vndoubtedly goeth mischief thintent may vexe plage oure natiue country germany forasmuch hath hys recourse sondry place ther taketh starting hole refuge credily informed thought necessary comon country sake renue ye former decree especially since beleue none loueth countrye wold prouide ye safegard self land subiects also wold haue thenterprises adherent impeched letted wherfore charge commaud vnder penalty expressed yt man aid felowes thing nether help counsel relief mony vitails artillery also yt nether fellowes permitted make power leuy soldiors theyr dominios attempt thing yt euerye man let alwaies possible kepe theyr people subiectes run oute offeders obey commaundemente punishe extremely letter set vp place print xxix decembre king ferdinando cou sel wherof haue spoken yt shuld holden auspurge came thither fineding man two day sendinge thimperial counsell auspurge letter messagers exhorteth prince yt much treat waightye affaire empire would repare thither spede self although great losse hindraunce leauing country commen thither yt might consult common weale deuise suche meanes profitable necessary thafflicted state germany wherfore let come selues thinge theyr deputy waightines cause requireth themperor brother hath geue ful authority treat neither wil tary longer neades must aboute middes ianuary breaketh vp parliament london amonges many thinges restoring cardinall poole enacted thactes also king former time concerning punishing heretickes authority bishop renued chieflye supremacy bishop rome wholye restored lawes statute ben made sea rome space xx yeares condempned abolished uery many supposed parliament king phillip shuld haue ben crowned herein nothing done beginninge february fiue condemned london suffer would returne romish religion men excellent learning ihon hoper bishop glocester ihon bradford laurece fiue codend london gospell saunders rolland tailler doctoure ciuil law ihon rogers burned london taught reast caried euery man home glocester manchester couentry hadley ended liues like punishment right constantly little also bishoppe saint dauid condemned sent home suffer wrytten englad ambassadoures woulde go rome name whole realme shuld geue bishop thankes hys greate clemecy hathe shewed towardes promise also henceforth al obedience fidelitye v daye february king ferdinando though verye fewe prince beginneth treaty auspurge selues knowe howe waightye neadefull cause emperoure appoynted conuention first wuolmes citye begin middes nouember dede request aduise brother wished yt matter might haue ben comenced time howe puttinge thinges ordre home absence thinges mighte well gouerned neare ennemye resisted case made anye enterprise impeched letted notwithstandinge xxix nouember came hither laste consulte common wealth thinge also emperoure desireth chiefly wit euer cocerneth goddes glorye tranquillitye empire might common consente determined much hath bene alwais themperors dilligence studye paine care zeale hath common country publicke quiet offence taken away religion might established wel tried knowen others also decree made two laste assembles nedeth declaration euer also promised time perfourmed dede pernitious co motion well ciuill foreine haue beyond al expectation chau ced sence holsome decree onlye letted disturbed also taken away greate damage common weale manifest men nedeth rehersall herein emperour blamed gaue none occasion offence vnto man hath alwais dealt vprightlye constantlye whatsoeuer sclaunder aduersaries hath chiefly respecte common profit neither doubteth also beleue ye hold clearged behalf wher therfore remeadye euils themperor hath called counsell certenly purposed haue ben present self whole treatye deteined sicknesse affaire could yet neuerthelesse would thing longer delaied thintent verely bothe euill increasing might restrained mighte duetye country loueth aboue thinges wherfore hath made uicegerent geuen ful authoritye together maye deuise meanes bothe honourable also profitable common weale purpose hathe sente certen men ioyned commission treat chief principal matter shalbe concerning religion long dissention hath ben head welspringe tumultes misery many yeares manye thousandes haue loste oulye liues also soul eternal saluation altogether long manifestly known neadeth declaration doubtles lamentable heauy sight al one baptime name empire laguage shuld thus torn sodre professio ye faith many hundreth yeares haue receiued elder deliuered hand hand case much greuous ariseth daily one sect two diuers whilest euery man wil maintain opinion whiche thinge doubtlesse bothe reproche god breaketh bonde charity disturbeth mennes mindes sort vulgare people knoweth world beleue greatest mischief greate erroures many little little growe vp found diuers wel chiefest nobility others setting cocke houpe beleue nothinge neither regard reason honesty thing consciece doth prescribe done great hinderaunce daunger innocent youthe certainly chiefly lamented germanye hath manye yeares chief praise religion vertue shuld abased far degenerate mighte compared heathen people old time neither oughte preferred daye turkes also barbarian thys poynte thoughte one whit better hath bene redresse made hitherto great enormity althoughe many conuentions haue bene therefore fewe men cared whome best became remeadye partlye wincked therat partly seruing time respect priuate commoditye cause euer liuinge god hathe longe time nowe plaged germany certaine state priuately diuers calamity muche region time past nombre people excelled strengthe valeauntnesse hable easily repulse foraine violence rent torne dissentions warres commotion well ciuill foreines greate daunger tendeth vtter destruction excepte god wonderfullye preserue therfore neadfull euery magistrate indeuor part herein duetie haue especiall regarde cause religion wherein bothe god honoure honestye life also conteined moreouer ther hath benmo way one deuised appease religion vniuersall free godlye counsell mighte semed alwaies beginning emperor also vnto best waye much matter faith apperteineth one people also vnto al nation christendome must doubtlesse called yt vice soeuer place may reformed taken away therfore emperor duetie theyr request also labor waye vttermost power length brought passe counsell oftner called sometimes also commenced impediment ther euerye time frute returned common wealth doth leaue place doubting many whiche either counsel selues hadde deputy know matter well inough contente ordre counsell maye repared take place thing verely aboue others wished almighty god assent thervnto willingly also apply thing study faith dilligence dede thing consulted cause wer let impediment might auoided taken awaye tumultes warre tempest common wealthe shall thincke mete differred vntil time quiet content godly tollerable way debated meane season people state may liue peaceably kept vnder honest discipline glorye god alwaies safe conscience former yeares dede ofttimes mention made counsell prouinciall thoughe fit conueniente oure purpose much bothe name manner fourme thereof ouretime hath opinion bene much knowen accustomed determine nothing therof present third way meanes hath bene diuers time assaied talcke conference learned men hath commen small profit yet well perceiued many chiefest poyntes might haue bene reconciled case matter bene handled wyth godlye zeale respecte priuate commoditye either side thinge neuerthelesse woulde manne shoulde thincke spoken iniurye waye therfore muste take deliberation also themperors deuise purpose touchinge matter together mente good faith otherwise taken former yeares small thanke either partie yet doth againe shall thincke good mislike party also treat sincerely affection laid part obstinacy set side haue theyr eies goddes glorye onlye common saluation men shew herein faith dilligence perceiue none way present conuenient case haue anye thing mete purpose shall lawful declare part consultation concerninge peace whan certen yeres past lawes made hereof themperor supposed well prouided common quiet thend declareth sufficiently foresene might condempne outlawe rebel seditious parson vnlesse first cited appere due order iudgement conuicted meane season hauing time space afflicte diuers without desert also prouided former actes man suffred iniury force inuaded next neighbor assist vnknowen impedimentes haue chaunced therfore must consult way diligently two poyntes law maye amended bothe vnquiet troublesome person may made feard suche faithfull thempire may know assuredly shal want aid force violence thing may done much commodiously foundation hereof laid late woormes frankfurt wherfore shal wel follow consultation begon bring end exorteth moreouer consult establishing iudgemet imperiall publicke contribution coyne politicke thinges hitherto applye deuises meanes domesticall euils dissentions tumultes sedition force may taken awaye cleane roted oute herein consider chiefly state thempire se greate daunger germany standeth reason cruell turke ennemies also nothing lesse turke seke ye destruction thempire let ponder therfore commodity receiue discordes domesticall euils vndoutedly haue craftelye raised supported dissention state might accomplish theyr gready lust soden inuasion might bring al men subiection bondage nation haue bene vanquished suppla ted ought warninge take hede selues take counsel wherby present tempest ruine country may blowen ouer empire consiste perseuer full strengthe authoritye foraine violence time paste nowe also maye manfullye valeauntly repulsed euer emperoure able bothe theyr aide counsell right gladlye suche sorte men maye vnderstande intier loue beare common countrye let perswade selues moste assured time oration kinge fardinando published throughoute germanye wrytten self time sondry place exiled boheme two hundreth minister churche minister exiled boheme signified also bi letter cardinal morone shuld com fro rome counsell thempire would assay like germany cardinall poole already brought passe england thought assuredly recoueringe england bishop rome client conceiued wonderful hope mindes much thing lucky successe therfore thought el neuer yt god theyr side maintained iuste cause neither theyr church could conuict error thus chiefly beleued least pretended whan send ambassadours germany intent acknowledge faut theyrs may helpe succor saye mennes infirmity end february ihon albert duke megelburge said league duke moris henry duke brunswicke afflicted sore yere time kept war saxonie marieth daughter albert duke pruisse whan proceded thus farre aduertised oute england fiue whome spake little bradford althoughe condempned reserued prison mindes manye constancy reaste suffered wer wonderfully astonied amased xxvi booke sledaines commentary concerning state religion common weale reigne empyre charles fyfte argument xxvj booke england brought againe subiection bishop rome wrytinge se te indulgence duke saxon ambassadoures maketh purgation ferdinando excuseth selfe thassemble minister churche expulsed oute boheme comforted wrytinges godly learned men townes taken french men prince germany mete enter also league pope iuly dead immedidiatly mercellus chosen stead dieth paul fourth name founder sectes iesuites succedeth whilest sene yelde emperoure cardinall poole solliciteth themperor french kinge vnto peace vaine quene england therin meane persecuting cruelly true christian time rose tumultes geneua lucerues senate paris indeuoureth mitigate call proclamation setforth french king true christian thinges done rome bishop norman spaniardos uulpian taken french men dissention amonges minister churche concerning lordes supper whilest compact made lordship chattes themperor going spain committeth gouernment sonne thinges doue thassemble thempire concerninge religion extraordinary wryting papistes thanswer also ferdinando protestantes bothe decrec insued vpon parlament state england austriche ambassadoures requiringe mighte permitted haue true religion denied diuers answer fardinando sue baine manner time bauarians sollicite theyr duke like matter vaine lengthe truce taken betwixte emperoure frenche kinge duke prusse imbrasing confession auspurge therror dsiander quenched time appeared blasinge starre matter marque albert heard tharchbishop cantorbury openly constantly professyng true religion burnt pope seketh priuelye infringe disseuer confession auspurge cardinall auspurge accused treason purgeth self declaring plainly nature faction suspition conspiracye englande brodeth trouble increaseth crueltye againste faithfull xiij burnte together stake fardinando alledgeth reuoltinge transtiuania diuers townes also turke ready inuade cause lettes come thassemble hitherto oft differred themperor length taketh shipping spaine leauing soone gouernor lowe country sleidan departeth thys life england submitted self againe bishop rome hathe bene shewed ioy rome england reduced yt romishe church former boke newes wonderfull expedition broughte rome greate ioye rose citye te deum song euery church christmasse euen bishoppe sendeth forth wryting since lately heard saith england many yeares nowe separated plucked body church vnmeasurable mercye god broughte againe communion church obedience sea rome singuler dilligence fidelitye trauell industrye kinge phillip mary wife cardinall poole toke greate pleasure minde also reason gaue thankes vnto god hartely could omitted nothing frute profit gladnesse might redound whole city like father gospel mentioneth hauing recouered sonne lost reioyseth exceadingly priuately glad minde also inuiteth others feasting making good cheare together euen verely thintent al world may vnderstand great ioy gladnes common thanckes praiers made therfore power yt indulgeces graunted pope conuersion englande haue permit euery man generall maye chuse priest list vnto may confesse sinnes rightly geue priest authority yt may forgeue al manner sinnes neuer greuous euen whiche reserued power alone wonte excepted name may remit trespasse paine also sinnes due may impose satisfaction behoueth may release vowes except chastity religion yet recompensed worke yea trusting vpon god mercye intercession sainctes peter paule graunt full remission sinnes wont geuen euery fifty yeare humble hart conuert god wholy confessing sinnes whan shall vnderstande indulgence setforth v twise thrise weke fast geue almose vse godly exercise receiue sacrament thanckes geuing praiers vnto god ye light countenance would illumine walke darknesse would geue peace moue heartes kinges concord great benefite graunt also hindred either reason age sicknesse performe thinges said intent oure wrytinges may euery knowne charge commaund patriarch archbishop suche like sone shall haue receiued copy cause published euery man prouince since gift fre set forth without gain last boke shewed blassenburge head castell marque albert wherin hope whole country co sisted surrendry taken time least recouered mighte geue occasion displeasure aduersaries subuert rase ground without greate displeasure house brandenburge marque kinred ferdinando king romaine came fro home also commen auspurge assemble messagers letter exhorted prince make haste come thither parson last boke hath ben said chiefly sollicited prince elector saxony come auspurge excused selfe could come namely state saxony quiet sending ambassadours thither excuseth matter againe occasion falling mention turk sheweth pearill germany standeth time past mightye feared others almost destitute void strength hauing receiued many displeasure plague euill much worse amonge state greate alienation mindes distrust amonges selues emperour self remeadye disease omitted kind diligence yet yt al labour hitherto hath ben taken vain mind men bitterly exasperated alwais set open displeasure vnneth hope reconcilement yeares past brother moris ordained certain ceremony thing indifferet kept still church dominion commaundement little force also taunted libel bitter raylings many much power confirm vnles would bring self daunger therfore many afraid attempted thingin behalf thother side contrary part impugn doctrin professed auspurge little thincke establish godly lawfull reformation known wel inough doings former time matter attempted ether talk conference el counsel consideringe therefore much labour taken counsel holden waye concorde found god peranenture willinge reuenginge oure sinnes besecheth earnestlye booke conteineth christen doctrin time past exhibited auspurge would take euill wicked boke know certenty pure godlye wrytinge shewe vnto v sonne god authoure saluation whiche doctrine dothe plainly agree thauncient churche foure chiefe counsel whiche teacheth fetteth forthe true christen worckes exhorteth people shew obedience magistrate wherefore case sure peace assemble maye established doubte emperoure maye haue greate aide germanye againste turke elsse protestauntes religion manye theim dede borne broughte vp therein perseuer constantlye religion vnlesse peace may may comprise bothe religion also churche goodes matter manye time hathe bene shoulde differred assemble delaied daye daye people lefte doutfull state thinges vncertaine howe pacientlye menne woulde take though prince quiet duety shewe obedience yet maye menne meaner baser sort may raise tumulte maye pretende vncertaintye state feare pearill religion especiallye place whiche geue oportunitye attempte suche thinges since therefore case empire suche earnestlye requireth prouide common tranquillity muche hathe full authoritye emperoure determine late yeares condition propounded brother moris passawe case controuersy religion mighte reconciled yet neuerthelesse assured peace might til thing might throughli appeased although emperor would admit condition saide apperteined thestates empire yet muche time reproued expresse woordes added composition woulde see counsell matter shoulde bee handeled indifferentlye neyther shoulde anye crafte vsed voice concerning religio trusteth cause moue behalfe whiche tyme passawe state also sone counsel ginneth perswade peace thambassadours spoken effect fourth daye february nexte daye king ferdinando propoundeth state suche sorte shewed ye last boke minister ye churche driuen lande boheme learned men meissen wittemberge amongest others melachthon melancthon comforteth ye minister boheme comfort epistle shew craft co trary part affirmed kept necessary order churche whiche either receiued order byshops hande wynes could minister sacramentes cause expulsion fayned seme haue desire oppresse ye true doctrine men shewe starke tyrany maried priestes put holy ministery satha authour prohiting matrimony euidet ye scripture ought seke ordeined byshops yt open ennemies gospell defende idol fellowship hath pure doctrine therfore hath keyes kingdome heauen absurde dau gerouse shepeheardes ordeined wolues churche haue alwayes right chouse mete minister decree counsell nice chosen tried haue bene confirmed gouerned godly congregation maner bee nowe also obserued therfore sclaunder saye disturbe breake order since therfore matter true professing gospell expulsed ought take calamitie muche moderatly god wyll fayle tyme ready theyr next church shewe loue hospitalitie frenche men ides deceber yeare conduit brissake taken eporedia towne towne cassalle taken frenchman alpes water durie yeare third daye marche intercept town casale nere vnto ye poo wherin garrison spaniardes almaynes vpon sodayne fewe dayes castell also afterwarde bringe many thinges subiection amongest others thei rase make euen groud ualence saluadore sixt day marche august duke saxony ioachim marque brandeburg prince electours sonnes also assemble prince saxonie numburge duke iohn fridericke lantgraue certen prince thesame countrie assemble numburg vpon riuer sale renew league inheritauce whiche betwixt house saxon brandeburg hessia shewed xxiiii boke also determine would sticke constantly ye cofession auspurg least suspicion arise new secret cousell fift day came thether signifie cause assemble ye emperour wryting former yeare time compact made betwene augustus iohn fridericke duke saxonie also agreed vpon old familiar leage letter prince saxony themp renewed witte league whiche made hondreth yeres since established lawe therfore yt haue met cause league profitable elder people likewyse thei trusted yt shuld com luckely passe since thei sought nothing el peace traquillitie ye displeasure man moreouer yt maner aucesters haue excepted highnes brother king romains intende priuatly kepe mutual amitie amongest selues wil also openly doe dutie requireth may become obedient prince thempire yt religion wil procede limited confession auspurg much coteined chief article ye christian doctrine wicked sedicious opinion found therin thei wil god grace perseuer thesame doctrine neither wil fayle also co mon welth germany far forth thei able trauel counsel treasure much time moste quiet auoiding discomoditie abide home haue sent ambassadours thasseblee thempire haue comaundemet refer al counsel doings vnto peace yt neither religio ciuile cause force violece feared ye peace established shal occasion yt cotrouersies may ye better appeased state doubtles ye comon welth yt great nede ioine together force mindes wyder entrie set open ye turkes inuade v know wel enough howe greatly desireth sone may sufficiet army might prepared repres thennemies violence wherfore case peace might established ther doubt state thempire wold gladly imploy substaunce vpon war verely hitherto reason sondry tumultes ciuile discordeshath bene omitted wil alwaies ready haue comaunded ambassadours offer thinges name counsel thesame day write king ferdinado maner ye effect said ye duke august ambassadours vrge copact passawe shew desirous peace thei comend doctrine cofessed ausperge exhort confirme peace also pray wold geue credit haply seke disturbe quiet germany ides march archbyshop metz dieth archbishop mentz departed life saied haue bene counsel trent put flight marque albert daniel bredel succedeth viii day yt byshop mentz ye xxiii day march death pope iuly third dieth pope iuly third bicause easely beyond al expectatio recouered england thought haue co ceaued also woderful hope germany therfor sent thither cardinal morone next day dead came cousell thempire auspurg eight day hearing newes therof ye last day march departeth thence againe truckesse cardinal auspurg spedeth electio rome cardinal wer rome tarieng rest made hast ix day april proclaime pope marcellus secod name marcellus ye second chose sent ambassadour cardinal farnese ye emperour paul third shewed xiii boke cardinal auspurg fewe day went rome letter sent senate prince ambassadours sheweth desireth dede peace al meanes wise cosent dignitie sea apostolique olde religion defaced neuer permitte meane time sene nowe space eight moneths wit euen time peter strosse sene rendre selues themp receiued ouerthrowe shewed last boke besieged ye power themperour cosmus duke florence driuen want thinges ayde appered ye xxi daye aprill yelde theselues theperour ruled garrison soldiours lieftenaunt themperours armie marque marignane twyse famous policie war thre yeres since time thayde french king spanyardes beinge discomfited rased castell sene sending ambassadours gaue kinge harty thankes could deuise time forewarde co mended tuition selues marcellus second newly created pope xxii daye marcellus ye second dieth creation night yt goeth first may chau ged life death alitle wercome citie forduties sake salute hercules duke farrare guy ubalde duke urbine preueted others neuerthelesse haue come cardinal assembled conclaue xxiii day may proclame cardinal theatine pope thesame iohn peter naples deane college gentleman borne noble house carastes man aunciet yeares notably learned chaunging name called self paul fourth paul third chosen nomber cardinal self began paule fourth certen new secte whiche called iesuites haue nestled italy also certen place germany log created nephew brother sonne secte iesuites cardinal man warre chief captayne seruing moste part frenche kyng shewed last boke poole thenglish cardinal went themperour french king sollicite moue trauell cardinall poole make peace betwene perour frech king peace handled cause wordes writinges amongest thinges vsed perswade whilest saith kepe ciuile war turke doeth much inlarge dominion hauing wonne sea land two strong holdes belgrade rhodes hath made way open offen hath possession tonowa god stired vp king persia aduersary bee thought might haue already subdued self al prouinces christendom selfsame occasion haue euil christias also increased sondry place much deprauation corruptio al discipline aswel ecclesiastical ciuile power great inough suppresse declare welenough many rebellion stired vp euery duty religion neglected heresy scismes meane time spring vp increased place ye ought consider saith ar prince christen beligion albeit god hathe permitted sathan thauthour euil altogether yt might sift churche wynnowe like wheate styre vp war amongst two ye chiefest moste noble mebers ye church yet hath suffred wickednes prophane ciuile matter religion hath kept sounde one opinion annexed body churche el coulde hardly made againe concorde betwixt many prince haue reuolted churche thennemy mankinde hath attempted many thinges yet hath god moste benignely loked vpon hath made enter prises frustrate wherby moste certen token goodnes clemencie towardes sheweth wil length vse ministerie wil ioyne together vicar earth intent verely hurtful dissentions may taken way well state ciuile sacred peace may restored al many like thiges brought poole threatening also wrath geaunce god vnlesse leaue releaue miserie ye afflicted people although preuailed nothing yet whilest matter went forwarde englande holdeth matter legth brought point emperour frenche king refused sende ambassadours treatie peace quene englande meane matter appointeth fit mete place myddes place treaty peace chosen quene england playne betwyxt caleis arde grauelyn townes englyshe frenche flemishe dominion set treangle intrenchynge rounde aboute wyth ditch buylded foure pauilions sommer house deede yet fyne fitte pourpose place therfore xxiii daye maye yeare ambassadours mete emperour amongest others came byshop arras frenche kyng cardinal loraine conestable england came peacemaker cardinall poole bishop wynchester chauncelour erle arondell lorde paget brute blowe abroade far nere styred vp diuerse expectation iudgementes men amongest chiefly vnto whome controuersies vnknowen came question dukedome millan burgundy sauoye piedmont corsica nauerne loraine lande luke city tully uirodone metz matter long much debated amongst thinges last englishe intercessours sayde certen controuersies ought referred hearing generall counsell departed nothyng finished kyng ferdinando state empire sendinge letter emperour ye fourth ides iune praied treatie peace would haue consideratio thinges whiche kyng fraunce taken empire therfore nothing done emperour empe letter state empire wryting againe state xv day duty saith ryght acceptable moued calamity thinges whiche mine also publique ennemy empire hath afflicted doubtles careful suche thinges might restored fourmer estate epistle deliuered inioyned mine ambassadours chief counsellours sent treate peace amongest thinges handle moste diligently nother herein relent thyng although wayes meanes concorde set open v thought comon quiet would haue dealte obstinatly yet time broken without good done neuerthelesse better stay christendome refuse peace vpon reasonable condition hitherto haue bene propounded occasio shall serue wyll wholy indeuour thinges may restored empire may better state hereafter emperour little sent duke alba lumbardie might make warre ferdinando duke alba sent millan gonzaga discharged selfe office retourning home flaunders liued priuate life many monethes bene report dede certen chifly tyme ye quene englande childe nere time expectation vain also began burne againe englande bradforde whome ende xxv booke sayde bradforde burnt englande fewe monethes condemned caried againe pryson last burnt amongest others ende moneth may iohn fridericke eldest sonne duke iohn fridericke toke wyfe agnes iohn friderick thelect sonne marieth lantgraues daughter whiche bene wyfe duke maurice thither came many prince whiche vpon occasion also consulted againe matter numburge maner tyme lady iane emperours mother departed lyfe kyng ferdinando kept funerall auspurge empe mother dieth certen tumult night raysed geneua certen senatours thought bring gouernment tumult raised geneua citie faction chiefly hated caluine persecutio come thither fraunce sought expulse running vp downe night season sondry place token watche worde cried frencheme vp harnesse citie betrayed kept selues house matter length appeased certen executed many saued selues flight cause would haue expulsed french men straungers amongest others many late chosen nomber citezens wherby sawe owne force weakened nomber part increased turkes nauie certen former yeares nowe also sayled tuscane sea threatening hetruria wherfore euer went ioyned frenche nauie marque maarignane lieftenaunt emperours armie inuaded porte hercules kept frenchemen force souldiours wynneth castell putting porte hereules taken imperial plubine besieged turkes garrison ye sworde ides iune turkes afterwarde besiege towne plumbine ouerthrowe matter would succede thei attempt ilua ilande duke florence vayne also certen politicke lawes set foorth metz whiche citie frenche kyng garrison gouernour also iudge execute iustice wrytten amongest thinges brother sister vncle tutour gardien bawed mayde woman haue rynge iron put necke shall openly vse suche practise subiect iniuries rebuke men let beaten roddes bannished father mother shall lyke shal lose head many men marueled thinges set forth vnaccustomed vice euery vsed semed muche forboden shewed howe corrupt maners tyme hereof may easely gathered controuersie hath nowe many yeares controuersie dominion ye chattes vene betwixt lantgraue william erle nassow lorship chattes haue spoken heretofore oftener tha wherfore intent last ende might made least inconuenience might arrise therof certen prince intreate matter indifferent arbitrers appointe daye wormes first iuly paulsgraue prince electour christopher duke wirteberg william duke cleaue latgraue sent thither william eldest sonne condition propounded certe tyme debated last permitted deliberatio certen tyme appointed matter ye meane season frenchemen intent might haue victualles readines plucke downe many village countrie mountfarrate least ennemie possesse casale brought distresse partes towne uulpiane great force estimatio uulpian vitayled kept spaniardes newe comming duke alba great power gathered towne vitayled tyme also frenchemen vitayled maryburge taken yeare flaunders kept emperour frenche kyng moued counsell set maryburg vnailed forth proclamation wherby commaunded officer suche ecclesiastical iudges inquisitours fayth condene greatnes fault freche kinges proclamation co demned yt inquisitours without delaye respecte appealyng put death cardinall lorayne deliuered proclamation senate paris old custome allowed set forth might registred common recordes somewhat astonied newnes ye thing helpe appealing take away require time take deliberatio sending king ambassadours opinion shalbe declared place towne rhaetia next italy called lucarne whiche belongeth common citie heluetians citezens towne required swiss lucernates require yt swiss doctrine gospell would permitte haue doctrine gospell muche religion diuerse varied sentence thought mete graunte requeste others ought permitted lyke ciuile tumulte arise therof ende voice preuailed wherby decreed remayne religion elder lawfull would go dwel el founde many whiche leauing house went zurick whiche citie dede receiued dealt liberally time english ambassadours sent pope name whole realme shewed ende laste booke retourne rome homewarde pope allowed well enough al thinges retourned repentaunce craued pardon churche goodes restored saide wyse suffered amogest ambassadours byshop ely king denmarke nauie time sailing nauie kinge demarke towardes north made men talke diuersly said done emperours counsell mynded put kinges sonne brother possession scotlande others sayde prepared vse frenche kyng others cause emperour king philip sonne whose power waxed great reason englande straye might restrayned therfore city sea coaste thought also haue borne charge nauie log great expectation rumour vanished away preparation found made pirate ye state rome troublesome yt pope hauing sanstorian camillus cardinalles led pryson coceiued suspicion certen noble prouided garrison placing soldiours citie committed ssortia cardinall sanflorian camillus house columnois prison muche emperours part many men thought went greater matter suspicion increased tyme required duke florece emperours client wonderous great summe mony whiche clement seuenth lent alexander medices lately iuly third lent siege sene captiue cardinalles length putting suerties inlarged spanishe flete tyme came towardes flaunders laden kynde marchaundise came vpo spanishe flete intercepted french coastes normandie frenchemen whiche knewe long set vpon great force fight conflicte terrible shippes sunke burnte either parte many loste wherof weapon others fire many swallowed vp billowes perishe frenche men caried away certen shippes king philip came england father brusselles toke depe hauon whence came monthe august whereas end moneth kyng philip sayling englande flaunders came emperour father brusselles accompanied noble englande truckesins cardinall auspurge vniuersitie erected dillinge fewe yeares past founded uniuersitie dillinge towne situated vpon riuer danubius wyll permission pope iuly thirde graunted publique bull exceading great fredoms priuileges wryting set forth print declareth hither therfore amonges came whome themperour many yeares vsed ghostly father confessour terme peter asot spaniarde blacke freer yeare began contrary wryting impugne booke conteyning boke peter asot co fession duke wirtemberge christen doctrine boke christopher duke wirtemberge sent ambassadours father counsell trent sayde whiche also afrayde dedicate duke iohn brentius time aunswereth large confuteth sophisticall reason whiche boke brentius uergerius afterwarde translated italian ende men owne nation might vnderstande thing came controuersie whether parte handled scripture purely sincerely ides september george counte mountpelicarte george erle mount pelicarte marieth yt lantgraues daughter vncle duke wirtemberge maried lady barbara lantgraues daughter arriuall duke alba lumbardie king fraunce also sendeth thither new ayde many warlike captaines ioyned selues monsour brissake companion peril fortune towne wherof haue spoken called uulpian fortified garrison spaniard great annoyaunce frenche matter seing thence roades made farre taurin intent therfore let might taken away might haue victualle frenchemen towarde ende august besiege al force batter uulpian taken rased frenchman muche harme done receiued length xxii day september take surrendry rase walles towne castell make shape uillage fewe dayes take also towne castell mountcalue taken yt frenchman mountcalue betwixt aste casale dissention hath bene nowe xxx yeares betwixt learned men aboute lordes supper presence christes body began time renewed bokes set forth minister church breme hamborough namely againste controuersie lordes supper renewed yt bremers caluine iohn alascus caluine afterward aunswereth sharpely defendeth cause thesame doeth bullinger iohn alascus also setting forthe booke kyng poole complayneth bewayleth examination made talke coference sentence opinion condemned preiudice verely maner papistes whiche also procede argumentes scripture wyll violence end september augustus duke saxony august prince electour sonne borne sonne borne called magnus godfather fotstone amongest others henry duke brunswicke iohn fridericke lantgraues sonne lawe haue spoken archebyshop cantorbury ridley byshop london hughe latimer howe caried oxforde reasoning diuines condemned therfore kept prison vnto tyme nowe last moneth october ridley olde father latimer burnt archebyshop also ridley latimer burnt england brought forth place execution openly call vpon god mercy lead againe pryson moneth cardinalles lorayne tournon went rome also senate paris whiche cal parliament aunswering king thanswere parliament paris yt kinges proclamatio lutherians whiche cardinall loraine requested mentioned proclamation say whiche came forth foure yeares since moste mighty kyng reserued selfe iudges examination punishment luther heresie neither thinge exceptep vnlesse time required declaration heresie sentence pronounced suche taken order proclamation set forth doth plainly establish contrary submitteth people realme ecclesiasticall iudgement inquisitours meane diminished dignitie wherby excelle men geueth subiectes iust cause grief clerely destitute ar made subiect foreine power herein great deale inconuenience shalbe goodes lyfe health dignitie shall pleasure helpe appealing taken away verely appellation refuge sanctuary innocencie protectour defendour appellation also innocentes yea besides note howe byshops seke authoritie kinges co demne innocentes man hath right ouer people lawe iudgement nowe committed inquisitours byshops officer appellation taken away set open wyndowe make waye euen innocentes might condemned lose body goodes indewed great power witte kinges ful authoritie forget dutie kepe measure tyme shall see euery degree subiecte common persones also noble men prince stande hande howbeit yet meane waye may take iudges shuld heare cause geue sentence obscure opinion determined clergie let also order iudged owne men concerning appellation let wrytyng obteined pope wherby may permitted iudges matter shall come issue iudgement must made suche haue appealed let present certen chosen counsellers ecclesiasticall order suche wante tried fit men inquisition let obserued pope inquisitour doe substitute place vnder prouinces men vpright fame good men byshop doe beare whole charge defendaunt yet matter determined costes required whome behoueth thinges tende ende verely suche maner controuersies may restreyned within certen boundes limites notwithstanding muche appeareth punishement heretickes al though necessary hath hitherto bene thereby brought passe facte detested rather amended moreouer bicause much better remedy disease time geue space whilest may increase lay medicine shalbe law full moste mercifull kyng herein followe maner steppe olde primatiue churche established either fyre sworde diligence bishop euer resiste heretickes whylest preached oftentymes god worde shone example good lyfe since therfore tymes past meane firste confirmed may nowe also reteyned kept would execute whiche lieth rather power verely byshoppes pastours shepe selues gouerne church presently let also inferiour minister againe henceforth suche made byshops able selues teache people substitute deputy steade rote must tilled vpon fou dation must builde may hope well heresy wyll litle litle vanishe away case waye neglected feared least thei wil increase proclamatios euer finally made remedy euer vsed xvi daye october signified thinges king ambassadours letter also prince vmperes controuersie gouernemet chattes mete againe appointed meting prince yt atgrauet matter first bacherach afterwarde sickenes paulsgraue wormes matter dede ended certen somme money agreed vpon whiche lantgraue shoulde paye erle abyde styll possession erle vnlesse mony payd certen time would haue compact vaine action remayne hym whole lantgraue whiche sent sonne thither reiected condition departed matter finished moneth emperour calleth emre charles geueth gouernemet sonns philip brusselles ruler state speaking sicknes sheweth amongest thinges would goe spayne geueth ouer gouernement right power philip sonne exhorteth dutie newes spred abroade ouer al europe far nere nauie prepared day appointed iourney ides nouember litle litle brute waxed colde wynter hande sayde nauigation differred next sommer nowe must come counsell empire matter treate kyng ferdinando fifte daye february propounded sayde ende laste booke many came slowly began nonas marche laste ambassadours prince electours doe consulte matter first treate although many yet doe consente laste treate fyrste religion also thought mete senate prynces city muche debatynge agreed geue peace religion thynge came chiefly controuersie whether peace geuen religion protestauntes woulde haue lawefull men indifferently followe theyr doctrine aduersaries muche contention resiste sayde permitted either city receiued decree auspurge made seuen yeare concerning religion yet whole state clergie yf byshoppe abbot woulde chaunge hys religion woulde haue hym remoued substitute place therfore contention sharpe protestauntes alledged cause purpose promesses god well olde newe testament whiche conteine saluation doe apperteine generally vnto men therfore lawfull include within certen limites brynge restreinte least shutte bothe selues others kyngdome heauen neither turke iewe zeale would bee glad bringe men owne religion howe muche ought doe whome god hath earnestly straightly charged wherfore able proue men case oughte haue libertie graunted bothe holy scripture also decree father counselles howe whiche take vpon title olde catholique religion without great dishonour god handle religion abuse churche goodes neuerthelesse establishe peace permitte may kepe styll lawes rite ceremony inioye goodes landes possession customes rightes priuileges tyll suche tyme dissention religion accorded wherfore allowe shoulde prescribe condition byshoppes come passe selues shoulde bounde impugne approuers felowes owne religion theyr great dishonour shoulde condemne owne cause saye graunte religion doctryne worthy churche goodes goodes haue bene hetherto applied amisse church ministeries also confesse theyr wicked doctrine ministerie grounded vpon goddes worde churche goodes consecrated fylthie lyfe theyrs lawes ceremony howe greate assence woulde thynge ingender yf shoulde maynteyne cause lyuynges whyche doe perfourme profitable necessary dutie churche shoulde betraye religion oughte v bee moste set aduersaryes amonges thinges saide clergie permitted alter religion would come passe byshoprikes suche like college made prophane litle litle plucked away churche come handes prince made inheritaunce affirme neuer intet haue respect called olde foundation might imployed true v goodes might annexed church euer take awaye doubtes promise put good assuraunce byshoprikes college soeuer religion shall altered part goodes alienated death resignation byshop free election administration permitted college muche reasoning could agree exhibite partes kyng ferdinando reason comprised wrytinge requeste hym wold fynde waye ides iune proceded slowly cause wherof many thought conclusion peace betwene emperour frenche kyng loked thought make litle either parte papistes made extraordinary wryting wrytinge papistes requestes yt protestauntes vehement byting intent myght set forth matter firste saye protestauntes haue propounded fiue condition first catholiques allowe doctrine many yeares past time also sone sprag vp ordinary magistrate hath bene alwayes condened secondly sacrilege space xxx whole yeres haue co mitted ratified allowed neither law godly lawful meanes church may recouer yt goodes wold also haue peace made notwithstading forboden haue copany moreouer thei might place ye college church archbishop prelate wicked minister set forth dotestable condened doctrine abolish true seruice ceremony ye church bring new wicked place may norish false preacher ye churche goodes directly tholde lawes custome churche lawefull persones well ecclesiastical ciuile yet followe catholique religio reuolt fro true religion come followe lore finally prince byshops reuolt syde shall concerne persone must apperteine people also subiecte gouernement goodes whole ecclesiasticall iurisdiction nowe although thinges striue lawes god man albeit thei contrary othe themperour king al prelate muche catholiques may conueniently receiue vnlesse would breake fayeth promesse yet much sticke obstinatly pourpose threaten force also catholiques length
