contented farre forth ought pacification passawe haue declared sufficiently senate empire shewyng graunt libertie chaunging religion indifferently men come passe empire shoulde broughte desolation hyghe top dignitie taken away germany dutie archebyshops prelate office archebysh permitte religion condemned also admonishe put feare byshoppes suche others yea vnlearned ready reuolte suche continue errour present catholique romishe churche maner hath euer since tyme apostels bene obserued proued sondry testimony counselles chiefly calcedonie neyther ought man thinke suche reuolte left owne conscience thinges concerne fayth euery man ought permitted haue co science free departeth commo consent churche ought punished restreyned case obeie must excommunicated example counselles whiche accompted chief whiche condemned arrius macedonius nestorius eutyches dede counsell calcedonie deposed dioscorides maynteyner eutyches byshoprike sayde euery man ought haue iudgement conscience free neyther christe apostle euer compelle beleue yea many went awaye christe none holden wyll verely grounded vpon foundation confuted saint augustine large two hondreth fourth epistle free byshoppes forsaking catholique religion reuolte wyll relinquishe theyr byshoprike wyll saye doe saufe conscience wyll desyre ayde protestautes wyll assiste mainteining state keping people religion done doubt wyl take hande defende wil saye doe dutie end may haue gouernment also possession good wher men saye bounde admitte fellowes religio exclude man kyngdome heauen doth excuse one fayth whiche christian ought professe obserue faith tymes past emperours kynges prince ruler empire people also confirmed othe uerely catholique faith selfe germany beginning vnto time haue followed excepted haue reuolted wherfore nothing made newe thynges ought referred fayth mynde subdued may obeye catholique churche doeth otherwise taketh selfe priuate religion vnlesse obeye admonishementes ought byshop excommunicated remoued function goodes also ought ciuile magistrate published neither suffered within limites empire libertie licenciousnes religion father haue alwayes reiected certen confusion faith made lawe thinges euer determined cousels matter faith shuld reasoned called doubt lawful none ordeine propounde thing cotrary history teache v time ualentinian themperour admitted kinde sectes trouble arose shuld receiued yt whosoeuer dissenteth fro ye catholique faith shuld excused conscience anabaptistes zwinglians schuuenchfeldians suche like also excused peace coprised saye promesses god wherby promiseth v euerlasting life apperteine men generall neither ought restreined though promesses apperteined whiche profession thing far otherwyse tyme shall swarue communion churche excluded kingdom heaue euen iudgement saluation churche howe kyngdome heauen belonge whiche reiecte sacramentes churche contemne ordeining priestes vnto whome christe hathe geuen power binde lose priestes consecrated amonges howe obteyne remission synnes except sinnes forgeuen shall made partaker heauenly kingdome therfore promise apperteine rather thought nomber whome christe sayeth knoweth bragge able proue howe catholiques sondry abuse religion churche goodes let v see thing herein blamed holy scripture lawes father counselles churche goodes ought distributed byshops minister churche imployed vpon poore vpon reparation thing require vpon raunsomyng kept prysoners turkes barbarian uerely custome hath continued thousand thre hondreth yeares since goodes shoulde bee imployed godly minister v whiche sorte saye masse shewe god worde repare builde church fynde pore men also monkes freers nunnes putting certen byshops make newe prophane ciuile officer vnto whome geue small portion possible ioyne minister whiche bring ye sely people errour whilest contemne sound doctrine minister people sacrament whole bread dede consecrated witte creature place creatour vnder colour true worshipping committe idolatrie saye henceforth wyll imploye churche goodes aboute none matter vse scholes wyll conuert part therof selues well let vse catholique religion polluted vtterly oppressed vse shall great deale worse goodes bestowed prophane matter cause therfore lawefull catholiques allowe condition wrytten wryting sayed extraordinary priuatly made protestautes aduertised hereof write answer protestauntes yt wryting papistes first shewe true doctrine verely whiche conteined wrytinges prophetes apostle secondly declare muche doctrine papistes differeth whiche haue many wayes polluted lordes supper whiche haue brought filthie errours purgatory praying dead whiche take awaye denie remission sinnes whilest saye must alwayes doubte grace god whiche muche dishonour matrimonie instituted god detestable horrible crime defiled senglenes lyfe eue vice saint paule rehearseth thinges may clerely appeare haue forsaken true religion seing suche ecclesiasticall persones either haue nowe already el hereafter shall imbrace pure doctrine neglected touching churche goodes thinges maruelously defiled also truthe benefice geuen dutie considered diligently sorte office priest byshop consideration scholes must also euen tyme ye prophetes maner hath euer remayned nowe prelate church seke chiefly suche thinges due ministrs churche teacher schollers scholes almouse house hospitalles imploye v may liue al voluptuousnes thei abbey colledges doeth byshop represent great prince taking first possessio byshoprike entreth citie two thousand horseman thinges dede none doe dutie mynde conscience obiecte sacrilege extortion others doctrine dede condemned freers wickednes yt perswade reade wrytings pope rabble condemne despise maruell maner christe doctrine intreated anna caiphas sorte phariseis byshoppes make oft mention counselles churche lieth power counselles churche propounde commaunde newe doctrine besides whiche left v prophetes christ apostle speake consecrating minister fonde worthy laughed folishe histrionicall annointing maketh nothing ye purpose finally wryting full rayling opprobrious wordes committe god would aunswer thynge fewe wordes wryitng king ferdinando prince state thinges king ferdinado partes requested would shewe waye sayde beginning auguste sendeth ambassadours electours certen prince message howe obeye emperour brother common wealth came auspurge third kale de ianuary without losse hinderaunce owne affaire againe come thither driuen tary long fewe none come could propounde thing matter differred tyll nonas february firste declared cause sommoning sayde assemblee consultation haue wonderfull delayes tenth kalendes iuly aunswere made hym one point deliberation witte peace religion selfe aunswere one mynde diuerse contrary verely fearyng longe admonished diligently woulde haue bene present counsell selues followed aduise herein matter opinion might haue bene brought ende wyshed upon parte whiche concerneth publique peace doe nowe consulte thought dispatched short tyme againe bicause state country requyred presence muche turkes semed attempte new matter threaten sore notwithstanding treateth peace moreouer muche nothing done determined pourpose vnlesse present selues therfore thinketh good counsell differred tyll tyme nowe decree made maner muche absence prynces nothynge determined agreed treatie differed tyll nexte assemblee begynnynge whereof made regensburge aboute kalendes marche yeare followyng prince selues bee present may together emperour hym determine ordeine thynges wherof haue nowe consulted hereafter shall doe meane season pacification passawe remayne full strength muche conteyneth fyrst counsell empyre treated whether generall prouinciall counsell germany el conferrence learned men cause religion ought appeased secondly thynge done common cou sel al state without ordinary power themperour therfore whiche loueth peace concorde hath determined next assemblee exhibitie certen booke compiled reconciling suche matter controuersie none intrapping made ende discorde shuld growe offence might mitigated moreouer thintent selues may better determine whether meane declared boke dissention may taken vp whether way must sought therfore requireth take proroging good part next counsell would come selues example co mon welthe sake hath bene nowe longe tyme prouinces hath chosen place regenspurge bicause iminet dauger turke may depart far owne countrie let aduertise therfore wil herein ende may certen matter shall forslowed vaine expectation better part time passe away hath heretofore oftener one requestes hearde part prince thought good departe peace confirmed al germany great expectation matter since agree nowe better voyces euer time beseche woulde make ende departure intent verely next assemblee might muche expedicion take order determine turkishe matter yet remained touching boke wold exhibite many sayde howe like would come chaunced boke whiche seuen yeares paste wrytten also religion set forth yet freshe memory rayling wordes taunted set forth priuileged emperour haue made cocorde arose occasion therof many offence dissentions ferdinando heard ambassadours eight kalendes september daye kalendes moneth declareth opinion wrytinges partes exhibited amongest matter chief poinct concerneth byshops case chaunge religion forgo office bishop whiche chaunge religion shuld lose promotion goodes also wyll many wordes moueth protestauntes would assente codition sayth taketh nothing doth byshop forsaketh order departeth olde religion benefice promotios may neuerthelesse remaine state wherin instituted whiche thinge agreable ciuile lawe also lawes empire pacification passawe whiche sayeth playne wordes whiche followe olde religion well state ecclesiasticall ciuile molested religion ceremony goodes possession rightes priuileges inioye thinges quietly without interruption man se therfore condition denied whiche apperteineth ende spake may inioye thinges quietly whiche dede release condition come passe suche happely forsake relinquishe holy order auncient religion would kepe styll neuerthelesse office goodes possession neyther lawefull college meane time trie lawe case inconuenience wil come also betwene byshop wyll great good wyll reason according lawes foundation mete persones gouerne rule holy office lawes relinquishe state tha collegers remoue forsee reuolting hurt alone certenly demaunde ought refused wherfore exhorte agayne agayne contende herein amonges thinges ought consider prescribe vnto meane waye kept gouerning suche office college benefice selues haue vsurped yet done minister church dominion whiche breake lawes set forth neglecte dutie lyke greuously euyll taken case would haue suche minister forsake impugne religion reteyned muche greuouse vnto gouernment possession landes goodes left vnto whiche forsake impugne religio thing myght hereof loked debate strife contention foundation therfore thinge nowe hande witte peace selfe meane vtterly taken away eight daye aunswere howe intent prescribe clergie herein muche lesse holy gouernmentes brought desolation nature altered made ciuile prophane wear ignoraut say part empire consisteth matter possession whiche couet deminishe decaye al meanes mainteyne would haue pleased v right well question neuer bene moued haue stande decree fourmer yeares made norinberge regenspurg spiers whiche include peace al parteners co fession auspurge first dede ambassadours thre archebyshops electours wittely consider also doubte began moued others went vnto syde first moued question peraduenture cause doe hath insued therof nowe appereth let chaunced way al ye matter opinio ben brought good ende admitte codicion wer godly weighty cause euery man doeth easely perceiue howe muche contempte hinderaunce religion permitte suche imbrace displaced depriued honour dignitie accompted nomber heretikes first foundation college vice haue crept since wyl passe ouer silence suppose many statute religion assente none ecclesiasticall state religion whiche true christen religion professe doubtles smal offence facte codemne wicked vnworthy state pristes whiche ought chiefly set forth religion seing thus moste mightie kyng beseche waye thinges mynde authoritie haue emperour would suffer part omitted maketh aunswere nothynge graunted sayeth moreouer thinges nowe permitted many yeares could neuer obteined therfore let haue consideration hereof el shall fayne departe without thing finished whiche come passe incouenience arise therof cause blame shuld layde either ye emperour quietly patiently hath handled matter hitherto hath remayned whiche nowe defer longer therfore geueth ten dayes meane time may wryte thinges home prince make direct answer daye came men omitted diligence al others prouided concerning religio might prescribe measure herein ye king emperour doe assent especially since king also released certen thinges hereafter shalbe shewed therfore seuenth kalendes october decree made red openly maner effect doctrine decrewher religio frely permit men protestauntes faith religion emperour king ferdinando residue prince state shall hurte man whole empire wyse neither shall compell man forsake religion ceremony lawes whiche dominion protestauntes haue already ordeined hereafter shall ordeyne commaundemetes meane yet contemne permitte religion free also goodes faculty customes possession rightes peaceably may inioy controuersie also religion appeased none godly frendly quiet meanes like case shall confession auspurg demeane selues towardes emperour king ferdinando rest prince state addicte olde religion well sacred ciuile towardes whole state ecclesiastical college whether euer shal finally remoue dwel ministerie well ordered beneath shall sayde shal permitte religion lawes ceremony possession customes rightes frely neither meane hinder may quietly inioye euer displeasure strife shall arise determined either syde custome lawes empire suche neyther religio comprysed peace archebyshop byshop prelate ecclesiastical persone shall reuolte olde religion shall immediatly ecclesiastical person chaungeth religion shalbe depriued departe byshoprike office benefice also prosites receiueth therof shall lawfull free college whome thing shal ryght custome apperteyne chose substitute place whiche olde religion intent ryghtes foundation election presentation confirmation like may remayne whole quiet possession goodes yet nothinge hereby taken away foresayde reconcilement religion shalbe bicause diuerse state empire progenitours haue taken certen ecclesiasticall gouernementes abbey suche like goodes church haue disposed minister church vpo scholes church goodes al co trouersies ar taken away good v shal troubled sewed law therfore goodes wit belog state thempire others subiecte thempire possession wherof clergie time pacification passawe also shall remayne coprised peace neyther shall lawfull iudges chamber imperiall graunte proces decree thing vsurpinge goodes ecclesiastical iurisdiction exercised take place protestautes religio faith ecclesiasticall lawes shall exercised ye protestauntes rightes lawes ecclesiasticall ministerie remayne suspence stayed moleste nothing tyll controuersie throughly ended taken away al matter concerne religion ceremony lawes ministerie let force exercised olde custome lawe againe goodes customes rightes remaine whole state ecclesiasticall yet whose iurisdictio goodes lose part politicke law cotention religion moreouer yt selfsame goodes necessary ministeries churche parish scholes almouses hospitalles poore sicke people founded time past ye also established mainteined without respect religio whose vse almouse sustenauce imployed fortune strife contention arise reason sustenauce yt measure therof yt bi cosent ye partes arbitrers chosen viewing ye thing within ye space half yeare shall determine make estimate howe much ought decided bestowed vpon suche v ministeries meane season til matter decided yt thet whose part geue suche ayde molested possession loke wont geue bestowe tymes past let geue also till matter determined october nouember parliament holden englande many supposed would haue treated parliamet england coronation king philip nothing propouided quene motioned restoring abbey landes muche pope vrged many noble men gentleman doe possesse wherfore nothing could brought passe quene selfe dede whiche al coulde restored clergie first fruictes tethes benefice tyme parliamet certen biting libelles libelles strowed london sowen abroade london wherin thinges whet people spaniardes yt might haue withdrawen quenes minde fro king philip inquisition made nothing could tried end parliament byshop winchester chauncelour died byshop winchester dieth dropsie whose place substituted doctour heth archebishop yorke bene tymes past archebyshop cantorbury germany thought rightly pure doctrine ye none noueber wife iohn wife iohn friderick dieth friderick lantgraues daughter died whose mariage spoke frauces uenerie duke uenise handled selfe well vytayling citie set france uenery displaced priuate profit tha publique displaced time themperour geuen ouer gouernmet coutries philip sonne sendeth ambassadours chief prince city germany signified yt ambassad prince germany offereth good wil amitie time also ye ambassadours king ferdinado sollicited prince germany much moste present dauger hanged euer turke required al transyluania geue coutrie nature strog fertile ful horseme wold day appointed present selues cousel empire consulte common wealth helde also assemble austriche cousel subiectes cause yt whiche assemblee austriche required religio might permitted fre king differred cousel thempire next regenspurg also toke order shuld uienne ides ianuary next yere marque marignane diyng millan cardinall trent sent lumbardy emperour king philip sonne haue gouernment duke alba made viceroy naples christmas day pope maner createth newe cardinalles amongest others iohn gropper counsellour archebyshop collon whome often mention made fourmer bokes also iohn gropper cardin reinold poole cardinall deacon made priest call began singe masse law full deacon pope lawe beginning moneth ianuary throughout saxonie meissen boheme horrible tempestes thondering lightening thonderboltes whiche dyd muche harme euery especially church moneth uirodure whiche towne swicerlande two mile zuricke night suppertyme fyre bursting one towres church cracked men came running quech came thither ther flame twyse happened one tyme witte fourth daye moneth xiiii daye certen men townes heluetia moued pope go afterwardes rome without great suspicion many kyng philippe beginning newe gouernmet whiche receiued father great pompe solemnitie xviii day ianuary entreth andwerpe chief towne coutrey meane tyme great king philip entreth andwerpe persecution burning englande ides ianuary thabassadours prouinces austriche assemble uienne appointed king oratio graue long declareth great dau ger stode turke iminent therfore doth admonish sone may would helpe hym men mony great outragiouse crueltie might repressed yt lower partes austriche saye thei comaunded thei shuld treate thambassadours austrtche require kynge ferdinando true religio may permitted first religion therfore recite haue done selfsame cause ye space xiiii yeares oft haue intreated put vp supplicatios maner proclamation hath set forth contrary expectatio muche hitherto say al couselles ye turke taken vaine yet could repressed also violence hath farre proceded hauing taken hongary slauonie many townes castels fortes hangeth ouer yt neckes v doubtles thought manifest vengeaunce god whiche plageth v sinne afflicteth v amende life dede afflicteth v vnlesse worde receiued amendement life followe losse lyfe goodes also eternall saluation like insue although whole worlde toke armure ennemie yet long shall remayne state lyfe hope victory rather destruction slaughter euident haue chaunced tyme moste florishynge kyngdomes treated matter also laste assemblee prayed myght compelled thyng conscience referred matter counsell regenspurg may cosider mightie king howe greuouse whiche thyrste health soules differred tyme vncerte meane time mynde angwishe angwyshe perplexitie many thousandes ende life doubtles worde god whiche sauiour iesus christe opened v rule whiche church ought followe case thing cotrary god worde haue crept although grounded great antiquitie must reiected god wilbe honored worshipped selfe prescribeth comaundeth men wene fayne horrible greuous plage reuengeth neglecting comaundemet obseruation me tradition empire fourmer time shewe also freshe domesticall calamity people next v declare therfore moste diliget searche appereth v none remedy manifest errours deprauations brought long since churche caste away pure doctrine may receiued frely preached gether suche administration sacramentes christ selfe institute departe tourne away worde god manifest plaine may haue ofte shewed tymes firste must seke kingdome god whiche done god assisteth v spirite gouerneth counselles doinges ende therfore would deliuer v al daungers would counseller warre enseigne bearer may assiste v battel discomfite thennemies force moste humble earnest wyse beseche highnes euen death christe saluation last iudgement shall abyde muche thing apperteineth perpetuall felicitie child al realme spotted secte may leaue permission remaine pure sincere religion vntyll free generall counsell may inioye benefite peace whiche laste assemblee empyre haue made fellowes confession auspurge seyng baptized christe beseche state condicion worse nother woulde denye v thynge whiche haue graunted diuerse prouinces woulde call proclamation sette forth concerning religion woulde delyuer v thys carefulnes wherwith bounde moreouer beseche woulde set forth proclamation minister church teache wrytinges prophetes apostels maner said doe minister sacramentes molested yet suche schomaisters neither imprisoned banished shall pleade cause lawful iudge thus trust wil extreame daunger doubt god rewarde moste aboundantly also state empire sende ayde haue done hitherto likewise behinde dutie moste willing mindes bestowe geue euer shall apperteine comon defence preseruation coutrie wil throughly satisfie demaudes muche shall lie power habilitie selfsame time ambassadours themperour truce take betwene emperour kynge fraunce frenche king met controuersie coulde finished peace fift day moneth february take truce fiue yeares sea lande well flaunders partes also italy place euery one kepeth possession thinges whiche hath gotten tyme war themperour excepteth exile naples scicilie compriseth pope first place doth also frenche king afterward euery frendes ally maner truce long king caused proclamed throughout fraunce metz also emperour somwhat later cou try brute went pope toke snuffe truce made went afterwarde perswade frenche king breake others thought cotrariwise made chiefly aduise yt might make warre lutherians touching prisoner nothinge could concluded truce amongest whome chiefest duke arescot bourgunnion monmorauce conestables eldest sonne take thre yeres terwin austriche sayde wise answer king ferdinando yt ambassa house austriche day kalendes february put vp supplication king ferdinando wryting king eight day aunswereth speaking first good wyll towardes common wealth common calamitie miserie time god wrath whilest consider saieth way mine owne state place diligently whilest thinke howe haue euer yought hitherto followed preceptes christen catholique churche maner progenitours whome haue receiued religion meaneth emper sigismonde burnte iohn husse discipline deliuered hand surely finde yt may assent whiche require would gladly gratifie people see lawful preiudiciall christe church shoulde alter lawes holsome decree pleasure must rather heare christ comau deth beit much know long experiece occasion great euils bitter contention religion bringeth haue doubtles brother yt emperour bene many yeares wholy occupied might come composition therfore hath matter bene attepted many counsel empyre certein conference learned men mediation hath bene begon twyse counsell trent treatie came good effect doubtles imputed v neither vnknowen diuises craftes matter hindered require pure doctrine benefite peace newly made religion may grauted like heretofore haue kept backe man fro true religion also hereafter well comprised peace people prince meaning decree people shall followe religion prince permitted temporall prince chose whether religio people ought content choise prince yet al shal like religion whiche prince hath chosen may haue fre libertie sell haue go dwell place without hinderaunce blemishe estimation whiche seing dutie perseuer olde catholique religion professe gospel purely taught exposition apostels martyr father whiche churche hath receiued neuer lordes supper although instituted whole yet olde churche also distributed vnder one kynde may declared large therfore altered first ye time counsell constauce custome lasted many age wherfore may easely thinke lawful priuate authoritie chaunge abolish lawe receiued approued generall counselles especially tyme lately peace geuen religio next assemblee must treate reconcilement treatie doubtles wil seke vttermoste power dissention may vtterly take away done tha wil take away may profit wealth soules health also ye intent may vnderstand good wil clemencie towardes wil dede staye restreine part proclamatio cocerneth lordes supper yet vnder conditio sectes forsaken alter nothing lawes ceremony churche tary decree assemble empire next coming minister churche scholem aisters followe order also shal molested also time suffered man right iniuried seing therfore beare good wil truste desire nothing furthermore muche publique necessitie vrgeth shall become consult common wealth geue behoueth wherunto make aunswer xii daye february ambassadours answer ferdinando cause moste weightie whiche conteineth perpetuall felicitie especially apperteineth saluation child obteyne nothing thei moste hartely sory say moste mightie kyng say wonted distributing lordes supper oulde tyme receiued churche may aboundantly cofuted holy scripture also errour detected haue perswaded highnes herein say meaning late decree made auspurg people applie selues religion prince uerely much fewe yeares paste longe decree haue common consent exhibited highnes supplication concerninge religion lawfull v also case would dwel aunswer sell good flitte wyues child place discomoditie herein agayne heuie sorowfull newes would people seeth verely shal heare whiche custome elder haue bene euer ready spende bloud lyfe preseruation dignitie house austriche must nowe forsake moste swete natiue countrie many yeares inhabited inriched fore father therfore admit ratifie aunswer behalf haue done oft heretofore honour god beseche woulde permitte v haue incoparable treasure god worde suffer v haue let matter condition cause suche whole blame ascribed doubtles could cotent lyke thinges case also obey willingly since euery man must render accompt owne dedes since difference persones god bycause ende lyfe euery moment hande neither thing vncerten life earnest suite labour requyre thinge wherfore beseche may haue sufficient warrauntise herein hereunto kyng fourth daye suppose sayeth answer king ferdinando iust cause wherfore satisfied fourmer answer permit apostels haue set forth martirs father approued churche haue taught expounded scripture nowe taught also pray require herein since god hath promysed churche holy ghoste saluation sought el saye defiled secte whiche sorte many adayes anabaptistes sacramentaries zwinglians schnemfeldians lyke dede well doctrine set libertie included within certen limites sayde howe long suppose wil continue pure euery man hym selfe wyll bragge goddes woorde saye subiect creature god alone admitte iudgement man see happen many place ful trouble whylest euery doeth stifly mainteine owne opinion authoritie churche vtterly contemned much fourmer wryting recite laste decree empire somewhat otherwyse apperteineth therfore haue declared taken would haue go dwell el againe take fro carefulnes haue suppressed ye parte proclamation touching lordes supper promysing hereafter diligence reconcilement may cause reuolte lawes ceremony churche haue shewed christ sayeth church must heard also thing selfe teacheth fourmer age whiche renewyng nothing abode religion forefather haue bene muche quiet fortunate thinges nowe thinges tourmoyled sectes dissentions many men rauished toste hither thither euery wynde doctrine wherby would rather haue thought would haue answered sorte nowe albeit aunswere may throughly confuted yet much must treate contribution subsidy therof shortly determine vnlesse determined suffer extreme miserie wyll ouer longe trusting also wyl doe matter selfe also consideration dutie requyreth agayne solicite thing saye howe leaue case obteyne nothinge saye wyll cause consultation geuing ayde wyl surely hindered letted haue commission promyse thing herein vnlesse haue first good assuraunce religion minister churche scholemaisters may authorised teache frely moneth february henry duke brunswick taketh wyfe sister sigismunde king poole duke hery bruswick marieth wyfe byshop treuers dieth fredericke counte palatine dieth tyme dieth iohn isemburg byshop treuers hath iohn ley successour xxvi daye also moneth departeth alzeme fredericke pausgraue prince electour man great yeares whome otto henrick brother sonne succedeth log since receiued doctrine gospell daunger therfore haue lost al possession taking othe people commaundeth man within dominion say masse vse ceremony trouble osiander styred vp prusse brought newe doctrine iustificatio spoken xxii boke moste part learned men reprehended opinion albert duke prusse open wryting professeth duke pruse professeth co fession auspurge wyll followe doctrine confession auspurg commaundeth therfore minister churche teache according promyseth saue harmeles case obeye ende matter might throughly appeased iohn albert duke megelburge sonne lawe duke pruse prince excellently learned going thither hauing learned men hym brought iohn funccius chief secte osiander poinct acknowledged errour affirmed would confesse openly would hereafter teache confession auspurg others would agreed diuines state churche appeased fourth daye marche began shine blasing starre sene space twelue dayes moneth camete sene ambassadours prince city mete regespurge treate cause marque albert brandenburge aduersaries counsell last yeare againe required ayde prince mediatio frendes matter heard intercessours therfore moneth february yere came frauce germany matter heard cause thempire differred till moneth aprill archebishop cantorbury already condened tharchebyshop cantorbu burnt religion death ryddley latimer retourned prison said ye xxi moneth burnt oxforde certen day put hope life perswasion certen reuoked diuerse article doctrine neither shewed constancie sawe must die made oration people speaking many thinges amendement life maners ende might haue audience attetiue legth sheweth greuously offended god denying truthe reciting chief article doctrine declareth briefly thought confirmeth papistrie kingdome antichriste ner said thence without moste bitter railyng wordes place execution came thither stretching forth right hand saith hath wickedly offended subscribing ye wicked opinion ennemies truthe propounded wherfore shall first suffer punishment thus tied ye stake sone fire began burne stretched forth hande far coulde reache might first fele torment burnt primate englande man greatest learning authoritie time popishe marke taken call degrading whiche wont done many cerimonies put vpon vile garmet brought forth amonges people laughed many hauing copassion vnworthy chauce could kepe fro sheding teares although thei doubted nothing flitte miserable lyfe heauenly countrie life euerlasting promotion got cardinall poole made archebyshop massed bauarians sollicite prince forreligio like austriche also bauarias sollicited albert duke cocerning religio maner ye time duke seing kyng ferdinando father lawe permitted thing subiectes also exacted mony graunted thing time might receiue lordes supper whole day prohibited necessitie requireth eate flesh howbeit prosesseth many wordes wyll departe religion auncesters alter thing ceremony thinges lawfull doe without consent supreme magistrate spirituall temporall permitteth two tyme tyll thing established publique authoritie reconcilement made wyll proclamation fourmer tyme concerning religion exactely stryghtly kept two thinges excepted wyll procure also muche lieth metropolitane byshops shall confirme graunte shall cause seke moleste man proclamation written daye kalendes aprill metropolitan whome speaketh archebyshop salisburg time certen noble men transiluania reuolte kinge ferdinand ferdinando also prorogeth counsel empire time vncerten leuieth army whiche sendeth downe riuer danubius hogary town alsatia called obereyne thre leages strasburg certen citezen towne labourer vine penury want wyfe absent tenth daye aprill sleeth father killeth thre child thre child daughter seue yeares sonne foure yeares olde sucking babe cradell fully halfe yeare olde tyme brute reporte went secret conspiracie pope adherentes protestauntes increased opinion doubte pope toke moste displeasauntly decre pope toke displeasauntly peace geuen religion last yeare made auspurge wherby peace libertie graunted religio thought also sollicited emperour make frustrate sawe many reuolted daily kingdome vnderstande austriche bauarians went moreouer archebyshops mentz treuers collon occasion bathe met tyme together whiche thought done without cause king ferdinando breaking vp assemblees austriche goeth boheme calling country kyng ferd goeth boheme prage iminent daunger demaundeth mony hath graunted sending letter whiche bene certen monethes regenspurg excuseth absence bicause must retourne uienna appointeth assemblee empire first iune departure king ferdinando lantgraue came meissen certen tyme auguste duke saxony tenth duke arescot brake pryson day may duke arescot prisoner castel uincent far paris escaped came home safe cardinall auspurge taried whole yeare rome lately retourned fro thence heard sinistrally many euill men spake thought though practise pope priuie perniciouse counselles germany pourgeth open wryting set forth vulgar tongue thende may last yeare sayth death iulius third went rome dutie present cardinall auspurg pourgeth wryting election ruleth pourposed doubtles haue retourned home germany expedition deteined pope went reformation churche chosing certen excellent men nation purpose chose also although vnmete weightie matter bycause germane nomber charge byshoprike required presence askyng leaue byshop day ides aprill retourned home neuerthelesse although haue vsed self alwayes also came kynde lyfe whiche wold spoken without boasting shamefull matter truly obiected although haue bene oft cou sellour authour peace without great losse hinderaunce although welth dignitie countrie hath bene alwayes dere yet sone came againe germany heard great worthy credit frendes myne absence certen wrytynges caste abroade whiche sounded dishonour though rome ye pope also euery italy secret diuises practise germany namely league fellowes confession auspurg shuld againe vexed moste greuous warre wrytinges alledged cause enterprise sinisire suspicious spred card auspurg fecret working pope greatly mislike decre made last yeare auspurg cocerning religion much perswaded emperour woulde abolishe dispensed faith promesse herein promysed ayde power could make subdue germany themperour againe would fayle hym recouering ecclesiasticall iurisdiction germany therfore made truce betwixt emperour frenche kynge bothe army might conuerted vse thei added moreouer written libelle foreyne soldiours leuied germaynes thing might better hidde moreouer kyng england wold hire eight thousande horseman gouernour whole warre mounsters shoulde take sondry place briefly whole matter shoulde handled circumspectly power set forwarde together one tyme inuade protestauntes vppon soden many shall home counsel regenspurge furthermore pope kyng englande sending ambassadours certen prynces germany doe promyse largely pope dede prepareth greate army horseman fotemen sende ayde furthermore sclaunder otto henrick paulsgraue christopher duke wirtemberge albert marque brandenburge heretickes seditiouse worthie driuen countrie hyghly commende lantgraue senate cardinalles forsaken religion titell man one minister churche reuoked doctrine rome worde wryting muche sclaunder toucheth pourgation yt cardinall auspurg suspicious certen pope emperour hurteth also name estimation bycause part honest man defende owne also honour innocencie magistrate must nedes aunswere begynne surely greuous paynefull heare yet remayning founde whiche contrary auncient vertue germany faythe constancie doe geue myndes suche sclaundering applie selues moste wicked libelles lewde talke myght styre vp prynces empyre hyghe magistrate set prynces together eares wycked warre cruel troublesome full perill sclaunder diuised xxviii yeares past suppose full many doe remember sclaunder deuised certi prince kyng ferdinando byshoppes mentz salisburg bamberge wirseburge prynce electour brandenburge lewys william brother duke bauier george duke saxony sayd haue conspired iohn duke electour saxony lantgraue matter brought poinct al thinges tended moste cruell ciuile warre doubtles prince ought set eye remember tyme bothe wyckednes deuiser detected euery prynce parte denied thing open wryting sclaunderer afterwarde loste head deserued whiche truste shall nowe come passe also euen god beyng reuenger authours wycked deuise may disclosed parte praye god sende better mynde confounde theyr counselles redounde distruction countrie seinge thys lyke sclaunder furmer may easely perceiued authours haue forged selfe mynde dyd imitation hym haue attempted intente verely myght nowe bringe passe thynge whiche coulde finishe muche intente sclaunderer myght perswade pope emperoure woulde force armes breake decree made peace religion kyng englande byshoppes germany would also ayde herein proteste wyckedly forged inuented intent verely men myndes beyng exasperated displeasure increased place myght swymme full ciuyle bloud although doe doubte emperoure prince iniurie seditiouse famouse libelle apperteineth wyll selues defende theyr cause yet duty sake omitte must also pourge highe magistrate unfaynedly tyme remained rome presence knowledge ther one worde spoken rome peace religion falsely therfore ascribed pope though applie hys counsell force violence though went perswade hereunto emperoure kynges falsely saye imputed neither proued seing like wyse false wrytten emperour since coference treatie betwene matter howe coulde pope conference yt emperour religion libertie germany determine vpon warre make compacte betwene recoueryng ecclesiasticall iurisdiction subduinge germany defamer sayth truce made betwyxt emperour frenche kyng intent soldiours either discharged might led warre cause truce copie declareth againe soldiours reteined prynce many kyng ferdinando commaunded taken vp sent hongary turke also excepted whome auspurge norinberge byshoppes bamberge wirtemberge hired least haply oppressed vpon soden part therfore deuyse falleth touchyng pope emperour byshoppes nowe concerning selfe haue verely hitherto followed olde trewe catholique religion becommeth cardinall anspurg addict olde religion germayne borne treade footesteppes elder perseuer communion churche brought vp also last counsel imperiall declared letter counsellours mynde pourpose god grace perseuer neither mynded doe thynge may striue honestie consideration dutie yet neuerthelesse couet peace men sayde haue secret conference pope emperour kyng englande state empire certen priuate men framyng war agayne paulsgraue duke wirtemberge marque brandenburge moste false neyther proued man yea bringe vp suche tale whether done woorde wrytinge saye sclaunderers ennemies common countrie touching counte palatine thus standeth matter maner dignitie vocation requyreth maynteyne ryght byshoprike kepe people committed charge olde catholique religion beynge aduertysed otto henry prince electour went aboute make certen townes byshopryke religion placed preacher toke doubtles euyll parte cause defende lawes therfore counsellours absence howbeit yet commaundement brought matter chaber imperiall matter dependeth yet otherwyse much worde neuer hurte name estimation muche lesse haue attempted thyng countrie coulde doe thyng might tourne commoditie hym selfe countrie people would omitte nothing suppose people coutrie beare witnes thing knowe haue done tymes paste great aduersitie moreouer haue euermore loued house palatine readye gratifie soeuer meanes myght wil neuer whit chau ged semblable wyse affected towardes christopher duke wirtemberge good man wyse skylfull louer peacei haue euer synce tyme fyrst acquaynted good cardinall anspurg towardes duke wirtemberg borne hym great good haue studied also perfourme dede eyther paulsgraue dryuen theyr countrie came neuer mynde also case knowen suche matter myght haue tended losse estimation goodes would haue bene ryght hartely sory woulde haue letted also vttermoste power suche thinge haue chaunced hitherto dede haue demeaned selfe alwayes suppose haue founde nothyng shal also vse selfe henceforth shall geue occasion thynke vpon hope verely muche haue geuen cause offended wyll beare lyke good wyll howe muche lamented chaunce marque albert ignoraunt hym selfe haue assayed haue proued discorde myght bee taken awaye quietnes restored empire doubtles trauell thyng hath bene muche industrie great although regarded herein common wealth yet came suspition many tendered commodity ouermuche sought hynder others howe vpryghtly handled matter letter wrytten hym shewe seyng therfore mynde towardes neyther duty wantyng truste vertue true nobilitie wyll sooner geue credit muche saying doyng whiche manifestly appereth sheweth selfe sediciouse persones certen bellouse seke reyse vp flame intier loue also good absent imbraced al germaines remembraunce moste swete countrie loue yt cardinall auspurge towardes yt germaines ambassadours many prince many also nobilitie declare whiche rome mentz treuers collon saxon brandenburg maydenburge bauarians brunswicke passawe osenburg minden basill repared certen hauen faythfully holpen affayres certen also labour commendation haue ascheued office great promotion lantgraue one titelman fonde diuise neyther euer talke lantgraue sonnes matter neyther remember spake one worde either rome italy much lesse tell minister dominion teache reuoke dede able saye knowledge suche recantation made rome therfore doubte lantgraue matter shall requyre wyll easely confute also commendation considering therfore artificer perniciouse libelles haue shamefully forged thynges ende fyre whiche many yeares since layde together myght nowe length burne breake one nedefull prince magistrate take dilligent hede laste shall detected set suche example may make others afrayde finally case haue conceaued euyll opinion reason sclaunders earnestly praye laye awaye thynke assuredly synce bothe germayne borne come noble house wyll doe nothinge vnworthy vertue nobilitie auncesters published wrytinge fifte kalendes iune sayde wrote also priuatly diuerse prince effecte went againe italy tyme bona mother sigismunde kyng poole retourned home goyng naples meane season commotios england many commotios england suspicion conspiracie gentle men suspicion conspiracie sayde cast prison wherof executed fled fraunce amonges sir androwe dudley brother duke northumberland two also taken lady elizabeth house ides may sir peter sir peter carrowe syr iohn cheke take prisoner carrowe insurrectio fled certen monethes reconciled king philip sir iohn cheke whiche king edwardes scholemaister retourning germany brabant fetche wyfe going brusselles andwarpe comaundement king philip apprehendetd caried london aboute ende iune far london xiii burnt together xiii burnt stretford bewe marq baben receiueth gospell one stake religion meane tyme charles marque baden receiueth doctrine gospel neighbour borroweth minister refourme order church also senate spire taken preacher two gospell maximilian eldest sonne king ferdinando wife emperours daughter departing fro uienne xvii day iuly came brusselles bene long much desirous take iourney austriche boheme could come hither hym selfe time appointed sheweth present yet neither meanes peter petrouice ye kynges cliente desired ayde turke coutrie transyluania necessitie vrged iust cause reuolted king sonne iohn uayuode fraunces beuecke george sonne making rebellion hongary haue helpe aide walachias taken certen townes castels againe turke hath lately sent gouernour offen also time treated truce beseged towne castell buda latin zegeste xi day iune began batter sore moreouer signified letter message many gouernour bosnia leuieth exceading great army inuade slauonia also president grene gathereth small power citie sophie intending marche forward emperour turkes selfe wyll haruest next come hongary wynter defer next spring wil come strong army wyn uienne sege cause therfore ye kyng time leaue country wholy busied occupied making preparation resiste much profit comon wealth differ cou sel loger therfore hath appointed begin treaty procede till may come selfe dede thre yeares since king sent noble ambassade turke peace truce yet deteined costantinople albeit truce taken betwene till thambassadours retourned home yet turkes meane season hauing broken faith haue take many townes castels vpo frontier seing also zegest beseged appereth peace dede loked handes firme tollerable whiche thing seing muche great daunger hangeth ouer remnaunt hongary austriche also ouer germany first nede consulte imediatly sending ayde co tribution mony kept certen place warre nede defrayed publique treasurer kynges prince also sollicited kyng ayde neither wyl selfe spare coste perill either selfe sonnes also since country sore inpouerished warres many yeares able resiste great ennemy requisite contribute thereunto spedely moreouer much last assemblee decreed also assemblee wayes sought appease religion kyng ernestly exhorteth would searche diligently whether reconcilement myght made whiche waye muste also treate mony establyshyng peace empire consultation turkishe warre set nowe cause moued write story proceded yt howe wrote displeasure fauour man couched thinges order declared preface worke added moreouer desirous truthe therin affected knewe thing wrytten vntruely would scrape admonishe reader myne owne accorde geue credit doubtles would haue thought men would haue bene satisfied especially since reading proue true said muche reported far otherwyse whiche lothsome greuous driuen necessitie adde thinges preface first dede euer since beginning worlde hath bene accustomed matter wel ecclesiasticall ciuile comitted wryting thing dede bookes testifie custome hath alwayes florished chiefly amonges noble free nation especially grekes romaine chief precept ornament kinde wryting right trewe therfore tully calleth history witnes tymes light veritie lyfe memory maistres lyfe whiche wordes verely doth commende exceadingly also sheweth sort ought nowe muche tyme hath chaunced great alteration religion since tyme apostle like hath bene smal sturre ciuile policie hath insued also vpon co monly wont verely although metest man al requeste certen good men toke vpon kynd wrytinge setting forth god glory great fidelitie diligence haue brought tyme haue herein geuen nothing affectios haue vsed selfe moderatly argument peradueture none hath done truste l indifferent iudges wil confesse although gladly prufesse doctrine gospel benefite god restored reioyce exceadingly nomber fellowship yet absteyne al bitternes wordes declare simply whole matter done god also take witnes myne intent hath ben falsly hurte man shameles impudencie thinges wherof memorie yet freshe set forth thyng contrary truthe know throughly haue perceiued truste vanitie notwithstanding case haue erred pointe acknowledge willingly admonished also saide preface wil proteste openly reader abused concerning paynes suppose verely searching truthe man dilligence could haue bene myne hath bene like many able testifie doubte thing also selfe shall declare describing
